text: You can find most of your grocery items in here. Not as big as other locations that I visited, but It good enough for your weekly shopping. Nice staff, clean and neat Costco's store.

I have never been to this Hoover location where it was not absolutely a full parking lot ( any day of the week, any time) and today was not exception. But the store, although crowded, was in pristine condition. Very neat and tidy with an excellent selection of products. Employees were all busy and very polite as they worked. Staff were scattered through out with samples promoting different tasty goodies. This store is well run and in great condition.
Nice selection of groceries, food clothing, electronics, house essentials and most of what you‚Äôd need at home.

Is it wrong to say that Costco is so much better than Sam‚Äôs? I guess the truth hurts. I love Costco even on a Saturday at midday. There is so much variety in what they offer. From toilet paper to midweek oven meals I always love the deals that I find.

Extremely stressful checkout procedure! I understand the company doesn‚Äôt want us to share memberships, but made it extremely difficult to pay. The cashier asked me more questions about who I am and how I am paying than what they ask me at an airport. At first I thought he was only verifying and doing his job. But as it continues with the questions and calling a manager twice over paying with a Visa which the company takes. We realized he was making the process harder! For no reason.. I understand they deal with plenty of people, but never was me or my husband rude. We only ask to reciprocate the energy we give. Costco is not what it used to be.

Lots of selections and good prices considering the inflation we are all facing today. They do the best they can with so many people coming in at one time. But the checkout is an absolute nightmare. But, I have come to expect that this is not going to improve because so many people are trying to check out at one time.

I really love this Costco. But I love all Costco stores. It's laid out nicely and it's very large. Great products that I can't find at Sam's Club or locally at Walmart.  We live 90+ miles from any Costco so this is a treat for me! Check it out!

I‚Äôve been in Costco‚Äôs all over the country and been a member for 15 years and this is the worst location I‚Äôve seen. Not only is it perpetually crowded it doesn‚Äôt carry some of the items the other‚Äôs do. They seem to have a culture of racial prejudice stemming from the Regional Vice President down to this club which is the only one in all of north Alabama. The employees in the store called the police on me and falsely accused me of threatening to shoot an employee after they falsely accused me of not having a membership due to what we saw was a clerical error on their behalf. When given the opportunity to apologize they instead claimed they did not tell the police that story in spite of the recorded call internal investigations has. They had me handcuffed and searched but I was released due to those false claims. The culture is toxic and the customer service is nonexistent. They‚Äôre running this store like a frat house instead of a business where paying customers are respected and valued.

Costco is a good place for saving money if you have a place to store the mass amount. You can fill your freezer with steak and seafood at a reasonable price. My best hint? Don't go on Saturday if you have another choice. ü§£
Use to love their paper towels. The cheapened them to the extreme. Used to come wrapped so you could store in garage...no longer. Never buying again

I like Costco generally, but they need to stop carrying the Bestway/Coleman U.S.A. inflatable hot tubs. Didn't even make 1.5 years before the liner started leaking and it can't be patched where it leaks (the filter connections) and remain functional. For the cost, it should get twice that lifespan at bare minimum. Surprised they carry this trash. Dump 'em Costco!

So many things are a scam these days. Costco is so refreshing! It does not fail to impress me. They offer good quality at good/great prices and their 'no questions asked' return policy is off the charts. If you buy the exec membership and just do your basic shopping, it is essentially free after getting a 2% rebate at year's end.

We enjoy the drive from Northwest Florida to visit this location at least once a month. We never leave without spending hundreds of $$$ and try many new items.

Only small gripe would be to make the refrigerated club-prepared foods a bit smaller. We find Sam's Club portions are much better sized for my family.
Perfect stop along busy travel day. Gas,snacks , bathroom and a little needed exercise all within 30 minutes! That's why we love being Costco members away from home.

Absolutely worst trip to Costco I've ever had... We literally drive 30 plus miles to come here to purchase... Today I bought a mattress and could not get anyone at all to help me load it onto the buggy to take it out... Nor to walk outside and help me push it in the trailer. Absolutely amazing but if you're a guy you're not going to get a shred of help... I muscular and in good shape... But a full king size mattress is a lot to wrestle for one person.

The people that work there are awesome!!. They have the best member service! The membership  pays for itself really the same day, depending on what you buy because of the savings. Their membership has so many discounts on vacations,  cars, hotels rentals ,plus lots more. It's worth it!!

First visit to Costco in Montgomery. Went for hearing evaluation and shopping. The friendliness and helpfulness of employees was striking. Needed a motorized cart and none was available. Staff went the extra mile to locate and bring one to me. What a difference it made to be able to shop comfortably. Hearing aid  department could not be better.  All in all a delightful experience in the store. What a difference a pleasant staff makes. Clearly someone is doing something right!

Most of the people are super nice. I did have this one old white woman not let me check out my own groceries. When i told her that other people did not know how to stack she took my buggy threw my food on the belt for the nice man to scan. Due to my agitation I forgot my pin. She then explained to me if we could not afford it they could just abort the transaction. I asked politely if they could give me a minute to transfer funds. She was very rude. There was a young man came up and took us to the service desk and being out of her condensinding ways I remembered my pin. I paid for everything and left. Btw the cokes I bought yesterday expired last year. Wonder how returns go? Will let know.

We are Costco members for the last 15 years, but the lately the quality of fresh fruits and milk has gone bad. They keep the same batch of fruits like apples, dates on sale for months and they start to go bad. Lately the organic milk also has brown residue at the bottom of the tetra pack. The management should please make a note of this. We love Costco, but the fresh produce section needs to adhere to quality standards.

Worth every penny for the membership! Costco is conveniently located right in eastchase, so after you‚Äôre done shopping you can shop some more!
Tried the sticky toffee pudding! Get it while it‚Äôs there! Really like it! It‚Äôs so rich and decadent! Love when they have rarer cuts of meat! Didn‚Äôt get the lamb this time, but definitely picked up those oxtails!
Love all the products they carry. The only down side is leaving. Getting out of the parking lot is hectic. There are no traffic lights so making a left to leave can take forever.
Great experience! Love the prices, and I don't mind that  things come in bulk. Because u can always freeze stuff. The meat selection  was really good. I will definitely be back soon..

I recently made the trip to the Costco in Baton Rouge for some bulk shopping, and I must say, it was absolutely worth the drive! The selection and savings I get at Costco are unmatched, and this trip was no different. However, after returning home, I discovered an issue with one of the produce items. Knowing I couldn't easily return to the store due to the hour-plus drive, I reached out to their customer service. The response was remarkable! The store manager was incredibly accommodating and swiftly resolved my issue to my complete satisfaction. This level of customer service is why I love shopping at Costco. I'm eagerly awaiting the opening of the new Costco in Covington later this year‚Ä¶ more convenience coupled with the same great experience!

I just wanted to give a shout out to the hardworking crew today!  A nice lady and gentleman (Que) helped me get a cart and load 2 huge bags of smoker pellets and the staff of the front deli with the pizza was so polite and working so hard.   At closing‚Ä¶.with a smile.   Just wanted them to know how appreciated they are. You rock.
Go there a lot, and the prices are hard to beat for what you get, including my gas for the vehicles...

Costco just got rid of their Kirkland Chardonnay in the box. Great wine inexpensively priced. But they did put it in a bottle at a much higher price. The box is a much better packaging option.

It is also very inconvenient to have to be watched at the self checkout. Not only does Costco want us to do our own checkout, they hire someone to watch us. And now they want to charge us more for helping them.

Enough of this rant. Need to go to Total Wine to buy what I wanted here.

Costco is virtually consistent no matter where you go. The layout is different in some store but it is usually the reverse order of things. Still...there is so many good deals and large amounts of options on items! I appreciate the friendliness of the staff. They are usually more tenured individuals who know customer service!  This is a great location with lots of other amenities in the area!

I was disappointed with a return, I bought two variety packs containing 4 candles each and the two cranberry candles were defective. Unlit, they didn‚Äôt smell nearly as strong as the other candles. I lit a cranberry one for an hour and you could barely tell a huge candle was burning in my apartment. I couldn‚Äôt return the defective cranberry candles because they were 25% not 50% of the item. The customer service rep told me I could gift them to people and I told her they didn‚Äôt meet my standards, I was gifting the other candles that did smell good. I offered them to her since Costco could not accept them back, she declined I asked her to pitch them for me in a trashcan beside her and she wasn‚Äôt allowed to? I had to take the candles outside so that I could continue shopping.

Attention anyone that shops in-store with the person they have given their secondary membership card to (husband, parent, child, etc): if your membership card is scanned at self check-out, you MUST be the one paying with your own personal card. If not, (e.g. you and your husband share the same Costco account, you scan your copy of the membership card but he pays) and the attendant notices, they will void your transaction and make you start all over again using that person‚Äôs issue of the membership card. Yes, even if it is from the same account.

I unfortunately found this out today while shopping with my mother for last-minute items for our family Easter party. I scanned my membership card at check out and the attendant came over to scan our larger items. I told the attendant, ‚ÄúOh, the case of beer is my mother‚Äôs,‚Äù and beckoned for my mom to take out her ID so she can scan it if need be.

The employee then stopped our transaction and asked whose membership we were using. I replied that it is my membership but my mother carries the second card associated with my account. She then weirdly caught an attitude with us and told us that since the beer is my mother‚Äôs, that my mother will be paying for the transaction and that we will have to start all over again after my mom scans her own issue of the card. My mother asked, ‚ÄúEven if our cards are from the same account?‚Äù And the attendant cut her off and snapped back, ‚ÄúYES, even if the cards are from the same account, because the cards have different ending numbers!‚Äù

Had the attendant not been so eager to void our transaction, she would have noticed that I had already taken out my own ID for her to scan for the beer so we wouldn‚Äôt have to start the check-out process over. (I had already planned on paying for all of my family‚Äôs Easter groceries at the end anyway‚Ä¶ So yes, my membership, my card, my money.)

I understand that since I said the beer was my mother‚Äôs, that she would have to be the one to purchase it. I also understand that it has been a busy holiday weekend and that she was probably having a stressful shift. But the attitude towards us was misplaced and voiding our transaction just to scan another card that is linked to the same account and having to start over was an overreaction. I thanked the attendant anyway as we were leaving but our interaction left a bad taste in my mouth.
A very busy place but you don't see employees looking stressed out.  Always smiling and happy to help customers.

I enjoy comming here. Employees are nice, it isn't crazy dirty or unorganized. It's easy to find stuff and get help if needed. I only come here when they have pokemon cards. So it's been good every time

Are used to love Costco. I spent 30 years in Seattle and used to supply some items to the Costco stores in Seattle. I went to Costco in New Orleans and picked out a blueberry muffin six pack. I went to pay for it, and the girl told me I couldn‚Äôt buy just one I had to get two packs.she said it was a two for deal. I told her I only wanted one and the other would get thrown away so I can‚Äôt sell you one. So I said keep it. Morons.

I like Costco. You do need to check their website to make sure they have the items you want to purchase at your local store.  My only complain is that some of their users are a bit of a higher price than other warehouse stores. I know the products are good quality though.
Big well organized store with just about everything you can imagine

Some of the employees, I gather that they are managers, are awful. I can handle them being rude to me when I ask a question, but when they are rude elderly people who can‚Äôt hear that well and are just trying to do as they are told, it makes my blood boil. I used to work for Costco. They act like it the hardest job‚Ä¶it‚Äôs not. And it s also not hard to be kind. This is my first ever review. I hope Costco does something to make the environment more friendly. We spend and love shopping there but I wish the check out was more like Trader Joe‚Äôs. Fast and friendly

No complaints, got some food here and has a few local delicacies like Pralines (check the box to see if all of them are in there). The food court has Brisk Sweet Tea, which isn't a thing at Midwest Costcos.

I frequently purchased the rotisserie chicken from Costco and I have to say, it exceeded my expectations! The chicken was not only reasonably priced but also incredibly tasty. It was perfectly seasoned and cooked, with moist and flavorful meat.

The Costco rotisserie chicken is also perfect for meal prep. It provides a convenient and delicious option for preparing meals ahead of time, whether for lunches or dinners throughout the week.

Overall, I highly recommend you grab Costco's rotisserie chicken. It‚Äôs for anyone looking for a tasty and budget-friendly meal option. It's a great value and it‚Äôs delicious!

Had to deal with customer service twice both times left a bad taste in my mouth the first is when I got my card, should have canceled then. Had to return something the other lady the woman that waited on me was super rude to me , but the next lady she was so nice to! Next time I go I will be canceling my membership, not paying for their people to be rude to me! I‚Äôll stick with Sam‚Äôs !!! At least they are ALWAYS NICE AND HELPFUL!! unlike Costco

I really like our Costco in Moore, Oklahoma.  Their dairy products are usually hard to beat and the produce section offers a wide variety of things to choose from.

One of the things I like most is the speedy checkout out.

The Top Teir gas they carry at a very competitive price is worth the visit itself

Overall, large stores in the wholesale category There's a lot of things to choose from here. But some things are not as delicious as other wholesale stores. Arranging membership cards does not allow fellow members to use the cards interchangeably. If members don't go along with them, sometimes it's a loss of ability to sell things. (in order to get new members)

Now at self check out they make one large mega line. And they have one employee telling people to go to the empty registers.
I didn‚Äôt know that and I walked over to the two empty ones while other people were still standing in the mega line.
And the guy tells me ‚Äúit‚Äôs one line now.‚ÄùYou have to get behind these people.
He hadn‚Äôt noticed the other two registers opened until after I went through the regular check out.  And then he had people go to them.
This is extremely annoying and it slows people down.

I was fortunate enough to visit the new North Tulsa Costco location and I'm extremely pleased with my experience. The store was absolutely spotless, clearly showing the efforts they're putting in to maintain a clean and safe shopping environment.

I was in awe of how well-staffed the store was. There were plenty of employees on hand to assist with any queries or concerns, and they were all friendly and highly professional. Their willingness to help made my shopping experience significantly easier and much more enjoyable.

The staff's positive attitude and the store's cleanliness truly set this Costco location apart. It's apparent that they're not just aiming to provide an excellent shopping experience, they're also striving to create a welcoming environment for all shoppers.

This North Tulsa Costco location has set a high standard that other stores will struggle to meet. Well done, Costco, and thank you for your commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. I can't wait for my next visit!

My favorite store in town. I loved my experience over all. Great prices, great vareity of products. Great quality and good service. Exept the tire shop the guy that helped me was not nice he did not like his job.

Prefer this one over the south tulsa location due to accessibility & less traffic, but their refrigerated grocery sections do not seem as big as the Tulsa one.

I had laid everything out in my basket so the cashier could scan it easily, and some lady hovering around tossed it onto the belt- not nicely either. I said, "I had it where the cashier could scan everything easily, " and she said, "depends on the week. " I don't even understand what that means or the point of her action was, except to exhibit control.

They should get with the times like Sam's, and offer the scan&Go option from the app.
Prices are good and barely any registers are open.

I went there to get glasses and the manager was there, she was very professional, polite, and intelligent woman , she helped me pick out my frames. She helped me make sure I got the right prescription. She explained everything to me in detail. The price was Very reasonable and the frames were top quality, comfortable, and looked nice. She even helped me fill out the paperwork for my claim to turn into my insurance. Such a lovely experience. I will be doing all my shopping for glasses at Costco moving forward.

Beautifully clean store with many options I haven‚Äôt seen at the other local Costco. Was amazed recently when we bought the floor model of a workout machine and they held it as we traveled from over an hour away. We called and Ally took care of us as they moved it off the sales floor. When we arrived Jeremy the FES was incredibly helpful in checking out and loading! It barely fit in our truck, but thanks to Jeremy‚Äôs quick thinking and willingness to help it fit with 1/16‚Äù to spare. So thankful!!

The least crowded of all the Costco locations I have been to, and I have been to many. And yet there had to be 500 customers, but the place is so huge it still seemed empty. Easy navigation around the store. Place is spotless, with shiny floors and lots and lots of merchandise. Wine and beer but no liquor. Oh well. Quick checkout and lots of convenient parking. And the neatest piles of clothes I have ever seen. I don‚Äôt know how they do it. Terrific location.

We love this COSTCO location in OKC. The employees are extremely helpful and go above and beyond to help us find our favorite items if they‚Äôre missing or out of stock at a given location. Mr. Ronnie always greats our son with so much joy. Grateful for their prices and samples. Even on a busy Saturday the managers do a great job of getting everyone to a short line and moving at a great pace. Also, our toddler loves their pizza! Always an amazing deal at COSTCO.

I was disappointed to see that the store removed the handheld self-checkout scanners. I've noticed that Sam's Club, for instance, still offers handheld scanners and even has a convenient 'Scan and Go' feature on their mobile app. While I understand the need to address theft, I found those scanners convenient for my shopping experience. However, I appreciate the store's efforts to improve security and am hopeful they'll find alternative solutions to enhance convenience for customers.

Costco is a good place for shopping. This location in OKC is well stocked and clean. Most employers are friendly, but the supervisors are very rude and abrupt. Yesterday I was so disappointed, being treated like a bum by the supervisors at the front service counter. On the way check out at the door, a very young man ripped my receipt with his marker, I don't know how because the marker isn't sharp enough to poke through paper, he must yanked it hard and ripped the receipt. He asked me if I needed the receipt, yes , I need it for those items I bought for my friend.  He sent me to the service counter to have them print another receipt, the lady here took my Costco's card, went to the back office, I was in a hurry to go home after spending a long time at Costco ,  I asked her to give me back my card so I can leave, then the supervisor man came, he looked at me with a serious mean face and asked me "WHAT DO YOU WANT? " I wish I could record this one my phone. I couldn't believe what I heard, it is a very inappropriate way to talk to customers when it came to a problem situation. Especially he works for Costco, worldwide companies, he represented the company to serve community, other than that it's a attitude towards public for a gentleman. I don't know is it about races or anything else, but I left Costco with tears. I've noticed that several times here at this location, the supervisors never break a smile to customers, and talk very abruptly. I'm from the west coast California, I do not have this kind of problem, I don't see this kind of attitude, he's a good looking man, but he has bad attitude. Costco needs attention on their employees. I will call corporate and talk about this matter on behalf of Costco shoppers. We spend money here, we should not being treated like this. Maybe more locations needed here in OKC would help to eliminate this shameful. Maybe someone doesn't care, but I've seen reviews from other customers visited Costco had this same problem.

Clean as always. I'm glad this one has the citron tea. I am anxious to try this new mango flavor. I'm sure it'll be as good as the citron ginger tea they removed from their database last July. Hopefully, they'll bring it back. It's great during fall and winter cold seasons.

I had a great experience at Costco! The store offers a wide selection of high-quality products at competitive prices, making it a one-stop shop for all my household needs. The staff were friendly and helpful, and I appreciated the efficient checkout process, especially considering the size of the store and the number of shoppers. The Kirkland Signature brand offers excellent value, and I found some great deals on bulk items that will save me money in the long run. My only minor complaint is that the store can get quite busy at times, but overall, Costco is definitely worth a visit for anyone looking to stock up on essentials and save money.

Crowded and loud. So loud we had a hard time hearing the lady selling us the membership. Customers are look down your nose at the pink haired lady. We are forced to have a membership due to our insurance only filling scripts there. I prefer Sam's

Good selection of everything with decent prices, but I hate their opened fridge area because the food in it was sweating, and the area smelled like rotten food, hopefully nobody gets sick or dies from buying food from that area. I‚Äôd only get freezer food because at least it‚Äôs at the correct temperature. It has to be a FDA violation to let meat get to room temperature. Meat shouldn‚Äôt be warm when you touch it

Online orders go fine. Big orders will be broken up into different boxes and delivery dates. The only issue I have is from UPS or FedEx which will leave the package in front of the garage, which I can't see from the front door. Other than that. Costco online is a great experience here.

Great store and great value but some of the service members were rude and condescending which i would like to point scott who would not let me finish a sentence when i trying to cancel a charge at the self checkout due to him interpreting me saying he cant cancel the transaction. 6/10 if like value and dont care if there rude come here.

We love that you had a moose hanging out there. I guess he needed a few things before he headed home so we stopped at Costco and we stopped to take pictures of him. He was amazing beautiful just adorably large. He was eating your trees and we didn‚Äôt mind a bit and it was 2 feet of snow so we didn‚Äôt think you did either, thank Costco for feeding the moose. Even moose made love. We were so grateful to see him thank you, Costco!!!
Costco has a large selection and a wide variety of options for customers. The facility is very clean and the staff and extremely friendly and helpful
Lots of West Coast (Seattle, San Francisco)offerings, like coffee and bread. Best seafood and liquor prices. Gas also.

I had a tire appointment tonight at 7:45. Finally left at 10:50. When I got home, I noticed an absurd amount of tire balance weights on my rims. Long stacks of the stick-on 1/4 ounce weights. Between 4 and 7 ounces per wheel!

I gave these guys the benefit of the doubt and didn‚Äôt rag on them for taking a long time. However, they do not know what they‚Äôre doing. Huge let down. I‚Äôll have to bring them back to fix. Hopefully the other location can do it as I do not trust Dimond now. I foresee them telling me the soonest I can come in is 2-3 weeks.

Between the excessive time and the complete loss of confidence I have in their installation of my tires, my perception of Costco as a whole has taken a dive.
They‚Äôve gotta do better than this.

The environment is well organized. While I am looking for Apple products, the staff takes the initiative to ask me if I need any help and checks stocks in both Costco. After I tell him what I want to buy, he prints out the pickup receipt which allow me to checkout and pick up iPad very quick. I do have a good time shopping here. Here are nice staff and lovely price.

Very nice addition to East Muldoon community. Don‚Äôt expect this to be like a regular Costco. This is much different, not the regular selection you may expect, but also nice selection that the regular don‚Äôt have. Cashier line are short and you can get in and out very quick. Parking lot is plentiful and not crowded like the other two in to. Plenty of restaurants nearby if you‚Äôre hungry, this place doesn‚Äôt have free samples and no food court. Strictly business shopping style only! Which I love, if you want to be a free loader on food samples, go to the other Costco!!
My second trip to the new Costco. No hot food section. But way less chaos then the other costcos in amchorage. Great prices, clean store and easy check out. Highly recommend it!

First of all, I like Costco for the most part. All the stores are a little different from each other, and the business Costco is its own thing. There is a different variety of items here that you won‚Äôt find at the regular store. If you run a business that needs to buy things in bulk it‚Äôs hard to beat this place. I imagine it would be a Prepper paradise also.

The business center is a godsend for our large-ish family.  The meat is probably our favorite part, as the per pound prices are all dramatically lower than even other costco stores. Large quantities, yes (10 lbs of pepperoni for under $30), but so worthwhile if you're able to use truly bulk quantities.  Any costco membership will get you in and there are tons of items not found in regular costcos such as food service items (cases of individual packs of mayo, chafing dishes, folding tables/chairs, electric hand dryers, outdoor trash cans, 70 count boxes of avocados, massive bags of dry beans, flour, sugar, and every variety of concessions items you can imagine). There's no food court, deli, pharmacy, or clothes, but it honestly makes for a more focused shopping trip. The staff at this location are also incredibly friendly and helpful!

Very organized, with great selections. It was busy. Found all I needed. The checkout was super slow. Also, as lines began to back up, they took people just coming to the registers versus people who were already in line. Just a pet peeve of mine. I think people are still confused that this is a business costco and not a traditional store. Wonderful for snack bars at work or gathering supplies needed quickly.

I went in here to check out furniture. I ended up going to the main warehouse for my final purchase, but check with Dan Zeiger before making any big purchases. He can tell you everything about the product.

It's a Costco, great food and great products in the store. The three stars is because of the food court. I get that's there's not many employees working in the food court. I've worked fast food myself and was the only one running the entire front of the restaurant during the dinner rush half the time. However, is it really so hard to take 20 minutes to give someone a hot dog and a piece of pizza?

I've also seen at least one or two employees not doing anything in the back a couple times, while my pizza started getting cold sitting there. Hire more employees or better quality employees in the food court, it's ridiculous waiting 40 minutes for a chicken bake.

Great store other than that tho
What a revelation!  Great selection, esp. groceries.  Better than typical prices.

Generally, everything is quick and easy to shop for what you need and get out. Unless store management decides in not so infinite wisdom to move items to another location under guess of corporate wants it. Problem with stores who constantly move partial or even entire ailes of products only tick off the core customers who help pay keep doors open. Understand trying to keep customers shopping more, but why not drop prices versus keeping high percentages of store income.  People are willing to spend more overall if they feel the store they shop at trys to maintain items at location, shelves actually stocked with products,  promotional items in larger quantities being available versus limited amounts.
Very good, I love that I can find all that I need, the peanuts butter, avocado and customer service

Peggy at customer service is first class
-

She was welcoming and informative and helped me with making the proper decisions on my membership purchase

I appreciate the help.

Purchased a full set of tires November 2022, during which I had a membership. Last week I visited to utilize the services that come with the purchase and installation of a new set of tires (known as the ‚ÄúLifetime Maintenance Services‚Äù) and was denied because my membership isn‚Äôt active anymore.

So, fair warning to anyone who purchases tires here: You, apparently, need a subscription to utilize the ‚Äúlifetime services‚Äù they say they provide with the purchase.

On a lighter note, the chicken bake was my favorite thing to get, and was a good highlight to any Costco visit. Too bad I probably won‚Äôt be going back now.

I decided to visit the world's smallest Costco (it's about half the size of a standard Costco) while in Juneau to see what kind of local things they carried. Found some deck boots and sausage with reindeer meat added but that was about it. Their food court was a one-man operation with NO PIZZA but at least they still gave out samples.
oreos birthday was really fun! i got at least 3 slices of cheese pizza and i was hoping for more but apparently oreo ate it all... its okay tho its his bd at the end...
Nice ‚Äútiny‚Äù Costco with amazing glacier and mountain views! Some items are unbelievable cheap compared with Canadian Costco or mainland US
Didn‚Äôt know until after I visited that this is the smallest Costco in the world, but after seeing it, it isn‚Äôt too surprising. This thing is tiny! Super cool to see a different layout though.

I really wish Costco would open up a store in Wasilla! It's a bummer we have to drive almost an hour but I had a great experience visiting this store. Very fair prices on a lot of food items as well as clothing. Seeing this pretty cool folding wagon and the price was super fair at $99! Definitely my go-to place for shopping for certain bulk items. I also love their chicken pot pies as well as their shepherd pies.

They signed me up for the wrong membership‚Ä¶when I even verify a few weeks later I had the executive membership at your customer service because I spend so much money at your store and they told me yes‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve missed out on 1000 dollars worth of rewards. You all need to train your staff better‚Ä¶

You know, I like Costco!
That being said I do save a fair amount of money by shopping there! Then again, when I factor in the amount of money I have to spend on Gas to drive to Anchorage from Wasilla and the amount of time spent driving to Costco, I'm not sure that I really save much money! Their selection of items is great! So is their service and the Employee's are quality to say the least! You decide! The pictures say what I think of my Yorkie, Jack!
Love the Costco!! They have a beautiful pavilion for sale right now as well, go take a look!

Usually place is very full with people, but if you go during a done hour which is hard to find, it's easier to check out. It's a great places to shop for bulk items. For greeters and cashiers are friendly. Love getting the free samples and the shopping.

Amazing shopping mall in Portland. You get almost everything from fresh produce, groceries to heavy electronics. The prices are most competitive as compared to online shopping apps. Not to forget the food zone where they offer delicious pizza, cookies and deserts.

Good place. Massive store, better than Sam's club and BJ's combined. Lego sets for $40 and 4 pc laser tag set for $30. Especially good prices on ice cream. The guy at the exit, Peter, was very nice and smiling the whole time. Massive carts by the way. The store is 161,000 ft^2. Very good prices, great store. Better than any other store in the area for sure.

Praise God, Costco is here in Maine!!! Love this new Costco and the employees are super. I've missed Costco so much and all that wonderful food they have and super great prices on everything! Clothes, food, vitamins, glasses, car products, steaks, even new cars! I bought my Thanksgiving turkey here and it was by far the best turkey I've ever had!!!
Love Costco ‚ù§Ô∏è ü•∞‚ù§Ô∏è

I know this sounds crazy but, this Costco is getting better everytime I come here!!! I LOVE Costco ‚ù§Ô∏è

Huge and very clean! It has more than the one I used to go back home. Someone told me when I was here that this is the 2nd largest Costco in US. Unfortunately ended up spending way more than I was expecting to but I guess that‚Äôs what happens in a Costco. üòÇ

Update 11/24
I have been here 3 times already and unfortunately with only one person manning the station for taking the photo for id, it‚Äôs impossible to wait in line over an hour to try and get it taken. It‚Äôs been a failed attempt each time and today, I waited outside before it even open. Perhaps Costco can increase the number of cameras to help with this process if this photo id is a mandatory thing as one of the staff says.
So far I have enjoyed it,  I saw a lot of products and brands that I have never seen in the other warehouse stores. Gas has been reasonably priced also all things considered.

Good place for larger families to get groceries, especially when organic produce is a priority. They also have a solid meat selection with free range and organic meat and eggs. Gluten free options too! Not to mention the home goods and clothing choices.

Long time loyal customer. Food court has delicious and affordable food. Staff are friendly and hard working. Plenty of good sales. I like the rotating clothes options, but if you shop there exclusively for clothes, you will look like a generic midlife crisis manager.

Costco is always awesome. I love Costco and this one has amazing local items and amazing prices. Totally worth the membership and the staff are always friendly and helpful when you need to find something or need help grabbing something. So glad there is one near by
It was a surprising quick trip in and out.  Was able to get a few things before heading home.  Go thru the self checkout and off I went.  Still extremely hard not to load up a cart full.

I love Costco. The prices are great, but more importantly they typically have the best value. Meaning, you can often get a higher quality item for the same price you might find at other stores. Sometimes the packages are large so it helps to have a freezer or vacuum sealer at home. The workers are excellent and more helpful than many other stores. It can get busy so try to find off times to do your major shopping.

I've visited this location for many years and consistently love it. The staff here are friendly and helpful. Whether it's finding a specific item or offering recommendations, they always go above and beyond. Kudos to Costco for maintaining such high standards of customer service.

Costco is always good at attracting people with their prices and I am in love too. The staff is nice and friendly. Sometimes, it is hard to find a certain product since they move it around frequently. Thanks for serving the community. I would love to be back soon

Highly recommend a Costco membership! You do not need a membership to purchase beer or wine. Costcos in the state of Oregon cannot sell hard liquor. This Costco probably needs more parking available. We got our food at the food court fast, it was very busy on a Friday around lunch time.

Good place to shop and get gas. They have the best return policy. But there is one person works at the return place. I‚Äôve never seen her smiling. She seems pretty upset all the time. It makes me unpleasant by seeing her. Other than that no complaints. They have a great Costco reward program. I‚Äôve always enjoyed some extra cash every year.

Very busy during my visit. Drop off my hearing aid to get fixed and did some shopping while I waited. Hearing aid was fixed very quickly. Had a long wait in the checkout line for the rest of my shopping. Employees were nice and friendly.

Main shopping is ,reat service and selection, but they moved items around recently, so it's a bit harder to find things in their "normal" spots, we'll adjust.

Tire services has something to be desired. Two years in a row I have an appt and it takes over 2.5 hrs to swap out snow tires, others were waiting longer than me. Les Schwab kicks their butt with speed. I'm paying more for LS in the future.

Best. Customer. Service. Ever.

I bought two pallets of flooring when it went on sale and rented a U-Haul truck to transport it. I was unsure how it was going to work out but I had hope. My two teenage boys were helping me.

Everyone was beyond helpful from the lady manning the door, to the guy who met me in the correct aisle, to the incredible guys working at the loading dock. They were super helpful and friendly. They loaded up the truck using a forklift, then loaned us a tie down for the first trip (we had to return for a second partial pallet), and even helped tighten the load down for us! I‚Äôm beyond grateful and impressed. I only wish I could thank those guys by name but I failed to take note when I was there.

We went to Verizon and spoke with Kyle Manning about upgrading our S21s.  He was very informative, patient, and helpful.  He answered all of our questions, explained the upgrade process, and showed us what our new billing would be.  Mentioned a special on a Galaxy Tablet so I purchased one.  All in all a very good visit and we upgraded to the S24+.  Would definitely recommend talking to Kyle at Verizon if you are considering an upgrade.  He also printed a return label for us.  Good that he did because the one I received in email from Verizon is not printable.

Update 3/2024....  Great Costco staff and store.

Upstate 12/21.... Still awesome. Great people and great Costco experience always.

Classic medium sized Costco. Excellent products in bulk and superb return policy. Plus great food up front.

FOUR MONTH UPDATE: DOWNGRADE TO TWO STARS FROM FIVE
Four months of shopping here reduces five stars to two. Terrible beef prices (go to Winco for proteins of quality and good price), rotten seafood once, moldy bagels, mis-labeled meat, lame customer service. Still useful store for things you don't eat.

PREVIOUS POST
Just joined today. Great Costco, good selection across the board. Even proteins can be reasonably priced if you look. The store guess on and on (pic.), the butcher is highly competent (pic.) of him breaking down a whole animal) - and rivals the cuts you see at Whole Foods, not Safeway or Fred Meyer's. I got a hot dog and a drink for my voyage through the aisles, and that set me back only $1.50!! (pic.). The CEO of Costco announced laspping  September at an earnings meeting that this price is "forever" - which is good because I spent $665+ here today (pic.) and bought 50 things, bringing my avg. cost per item $13.30.

Kast's Tip: Join today and spring for the Executive Membership which is twice as much as Gold ($120 vs. $60). An average couple should get around $200/year in cashback, in addition to other benefits. If you think you spend about average, or have more than two people in your home, it just makes sense!
Went and bought a German chocolate cake from the bakery. Served eight people and still had a half a cake left. Delicious and filling. Definitely would buy again.

They had everything we were there to get, plus a couple of things. I still love the nice wide aisles, and plenty of room for people to pass with carts. Would have been nice if they'd had maybe another check out or to open, but it didn't take excessively long to get out of there. Must say that we stopped to get something to eat on the way out, and it was a bit of a cluster. No one working the register, and everyone standing around just jumping in trying to get to the counter in front of others who had been waiting longer. I know they're trying to encourage people to use the tablets and order that way, but not everyone wants to. They're going to have to try to figure out how to have a happy in between on that. Once we did finally break down and order that way it took longer to get our food then it did to check out with a cart full of items.

I'm usually a huge fan of our Central Point Costco but I had the worst customer service today.  I asked a person stocking meat if they had any corned beef left. I explained that I found the spot in the cooler but there were just empty boxes.  He said " maybe but thats not my area so I don't know".  He then turned away and when I asked if there was someone who could look for me he got irritated with me and told me they stock by the pallet and put everything out in the morning.  He did a great job of making me sorry I asked.
Awesome staff! Really helped me out in a pinch when picking up last minute pain meds for someone who just had teeth pulled. üëçüëç She would have had a rough night without.

Love going to Costco! The staff has always been so friendly and helpful. I enjoy getting what I need and stopping at the food counter before leaving for either a hot dog or a slice of pizza. Their new chocolate chip cookies are served warm too. Everything there is great. And I love that Costco lets you return anything if you‚Äôre not satisfied with it.

It is a nice, typical, and good Costco store. It has bigger parking lots than the ones I visited. I am getting used to gas-attended service, haha. The self-inflation service is next to the tire installation area. Overall, I had a positive experience

My new favorite tradition is shopping for pie the day before major holidays at Costco by myself. There's something so freeing about wandering in childfree, with no list or time limit and just... witnessing the utter chaos.

As long as you're fine with a walk, don't fight the traffic and park at the far end of the lot. Enjoy the stroll up, watching families argue over whose going to drive home from the Grandparent's the next day.

Get a slice of pizza, treat yourself to a Pepsi and bask in the fact that you're going home alone with 58oz of baked to perfection pie.

Before you head out though, fill up with that reasonably priced Costco gas and drive off into the sunset knowing... divorce means never having to spend another holiday with in-laws.

It is such a bummer to write this review because I have loved my previous experiences at Costco. However yesterday was a nightmare. We purchased a couch and the lack of support and assistance was insane. I asked someone to help me and he said he‚Äôd be over in a few. Luckily my husband is handy and was able to get both huge pieces on carts by himself BEFORE the Costco worker made his way over. Then we were told we could pull under the awning area so we could load up and there would be people out there to help us get it in the truck bed. We felt relief and said thank you! Well that was false because when we tried to do just that, a Costco woman managing the carts YELLED at us that we couldn‚Äôt do what we were just told we could do. not a single person helped us load up. We love our couch. But Costcos customer service really let us down yesterday.

Most items are cheaper than the supermarket so I would definitely shop here for some items. Do your research for items you buy mostly at grocery stores and compare them at Costco's? You will come out a lot cheaper. (Especially the rotisserie chicken which is $5 Here & that alone is worth the trip to Costco's.

Parking is usually a nightmare BUT what Costco parking lot isn't? üòÑ Store inside is as expected,  clean,  organized,  and busy.  When I grab a bite to eat at the food court it bums me out they do not have a way of accepting tips or a tip jar for their hard work.  In the food court every employee seems to be working their butt off while maintaining excellent customer service.  THEY DESERVE A TIP JAR üôÇü§ô

As usual, we went into Costco to purchase a specific item & came out with cheesecake, which is the best you can get at any restaurant or store. Having said that, I was disappointed to learn Costco hasn't had Sd cards  since November, which seemed odd to me, yet other retail stores have also been out recently. I found some good deals like the 32¬∞ brand shirts, in white & and black, along with some various food items that made the trip well worth it. Costco is a fantastic company that has continually put forth quality products at a discounted rate.
The drawback is that it's difficult to leave without overspending due to the huge selection of goods  & great discounts.
Another fan favorite is the in-store cafe that has items like the Chicken Bake or all beef hot  dogsüå≠ along with various drink items that are well priced & fly out of the kitchen in volume. Costco has become an American icon, recognized as the industry leader in membership discount stores & I'll be back again and again.

It has great product variety and super friendly employees. The prices are competitive and food quality is good. But NEVER go on a Sunday morning, it is crammed with way too many people shopping and in a hurry to the point lines are really long. Other wise not a bad place to shop on bulk items.

Crowded- out area could use a second location.  Parking is terrible even on weekdays. I always find more than what is necessary when I shop and I like the food court convenience for the teens- sent them to eat so I can shop in peace. Also wish they kept more seasonal items in stock. Planters I wanted to purchase were gone the next day- trees as well on a separate occasion.

I give it a 4 not for the deals but how crowded it is!! They definitely do gave some great deals, but it's just me and my husband. I definitely don't need gigantic boxes of cereal or massive bags of chips!! But for us I bought what I knew we could use that wouldn't be wasted!! I bought grapes, 2 pack of canola cooking oil, 12 pk. Muffins, toilet paper, minced garlic to be honest I pay that same price for a jar half that size so it was worth it..uur grand total at check out was $185. I think they have good deals but some aren't really that great!! The crowds drive me crazy there's people going every which way!! There's also no one on the floor to ask for help finding stuff!! ... that was the hardest part for me!! It's a gigantic store so u just have to go aisle by aisle til u find what you need!! I shopped here a long time ago with a friend but she knew her way around. They did have pre-made large meals like lasagna and things like that tha run between $20-$30 so in a pinch thats a good deal.and theyre roasted chickens are superb at $4.99 each and i gotto tell u its worth it because the roasted chickens at regular grocery stores are half the size!! So tast and delicious.we just purchased our first Costco card yesterday..then we went shopping...so it's good for if were going halfers with someone, or for a party,  or if you have a big family but like I Said it's just me and my husband...I don't know if it's worth all the people in the store!! To me personally it's complete insanity. In the past we have had family members order and pick us up a cake for a birthday event and they do have the best cakes with the best prices. We heard the gas was cheaper and the lines were super long but we couldn't find any signs with the gas prices...they have everything here, electronics, books, clothes, shoes, patio furniture pretty much everything u might need!! Christmas shopping will be good to do here ...Anyway thos is just my opinion.Excellent produce dept, and eggs were right under $6.00 buy I yhink it was an 18 pack or somethin
Great deals, love the new summer stuff. Only four stars because of Costco small parking lot. No matter what time, always hard to find a spot to park.

This is a great Costco location. I you plan it out right and arrive 15-20 mins after open, you can get a close spot from the early birds that already got their stuff. Also coming after 7:30 is the best time as the lot is near empty. But run the risk if things like eggs being out.

If I could give no stars I would.. I was truly disappointed when I went into Costco Feb 23rd, 2023 @5:40pm, all I wanted was a Rotisserie Chicken and Hawaiian Rolls and was grossed out when I go and see that 30 chickens give it take were all destroyed.. Like I couldn't believe EVERY SINGLE CHICKEN WAS LITERALLY BLACK & BURNT, like literally black.. There was the shorter gentleman with darker, short, curly hair. And I asked if he was going to make more chickens, and he stated No they were done for the night.. There was probably a good 30 chickens sitting there just ruined and wasted & truly can't believe that Costco would allow this quality of food to be served to thier paying members, or product to be wasted like that either??!!
Kellen in the optical department is a genius! He fixed my sunglasses with all kinds of tricks. He helped choose my frames and made the whole thing easy.

Best place in Hillsboro to buy everything with a guarantee and extended return policy like no other.
From appliances to clothing from food to electronics, best brands, and best prices, no doubt üëå there are always special on many items
Every time I visited

I love Costco, they need more samples every day, and more lines open when 3s a crowd. Also the polish dogs no longer available sucks at the hot food section and no more sauerkraut. Times have changed.

This review is solely for their floral department, and the attitudinal employees who chat with each other instead of pulling the dead flowers out of the display. We were here today a few minutes ago and wanted to buy roses that are usually fresh. However, today, all the roses were old and they had two bouquets of completely dead roses. There were two floral department employees standing right next to it talking away to each other instead of checking on all the flowers. We tried to tell them that the roses are completely dead. Instead of looking at them in detail, they argued and tried gaslight us saying that they're just brown roses. Upon further inspection, they're supposed to be a light orangish yellow color with either pink or coral. I can remove this review once they discipline the employees or do better at taking care of their floral display.

Every timer come here it's always a fun experience. Majority time I tell myself I'm getting one thing but I always end up with half a cart full.  There are many phenomenal selections and especially good ones when they are on sale. If you hit it just right it's sample time and there's no limit to how many times you can go on by.  On weekends parking can be chaotic. If you get gas the lines move pretty fast. The Employees are always willing to go out of their way to help make your experience that much better

Some days I really like shopping here, other days I don‚Äôt. Too many people for my taste but the prices on some items I like getting can‚Äôt be beat. The employees are so so. I like parking away from everyone and if I want to take my time shopping and not worry about running into other peoples carts I come after rush hour ( people getting off work 4-6 ) after 6pm is usually okay.
Food court is pretty fast but whenever I want to get ice cream it says sold out.

Costco is a great place for most items and clothing. They often have great deals and usually have very reasonable prices. We love costco overall! The only place I buy diapers, wipes and formula when we using it. My daughter and I love getting lunch after shopping. Tasty pizza, hot dogs and mocha freeze!

Key words: self control.
There are so many reasonably priced items (!!) from electronics to clothing, home items, medications and food. It would be easy to leave spending way more than one planned. On average, painting with broad brush strokes, items are ~$20. So, though you're getting 30 whatevers, 5 items is already $100.
Definitely good for large families, small (or all?) business owners and people like me who eat more than 10 horses ü§£.
Looking for clean foods? Gluten free, no antibiotics, no notrites/nitrates and organic. Costco is the place to go, especially for bulk.

If I could leave a half star or no stars, I would. I set up WiFi through your employee Omar and it turned out to be higher than what he told me. When I came in to talk to him about it he told me to go to the other store and that their manager would just credit it. The other manager politely explained that he cannot credit due to it not being an issue from their store. You would think Costco t mobile would fix their issues instead of giving people the roundabout and telling them another store will fix their issues. Truly unprofessional and just ridiculous.

Costco is the best nationwide. I travel the country and every Costco I go has great employees. Keep up the good work.they are amazing üëè love these guys. Costco has the best Christmas üéÑ items in town.

Costco is great! The prices are kinda high but you are getting a lot more than you would at a non wholesale grocery store. The food court is great and has good prices. The samples are good and the kids like to go around and try the different food and snacks. The only reason I have it 4 stars instead of 5 is because their customer service could use some work. The people at the sampling stations always look miserable like they are hating life. Ot actually made me not even want to go into a Costco for a few months.

This here is Costco. Smoking prices on way too big of packs of stuff. 5 gallons of BBQ sauce? Done. A metric ton of sugar? This is the place. Good luck not spending at least a hundred dollars or buying seven hundred pounds of food. Also good prices on electronics and household stuff. The staff is always friendly and helpful.

They always have great deals and their staff is usually really nice. Especially the butchers in the back. I love getting my kids birthday cakes here, and the ordering process is simple. Their quick ready made meals are awesome and of course the chickens. I like the bags better for chickens and hope they stay instead of cases. They‚Äôre easier to hold and carry multiple.

I thoroughly enjoy exploring Costco when I'm in a new town and my recent visit to the Salem location left me impressed. This store is much bigger than my home location and, being in a different distribution zone, stocks many products I wish were carried at my location including Olipop, Alexia, and Kewpie. The expansive selection of Tillamook cheese was particularly envy-inducing. Even the food court surprised me with a unique item‚Äîthe roast beef sandwich. Spending a Friday night meandering the aisles was a delightful experience and our cashier was particularly friendly :)

I don't like Costco as much as I did at the Mission St location. It is harder to find parking here and it seems the people are ruder (the customers, that is). It is also a LOT more crowded since the move out South... which is great for them, but not as a shopper. The other building needed more repairs than they were willing to do, however, so they sold it. I do like that Chic-fil-a and Starbucks are both now in the same parking lot, though! That makes it super convenient and easy. The staff at this location are mostly all nice and helpful. One woman, in particular, I can't remember her name, but she has helped me a couple of times with my special needs client when she acts out and starts screaming. She brought her stickers and sat with us. It was really above and beyond. Jenn, in customer service, is really awesome and helpful, as well!

This location was crowded and I felt like the parking lots were tight and hard to find. It is like the other Costco stores where you can find everything. It is also hard to find the self service inflation

I love this store.  The only cons is 1.  They are not consistent about what they stock and 2. The check out lines are long.  The employees are awesome, knowledgeable, friendly and go out of their way to help you.   Oh, don't go here if you don't have storage space for everything you get.  It is, for me, almost impossible to go in for 1 or 2 items.  I get everything I need and  huge bags of things I see and can't live without.

A Costco is generally a Costco and a fairly good experience. I generally don‚Äôt leave a 1 star review unless something is extremely bad as is the case of this Costco.

This store has extremely rude and passive aggressive employees who go out of their way to be antagonistic-especially at the front entrance. The employees are disrespectful towards the customers to an extent I‚Äôve never witnessed in any retail store, much less the Costco brand-which is known for friendlier employees.

On site management seems pretty dense on the issue and treats any complaint as ‚Äútwo different sides‚Äù of the customer versus the employee. What the management should be doing is holding any employees accountable for unnecessarily rude behavior and looking at reasons of why a customer would go out of their way to complain.

I will be avoiding this Costco despite it being most convenient for me. If other Costcos start to become mismanaged the same way moving forward, I‚Äôll cancel my membership that I‚Äôve had for 25 years.

Edit: looked at other reviews and noticed many others complaining of the same extremely rude employee behavior. The information is clearly available, yet management doesn‚Äôt seem to do anything about it. Would hope to positively change my review in the future, though I won‚Äôt hold my breath.

Our first Costco experience in Oregon and it was a good one. Not chaotic and busy lines or crowded unlike some we have been to. In and out relatively quick and cheapest water we could find in town. Was looking for Pans mushroom jerky but couldn‚Äôt find any but found other products they don‚Äôt sell across the border which was great to bring back home and to get us along our road trip around the coast. Real positive experience as it gave us more time to hit Woodburn outlet!

Costco like we know it to be. The self check out was a clutch addition. The fact toilet papers are in the back is a smart move on your part. But I was in and out in less than 8 minutes. Would be shorter if not for the lines to check out!!
Nice location off I-5. Big, clean, and full of great items!

What's not to like about Costco?
Good prices on useful products.
Should you have an issue, returns are breezy. AND..cheerful employees!

This store and employees are great. The recent redesigning of parking lot is horrible. When you cross from the front door and head towards your car there is no direct route to any row except the first. You must go around or squeeze between cars. The crosswalk in first row heads right into a dead end. This is a very dangerous design.
Stopped in for gas and wound up renewing our membership that was expiring. Bought a couple of our favorite Costco items at great prices as usual. Go Costco!!

Worth the trip from Longview. Everything you need. Their deli is awesome. The huge chicken pot pie is a staple for anyone's freezer. It is SO good and will be the hit of any gathering. Of course the hot dog and coke for $1.50 is still a great lunch!

Costco is my number one choice for small appliances and electronics. I  enjoy sampling the food, which I will often stock if it passes the taste test. Good prices for clothing, pharmaceuticals, and books. In the past, I‚Äôve found good deals on outdoor  furniture.

One of the less busy Costcos in comparison to those in Seattle or Portland, which is a plus if your looking for items that are already sold out.  If the savings are more than a tank of gas, keep this location in mind.  People are very friendly and ready to assist.

Costco employees are the best! Always kind & fast.
The store is very well organized.
Yesterday they had a GREAT price on Wild Ahi Tuna. I bought a huge piece for my birthday, ate it raw with soy sauce. Absolutely delicious! Very fresh.

This Costco has a nice store layout, and the parking lot and the interior are both infinitely less crowded than the Tigard one down the road. It's very easy to navigate, though parking is getting harder to find here at times as it is getting more crowded.

Clean, well kept Costco with easy access off the freeway. Decent selection of products, friendly staff. Like most other stores they always seem to have holiday stuff in stock way too early (Christmas stuff after Labor day? Why, yes they do!) They're usually totally out by the time the season actually rolls around. Still, they had some cool stuff if you didn't mind the fact it was several months too early but it's mostly sold out by the time the holiday is near. The staff is helpful and the selection of products overall is still good.

The pharmacy staff is polite and helpful. I have some allergies and they always take the time to check the ingredients of every medication and make sure that it's safe for me. If the one in stock is not, they look for one that is an order that.

The tire center has great prices on tires and batteries, their prices on batteries are the cheapest in town. If a battery goes bad, they'll under the warranty and refund you the price you paid for it (or a prorated price if you're in the prorated time frame of the warranty). You only pay the difference in price if the battery has gone up in price. For tires, they will not run bigger tires than OEM or put tires on with a different speed rating, so if you're trying to run BFG KO2 tires or the like keep that in mind, as they likely won't do it. Also, they did damage the OEM wheels on a Corolla I used to own when I purchased Michelin tires from here. So keep that in mind and check your wheels before and after getting tires.

Nice selection of TVs at good prices. No delivery, but they've never offered delivery. The Food Court still has the same great prices it's always had. Membership is $60/year, so you get a lot of value for the price you pay.

Best place fir buying in bulk at the best price. Always busy with lots of shoppers, but it's huge and fairly easy to navigate even at the busiest times. Plan on spending some time in line even though they move pretty quickly considering how much stuff flows through the doors. Love this place.

Love Costco ..but in the few years the stores have been too crowded..difficult to find a parking space...I do not  enjoy  shopping here or anywhere when there is such a crowd..  customers are not pleasant when it is this busy...also I have been so disappointed in Costco's price raising...!  I used to go shopping here once a week..no more !  I stopped (9) months ago ..too expensive and I'm not willing to spend our money on items that have doubled in price !  So...I'm back to my basics ...cooking and baking from scratch...There are other stores to purchase what we need for 1/2 the price....
20% of the customers were nice. 20% of the customers were grumpy. 60% were normal. The vanilla ice cream wasn't working but it still let you order it so that kinda sucked. Otherwise it was ordinary.

We just love Costco for several reasons, but now, since we finally ordered a couple of pies to take home and I'm glad we did. You're definitely getting more than what you pay for. For 2 x 18" pizza it came to $21 and some change, which was definitely a steal. Something we would consider again for larger gatherings or that really lazy weekend!

This location is absolutely terrible when it comes to the parking lot. It is super small, stressful, and there is almost always an accident.  However, they do have a way better selection compared to the newer buckeye location. I advise that you only go on nonbusy times so you don't have to battle the crazy crowds.

I like Costco wholesale in general. Offering exclusive & worry free services & goods. This location in specific usually busy, doesn‚Äôt have a well designed parking routes, hard to navigate and find a parking. Checkout services are at the average. It is acceptable if you are looking for a Costco location to shop. Cheers!

It was good! There were no samples to taste other than an energy drink which was super good. We ended up getting hot dogs, pizza and ice cream and I had just enough money in my waller to pay for it as a treat for my girls and I. It was a blessing!

I think I've been to every Costco in this state, including Prescott and Tucson, and ones in Washington, Alaska, Virginia, and Maryland. I've ever been to a bad Costco .. until now. This is the worst Costco I've ever been to.

1.) The lines are somehow always backed up
2.) parking lot is terrible. Cramped, hard to get in and out
3.) gas station traffic inlet and outlet is terribly planned.
4.) there's never soft serve at the diner. May seem small, but I've never been to a Costco that's out of soft serve. It further cements that there's something stand out mediocre about this place.

I'd honestly rather drive to the one in Tempe off Elliot. While further away, this one is currently a mess.

This is a really nice new store.  The layout is a little different than most other Costco stores I've visited.   It also feels just a little smaller.   However, it still has a very extensive selection of items, many of which are unique to this location.  The employees are very helpful, and the place is immaculate.  The best part is that it's not overcrowded like other locations, which makes the shopping experience even more pleasant!
Brand new store located in Buckeye AZ.  Great service.  Lots of gas pumps which is nice as rarely any waiting.

This store just opened in July 2023 and is conveniently located off I-10 and Verrado. Place is larger than most costco in the Valley. It's only Sept and they have Christmas items on display. Well I just stopped in to grab a bite to eat for dinner for the long drive to Phoenix. Will definitely be back this way soon.

I love Costco! I have been a strong customer supporting the Kirkland brand since the early 80's when they (Costco) were getting up & running in Seattle! They have a diverse variety of products! However; management for, whatever reason, will kill (discontinue) great products too quickly! If good products don't fly off the shelf in the first week of exposure, say bye, bye? If it's not a quick hit! It's deleted from the lineup! Example: Zacks jalape√±o cornchips! Super flavor, nice crunch, excellent with a variety of dips! But now they're gone! They presently have a stellar green chili cheese dip that I also hope lasts w/some duration! But stay tuned for further details?

I love the store. Love my people and my friends, Cool Jeff, Fabian, Frankie, and much more, and the whole staff is super friendly. Also, Camila you are so amazing and cool and very super friendly. Hope to know all of you guys. Stay safe

This was my first time to Costco since I was a young kid. I lived in AK and the nearest one was too far away to make it worthwhile.
So, as a first-time time impression, I was absolutely floored by the overall experience. I could not believe how busy it was. But everything moved along very smoothly except for the occasional person not paying attention or rude Karen's thinking that the world evolves around them. I was impressed by the shear size of the place and the fact they have everything you need in bulk. The prices were very cheap compared to the Walmart we usually go to 3h outside of the valley. I didn't attempt to go to the gas station because I refuse to wait in line for more than 5 minutes for gas. The staff was super cool and very efficient at check out. The food court is out of this world good! I chose this location because it was a convenient stop from Las Vegas as we were heading through the valley and back to Eastern Arizona. Pulling off the freeway and trying to get over to Beardsley is a little tricky. Overall, I was delighted with everything. Can't wait to make another Costco run next month!

They called cops on my friends just cuz we was parked by taco bell eating in their truck while their truck was cooling down so it could be fixed so we could leave.. lets hope none of the employees  at Costco ever brakes down in a business parking lot and the people that work there doesnt harass them and call cops on them. Your not better than anyone else. We work just as hard as you do. Were not jerks to people were under standing and help people. Costco thinks there high class store but there not. They take foodstamps so they cant be to high class.

Love this place, can spend my entire life savings here! They have a great selection of electronics, house goods, furniture, garage stuff, clothing, shoes, outdoor/garden, kitchen stuff, cleaning supplies, foods of all kinds, alcohol, beauty care products, toiletries, etc. This Costco has a food court, gas station, pharmacy and tire center. This place gets really busy but it's hands down the best place to shop at! Customer service is consistently top notch! It's well worth the money spent for a membership and there's tons of unheard of perks for being a member (auto discount for parts/service at dealers, insurance, vacations, etc)
Cool yummy food but this one lady wouldn't let me and my friend in to go pick up our pizza even tho we had my mom's Costco card and she was like right there
Yay!  Pumpkin Cheesecakes are back!  Yummy!  Hurry!  They sell quick!  Hopefully supply this year will last to Thanksgiving Day! üôè

Alot of times I get veggies that are already rotten. Because migraine and vision I have hard time going there but to get for thr week worth food.
