They suppose to have quality of fruit and veggies. Anyone experience this? I can't drive not worth returning when your in so much pain. Here are pix

In the grand realm of bulk-buy empires, where towering aisles are the skyscrapers and shopping carts the chariots of the modern age, our hero embarks on an epic quest‚Äîa journey not for the faint of heart nor light of wallet. The arena of valor? None other than Costco, the colossal cathedral of consumption.

Our tale begins in the dim light of dawn, with our intrepid shopper, armed with a membership card sharper than Excalibur, arriving at the gates of Costco at the hour of 8, a full thirty minutes before the battle begins. The quest was simple, or so it seemed: to venture forth and secure three sacred artifacts, items of legendary repute and uncanny value.

But, ah! The path of a hero is never straight, nor is it ever devoid of temptation. For upon the opening of the gates, a siren song of deals and discounts filled the air, leading our hero astray. The first challenge: a mountainous display of electronics, whispering sweet nothings of high definition and infinite connectivity. With a steely gaze, our hero resists... only to fall victim to a fortress of fleece blankets, softer than the clouds of Olympus and just as inviting. One magically leaps into the cart, a stowaway on the journey.

The odyssey continues, through the treacherous terrain of sample stations, where sirens with hairnets and plastic gloves offer morsels of ambrosia‚Äîbite-sized temptations that ensnare our hero longer than anticipated. Each sample, a feast fit for the gods, yet leaving our protagonist yearning for more. The cart begins to fill, not with the sought-after artifacts but with goods of unspeakable delight and questionable necessity.

In the heart of the labyrinth, our hero encounters the clothing section, a realm where logic and reason battle against bargains and bulk. Here, the second cart joins the fray, summoned by the call of cargo pants that double as shorts‚Äîa garment of such utility it could only be forged in the fires of convenience.

As the clock ticks, the realization dawns: the three original items, the very purpose of this quest, have eluded capture. Yet, our hero stands at the checkout, not with the modest bounty of three but with two carts brimming with the spoils of adventure‚Äîa veritable treasure trove that includes everything from a kayak (for those just-in-case aquatic escapades) to a 72-pack of batteries (because one never knows).

The journey concludes, not with the triumphant acquisition of the sought-after three but with a cornucopia of unintended treasures. Our hero exits through the hallowed halls of Costco, pushing forth the chariots of plenty, a testament to the unpredictability of quests and the irresistible allure of bulk-buy bargains.

Thus ends the tale, a comical saga of ambition, distraction, and the universal truth that in the grand adventure of Costco, one does not simply buy what one intends. No, in this land of plenty, the carts are never half full, and the list is just a suggestion‚Äîa parchment to be ignored in favor of the epic, the unexpected, and the utterly inexplicable.

Amazing products and the staff was really awesome . We got the membership and even gave our kid a Costco badge custom made! And also redid our picture and hooked up our of to the card. Awesome service and products even with the food! It is amazing just for a low price you can get a large pizza for $1.99 and a soda for 69 cents ! Wow and you get product costs off because of the membership, so pretty much free discounts and amazing service! And they scan your products at self checkout! Awesome place!

We have been members here for years, we always get decent service. Lately the service has been top notch. Very friendly and helpful employees. Do not like the self checkout lines but the regular checkout lanes with the cashiers move very fast. They have two people working each lane and making sure that everything is lined up get any boxes that may be needed and it moves very quickly. We also find that since they closed the the area in front of the entrance to through traffic this helps the lanes move quick when exiting not having to worry about getting hit by a car in the parking lot. The store is very clean and well stocked and the restrooms are always very clean. The automotive section associates are very helpful and help you find the exact item for your car. We will continue to frequent this Costco in the future.
Good Quality Bulk Goods. Love shopping here for me family. Great rotisserie chickens. The necessary goods here are always available. Workers are pleasant. Overall good costco location. Will be Back.
Usually very busy, food court goes by fast. Nice having a self-check out, just don‚Äôt forget your card!

Friendliest Costco staff we have ever encountered. Mission that day was optical. Dr. Waters and staff in optometry were just great. Not only were they friendly they were knowledgeable and covered everything and more. I felt listened to and comfortable. I wish i had found Dr. Waters years ago.   I then ordered glasses and contacts from Samantha and Emily who were very helpful, knowledgeable and kind. Will be back again.

Marked lack of the Costco spirit and quality that I would normally expect. Was in town visiting family and made a Costco run. I got verified with my card 4 times. Rather excessive so there goes one star for extremism. The second check was done while I was looking at food. When I started asking questions as to why, the staff immediately became defensive and honestly rather rude. There‚Äôs another star. Get to the self checkout and get verified like normal currently. Then I get verified again at the actual checkout. At this point I‚Äôm extremely frustrated. I start asking questions again, they act extremely rudely back as if I can‚Äôt ask questions. There‚Äôs another star. When I leave, the lady asks me how my experience was. I said very poor. She then informed me that the last person I dealt with has been acting the same way for a while now. Now we are down to one star. Awesome job Costco. I can see that this location has poor customer service and honestly a bit of an attitude. Must be because all of the extremely defensive employees were silver badge employees. Too much time in company to get a sharp correction or management just doesn‚Äôt care.
Great place for a quick bite to eat the hot dog and drink is 1.50 the pizza is good too the prices on food is good at the food court and they have healthier options

Checking out is so easy. The clerks are efficient and friendly.
It was interesting removing the rotisserie chicken from the bags rather than the plastic containers. Ugh.
Great store otherwise.

Costco is Costco the best shopping ever. Their eyeglass department is excellent and has a wide variety of quality frames to choose from. You can‚Äôt beat their meat department. Kirkland frozen food is the best frozen food there is on the market and their fruits and vegetables last a lot longer than any regular grocery store. Just everything is better quality and don‚Äôt miss the pizza. Super delicious.

We get our all important Gluten free bread here, also lunches and dinner meats. They had Made in the USA shirts too! Thank you for getting in more gluten free options! üá∫üá≤
New dog toys! üêï

The worst costco! Always moving things around.  Poorly trained staff, parking lot full of carts, staff standing around having personal conversations rather then offering customer service. One female staff was blocking an isle while discussing how God has saved her and the gospel. As I made eye contact she reached over flipped her name badge around. Not sure what has happened to this store? It use to be my favorite store, but I now know why friends are switching to Sam's club.

Ziggy is fantastic. You are all very lucky to have a kind person interacting with your customers. I misplaced my card in my wallet and he told me no rush, lay out your cards and we will find it. And I did without feeling rush or like an inconvenience. His demeanor overall is wonderful to interact with. It‚Äôs people like him that shine light in people‚Äôs lives even if it‚Äôs for the small interaction that occur at checkout.

I've been going to this Costco since 2019 as an executive member. The prices and local deals are pretty good for most items. Staff is great and store is well kept. It does get very packed during snow bird season however.

I guess I'm not the right demographic for Costco, but it doesn't seem like a value to me.   At least as far as groceries.   The choices are ultra limited,  most of the prepackaged stuff I've bought simply doesn't taste good.   And I don't think I save any money.   I spent $250 on groceries and it all fit into one box.  Not even enough to last a week.

Sure,  saving a bit on gas is nice,  but I doubt I fill up my tank enough to cover the cost of membership.

Bottom line,  it may have been a good idea at one time,  but the value is not there any longer

I‚Äôve been going to this Costco for years and watched it going downhill over the last few. People are treated like cattle. Costco puts the old stuff upfront even if it‚Äôs expired. In the meat department, I have witnessed meat that has expired and still out. When I questioned the attendant, He said they had just put it out.
I‚Äôve been repeatedly charged twice for same items. Sometimes I catch It at the store other times I don‚Äôt until I get  home. Some times, the double charges were caught at the door.
Last year I purchased a diamond ring of which was labeled 1.49 karat. But when it was all said and done, it was only 1.1 carat. I returned it which took weeks to process. This is a huge chain store so issues are bound to happen, and I completely understand, but it is happening repeatedly. Better  management is needed And better. treatment  of the public is needed. Expired food should be removed from the shelves and not forced down peoples throats.

Although the parking lot was pretty full. The warehouse was easy to navigate. We found everything we were going for with no issue. The employees were friendly. The gas station was busy but once you got in as long as you didn't pick the first two islands.  we got in a line that we were going to be next, once the two in front of us were done. I am a Costco employee but not in the state of Arizona.

I'm lucky to live a couple miles from this Costco. We don't go inside often. I tend to go crazy and buy too much! But we will usually get our gas here. The lines are long, but they move quickly and I try to work a Starbucks stop in right before our fill up! Quick tip though... I've recently downloaded other gas stations apps and have found I can actually get gas at a better price without the crowds so I might have to find another reason to stop by my favorite Starbucks (besides the coffee)!

I‚Äôm a cosco guy now‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs hard to beat what they got going on here. And great location. I come here all the times. Costco of course always has great deals and their customer service is top notch. It‚Äôs really true, one you go Costco you won‚Äôt go back!

The guy in the self check out total A$$. He was so rude only because in the picture of my membership I don‚Äôt have glasses. He made some rude comments and asked for my driver license like he thinks is a cop. Telling me if you don‚Äôt showed it to me I not going to let you scan.
Everything in the same day I bought the membership and took the picture.. idiot.

Super friendly staff. Very knowledgeable about the store and where different items are. I had forgotten something as I was in the checkout lane, and a very nice gentleman ran and got the item for me. Everyone was smiling.

Happen to be in North Phoenix, was en route home from a really long RV trip( 4 months in Mexico) we needed some supplies for the last leg through the US to get home, so we stopped at this Costco and yep it was Costco it had everything I expected it to have and a few things I wasn't looking for that I could use. Good location with lots of parking. Well stocked store. Deli is not as top notch as in past but still doable. Staff are helpful and friendly with store clean and easy to maneuver.

The store clerks are always friendly. Getting gas at this location is a little frustrating given the line of cars and  convoluted entryway to the pumps. Shopping is okay here, and returns are quick and easy.

Shout out (and huge thank you!) to assistant manager Mark Suarez!  Thanks for your consideration and patience, and for your immediate help to my elderly dad dealing with the 'lemon' TV we'd bought him... so glad we bought from Costco, great customer service, and so glad that you were on duty yesterday to help him, Mark!

Worst shopping experience ever been.

Update:
Glad to see the food court coming back. Bought some heavy duty racks for the shop. Decent price and amazingly sturdy.

Still the place to go for truck loads of stuff.

Costco, it's crucial to reassess your partnership with Citi for your credit card services, given their significant financial support of environmentally damaging activities. Your customers trust you to make eco-friendly choices. Let's pioneer sustainability together!
I love that many seniors use this warehouse to get their steps in every day.    I like their policy that if something goes on sale within thirty days of purchase, you can get a refund.

We've been shopping at this Costo since it opened almost 20 years ago.   From our experience, the staff provides the best service out of all other locations. We've been to stores in California, Colorado, TX and others in AZ. The staff in this location is excellent and always helpful. They're always willing to help resolve any issues and have an excellent understanding of customer service. The store managers should be recognized for maintaining such a consistently positive customer experience.  As an example, yesterday I bought a pair of pants and when I got to my car, I realized they dropped out of my arms between the store and my car. I went back to the store to ask if someone turned them into lost and found. The pants were not there so the manager gave me a credit to buy a new pair.  Also, anytime I've had to return an item, there are no questions asked and they refund my purchase. I have yet to find another company that is as customer focused as Costco. My family spends an average of $12k per year at this store and we'll continue doing so as a result of their excellent service.

I've been to this particular Costco a few time but hadn't had the chance to review and post pictures. For this review I have pictures and a video of the outside. It's located on Indian School Rd. and 31st Ave. Inside the Plaza del Sol area.
This store is mostly for commercial customers. It does have many smaller quantities items for home customers but if you look at tye pictures I posted, you will see the quantities are for restaurants and stores that buy here for resale. The isles are almost double the size since most customers here are using the flat bed carts to shop. They do have multiple registers open and moving faster than other Costco stores, so waiting in line was not an issue.
The store it's about the size of two regular Costco with massive walk-in freezer for meats, dairy, and other cold temperature products.

The store it self is amazing alway fine what I need for my business. I wish I can say the same with there customer service. I truly wish I can talk to anyone about the incident I had with a cashier name Dob she truly needs to improve her customer service.

Parking SUCKS!
Prices good. Interesting selection compared to the Costcos I have been in. A lot of brown boxed, very large full size quantities available.

Nice affordable prices in bulk to save money. No complaints here. A pretty good store with a variety of products, designed for businesses and customers to save money . I mainly use it to buy vitamins and stock up on healthy treats in my classroom. You always know you‚Äôre getting a good discount, compared to out retails to save money $
We love to come one every few weeks from Sedona area! Come load up on all our food & supplies for our growing family! Thanks for always having what we need at the best prices !!

Who doesn‚Äôt like Costco.  If you can‚Äôt find it a Costco maybe you don‚Äôt need it.  Staff is great, services are excellent. The free samples are back, hot dog is still 1.99, gas is good quality and the best price in town if you don‚Äôt have Fry‚Äôs points. Worth the price of admission. Join become a member..

The variety is generally less, but the quality of the goods is notably better than your neighborhood grocery store. Best for restaurants, celebrations and large families, and Saturday "munchies" at Costco is a "thing". The biggest downside is for the disabled. There are probably a dozen electric carts available at the store, but it's not unusual to wait outside for a half hour or longer to obtain one. Still, it's usually worth the wait.

We shopped at our Prescott Arizona Costco # 466 today. We also took along a friend who is 97.
She received excellent care at the hearing center from Dan-O.
Upon checking out we also received most excellent customer service and care from Stephanie K.
She helped track down a ‚Äúlost card‚Äù , was very kind to our friend who gets worked up pretty easily.
Everything got sorted out in an efficient and professional manor.
I hope Stephanie gets some special recognition for going above and beyond to assure our friend all would be taken care of .
I believe Stephanie  K works in the executive customer care department.
Thank you Stephanie K and Dan-O.
What a pleasant shopping experience at Costco!
No problem here! Super clean, wide aisles, friendly staff and fun with holiday inventory.

Shout out for great service in tire shop, Kyle took the time to explain details and helped us unload and load 6 batteries.  Top Shelf service.. he gave us suggestions on what to buy and why.. great attitude.. Thank You!

And thanks for new Costco in Queen Creek..

Papers please!  That would be, how I describe the place in two words. You sign up, become a member, pay your yearly fee and it used to just be that you show your card at the door, but now they want you to show your card at the door, show to a extra person at self check out Who has nothing to do with the checkout process ( which is the only way to quickly get through check out because they don‚Äôt have many registers open anymore) and of course, stand in a line, sometimes quite long so they can look at your receipt. Overall, the place makes you feel like a criminal just for shopping there. Selection is pretty good and the prices are OK, not amazing. I find it annoying that the only interaction you have with employees is to check your papers and if you actually are looking for one to try and help find something, it‚Äôs difficult to find one. When I asked why they have so many checkpoints I‚Äôm given the generic response that they‚Äôre worried about other people using someone‚Äôs card. Yet if they were that worried, perhaps they should implement a different system, or better yet open more registers.

I tried to get in at 9:30 on SUNDAY because Im super busy and I cannot go shopping during the week.
The woman in the enter told me "We don't open until 9:45"
So, I must to wait outside for 15 more minutes! Luckily the weather was good.
It's ridiculous that this store open so late and close too early!
Too many people now in this town to open that late.
In Sam's club they always let me get in early and don't make a big deal üò°
Also, they don't accept MasterCard!!!! ü§£üòÇ
Unbelievable!
No internationals like Sam's!

My son and I went to the optical department to shop for new frames. We looked for at least fifteen minutes and none of the ladies working there (who were standing around complaining about the last customer) even bothered to acknowledge us. When a Caucasian woman approached, they immediately asked if she needed assistance. The Hispanic gentleman was the only one assisting a customer- and as soon as he was done with them, he came over, apologized for the wait, and helped us. He was lovely and even gave us a free cleaning cloth.

Hopefully contacting corporate will bring this issue to light- because every human deserves to feel valued and to be treated fairly.

Large new Costco just opened today.  I like the newer layout.  Everyone was very nice and friendly.  It's going to be very busy for some time, so please understand that before you come.  They were even handing out little costco carts for their grand opening.   Welcome to the area Costco!

I‚Äôve never met a Costco I didn‚Äôt love. This location is very convenient for me and I‚Äôve been here too many times lol.

What can I say, Costco always carry new unique things for sale and today, I found a beautiful succulent arrangement for $19.99! I also found a box of 8 crispy potato corn dogs on sale for $7.69! Regular price is $10.69 so it‚Äôs a great deal. It‚Äôs an item I‚Äôve never seen before but another shopper said it‚Äôs so good so of course I had to get a bag. Their regular prices are very good , but when they have sakes, prices can‚Äôt be beat.

Today, they also had a couple events going on- jewelry and Candy & Chocolate Coz dipped apples- 3 of them for $13.99 which is a great price.

This store is always busy but today seemed busier than usual. I could not believe I scored 2 free huge protein bars at one of the sample stations. They sell for )4 each. How can I not love Costco? :)
We shop here all the time, busy but clean, and they do a good job of keeping things stocked. They should bring the churros back, though üòã

The Costco on Market Street in Gilbert stands out as the best in Arizona, and I've visited over six! The cleanliness of the store is immediately noticeable, and it sets a welcoming tone right from the entrance. The staff here are not just friendly but also exceptionally helpful and genuinely caring, which makes a huge difference in the shopping experience. The selection of products is amazing, covering everything you could need and more. However, be quick with new items as they tend to sell out fast! It's a fantastic place for one-stop shopping, combining quality, variety, and excellent service. I always look forward to my visits here and highly recommend it to anyone in the area.

Costco has gone down hill! If I could give it zero stars I would. My partner and I pay the fees, renew and maintain the memberships, and frequent the stores. Everyone knows the boycott situation with Walmart due to the receipt police after self check out. But nobody talks about the insane helicopter Costco employees by the check out and even throughout the store. I understand showing your membership card for entry. You have to verify that I'm a member before entry‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs totally okay. I understand checking the receipt upon exiting to make sure the item count is correct‚Ä¶ I completely understand.
But I was asked to show my membership card again while shopping in the clothes. Again while standing in the self checkout line. Again when we got to the kiosk.
A woman walked up and grabbed the scan gun to start scanning my items. I said nothing but Once she saw my face she stepped back as if to allow me to continue. She never put the scan gun back for customer use so I then had to take all the groceries out of the cart then scan and put them on the scale and then back in the cart.(considering it‚Äôs self check out shouldn‚Äôt the customer be able to use the scan gun to scan my own items? If I wanted an associate to scan them I would go to a line with a cashier).  She then stood there and stared at me to insure I didn‚Äôt skip scanning any items. (Isn‚Äôt that why they check the receipt at the door?) (if the concern was theft, why did Costco implement self checkout?)

Previously, I asked the associate who verified my membership ‚Äúis there a reason they check for memberships after entry and prior to check out?‚Äù
She said absolutely there is‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs to ensure other family members are not using the membership because when they do prices go up. Her example was they don‚Äôt want daughters using mom‚Äôs membership. I understand they believe it will stop daughter from using moms membership when moms not there. Realistically this doesn‚Äôt change anything, whether mom is present with daughter or daughter shops alone with moms card‚Ä¶ daughter still will not have membership and shop and the groceries will go home with whoever.
Checking memberships over and over is not going to stop family members from using others memberships‚Ä¶. It‚Äôs only going to upset other customers and derive them from shopping here. Just it did with us today.
Nice clean well organized Costco. Friendly staff. Receiving department goes above and beyond. Thanks to Zach for being always friendly and cheerful. Keep selling the water. I‚Äôll bring you more!

Solid Costco! Can never go wrong with costco. They got the quality with Kirkland brand making everything from granny panties to hot dogs. And their meal court is banging. Literally worth the membership just for the amazing quality food at a decent price. My one feedback is they need more staff on the actual floor to find stuff. It's huge it can be difficult.
10/10 to this great store, quality products and great prices.. everything clean, organized and the best customer service.

What is wrong with the Tucson Costco's food courts? This is the second visit to a different Costco in less than a week. This time I got a slice of pizza. This has to be the smallest slice I have ever seen. If I had a scale I would have weighed it because I'm positive it was under 5 ounces! The tin foil had more bulk to it than the pizza!
I am OVER IT! In N Out from now on!

While shopping 3 days before Thanksgiving, this place was packed. The lines were 7 aisles long. I needed a rest, so I found an amazing xl beanbag chair in a hidden spot and rested. P.s. I found everything I needed. I hope you get a little chuckle!

Costco is now putting their previously yummy rotisserie chickens in bags instead of a plastic covered roasting pan.  Ugh! They are not nearly as juicy anymore. What gives? We always recycled the plastic pans! Please bring them back!

Was visiting Arizona last week and needed a place to get some items on bulk. Great Costco in a good location. A good variety of items especially seafood options. The staff were polite and great. The self check out machines sometimes glitch and you need an employee to assist you.

Costco has a well prepared store layout that makes shopping there very time efficient.
Today, full lot, full store. I was able to locate, basket and checkout with little or no delay.

Came and bought a TV.  Went to the loading dock.  Encountered the employee Jeff. Very unpleasant experience.  He was not friendly at all.  He had an attitude.  He picked up the TV and just threw it in the back of the car before we could move other groceries and furnace filters we had just bought.  He almost damaged the filters when he aggressively threw the TV in the back of the vehicle.  HE SHOULD NOT BE ASSISTING FOLKS WITH LOADING THEIR VEHICLES.

Going to Costco on a weekend is like driving the wrong way down the 101.  You may get where you're going, but it will be interesting to navigate.  We were actually in and out in good time, considering the number of people that must run into their long lost relatives and feel the need to block the entire aisle while they visit.  Some ever so subtle "cart ramming" with a polite "I'm sorry, I didn't know this was the waiting area?" comment, does work wonders.  The staff was very helpful in keeping people moving, and only had to deploy cattle prods on two occasions.

Great Costco! The food court staff are outstanding! I don‚Äôt know of any other place where you will find staff with more hustle. I bring my kids here often for pizza and hotdogs and not only is it the most affordable way to feed kids in town, it is fast too. They keep the tables clean and the napkins, straws, and condiments are always stocked. If you call ahead and order your pizza, they usually have it ready in less than 15 minutes. You can also grind your coffee beans in the food court area while you wait

Good selection. Tons of products to buy especially ones I didn't know I needed. Loved their selection of frozen meals that are quick and easy to make. Their taco meal kit was amazing. Just the right amount of food for three--we had leftovers. And the tortillas were amazing. A must try for any one looking for a quick and easy yet delicious meal.
Always busy and clean. The lines move fast. The samples this time were spot on. Can‚Äôt pass up a roasted chicken.

Costco in Surprise, AZ, has become a staple in our weekly routine for groceries and more, often at the request of our children. The staff consistently impresses with their friendly and attentive service, ensuring a positive shopping experience. While most employees excel in customer service, there's room for improvement with the demeanor of the older cleaning lady at the food court. Nevertheless, the store maintains exceptional cleanliness and organization throughout. Despite the crowd, the food court operates efficiently, minimizing wait times. A special touch comes from the receipt checkers who consistently draw happy faces for my kids, bringing joy to their shopping trip. Costco remains a top choice for our family, offering not just quality products but also memorable experiences that keep us coming back week after week.
Wonderful Costco. Great for truck driver deliveries. Fast unloading, clean restrooms and friendly service. Great place for shopping as well. Can‚Äôt beat the prices. Love Costco.

Went to get my eye prescription filled.  The wait is a bit ridiculous, an hour long. Quite frankly, the frame choices were very disappointing and extremely limited, in my opinion. I didn't find anything I really liked, so I reordered my current frames... again! I just need to see.  LOL

Nice costco location. Everything was really organized and clean. They had a boatload of staff available. They were all friendly too ans helpful. The parking lot was a mess with so much congestion but that's to be expected. They have a tire ship and car stuff also. The bathrooms could be cleaner would be some other feedback. But other than that good experience and left happy and full with the amazing costco food court. Literally the reasons we go sometimes can't beat the food prices and quality at their food court!

I always enjoy my Costco experience! This location has just about everything the other locations have in the Valley. The staff are friendly and helpful. They were collecting donations for Muscular Dystrophy and each time they got a donation, they would all ring a small bell. The staff was very energetic with this.

The location was very neat and organized. I observed an employee straightening up the clothes area. I saw customers just throwing the shirt or pair of pants back on the pile without any care of consideration. My heart goes out to the employees who have to pick up after messy customers.

I ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza, vanilla ice cream, and a soda from the food court. They were very busy, but received my order within 2 minutes. It was also a very cheap meal.

I highly recommend this location to anyone who loves to shop in bulk. Also anyone who loves a great bargain and shopping experience!

Jonathan in the pharmacy is extremely aggressive. I have never felt so disrespected and dumb for asking a simple question. Maybe he needs to remember we don‚Äôt all work there and don‚Äôt know what is going on and has the right to ask a question regarding their order.

Always a top notch shopping experience at Costco.  Inventory is 90% consistently the same or similar between stores in different states. You just cannot go wrong with the Costco shopping experience.  The only issue at the Tempe location is parking...difficult to find a good spot depending on the time of day...

I went to Costco for the first time and I am so sad I never went sooner!? Parking is absolutely atrocious and so is the line for the little food area they have!!! You really can‚Äôt beat the prices!!! Workers were very friendly and super professional! I LOVE the prices! The rotisserie chicken O M G! $5 for one!? I can finally meal prep and save money! Their croissants for only $6!? And you get SO many!? Literally I am so happy. Checking out was SUPER fast as well.

Best place to shop for the best prices and the quality of Kirkland is the best when it comes to food and products. It‚Äôs easy to shop on the app and delivery is perfect. Then going there for eight years and I go once a week. I love their frozen food. It is so easy to cook and convenient, and the price is amazing

Good Costco. Nice layout. Plenty of product available. Clean, organized shelves/tables/aisles. Friendly, helpful staff. Small food court sitting area, small gas station. Parking wasn't a problem.

This isn't the closest for me, but sometimes we come here instead.

The pharmacy is great but the staff on the regular store floor can sometimes be rude to customers. Today one of the young ladies working the floor wanted to get by at the same time as me and another couple. I started moving (I had no cart) and she jutted the bin she was rolling right toward me to cut me off. I went around it and politely apologized to her and she started muttering things under her breath. Really? Being rude to customers isn‚Äôt what I expect from employees here. Have floor staff been briefed on how to treat customers, especially polite ones, in this busy environment? Do they try to hire patient staff that can handle working at busy Costco? Don‚Äôt shove your bin at me to cut me off. Wait the one second it takes for me to pass. And don‚Äôt rudely talk under your breath when I have kindly acknowledged you. Staff should be politely acknowledging us. Please Costco‚Äî keep the quality up of the staff you hire, or train them to have some.

They have a hard-working staff. I enjoy their small talks. I enjoy that they are accommodating with drinks. You could mix and match your own sometimes they've even made personalized ones before for me. So I quite enjoy their service and how tentatives they are to their customers. I highly recommend them.
They've changed the layout a little, but it's still a great place to shop. And the meats are amazing! Well, everything is amazing. Friendly and helpful staff, yummy samples, clean and organized.

Solid costco. They had alot if stuff for a great quality. And sold everything from granny panties to hot dogs. My one feedback is they seemed understaffed on the floor couldn't find someone to help me find something. Othersise their foodcourt alone is worth the membership.

Update from 1-9-24:
As always, I love this Costco! This is my favorite one in the city.  My daughter's only complaint is that each aisle doesn't have a sample!!!
Originator post:
Always great! Great diaper prices!
Update 12-12-22
Great selection! Expanded selection of clothes for the Christmas season.
Another update from 2-16-23
I have to update everyone as I would probably give it more than a 5 star, but that's not possible. I called there today at the last minute, thought to check on car battery prices, and found that they had the best price with the best warranty. When I 1st got on the phone with Nick, there was a bad connection, and he offered to call me back, fixing that connection. I took the old battery to Costco, he was actually at the cash register, took care of getting me the new battery, and was genuinely friendly. Way to go, Costco Nick is a definite asset to your company, and I feel like he went above and beyond what was expected.  I will definitely be purchasing all future auto batteries from Costco!

Older Costco, but far better than the other two in the area of for one reason, not nearly as busy. There isn‚Äôt this unbearable line for gas or to check out. I‚Äôd avoid on the weekend like the plague, but at least it‚Äôs not absurdly busy. Skeptical of this business model. In the past it worked.
However I value my time as well as a good bargain. Driving to a packed store with limited hours and having little to no idea what they have in stock. Clearly it‚Äôs about impulse buys. Competitors in the big box arena offer pickup services. They will even bring your items to your car. This is great for elderly and disabled. Then you can determine if an item you need is in stock. Not at Costco. I just think this model is dated and needs an update.

The East side Costco was our trek today and what a visit it was. This store feels like (I haven't checked) a bigger than normal store and the parking lot can feel overwhelming.
Once we got inside of this megalopolis of a store, it almost felt like we were still social distancing.
The isles are wide and there was plenty of room for shopping, socializing, and sometimes just parking your cart in the middle of an intersection to ponder life....
The checkout was fast and the store was clean; the workers were friendly and jovial, not a word I use carelessly. Lol

I recently moved from Denver to Sierra Vista. Unfortunately the closest Costco is in Tucson.
I used to like going to Costco, I like to take my time shopping and browse through the isles, that's when I lived in Denver. The Costco in the River Point shopping center was really nice,clean and not a nightmare zoo like the Costco in Tucson. I actually hate shopping at Costco now, there are so many people you can barely move around, it doesn't matter what day or time, parking is a nightmare. I run in and grab what I need and since I'm in such a hurry to get OUT of there I usually forget something. Very disappointing.. that's my opinion.

Costco is a shopper's paradise, offering a vast selection of high-quality products at unbeatable prices. From fresh groceries to electronics and household essentials, Costco has it all under one roof. The Kirkland Signature brand exemplifies exceptional quality and value. With friendly staff and convenient services like pharmacy and optical, shopping at Costco is always a pleasure. Plus, membership perks add even more value to the experience. Overall, Costco is a must-visit destination for savvy shoppers looking for great deals and top-notch products.

This is the Costco close to our house. They always have great deals, but sometimes the sizes are limited, which can be a letdown (my only reason for deducting a star). The lines are usually long later in the day, but the self checkout moves very quickly. Just make sure you have your membership card in hand because they will check it before you get to the register.

FOOD COURT.  You need a better delivery syatem.  Good price, that is not a problem.  For me to wait 1:30 hrs for having purchased 2 pizzas on site and 1:15 hr wait for having called it in defies common sense

Start by recognizing, you are selling more pizza between 11 and 1, than you can prepare and hand over.

Learn from your own numbers and start an early production.  Find out, if you would be disappointed

This is our go to Costco in the area. It's clean and organized and the people are pretty nice. Pharmacy is fantastic and normally has what we need. The tire center is also fantastic and it only took about 30 minutes to put on 4 new tires with an early morning appointment.

Overall I love this location. Staff is friendly and helpful.  But what has happened to the cafe?

45 - 60 min for a pizza?
3 people on a Friday night?
Products are not right

Use to be better, a lot better

It was super busy when we went on Sunday, the parking lot was jam packed!
But navigating the store was surprisingly painless. We got everything we needed (and some stuff that we didn't need üòÜ). Didn't even have to wait in line to check out. It was a real smooth Costco trip!
Bonus: they had a few tasty food samples available to try!
Love the place and all the treats you get along the way üòÇ good prices too
The parking lot can get a little crazy here, but other than that it is like most Costcos. Great deals on food court items, rotisserie chickens, miscellaneous monthly sale items.
No proper lighting in at the back parking lot.

This Costco has everything you could imagine under the sun. My Wife and I were tasked with picking up some last minute items for my Mother in law. As soon as we arrived we were over whelmed by the amount of people that were there. We were fortunate enough to find the staples that we needed. There was one scenario when my wife had found a huge tub of Philadelphia cream cheese, she picked it up and it was almost bigger than her head. She had never seen a big tub of cream cheese like that ever I think. My recommendation for shopping at this Costco, is to arrive early so you can avoid all the shoppers traffic. I highly recommend this location.

Costco located in Walldorf has ample parking and offers a variety of products. What stands out the most is the consistent kindness of an employee named Nicole, who always provides professional service with a warm smile.

Although I once considered switching to another Costco due to a rude employee at the customer service center, Nicole's demeanor has made me want to stay.

As a five-year veteran, I hope to continue seeing her friendly face during my visits. While I won't mention the name of the rude employee, I trust the store manager to make the right decisions and recruit excellent staff.

Also, what do you think about expanding the variety of chicken wings with flavors like spicy and super spicy?

I often purchase them, and I believe offering spicier options could increase sales. I wonder what others think about this idea."

We have been using this Costco since we moved from Florida in Oct 2023 and we love it. It has always been clean and organized, employees are always willing to help, and if things are out of stock they seem to be restocked quickly. The only downside is that when it's busy, it is PACKED and no buggies available.
Always a great shopping experience. If you can't find it here it might not exist. Even when they are busy the checkout lines move quickly.

I watched this person ( in the photo) load half the machine with raw chicken one by one. She proceed to put the trays they go in as well as the rib trays on the table, and handling everything else without changing the raw chicken gloves.

She even put her hands with those contaminated gloves on inside the big black gloves she took the meat out of the machine with. Then use the same contaminated raw chicken gloves after she took off the big black gloves to put the lids on the food as well as put the weight and price on it. as you can see in the photo, she still using the same contaminated, raw chicken gloves, while handling the pen and clipboard.

On top of that you can barely ask her for any kind of service or questions as she is a very unhappy and a rude person in generally responding to you.

This is a typical Costco. However, I have to say that the Optical place is exceptional. Exceptional service and EVERYONE working there is really friendly and/or helpful. I'm sure I learned more there in 15 minutes than I have anywhere else.

visited the store while visiting town ,
The location did not disappoint as always , have decent selection of items,  The warehouse was well-organized, and the staff was friendly and helpful. For Monday evening  checkout could have been little bit more faster however it was not  too bad.

Gas station has long line and took loooong before we could fill gas ! If you are remotely in a hurry to reach somewhere please avoid the gas filling part

It‚Äôs amazingly stocked and very crowded, Owning mills one is less crowded. They were allowing entry even beyond 6:30pm!
The staff is amazing, they have great deals! We even found ghee (clarified butter) in this one. Many November deals and it‚Äôs beginning to feel a lot like Christmas. They have great chocolate options now! Spices can also be found, even cinnamon sticks. Minced garlic was still not there. Drone is also on sale!
This week, there are lots of Black Friday sale!

Came to this location for a regular weekly run & noticed some of the holiday sale items like to share with you all. These are greatly discounted items.

I‚Äôd also like to mention, Throughout the years, I noticed this location tends to have some of the items many Frederick, Arundel Mills or other nearby locations don‚Äôt carry. So in case if you are looking for anything particular and couldn‚Äôt find elsewhere, do check out here.

Not sure if I will buy produce at Costco again. I bought strawberries and nectarines at a good price and was really excited to try them at home only to find that the strawberries in the middle were really spoiled and one of the nectarine had a developing mold. LIKE WHAT. I never had strawberries from Sam‚Äôs Club turn out bad so it was a real disappointment when not one but TWO Costco produce items turned out to be really bad. Had to throw away like one fourth of the strawberries :((

It was my first time here and I was taken back by what I‚Äôve seen. The customer base obviously should be more respectful to the space as it seems a horde of litter bugs have come about but it seemed evident that there is a lapse in cleanliness within the dining area. Kitchen staff was swift and hard working.

I love this store. The prices on produce alone makes it worth the drive. It‚Äôs worth coming up once a week just to get large clamshells of berries that you would normally pay significantly more for just a pint clamshell at your local store.

There is a large parking lot, the ability to purchase, gas,  low cost food at the food court, a pharmacy, Costco ‚Äúdeals‚Äù for major purchases, optical services, travel and extensive groceries selections.

The store requires a membership, which I believe is worth every penny. You can buy just about anything here.

Love this location. It is clean, well stocked, lines move quickly at check out and they even have self checkout lanes. Cashiers are excellent.

I highly recommend you get a membership and visit this location - you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Came here for body lotion and to check out if any new items added. And noticed MD merch are running out of sizes, new dessert items added. There are six options of body lotions, considered as a good selection choices.
However, in general, this location normally don‚Äôt have as many selections as the Columbia or Arundel Mill‚Äôs location.

I am a fan of Costco. I have had a subscription since 2015. I buy electrical appliances and furniture because I trust them and they help the customer a lot in the event of a return or if the goods are defective. In my last visit, I was not able to shop. To be honest, the prices are very high. I feel that I need to offer  A loan from the bank so that I can buy food. Meat, fish, chicken...everything is expensive. The quantity may be larger than in some stores, but I need $300 to buy a piece of fish, meat, and chicken!!!  Imagine...as there are some items that carry their Costco logo, their prices seem lower than other  prices. I was walking around and I was under the influence of shock. If I wanted to buy vegetables, meat, and bread, as I said, I will apply for a loan...I love Costco. Please be considerate.  People come to you from far away places.. so that you can find competitive prices and good goods.. also the price is important. We are not rich, we are just employees who take our wages by the hour. Imagine that I work a whole day for a piece of meat, and maybe I need to work for two days.....‚òπÔ∏è

This Costco is disappointing. Not time efficient. Long lines. Parking is insane with carts left everywhere. There‚Äôs a lack of employees it seems, almost NO registers are open ever, little to no one doing samples and I can never find someone to help me when I have questions etc.
the line for register was all the way to the rotisserie chickens.
I‚Äôm thinking of canceling my membership and opening one at BJ‚Äôs instead honestly, not worth it. I used to love this Costco, it‚Äôs gone down the drain within the last few weeks.

Extremely disappointed with this Costco. Shopping here used to be a great experience but these past few weeks checkout lines have been extremely long and the entire store has been super unorganized. The returns and customer service lines were so backed up it took over an hour to return one thing. Contemplating having my husband cancel our membership this isn‚Äôt worth it.

Staff are not friendly and they don't want to be fair with you. I got a Mikasa set and found a broken bow! inside. I went to the store the next day, they told me since they don't have any sets in the store at that moment, I can't get any replacement and I have to go to Costco in Frederick, which is more than 30min drive away, to return the whole set and get a new set. How am I supposed to fit everything back to the box and safely transport them to Frederick? I've been shopping at Costco for more than 4 years and I always loved it. I'm very disappointed at the staff at this location.................................................................................................................................................................

This has to be the worst location for a Costco.  The parking garage is an absolute stressful experience that is enough to make you want to avoid shopping here.  This Costco had no food samples.  Even trying to get food at the food court was stressful because of how disorganized it was and so little space to wait.  Sam‚Äôs Club and BJ‚Äôs are much better in my opinion.

"BEWARE" OF SOLOMON THE ENTRANCE GREETER
I have never felt so offended and treated like a thief in my entire life.

As a Costco Executive member for over 20 years, today marked the absolute worst experience I have ever had at Costco. Solomon made me feel discriminated against and like a petty thief.

I visited the standalone Savvy Cie Jewels section today to purchase jewelry for my wife as a Mother's Day gift. After selecting the items, I received a ticket to take to the cashier to be paid for. I proceeded to pay for the jewelry along with three other items. Cashier said I have to go back to pick up my paid items so I did. I exited the store, and returned to collect my purchased items.

As I re-entered, Solomon the greeter hesitantly ask me what am I doing? I explained, I came back to pick up my paid items he unpolitely told me to placed my shopping cart at the entrance which I did. Being very bothered by his attitude, I proceeded to pick up my purchased Savvy Jewelry.After picking up my items I headed towards the exit to retrieve my shopping cart, Solomon questioned my actions again(I felt a little harassed). I patiently reiterated, that I was simply there to collect the jewelry I had already paid for. To support my explanation, I displayed my receipts and the two purple jewelry bags, which are only given to customers who have shown their paid receipts to Savvy representatives. He insisted on seeing my receipt again. I showed him my paid receipts. Despite presenting my receipts and the two purple bags containing my merchandise, Solomon continued to detain me, causing me to be late for an appointment.

He insisted on searching my bags multiple times, causing a further delay and more frustration. Even after I requested to leave due to my appointment, he refused, stating he was just doing his job.

I felt extremely unjustly treated and discriminated against. Solomon's behavior was unacceptable, especially considering him detaining me for such a long time. I have never experienced such disrespect and disappointment at Costco before.

Solomon's lack of customer service skills, rudeness, discriminative and not paying attention to details on my receipts were evident. He urgently needs retraining. I hope management take the necessary actions on Solomon poor service skills so that this awful experience wont happen again to another customer. If it weren't for my 20 years of membership, I would never return to Costco after this incident.

Love this place! Cozy and a little art deco. It was my weekly happy hour spot. Until I realized my patronage was not appreciated.  The drinks are great. The veggie platter is so delicious and fresh. Brussel sprouts are also good.

Costco has always been a favourite place- it‚Äôs an emotion. This is another Costco, well- no this location DOES NOT HAVE GASOLINE! Otherwise, it‚Äôs super organised and well stocked store. You will find find good stuff in Costco in cheap price. Nobody can beat the price of Costco.

I am so impressed with this location! The store was clean and very well stocked. The employees are very helpful, and the store has a great layout. I had a question on some items, and the manager Rachel went above and beyond to help me out. I highly recommend this location.

They have your regular Costco items. However I cannot tell you how many times I have left the store and any items I wanted to purchase simply because the end of the check out line is in the back of the store. They will only have a handful of registers open but better believe they still have two people checking receipts. Do better people pay to be members of your club.

An older Costco location but I prefer to come here rather than the Costco and Sam‚Äôs nearest to my home.  The prepared food section is the best!  Plus, the layout of aisles have much better flow than what Sam‚Äôs has‚ÄîI can get in and out more quickly.  Prices are comparable to other warehouse stores and many periodically discounted items are things I really want/use/buy. The only reason it is not 5-stars for me is the lack of diesel fuel at the pumps.

Anastasia at member services was amazing! As someone who had never been to a Costco she was the perfect representation of the store and company. Super friendly and accommodating walking me through the process of becoming a member.

Compared to other Costco's, this place is a dump.  The shelves were half empty, they were boxes all over the place, the vegetable and fruit section was disorganized, they had maple syrup on the shelves that was set to expire in a month, and the workers at the hot dog and pizza counter seems very confused about a lot of things and it took longer than other Costco's for four simple hot dogs.  I know of at least three other Costco's in my area that are better than this one, two of which are much much cleaner and more organized.  This is not a third world country so we shouldn't be acting like it.

This is a review of the Tire Center. I have been here twice in 2024, both times with appointments scheduled online. I have waited approximately 3 hours each time. I have had the time to speak with many other customers with similar absurd wait times. I was there yesterday and one of the employees told me it would take about an hour to have my tires inspected and plugged. I went and ate dinner nearby, got coffee, and ended up having to wait another two hours. I saw cars with appointments much later than mine get pulled into the bay while mine was still not done. My complaint is not about the employees. The staff is pleasant and you can see them working, but management needs to do better. Why have so many appointment times available if every day they are backed up by hours? Why not give a more accurate time estimate so folks can adjust? Many customers came to the desk to ask a question or buy a battery, but there is no on there to help them. The free services offers if you buy your tires at Costco is great, but the reality is that you might be better off going somewhere else and paying if you value your time and consideration.

Great selection and bulk deals at Costco Owings Mills!

They have a fantastic selection of everything you could need, from groceries and electronics to clothes and home goods.

The bulk deals are unbeatable, especially for things like paper products, cleaning supplies, and pantry staples. It's a great way to save money on high-quality items.  The Owings Mills location is always clean and well-organized, and the staff is friendly and helpful.

Here are some of the things I like most about this Costco:

Huge variety: No matter what you're looking for, you're likely to find it at Costco. They have a great selection of brand-name products at warehouse prices.
Bulk savings: Buying in bulk is a great way to save money on household essentials.
Friendly staff: The staff at Costco is always helpful and knowledgeable.
Clean and organized store: The store is always clean and well-organized, making it easy to find what you're looking for.
Overall, I highly recommend shopping at the Costco in Owings Mills. It's a great place to find everything you need for your home at a great price.

Costco is the most annoying warehouse store on the planet, I don't care which location, they all just kind of suck. They don't let you in if you aren't a member, so even if you want to see the prices and items to see if it's worth it to join, you have to go with someone who is a member just to get in the door. They don't take Mastercard, so make sure you have a Visa or cash when you go. If you bring a friend, you'll probably have to pay for them on your same card and split the bill later.
I literally only joined for two specific items that I'd found out they carry like a week before, but because you can't look through the store before you are a member and they don't have guest passes, the day I joined they were out of both things. It was such a schlep to the middle of nowhere just to find out the membership I paid for was pointless.  I tried to order the items through their website and the product information didn't even show up as items they sell, even if they were out of stock, so I thought they were discontinued.
The parking lot at this location in particular is kind of a nightmare because there's basically two lots with a through-lane dividing them and people with their oversized carts just walk willy nilly in front of moving vehicles.
The prices on some of the items are decent enough, but we'll see if my membership actually pays for itself with the five items I get from there.
In comparison, BJ's lets you in even if you're not a member, and you can pay with both Visa and Mastercard. BJ's also has curbside pickup and ordering from their website reflects the products actually available in their store. The Owings Mills and Hunt Valley locations also have only one parking lot so traffic isn't as crazy.
The main difference between BJ's and Costco would be the inventory. Most of it's comparable, but there are things you can only get at one and not the other (which is why I got the Costco one despite them being like nazis about their stores) and sometimes the prices are significantly better at one or the other, but it's a product by product basis. I've never had a Sam's club membership so I don't know how that would compare.

We drive out of our way to come to this Costco because it‚Äôs always well stocked. However, recently they have been leaving all of their carts outside and when it‚Äôs raining you have to deal with soaking wet carts which is not fun when you have kids. Please consider leaving some carts inside that will remain dry.
They have added new food to the menu finally. I wish they add a area where mom‚Äôs get to take their baby‚Äôs and change and breathe a while. If that can an option

Wheaton Costco is the best except for the ongoing shortage of Kirkland water bottles. The meat selection is phenomenal. I love the ethnic items unique to this store and I'm happy they have a small kosher selection. I'm here weekly

Two stars are only for this particular Costco meat department.
We bought a beef meat couple weeks ago at this Costco. After cooking it in the oven we  found that this meat is all riddled with small holes, very similar to injection holes.  Nothing else can explain it. What did they do to this meat - who knows. Maybe they just injected water to increase the weight. Maybe it was something besides water.
I decided do not buy  meat at this Costco anymore.
This rating is only for this, meat department. I do not have any complaints about others. Everything is always clean and tidy.  Large assortment of goods. Convenient parking lot, fast and polite staff.
Even during busy days and holidays we do not spend to much time to pay for the purchase.
I also used delivery from Costco - perfect and fast service. Discounts are also attractive.

The customer service at this Costco is much lower than other Costcos‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs unfortunate.

Perhaps it‚Äôs just not consistent. Some staff are really helpful and pleasant while others are not‚Ä¶

If a checkout clerk doesn‚Äôt believe the photo on my card is me - instead of accusing me, perhaps look at my name against my drivers license? Or enhance the quality of photos on the card?

If an eyeglasses clerk sells me glasses - perhaps don‚Äôt sell me glasses that can‚Äôt be tightened much after you informed me at the day of purchase it‚Äôll be no problem.
They have some good bulk deals, especially when they're on sale. You can't beat $10 for an 18-in pepperoni pizza in their food court.

I like COSTCO for bulk buys. I have three sons, so when I need to buy meat, milk, and eggs for the week I really appreciate the slthe bulk sales offered at COSTCO.

They also got a lot of TVs; and don't hate on their jewelry!

$5 full size rotisserie chicken that taste amazing...what's not to like.  It's very helpful to know your prices...it helps because you are getting a much bigger quantity and some things are much cheaper some are not.  Overall you really do save money.

I love Costco! Just joined back after a number of years. I love the variation of everyday products. Prices have indefinitely gone up due to inflation. I love that they are so close to home for me. So my regular gas trip here will commence. I took so many pictures of pricing for comparison. There are also regular coupons. Buying in stock is really helpful. Especially on home goods.

The store carries items they should and is clean.  It's smaller than the other area costcos (arundel mills/owings mills) and doesn't have items I've seen at the others.  My biggest issue with this store is how they treat you as a member.

They treat you like a criminal when checking out.  One lady in particular got an attitude with me while I walked by with and item in a bag that I couldn't return and kept asking for the receipt. I explained to the lady i didn't have a receipt it.was a return i couldn't return and she kept talking over me insisting she needed a receipt instead of listening.

The hassle of not having an exchange policy when a item was on sale.  They tell you they will pull up the coupon at checkout, than the cashiers have another story for you like "they can't find the coupon"

Requesting id with your membership at self checkout is excessive.

I Was checking out and was unaware the membership expired i wanted to check with my wife before renewing at that moment  and explained that to the cashier.  She did not like that and gave me an attitude and told me i couldnt purchase the items i just spent an hour shopping for and were all rung up unless i renewed at the register.

We now go to the owings mills location due to  the negative shopping experiences we have had whenever possible.

Just bought a computer here and had a terrible experience. Absolutely no one knew what I meant when I asked if there was a warranty on the unit. I was told he "thinks there's a return policy of 90 days" buy he wasn't sure and I was directed to a manager across the way.

Little did I know I would then have to ask a different manager besides the first, and the second manager told me some of the computers don't even have a return policy- don't forget that I never even asked for that information and my question at this point is still unanswered. There was no sinage or person to tell me there may not be a return policy on the 900 dollar computer I just bought.

Now at this point I'm realizing no one knows what a warranty is. I might be using old retail terminology, but as someone who recently left a position of management even I know that a warranty is the same as a protection plan. So at this point I'm done. The only person who seemed to know what I was talking about walked into the conversation just as I was leaving it. Nice guy, but it was too late. I walked away.

teach your team to ask the right questions, or have the right answers. You know, the answers I later found out were on the receipt. a simple, "The phone number to call for a protection plan is on the receipt," because apparently I can't buy that while I'm in store.

NEVER. AGAIN.

Costco has very good prices and the quality of the items are very good. Their bakery is so good. I had my flooring installed by them and they had the best prices and it is beautiful. The tire department has great sales and quality installation.

Great place to shop in bulk.  There are so many options.  I went specifically to look for Keto options and was pleased with the selection.  They had great options for school lunch‚Äôs and you can taste test new items. I like that they have a pharmacy option, a tire center for car care and a great vitamin selection.  I always go I. For water and leave with so many other things.

A spacious and notably more chill Costco in the DMV.
Excellent section and kind staff. Lines move quickly. The food court is as splendid as you‚Äôd want it to be.
The promotions are easily spotted and plenty of parking.

I'm not really a big box shopper, but got a membership for the gas. So I will occasionally shop for a few items and often use the self checkout.  But today, everyone had the same idea. Except, I had three items and they had many! So I moved over to the checkout lines with clerks. Despite the long checkout line, I was able to check out in a fairly reasonable amount of time.
Love this store, although it would help to put the list of items on an aisle number so that people won't be aimlessly wondering around, but I get it they change things around.

Special shout out to Michelle.S in administrations!! I bought shrimp and it didn‚Äôt taste the same. I figured they added some kind of sauce when they served them as samples but I had no clue what it was. I called the store thinking it would be a long shot but Michelle answered, told me she‚Äôd call back and she did. She actually checked on the sauce name and followed up like she promised. I missed her call but she followed up with me the next day to make sure I knew the name of the sauce, literally amazingggggggg customer service. Thank you so much for going out your way to help me!!

The associate Tammy is the best!!! She helped me find a medium Hurley Polo shirt and even opened up a box from under the clothing shelf to find it for me! I love this store it‚Äôs honestly life changing to have a Costco nearby.

We go here at least once a month and not just for toilet paper or rotisserie chickens. Besides getting our food and paper goods here they also have a good selection of clothing, electronics and gifts. Honestly they have pretty much anything a household or business would need. Including furniture, cleaning supplies and equipment, health and beauty aids, holiday decorations and food. It goes on and on. I recently purchased a 9600 watt, 3 fuel (gas, propane and natural gas) generator from here. I‚Äôve seen this generator online for $1000.00 or more. They had it for $700.00. Works great. You have to buy a membership. I recommend buying the basic membership at first. It‚Äôs $60 for the year. If you  decide you like it and are going to go frequently you can upgrade the membership at anytime and save even more money and get more perks.

This is a busy COSTCO, especially on the weekends!  But Self-checkout and lines move quickly. They often open ALL cashiers when busy.

If you want samples, go on the weekend about an hour after they open, until about 5pm.

All the staff and workers are helpful and nice. Always a ton of enticing things to buy. Go with a list and a full stomach; otherwise you‚Äôll walk out with a full cart of goodies and a $300 bill!

It's Costco but with tires and gas.  They have fresh flowers, $5 rotisserie chicken (sometimes you have to wait), local gift cards at a discount, Sample Saturdays, electronics, cell phones, the usual.  The gas is generally 10-25c cheaper.  They do check your card photo at self checkout (which is annoyingüôÑ)  but the line generally moves pretty quickly.  Customer Service is great, glad Costco came to the Valley on the West Side.

Best hearing aid department EVER!!!! Charles helped me, was kind to me over the phone and in-person. He was patient with me (I‚Äôm old and hard of hearing, that‚Äôs why I came here) and had a bright, sunny disposition. his isn‚Äôt a common experience for me. They also have a lovely selection and are fairly priced, I must say. I will definitely be renewing my membership with them. Request Charles!!!! Don‚Äôt know his last name.

As always Costco on top of my favorite stores. Lots of good quality stuff in here with exceptional exclusive goods to offer. This particular store has some variety of produce that other stores don't have. So if you coming here make sure you take with you husband or wife to help you out to get big stuff

Arriving on a cold Monday in January at 11:00 I was appalled to see very long lines approximately  10 deep at the checkout area.  However, half an hour later there was no wait.  Perhaps the first hour is a madhouse.
In all other respects this Costco was like any other. Clean, a decent selection, high quality and mostly very good prices.
Note, that in the highly competitive Philadelphia market, the meat prices were almost consistently higher than nearby supermarkets, especially when the latter had sales.

Hearing Aid Center - WOW! I am nothing but impressed by the staff working here. I am a young woman and was looking to get my first ever hearing aid (which I was very nervous about). Lauren and the other techs/staff were professional, welcoming and very informed! Their pricing is PHENOMENAL with a great warranty and service program. Testing is thorough and well-explained. My life has truly changed now that I can hear correctly for the first time in my life. Couldn't recommend them enough!

Great Costco Store with multiple entrances that makes it easy to get in and out. The fuel pumps are situated off the side and that makes it easy as well.

Like all other Costcos, this is very clean and well stocked. Staff are always helpful and friendly.

I want to tell you first of all that I love Costco but I had a very bad experience last week. 3 months ago we had purchased four pairs of eyewear. Recently I had a problem with one pair where the screw came out and I dropped them. I went back to Costco to get a repair. When I approached the optical center there were three people standing there with no customers I jokingly said to the person who approached me oh you must have drawn the Short straw. Because I had a problem I said here's the problem and show them to her she looked up the glasses saw that I had purchased them recently and check the ID number on the frame she then told me I can't do anything with this you have to buy a new frame I said but it only needs a screw. She didn't say that would not work and she doesn't know what screw it needs. I asked her if she would just try. She told me you understand this when you buy the glasses there is no warranty. Again repeating it only needs a screw. Why don't you just try she said no I can't do that! I suggested she take the screw out the other side and then she would know what it needed. She said it doesn't work that way. I asked  her again, can't you just try she repeat it know you need to buy new frames. At that point I was pretty upset and I said give me my glasses I'm getting out of here. I went to customer service and spoke to the manager. He explained that they are really not Costco's glasses it's a separate business and there's nothing that he could do about that. He was polite and understood my problem. Just to mention the eyeglass case that they gave me says Kirkland and the cleaning cloth that comes in the case that says Costco. My insurance company said that they have arrangements with Costco for glasses. The person in optical simply did not want to do anything and there was no one else there she had nothing else to do. I got a $1 eyeglass repair kit at the dollar store they gave you an assortment of screws I tried two, the third one fit. I put the lens back in tighten it down and it works perfectly. I was able to do that in about 10 to 15 minutes and I am not a person that works in an optical department. I cannot express how very disappointed I am in the way I was treated at the Costco store which is on veterans highway in Warminster, Pa.
Just to mention I also purchased hearing aids at that store, that department is also an outside franchise. But the people in that department treat you with respect and are very helpful in any need. Someone needs to talk to those people in the optical department in Warminster on Veterans highway.

Always find more than I came to shop for. Some great finds and good deals. Came for half a dozen items and $350 later I checked out. But I still needed another 30 minutes to get out of the store because... Pizza and hot dogs.

I am a huge Costco fan. This is my first time at this location.
It‚Äôs a smaller location.
When I went it wasn‚Äôt super crowded which is rare for a Saturday afternoon.
Minimal samples today but that‚Äôs always hit or miss.
So many great  deals.
I had to get my $2 pizza slice.
I‚Äôll always be a die hard Costco fan

I‚Äôm an executive member. Every time I shop here there is an issue with my account. It‚Äôs taken 6 months for them to realize my 2022 Costco rewards money. Today, They forgot to print my receipt and I had to turn around so that my receipt could be reprinted. Took an extra 5-10 mins. The cashier gave me grief for using the app as my membership card scan.

Shoppers in the store are generally dazed and have no spatial awareness. I was cut in front of by an older woman. Would‚Äôve let her go if she asked but her display of rudeness and self-importance was enough for me to step up and say something.

My membership expires in a few days and I‚Äôm committed to never shopping here again.

In a recent car inspection, the mechanic told me that my tire treads measured 4/32 inches and I was told that I needed tires. I‚Äôm told that a new car tire typically has a tread depth of 10‚ÅÑ32 or 11‚ÅÑ32 inches. I‚Äôm also told that, you should replace your tires once they've worn down to 2‚ÅÑ32 inches. So, I immediately drove over to Costco (Glen Mills) with the intention of replacing my tires. After the Costco technician inspected my tires, he told me that my tires measured 7/32 inches and said that I didn‚Äôt need new tires. I was thankful that the Costco technician was being honest. That is why I‚Äôm a loyal Costco member. I‚Äôm impressed with Costco‚Äôs honesty and integrity. Bottom line? If you are told that you need tires, go to Costco for a 2nd opinion.

Very well organized warehouse, staff are always kind and friendly. Items are super cheap and everytime during the visit, you will get some better deals. Gas station is also near by. I also like the food and drink options which are super cheap and budget friendly. Definitely 5 star rating for this costco warehouse location.
It's a CostCo. Great sales on cleaning products! Eggs, incredible prices compared to elsewhere.
Always a great stop for loading up on staples.  Find some neat foods to try.  Cheese section one of my favs.  Love looking at the dry goods
The Costco team is always on the ball during checkout. They have the right system and pace in place. I wish many other stores would follow their lead . Great job, team Costco!!!

This Costco should be a flag ship store. There's not a better location than this one. It is always clean, fully stocked, and the employees there are second to none. Whether you deal with Terri in clothes, Jerry at tires, or Rachel at check out, you can't go wrong.

Been a Costco member for about 3 years now and we don't get there as much as we should. Went yesterday and it was busy as usual (lol) but we decided to go self checkout at the end just because we were down that way and we got to the checkout and one of the employees literally came and scanned our 12 items in like 60 seconds like a wizard, which probably would've taken us too long lol but it was much appreciated in the crazy atmosphere. Thanks see yall next time.

Best way in: from Jonestown RD onto Devonshire, left onto Commons Drive. Right onto the plaza entrance between Costco and David‚Äôs Bridal. Go to the tee and turn tight. Costco dock is straight ahead. Any other way in will jam you up. Everyone is nice, very helpful. Bathroom inside. Space to overnight, but you may get chased. Usually in and out in less than an hour.

I recently had the pleasure of shopping at Costco, and I must say, the experience was nothing short of fantastic. From the moment I stepped in, I was greeted by a variety of high-quality products ranging from groceries to electronics, all at incredibly reasonable prices.

The store was immaculately clean, and the aisles were well-organized, making it easy to find exactly what I needed. The staff at Costco were exceptionally friendly and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile. Whether I had a question about a product or needed help locating an item, they were there to help without hesitation.

One of the highlights of my visit was the food section. The fresh produce was vibrant and abundant, and the bakery items were irresistible. I also appreciated the wide selection of organic and health-conscious options available.

Another aspect of Costco that impressed me was their commitment to customer satisfaction. The return policy is generous, giving me confidence in my purchases. the checkout process can be slow however I used the self checkout which was efficient ‚Äì a real time-saver during busy shopping trips.

Overall, Costco offers a superior shopping experience that combines quality, variety, and value. It‚Äôs a one-stop-shop for everything you need, backed by excellent customer service. I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit!
I love Costco but I hate the irresponsible packaging- so wasteful and ecologically criminal.

I was visiting and went to Costco for items needed for Thanksgiving.  I love Costco.  I love their parking spaces, they are so wide you don't have to worry about someone dinging your car.  It was quite busy with long checkout lines but they moved very quickly.  I was amazed at the efficiency of getting folks checked out.

They just stopped selling the burgers we got all the time there and Bisquik. There are other items they stopped selling as well. Also, try marking the aisles so I can find stuff(especially fun when the item isn't carried anymore). Pepsi sucks, I stopped buying hot dogs when you made that switch 10 years ago. All I can say is I they get rid of the gasoline my membership is gone....
What an experience, never see a whole sale outlet. Full of new experiences. Purchased multiple cheese products. Store is only for registered customers, hence find one who is having one.

Overpriced shabu shabu slices are way too thick and every other packet has a random steak slice lol. Meat section here can‚Äôt cut meat for their life, I also witnessed them being rude to other Costco members.
