This Costco should not be charging for the premium of shabu shabu slices for these horrendous cuts. You are basically paying for 60% shabu cuts that anre kind of close to the real thing and the rest are covered underneath. Absolute scam. Easy fix is just have them modify the meat slicer to the correct mm/cm needed for authentic shabu slices.

Costco does it again! Costco is the place to go for shopping in bulk, even if you are only a family a two. The prices are truly unmatched. Their produce and meats are relatively high quality and affordable. I highly recommend getting yourself a churro to eat while you shop. It makes the whole shopping experience even more enjoyable. Don‚Äôt sleep on the Costco clothing either, my husband loves to buy their Puma products.

Incredibly rude staff. It's like they get off on enforcing their weird rules. Went to this location just before close (unbeknownst to me) but was let in without being informed that the store was closing. I made my way to the back of the store with only three items in my cart, when a battalion of employees starts blocking the aisles to get people to rush out. Each one held an intimidating posture and informed me that the store was closing. I've never had an experience like this as a customer, ever. This was not the first bad experience I've had. The self-checkout clerks and receipt checkers are often unnecessarily hostile. All this at a place where you pay to be a member. I asked for a refund of my membership and will never shop at Costco again.

I'm giving Costco a 5 star rating for successful selling the worst pizza I have ever tasted in my life to so many people including myself. No matter how I tell myself I'd never buy back their chewy, taste bad mozzarella cheese pizza, I still manage to eat it when hungry ah kill mi! Other than that fun fact, I LOVE COSTCO!

Upon joining Costco about three months ago, I have already spent thousands of dollars here. I have no regrets. I got new tires, a sweet lounger, all types of tasty foods, and drinks. Even some pants. I have had to accept the fact that I am washed and likely will never be cool again, but it‚Äôs been worth it for these incredible deals.

The food court is amazing! An 18 inch pizza for only$10 üí£ a hot dog and sink for $1.50!? Crazy talk! But it's so good! This place is ALWAYS packed no matter what time of day or day you decide to go. We always find great finds and the prices on foods and basket goods are amazing!

This is my local Costco and they‚Äôre great. The place is always clean, stocked and the staff is very kind. So far out of about a dozen visits I‚Äôve only seen one issue with a staff member over in the tech section specifically. I recommend this location for sure üëçüèª

Costco Wholesale in King of Prussia is a shopper‚Äôs paradise, offering an impressive array of products ranging from bulk groceries to electronics, all under one roof. Known for its value-packed deals and quality merchandise, Costco is the go-to destination for savvy shoppers looking to stock up on essentials or discover new favorites. The spacious aisles and organized layout make for a stress-free shopping experience, while the friendly staff are always on hand to assist with any queries. Whether you‚Äôre planning a party or simply doing your weekly grocery run, Costco‚Äôs wide selection and competitive prices ensure you‚Äôll leave with both a cart full of goodies and a smile on your face.
A wholesale firm available for retail shopping,parking is difficult during busy hours!

Checked in and out in less than an hour. Friendly staff. They prefer you not wait in your truck while unloading. But that doesn‚Äôt take long. Getting in and out is best using the main entrance and done before the parking lot begins to fill up, especially if you‚Äôre using a sleeper to pull a 53‚Äô van. There is a bathroom inside. I overnight here if possible. The nearby alternatives otherwise are slim.

It's a Costco! Every Costco is more or less the same. Some others have more Asian or ethnic foods and some others seem to have more home improvement stuff.
I'm barely in the Lancaster area so seeing a horse and buggy was a cool sight to see especially at Costco.

This is the best Costco I‚Äôve been to hands down. I had found a really great coat in my town that was a GREAT price. Well, the coat ended up being too big. Went to another location to see if they had my size, which they did, but the manager said ‚Äúthere‚Äôs no way in hell I can honor that other price.‚Äù What manager talks to a customer like that? Finally drove out to this one in Lancaster (i really wanted this coat). Linda, in clothing, would not give up til she found my size. However my size ended up being in a big box above the cereal aisle. The manager Glenn could not get it down for me in that moment, but got it down for me the next day, called me to let me know, put it on hold til I could come grab it AND honored the price I originally paid. THANK YOU LINDA AND GLEN! You guys went above and beyond and it didn‚Äôt go unnoticed.

I wish there was an option for Zero Stars!! Everytime my wife and I go to this particular Costco we have an issue. Lines are always long, and store associates are always rude and not helpful. Today was the last straw for us shopping at this particular Costco in Lancaster, PA. Most likely when our membership expires we will spend the extra time and money traveling to our closest Sam's Club which is an extra 20 minutes where our shopping experience is appreciated. Back to my experience today...
As my wife and I were placing our items on the belt to pay for them I pulled out my phone (because it is 2024 and there is an app for everything) and showed the cashier the membership card QR code to scan. She then asked if I was on the account and I stated I don't believe so and she said I will need to see your membership card. I then said I don't have a separate one and she continued scanning our items no big deal. I then still had my phone out and decided I would tap to pay with my phone. As I tapped with my phone to pay with my wife's debit card, the cashier then stated to me that I am not allowed to pay unless I showed her my Costco membership card. I said it is my wife's debit card and she said it doesn't matter, my wife had to pay. So you mean to tell me my wife has to tap my phone? What difference does it make who swipes card or taps a phone to pay? They are still getting paid. I realize policies are policies but this is a pretty dumb one and it's not like my wife wasn't with me, she was standing right next to me. If that is the policy the cashier could have been a bit nicer to explain the policy since I am the paying customer. She also could have mentioned this when scanning my membership card and realized I was not the card holder before she wastes my time and scanned all my groceries.

Costco has consistently exceeded my expectations and earned its reputation as a top-notch shopping destination. From the moment you step into the warehouse, the friendly and helpful staff create a welcoming atmosphere.

The membership perks are truly exceptional, offering access to high-quality products at unbeatable prices. The diverse range of items, from groceries to electronics, ensures that you can find everything you need under one roof. The bulk packaging not only saves money but also reduces the need for frequent trips to the store.

Costco's commitment to quality is evident in its selection of fresh produce, meats, and bakery items. The Kirkland Signature brand, in particular, stands out for its excellent value and reliability. I appreciate the emphasis on organic and sustainable options, catering to a variety of preferences and dietary needs.

The tire and automotive services have been a lifesaver, providing professional and efficient assistance. The gas station, with its consistently competitive prices, is an added bonus for members.

The seamless online shopping experience through Costco's website and app makes it convenient to browse and order products from the comfort of home. The delivery services are prompt and reliable, ensuring that you receive your items in excellent condition.

Overall, Costco's dedication to customer satisfaction, unbeatable prices, and a wide array of high-quality products make it a shopping experience that consistently earns a five-star rating. I highly recommend Costco to anyone seeking value, variety, and exceptional service.

Horrible experience. I will never be back to this Costco store.  They stand at the front checkouts checking your cards and I was like you can see my card when I check out. I‚Äôm not digging it out while I am navigating the line    we‚Äôre like no we need to see it now.  What an inconvenience we are in a long line as in and now all of us had to dig out our cards before we were even at the checkout and they were rude about it too.  Then they were hovering over everyone checking everything you scan.  I have never had this experience anywhere. I run and own my own business and we had my parents with us in wheel chairs and had to hold up the line for the cards with wheel chairs and carts and then again so they could push past my parents to watch us all scan our groceries and my sister who lives locally said she stopped coming because they act like that everytime she has come lately. I told her that‚Äôs why I love Sam‚Äôs club because you can scan/go and just checkout at the exit.  They don‚Äôt act like you‚Äôre a criminal. Which is insane.  I am canceling my membership at this point.

How can you not enjoy a BIG BOX store like Costco!  I enjoy all the items, but for me ALL THE BULK ITEMS are wasteful if you don‚Äôt have a family!

I usually go with my Dad who loves this place and we share/spilt items up and it lasts me a LOOONG time!

Lately, I have noticed significant price increases and that is difficult to manage for many who shop in Bulk!

Costco is a favorite when it comes to Warehouse shopping. Their bakery section is fantastic. The meats are very fresh. We go all the time. The only downfall is the parking lot. All Costco's seem to have small parking areas for the number of customers to get.
This location has its gas station which is convenient.

Can't remember if they ever ran out of anything other than the first two pandemic years. Good prices. Customer service is good and usually fast. Pizza is great. Sad to see some hot bar items go. Watch yourself in the parking lot because of idiots in a rush or don't know what they are doing. EVERYONE SLOW DOWN!

Ordered a dishwasher on line  and it was delivered as scheduled. The technician who came to install it was knowledgeable and courteous.

What I would have liked is if Costco was transparent about using a contractor to do the install. (May be it is in the small print). I did see a message when I placed the order that a second appointment is required. But there was no message or notification about who to contact, contact info etc. The contractor is assigned only after order is placed.

The installation went well and the dishwasher is working well.

Out of the three Pittsburgh locations this particular location is my favorite.

There is a wide variety of food fairly similar to the other locations. It's always clean and the workers are regularly happy.

Convenient to 376/79

The only downside is the parking lot is laid out awkwardly and can cause traffic backups.
Love this place! Free Snacks! Always worth it to reward yourself with the Inflation proof hotdog combo! 10/10 would shop again.

Always very friendly workers, usually pretty busy but still never a long wait to check out or at the food court. Food court is great, low prices and portions are huge, and has a decent sized seating area as well. Only downside is only 1 way in and out of parking lot which can be a pain at times

Costco is a great place for bulk purchases and home goods. This store is clean, nicely organized, and abundantly stocked. The staff is friendly and available to help.

There is a pharmacy and gas station. The parking lot is huge, so remember where you park. And the self check out is convenient.

If you live in the area, I would definitely recommend purchasing a membership.

Always a delight to shop here in a multicultural setting in a largely well-run Costco store, though it doesn't go unnoticed when a manager openly and needlessly demeans some staff for some inapparent reason. When was the last time district or regional management assessed store management of rank and file among the rank and file? Seems like many good hires there

Who doesn't love going to Costco?

There is always a great selection of items for homes and businesses. The isles are usually kept clear, and shelves are kept stocked.

This location tends to get very busy in the afternoon around dinner time on weekdays and almost all day on the weekend.

On this trip. I stopped by to get a quick bite to eat from their food court. It's the best place to grab a quality quick bite on a budget.
I got the hot dog, a pepperoni pizza slice, and one of their newer cookies üç™

Overall I had a good experience.

Best quality meats and love that many are sectioned in cryovac packaging.
Best hot dogs around. Fuel prices are always much lower than most stations. And even when they are very busy checkout moves quickly. I Love Costco

Wednesday November 2nd 2022
Clothes get marked down on Wednesdays but sells out quick & don't last until the end of the day.
------------
October 25th 2022
Festive cheese package $55. 12 types of aged, imported cheeses from all over the world & several pairing suggestions for each kind of cheese - good for 2-4 people. My birthday is coming up & I'm gonna do cheese & wine with a few girlfriends. What a treat to look forward to!

Super soft women's tube socks, 6 pairs on sale for $7. What a steal!

I'm helping organize a fundraiser in a few weeks & responsible for meatballs. Costco has a 6lb/140 count bag of beef meatballs for $20 (they're bigger than half ounce but smaller than 1 oz). It beats out 2 deals I found at bjs (although bjs does offer a cooked perfect gluten-free meatball)
------------
Thursday, July 28th, 2022
Costco's Kirkland brand came out with the BEST frozen gluten-free pizza I've ever had in my life! It's supreme, but thank god they left off the olives. Pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, zucchini, red/orange/yellow peppers. *chefs kiss* thank you costco for continuing to consider those of us with celiac or who can't have gluten. There are a LOT of gluten free options at costco.
--------

Awesome prices & deals on all types of food, books, furniture, electronics, home goods, beauty products etc & even gas. I wish they had diesel.

Check the website to see when specific vendors will be there.

Employees are VERY friendly & try to go above & beyond to help. Hit up the food court on your way out - who can beat a soda & hot dog for $1.50?!

Annual membership is $60 & pays for itself! Shopping in bulk for a family of 5 comes in handy!

Visit between noon & 3 - you can sample all types of foods for free.

I used to love their pepperoni pizza. Unfortunately, I've been diagnosed with celiac disease & can't enjoy it anymore. I wish they offered a gluten free pizza without cross contamination.

Costco has dozens of gluten free options in general. Fresh, refrigerated, frozen, canned, etc, there are many official gluten free certified options. Impressed with the amount of protein shakes in bulk.

For days I'm crippled & cannot walk, there's always a motor scooter available! üíú1 wet

Customer Service ladies are friendly, knowledgeable, informative, & efficient.  This is one of a very few franchises who genuinely DO put the "Serve" back into "Customer Service".
Such a winning team, from the top down & back up !  Thank you for a pleasant shopping experience.

We drove from Tahlequah to grocery shop. The cashier was so rude and disrespectful. Kept throwing our food and I asked him nicely not too. It seems the more I asked the more he did it. I spoke with the manager but it seems like she didn‚Äôt reprimand him for his actions. On the way out the lady checked our receipt and he even charged us double on some items. This is very unprofessional behavior especially for a paying customer. We work in the customer service field and our customers are important. Seems like he didn‚Äôt care about us or are wishes. I posted some pictures of him and hopefully this doesn‚Äôt happen to anyone else.

As a Costco member since day one at Little Rock, I've sadly observed a noticeable decline in the level of customer service and overall shopping experience. Previously, the staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive, with individuals guiding customers to the shortest checkout lines, assisting with loading groceries, offering carry boxes, and greeting with warm smiles. However, this has changed over time, which I understand can happen in many establishments as they mature. With the introduction of self-checkout lines, I found it convenient and didn't need to rely on cashiers as much.

Yet, when employees were assigned to the self-checkout lanes, one would assume they'd be there to assist with scanning items, given their access to barcode scanners. However, this wasn't the case. I encountered a situation where a staff member declined my request for help scanning two king-size pillows, citing them as "small items," despite it likely taking mere seconds. Meanwhile, I observed her colleagues assisting customers with scanning smaller items like boxes of strawberries. It appeared that their willingness to assist depended on their mood, which was disappointing. While I don't mind if they opt not to help if they could let the customers ‚Äúself‚Äùcheckout, unfortunately they also tend to linger and monitor the checkout process, seemingly scrutinizing customers until they deem someone ‚Äúworthy‚Äù of their assistance.

The two stars are for selling the quality items and the kind senior lady at the entry always welcoming people with smiles.
Clean, just like the one we have in canada. Customer service was great! Different food menu from Canada and it's amazing. As always, 1.50$ hot dog is bomb.
Nothing special, normal coscto thingy. Haven't seen any discount for year-end

I've always enjoyed Costco stores more than Sam's Club and the one in Little Rock doesn't disappoint. They seem to turnover their stock more often and the Kirkland brand has some very nice quality.  This Costco also has an attached liquor sales store. Hopefully it remains open as I have seen where a few others closed.  The have self-checkout and they offer the food up front that you can buy like pizza, hot dogs, and drinks. If you pay with a card there, you have to use the self-checkout. The staff is always nice and the store is always clean as well.  We'll be back.

I bought this salad kit from Costco. And its washed and ready to eat. But when i opened it and i was just cut leaves in small pieces then i saw the ‚ÄúBUG‚Äù üêõIN SALAD KIT. Its really horrible. Please don‚Äôt eat this kind of ready to eat salad kit FROM COSTCO. This is my second time before i saw the same bug in broccoli package which was same washed and ready to eat.

Although I don't have a membership I have gone a few times with my friend Tabitha who is a long time subscriber. I can't say anything bad about this place I love it, they have everything from potato chips to couches. you can buy in bulk obviously and the prices are pretty good. Also everything is kept  clean and tidy, very well managed. The employees are very knowledgeable and friendly. I will get a membership one day...

I purchased tires and installed. They took me in earlier than my appointment and finished in a reasonable short time. Curtis was very helpful in  finding the right tires mileage and dollarwise. The Installers were professional, polite and friendly.
HIGHLY recommend.

I‚Äôve been  DISCRIMINATED at this Costco‚Äôs check out associate name JULIO

I went to cosco with family members and we‚Äôre having trouble at self checkout cuz the Apple Pay didn‚Äôt work.

We got sent over to the regular line with a barcode of what we have scanned.

When it was my turn I Said ‚Äúhi how are you‚Äù
and he was completely dismissed my present while I saw him was CLEARLY have a great conversation with a lady in front of me, big smile .

However , when I handed him the barcode he turned and said to his assistant in front of me like ‚Äúohhh I don‚Äôt like it when they sent ppl over here with this because I have to recount cuz something must be ‚Äúmissing‚Äù .

He clearly annoyed and gave us the attitude.

I was so angry to the point I was shaken, but because of my family members doesn‚Äôt understand English well, so I didn‚Äôt said anything till after we checkout, I sent her to my car and went back to talk to costco manager .

I do hope that NO ONE should‚Äôve experienced in.

I find Costco's brand (Kirkland) slightly ahead of the other store warehouse brand. It would be funny if they were made at the same secondary manufacturing plant, but Costco seems to have more variety. Expect slowdowns people, being the only Costco in 3,000 miles it's going to be busy no matter what time of the day you go. Also, get the $1.50 footlong and soda on the way out. Can't beat that price and it's tasty.

You don't realize how good you have something until you go somewhere else to check out the experience.

First off,  I will never shop at another costco besides the danvers location again. I decided to take a ride to the everett location and that was a huge mistake. From the employees to the customers all the way to just getting into that store gave me anxiety. I hated it. It could be I'm so used to Danvers and I will say Everett is bigger and had a bunch of things Danvers does not have but all and all Danvers is just a much better experience.

Horrible experience. The manager wouldn‚Äôt let us pay for our stuff because our dad who is on the membership wasn‚Äôt with us, even though we‚Äôre in the same household and using the same  membership card. Manager was very rude and unprofessional and needs some teaching on how to communicate with customers. If Costco continues like that they can expect to lose half of their customers. We will personally be cancelling our membership and will never shop there. 0 stars.

The manager was absolutely rude, I was at the register and she would not let me pay since my wife was not there, The women in front of me offered to use her card and then she said that COSTCO does not allow soliciting so i asked if i could get a day pass  then she (the manager) told me to bye my own membership. My wife will not be renewing her membership ever. the blond manager should be fired. I was extremely embarrassed. This was costco danvers
0 stars

Very poor selection for men‚Äôs glass frames. And when I pointed out the extremely limited choices in my size first the salesman disputed me several times. Then, after seeing I was correct he said I could just go to a slightly different size. Amazing. Each Costco store has different glasses and only the ones on display are available.they won‚Äôt order you a frame in a different size or ones you saw in a different store, etc. always bought my glasses from Costco. No more.
Best place to buy your food! They have good brands e unbelievable price! I love it

Crowded on weekends. Tough to find parking.

Typical American consumerism. You need to purchase a card to go shopping. Purchase on purchase!

Huge packs of elementary requirements. You cannot buy a sample pack to try. Either you commit to a huge quantity of a food that you may not like or get out.

Non-food costs comparable to Amazon.
best costco in MA! (but if it‚Äôs busy, the parking lot is a hot mess). great selection for staple items and seasonal plants & houseware items are excellent.

There's nothing wrong with this Costco. It's a solid Costco.

The Costco chains offer large quantities of food at seemingly discounted prices. When you look into it, you're really not saving that much especially when compared to smart grocery stores like Aldi.

Customers also tend to overbuy because they think they're getting a "good deal" and end up throwing most of it away so all the savings are a wash anyway.

This also creates a lot of plastic waste and food waste while other face famine. There's such a thing as overconsumption.

Crazy busy right before Christmas, but the staff is always  helpful and knowledgeable. Many have been there for years -- a good sign. Supposedly a limited number of products, but you'd never notice it. Prices also continue to be reasonable. Worth the annual membership fee. ($60 or $65).

If I could give them 0 stars I would. My son went for an interview and was racially profiled by Bob the store manager. He followed him around the store then kicked him out and no he wasn‚Äôt doing anything inappropriate. I spoke with Bob directly and the only thing he could say was he was kicked out because he doesn‚Äôt have a membership. As everyone knows no membership is needed to be in the store or purchase hot food. I called corporate and they were no help either. Needless to say my whole family has canceled our memberships.

Costco...

*temporary issue*
The concession stand was under construction last time I was there and was closed. It looks like they are going to do a full renovation, but time will tell. I'll update when it reopens if I remember. : )

I don't go there on the weekend if possible. It's incredibly busy and the lines for checkout sometimes reach the back of the store. That said they do do a very good job at getting people through the checkout lanes once you get to the register.

I would definitely avoid this location near the holidays if possible as you will be trapped in the shopping center for a good 10 to 15 minutes at best trying to get back out to the main road. I have been stuck in the traffic for nearly a half hour in the past.

Other than that it's a good store.

I wish they had a Costco gas station here. That would be a really nice addition. I go to Revere or Stoneham a lot instead of here because they have gas stations at their locations.

It‚Äôs a COSTCO!  There‚Äôs no gasoline here. The people are nice. The parking is good. There‚Äôs no covered parking. When leaving there can be traffic when you get close to Route 16. Try to avoid busy times.
Great sunset views.

Nice Costco, with acceptable line lengths on recent visits. Food options seems to be going downhill a bit though, less toppings for hot dogs than their used to be and the soda machine has more duplicates and fewer flavors than the original labels suggest there should be. Also, only had a single option without caffeine, which was out of flavor...

I made the mistake of letting my Costco membership expire a few years ago and have forgotten how remarkable they are! It is not only about the savings it's about quality.. if it has the Kirkland name on it, be assured that it will be superior..  good luck finding better olive oil, tuna than theirs.  Ted was very pleasant helping us becoming a member again.

My experience at Costco Wholesale in Everett, Massachusetts, was excellent! The variety of products offered was impressive, from fresh food and organic products to electronics and home items. The prices were competitive and provided a great cost-benefit ratio. In addition, the environment was organized and clean, facilitating navigation through the corridors and the location of the desired products. The customer service was exceptional, with employees always available to help and answer any questions. Overall, my visit to Costco Wholesale was very satisfactory and I will definitely return to do my shopping there in the future.

This is a one stop shop for most of the household products. They also have a section dedicated for electronics. The fruits and vegetables are very fresh. They also sell dairy products, frozen meat, ice creams and many other products. You can also find a lot of products for amazing prices. Parking is available.

We've been members before Price Club merged with Costco and in multiple states. Amazing how Costco keeps up with growing membership without compromising service and diversity of products.  Food section is where we head first because no one else beats Costco quality and pricing  One thing that's a hassle in the warehouse  is that there are crowds at their Food Court that block our way after we finish shopping and are headed to the exit. Given that even non-members can come avail the Food Court,   they could consider relocating the Food Court ( like the tire center in some locations) away from the warehouse. That will ease the crowded situation at the end.

I love Costco, but this one at this location not so much... Is the closest to our home 48 min. But we prefer to drive to the Springfield location (more organized, less crowded). Didn't want to drive far for diapers so I figured out to try their app and 2 day delivery for the first time. Choossed this location for delivery since it's closer, just got 2 items delivered on time and the most important the diapers no where to be found had to call and ask what's happening. Now I need to wait 4-5 days for a refund. Never ordering from this warehouse again.

The cashiers here are extremely rude as we had experienced 2 incidents as one was when we were checking out, a cashier told us that we needed a business card for our receipt because we wanted to get separate receipts for a business and they told us we needed a business card. There was a 2nd incident in which a cashier recognized us from last time and went to tell here fellow workers "he's back" she had given us a really intimidating stare t hen proceeded to leave her register and ask someone else to do check us out and we know this for a fact because when we were done she came back on the cash register.

Very nice grocery store you can find everything but in bulk, billing staff is nice but I had bad experience with a lady who always stand at clothes section I don't know why she was yelling me that I messed the clothes which I didn't do I was just reached that section and searching the size she came and asked me to not to do you messed up and bla bla she was also talking in her native language she didn't speak English.
Costco should be careful what staff they are hiring. Other things are good.

I found the store had no order, for the purpose of finding anything, the aisles are not labeled, and the employees seem lost helping you if you ask for anything.  My needs were simple, I wanted grape jelly, available in every grocery store, but they don't stock it.  I could get coffee for 12.7% less somewhere else easily accessible, even with the two Costco discounts, it's still not worth it.  And at the other place I can get 2 more percent off with another credit card.

I went to return two items, then stood in line to cancel my membership and get my money back for the membership, the clerk called the membership manager over and he asked me why I was cancelling, I told him, and the man who is known for putting on an act akin to somebody selling medicine at a traveling show scowled and walked away.
Costco is just great, whoever does their (seasonal & regular) buying picks great quality products. Samples are always great & I've often bought things I've tried. It works!

We had to stop into customer service first thing. The upbeat energy and comeraderie of the employees was infectious! Despite being packed, we zoomed around and got what we needed easily, and we're through the self checkout quickly. Excellent experience!

I would recommend improving the store layout. There is another big store like this close to me and it is easy to navigate. I am able to cruise the whole store, isle by isle, without missing any area. At Costco the layout makes it hard to go thru all the store in a logical way.

I love to shop at Costco and go there monthly. Although I mainly stock basic staples like olive oil, cleansers, paper products and canned foods I also buy a lot of fresh items . They have great deals in the meat, fish and cheese Departments. I always get one rotisserie chicken and a box of croissants before I leave. If I am going to have large gatherings I will get some prepared dishes which are delicious and easy to serve. Clothing, flowers electronics and appliances are always a good deal. It is difficult not to be tempted and you should be prepared to spend a lot more than you expected!

Usual Costco Wholesale, but unusually neat clothing section. Second time I have been here in 6 months and the pants and shirts are immaculate. What I really like about Costco is their checkout area. Whereas other stores have long lines due to the fact that they have 10 cash registers but only 2 cashiers, Costco has every register running, with a terrific self-checkout option as well. So I never mind the wait, as I know they are doing everything they can to move things along. They don‚Äôt skimp at their customers‚Äô expense. I appreciate that.

Okay, I'm giving this Costco five stars because of the store cleanliness, the excellent customer service, and how well they can keep things organized and stocked with such massive crowds. Now, bring your patience when you come to park and shop on a Sunday afternoon.  You will have to wait for a parking spot. There are so many people shopping inside that you will need to take turns getting items from the shelves. When it is time to check out, though, it will go fast. Be mindful while walking back out to your car. There will be a lot of vehicles driving around looking for parking. Help others always and have fun.

I've always loved shopping here, and never had a bad experience besides the place always being extremely busy. But today may 1st 2024 I was shopping with my elderly parents and Mrs Brenda L moved us to the back of the regular lanes because she didn't want us on the express lane even though I was helping them... my parents are 76 and 75 with multiple health conditions.

Kind of crowded today, but if you know previously what you are looking for and have your budget clear, it was a smooth ride from the beginning to the end. All cashiers are pro and client service oriented.

30 minutes waiting for a pizza is too long for those of us who happen to shop there as well.
I had to return all my frozen food and meat since it was already lukewarm and soggy by the time the pizza was ready.
The Manager said they would need to be thrown out. That‚Äôs 100+ bucks of food in a world where we have still people starving.
You guys already know when peak time happen: please, coordinate your staff accordingly and make sure you cater for those times.
Do better.
This place gets us in trouble. We bought an inflatable hot tub. It's been an awesome purchase. Someone put it on the cart and once outside another nice person loaded it in our car.

I use to always go Sam's club, But one day I wanted to check out Costco I don't regret it at all. I'm in love with Costco. They have more Organic food and variety of foods. And yes sometimes what Sam's don't have costco will have, versa also üòâ It's like they take turns in sharing who will sell a product once in a while üòâ shhhh lol. They have huge parking, it gets pretty full especially on weekends. To check the membership is easy a little  bit $ than Sam's  but it's worth it. The prices in food are awesome also. I like Costco and in this area. üòäüëåüèΩ
Waited for four hours for a tire change, my grandma can change tires after than them, they're always talking and ignoring their work honestly the worst Cosco ever
It's always a pleasure to shop in Costco. With their wide variety of products. Not to mention their collection of gourmet foods. Good quality with reasonable prices.
I like the products although it is turning to be expensive and rough service

A huge, terrific Costco. What a surprise. Just like all the others. Huge parking area, with everything under the sun to choose from. Store is very clean and well organized. Floor is spotless. Place is very well lighted. Lots of help on the floor. Displays change constantly. Only the very reasonable prices remain the same. Lots of cashiers and self checkout lanes. Big food court. Clean bathrooms. Well stocked and merchandised. What else could you ask for.
Great store to shop about anything. Very nice and great quality products, as always.

The Costco experience unfortunately comes with waiting especially on busy days and/or times. I ordered 3 whole pizzas at the kiosk. I knew I would have to wait a bit as I have ordered 1 and 2 pizzas before. Order in 11:30. Time pizzas were ready 12:08. They had 3-4 employees in the food court. That is a long time to wait. My number was 262. By the time my order came up they were on order 295.
Mistakes were made, on my part also. Next time and I recommend you should while in line order the pizza at the kiosk. I do have to say the main lady up front was able to multitask like a pro. Taking walk up orders, calling out orders to be picked up, managing the other employees, etc.
PS: the strawberry side of the yogurt machine was broken.

Very thankful for Costco.  Overall very good. The main problem is the entrance / exit.  Would be ideal to have an additional entrance/ exit but I guess this is typical of most shopping places here in PR.
There's good-sized products to buy and maintain yourself carefully. On occasion, the employees show examples so people can try them and probably buy them right then or later.

I found that the goods in this supermarket are of very good quality, especially fresh food and fruits and vegetables. They look very shiny and taste fresh. In addition, the variety of goods is very rich. Whether it is daily necessities or special food, it can meet my needs.

Overall, my experience at Costco was a mix of positive and negative moments. First and foremost, I want to commend Anna L., the cashier who assisted me during checkout. She was exceptionally friendly, helpful, and made my checkout process smooth and pleasant. Her professionalism was truly appreciated.

However, there were some aspects of my visit that left me feeling disappointed. Despite having already scanned my membership card during checkout, I was approached by another staff member who asked to see my membership again. This redundancy felt unnecessary and somewhat frustrating, especially since I had already completed my transaction.

Additionally, I encountered a staff member during the final checkout process who seemed dismissive and unhelpful. When I questioned a procedure, his response was curt and bordered on rude. It would have been more helpful if he had taken the time to explain any new policies rather than dismissing my concerns.

Food court:
Furthermore, while I understand the cashier‚Äôs need to count money, a simple acknowledgment of our presence and assurance that she would assist us shortly would have been appreciated.

Lastly, I want to acknowledge the positive interaction I had with William. Despite our frustration and hunger, he remained calm, attentive, and ultimately assisted us with getting our food. His kindness and understanding were a welcome contrast to the challenges we faced earlier in our visit.

In conclusion, while there were highlights during my trip to Costco, such as the excellent service from Anna L. and William‚Äôs kindness, there were also moments of frustration and disappointment. I hope this feedback helps Costco improve their customer service and ensure that all customers feel valued and respected throughout their shopping experience.

Usually my experience in this Costco is pleasant. However today I met the rudest cashier. When it came to us I said hi to him and he did not respond anything, instead he banged his scanner on the belt impatiently and made a noise. Then after he‚Äôs done scanning, and we were waiting for the machine to print receipt, he turned his back started to chat with his colleagues. When the receipt was printed he just picked it up with his fingers and hold it in the air to let me pick up, with the whole time still back to us chatting and laughing. Luckily the receipt has his name - Larry P. Costco, you really need some proper employee training.

This is my home local Costco.  I swear this is the busiest one in the world!  No matter what time of day or week.....it's always non-stop action.  However, all the employees at this location are good with service and efficiency due to their consistent busy workflow.  I am and will always be a big fan of Costco and it's own Kirkland brand.  The name just represents quality you can trust.  Here's to another $100+ saying goodbye to my wallet.......because you can never step out of a Costco without spending a minimum of one hundred bucks!
#iykyk #costcolover

Good selection at a good price and excellent customer service.
Update: Sunday April 7th 2024 The food court-yard w/ picnic tables now has kiosk (computer screens) to pre-order food, but on this Sunday afternoon the lines were still long. That is the one less than perfect thing about Costco, so bring a book or a friend to talk to in line (& eat with).
If you just want to see what's here don't go on a weekend. Plan your insertion and egress like a war zone. The cookies are almost as big as the pizza slices. They have many types of olive oil. Wow!

It is one of the busy Costco to shop. It doesn't have gas station here. You bring your car in for new tires or rotation with appointment. They sell almost everything here and with seasonal food. Their food court is outside and you could order through by yourself. It is hard to find close by parking.
Hidden secret: tuxedo chocolate mousse cake ü§´ absolutely to die for.  It tastes like HEAVEN.  Happy Mother's Day!

This Costco is always well stocked and Customer Service is always friendly and very fast. Great deals on groceries. Clothing, household goods, unique items, bikes, sporting goods. It is conveniently located right off of Highway 85 at the Almaden exit the best time to shop is on a weekday evening. Otherwise, the weekends are pretty crazy. This Costco is located in a shopping center near a Trader Joe‚Äôs in a coffee shop in a row so lots of shopping can be done all in one spot.

We ordered 8 large pizzas 7:40. About 8pm, came to pick them up. The manager said to wait for 20 minutes. At 8:30, she said no more pizzas left. She gave us 4 pizzas for 50 high school kids. The party started at 8:30pm. We had to order more to anchor place, delivered 8 pizzas by 9:10pm.

It‚Äôs so funny how when a lady asked me to apply for an executive club membership, I said ‚Äúno‚Äù because I don‚Äôt come here that often. I‚Äôve been coming here a lot more and more than what I said to the lady when I first applied for membership years ago.

I really love that there is a Costco close to me. This Costco has great selection of items and I always get what I need. The one con about going to Costco is everything is big. What I mean is if I need just a carton of milk it comes in a pack of three. But the price is right. Costco always has great holiday items.

Costumer service is ok. I rarely need to ask for help. Unless I go to Optical or their foodcourt area and then when you check out. That‚Äôs the only real reaction with employees at Costco.

11/17/23
Went in today to scout out items for Thanksgiving dinner, plenty of turkeys, never seen so many options! Tried out the brined and seasoned Spatchcocked turkey and it turned out great!
I have to say that after my September comments, there were at least double the picnic tables in the Food Court earlier this month!
9/23/22
The Food Court Area really should double the tables and seating available, though the check out counter on the end usually serves the purpose for me and has paper towels ready for clean up!

Over the years my wife and I have enjoyed shopping at Costco for many reasons. These days our physical abilities are limited. So, using their electric mobility shopping carts helps us to get around these warehouse-sized stores more easily. Also, the folks who work here are always friendly and helpful. Their customer service is amazing as well. The only thing that I hope Costco would do is for shoppers with a smaller household i.e. (who are single or have a two-person family) is to also have perishable food items that come in smaller portioned packaging. Since we live in a small apartment, our storage space is minimal and our refrigerator doesn't have a large freezer.

Lately, costco in Antioch has been dropping the ball. I'm not sure if they're under new management or what. Today, when I went there, I was in a great mood and left in a bad one. There was a female associate yelling at customers and herding them like cattle toward the other end of the store. She had the most miserable look on her face and was irritated whenever anyone asked her anything. It was incredibly rude, vulgar, and unprofessional. When I finally got to the register, the man ringing me up didn't even acknowledge my existence. He rang up 4 items before I said "hello how are you?" It was at that point that he even looked at me. He was literally looking past me and over my head prior to that. I am absolutely shocked at what is acceptable as an employee in 2024. I mean, you are getting PAID to do a JOB. You are not doing anyone a FAVOR by going to work, and people going into an establishment expect BASIC and COMMON courtesy. It's one thing when you encounter a single rude employee, but it's entirely a different experience when it seems like there is just absolutely no standard for service there anymore. I'll drive all the way to concord to have a pleasant experience and not leave an establishment feeling drained and brought down while spending a large amount of money. This was my third poor experience in 2 weeks. Done!

I love Costco. This one‚Äôs pretty good, it has all the basic essentials in bulk and it stays well organized. They got a gas station too with very cheap prices, but the line can get pretty long at times.

It's hard to add anything new to the chorus of praises for Costco. Picture this: you enter the store with a modest shopping list, only to walk out with a receipt totaling $500. It's as if they stock every conceivable item, each more tempting than the last with unbeatable deals. Just today, I went over my shopping list by 20 items, each one as necessary as the last, and I couldn't have been happier to indulge. The cherry on top? Exiting the store with a $1.50 hot dog and a generously sized soda in hand. In what other place can you find such a steal? Naturally, I doubled my order. Spending a mere $3 on two hearty beef hot dogs and two sodas seemed like the bargain of a lifetime. Costco is the ultimate destination for those who seek incredible savings on bulk purchases, from essential groceries like chicken breasts and beverages to anything else you might need.

I think it‚Äôs worth it. You can find good deals on most anything.
If you don‚Äôt have a membership, go with a friend that does and apply.
I‚Äôll tell you want makes my blood boil:
1. People put their Emotional Support CUR, in the shopping cart.

The Costco Staff is very friendly & cooperative.

Yo, this place has some seriously rude employees. They act like they're the kings and queens of the checkout line, especially this lady named Maria. She made me wait just to count the cash after helping the person in front of me. When I called her out on it, she started screaming for a manager!

This costco is one of the cleanest I have seen even the bathrooms. The selection is what you‚Äôd expect from a big box store with prices to match. There are a ton of employees who are all eager to serve as well making this a great all around experience.

So I stood at the trash cans in the food court trying to see which slot I'm supposed to put my trash. About 8 seconds into reading I needed to use 2 different ones. Costco is one of the better "big stores" in Chico, IMHO. Their gas station is well organized; even though it's always packed, it doesn't take that long to make your way through. And it's always packed because oftentimes they have the best gas prices in town.

Their eye-glasses department I feel is the best in Chico. They have the absolute lowest prices for frames/lenses versus everywhere else I've experienced. They also have a wide selection of frames for men, which has been an issue for me at other places in the past. Not only that, they took my eye insurance with no problems and I had my new glasses in just 2 weeks.

Then for everything else they sell in the store, they have a nice big variety of items to choose from and their prices are normally lower than other stores. It just depends if you want to buy in bulk or not. Its become one of my family's "go to" stores that we visit at least once a month.

Costco also sells a lot of seasonal, non-grocery, related items too and their selection is always changing (the whole middle section of the store). These items always get me into trouble because it's often stuff that I like a lot but they're usually bigger items. So, my wife tries to steer me away from the middle section of the store once she sees me wandering that way, lol.

The last thing I wanted to mention is their food court. You can basically get lunch for pretty darn cheap, and it's usually pretty good. I know some people come here regularly just to visit the food court area. However, if the lines are really long - I tend to skip on the food court because it can get super crowded with people/carts and the lines can get unwieldy.

The only thing I would change about Costco is the rules to be able to use their pharmacy and food courts. It seems some locations allow you to use the pharmacy without a Costco card while others require it. Same with the food court

Always great deals to be had. The clearance items always hiding in plain sight make it an adventure every time (look for the little star in the upper right corner of the price tag. Thats the clearance prices)

Well I finally gave in and signed up for an executive membership. Pricing is decent for the perks you get. Staff at Costco was also very friendly. The store has a larger variety of items compared to Sam's. Prices are also lower on most items. The upside to Costco in ny opinion is the lower prices, better quality items, shorter lines, later evening hours, convenience of an optical center, tire center, low gas prices, and  curbside pickup. However the down side in my opinion is the lack of their app services such as no "scan as you go"  type of shopping available, no cash back rewards unless you have their credit card, many items are shipping only, the member service desk at this location is a tad to hectic, unorganized, and very confusing for any new memeber trying to navigate what to do next. Nevertheless, I'd still definitely recommend this Costco to anyone and gave it 5 stars because the cons are all minor, and it may have just been one of those hectic days for me.  All together I honestly can't complain and I'll Def be back.

Costco Wholesale at 2270 Clovis Ave in Clovis consistently delivers an exceptional shopping experience that sets it apart from other bulk retailers. As a regular shopper, I appreciate the wide range of high-quality products available at competitive prices, which makes this location a go-to for both personal and business needs.

The store is well-organized and stocked with a variety of goods, ranging from groceries and electronics to clothing and household items. The produce section deserves special mention for its freshness and variety, while the bakery consistently offers delicious, freshly baked goods that rival those of specialty shops.

One of the standout features of this Costco is its customer service. The staff here are notably friendly and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile, whether it's helping locate a product or offering detailed information about an item's features. This level of service greatly enhances the shopping experience and sets this store apart from its competitors.

The additional services offered, such as the pharmacy, optical department, and tire center, add significant value, making it possible to accomplish a variety of errands in a single trip. The food court is another highlight, offering tasty and affordable options perfect for a quick snack or meal after shopping.

Parking is ample, with spaces usually available even during busy times, which adds to the convenience. The cleanliness of both the store and the surrounding premises is consistently maintained, creating a pleasant environment for shoppers.

In conclusion, Costco in Clovis is an excellent choice for anyone looking to maximize value without compromising on quality. From the wide selection of products to the exemplary customer service and the overall shopping environment, this store offers a superior retail experience that keeps me coming back. Highly recommended for efficient and satisfying shopping trips.

I love their Pharmacy. It‚Äôs high volume so all of the problems get ironed out before you even get there. Costco Wholesale in LA is a shopping haven for those looking to score great deals on a wide range of products. From household essentials to electronics, furniture, and even groceries, Costco offers incredible value for its members. The sheer variety and quality of products available at Costco are impressive, and the bulk packaging makes it ideal for families or individuals looking to save both time and money. The spacious aisles and organized layout make for a pleasant shopping experience, even during busy times. Plus, the food court is a bonus with its delicious and affordable eats, perfect for refueling after a successful shopping spree. With its unbeatable prices, quality products, and convenient locations, Costco Wholesale is a must-visit for anyone in LA looking to stretch their dollar without sacrificing quality.

Every visit to the Cypress, California Costco proves to be a bustling, vibrant experience. Despite the overwhelming rush of customers which is a common spectacle, the staff impresses with their excellent management and efficient handling of the crowd. They perform their duties with a professionalism that truly embodies the spirit of Costco.

Parking can occasionally be a bit of a challenge due to the high traffic volume, but this is a small inconvenience in light of the overall shopping experience. The in-store amenities are numerous, and the pharmacy stands out particularly. The pharmacy technician, Jenn, demonstrates stellar service, embodying an upbeat, positive demeanor that brightens your day. She rectified a price error on one of my medications with such swift grace, it seemed effortless.

The snack bar is also a buzzing hub within the store, constantly busy serving up their delectable treats. A suggestion for improvement would be the incorporation of kiosk ordering at the snack bar, similar to other Costco locations, to streamline the process and better serve the high customer volume.

This Costco location delivers an exceptional shopping experience, and I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone in the Cypress area. Their staff, especially the likes of Jenn at the pharmacy, and their wide range of products never fail to impress. The busy nature of the store is a testament to its popularity and the value it provides to the community.

I went with my sister to shop. I grabbed a few things.When we was checking out the total was more than she has on her card.   So I offered to pay the remaining balance. COSTCO has some items that are worth the crowded isles and sometimes lengthy lines when checking out and when leaving. However lately, it isn't always the best deal when purchasing certain items. So, if you like to always get the best deal check prices while you're shopping or before going out and you can avoid buying items that are overpriced for no good reason other than price gouging the middle class by the popular grocery store chains.

First off, I generally have a positive experience at Costco. You need to move!‚Äù as he walked away towards the kiosks/counter area.

It‚Äôs so good except the parking. It‚Äôs takes some time to find a parking spot. Food court here is very good they serve quickly. 8-10 self check out counters are there so if you don‚Äôt buy any liquor it‚Äôs convenient to use the self checkout. Staff here are generally helpful.

This my local Costco is hands down the best location in the entire Bay Area. Not only it has friendly customer service people around, it‚Äôs also very clean, organized, spacious, has most if not all the best items available and not super crowded too. They got my five stars ratings.

Costco in Danville consistently impresses with its offerings, and I'm particularly pleased with their selection of Tumeric immunity shots. The fact that you can get 10 of them at such a great price is a fantastic deal. Additionally, the availability of Harmless brand Coconut water adds a refreshing touch to the shopping experience. Overall, Costco in Danville provides quality products at affordable prices, making it a reliable choice for health-conscious shoppers.

One of the things I love most is that they offer food in family-sized portions, which is perfect for my household. The staff always provides excellent service, making every visit enjoyable. Great selection of ready-made meals, and they have a wide variety of Asian products that I appreciate. Plus, their range of home items is fantastic. Costco meets all my shopping needs.

Very stocked store! They even have Human Touch massage chairs there till this weekend!!
Great staff! Tons of top shelf liquors and wines too.

Costco right across from Amazon fulfillment warehouse or Ranch market, parking is quite easy even on the weekends. The staff is always friendly and courteous. There are  optometrist, optical, hearing aids, pharmacy, food court and tire center.

I still brought my daughter shopping this Sunday, but this time I was treated very unfairly. After I paid my bill, I waited in line at the membership counter with my little girl in her shopping cart, ready to ask about the less than $60 cashback on last year's EXCLUSIVE card. (I saw a share on the social media platform that users with an EXCLUSIVE card that costs $120 a year can either downgrade to the $60 adult gold card or refund the difference. But the man in front of me and I were not so lucky, we waited for half an hour, still no one, inexplicably there are four counters, standing about 5 male and 3 female staff, they did not even politely tell us to wait a little bit, they were just there to laugh and chat! I was very angry, I did not understand why it was ignored, I told one of the male employees, I need to find the person in charge, did not think, this so-called manager kept explaining, did not realize the problem, and did not apologize, at this time my daughter was about to cry, I told him, if your employees treat customers kindly, it does not matter if you wait a little longer. It's a shame they can't even say a word, but they're there talking and laughing and fighting? I think the reason why Costco East Valley is doing this is racist, I can't think of any other reason, I have not encountered this kind of thing in other stores. A weak woman and little girl were racially abused, bullied, ignored, and disrespectfully treated by Costco's East Valley membership counter staff!
Great warehouse in a brand new building. Updated 112023 : still very well stored with good levels of inventory and assortment.

I‚Äôm a huge Costco fan. But this store's customer service today was way below standard today. The two main reasons it went from a one-star to a four 1/2-star rating were Chris and the Manager Bill. I was upset about how one of their employees handled the self-checkout line. He was not the most tactful person. Chris was courteous and fast, Bill was the poor manager who listened to my frustrations with the checkout line and their mobile app. I could totally understand why Bill is the manager of the store.

This Costco is a great location. Some nice places to eat in the "Station" shopping center as well.  It is much more pleasant to shop at this Costco than the one in Chino Hills. The gas station has 3 pumps per island!  The cows that were nearby are all gone, so no more cow smell.
I like this Costco :) they are friendly and have good services. It is a little more compact than the South SF one closed to the airport, but they have some unique stuff!

As usual great experience in Costco. Getting in and out is slow during peak times. All standard items from Costco are available.  Lots of carts available. There is a separate line for returns so you don‚Äôt have to jam with folks who are coming out of the store. One thing noticed in the entrance of the store is that it is a place of many items with discounts. Sometimes many clothes has discounts.

Most importantly with Costco is return policy. As usual you can find dairy, produce, fruits, bakery, stationary, clothes items.

If you come early, they don't have the little container of onions for the hotdogs. Sometimes only the hot dogs and pizzas are available. Other stuff like salads aren't available. Otherwise, this is a good Costco.

I recently visited the Costco on El Camino Real and was very pleased with the experience. The store was well-stocked, and I was able to find everything I needed, from fresh fruits and eggs to a variety of frozen foods perfect for quick weeknight dinners. Everything was fresh, and the quality of the products was excellent. The store layout made it easy to find what I was looking for, and checkout was efficient thanks to the friendly staff. I appreciate being able to rely on Costco for consistent quality and great customer service.

Love coming to this Costco, they have more and more Asian snacks now. Omg! Look I found a lot of the new year snacks from my childhood! I wish I can bring them all home ( that is prob everyone‚Äôs thoughts while shopping at Costco XD)

Want some chaos in your life? Come on a Saturday. I've been a Costco member for awhile and I get the appeal of trying samples, but there needs to be more thought going into where these stations are set up and maybe some arrow signage on the floor to veer right so the flow is manageable. Some shoppers stop and cause traffic jams which are so unnecessary, time consuming, and frustrating. Let's fix this. Have a light on a stick (think back to the Blue Light Specials at Kmart) and place the taster carts in less busy areas or line them up so the folks who want a taste can do that. And maybe train the folks making the food to help with these situations.

What can one say about Costco that has not already been said.  They pay their employees living descent wages that's why their employees provide the best customer service. All their merchandise is of the highest quality backed by the no question asked return policy. Don't forget the cash back if you use their credit card.

Not worth a 1hr drive to this Costco. If you have a service dog they deny you entrance. The elderly woman in the front was super rude about it just nudging her finger and mumbling all you can hear is no no and pointed  at my service animal. I kindly asked to bring the manager and he was super rude he came to us up front with an attitude and ready to argue  when we were extremely calm with no attitude. We just turned around and left so if you come with a service animal bring your proof of it because if not they will deny entrance. So they are not getting my money. I‚Äôve been to several Costco‚Äôs in my home town in New Jersey and not once ever ever was denied entrance. Or asked to show any type of proof. By the time I got to the checkout , I was almost full from all the food samples. It was great.
They had no handicap carts for my disabled husband. This Costco has like 3 carts not very handicap friendly. If you come bring your own rideable cart.

This Costco in Elk Grove has quickly become one of the busiest Costco in the Sacramento area after it opened in 2018.

It gets to the point that I try to avoid the weekend to shop at this Costco. I have a hard time even getting a parking space. I have spent more than 15-20 minutes to park my car before!

The gas station in this location is also overloaded even after the expansion a couple of years ago. 20 minutes wait is normal during peak hours.

Customer service is also worse than most of Costco in the area. I have had bad experiences even with the manager at the store.

However, the store offers good products at reasonable prices. I'll still shop here if I'm at home. But I will choose another Costco if I can.

I‚Äôm so sad. I ordered a half cheese, half pepperoni pizza over the phone and was told it would be ready in 20 minutes. I went to pick up the pizza and when I got home, it was all pepperoni. Quite busy all the time even 30 minutes before closing. Although they keep up with demand and always have new and unique products. The Costco food court food is delicious and large in portions. I have had the chicken bake, cheese pizza slice, and roast beef sandwich in the past, I recommend all three for you to try.

I love to shop at Costco. They have so many good things to choose from. It wasn't too busy, and I was checked out quickly.
Great store but I wish they had a few more gas pumps and also it would be great if they were able to add some for diesel too. Other then that overall love this place
Love that we have a Costco here in Humboldt! The staff is always super helpful and nice (especially the pharmacy!) And kudos to Scott who was wrangling carts and helped us with an oversized shed box!

Needs more handicapped spots, put the ones back in the one area where you repainted the lines
They were completely great there. Only 6 to 8 spots now for a store that size is ridiculous.

Members only to enter the store. Anyone can enter the little restaurant. They have employees posted at the entrance to double check your costso membership cards. Only members with a card that has their picture id may purchase items from the store. I got red flagged for 6 months because I went shopping without my husband, he had the card with his name on it. They are strict.

The prices are worth it if you have a family of 4 or more. If it‚Äôs just you and your significant other, the bulk prices may be amazing but realistically it‚Äôs hard to eat a dozen muffins before they go bad, or enjoy all those huge bottles of juice before they spoil.

Definitely stock up on alcohol here. Best prices in town for handles of liquor. Their Kirkland brand is basically the exact same as what they are imitating, but with their own name on it. Kirkland vodka is exactly the same as Grey Goose, for a fraction of the price.

Come here for a really cheap but satisfying American meal - hotdogs for $1.50 including a drink. Slice of pizza for $1.99. It‚Äôs more like 2 medium slices that add up to a lot of pizza. I got a chocolate vanilla frozen yogurt swirl

Praise God üôèüèº I was able to find several options for some upcoming trainings I have at work. I am disappointed that the platter options changed, but the prices are very reasonable. I did find some gluten free and vegetarian options.

Love Costco. The mocha freeze drink was the best ive ever had! Bravo you guys! I'm not sure I'm a fan of the food court location. Love the patio with all the tables but those employees and customers lined up are very vulnerable, like sitting ducks for any angry haters who might be bored for something to do. Bullet proof glass?
Gotta luv Costco. It‚Äôs truly a one stop shop. This Costco is not as big as the others but it works. The samples are an added bonus. They always have me buying something I wouldn‚Äôt buy ordinarily

Costco management directs their security team to openly exercise racial profiling through the use of intimidation and all-out disrespectful behavior toward those they deem undesirable to shop at Costco. Was extremely busy, and carried a lot of items some of which were in disarray messy, and not organized. It didn‚Äôt carry any interesting or items that other Costcos don‚Äôt carry. Had extra rows of alcohol. Bathrooms were clean.

One of our favorite places to shop. Reasonably priced, reasonably busy, and very nice employees. You can always find what you need, and more. Only complaint is that the carts aren‚Äôt big enough!
Very full cart +pizza for dinner for $620

10/5 food court

Once a month, shopping stop. East off, easy on freeway entrance. Plenty of parking.  Usually arrive at 9am opening.
People already lined up to enter. Very clean and organized.  Staff is very friendly. Usually spend $250- $350 per visit.  Usually purchase: various meets, dairy, and pantry items.

Has everything you need and more.  The place was a bit crowded, but who wouldn't want to come to a place that has bunk items and bargain prices, membership required.

This Costco's cafe was not the most efficient, but it did fill everyone's order with a little wait time.  I know the Costco Cafe in Elk Grove is more efficient with multiple lines, 1 just for whole pizzas and workers for each line to fill orders, even as the cook staff is cranking out fresh food to keep, but this Costco the cook and serve staff were the same. I love going to Costco. I like their honey which I always put in my oatmeal and of course a lot of very affordable stuff.

Costco continues to be our go-to destination for gas refueling, and for good reason. Not only does their gas station consistently offer competitive prices, but the process is also efficient and hassle-free. Beyond the pumps, the warehouse itself maintains a high standard of cleanliness, which is always appreciated. Whether it's grabbing a quick refill or browsing through their extensive selection of products, Costco consistently delivers on quality and convenience.

I really like shopping at this Costco. Every time I can‚Äôt find something I call the stores phone number and they tell me the aisle. It has helped me immensely. I do wish they could add the items aisles like walmart and target have on their app so I don‚Äôt bother the nice people. But tHank‚Äôs again for the help!
Great place to shop. They have amazing deals on TV's. Also, their food court is very good. $1.50 for an all beef hot dog with a drink, can't beat that!

Shopping groceries and other household items at Costco is always a pleasure. Its easy to locate your required items very conveniently as store is decided in sections and racks very methodically. Prices are reasonable and return policy is matchless.
Outside the store there is ample car parking. Fast food counter inside is phenomenal as eats are available at very low rates.
Its an experience shopping here.
I love this Costco, it‚Äôs amazing but yesterday we got ice cream and look what they give us üòÇ I hope they don‚Äôt do to anyone else cuz I love ice cream.

Costco is a gaint warehouse filled with everything you could possibly need. Produce is fresh and well stocked.  Bakery is filled with fresh goodies. Store is clean, well stocked and plenty of staff on the floor. Check out is generally quick. Cashiers are friendly and fast.

Great selection of wine, whiskey, seafood, meat, vegetables, and fruits. Fast and efficient check-out process, along with a large parking lot. The free nitrogen tire pump has also been very useful. Only wish they hadn‚Äôt taken so long in fixing the kitchen for the roasted chicken and ribs!

Nothing to complain about. A typical, well run Costco with efficient service, well stocked shelves and fair prices. Jewelry, electronics, basic clothing, household items, and plenty of food. Parking can be tough because the store is always crowded. Nowhere to sit except patio furniture area. Bathrooms are clean.
Love their ice cream and deals!

First time visiting a Costco in America and I can confirm they‚Äôre 1000 times better than the ones in Vancouver, Canada.

Tons of alcohol choices + the food court has chicken bake.

I‚Äôll definitely be back to pick up some items before my trip back home.
Decent parking, clean store with great automotive garage for basic services+ nitrogen air available in the parking lot. Their food court is decent but lacks tables to sit and eat your hotdog/pizza.

This is definitely our favorite store everything is good quality well worth the prices. What I love the most is when something goes wrong they don‚Äôt give you a hard time. They just replace the item but they will make you happy and I‚Äôm proud to say that a family member works at one for 22 years now he‚Äôs happy, they respect him. It‚Äôs a great company and I do post this things for other people to see how Costco does it. This is like the third or fourth one that we do repave the parking structure which I think is very smart and it gets there a better look to the whole store. Actually the whole Plaza Costco definitely for batteries tires and a lot of the things. Great products I am a customer I know what I‚Äôm saying.

I‚Äôve been a loyal customer of this store for a while now, and I‚Äôm always impressed by the quality of products they offer. Whether it‚Äôs the unbeatable deals on electric toothbrushes or the wide selection of clothing, there‚Äôs something for everyone. The staff, especially at the tire department, have been incredibly helpful, making each visit a pleasant experience. While the parking can be a bit challenging at times, it‚Äôs a small price to pay for the value and variety you get in return. I‚Äôve noticed the customer service could be more consistent, but it‚Äôs never deterred me from coming back. Keep up the great work!

I've visited this Costco about half a dozen times now and nearly each visit I come across unprofessional supervisor Kieran. The way the way he talks to members especially non-Caucasian members needs to be addressed immediately; he is rude, short tempered, and condescending.
This type of attitude does not belong in customer service, much less in management.
Quiet today but still a great shopping experience at Costco also discovered fit my foot
Cheap toothbrushes here. If you want good deals on electric toothbrushes this is the place you want to shop for.

One of our favorite Costcos in the Bay Area. Got lots of stuff that we like which you can‚Äôt get in many of the other locations. And many on discounts too!

And now that the other new one is opened in Newark, it‚Äôs practically empty during the weekdays. So easy parking and quick in and out. And the service by the employees is better too cos they‚Äôre not as busy and rushing around like in other locations!
As usual great Costco store experience. There few Asian special items are sold in this store. Lots of parking space. Gas station and food court is also present in this Costco.
Clean interior and exterior; not too crowded at this location and good for shopping around.

It was overcrowded (we visited on Saturday). All Indian dal's are available and it also has Sona Masoori in stock. They have started selling Motichoor Laddu, Pani Puri, Khatta Meetha and two varieties of Haldiram's sweets and Savory combos. They cut the pizza into small pieces, which was loved by my entire family. The pizza was cooked perfectly.

I am here on a Monday morning and this place is abuzz with customers. Good news is Trolleys are available. Coming from Australia üá¶üá∫ we are new to Costco. Believe me, we have only one branch of Costco in Perth. This store is massive we bought lots of clothes and even a üß≥

Costco is still Costco. I like to go there to shop for other things besides food. I sent my friend who helps work on my car the pic of the oil. That price is for 2, 5qt containers. That is the normal price for one 5qt at the auto parts store.
And welcome to my new back patio set. With the fire pit and rounded seating, just envision thebottles of wine to be shared in this set. Can't wait!!
I was there on about 10am on a Saturday. SURPRISINGLY NO LINES AT CHECKOUT. That made the day an even better success.

Every single time I see the female worker with short black hair, typically in a button-up or t-shirt she is extremely rude to me. She is  Today I had a return, she saw I had the receipt and item in hand. I wanted to do an exchange (unknowingly you have to do a full return). She was too busy chatting about personal matters with her coworkers she said ‚ÄúEHHHH- other way!‚Äù I politely said ‚Äúoh I wanted to buy something else-‚Äú she cut me off and said ‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt matter other way.‚Äù So I walk through the exit, shop and try to exchange.
