In the past with this worker I used my mothers Costco card at 16 years old to enter and purchase SOLELY milk. My mom was in the car with a screaming sick baby and sent me in quickly. This same worker was at the door and literally SNATCHER the Costco card out of my hand.

She has no respect or compassion for others, at least every-time I have interacted with her. Never seen her smile or be friendly. It irks me that ruins my Costco experiences every time she speaks to me and it‚Äôs inevitable to avoid this lady when she works the door.

It's quick and easy I love this self-checkout. I did not know that you can get your prescriptions without a Costco card. However you have to get a specific card just to walk in to get your prescription medication I recommend it it is much cheaper that's the only reason why I purchase a Costco card. And later found out I did not need one

This is one of those know before you go kind of shopping experiences. If you don't know how stuff works here it can be intimidating. Great prices and if you can catch the food court when they aren't slammed they have good quick food for a decent price.
My favorite Costco! Always clean, friendly staff, great products. We spend WAY too much money here. Expect it to be busy after 5 and especially on weekends.

The only thing Costco has perfected is creating the most illogical gas stations. They are incredibly consistent on building the gas stations in a way that seems purposely inefficient. This specific location is the worst gas station setup I‚Äôve ever seen at a Costco. It took 7 minutes to get out of the parking lot and take my business elsewhere.

Navigating the parking lot at the Fullerton Costco can be a challenge. Despite recent efforts to ease congestion by adding another lane, the parking situation remains a hassle. The entrance and exit lanes still struggle to adequately accommodate the high volume of traffic, especially during peak hours.

The gas station, known for its competitive prices, sees incredibly long lines. Like many others, I've found that arriving at 7:00 AM significantly cuts down the wait time. Otherwise, the wait can be daunting, and I often find myself looking for other cost-effective fuel options in the area.

Inside, the store maintains the typical Costco standard with a wide variety of products and generally good customer service. However, the food court is a different story. It often has long lines and can run out of supplies, which can be frustrating. The seating area frequently feels overcrowded and could benefit from better management, particularly during busy times.

Despite these challenges, the savings on bulk goods and gas usually make the trip worthwhile. For a smoother experience, I recommend visiting during off-peak hours to avoid the crowds.

I had a disappointing experience with the girl on self checkout during my recent visit to the Costco at Fullerton The interaction was not up to the standard I usually expect from Costco, with the cashier behaving she gave me a very bad attitude. I believe this might have been an off day, but it‚Äôs important that such issues are addressed to ensure they are not repeated. I trust that Costco will take this feedback seriously and work towards maintaining their usually high customer service standards.

Today I went to try and open a bank account but they wanted to see my name on the business license but we have a corporation so it won't have my name as the owner. They also didn't know what documents I needed to prove it was my business. They also had bad customer service! They just talked with the manager on the side instead of saying it in front of me. The first guy we talked with was new but he was trying his best but his supervisor was not kind of polite. Then her supervisor was the same. That happened two more times. If you want to open a business account do it online so you won't deal with people who don't know what they're doing.

I really like the way they set up the gas station area.. others are messy.  The line for self checkout was moving fast. This location has a different variety of items than other locations - which are actually really good items I use. Other than parking lot area..being a bit tight and scary to drive thru.. this Costco is one of the better ones
Not as big as other stores but well stocked. Liquor selection was much better than other stores in LA. Found everything I was looking for and the some #thecostcoway

She told me, ‚Äú Give me for the receipt ‚Äú andthen, She checked, returned and gave me the receipt for the return. when I checked again but 5 items not on sale were on sale, I told her andthen She checked again but she does not happy and she told me,‚Äù Did You it return it before?‚Äù , I said,‚Äù No‚Äù. she returned and missed an item in 5 items not on sale, I said that again, she has attitude to me, when shen done, I told her,‚Äù Thank you‚Äô‚Äô .The first time, I and my husband returned item to her, We feel like she's racist to me both we are vietnames, but I'm still happy to forgive her. My grandfather is old and he cannot speak English. Improve your customer service and attitude, Jorge and Mark!
Costco, train your employees again with their customer service skills!

HEADS UP! You can order pizza over the phone for pick up. But what they don't tell you is that they will only hold the pizzas for 30 minutes otherwise they will start selling them make sure to get there on time ‚è≤Ô∏è

As is the norm, packed, parking lot, gas station, warehouse. But, it moves fast, parking spots open up quickly, lines and in stores, traffic flows well and quickly. I almost opted not to go in, but I'm glad I did. Quick, easy, and painless. Clean, well stocked, and staff is friendly.

I love to shopping and costco and saving money some of my favorite foods.  Yiu can also save a ton of money on diapers and baby wipes if you have a new baby.  Costco travel offers great deals on trips to Hawaii aa well.

After walking by the Madeline cookies, thinking they were the ones that tasted like a piece of plastic wrap, tried one when I received a gift box. Dang they tasted like the ones made in The City. Each visit to Costco has me purchasing 3 boxes and slowly nibbling to make each cookie last longer .

An interesting fact about Costco, my Veterinary did not have the antibiotic for my dog and they found it at Costco. The wonderful part is that the cost was extremely low in price at Costco compared to what my vet charges. I did not have a Costco card and I had to be walked in with a worker, but it was worth it and they were extremely nice. This makes me want to get a Costco card. I appreciated this so much, as everyone knows the veterinary charges outrageous prices. Thank you Costco!

So I just went to Costco to the optical department. The lady there was very nice professional. Help me super fast. I was in and out. And I tell you. I should have got a membership to Costco years ago. Because the eyeglasses were half the price as the last pair I got. So I basically got 241.

Costco has an excellent return policy!
I highly recommend getting the Costco Citibank, this way you earn cashback not only by using your Costco membership but also when you pay with its credit card.

This is the only Costco in Gilroy area so it's always busy.  I call ahead pizza orders often. This is a regular Costco as far as I can see. Which is not bad,  but i haven't seen anything unique that the other Costco's don't carry.  They have a gas station that is great. The gas pumps have extra long hoses, so you can pump from any side.  It will reach ! I wish more people would realize this, as it would help the lines to get gas. Cars stack up to be on a certain side and it backs up the lines unnecessary.

Edited
New Review: The staff successfully fulfilled a part of my request and went the extra mile by personally emailing me to inform me that they had completed my request and specifying the location of the item in the store. However, they still lack a variety of vegetarian/vegan take-away or ready-to-cook options, which is why I am withholding the final star.

Old Review: Giving them 3 stars only because they don't have any vegan options. Just one or two vegetarian/vegan(and those are just salads) take away options. I requested them on their website too about this, but I don't see any difference. Apart from this I love Costco!

The Costco store itself is exactly what I expect from a Costco - good service and low cost. Normally, I would leave a 5 star review because it does meet my expectations.

Edit: If you need your phone unlocked and you are on the "free" phone plan, you might have to go through multiple people, but, if you press them, Costco can accelerate the phone payments so that you can unlock your phone.

However, I would steer anyone away from the AT&T kiosk. The kiosk is a vendor. It is separate from both Costco and AT&T ‚Äì so do not expect either company to help you with any issues that arise. If you choose to use the kiosk:
1.	Be very careful that you know what your contract says and do not rely on the assurances of the salespeople.
2.	If you have to call the AT&T Costco line, be aware that you might be transferred to a representative who is not aware of your Costco agreement.
3.	If you are offered a free phone, be aware that you will NOT be able to unlock it (regardless of what the sales staff tell you) without paying off your ‚Äúfree‚Äù phone.
4.	If you decide to return your phone within the 90 day grace period, you will receive no refund or compensation for your previously exchanged phone.
5.	Edited: The sales people varied from being helpful to completely unhelpful and excellent customer service to terrible customer service.

This costco is so unbelievably rude. This is not a once or twice thing, they are continuously harassing me any time I am here  and treat the college students horrendously. I am not from Santa Barbara but this is the worst costco I have ever been to. They are so rude to me the whole time and will ask me to provide identification randomly through out the store and will be mad If i bring even a singular person who is not a member with me to help me out. I was fresh out of hospital resting in my bed as the doctors ordered and my girlfriend went to go get me supplies to feel better for the week coming up and they took my card from her and threaten to cancel my membership instead of just saying she cannot do that or god forbid be a little sympathetic to the situation. Most of the people who shop here are college students just trying to get by I think this multi million dollar corporation can afford having college students coming in to PURCHASE food

As a loyal customer, I am consistently impressed by the outstanding service, competitive prices, and remarkable selection of products that make each visit truly enjoyable.

From groceries to household items, I am always amazed by the significant savings I can achieve without compromising on quality.

Plus, I absolutely love their new self-pay addition for the food court. I literally did not have to stand in line. I payed for my food order and walked write to the pick up window. Priceless!

What can I say, it‚Äôs a Costco pretty much like any other Costco. I suppose a couple of small but notable differences are that there‚Äôs actually enough parking in this lot, and the store feels less busy than any other locations I‚Äôve been to.

Costco is a top-notch shopping destination! The vast selection, great prices, and spacious layout make it a favorite. Friendly staff and quality products add to the positive experience. Highly recommend for a convenient and enjoyable shopping trip!
Workers are nice!!! Don‚Äôt believe me check out my 5 starts. Lines are a bit shorter, and it is so clean inside

We went to Costco today to return something and I was helped by Linda. I just want to give her credit she made me feel like a valued customer and treated me fairly. Such a great asset to Costco.
Thank you Linda for being an understanding and caring person!

Brand new! Fresh and clean. Big parking lot with great view of the hills. Seems larger than the other stores. Has tire center inside the main store (good, finally), food and gas station. Very nice new COSTCO.
Update: very efficient tire purchase. The purchase price includes installation and rotation and balancing of the tires. This is a huge savings and value for tire purchases. I'm very happy with the Costco tire center.

I know it‚Äôs probably pointless to complain about your staff when it‚Äôs no secret most of San Jose is stuck up regardless of net worth, but if my last visit went worse it would‚Äôve resulted in a lawsuit. I‚Äôm disabled and use motorized carts when I go to large stores such as Costco locations. Thankfully a cart was available and charged. I was next in line and just waiting on the member I was with to present the membership card, and no one behind me in my line. Anyways, the member I was with was taking only like three minutes to get to the line and still no one behind me. Your packer took it upon their self to go to the line next to me to and started taking stuff out of a lady‚Äôs cart who was in no obvious way ready to be checked out- after I was told she was going to help the next customer. My stuff was already on the conveyor and my motorized cart was less than a foot away from being behind the check stand so I decided to move up before the stuck up packer could bring the stuff over to be checked out. She could‚Äôve injured me and I would‚Äôve defended myself and sued her personally and your manager on staff and your company. Your cashier didn‚Äôt greet and was tapping his finger the whole time the card machine was taking payment. It‚Äôs clear Costco could care less about the disabled. Shame on you. Also, make sure all of your locations have ready the motorized carts and enough on hand, otherwise that‚Äôs illegal.
First time at this location. It looked super clean and organized. Only got a few things like shoes and macaroons. They had many cute bottles of tequila.
Hanford Costco Has it All... They called us to go help Assemble their new playset display. If you ever need help, contact Assemblyhub.us or Google us and lets us help you...

Let me start out by saying that Natasha in self checkout was fabulous and very helpful and gets ten stars, however the rest of my experience was negative 9 stars, at least.

I am sorry, but I do not go to Costco or to any other business establishment wanting to hear about Jesus Christ. I was innocently sampling focaccia when the vendor complimented me on my Spanish and asked me where I was from. He stated he was from Tijuana and I mentioned that I was going there later this year. I mentioned hearing scary stories in the media about TJ and asked him if it was safe and he said it was, but that I should put my trust in Jesus Christ. I said that I feel that organized religion is worse than whatever killed the dinosaurs and he said, "I don't believe in dinosaurs."  Oh gosh. I can't even. He began to rant and rave about the devastating effects of science and I said, "Ya estuvo" and walked away.

Are you kidding, Costo? Really. Is there a policy on this? Are your vendors free to proselytize and promulgate religious propaganda, or is this just a lack of imagination? I mean, I wouldn't think you would have to tell people this is entirely inappropriate and I didn't even know that not believing in dinosaurs was a thing. Thumbs down.
Nobody wanted to help me. I just kept getting sent back and forth to people. I asked for a manager, and they ignored me and just left and never came back.

This particular Costco was very clean and organized. It wasn't super busy on Monday morning, there were plenty of carts. The lines moved quickly and the cashier was very polite and helpful. The selection of desserts were impressive.

I love going to Costco! It's always super clean and I can find the best deals on pretty much everything. It's like every time I go, I end up saving a bunch of money without even trying.

The best part? The samples. Seriously, you can try so many cool snacks for free, and my kids can't get enough of them. It's like a mini adventure for us every time we're there, seeing what new stuff we can taste.

Oh, and you can't beat the hot dog and soda deal. It's been the same price forever, and it's such a steal. It's one of those things that never gets old and keeps us coming back.

The only bummer is that they don't take all kinds of payment, which can be a bit annoying sometimes. I wish they'd be more flexible with how you can pay.

But, honestly, that's a small thing compared to all the good stuff. Costco is just awesome. Great prices, clean place, and fun snacks. Totally recommend it!
Do not get Free Phone from vendors inside(scam). They cannot tell your first two or three months bill. Just get plan ONLY! Costco needs to kick them out!

I went here around 3pm on a Sunday and it was raining. The parking lot was packed and traffic was terrible. The way they have it set up to get in line for gasoline is confusing with no clear signs. There is only one line until you get up to the pumps. Cars coming from another direction were trying to cut in and people were getting angry. After getting gas, I just wanted to get out of the parking lot. There is basically one way you have to take to get out of the gas area and it leads you to main road in front of the store. Before I could advance very far, a woman stops in front of me and is waiting for a spot to her left. She waves me on to go around her but it's impossible  due to oncoming traffic. I wait 5-8 minutes and no one is moving and now there is gridlock and a line of stuck cars. People are getting angry and a man lays into his horn but the lady ignores him. He squeezed barely through on her left  leaving inches between cars and cannot proceed past her because a shopping cart is blocking his way. He stops next to her car and tried to get out of his car but can open his door only about 8inches. He begins shouting angrily at the woman and they have a shouting match. Finally the woman removes the cart and he can pass. I was barely able to squeeze past that was woman but scraped my rims on the cement planter. I have a small card but no truck would be able to fit. Last I saw the lady was still waiting for the spot and cars were all honking at her while she ignored them. Such a bad experience, I will never ever go here again.

Well, an entire pizza is $10. Can't beat the price. But I spent a half an hour is a crawling line. The pizza looked nothing like it was in the past or the large picture showing on the wall. Came out super thin, like New York style. Don't recommend getting pizza during a weekend

Costco is the place to shop for shopping in bulk for affordable prices. I love Costco ever since I was little. They don't just have food, they have EVERYTHING you can think of from Tvs to clothing to Jewelry and more. Shop at Costco for your family needs.

Experienced Alma‚Äôs world class terrible customer service here. Customer service rule #1 - Listen.

We got rebate check of about $25 and came to ask how to get the difference back in consideration that the regular member costs $60 vs. ours $120.

Then Ama came without any clue arrogantly repeating herself ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt have the policy. We can cancel or downgrade your membership OR bring the paper to WHOEVER told you‚Äù ‚ÄúDo you understand??‚Äù.

She didn‚Äôt want to listen and kept cutting in by raising the voice. Increasing your voice doesn‚Äôt mean you‚Äôre right keep in mind.

We decided to go back to ‚Äúwhoever told you‚Äù location and got taken care of fast and easily.

Sadly Costco has this type of not well trained staff at front line. It‚Äôs about corporate image and people skills. Apparently she thought she‚Äôs the absolute voice there representing the company.

Never racial profile anyone. Go back to take some education and learn how to handle.
His work is amazing, he tailored 2 vintage suits and made them look so good. Cash only and worth it!! He is THE place to go to. I have done a lot of tailors and he is excellent. No joke.

Amazing deals that any Costco member can take advantage of. Yes, some items are super wholesale quantity but the deals are just so good. You'll likely get the best prices on produce including meats, kitchen goods, paper goods, snacks, and more!! Several instant coupons here are not available at regular Costcos

This location is great and has a lot of great staff. But there‚Äôs one cashier, I think her name is Alma, who is nosier than most. I feel discriminated by her because I understand that I look really young, but she has absolutely no right to question me as to why I‚Äôm purchasing what I‚Äôm purchasing. Worst Costco ever!!! Got attended by ‚ÄúCarla‚Äù on a register. She had the nerve to be disrespectful & rude. If you‚Äôre having a bad day just say that!! Definitely will stick to Sam‚Äôs smh!!!! BOO CARLA ON THE LAST REGISTER GOING OUT.

üõí Costco Hayward is a shopping haven! The extensive selection of products and goods is impressive, ensuring you find everything you need. From fresh produce to household items, the variety is unmatched. Quality meets affordability, making every visit a delightful and cost-effective shopping spree. Highly recommend! üõí

This Costco offers a wide range of products including groceries, electronics, furniture, appliances, eyewear, gas, pharmacy and more. I love their high-quality private label Kirkland Signature brand. Costco's membership model contributes significantly to its revenue and customer loyalty. I have been a long standing member of Costco. Hayward‚Äôs Costco is one of the best - Great staff and availability of products. Parking is hard to find on the weekends but we never feel disappointed visiting this place. Went to Costco it wasn't open yet when it did open went to get a cart and this woman kept saying excuse me and I turned to let her know I was getting a cart and not to run into me someone could get hurt. She told me I would get hurt I told her No my daughter is right over here. I got my cart and we also helped an elderly man get a cart.

Shopping was okay but they were sweeping up the store while the crowd was trying to shop I think that should have been done earlier in the morning.

This one's okay. It has more of wholesale business deals there. Not too much activity but just enough. But it gets the job done. Whatever it is that you need there. They have it. Not a lot of foot traffic that I saw when I was there. But that was just through the week time. Maybe the weekend. It's much busier. But it's cool

Everything about this place is great as I love Costco and am a huge fan. But something has changed at this location over the last couple of years and it's that the weekend traffic here is insane. You would think you were going to a concert or something. Always had a great shopping experience here other than the ten million others doing the same at any given time and the folks here are super friendly!
Most restaurant supply items are available. From packing containers, cups , silverware, all bulk meat, ( in cases) .

I‚Äôve spoken to a Costco‚Äôs Business Center Supervisor about swiftly and proactively resolving the matter of unauthorized ICE members unkindly occupying the 10 Blink Charging spots to no avail.

Blink Charging members who needs to utilize the service are unfortunately unable to access it.

***Has NO food court***
Overall good- HUGE food and snack selection.
Great parking. Fast cashiers. They have more selection on food items for sure. I saw a whole frozen pig‚Ä¶ will come back to this location- especially for a party.

Ample parking.  Clean store with the usual Costco selection.  I did, however, notice that this one was arranged a little different than most.  Took a little to find what I was looking for.  But product was nearly stocked and arranged. I didn't find a gas center here,  so I'm assuming they didn't have one.  Clean restrooms and great drink selection.

Good variety of food and food service equipment for a caterer, restaurant, or a big family with the right membership (it is a business costco). Quick people at checkout, a good amount of pumps for the gas station, and electric car charging spots.

Giancarlo is the best!!  My husband purchased his hearing aids from him.  He made it so easy.   He did his testing, fitting, ordered them and spent time teaching him to put them in.   The price was so incredible!   He is so professional and very helpful.   He is a true asset to Costco.    We went back after a couple weeks for an adjustment.   He is the nicest man!  Thank you for having him available!!

I recently had the chance to visit the Costco Wholesale in Huntington Beach, CA, and I must tell you, my experience was unexpectedly pleasant. You know, typically shopping at Costco can be a bit of a hustle, with the packed parking and the post-work crowd, but surprisingly, despite the initial struggle with parking, the rest of my experience was rather positive.

Once inside the store, which by the way, is located in the bustling Bella Terra, I found it to be well-stocked and organized. The particular item that brought me there ‚Äì an SSD Drive ‚Äì was available, even though my usual store was out of stock. And this, my friends, is why I love Costco. They always seem to have what you need.

Now, let's talk about the checkout. Despite the very large crowd, I was pleasantly surprised at the efficiency of the process. It was quick, it was easy, and before I knew it, I was out the door. This was a testament to the well-trained and professional staff who handled the constant stream of shoppers like pros.

I must mention though, the long walk back to the car at the front of the mall. It was a bit of a workout but hey, who's complaining about a few extra steps?

In addition, if you ever need to fill up your tank while shopping, the Costco Gasoline in Huntington Beach is worth a visit. There is always a long line here, but moves quickly and huge savings.

In conclusion, my visit to the Costco Wholesale in Huntington Beach was a great experience, and I would recommend it to anyone in need of a good deal on a variety of products. Despite the heavy crowds and the slightly far-off parking, the well-stocked store and the swift checkout process more than made up for it. Happy shopping, everyone!

Poor Customer Service experience with Gina and Bianca have had increasingly poor customer experiences with my visits each time. Family of eight spends quite a bit at Costco monthly and have found that we are getting better service and better products at Sam‚Äôs Club and will continue to move away from Costco due to their poor customer service and poor return policy and the way that they are handling returns now. It is stated that they have a customer satisfaction guarantee, however that seems to not be the case anymore when you return some thing they‚Äôre having several people look over you and watch over you and watch over your products like you‚Äôre trying to steal from them and it is becoming increasingly more uncomfortable and not a satisfaction guaranteed state of mind. Employees are acting like we are taking this amount from their checks directly and it is a very poor customer experience. Bianca had the audacity to say that my profile was negative that I am returning more than I‚Äôm spending at certain locations which could not be further from the truth. Again, poor customers, satisfaction, poor customer experience and will again move away from shopping at Costco in the future.

Costco requires a membership, but if you are buying for 2+ people in your household, especially if also buying gas ‚õΩÔ∏è at Costco, it‚Äôs worth it.  The more you are buying for the better for food as the items are in bulk with bulk pricing.

We enjoy getting our gas ‚õΩÔ∏è at Costco along with the selection of groceries and other items at great prices.  Be sure to go between 1 and 4 pm for the free samples of items sold at Costco. We have bought many items we would not have after being impressed with the samples.

Happy shopping.  They like to have hidden treasure finds in the store at great prices, but require some time to find.

Great Costco and Location, fast check out even when busy. However, parking is usually full so better to take the first open spot you see. Try to avoid after school rush and weekends. Better to go when they first open, otherwise it's a hit or miss. If there is a line entering the parking lot, come back another time if you can wait. I was uncomfortable at how these employees started to surround this customer because of some card membership issue.  The employees here are mostly stressed and uptight.  Few are okay; however, I refuse to allow others to treat me like l am a thief just because of my skins phenotype!! The staff is so rude, unfriendly, and don't respect the customer, and yet we pay a high price for membership. I was treated as if I was a thief. The employees act as if they were superior to others. Always a great place to shop.The parking lot was pretty fulland there were a lot of people inside but the self check out was quick although the line was long so I really appreciated that

At the optical department,  Brenda so far has been treating me with care and respect but the other staff at optical don't,  they are very rude and unprofessional,  very bad costumer service. It was the most unorganized Costco I have ever been in. I asked for the location of a product I saw on YouTube. The supervisor looked it up on her phone and she said they didn't have that product at this store. While walking through the store, I saw the display of the product I was inquiring about minutes earlier.  I was disappointed so I went and bought the item at Home Depot (they were helpful and wanted my money). Folks do not shop at the Inglewood Costco,  go to the Hawthorne location where the staff is more knowledgeable, and the store is well kept and managed.

Workers in this Costco are really kind, and friendly.

When I called to check steamed dungeness crabsü¶Ä, they kindly replied to me that they have.

I ran to Costco, Irvine, and then I bought two packs of Steamed dungeness crabs. (Total 6 crabs)

Also, I bought one pack of sea bass, and octopus too.

Those are cheap, but very good quality.
(3 dungeness craps are in one package, and the price is around $32.00)

Wow, steamed dungeness crabs with melted Ghee Butter was perfectly matched.

As a frequent shopper at Technology Costco in Irvine, I find that staff is friendly and store is clean, well maintained.

I have many plants from
Costco and I love them all
This Costco is great it has great deals sometimes but it‚Äôs never busy.

This is not just about this Costco but every Costco. The beef quality is so bad, to the point it‚Äôs not edible. What happened after Covid? They mostly have only ‚Äúchoice‚Äù options and it definitely can‚Äôt be that either. It is the worst quality.

Thank you Costco for ruining a birthday event. My friend said go to Stater Bros instead for beef and check their weekly ads for the best deals.

As a frequent shopper, I've consistently been impressed with Costco Wholesale's unique approach to retail. The heart of Costco's success lies in its unbeatable pricing strategy. By focusing on bulk purchases, Costco offers a range of high-quality products at prices that are tough to match elsewhere. This has been a game-changer for me, especially when it comes to stocking up on essentials for my family.But what truly sets Costco apart is not just its prices. The cleanliness of the stores is remarkable. Each time I visit, I find the aisles spacious and well-organized, with products neatly displayed, making shopping both efficient and pleasant. It's clear that Costco prioritizes maintaining a clean and welcoming environment for its customers.Moreover, the staff at Costco deserve a special mention. They are invariably friendly and helpful, ready to assist with a smile. Their efficiency and willingness to go the extra mile add significantly to the overall shopping experience.In conclusion, Costco Wholesale is more than just a store; it's a comprehensive shopping solution that combines great prices, cleanliness, and exceptional customer service. It's a place where shopping feels less like a chore and more like an enjoyable experience. For anyone looking to stretch their dollar further without compromising on quality, Costco is the place to be. 5 stars!

Who doesn't love Costco? Fun story about one of my first visits...

I had given blood at a work blood drive a few hours before shopping, maybe not a great idea. I found myself fainting after I finished shopping and was grabbing a bite in the food court.

Employees took care of me and called 911, I had two young children with me... they even gave my sons comfort. I ended up taking an ambulance ride as a result. Staff stored all my groceries too!

I just really appreciate this Costco. I don't even know who it was that helped us, the experience was very fuzzy... but I hope they read this and hear me when I say... Thank You!!! From the bottom of my heart ‚ù§Ô∏è

It is one of the blessings of life that there is a Costco near where we live. Always fresh and reliable products Appreciate the friendly staff
Especially when I'm hungry, the price is very cheap but the quality is good. Pizza or hot dog set are my friends.It's the end of the year and there are a lot of sales, so buy healthy products.
These days, thrown crabs and clams are fresh and delicious.The clams are the best when served in Korean style clam kalguksu.The shrimp are prepared, so if you make soy sauce seasoned shrimp sauce, they are very delicious.Let's buy pork and make Korean-style bossam and eat it.We are lucky to have Costco near us.

Today I visited Costco and I recently had a surgery and I cannot lift heavy items. One of the guys outside pulling carts. Ivan. Helped me with all my groceries. Really nice guy.  He didn't accept the tip I  insisted to give him. He was really nice and polite. Really nice personnel working there, that's why I love Costco

Always clean and that's something great considering the number of customers going through there all day. Lines move quickly. I like that different sales take place daily to save us money. One thing here that I don't bother buying anywhere else is the Lactose free organic 2% milk. I've tried it from numerous places and this one has the best flavor. Frozen chicken comes in a large bag (2 sizes) and is worth the price!! Money saver plus great quality for the chicken breast. Cara cara oranges are very sweet when in season!!
Costco, obviously the two cuts in the middle are worth $16/lb but you mix in cuts that are definitely not USDA prime???  That's messed up, won't buy this again!!!

This Costco has the most insanely designed parking lot! It is always busy and hard to get in and parked and also leave after shopping! I'd so give it 5 stars if the parking lot was different! Other than that tho the staff at this location are amazing and it's also very well organized! They sell Prime energy packets and also literally everything you need! Amazing location! Highly recommend!

You know what's awesome? Being put on the spot for missing items on my receipt that the cashier's missed to scan. How many of you check your receipt? I know I don't and I'm sorry I didn't this time because having your cart pulled out of your hand and having staff call management like I'm smuggling drugs out of Costco is an awesome feeling. Instead of pointing the finger at me why don't you check your staff and have them make sure to scan all items correctly. Literally had 7 items. Will i stop shopping here, no but will I be double and triple checking my receipt on the way out. Yes. Do better.

I admit to being somewhat of a Costcohiloc member for over 20 years.  It's great when feeding a big family and hosting parties.  Downside is it gets costly and we tend to eat more just we should.  This location is very busy,  but I love the staff working to make experience smooth.  Im happy to find these artichokes yesterday.   My 4 stars was mainly because I tried the "new chocolate chip cookie, which was quite disappointing as it was hard and dry.  Maybe I got a bad batch.  Will try it again soon.

Love this Costco, employees are kind, however I watched them put their carts into the accessible parking lines. I am a paraplegic and could barely open my passenger side door to get myself and my wheelchair out. Pretty disappointed.

This Costco constantly puts in effort to improve. They have completed a large part of a major renovation, so parking is bad depending on when you go, but I always like to walk from near the gas station anyway since trying to get out of the central parking lot can be a total bear. I've seen the most improvement in how they handle the entrance to the gas station. People can be crazy trying to get in, but the better setup lends itself to easier servicing, which I gratefully notice as someone who gasses up almost once a week! I'm looking forward to enjoying the new store when it's done in 2024, I believe.

Who doesn‚Äôt love Costco????
First thing I noticed walking in was it was clean.
Merchandise was presented well and the place had a good feel. They were busy at the time of our visit, but everything was moving smoothly and people were able to move around freely.
I was interested in seeing what this location in the desert southwest had to offer that my local store didn‚Äôt.
We found a few differences, but for the most part very similar to our store back home.
We met a very friendly employee up at their self checkout area. He had a great attitude and was fun to converse with. He really seemed to enjoy his job and it showed with his attitude.
Great job once again Costco!!!!

Dan P. Is Amazing! Had left my phone in my cart. Had gotten home and had a panic attack! My phone is my life! Everything is on it!  Luckily Dan had found it and turned it in! Literally a life saver man! Foreverly grateful for this man!üôèüôå Thank you Dan P.!

Being stopped twice to recount the items and compare with the receipt when leaving the store is not acceptable.
This is very annoying to begin with, checking our receipts waiting in line to show how many items you got and check off the receipt is what crossing a communist border looked like 50 years ago in Eastern Europe. Making me feel like a thief, me who spent probably tens of thousands of dollars at Costco is why you get one star. Costco YOU SUCK! We pay a hefty membership and you treat us like some sort of shoplifters! Shame on you! Yuck!
Meat,seafood  and almost every product is  great here. Employees  are friendly and  helpful. Store a d restrooms are always clean. I shop here weekly.

I usually don‚Äôt have problems shopping here until yesterday staff wouldn‚Äôt provide helping me in the liquor department. Most of them were on the front helping checkers or the ones in the back of the store made excuses like ‚Äú ohh I‚Äôm not familiar with the liquor,‚Äù I only need four bottles of imported wine. I was running out of time and I couldn‚Äôt find them at first because I never had them before . I searched five times till I finally found them but it could had been easier if someone was with me. I understand that it gets crazy on the weekends but staff are acting rude and silly . I had two different oder from InstaC, the same time I couldn‚Äôt find the wines, the moment of paying a Latino manager at Costco was making excuses for not helping me put times on the check stand. After I had repeated more than once which oder belong to whom, he kept saying , ‚Äúooh I not helping because I don‚Äôt want to mess up his order.‚Äù I felt it was more like u we‚Äôre been lazy. Like we say in Spanish, ‚Äú el Que no ayuda estorba.‚Äù

This is my first time shopping at this Costco location. It is a much larger store than the one I have been to off Cabot street. This one also has a gas station and parking lot is more convenient. Found what I needed as I was looking for a particular brand of a vitamin they normally have at the other store but were out. Also shopping for humidifier which they had here. They also have a large plant selection, live palm trees, etc.

The store itself is fine, but the patrons are a bit of a headache. Getting in and out the parking lot is one of my least favorite things to do. Otherwise, it's just like any other Costco in the area. I recommend coming here at least once per month to see their seasonal items. Their selection of things is constantly changing, so you'll see different things from one month to the next.

TERRIBLE service in the food court! I ordered a pizza in the store and went to pick it up. They said the wait time was 30 minutes to an hour. I understood that they had high demand so I just asked for a refund because I couldn‚Äôt wait for the pizza. The male manger at the food court was SOO rude when I asked for a refund. He said that he can‚Äôt do that, and when I asked for his name he wouldn‚Äôt give it and started hiding his name badge under his shirt. I asked him to show it, but then he covered it totally. As a Costco member I know this goes against their policy. This manger should be fired immediately!

Always great except the long lines for everything...busy for sure.  Parking is easy and lot is large.  Layout inside is similar to many Costco's.  Gas is In a separate area across parking lot so seems easy to get fuel.  Please like this post and follow me if you find helpful.

Everyone knows that weekends are horrible to shop at Costco.   From the hoarders at the food stations looking for meal replacements when it's just a sample, to the people not getting out of your way, yes weekends are horrible!  I came in preparing for this and managed to navigate through it just fine.  When it came time to check out, I had a nasty blond cashier woman who loved to inconvenience me.  I had my barcodes up in the cart ready to scan and all of a sudden blond cashier woman said " we need to have your light items placed on the belt".  Really lady?  I have like 12 things easily accessible to scan and leave in the cart so it's faster on your end.  So I took all of my things out just to piss them off.  Then she was like "did you find everything ok?".  My answer was "why wouldn't I?".  If the workers are going to inconvenience their customers even more than they are already battling weekend traffic in the store, I'm going to have attitude.  I'll try to avoid this Costco because the other ones could care less about how things are scanned as long as the customer pays.

Who dosnt like Costco.  I tend to go in with a list and come out with a lot of extra stuff.  How does that happen?  Haha.  Seriously everything seem really fresh.  But don‚Äôt go on the weekends if you don‚Äôt have too. Super crowded. Best is weekday afternoons and evenings.  But for staples like cleaning supplies and paper goods and household items.  The bulk size items are the best.  Caution with the food item, if you have a small family, the portions are too big and tend to spoil before we can finish them.  In our last visit, we were surprise what a good deal the garden supplies were, especially the potting soil was ‚Äúdirt‚Äù cheap.  Pun intended

When it comes to Costcos , this one is definitely not my favorite. It‚Äôs oddly laid out. Some crates were under the wrong labels. And not many people knew about the merchandise that was sold there. I had to asked three people about the location of a typical beverage that Costco usually has. None could answer me, nor were willing to help me find it. Not to mention the look I was given when I dare ask a question..
On the upside, the cashiers were friendly .
Very slow food court, waited 20 mins for 7 orders to come out. Manager saw the long line and came over to try to sell gold bars to everyone waiting for their hot dogs. Weird.

This is still a very good location. At least on my part, we have not really have a bad experience here. We do not come every week, but maybe once every 3-4 months just to buy things like TP, napkins, water, wipes, vitamin C, Combat protein, and sometimes they have some good quality cargo pants (Sometimes.)

They do have a car service area too, but it looks really busy always, the same as their gas station, always full, but it is cheaper.

2023 Update: being a level 7 local guide, this location still doesn't disappoint! There was a lovely lady with a cowboy hat; her name was Connie, and she went above and beyond to help me, even at checkout.
This is a great, small location! The parking isn't bad (unless there is a rush), the employees are very helpful, there are lots of items on sale, and the food court is inside! 5-star recommendation... worth spending a couple hundred bucks every month to get all my essentials for a cheap price!

People are amazing. Store is clean. Don't like the constant product reorganization,  very difficult for my elderly father. Product quality seems diminished past several years. Not an expert but am a fan of scotch.  DO NOT buy the Kirkland 17 year Speyside. It is NOT smooth and tasteful.  Tastes like a bottling mistake.  Frustrating I am unable to return such a poor product.
They don't have everything like the Temecula warehouse, but it also doesn't have the crowd that Temecula has. Love Costco! P.s. These pickles are a must try!!!

First experience ordering pizza here. Hope this helps others but I Called 5:15pm for 2 pepperoni pizzas. They said it would be ready in 15-20 minutes. I get there in 20 minutes. I pay and I‚Äôm placed in line to wait 30 minutes for pizza. I ask them why am I waiting for pizza when I pre ordered from home. They said that‚Äôs how it is there. I Can tell they were stressed and didn‚Äôt push it there. Figure I‚Äôd do it here of course. Did I get lied to? Or is there no point to ordering ahead of time. Genuine question please help

I‚Äôve gotten terrible service at this location before, but this time just about did it.  Visit 3/30/ 2024 6pm, waited in line for self check out for a long time, when it was finally my turn, as I was approaching the register the girl yelled at me that I was not in line. Apparently two lines form without the girls noticing (I wasn‚Äôt the only one in line )One girl was unbelievably rude, while the other was just staring at me. I went anyways, because I waited in line. It‚Äôs not my fault they didn‚Äôt do their job and let me know that I was in the wrong line. Both girls had so much attitude. I work customer service, and this is not the way you serve people. Im grown adult and don't appreciate being yelled at, stared at and treated this way. There was a much better way of resolving the issue. Completely unacceptable. Costco you got a step up your customer service culture. Because this isn‚Äôt the first time I experience rude workers here. Do better.

Great people always packed pretty much on the weekends more. Food eatery is a bit over packed with not allot of seating during those busy times. But very reasonable for a quick bite. Need to find everything pretty much on your own. Maybe a info desk might help but not electric area. We go there at least once a week. Close to a 5 star.

Like all Costco Wholesale stores this is packed most especially on a weekend. The best days to come in is in the morning or early afternoon in the middle of the week. You have to be a Costco Member to take advantage of the monthly deals. Discounts are great for people on a strick budget. One good thing about being a member is the cash back on all your purchases that normally can be used for renewing your yearly membership. This store has a gas station. It has a food court to where you can always purchase the cheapest Beef Hotdog that comes with a refillable drink. Other items are also available such as a large pizza,  chicken bake, and soft ice cream served on a huge cup. The tire center is always busy as they have a lot of great offers for their tires. Also available is an air filling station on the side of the tire center. The air they use is nitrogen so it meets the standards of saving gas when used on your tires. Next to the store is a walk to the Lakewood Mall if you want to swing by and shop for Mall Items

Our favorite Costco location of all the ones we've visited, including the ones we visited cross country and in M√©xico. It has an amazing and loyal team, with members that continue to be the friendly faces we see every visit. Everything is always in stock, with the exception of literally twice in about 10 years. And both times they looked it up and were able reserve and ship it for me. They educate and honor warranties on items their consumers purchase from their location. It had a great tire center, electronics department, appliances, phones, jewelry, skincare, pharmacy, and honestly pretty much every department without exaggeration. They are busy and still have time help you find what you need. Their cashier's are speedy and friendly as can be honestly. When the Costco looks mayhem, the cashier's got it down along with the rest of the team. They have an excellent food court and gas station. They even have complimentary air pumps for members. We can't forget the samples of course, they are always good and the team are also like family. We always look forward to our weekly visits üòä
Very bad customer service and employees staff ,The place is not clean, it is not organized, and it lacks a lot of order.

Tried to place a pizza order over the phone and the lady who answered the phone told me ‚ÄúI only take phone orders for 6 or more pizzas. Please come in and place your order‚Äù

I ordered at the kiosk and got in a line just to be directed to another line for pizza pick up. Not sure why they advertise to call and place a pizza order if you have to order a certain amount and make their customers wait even longer.

I don't even know where to begin with this place.

Everytime I walk in here one thing, I always end up leaving with the whole basket full. The relationship I have with this store is bittersweet, but to be fair I've never had any complaints.

Actually, there is one complaint they are getting tight on those samples. That used to be part of the experience and now they only got three stations. I know all of you guys reading this can relate.

This is a really busy Costco, and the parking lot is full of a few angry drivers due to the limited access in and out - the food court is right in front of the cashiers and has limited space avail and normally has really long confusing lines to stand in. They have propane and an incredible price compared to all other places. The car wash is very reasonable but sometimes hectic to sit in traffic for along with the long wait times at the fuel pumps. ‚õΩÔ∏è I really like the optical Dept. Great lens selection and great prices.

Why do they run out of stuff, and they are not stocked up all the time everywhere with the most popular products. How is that for a good customer service policy? And I leave aside the fact that some products are not even carried in certain stores because it come down to demographics. Marketing for narrow segments of population is non-existent

Always fun to see what's new at Costco. Having a big family it's best to buy in bulk, and costco meets my family's needs hands down. Also nice all the programs they have for their members. Plus don't forget the eye glasses, pharmacy, ear center, tire center, and the awesome food court

I‚Äôm not one to get on and do a review. However, I‚Äôve got to say since coming back to the antelope valley to assist my elderly parents and my mom needs a scooter, it‚Äôs been challenging most places. I would think that Costco would be better in this department.  One employees reasoning was that people steal them. Fair enough with today‚Äôs technology there‚Äôs gotta be a somewhat simple way to prevent that for example‚Ä¶ At Winco when you borrow a scooter, you give them your keys then when you return the scooter, you get your keys back, there‚Äôs multiple ways in regard to the theft of course maybe they give yousome random key but there‚Äôs got to be something. And on a lighter note and more importantly, I cannot emphasize enough how kind and helpful the door greeter was throughout this 20+ minute waiting. I believe his name was Jay Jason he‚Äôs awesome and he‚Äôs a keeper.

I usually don‚Äôt like to give bad reviews on people working in retail because I know how hard it can be sometimes but ‚Ä¶ lately i‚Äôve been experiencing some very rude females working at Costco and I‚Äôm extremely polite, friendly and nice so it‚Äôs unfair to me when I get treated like i‚Äôm bothering an employee thats supposed to be willing to help customers out but‚Ä¶ I just left the costco in Lancaster on Ave L store # 762  I go to self check out now because I had a bad experience with a cashier working there very nasty altitude, gave me and my family such a hard time so we go to self checkout that way we don‚Äôt have to deal with unpleasant angry cashiers anyway I came for pull-ups and wipes for my babies thats what I usually shop for, as I‚Äôm waiting for a register to free up the employee calls for next person for the open register so I walk to it and scan my card now they dnt have hand held guns for us customers to scan our items so I politely say hi to the young lady ‚ÄúPROSHA‚Äù working self checkout and ask her can she please scan my 2 items I had which was wipes and pull-ups and she frown her face up and looks at me like I could of picked them up and scanned them but I never had to do that because the employees working there have always did it for me but she (Porsha) had an attitude even after she scanned my 2 items I told her thank you and she barley responded to me and was like Mmmhmm. Drove over to this Costco because my local Costco didn‚Äôt have and also ran out of items I needed. I have to say all Costco are awesome, consistent and never boring. This was the first time seeing and experiencing membership card scanning when entering.

Here's a revised version of your statement:

Recently, me and my wife had the pleasure of meeting Ashley at the cash register, and her exceptional courtesy and mannerisms truly impressed us. Her warm smile, friendly demeanor, and efficient service made our shopping experience even more enjoyable. Please pass along my compliments to Ashley for her outstanding customer service skills!
Sometimes I‚Äôll come here because it can be less crowded than the Bay Area stores. Otherwise it‚Äôs your typical Costco with a gas station.
Best Costco in the area. They always carry items other warehouses don‚Äôt have. We got the whole earth sweeter that we couldn‚Äôt find at nearby warehouses.

Sam's Club has better customer service, pricing, and lots of variety of items to shop. I have become member of the Sam's Club and don't mind driving to Concord. By the way, Costco has raised the price on lots of items and made it smaller compared to the Sam's Club. Sam's Club has not raised the membership cost.

This Costco location is something. Employees make their own decision to close the lane while you are waiting for your turn or even ban you. I had one associate at the return counter who appears no longer there. He banned me due to I complained to the customer who got in front of me while I was waiting. He thought I was being unreasonable. The manager said they reviewed the video and made it clear that I was not at fault and removed the ban.

Craig is the one of associates and his helper closed the lane when I was next in the line. It is not that I just got in the line, I was there already there waiting for my turn. All sudden they decided to close the lane and then I had to go to different lane where 3 people were already in the line with full carts.

Love coming to this Costco. It's typically not too busy here. Which is why we love it so much. Easy to shop and they always have what we need.
Helpful at the check outs whether you're doing self check out or are waiting in line. Everyone is quick but friendly. Very efficient.

Food court area is clean and easy to maneuver around even with shopping carts. Again never very busy during the week. Weekends, plenty busy.
Food is delicious! Quick service.

Very ckean and well stocked. Sraff is friendly and helpful. This store does not rrally change put items so you are able to buy your favprites without worrying about it being out of stockton. The food court is fast and alwats ready to take your order.
Went to Costco (Lodi) Optical for. Contacts. Got an appointment quicker than most places. Did not try to upsell exam add-ons or contact lenses. I would recommend.

We finally got a membership here. The membership lady was very helpful at explaining different tiers avail.
Only complaint is there is no set area for certain types of items. Other than you can see where the grocery section is. I get that their inventory changes frequently, but it'd be nice if they could at least have generalized groupings located in certain areas.

Went to lodi Costco today there was a issue about my membership, it got kinda heated with neomi in membership department she wasn't very helpful at all, she sent me to her manager Kurt.. he was ABSOLUTELY  above and beyond AMAZING !!! I was ready to cancel my long term membership and I spend thousands there a year! Being a business owner that definitely needs costco.. but was ok with other options after today, until kurt thank you so much for being kind today !
