You rock kurt!!! As for neomi you should take notes!! Since your unkind and have a bad attitude you ma'am should not be working with the public!!

The 7th review.

Costco on Sierra College Blvd consistently offers an exceptional shopping experience that deserves every bit of a five-star rating! From the moment you walk in, the staff members are incredibly welcoming and helpful, ready to assist with any inquiries. The store is well-organized, making it easy to find what you need among the wide variety of products, from groceries to electronics. The cleanliness of both the store and the restrooms is always up to high standards.

One of the highlights is their bakery and food court. The quality and taste of their baked goods and meals are fantastic‚Äîdon't miss the pizza or the hot dogs! Plus, the prices are unbeatable, especially when buying in bulk, which is perfect for families.

Additionally, Costco's commitment to customer satisfaction is evident in their return policy, which is straightforward and customer-friendly. This location also manages to handle crowds efficiently, minimizing checkout times compared to other stores.

In summary, shopping at Costco on Sierra College Blvd is a pleasant and cost-effective experience that I highly recommend to anyone looking to get the most out of their budget without compromising on quality.
Proud to be the 2nd person to review this location! Damn you, Preston H!! Jk. Love Costco and the $10 Pizza.. Don‚Äôt ever change that!
They have everything at reasonable prices. And there meat dept is very good.
5 star cause it‚Äôs next to Sierra college, saving so much and so convenient
Will not have a gas station.
Good, clean, big Costco. Be warned tho, it gets super crowded and crazy during weekends. Legit had to fight getting a sample of garlic bread üòÇüò≠

Lots of Door buster deals.

YOU got towels 4 bathroom
And plenty of seasonal items 4 spring and summer..

Don't forget mosquito spray

Xcellent place 2 load up on food 4 camping üèï trip.or beach

What an awesome Costco ‚Äî easy to get around, plenty of parking even on a crowded day, and the kindest of staff members. Lizelle and Ron, for the win! Filled out the cake order form, dropped it in the box and showed up four days later to pick up my awesome cake. I will always choose this location for my Costco shopping needs.

I love this location. Staff has always been very helpful when I needed them. Some have come out of their way to help me. I have never encountered a rude employee till I think it was monday or Tuesday of this week. The cashier was super rude. She seemed like she didn't wanna be there or was in a hurry to leave because she kept looking at her watch. There was a lady in front of us and she was trying to pay with cardbut I don't know if she wasn't able to or not but the cashier didn't help her in any way. She didn't tell her if the card passed or not. The lady asked her and all the cashier told her was "well look!" and pointed at the CC machine. When it was time for us to pay, she was very rude. She kept pushing the items away from her very hard. She almost broke one of my eggs and threw one of the windshield wipers hard to the end of the table. People like that shouldn't work at the register. Her name is ELSA... SUPER RUDE.

As all customers know who have shopped at Costco, it has busy times and it has terribly busy times.  I happened to visit this particular Costco store (for the first time) at a terribly busy time.
Parking was a nightmare (which is normally smooth at other stores, depending on the layout of rows and lanes to have the traffic of finding a parking space a smooth endeavor, you definitely need to be  patience).   However, inside the crowded store, the rows and stocked shelves were neat and tidy.
I found everything that I came looking for.
And I have to remark, the staff were plentiful.  No matter who I dealt with when entering, when leaving, or when asking questions, when looking for certain aisles for particular items, helping me with a price check or assistance on a returned item, ALL staff were kind, patient, knowledgeable, helpful, and downright friendly, even with all the added stress of a huge crowd of customers!   GREAT customer service!

It's always a good place to shop if you're shopping for more then a weeks worth of food. The workers are always there if you need help or haze a question. Never have I had any problems there. I highly recommend it.
Costco Is Costco.   It's always a great place. Busy but quick checkouts and fast food service here !   I've been to a few where a pizza might be an hr wait ...it can get bad.  Not here though.
Bought outdoor landscape lights.  Good looking and great price.  Great price on drinking water also

It's pretty much an amazing place where you can buy most items in bulk form. Same thing with some of the chips too. I recommend it if you know you need a lot of a specific item, or just wanna go there for the food court. Best place to get some good food!

I would like to share my experience with the people who helped me at the Manteca Costco.
They went above and beyond to help us out.
We had a terrible experience while driving south on the Freeway the sunroof of our car suddenly exploded and showered us with glass! Fortunately my adult son, who was driving, kept his cool and calmly took the nearest exit which happened to be near the Costco.
After parking, I asked the staff in the tire shop to help us- they advised us to go Mr Car Wash and vacuum the glass- the awesome free vacuum was amazingly efficient.
We went back to Costco to wait for AAA to tow us. It began to rain and we had no roof!
We again asked for help and the tire shop moved our car inside for shelter.
I went inside Costco, we are members, we looked for tarps but the only ones for sale are heavy duty stiff plastic ones that would ruin the car paintwork.
Then I noticed that the mattresses have heavy duty giant plastic bags. But they are not for sale. I spoke to a couple of staff members and they kindly gave me a bag.
Their kindness allowed me to cover the roof of my car- by tucking the bag into the doors and the corners under the edge of the hood next to the windshield.
The tow truck arrived soon after. We reached our home safely and despite the pouring rain the whole way home, our car interior stayed dry.
Thank you so much for your kindness Costco Staff Manteca.

That serving didn‚Äôt match with how they advertise their food. I have often seen Costco Linda food isn‚Äôt served properly compare to other Costco in Sacramento and Roseville. I love Costco but Linda Costco food service is disappointing and this is not the first incident.
The place is huge and has everything I imagined and more. Prices are very reasonable. Only takes a couple visits to make up the membership.

This Costco is so clean,and it is quick and easy to get In and get out if you don't have time to browse. When I hit off work I pop in, including parking and loading my car I think 15 to 20 minutes is about what it takes to grab what I need and a few thing I just want!

Nice store clean with big parking lot easy enter easy exit.
gas station available no waiting for fueling up.
location is not bad but in general, the area looks old and needs some organization, especially the main street needs restoration.

Costco‚Äôs membership rules are enforced strictly to where family members of the home may not enter Costco, only 2 people per $60.00/annual basic membership. It should be clearly stated prior to purchasing a membership. I have my membership and use it once in a while however, I prefer Walmart because of their delivery service, discounted fuel pricing as well as customer service. In comparison to cost savings I‚Äôve actually saved more through Walmart on groceries. However, Costco diapers are the best product! But the rules and cost of a basic membership, along with rising grocery prices will keep my young family utilizing it very minimal to next year no more. Hopefully, family households members are all considered members in the future and specific to the Linda location I hope their training on enforcement of membership rules are also up to par on informing value customers on the rules/restrictions of the memberships in the future.

Unfortunately I can‚Äôt say that I‚Äôve had more positive than negative experiences, at this location. Always packed, staff is always passive aggressive. Very messy. I see more staff watching members shop than check members out at the registers, which only a few registers are open ALWAYS. Overall I prefer to TRAVEL to the Turlock or Clovis locations. I don‚Äôt personally recommend this location. We have even tried to phase out anything we need from Costco, We happily have joined Sam‚Äôs Club and again would rather travel than face the onslaught of this Costco.
I love that everything changes as the seasons do.

I love Costco but they don‚Äôt always carry the same food products that I usually buy. They sell out really quick. Their love their clothes and seasonal items. You could always find a great buy! Too bad they don‚Äôt always have the food samples. You could try new things like it and buy it plus my kids love them.

Nice location like many others. Noticeably less crowded on a Friday morning/noonish time.

Tried the new big chocolate chip cookie and it's pretty high on my list of cookies now. Worth the price for sure and can't beat the hot dog+drink combo for $1.50
Nice Costco. Opened at 9 instead of 10 so worked out nicely. Got gas here and a few items for our traveling. Fast checkout and good deals.

Costco is absolutely worth the price of membership.  I know we save enough to pay for it just with the savings on butter.  This particular store does not carry everything that can be found at some other locations, but it is still a good basic Costco store.  Employees are helpful and generally have a great attitude.  I took a photo of the employee lockers, because the uniformity of the lockers reminded me of the common commitment of staff, but the differing locks reminded me that they are all individuals, each contributing in their own way.
I tried deleting the stupid extra photo, but it won‚Äôt go away.
This is definitely one of the busier stores and the line to get out can be a hassle. But they do have a nicely organized store and plenty of items stocked.

What can I say about Costco that hasn't been said.  You either love it or hate to love it.   Angelica was a pure delight went ot comes to being approachable and was more then willing to help me find the cookies I was looking for.  Jose is one gell of a salesman.  The man sold me a Vitamix along with two attachments.   I was only their for some cookies LOL while I cry at the same time.  Thanks you all for your hospitality.  I'll be back like always !!
Costco is holding an Asian ‚Äúfestival‚Äù before the Lunar New Year.  But these items are already on sale, a week before it.

I usually don‚Äôt do this, but recently Costco been having some terrible slices of pizzas and it‚Äôs been going on for quite some time now. For a little bit I switched over to Sam‚Äôs Club because their pizza was way better. Just recently today I had the best slice of pizza ever had since being a Costco member! I have no idea what happened but keep up the good work. I love you Costco.

I like to get my rotisserie whole chicken at this location
It is very clean how they handle and cook them. Whenever I need to improvise to make quick meals this is one of my go-to. The size is good and the flavor is neutral not too much seasoning which is good so you can add your flavoring to it.

The price is $4.99 each.
Heck of a deal!

I love Costco, the products, most of the employees. However was judged based on appearance and asked to see of our cards and id's while waiting in self checkout. I understand enforcing a policy However when looked at up and down while I said we both have our own cards, I was put off as this is not how I've been treated at other locations. So tonight we drove an extra 10 minutes to visit a different costco. It's not what you say it's how it is said.

What do you say about Costco? It's the same wherever you go. I was borne and raised here in CA and it's the most consistant store in every one. ... I do think they need to Highlight the Best Deals better though. We need to see more seasonal items featured too.

Who doesn't love Costco. Superior quality products, and you get more for less money. Plus, all the additional benefits like the optometrist, travel, and fuel station. Very exited for the Riverbank location. If you don't have a membership, get one.

I love that they open @ 9 am now ü§ó. Convenient location but getting into parking lot & having to by pass gas station area to get to entrance of warehouse is not. Always busy unless you go the last hour before closingüòè

OK, the only reason I am giving Costco five stars is their gas station is the lowest price for premium around of course you need to be a member, but I feel it‚Äôs well worth the price for a membership. The lines may be long at times, but you need to arrive early in the morning around five thirty in the morning when they open to around 10 a.m. That‚Äôs the best time if you want to avoid the crowd. It seems with the economy and signs of the times with world conflict gas prices are only going to go up.  Costco Gas also has handicapped services, just honk your horn and make sure your handicapped card is displayed and visible in your rearview mirror.

We have been shopping at this Costco for a long time now.  Staff is typically friendly and helpful and the store is always fully stocked.  However, there are some major concerns about the freshness and quality of their food.

My husband came home from Costco yesterday and there were two major issues.  The first is that he brought home the famous rotisserie chicken and it was RAW on the inside - huge issue.  The second is that he bought a two pack of Dave's bread and it was long expired - 12/8/23 to be exact.  So the bread is almost one month past expiration.

The last item that was of concern was my carton of brown eggs.  There was no date on the carton, so I decided to check if the eggs were good.  I placed an egg in a full glass of water and it began to float - which means the eggs are old.  Because of these issues, mostly because of a raw rotisserie chicken, I'm thinking of switching to Sam's.

When you come here...... bring your patience hat......and around lunchtime it is packed. The prices are expensive, I don't know what to say. Everything is so darn expensive. Is there such a thing as bargain shopping now?  The store is always clean and well stocked. And check out is always friendly and a breeze.

Costco is always hit or miss with items each individual (or couple) may prefer to purchase in bulk. They have been fairly stocked with the items we have been looking for lately. We must stop shopping there on Sundays though because the isles are large but packed with many consumers (customers). They have made vast improvements with the check out lines which WAS the really dreaded part.

Management lacks customer service skills. Came here the other day to do my shopping and my mom who is the cardholder decided to stay in the car while I grab what was needed. Upon checkout, the person checking us out asks if my mom was present and I said she's in the car, she'll be right in. She calls over her supervisor who said I cannot get the groceries because my mom wasn't there when she initially scanned the card. They did not let me purchase the items and had another employee come and collect the items which sucked for them because it was a lot of items. The man was very sassy and had an attitude. I completely understand store policies and procedures but customer service goes a long way. Luckily I went to Sam's club where we also have a membership and they saved the day. Plus the Scan and Go App is a life saver. Obviously we'll be going back because of the membership. I get that people have bad days but it shouldn't be taken out on a customer because they don't know how to express their emotions in a healthy manner. Side note, the cash register person was very sweet, it was just the cranky supervisor.
Went there on 05/10/2024 to upgrade my account. CS Lilia was superb, the next level of customer service. She is very nice and patient. Thank you !!!

Great, busy location, but easily able to go in and out with their self-checkout registers. You really can't go wrong going to any Costco for your bulk shopping done or even regular purchases. They have a pharmacy, optometrist, photo, bakery, meat, and tires departments.
More crowded than most other Costco, in a busy shopping center too, parking always takes at least few minutes to search.

I went for their rotisserie chicken.  Someone said 10 min. So I watched these two guys, mainly one of them. His routine from removing from oven to container was amazingly fast! Then I went to their food court. Their kiosk couldn't be simpler. Then I got in a line that had at least 12 people in front of me.  It took only a few minutes.  Can't beat that, plus food is good!

This store is clean and the employees are friendly and helpful. Parking sucks! The parking lot is BIG, the problem is people think it's okay to just sit in their cars with a blinker on, as if they are waiting on a car to pull out of a parking spot. In REALITY, THEY MAKE A MESS of traffic!!

I cannot believe I was trying to get a park. Normally I park this guy still in front of me start hitting my windows told me to move away because he needed that parking space even though I‚Äôve been waiting for that parking space I park comes and open my doors and starts, threatening me and telling me that he was gonna kill me, Costco just turned around. Did not do anything. Here‚Äôs a picture of this guy.

Costco, if you care safety of your customers, you need to stop this guy and review his membership. This was a noon time.

They made me sign an NDA, but it won‚Äôt stop me from speaking my truth. DO NOT GO TO THIS COSTCO. I am SHOCKED this location hasn‚Äôt closed down. It is a DISGRACE to this iconic franchise. I can‚Äôt get into details. Beware of the employees here. They have eyes EVERYWHERE. I did nothing wrong and they treated me like DIRT. I wish I could say more but I can‚Äôt. Watch your back when you push your cart through the aisles of this Costco. The people that cook rotisserie chickens are NOT your friend. Worst experience EVER. Don‚Äôt go here. Trust me. I fear I‚Äôve said too much.

Thank the universe for costco. This is a great costco. They almost always have exactly what you need. Always great sales going on. Make sure if you see something new that you like to grab a few because they might be gone for a while.

Costco Tire Center on Morena Blvd. has the worst Customer Service.  This is the second time I have had a bad experience with them.  I would not have gone into this one, but the sidewalls on all 4 of my tires were failing, and I had to get them replaced same day.  One tire had already gone completely flat as the entire side wall had failed (first picture). BF Goodrich has had problems with sidewall failures, and will reimburse customers for the remaining tread toward the purchase of new tires.  Costco also has a similar policy, and I had purchased these tires 3 years ago from Costco.
I told the employees and managers that all I wanted was the warranty benefits of credit toward the unused tread for the purchase of a new set of tires, since I still had about 10,000 miles left on the tread.
The employees and "managers" there claimed these off-road tires will fail if I take my truck offroading (which I haven't) and if Armor All "protectant" is placed on them.  Funny I didn't see that on any of the warranty information with Costco or BF Goodrich.  The "manager" said the "best" he could do is give me $30 off a new set off tires, but would not honor either warranty.
We have been going to Costco for tires for many years, but this is the final straw.  When they crushed the lug nuts on my truck and made me buy new ones, (which are a custom order from Toyota), I was hesitant to come back here.  But after making us stand in the rain while they sat inside trying to decide how to get out of their warranty, I am done.
I took my truck to Discount tire on Garnet.  BF Goodrich made good on the warranty, and I saved another $90/tire on the same exact tire Costco was going to sell me.  Discount Tire has a new customer.

we were verbally assaulted by a Cashier by name of Carlos today..due to the color of our skin, he was rude, aggressive, thuggish,,he refused to simply provide a receipt/as i asked very kindly for the receipt , he replied with ‚Äúyou can pull the receipt yourself off the printer‚Äù

How can this store allow the cashiers to be so entitled to exhibit rudeness!

As this cashier behavior is wrong and violates  operating protocols, i stood up to this thug and said ‚Äúno, your wrong , providing a receipt from the printer is your assigned job not mine, as i‚Äôve had discussions with your senior leadership about this‚Äù

Carlos then replied with a thug tone ‚Äúyour wrong‚Äù then finally provided the receipt.

The previous visit a cashier by name of Gina assaulted my brother and ripped a cell phone off the lanyard of a 66 year old man, the management observed it and never made a supervisory action.

I‚Äôm fascinated this store is hiring thugs , while the cashier supervisors have zero knowledge about holding cashiers accountable to a minimum standard of behaviors.

If this verbal abuse continues, it will be a costly legal action to defend for costco and will adversely hit their stock price/because these cashier assaults and things actions continue to be repeated , without any supervisory actions of accountability.

The store here is always nice and organized. Usually come here for gas, and since it gets pretty packed with long lines, I always go early morning during the week to fill up. I never wait more than 10-15 min in line but once I made the mistake of going a bit later afternoon and waited around 45-1 hr wait. Never again! Their gas prices are great that‚Äôs why I continue to come here whenever possible.

Great Costco! Stocked and very friendly staff. Area is clean lots of parking and very helpful people. Gas station is big and easy to drive thru. Food court sells out of some items however the pizza and hotdogs are always a kid favorite!

They have unethically and immorally and illegally erected barriers in the parking lot that were not on the original design review for the property. There are too many cars and these barriers take away dozens of parking spots. This has created a public safety hazzard and puts shoppers lives in danger in the event of an emergency.  People illegally park in fire lane and employees can see them but do not call police. No way for emergency vehicles to get in or shoppers to get out.
Love Costco hot dogs! Don't steam buns. Thanks

I am reporting this today 01/23/2024 around 7pm I am a member In I ask the manager in she is white lady in I am Hispanic lady in I ask her if she can let me pay my egss in milk because I dont know when My card is got expire even I am still a member she told me
she can not help me then I went with another employee her name is Brenda she is very rude in not able to help me she told me is like one month got expire my membership I told her in she can give me a pass into I renew soon because I did not bring alot money to pay the full of my membership in with a bad ugly face look at me no you can not I feel race here in plus is not even the year is expire my membership I am reporting this to the supervisor today very ugly in the manager is a white lady all race with me because I am hispanic I ask her please let me pay my milk in my eggs in with her bad attitude she say no!!!!

How often do you go to Costco? We go about 1x a week.

A week would not be complete without a costco run just because.

Seriously, we get our food here because 4.99 for a humongous chicken that is just cooked to perfection I tell you.

This Costco has some cool things you wont' find anywhere else.  I bummed out that they don't have gas here.  My rating for this Costco is compared to other Costco's.

PRO:
- Cool Asian selection you won't find anywhere else
- Limited seasonal items like Ice Wine from Canada
- Can tend to have bougie $$$$ items
- Extensive seafood, more than regular Costco's
- Excellent food selections if you don't want to cook
- Occasionally Wagu beef here!

CON:
- No gas
- Located in a super busy mall (Ross is here)
- Parking is challenging

SUMMARY:
Costco is always worth a trip.  My rating for this Costco is compared to other Costco's.  This one is cool cause it has more expensive items.

The employee at the front entrance is obviously in a miserable mood . She tried to violate my rights to have my service animal. She then called the manager who did not know current federal law. I am a travel nurse who has gone across the country many times and I have never had this problem at Costco.

Close to 101,  fast checkout lines, friendly staff, tire center on location, lot of parking spaces, McDonalds, Crispy Cremes nearby, No Costco Gas, good selection of gifts based on the time of year, decent jewelry selection

It's always a zoo in there. One checker closed his line right as I was standing there and said he was closed even though i was next and last and the guy in front didn't have much and i only had two items. I thought that was kinda rude. Also I left my basket for a few minutes to use the bathroom. I parked it near some closed checkout lines. I came back out to discover employees already took my stuff and got rid of my basket. I was disappointed but not terribly upset. The employee retrieved my stuff and got me another basket. Most prices are favorable however and most of the employees are more often nice and helpful than not so it kinda makes up for the few sour ones.
I also bought a hotdog and soda on my card on their automatic charging deals but it charged me for two orders which I didn't discover till I got to the front of the line and was being served two orders. It was a little late to complain at that point so I just dealt with it.
One manager i talked to for something different. He was incredibly nice and detailed in his answers about my questions. üëç

This place is amazing!! By far the best Costco Wholesale in the area. Always organized, neat and clean.
Definitely come with a list because you will leave with 5+ more items than you wanted to. Toy store for adults. Always packed due to it being an amazing and perfectly located Costco.

Trucker 215 fry exit Clinton Keith rd then left on (bronco court) warm spring Pkwy go straight next to  gas station  dead end make left  on costco dryway see the dock its good parking and nice staff fast service.

Who doesn‚Äôt love Costco?! Great deals, lines aren‚Äôt too long at this location but ordering from the food court could use some improvement. They need a loud speaker so people waiting for pizza 20-40 minutes don‚Äôt have to all crowd around the window waiting to hear their number be called. Food court is always over crowded.

Beautiful store, good atmosphere and friendly staff, I like the layout of this store over the other Costco's I've been to. The design for the gas pumps makes so much more sense than the other Costco's. It also makes a huge difference when you are shopping in your own home town Costco vs visiting other cities being that many of the staff members are your neighbors or locals in the neighborhood with a familiar face, attitude and demeanor. Helpful friendly and not to mention again that it's aesthetically pleasing. I can see this store coming in handy for many of my family needs + more.
Parking here is chaos. The lines are long and Costco is small. Further development with outlining shops is only making access worse. But as a local it's still better than going to Temecula.

Do better Costco.. I needed some limes and almost all of the bags were rotten.. it seems the produce isn't that fresh the last few times I have gone.. ended up going somewhere else to buy them.. very disappointed

I love my Costco never let down we went and bought 20 pizzas for a funeral service and they were done fast. It was so amazing. Thank you Costco for being so fast so efficient and always having good stuff.

I recently had the pleasure of receiving exceptional customer service from one of the staff members at Costco Alexis at front. During my visit, I encountered a situation where I needed assistance with swapping a mat. Without hesitation, the staff member went above and beyond by going behind the line to assist me promptly and efficiently. Her reliability and effectiveness were truly commendable. Her willingness to assist and her dedication to providing excellent customer service left a lasting impression on me. I highly appreciate her efforts and professionalism, making my shopping experience at Costco a positive one.

What happened to customer service? I went in early one morning with my three little kids. My 3 year old said he needed to use the restroom so I proceeded to the restroom and when we got there was a short heavy set lady working there and she told me to turn around and put my groceries back. I said my three year old has to use the restroom and I had to Littles in car seats that I can't carry and leave on the other side of the registers. She said oh well and stood there waiting for me to go back by the time I got back and unloaded my kids my 3 year old peed everywhere. I was not even attempting to take my cart in the restroom. I am so tired of the customer service here

Best local Costco I've ever lived next to. Gas lines move well, and I'm not above a quick visit to grab three to 5 items at a time. It's so easy to pop in and out. I don't treat this like Costco, I treat it like a convenience store. I hope that comes off as complimentary because in years past,going to Costco meant setting aside some time and making a day of it. Nowadays, I show up on whim.

My spouse and I are not from California so we‚Äôve been itching to see what products in a Cali Costco has. Was great to see the various Asian and other ethnic products (more than usual) in the refrigerator and shelves. For example dal, roti and jumbo-sized tortillas. The parking lot also has a lot of spaces. Also great seeing the plentiful bread section in multiple places.

Costco Wholesale is your one-stop shop for everything! Whether you are looking for groceries, household essentials, or even toys for the kids, you can find it all at Costco. They have a wide selection of products that are always changing to meet the needs of their customers. If you are looking for a great place to shop, Costco is the place to go.
The N.E. San Jose location Costco is my favorite. Plenty of parking. The staff on board are friendly and helpful. And you can‚Äôt beat the prices . The food court is a major plus when on the go!!

Bought a rotisserie chicken and sweet kale salad for lunch. The chicken tasted a little bit bland, the salad was a little dry but the sauce was good. Trying this idea for a cheap lunch. Properly won't do this regularly.

I love it here the only problem I had was that they had no loud speakers there. I was trying to let them know somebody left their keys in their car door and they couldn't make an announcement. Kinda of safety risk if you ask me. Other than that it was a good place to shop as long as there is no huge emergency you shouldn't have any problems. My favorite part is the food court It's really inexpensive food but it's really delicious. The chicken bakes are off the hook.

It's always exciting to explore a brand new Costco. This one is located right off the freeway on arena boulevard off of I-5. Always interests to see what the layout is and it's always so nice and clean. Arrived somewhat early. Wasn't too busy yet. But as the day went on it certainly got busier on a Saturday. Not as busy as some of the other older Costco's in the Sacramento area. Plenty of ample parking spots with also electric car charging spots. They have the same range of products as other Costco's. The restrooms are more accessible, which is nice. This one has a similar feel and layout to the Arden Fair Costco location. People were very nice and friendly here. It's been open for just about 2 months now.

First time shopping at this newly opened Costco and the place looks like it‚Äôs been opened for years. Dirty and disorganized. The shoppers are rude and employees are unhelpful. Food court lady is not well trained to do her job. She stood there all confused where the line next to me had served 10 peoples already and our line is a stand still üò°üò°. Basic Check out line is confusing and many workers standing there talking and laughing. Will not shop there again.

Nothing like the brand new Costco store! Amazing deals, spacious, with great selections. You're looking at a full parking lot during a regular weekday.

Tire center is also open for appointments, though with limited staffing. But overall a great experience!

Even though there is NO gas station here, this Costco still gets 5 stars. Why? Mainly because they have a huge selection of liquor haha. The newly opened Costco in Natomas is pretty crowded, but very large. They have some hard to find products here and not in other Costcos. Staff is friendly so far and it's been very fast to check out, even when it's crowded.

It is  an important  event: new Costco  was opened  in Natomas!!!  I  am driving  just  10 minutes  from my home  to  Costco! Amazing!
This is  my  favorite  store!

Great new store. Has tires, food court, optical. Newly added sushi roll station, which is actually really good. Much better than the rolls they previously carried. Super delicious hot chicken drumsticks right next to grilled chicken‚Äôs. It smelled so good. I will get it next time as I already bought steaks and ground beef. I got fresh fettuccine. And some new interesting pasta sauce, which is Parmesan and black pepper.

Usually, a crowded Costco can make my anxiety flare up, and I'm often eager to leave before even exploring the store. However, the wide walking areas, pre-packed fresh food, meal ordering options, extensive clothing selection, and the spacious food court with plenty of seating were absolutely perfect. I want to express my gratitude to Costco for consistently turning my shopping trips into enjoyable experiences. Thank you! üõíüôå

Costco's new location in Newark, California, adjacent to Newpark Mall, is a game-changer for local shoppers. Having opened just two weeks ago, it presents itself as a modern, spacious haven for anyone looking to find a wide array of products under one roof.

The store layout is designed for ease of navigation, allowing customers to effortlessly explore the vast selection of items. From electronics to groceries, clothing to home goods, the variety is impressive. During my visit, I took over 100 photos, each showcasing different products, and was continually impressed by the quality and range available.

Moreover, the staff at this new Costco are commendable for their helpfulness and knowledge. Despite the store's recent opening, the team operates with a level of efficiency and friendliness that enhances the shopping experience.

Overall, Costco's new location in Newark is more than just a store; it's a comprehensive shopping destination. Its proximity to Newpark Mall adds to its convenience, making it an ideal spot for a full day of shopping. Whether you're a long-time Costco member or new to the experience, this new store is definitely worth a visit.

Visited this Costco for our regular Costco shopping trip.  It is located at Newpark Mall, whereas, we were able to visit the mall during the same trip.  It was very busy for this Costco and I sense that the location has more area within the warehouse.  Product offerings were basically the same as the other Costco stores but the food area has more space in the front.  Getting to the store was a title hard as the road has only one lane.  There wasn‚Äôt any cell service while we were in the warehouse; therefore, my digital payment system did not work ‚Äî luckily, I keep one valid card with me at times.  I will return when at the mall but I would not make a deliberate trip to this location.

It finally opened.
It‚Äôs about 1.3x larger than Fremont Costco.
Outdoor parking is a mess.
I recommend you park at the parking garage with no traffic jam and no wait time.

But overall, it is just a regular Costco.
I would probably stay in Fremont/ SJ next time.

High quality products at great prices. Costco has earned my trust and my business. I do my main weekly grocery shopping for my family of 5 here.

Jim Senegal, you have my congratulations for building a wonderful company.

Great selection, good quality and good prices.
Now it seems like they are able to keep almost everything in stock, it seems like if you they are low on something its refilled the next day.
Now things are in stock but they now have a few checkout clerks that should not work with the public, they yell at customers, do not listen and are just plain rude.
Today all registers open and a quick checkout. Great visit.
Update: Holiday Monday, crazy busy at 2ish, got out alive.
Things back to normal, spring is coming.

I like to buy my paper products at Costco, as well as other commonly used items. I especially appreciate their sales, which usually offer great deals. On this trip I had my cart piled high with items. At checkout cashier Evelyn M. scanned the items in the cart. She then looked at what was on the belt. Took a few seconds to rearrange the items in the cart, and started scanning the rest of my items. She was done in a flash, and all my items were neatly placed in the cart. She was just doing her job. But, she was doing it quickly and efficiently.

I came today at 7pm at the store, and was super upset the way the staff talked to me and behaved. I came with the whole cart and alcohol to self check out register, and only half way done was told no alcohol alowed at self check-out. Two of the store attendees were standing at the self check-out registers and "pretending to work/help customers to process items". When I heard no alcohol allowed, I asked for the manager, and told him it would be nice to have signs at the registers, so customers see the policy right away. All the supervisor was doing is just keep repeating "alcohol is not allowed at self-check out". I told him I am not stupid and I was told that already, but it will be helpful to know that before starting scanning the items, but not half way done.
The other attendee, Bertha, was laughing and waving her hand, like I am crazy, when I was trying to explain to them that the policy should be visible. If these are new customer service standards, I don't want to come here again. Just ridiculous to see such behavior in a big corporate chain like #Costco.

I hate Costco they have shopping carts all over the place one one of the carts struck by a vehicle I brought this to the attention of the manager when I came back out after the shopping no attention was brought to removing the carts I will never shop at this Costco ever again it's disgusting that customer service does not exist I should have filed a claim for the cards scratching my vehicle shame on you Costco

The place is pretty nice, I enjoyed the food that they served. The cookies were a top tier and must be tried by consumers that go. The pizza isn't very expensive and the drinks are moderate, but they were very kind and would recommend going back. Would go again!

What an adventure! Half of the town of Norwalk was there. Black Friday on a hot Sunday. Costco has the best stuff. Always cool and interesting to see what has been newly displayed. Loved the outside dining area. Thank goodness too, sure wasn't any room inside for it.

Costco is clean and check out is easy. Only hassle is the parking. There is not enough spaces like other Costcos. You will have to circle around or follow someone who is leaving. It gets crazy on busy days like weekends.
Optometry salespeople for glasses. Come on, you gotta be faster. These people work at a snails pace .
Great food,service and price

So much to love about this Costco.  But there are things NOT to love also

PRO:
- The wine selection!  I believe it's the biggest at any Costco
- Easy off the highway
- Best tax rate in the Bay area
- Better selection (Marin county is $$)

CON:
- No gas.  No gas. NO GAS STATION
- Very busy mall
- Difficult to find parking

SUMMARY:
Much to like about this Costco.  But the lack of gas here means you either go towards SF or towards Rohnert - not ideal if you are on the go.

You can get unique selections due to the area.  The wine is the best I've seen at any Costco.  I found special ice wine from Canada, that's amazing.  The selection of the California wines here is amazing due to the proximity to Sonoma & Napa.

Customer service is exceptionally helpful. Who‚Äôd think that they could pull up a detailed receipt from 6 weeks ago? Yep. That, and when I asked if it made sense to upgrade our membership, they ran the numbers based on the past year. Marginally better to upgrade. Told me how to check back & monitor. Can‚Äôt ask for more. Also, if you buy fish (so much & $$$) and it‚Äôs stinky, they take it back. No grocery store does. Love them.

To start, we LOVE Costco. We have 4 teenage children so Costco is a staple in our lives. The low rating has to do with the quality of this Costco in particular. We moved to Marin 7 years ago from Encinitas so our benchmark is the Costco in Carlsbad, which is one of the best out there. Issue we have with this Costco is the availability of healthier choices is minimal - from Mary's crackers no longer being available, to blueberries constantly being out of stock, to the lack of availability of good eggs. This unfortunately brings my rating down to a C+/B-.

Bad customer services and bad Costco practices.  Yesterday we bought two citrus trees at $19.00 each, indicating fast sale.  At cashier, it was $26.99 each.  We caught the mistake, and it was corrected after some maneuvering.  Imagine if customer is not vigilant. Then we noticed sales tax was added on the fruit trees, which shouldn't based on our experience.  I then talked to two managers at least that are what they claimed, named Ramone and Sherrie, who said that is Costco policy of adding sales tax on fruit trees based on California law.  I showed them California Board of Equalization Regulations 1588 regarding seeds, plants and fertilizers, which clearly states no sales tax on fruit trees. Then they said Costco policy supercedes whatever.  They said if you don't like this Costco policy, then don't buy it.  These two self-claimed managers continued to escalate their hostilities.  If these are the people working for Costco, and Costco continues thinking that they are too popular and too big to fail, it will be like Sears and the likes.  I also simulated buying an apple tree from Amazon, and it showed no sales tax applied.  Imagine how many loyal customers have been ripped off by Costco.  I also remember many years back when Costco was selling discounted items but sales tax based on the original price.

After writing the above, I reviewed the receipt carefully and I see the problem as follows: when scanned at $26.99, the item is called Citrus Tree and there is no "A" after $26.99, indicating no sales tax.  When the same item was re-scanned at $19.00, another so-called manager called the item 27 GARDEN, then an "A" appears, indicating sales tax.  The problems of bad customer services are still there as follows:
1.  These two clown idiotic so-called managers, RAMONE and SHERRIE, as well as other employees kept insisting it is Costco policy to add sales tax to fruit trees.  They even called me tax cheater.
2.  Bad attitudes, such as "if you don't like this Costco policy, don't buy it", "you can always hire your attorney to challenge Costco", and on and on.
3.  I got ripped off, and probably other customers as well.
4.  This is not one Costco employee making a mistake.  This is three so-called managers together with employees ganging up to stonewall a long-time customer's legitimate concerns.  Instead of helping, they aggravate.
What can I say...the usual great Costco with a better than usual selection of fine foods and wines appropriate to its location and customers tastes and disposable income.

Give a thumbs up if you agree.

#1. You do not have to dodge all the people with empty carts. Waiting in line to get some free sample.

#2. The main aisles are two to three times wider.
#3. As a general of thumb, the people shopping at the store know what they're there to get and keep it moving.

#4. All of the staff at most Costco's are generally very friendly and knowledgeable. The business center staff seems to be a step above.

#5. There's no food court and all the riff Raff that goes along with it.

Just my opinion üòÉ

This is the store to shop if you have a  business. More variety and choices to buy. They have Starbucks coffee beans.  I went to 4 different Costco stores looking, no Starbucks. I love this store. No food court.

I love Costco, but I think I love the business center even more. It‚Äôs not a replacement for Costco and they do not stock the same items, so don‚Äôt go thinking you‚Äôll be able to get all of your usual Costco faves! I go to Costco once a week and business center about once a month. My favorite things to stock up on are paper plates, cutlery, cleaning supplies, drinks, protein shakes, frozen fruits, baking items (they have AMAZING cocoa powder), gum, and bagged snacks. They have tons of snacks there that you can‚Äôt get anywhere else. I particularly love their variety of flavored nut packs. My kids love getting things like popcorn or baked chips and I love the prices on these things. Snacks can quickly kill the budget, so I really appreciate the low per unit cost on these items. They also have tons of great kitchen supplies super cheap! Sheet pans, pots, knives, etc. Great place to outfit a kitchen on a budget.

Very clean most of employees are polite others seem to hate their miserable job no worries as a customer I learned to avoid that kind of unhappy employee. I do highly recommend thus place if you possess the ability to ignore the bad service and rude attitudes by the unhappy employees.

In the other hand I really want to give thanks to the rest of the employees which always go beyond the extra mile to assist you with any question or help you may need. So much of everything you would need or want, super great prices. Just be prepared for many lines, hard to find parking, even in the restroom. üòÑ Feels like the 405 FW shopping. üõí Overall great place to shop if you buy in bulk like i do and save money.

I was at Oxnard Costco today 04/30/24  Tuesday around 04:00 pm asking at the tire center if they can take off all the air on my 4 tires and replace them for nitrogen it only cost $15 but he wants me to go in the morning because he has 3 employees out but I work in the mornings or he tell me to make an appointment for next week and I think its ridiculous make customers waiting that long when we are all ready in the store doing some shopping  because they close at 08:30 pm that only takes about 20 minutes to do the job, and I told the employee that I was going to go better to Big Brand tire center at the other side of the free way they also do the same job

It's not worth the aggravation to endure the parking and store layout to save some money, but apparently it is for a lot of people who are less successful than I. The place is designed to tempt you to buy more than you can use and stuff you wouldn't normally get.

This is about tire center: I bough tires online for delivery into the tire center. It says tires will be delivered before May 5th. I scheduled an appointment on May 6th using their new appointment system that specifically asked for the order number. I went to the tire center as scheduled to find out that: 1. Tires did not arrive. 2. Agent was surprised that I placed an order online and did not call to confirm the order delivered. 3. Said order might get delivered tomorrow, and I should wait for a call from them, and then discuss with them a reschedule of the appointment (just imagine when the new appointment will be). So overall, not sure what the benefit of the appointment system is if it simply books an appointment AND asks for the order number if the order isn't delivered. That appointment system AND online orders need to talk to one another. I trust no one from Costco will have time to read this review or put an action plan to fix these issue for future.
Big store, a lot of options. Peking lot is usually full. Workers are kind and very helpful.

This Costco is the worst from the old warehouse manager that she probably doesn‚Äôt work there no more , I remember one day I had attitude from one of the gas attendants asking if I had a membership and I said of course I do so I complain and Liz the old store manager told me you should go to another  store and shop   So I call corporate and reported the issue cause if it was just a random customer and not someone who use to work there then Liz would of responded another way . then there was issues  to working pushing carts we never got a cart pusher after years when it broke down probably 2014-2019, management would always push us to push carts and if we didn‚Äôt work fast they would makes us feel like we were lazy . No wonders there‚Äôs guys pushing more than 10 carts, since they feel the pressure from management, then some managers have favoritism,I once got promoted to be a merchandiser in the morning and since I switch with another person who wanted to push carts I when Inside to work in the warehouse . When that person  shift was over we switch back and management  blame me since there was a bunch of carts and I lost my promotion. Then for what ever reason they would write you up .  I understand if your late 3 times you deserve a write up but these guys would write you  you up for anything even if they expected you to clean one section of the store by stocking and condensing yourself and if you didn‚Äôt finish well write up ‚Ä¶. Or If a supervisor didn‚Äôt like you write up they would find what ever reason to write you up and that would stay in your employee profile . Most of the managers like Elaine , or Felipe   Or the other second  warehouse manager some short guy would always come out with his vape pen to take a smoke on the job and walk around the lot he was just a red flags . The only good manager who would always understand his employees was Ricky ,  John  the manager   and Kenny  who used to work their , or David who use to be a supervisor  these guys were the best of this Costco warehouse .

I am disappointed at the fact that Costco has not taken any measures to ensure that their employees do not get hurt while pulling and pushing carts all day. Given that it is a huge corp. people coming in and out of Costco and needing a cart asap one may think they would at the minimum provide them with an electric cart pusher. (I just feel bad because it‚Äôs tough labor)

There is so many cheap & expensive products selling at Costco Wholesale at Pacoima. Self-checkout is easy access. I really enjoy tasting samples like as same as customer do. Easy parking lot; lots of empty space near Lowe‚Äôs. Occasionally I visit there once a while during weekends Saturday & Sunday. Not weekdays. As busy as it gets. The food court is located inside the store. Most enjoyable as well.
This is one of my favorite Costco‚Äùs - easy parking, great selection, great staff & you can buy gas :)

I came here with my mom. She forgot her membership card at home. The woman at the entrance directed us to membership services. There wasn't a problem at all getting a temporary membership. It only took about 5 minutes. But, the really nice thing is the woman at the entrance already had a cart waiting for us when we came around to enter the store. The shopping trip itself was ordinary. However, the overall experience was positive.
One of my favorite places. Customer service is awesome and they have good prices. Return policy is the best. Go there at least twice a month. Try this steak and loved it!

This is our local Costco and we love going here. It has plenty of parking for everybody, a cheap gas station, and of course the usual groceries inside the store. They have recently changed the layout of the store and it seems to work better. The staff here are friendly, and there‚Äôs always a good selection of different products and produce is available. The snack bar is also great value especially feeding hungry kids.

The Costco food is great, but our chicken had food poisoning which made me and my family throw up NON-STOP. How do we know it had food poisoning and not anything else? It was the only thing we ate throughout the whole day, and the people who threw up are the ones who ate the chicken. Family members that didn‚Äôt eat the chicken were feeling perfectly fine. Never buying costco food again.

Very clean store. Every employee looks happy and smiling. 9/10 times they have their store/food court stocked to the max. Clothing is generally folded and put out nicely. Mostly everything is easy to find and the price is clearly displayed.

The costco chicken made my friend throw up non-stop all day and that was the only thing she ate. How do i know? because she was texted me throughout the day saying she threw up. and don't get me started on the pizza I once have pizza from here and my stomach was hurting throughout the day that i could not go to school for the next few days. üò°üò° very disappointed.

I actually prefer this Costco over others because it's not as busy. Plus there is a car wash which does a good job. It's a reverse layout of the Carmel mountain Costco but it's got basically the same items. I used to frequent it more but now I'll come here if I'm in need of a car wash.
Good place for shopping , items  are cheap . Fruits and vegetables are very costly . Quality is good no doubt.  I liked very much.

Best Costco around! Lots of parking, clean, well staffed, usually not too busy, employees are helpful and friendly. Has a gas station and car wash;
worth driving a little farther to this Costco.

Nice Costco location with gas. Internal layout is a bit different from "standard", but overall everything is where it should be.  This location does good business in their tire shop, has a carwash and also sells Xmas trees during the holiday season.

1 star is for Litzye at returning department.   This person was too busy lectured me about the policy (which I already know and I already confirmed with the other customer service that they can look up) so she forgot why I was there even tho I told her couple of times but she didn't listen.  Hopefully she will get the proper training for her job and not trying to intimidate customer.

Everyone is so polite at this Costco! The food court is outside and takes cash. There is a huge gas station that's never super busy. The parking lot is large, and there is plenty of parking. I really enjoyed shopping at this Costco. Go in the morning because they get cleaned out!

3/23/24- I had a great visit. Lots of deals in time for spring. I bought meats and vegetables for grilling. Flavored waters and Pho soups. Popcorn. I enjoy shopping here for 30 days when I travel.
The customers are in a hurry. The employees do their job. They are happy to help.
Make sure you know they check your membership card. So if you don't have one don't be upset when they ask you to leave. They don't take cash so bring a debit. One lady got upset. That's all folks!
Picked up a beautiful leg of lamb boneless to bbq for Easter and some highly rated wine for a great price.
Great everything! I can grab my stuff, be quickly tended to pay and head out promptly. A model program for other businesses to follow.

The staff here are always friendly. Today, I broke an egg when checking them and made a bit of a mess and the cashier and bagger attentively noticed and offered to replace the egg. I declined (afterall, I broke it ‚Äî that‚Äôs on me), but I just appreciated how we had a real connection over the egg.

Also, this Costco has THE best sampler staffer: he‚Äôs hilarious, always friendly, and manages to make peppy rhymes for his samples. Stop in and say hi to him!

NO Membership needed for Alcohol/Hard Liqour, Wine or Beer.
Also Pharmacy , however members may get a better price.

I come here for liqour at a great price. Costco has the best prices and is hard to find anywhere else for cheaper.
Alot of liqour options is based on location and or season. Many different stores have different types or options.

Parking can be a be hard to find on weekends. I try to avoid this place on Fri, Sat, Sun.
On those days it's pretty crowed and may have a long wait at check out.

Since I always get a bottle or beer. Those items are not allowed at self checkout.

Today, it was raining heavily and I took my daughter to Costco to buy a can of children's multivitamins. It's Smarty Pants. After getting home and eating dinner, the daughter opened the lid and was surprised to find that the disposable aluminum film had cracked. Obviously someone opened it and put it on the shelf. I'm worried someone put something in there as a prank. No matter what, I don't feel safe. I wish Costco employees could spot check health products every week to prevent someone from intentionally opening them and leaving them on the shelves. Thank you for your support.

Typical Costco, it's good. ... But as they push out more manufacturers to sell their own, my membership satisfaction will drop more because the more products that I buy disappear from their shelves, the less I will feel the need to continue there.
Standard Costco. The majority of employees are very rude. They sort of remind me of DMV workers. There‚Äôs a few that shine but most of them very rude and probably shouldn‚Äôt be in customer service.

Just went to have lunch..One Hot Dog and One Hamburger with 1 Coke.. great, except that they ran out of onions. The shopping is still great for family size products, buy big to save money! No more hamburgers. Back to long lines early in the day. Cookies üç™, yummy.

I love Costco ! ....  only place I know where I can go to for one $20 item and when I check out, that one item has multiplied and the cashier is asking me for 150!!! But where else can you find such a variety of items to purchase...  or have your hearing tested.. or eyes examined while having tires replaced?? as I said..I love COSTCO (don't forget the best priced gas!!)

Not my usual store but I was nearby getting my car serviced.
Crazy busy around noon on a Monday. Parking lot and adjacent gas   station were pandemonium. Luckily,  self-checkout moved quickly.
Stock seemed limited compared to Morena & Market stores  (suburbanite tastes are different, perhaps?)
I imagine folks in the surrounding neighborhood have little choice, and  the nearest alternate store further south in Broadway is worse.
I don't plan to go to either one anytime soon.
Why is Costco so crowded all the time.   Still like this place.  The choices are so much more than my last costco.

Hot dog and soda for $1.50,who.can beat that deal? New ordering stations, order, pay, then wait for your number to be called. Staff is still robotic with little to no emotion, looks like they don't like their job, zero customer service, no changes to orders (sold as is, take it or leave it) mentality. All about volume. Great for a quick bite to eat at a reasonable price.

I‚Äôm confused because I understand helpfulness but self checkout is a good option for people who do not want to talk or deal with people, but they had a lady staffed there who didn‚Äôt even ask if I needed help she just pushed herself into my personal space and was scanning things for me. She had on a white top. Thought she was trying to be helpful at first but ended up confusing me. I didn‚Äôt have heavy items and I am a male perfectly capable of lifting up a small bag of rice but she came in and started doing it for me. She was not doing this to anyone else, which is a problem because why Me? Are you not liking my physical appearance? As a retail employee you‚Äôre not supposed to treat me differently because I look different than you. I was going to scan my items and she walks up and just starts scanning stuff and I lose track of what was scanned. This is not helpful at this point and because of her an item went unscrambled but I caught it because I made sure I read the screen and receipt to see if things were there. I‚Äôm assuming her intentions were to harass me for some reason? She didn‚Äôt even know what was scanned when I asked her. She just made a face at me like I was dumb.

Costco. Need I say more? Great gas prices and nice new location. Great staff too. I was standing by the tvs and I had 4 people come ask me if I needed help and they answered every question I had. Great place to shop. See for yourself!

I‚Äôm writing this review not for Costco of Redding itself, but for the eye examiner that works there. I came in with no knowledge of the eye, I don‚Äôt know it‚Äôs possible to damage your vision permanently by simple mishandling of contacts lenses. I wasn‚Äôt given any warnings. Not about eye infection, not about what can cause it. Nothing of the sort. When they let you trial the lenses they aren‚Äôt even concerned at the fact my eyes were bloody red and said nothing about it. Lousy, selfish people who don‚Äôt show what they practice. My vision has been clouded up and I have floaters in my left eye ever since then and this is no lie. I hope that whoever reads this please understand that you should get your contacts elsewhere or at least have the knowledge of the eye or experience with contacts to prevent such a thing from happening. I‚Äôm not dead but scarred for life. Don‚Äôt even know if a lawsuit would help in this case
Costco has everything. I know the place pretty well, I went to law school here.

Great layout. Very large selection (the most I have seen from other Costcos). The tire center is directly after checkout. Staff is extremely friendly.

(Photos taken Sunday morning at 9am)

This Costco is nice, its all brand new. Its right off 5, the traffic flows in and out in of the parking lot in multiple places. The lines inside aren't huge and they move fast. Well, the pharmacy has a long line sometimes. There is never a wait at the gas station! It's not absolutely insane and packed all the time like other Costcos. This store is spotless and well stocked. Shut up and take my money
Great for so many things, from gaz prices to great french Cheese and Wine!

Nice Costco location
They have gas too
Love it

I've been wanting a Tomahawk Steak and decided to check out Costco's meat Department, this adventure requires a Membership, however it is worth it. I'm not sure how much it is as my Mom gifted it to me.

Apon arriving the only issue was the parking, it seemed chaotic but I took a deep breath and it actually is deceiving as people are constantly pulling out, just be patient.

I had a blast looking at all the food options and was impressed at the variety of Fish and Meat on a larger scale than at local Grocery Stores.
Their they were two Tomahawk Steaks $50.
A big rib bone popping out of a Dinosaur sized Steak, not only that but big Beef Brisket and giant Pork Butt~ Great Rubs and More.
The variety and sizes are bigger than other stores.
One tip is the Pesto in a jar, it is unreal, loaded with cheese and Basil olive oil, it compliments a Sandwich or with Pasta~ it is exquisite.
The snack stand is legendary for the Pizza and roast beef sandwich as well as other great favorites.
I was excited to start the grill and get to work.
Randy Chavez

Nice Costco!  Love that they have gas here also.  My rating for this Costco is compared to other Costco's.

PRO:
- Great selection you come to expect from Costco
- Excellent food selections if you don't want to cook
- They do have gas here

CON:
- Parking is challenging

SUMMARY:
Costco is always worth a trip.  My rating for this Costco is compared to other Costco's.  I come to expect a lot from Costco so which can be exceptional.
Super clean & just a beautiful store

Super busy on a weekend, 'but to be expected.'
Everything in stock, great selection.
Checkout was very quick. Getting out the door took a little shopping cart maneuvering.
Able to fill up at the gas pump is also very convenient. A bit of a wait, but it was the weekend.

I live in Oakland and there are a few Costco's in the East Bay but I prefer to go to the Richmond one which is off the 580 or 80.

This Costco is decent sized and most of them organized pretty well. They have a big parking lot which sometimes is almost fully packed, I usually try to go at off peak times.

I don't have a gas car anymore but I used to get gas there, recommend doing early in the morning to avoid a line.

I do get prescriptions from their Pharmacy and have always had good experiences with their pharmacies, no problems getting prescriptions filled.

I also have dogs, so my wife and I like this Costco because right down the street from Point Isabel.

Convenient Costco location close to the freeway. Well stocked, clean, organized. Only tricky part is getting in to and out of the parking lot. The street that feeds into the parking lot is narrow so traffic bunches up. However there is a nice view of the water while waiting to get out of the parking lot...also a good time to enjoy the Costco hot dog and lemonade you grabbed from the food court on the way out.

A standard Costco experience with no frills. The most convenient aspects of this location is for those of dog owners as it‚Äôs right next to Point Isabel dog park - which allows you to knock off multiple items on your list such as dog walking and picking up your pets medicine at the Costco Pharmacy.

The only gripe I have about this location is that they have a separate door for merchandise returns that for some odd reason is always locked when I visit, forcing you to maneuver through the many shoppers exiting the store.

Pretty fast gas lines for the amount of volume.  The warehouse is usually pretty clean and well stocked.  This location can be EXTREMELY busy.  Choose your visit time wisely.  The pharmacy doesn't seem too busy but they are on the slow side. I was told ready in 30 minutes... it actually took 50. And there wasn't a lot of people there.
It is not opened YET!

In between the Novato & Santa Rosa Costco is Rohnert.  Rohnert park is a great shopping area and this one has gas.

PRO:
- Great selection you come to expect from Costco
- Excellent food selections if you don't want to cook
- They do have gas here
- Huge parking spots

CON:
- Parking is challenging

SUMMARY:
Costco is always worth a trip.  My rating for this Costco is compared to other Costco's.  I come to expect a lot from Costco so which can be exceptional.
A nice facility very well stocked the staff was very friendly I found what I was looking for and of course a lot more LOL
I love Costco! Great deals, great selections. Some items I can't get in my local grocery store. Rohnert Park lines weren't bad on a Saturday either. If you don't have a Costco card, get one!

When I need to come to Costco, I so much prefer this location. It's more mellow than the SR Ave one. Easier parking and less people. It's just a few miles away from the other one, and so much worth the drive for a more pleasant shopping experience. I like coming here for bulk items like paper towels to save money or for food for family parties. I will go out of my way at times to come get their bulk fruit/veggies as the quality is incredible. Same with their fresh flowers & plants!!

I went to the food court for 3 pizzas 2 chicken bakes amd a hotdog. I came all the way from windsor since the santa rosa one is being updated and 1 of the three pizzas looked like it was stepped on...the cheese and pepperoni was smeared and it sat cozy in my trunk ...I would call to complain but they NEVER answer their phone...I had to call before hand to santa rosa to find out if the food court was opened.
The facility was clean in general; too many people though, it‚Äôs kind of difficult to find the parking space. The selection of the products seemed less than other locations in different cities.

Nothing wrong with Costco! The staff are always kind, helpful, and ready to great you with a smile. The parking lot can get a little nuts but there are ways to avoid the nuttiness. The food court is the best but unfortunately is down for renovation until mid February 2024.

Very good ready to eat food! Everything they make is fresh and perfect to taste!

I recommend their rectangle tuxedo chocolate mousse cake, chocolate round cake, rotisserie chicken, and so much more I can't list it.

Well costco is king! You want to cheapest food for lunch go to there food quart. You want to buy in bulk or need to host for a party here‚Äôs your spot. You want great deals PERIOD! Here‚Äôs your spot! You can just look around to see if you want a membership too and then decide after they will let you look! Just tell them. Don‚Äôt have a member ship but thinking about it. They will let you walk around.

This Costco is set up a little different than what I have seen across the south. The eating area to sit and enjoy your food at the Costco is outside which is strange to me because all the ones I have seen they are right next to the place where you get your food. So, if you forget anything like napkins or silverware then you will have to go back in and get it. That makes it very inconvenient for those who have children or have difficulty in walking!!! It was very crowded but the lines did move quickly. Gas was cheaper too!!

The lady at the front was extremely rude. She yelled at my family and I for absolutely no reason as we were walking in. We didn‚Äôt get her name but it seems like other customers have had similar experiences at this location based on previous google reviews.

She was working the front on 5/4/24 at around 2:15pm.

IYKYK Costco has excellent prices on tires. Incredible warranties too (75K miles)
If you get your tires from Costco- they do tire repairs for FREE‚Ä¶ not much you get these days for ‚Äúfree‚Äù‚Äî you can even schedule it online for repair or buying new tires‚Ä¶ excellent job!!

Review for Costco in South SF near the airport:

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Had a fantastic shopping experience at the Costco near the airport in South SF! I was thrilled to find the alkaline water packs, grabbing three of them. With 18 bottles priced at just $11, not only was the value unbeatable, but the water tasted pure and refreshing. To top it off, their selection of organic orange juice was impressive. Fresh, flavorful, and a wide range to choose from. This Costco location truly stands out with its quality products and competitive prices. Will be returning soon for more great finds! Highly recommended.

‚ÄúI recently visited the Costco food court and unfortunately, I had a rather unpleasant experience. The cleanliness of the establishment was subpar, with dirty floors and an overall lack of tidiness. Additionally, the absence of air conditioning made the environment uncomfortably hot, and a lengthy queue added to the frustration. I hope the management takes these concerns seriously and makes the necessary improvements to create a more enjoyable and hygienic dining environment for customers.‚Äù

Not bad place to shop. Usually busy on weekends and workday evenings but not too bad. The food court line can get pretty long sometimes but overall it‚Äôs not bad of a wait.

It‚Äôs a bit small but there‚Äôs a business center nearby too.

We frequently visit the Business Costco in South San Francisco for stationery, bulk purchases, and more. I highly recommend this location, especially if you're organizing an event or conducting business-related shopping. The customer service is friendly, and it's worth noting that they are now open on Sundays as well. Great location with easy access from Hwy 101.
Nice place for restaurants owners or if you just wanna grab a bunch of stuff for party
A good place to buy meat compared to the regular Costco locations.

This Costco Business Center is way better than the Hayward location, it‚Äôs more spacious. They have a food court and the line isn‚Äôt as long as many Costcos.

Please support and follow me on IG @ssindyeats for more foodie bites and travels.
Less crowded than the non-business Costco, easy pop in and out, get all my needed with no complications. What would Americans do without Costco in their lives?

Clean and well organized but parking lot is small and very crowded. Had to circle around quite a bit to get a parking spot. They have mix variety of things including shed or treadmill! Overall good experience

I mean, it‚Äôs a Costco, what else would you expect. Samples, Wholesale, Bulk, Party Food and Chips. They also sell outdoor furniture here + toys. They have an Optometrist here and food court requires a Costco card to buy anything. It‚Äôs your average neighborhood Costco

I bought two pairs of glasses last week. I picked them up today. One pair of glasses felt big.
I was not happy, but the lady who helped me was beyond rude.
I told her more then once that they felt big.
I ended up telling her that I was not happy, but I was going to take them.
She said, okay then have a good day.

I still don't like how they feel.

Literally every time I go to checkout the machine says my membership is broken.  I wait in line for customer service and they tell me it's fine.  I ask them to reset something, give me a new card, new number; they won't.  Next time - same problem.  Customer Service acts like I'm the idiot and I'm just not scanning the membership correctly.  Even the checkout people seem broken when it comes to our membership...but it's a waste of our time, and requires a membership solution EVERY time we try to check out.  Nothing will be done every time.

Great Costco location! Gas prices are usually $0.5 cheaper than at the nearby gas stations. Also sells a ton of great things, including great sushi. It is busy almost all the time, and there is almost always a line for the gas. But it is worth the wait. It is more chill than other Costcos in San Diego.

It was Saturday. It was chaos. But that‚Äôs just a part of the Costco experience. Our cashier was super friendly and quick. We bought two orders of Spafinder tickets ($100 value apiece for $69.99!) It took longer for the supervisor to return to the pickup desk and get our tickets than it took standing in line(probably four minutes). She wasn‚Äôt rude, but wasn‚Äôt friendly. She also only handed us one set of tickets when we ordered two. We had to correct her. Simple mistake. However, if management should read this review, your cage where you keep your pickup items was open. The door wasn‚Äôt closed completely. I could‚Äôve walked right in. This wasn‚Äôt an accident as when she exited to give us our tickets, she purposely left it ajar.

Overall, not a bad experience. Restrooms were remarkably clean considering the sheer amount of humanity going in and out. Kudos!

Gotta love Costco!

If you've seen one Costco, you've seen them all. This one in Bakersfield on Panama was my gas and rest stop on a recent road trip. Gas at a good price and I get 4% back on their Visa card. This Costco had a smaller amount of gas pumps than I've seen at other locations.
After a short stop in the warehouse for ice and snacks I was on my way.

We love costco pizza in a pinch for dinner but it's always like a 5 year old cut them. Half the time not cut through and mini and extra large pieces. The last pizza we got 1/2 had no cheese. Wish the quality check was better at the Panama store.

What can you say about Costco That hasn't been said already, everyone loves costco for all the right reasons. And don't forget the fabulous Costco gas and food court And high quality tires at a discount. Do you like free samples well, this is the place for you. If check out lines are too long No worries, they go down extremely fast.
Great big busy clean store with lots of samples and great food üçïüå≠üç®

Got to drop 1 Star because they are using plastic bags for the rotisserie chicken now. I get that they are cutting cost but when you go to a container which was easier to put in and take it to a plastic bag things aren't for the consumer or the person putting the chicken into the plastic bag. So far I've gotten bags that aren't closed all the way and super oily near the plastic bag handle because they don't change gloves right away when inserting the chicken. I have to put into another plastic bag so it didn't get everything else oily.

This Costco is one of the older Costco Wholesales in South Sacramento. The parking lot is one of the busiest and the gas station is smaller than the other Costco except the one at CalExpo.

This store carries more Chinese merchandise than any other Costco in the Sacramento area. That is why I like to shop at this Costco sometimes. However, the busy parking lot often stops me when I think about coming to this location.

The gas station at this Costco also has too many cars all the time and it is smaller than the other Costco without a place for expansion!

I like to go there for Ascian Goods, especially during holidays.  But the products were inconsistent on availability.

I love Costco. That‚Äôs a nice place and nice service. The things are cheap and have a good good price !! Everything is so nice in here but the parking lot is always crowded. You must be looking for faster when you go in here. The food in here so nice ! And skincare have a good price too!

I don‚Äôt see a huge difference between the regular Costco Business Center other than they have workers pushing carts with shipping boxes to pick up customer orders. Also, Costco Business Center doesn‚Äôt carry alcohol products or clothing.

The store is about the same size as most of the Costco. They carried bigger bags and bigger cuts of meat. More restaurant equipment is available. Otherwise, they are just like another Costco. All Costco members are welcome too!

First time at a Business Center. They have a great selection of BULK items. There are the "normal" sized costco items, and then Mega sized options. The walk-in fridge is HUGE. A great selection of meat, cheese veggies, etc... They do not sell any booze of any kind, and there is no food court. If you're shopping for a restaurant or large party this is the place to go. I went on a Friday and it was empty. There are no lines to check out. It was a ghost town! They sell whole pigs in a box and full lambs which is unique. This location is well stocked and super clean. I would highly recommend a visit here.
Huge has great stuff üëè love it
