I ordered one few years ago for special btd and today for retirement üòÅ They are amazing and exactly listen to you and even help you decide what design to pick all thatüòÅSuper happy with their white cake üòÅüòÅ
Thank you guys for making our special day more special with your amazing efforts üôèüôè

RUN don‚Äôt walk away from this store, staff was confrontational and started pointing at imaginary signs with imaginary rules. When I asked where the sign that she pointed at was she proceeded to call a supervisor that did NOT bother de-escalating the situation and instead just reiterated the same thing his staff had told me over and over again, after explaining to him in GREAT detail he finally understood how wrong his staff member was and finally let me check out. Won‚Äôt be coming back to a store with power tripping staff anytime soon.

Customer service at the self check is terrible now. An employee used to get you a box and scan the large or heavy items in the cart. This time, the employee just harassed me about not having a picture on my membership card and only offered "help" when I stepped away to get my own box. He helped by putting all the items back in my cart and pushing it aside.

Recieving will unload everyone else before they start on you. Slow and unmotivated. And then the unloader will drive the fork lift to his car a few times while you've been docked for an hour and 45 minutes.

Super ridiculous store . My mom is disabled and can't shop for herself so she sent me inside while she waited in the car and they really denied letting me purchasing the stuff she wanted on MOTHERS day . Unbelievable.

I used to absolutely adore this spot. But over the last few years it's become more and more of a nightmare to navigate.

First, the parking lot, and entrances are so incredibly difficult to navigate, often leaving traffic stuck in the intersection leading into it.

Then, good luck finding a parking spot. The parking lot is chaos, and I can't imagine how many accidents must occur. The line for gas, despite recently changing, still often leads out to the street, blocking traffic.

Inside the club you're met with extraordinarily long lines to check out, even in self-check out.

The food court, despite making changes to their check-out experience, also seems to always have wildly long lines and waits.

With as well as this store must do, it's a shame they haven't considered moving locations to provide a better experience to their customers. Expand their parking lot to double, and consider building out the store to support more customer visits.

I will say, the products are wonderful, and the prices and return policy keep me coming back - but I often dread having to head over.

Finally, is there anything better than a Costco hotdog combo? I dare say not. It is one of life's greatest joys.

This review is solely for the new chocolate chip cookie sold in the food court. It was absolute perfection and I would buy it again and again. The cookie was crispy on the outside and soft, chewy and chocolatey on the inside, warm all around. I love that they decided to use bittersweet and semi-sweet chocolate chips instead of milk chocolate!

Wow! Its been years since I‚Äôve been, impressive. So many items, great prices, super selection of just about everything! This store has good prices on electronics, lots of clothing, yummy baked goods, fair prices on alcohol, outdoor furniture, and rows and rows of food and household items. I may turn into a SamsClub convert!

I always have a positive experience at the local Costco. The staff are friendly and helpful, going above and beyond with customer service. The store itself is immaculate and well-organized, making it easy to find what I need. Plus, of course, the bulk buys and deals are fantastic ‚Äì it's a real money saver!

This place is great! I haven't had a problem with the staff. There are times when they are out of items, but that is no deal breaker. The problem I have is when items are left out in the aisles, people are not the smartest when shopping here. There is an understanding when you want to look at an item, but there is no need to block the whole aisle to do so. With that in mind, having stock in the aisles makes it much more difficult to shop with ease.

I've been a Costco member since I arrived in this blessed country, and when it was Price Club. Costco is one of the best businesses in the world. While in Austin, I worked some months, part time in RTV. I truly recommend this company. This particular warehouse is more focused on business owners.

This Costco Business Center have almost the same things as regular Costcos, ALMOST everything except a bakery department, so they don‚Äôt carry my beloved blueberry muffins üò•üò•üò•

Also the line I was in was super slow as the 2 customers in front was buying 2 giant carts worth of stuff like the sales ends tomorrow ü§£

Love shopping at Costco.
The store is very clean, the employees are nice and there was no line to pay.

I bought ice machine Last year in cotsco business I call Customer service before I bring it Very rude they answer me the questions that I have . My ice machine is not making enough ice. I bring it back to Costco business where I bought it and explain and they don‚Äôt Want to return it  Bad experience I never buy appliances in Costco again manager come over and show me a receipt policy. It‚Äôs only three months when you buy commercial Appliance They don‚Äôt explain that when I bought I Drive more More in an hour And I can‚Äôt return it be careful when you buy the equipment !!!! very Disappointed  with  Costco business üò¢

This Costco center is little different from other regular Costco centers. This doesn't have Gas station with it. This warehouse is mainly for Restaurant and cafe owner to buy bulk groceries and restaurant related furniture, electronics, cleaning and other stuff.  Good for families buying groceries, drinks and snacks in bulk.

Prices are sometimes little cheaper compared to regular Costco centers.

In short - One stop shop for all Food related business.

Handicap parking is literally right at the front door! Thx!
#No MasterCard is not accepted‚Ä¶ Visa, Discover, EBT.
#mobilecarts were located at the front entrance.
#early morning is best time to shop with the mobile cart.

Costco San Dimas California is the place where I usually do the shopping and really enjoy coming here. Staff is friendly and very cooperative and gentle. ‚ù§Ô∏è  to come here, certain items are only available at this Costco. please visit and enjoy the friendly environment supportive staff and conveniently located Costco warehouse.
If you agree with my comments and review, please leave feedback and share it with others. Enjoy shopping at San Dimas, California. Costco warehouse has fun. Have fun with Costco. Kindly.
San dimas Costco is small and not very busy. My husband and I love finding little useful appliances at every Costco. Also, look at their sales. Getting gas at 9pm isn't bad either.

I like Costco because I buy a lot of organic fruits & vegetables there.
I like to look through their big selection of clothes.
I buy their unsalted crunchy nuts but I wish they had low salt tortilla chips too.
I also am thankful for their many samples because sometimes shopping makes me hungry.

Costco needs to get better with the toilet paper. This is the second time I have opened a brand new toilet paper package and found stains that look like blood. The last time this happened was about two years ago. This is a safety hazard. Please check your toilet paper, guys. This is probably not a store issue, but wherever this toilet paper is being packaged, nevertheless, this is a safety hazard for all of us.

As of October 2023, the fastest Formula 1 (F1) tire change record is¬†1.80 seconds, set by McLaren's mechanics during the Qatar Grand Prix while changing Lando Norris' tires.¬†This record is 0.02 seconds faster than Red Bull's previous record of 1.82 seconds, set in 2019.

At the San Francisco Costco, tire changes on a vehicle may take 3,600 seconds or more because they are talkative, understaffed, and really slow. Be prepared to wait, and wait, and wait some more for customer service or installation in the tire center, especially in the mornings. Even when you have an appointment, the best they can promise you is 1 to 2 hours.

This is a massive Costco, it has 3 levels of parking and it‚Äôs still hard to find a parking space!

The store itself is no bigger than most I‚Äôve seen, however I like the large selections of Asian goods, more than the ones in my city.

They also seems to carry more organic fruits and vegetables too.

This Costco is crazy busy!
Get there early or prepare to brace yourselves. The store is overrun with shopping cart warriors and aggressive old ladies who will run over your toe for the last possible case of toilet paper and applesauce.

Things to keep in mind:

If you have an EXECUTIVE MEMBERSHIP card, (the one you spend $120/year for) you are allowed access inside one hour prior to when the store normally opens, and one hour after it closes to the general public.

If you hold the basic biiiish membership, this won‚Äôt get you any special privileges and you should prepare to get there once they open. Do not go on weekends unless you plan to leave your vehicle at home.

Also, Bugatti sells electric scooters here. How awesome is that?! Only $900.00.

Employees are very helpful here. Not sure how they do it.

Purchased a few items and at the food court too. This is a decently sized Costco in the middle of San Francisco and seems to offer much of the same that other traditional Costcos manage with larger stores. Good selection of products. Fairly accessible parking, distance to public transportation, and rideshare stopping area.

Great visit - we walked 25 minutes from market street to get here. Bought everything needed to move family member into their place. Caught a $15 Uber back - totally worth the trip! Prices in California did not differ too much to the East coast prices. We were pleasantly Surprised by this.

Great fresh produce, grocery staples and of course nice to haves as well! Super long lines for the self serve food court- try and purchase what you want to eat at the registers so that you don‚Äôt have to stand in line to order.

I have shopped at costco for years and visited many locations. This brand is always my most favorite one whenever I want to purchase groceries or household items and more. Prices are so much more affordable here. Try to plan to buy your items when they're on sale so that you can get the best price possible. Their return service is one of the best available; Especially when you need to shop for big items such as a mattress or couch, you dont have to worry about what if it's not the right one for you and deal with the return by yourself - they take care of it professionally. Not to mention that all the stores are always clean and spacious. When I am not so busy, I love to go around the store to find something new or interesting to try. More asian products have been added such as fish sauce and dried guava and many more.

I recently went to Costco for sunglasses.  Not only did I find great prices as expected, but also Rhonda at the optical department provided exceptional service. Although it was very busy, she took the time to show me all available sunglasses, even patiently waited while I tried on a few in the locked cabinet.  After the purchase, Rhonda gladly kept adjusting the fitting for me until I was perfectly happy with them.   This level of customer service is truly remarkable!

On 2019, I had the pleasure of visiting Costco in San Jose, where I had the opportunity to see the exceptional Red King Crab legs. The experience left a lasting impression on me, primarily due to the outstanding quality and freshness of the seafood.
Very crowded store even though there are 3 Costcos in San Jose, some new Asian sauces and sweets

We like to come to this Costco than the others, partly because it is closest to our home, but also because it‚Äôs easy to get in and get out as it has 3 entrances, and parking is ample, though on weekend peak time it‚Äôs still stressful. And now that they have installed many self check out stands, check out wait time is not bad.

Less crowded, lots more options and choices in many different categories and areas that you may not able to find in the ‚Äúregular‚Äù Costco.

But you may also find lots of the items in the regular store also available here.

The cleanness, the quality, the selection and the efficiency are just as good as any other Costco store!

Even is 15 minutes more to drive for us, we may come back here to be one of the regular shopping locations.

Costco feild trip from Seaside to this business center! Went on a sat got there before noon and parked right by the doors perfect! So many choices of snacks meats cheeses and produces! I would go just here to stock up on the explosive prices on meat that my local Costco doesn‚Äôt carry. Everybody just minds there business and everybody seems friendly. It‚Äôs very clean well kept and we where there for a couple hours walking to aisles all around looking for needed groceries plus new things to try. My baby loves coscto since we shop there many times a week I know he loved how big it was and loves to look at the fans spinning on top of the ceilings. I love it I‚Äôd definitely come back once we eat up all these meats we horded for our deep freezer. We are a family of 3 but my fianc√© is a big man and eat a lot of food. So we will definitely make our way back into town!

Love stocking up at Business Costco in San Jose for our Real Estate Business in the San Francisco Bay Area! From stationery to dairy and open house supplies, they've got us covered. This members-only warehouse is a treasure trove of bulk groceries, stationary, and electronics. A must-visit for all your business needs! üëå #CostcoHaul #BayAreaListings #WarehouseShopping  #SanJose #realestatebusiness supplies üåü

They deserve a 100star rating.

The most HUGE Costco wholesale warehouse in the south bay area! It looks clean and new inside, with big stuffs inside  so you won‚Äôt bump into someone else while shopping. Most products are fully stocked and some jumbo sets for business or large family are available.

The layout  is a bit different from regular Costco, the frozen and refriged area are combined, not as many yogurt brands as the regular,
Lots of items (seasoning and spices) are huge packages.
Mountains and mountains  of TP( toilet paper) and PT ( paper towels)
Lots of stocks of face masks.
No bakery, no wine section. Understandably this is business center.
Nice to see the seasoned staff training the young newbies on site.
It's clean and very organized everywhere even though there're lots of lots of customers.
One thing for sure everywhere in Costco,  you never need to worry about the quality,  and unbeatable price.
Crowded parking lot since big part of it is still under construction.

Their service is great than ever in any Costco, they really eager to help to anyone. Staff are really great.
I never realized that the business center can be so much cheaper even for regular consumers especially in the meat and dairy. Besides, it's all much less crowded and cool on a hot day.

it's a little hard to believe that i had such a negative experience on my last visit but it was such a non issue that was blown out of proportion by the cashier and supervisor that it should've never happened. i had a $5 cash back coupon to scan because i have the costco credit card. i literally wanted to purchase 1 item and use the $5 coupon and then be on my way but it seemed as if i was a burden to the cashier as they saw me put down the 1 item and them asking me "is that it?" even before they finished helping the previous customer ahead of me. the cashier then scanned my item and wasn't able to scan the coupon on my phone for whatever reason. the cashier then got upset and told me to turn my brightness up (which it was) and they were huffing and puffing while attempting to scan my phone again. they then tried to manually type in the code but complained that they couldn't see the numbers and tried to make it like it was my fault. they then raised their voice and called for a supervisor for assistance which they then attempted to do the same process and it worked. the supervisor left before the transaction was completed and the cashier continued to eyeball me. i wish i would've kept that receipt or gotten their name to report them for terrible customer service.
Costco it‚Äôs always a great place to find quality items at reasonable price
The TUSTIN store on El Camino has the WORST TRAFFIC flow for the GAS station. Traffic jam goes all the way out into the street. What a NIGHTMARE trying to shop  !!

Really nice experience every time I go there the people are extremely helpful there‚Äôs a lot of things to look at samples are back which is really cool also this is one of the few Costco‚Äòs that they have self check out which  makes everything very fast they don‚Äôt take cash at the self check out and I believe you can‚Äôt buy alcohol there either they have floral department bakery deli and a meat department everything looks super fresh and delicious Great wine and spirit collection I would recommend one thing the people who is in charge of self check out they need to relax a little bit not like we have never seen a self check out they‚Äôre a little pushy and act like if it‚Äôs first time using it. Maybe if somebody older they need help with that but younger people great chance they have used it before so just give us a little space to breathe.
It‚Äôs a Costco, you can‚Äôt go wrong! Super gas prices.

We came on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed with people and carts everywhere. The lunch line was crazy. Carts parked everywhere as people are trying the free samples. But, it's still a great place to get bulk household necessities, clothing, seasonal stuff, and gifts. The rotisserie chicken is very popular here. I tried the Roast Beef Sandwich at their deli. It tastes good, but I was hoping it would be warm.

My niece, who lives in Colorado, ordered flowers üíê for Mother's Day and was delivered today. Sew what happened? When my other sister took off the plastic, almost all the petals just dropped down the sink. We were so disappointed that I even called my niece who lives in Colorado regarding this experience. I was trying to call to complain but can't get anybody on the phone. I hope management do something about this and  will not allow this to happen to any of their consumers!!!

Shopping at Costco with Uncle Bob for our annual crab boil is always a hit! We stock up on liquor and seafood, and they never disappoint. The selection is unbeatable the times that I go, and the quality is usually good. It's our yearly tradition, and Costco makes it perfect every time.
I like Costco in general. And now I have yet another reason - a very fairly priced Hibiki whiskey!

Insanely crowded all the time. Cashiers always fed up with their jobs. Cashier today did not say a word to me, just shoved the scanner in my face, then the receipt. The very least you can say hi‚Ä¶ However I did like samples on a random Wednesday.

Worst Costco experience. Our family has been shopping at Costco for years, but tonight was awful. At the door, the greeters were harsh and unhelpful, shouting at me because I didn‚Äôt understand their return procedure (specific doors, yellow tickets stuck to return at the door, pretty different from Costco Santa Maria where I usually shop). The lady at the membership counter lectured me on how ‚Äúall Costcos employ this procedure.‚Äù Thanks,  cool, all good, I wasn‚Äôt asking? Rude, cold, abrasive. All our encounters with other employees proved pretty weird. Groups of employees gathered around chatting, unhelpful when approached. Finally we had a membership issue and the cashier was incredibly rude and hostile. They were understaffed and it took them 40 minutes to help us. When we finally made it out the door we were held up with aggressive queries on why we had two receipts (2 transactions, all items accounted for on the receipts). Absolute misery. If you can shop anywhere else, save yourself the headache.

Came for gasoline.  Line is easily designed.  Flow is good, but people seems slow. Didn't look like long lines, but the wait felt long. The checkout line was the shortest i have ever seen. May be because its a Tuesday. Food court was great and fast.

I didn't know you needed a Costco card to buy food from the outside eatery, when I had ordered my pizzas. But I had planned on getting my card anyways, so it worked out. The lady who did my card was very nice, and she got me out as soon as she could. They have great customer service. Now, I can't wait to just go back in and do some convenient, normal shopping, and save a whole lot of money!

This is a customer experience rating. Since moving to the area from San Diego, we've come to this Costco twice, first was in January 2024, and the second, on March 02, 2024. On our 2nd trip, we brought along our small dog without knowing that dogs are not allowed inside, until we were told by an older lady at the entrance. However, even after acknowledging her and the crowd in front of us finally cleared, she made sure to point the sign to us that dogs are not allowed. After dropping our dog off in the car and made our entry, the same lady was still talking about us and our dog with the other lady at the exit. At checkout, and just like our first time, we tried to put some of our things from the cart onto the belt but stopped after a register helper vigorously started to. To our surprise, we got a similar comment from both helpers on both trips. The first time, we were told "Are you going to help", and the second time was, "Thanks for the help" both accompanied by frustrated looks and tone directly at my wife and I. If it weren't for the nice guys at the meat section, this customer experience rating would've been a 1-star.

Do most workers here have an attitude or something? Heading out, my receipt was checked by Mark. I said 'thank you' to him twice. I know he heard me the first time because the second time I said 'thank you', he very rudely said, "yeah, have a good one." He couldn't even make eye contact. Customer service is huge in any field. Such a shame to have poor customer service in such a great city.

Love going to this Costco. Everything is always clean and clutter free. Their flower selection is the best here. Always fresh and always in theme for the current holiday.  You can be sure to get you're roses and box of chocolate and champagne. One stop shop!

Bought a bag of romaine lattuce the last week.
Opened the bag to enjoy it.
Surprise!
More than half of them were trashed away.

The Costco's economy 101.
How to monetize waste:
Share the waste with your paid members and have them pay for the waste economy.

This place on the weekends is bananas. Fast station traffic is right up against their conventional channel lot. I always park in the back furthest from the entrance, it's faster. They have a food selection of goods, never had an issue with service. Although they get a large influx of shoppers, and at times there are lines to check out, the wait isn't horrible and goes by quickly.
I bought a 23 pound turkey for $23. Ham is good price $13-$40. Your choice. Also they are selling fresh Christmas trees.

I like this Costco. ‚ÄòNuff said.

‚Ä¶But I can always go on‚Ä¶.
The parking is definitely ample, the gas station is well organized and constantly flowing, the parking lot has good organization, the carts are often returned to the store front, the staff are friendly and obviously finding some joy or pleasure in their job, they have a slow (and good) frequency of shifting/ reorganizing the store, ‚Ä¶
You get the point. Lastly, I do not often see a long line at the returns department.

Costco Business is a wholesale market store selling items on wholesale basis so items are available at very reasonable rates & consumers are getting benefits. The purchases are only allowed to Costco Members. Sometimes many items are offered in deals at very cheap prices. The  items are offered best quality.
Great business costco. Tons of parking and everything you could need for your business. The produce and dairy section is COLD. Maybe bring a jacket.

Nice new business center conveniently located right off the 78 in north county. ((The old Frye's building) plenty of items that serve the business customer that other Costco's don't carry.

Keep in mind that this location doesn't have a gas station.
Very spacious with a variety of products.  This is a business center so they do not carry all products from regular Costco. (ie clothes, furniture, appliances, eyeglasses...).

Costco Business Center is very different from the regular Costco stores.  There's no gas station,  no food court, and it appears much less busy than the regular locations.  Parking is easy to find and the spaces are huge! Make sure you bring a big car,  everything here is sold in MEGA BULK.  I'm talking food service sized.  Probably for business owners or caterers. Because there is no way a regular family needs a WHOLE LAMB or a deli slicing machine or a 10 gal bucket of yogurt. Unless ü§îü§îü§î...

Anyway,  prices are great.  A hallmark of Costco.  There's a couple spots at the front of the store that is used as a loading zone. Overall,  I don't foresee regular people going to a Costco Business Center for a standard Costco run,  but it would be a great stop for anyone who's planning a big party or needs large amounts of goods.

For a small town, this Costco has some amazing products that we don't see around Los Angeles.

The sweetest batch blackberries are just as advertised, very sweet. There are numerous dried fruits to choose from including strawberry and dragon fruit.

The meat section has fresh wild octopus, wild sole, and wild black cod.

The clothing section also has a discount area where they have the last of single items.

Employees seem to enjoy working here.  The store is clean.  Quick self checkout, helpful staff.  Membership is well worth the cost.  Lots of quality in bulk.  Easy no receipt return with purchases under your membership card number.  Seasonal clothing changes regularly.

To Costco Sand City, CA
This one star is  on a product I bought.

I am writing to express my disappointment regarding the quality of the produce I recently purchased at your location.
On Sunday, April 14th, I purchased a box of Rio King green seedless table grapes from the store. While they appeared fresh in the box, upon tasting them, I found them to be very old and lacking in flavor. This is not the first time I've encountered such issues with the produce at Costco Sand City. Last week, I also purchased green beans that were not only old but also moldy. I feel embarrassed to take them back and return them.
As a loyal Costco member, I have always trusted the quality of your products. However, these recent experiences have left me concerned about the standards of your produce selection at the Sand City location. I believe that as a reputable retailer, it is essential to maintain high-quality standards to uphold customer satisfaction.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution.

Purchased a prime (choice) rib roast.  Prepared as usual to 115 degrees.  The roast looked great. However, the roast was so tough that it was difficult to cut and chew.  The last time I ate beef this bad was 35 years ago when I didn't know what "select" grade beef was, which is meat that is tough to chew.  $85 and had to toss the beef in the trash.
They have great clothing deals. Love the samples. Try before you buy.  I save on lots of food I usually get at my local store.
All staff at Costco are really nice, maybe not so much the managers‚Ä¶ Vincent or Van not sure his name but I think he is a bit young and can‚Äôt handle the pressures. Other than that 5 star
It has everything as other Costco but it seems smaller. It also has a gas station here to pump for your vehicle. It is not too crowded compare with other Costco. It is a good place for quick in/out.
Costco Wholesale offers a wide range of products, but the high traffic can be a drawback for quick entry and exit. Overall, the shopping experience and offerings are satisfactory.

This Costco has a lot of Asian stuff.
We spend 1 hour here, and we actually bought something, unlike ikea.

Costco is always a great place to visit. This particular Costco has some in/out vehicle flow challenges if you visit during peak hours. They employ a roundabout which is a little on the small side. The staff is normally very helpful and friendly.
I LOVE @Costco always finding new items and old. Great clean and spacious

Hey, it's Costco. Great place to get that 5 gallon can of peanut butter.
Or a 40 pound beef brisket for that intimate back yard BBQ.
I like to get my tires here because that fill your tires with nitrogen. Great for tires, look up the advantages.
Love Costco!

The Costco Warehouses are always clean and have a great selection of fresh produce and meat and dairy items. The prices are affordable, and the selection of novelty items is usually pretty good, especially for kid's clothing and cleaning essentials. I like shopping at Costco and love their gas prices, although the long lines sometimes are discouraging. If you haven't shopped at Costco, you can ask Member Services for a guest pass to check it out and shop to see if a membership would be beneficial to you. Chances are it would.

Thus Costco is the Best Costco ever! One of their Managers is Robert K. And He takes care of any problems you might have. If he feels that he needs to get you to someone qualified in the field you need he will set it up right away and make sure they took care of you. He does it for all his customers! So many people on my street shop there and say the same thing.
This store is always clean, even the restrooms.
The produce is always fresh and the store is well stocked.
The personnel in every department are very nice and knowledgeable. A great store is great because of its leadership. This store is no. 1. Good job Costco on your personnel choice. Thank you .
This is one of the best Costcos in SoCal. I find this branch very clean and well organized.  Parking isn't a problem except during the holidays but you can always find a spot.

They close kinda early on the weekends, and several items I frequently buy are often not sold year round.

It would be fantastic if they calibrated the Pepsi machine in the food court once in awhile so it actually tastes like Pepsi or something resembling Pepsi in taste rather than just the color.

Otherwise it's great.

It was a great store for the most part. It's always busy but I can get help relatively quickly and they have a lot of products. I love the automotive part a lot really good prices and their employees do a great job to help the customers. For this reason I give them 5 stars. If it wasn't for that department I would have given them  4 stars.

This location closes a little early on the weekends. I'd prefer they were open till at least 8pm.

Can you at least calibrate the Pepsi machine in the food court to taste something close to Pepsi?

Always great prices and products. I am glad Santa Cruz has a Costco. The gas prices here are way better than the other gas stations in town. It gets super crowded in the weekends. Especially on Sunday, you can witness the chaos inside. I feel like it would be good to have traffic lights for carts for the weekends.

Tire Center workers seem very unhappy, not enjoying their job much.
I was hoping to see the manager. The two guys I spoke with would rather be having a root canal without pain relief than be in the shop.
I thought maybe the manager would be as miserable as his employees so I left after 15 minutes.
I have pretty good luck at the Gilroy Costco Tire Center.
Sorry you guys are having such a bad day.
Hopefully things will go better
Never ever ever had a problem at Costco with either a product, store or employee. If I didn‚Äôt like something, I simply take it back. And who can beat their fuel prices. Thanks Costco.
Foot court has many problems since switching to self-service ordering. Ice cream is often "out of stock" and today none of the DIY machines were in service; long waits.

Currently experiencing low quality customer service and negative attitude from an employee who didn't want to help me purchase the item I needed. My friend was shopping and asked an associate if they could grab an item off a pallet for them. The associate replied that they did not have the item in stock even though my friend pointed out that the item was on the higher shelf. The employee repeated that they do not have the item available on the floor. After hearing my friend's attempt to get help I then roamed the store looking for an employee who would help me. After finding what seemed to be a supervisor, I received the help I needed after the first associate came back to check the isle again, even though the other supervisor and I found it. He walked the isle and still did not see it until I pointed it out again. Once he came back with the lift to get the pallet the employee then continued to make remarks to his colleague that defended his poor attempt at stocking the shelves. Still leaving 5 stars to not spread anymore negativity but this employee needs to practice their service skills. They did apologize once he handed me the product I asked for but it shouldn't have taken us 20 minutes to get the item or service my friend politely asked for.

Other Costco food courts are doing this: You order the food at the kiosk then what you need to do is just awaiting to be called upon your order number on your receipt. But here, ridiculously slow, you have to join a long line to bring your receipt to the window then they will process your order from there. I saw a staff wearing the same pair of gloves collecting different people‚Äôs receipts, scratching markers on the receipts, handling kitchen machines, receiving cash for those can‚Äôt pay at the kiosk, then grabbing your hotdog directly from that dirty gloves.
Overall, experience was and usually good.  However,  I expect better quality products when buying from Costco. But the eggs haven't been too good, as well as the Charmin bathroom tissue.

Unsafe!!!!

My wife refuses to come to Costco because of the ‚Äúmigrants‚Äù who wear masks, hats, and face coverings like bandits. Nobody should EVER approach a woman alone in a parking lot, not ever. I have warned Costco mgmt about this and also SOCO, the contracted security company. Costco management told me ‚Äúwe have exhausted all of our recourses and to call the Santa Rosa Police Department. I then did at the direct advice of Costco‚Äôs mgmt-Arnie and Will. SRPD laughed at Costco‚Äôs inability to handle this civil situation which is actually criminal and blamed Costco mgmt for this ‚Äúnegligence‚Äù.

Essentially, because of Costco‚Äôs management, inability to solve a simple problem, they are losing shoppers who have come to this location for 10 to 20 years now and have to drive all the way down to Rohnert Park to receive a similar level of service but without the eminent danger. Nobody should ever have to be a ‚Äúvictim‚Äù buying groceries.

Been pretty busy the last few times I've been there. The prices are considerably lower than other places. Good quality non food items. LOTS to choose from on foods, and I LOVE the tasting carts! They've sold me on quite a few products!

You would expect the service in a "big box" store to be impersonal or actually non-caring. However, at this Costco on Santa Rosa Avenue in Santa Rosa, it is the opposite. The staff is friendly and upbeat and focused on their jobs. There is a lot going on within this organization, so kudos to the management for creating a great shopping experience for customers and a great work environment for employees.

Costco is not my favorite place to go because it's so crowded and busy. But sometimes you gotta do it. I must say it has gotten so fast and almost pleasant with the addition of the self check outs. Still find lots of good deals but now I can get in and out with ease. No more 30 minutes of waiting in line to check out. I like it!

We all the love to hate on Costco for various reasons but in truth every time you go there you will find some products that are quality for a very fair price. It might not he what you wanted that day and not everything gets their low price commitment but all in all they still offer significant value in many ways and they work very hard to organize and move a huge amount of product.  I don't feel taken advantage of and therefore am willing to spend big and buy a huge amount of product if I see quality for a great price.

costco is normally good for shopping. it's nice that they accept returns indefinitely and unconditionally. it's also nice that they don't sell bad products. but there is one thing that is very very ridiculous. it drives me crazy that they check the costco card at the door when entering and the receipt when leaving. if I'm not a costco member, I can't buy anything when I get to the checkout anyway. it's ridiculous. let's accept that, maybe, they can say that they don't take non-members. they can also say that it's more expensive to install a card reader for this than to put an employee there. but checking the receipt on the way out is very humiliating. if there was an alternative, I would never go. it treats me like a thief. what do I care if thieves steal. That's your problem, put more cameras, security personnel, barcode alarms. It's your problem, not mine. Don't tell me every day "let's see if you stole anything today".

Honestly this costco is not that bad as the one near chula vista so that was a relief but it took so long for our food and the people in the food court (custimers ) are snappy i was just happy it wanst crowded but it took so long as if it was super crowded workers seem super rushed and they keep poiniing you in all these directions almost if your doing them a favor? just gave the 3 stars thanks to food court not being crowded
Shopping experience aside, Costco needs to  REMOVE  this speed bump that's placed at the main EXIT that faces Walmart. It makes NO SENSE to slow traffic down 30 feet from EXITING the driveway.

Listen, if you do not have a Costco membership yet, you need one if you have kids, you need to get a really good 1. This place has everything you need for a very good price. It seems like you need to buy a big but for the price you save. You're gonna use it anyway. It's worth it.

I love this Costco, I come in, get food and gas once a week. The associates are so nice and helpful. I am pregnant and need help getting my items in the car, Mike Palma was so sweet and pushed my cart as well as packed my car. Amazing !

Costco is good if you're trying to get things in bulk. I personally love it since it helps me get all the groceries I need for about a bit over a month. It's good overall, the only downfall of this is that the lines are huge. If you try to get there before they open, the line is going to be huge. If you get there during certain hours of the day, it's going to be packed. Overall, it's a good place to shop at, and the free samples that they sometimes give out make the experience better üòÇ.

Excellent experience as always. Beautiful fresh food and fast check out. They did make a change when buying food at the food court.
You scan your Costco card and self pay with a card, then bring receipt to the window then they serve you.
If you have cash you still go to the window. It was really quick only issue was people's carts but no big deal üòä

I love going to costco with a good $200 to $300 every month or so to go on a big snack haul, there's always good variety and decently clean snack options that I don't feel guilty about eating.. also the free samples are a great way of knowing how some snacks are gonna taste like before buying them, another thing is if I'm not satisfied with something I bought I can just go and refund it. Overall a very fun place to just walk around and spend money
Shopping was great, no line to get in. Only bad thing is they don't  allow out door dining. Due to city guidelines. This was During  Covid 2020-2021
Signed up today. I must say, Nicole has the patience of a saint. Was having some difficulty, but she stayed so chill. Literally walked us through every step. Great customer service!!

I had an unpleasant experience at Costco in Simi Valley today. It was frustrating to wait in line for 20 minutes, especially when there was only one person in front of me, only to be ignored by the staff. It's difficult to stand there with an injury and not receive the help you need. It's unfortunate that the customer service was poor and lacked compassion, especially during a time when I needed it the most. Businesses need to prioritize the well-being of their customers and provide professional and courteous service. I was able to receive the help I needed at the Westlake Village location.

I am not sure how many Costco's I have visited on my travels, but it has been a few.  This one in Simi Valley has my absolute favorite Food Court since it was outside.  The ordering kiosks are outside, you pick up your food outside, and you eat outside - it's beautiful!  They also had a few items available at this Food Court that I had not seen elsewhere, so I had to order the $2.59 chocolate chunk cookie.  It rocked; I hope they roll this out elsewhere.

The establishment offers a favorable shopping experience due to its cleanliness, organization, and relatively low customer traffic compared to other Costco locations. The service provided is commendable, and the products offered are fresh. Additionally, the store introduces a selection of seasonal clothing. It's important to note that membership is required for entry.
Order Pickup staffs ( Simi Valley)so rude ! All needs to be fired  No customer service skills. Sill a member Ship Store ?????

A very modest and decent employee, Luke, helped me. I have never met such a professional in my field in so many years. He listened to me patiently and solved the problem very carefully and very responsibly. Luke is a great example to follow, such an employee you can be proud of
The place has many new stuffs from foods, seafoods and electric items. There's always a long line but it moves very fast.

Clean, great customer service, and you can't beat the prices, especially the hotdog soda combo,üå≠ü•§ $1.50. It's also the best place to get a family meal for less than $20. A large pizzaüçï $10 or even better, the baked chickenüêì with croissantsü•ê and a family size bag of chips. All add up to about $15.
You're welcome.

My experience with Costco is that the food court is terrible!! üíØ They hire people use them up and fire them!!üíØ They waste tons of food, which doesn't make sense because they say that they donate their food but I have personally worked in snack area and watch them throw on a daily at least 20 pizzas because they had bubbles in them or ugly!! They threw away any food that isn't made right meaning somebody ordered it they made it the wrong way but it's perfectly fine... It's sad that there are tons of people in this world have nothing to eat and they are literally throwing away tons and tons of food on a daily!!! Facts are Costco is a very very wasteful !! Facts are I got hurt on the job working there and was fired as soon as I came back and they didn't have to give me a reason because it was before my 90 days!! So my advice to anybody that is going  working there if you get hurt don't report it or you get fired!!üíØFacts!! My supervisor was Jimmy he bullied me and along with my other supervisors in the food court, l did want l was told to do , when I got hurt they told me to report it and then they stopped talking to me they started treating me like I wasn't there they started giving me dirty looks if l asked a questions they flat out ignored me and walked away giving me dirty looks like little kids !! I went to work every day like I was supposed to l did my job 200% and yet I was fired for doing what they told me to do which was making incident report.. l have never been let go from any job!! Because I'm a really good worker üòÅ I take pride in everything that I do big or little and I would never stoop to the level they did but l will not be quite about this!!, if I would have been fired for doing anything wrong ü´£ I could accept that but I wasn't I was let go because I got hurt ü§ï and it ruined their safety goals!! Jimmy, Juliet, and Brandon l will pray for you üôè!! You are welcome for the fantastic job l did!! I know l am a great employee!! Bullying new employees is sad , sham on you for playing with people's jobs that have families because you're feeling some kind of way not because I did anything wrong but because I did exactly what I was told to do because I didn't want to get fired!!! Lol  that's funny!! To anybody going shopping at the Natomas Costco  the food court is disgusting, don't eat there!! You will wait hours for a pizza crazy they will tell you to call and order ahead but they don't answer their phone they don't care about you they will cuss you out and not even get in trouble of it!!!  I witnessed it myself!! Spare yourself and go to a different store this one isn't worth your time!! I use to love Costco, not anymore!! God bless!!üíØ

I have been shopping at Costco for many years now, and the customer service has been excellent throughout these years. However, yesterday, I experienced something utterly ridiculous at this Costco. They have made a new rule where associates block off aisles for customers to get them out of the store as soon as it hits 8:30 pm(closing time).

Customers who enter the store before closing time cannot complete their shopping. The associates will stand in front of the aisles and tell you that you can not get anything from this aisle and that they are closing now.

If the employees are rushing to leave early, management should plan a different strategy rather than having the associates play the role of bouncers at a club.

Went to Costco Stockton to shop and asked if I could redeem my bed ridden terminally ill wife's cash back certificate  and they wouldn't  honor it because I wasn't  on the membership.  Mind you we both have separate  executive memberships,same address brought in her ID  and membership card,my membership  card. Asked for a manager  who didn't  show up  who was Lisa apparently  and the the representative was Monica. Told me I need to show a power of attorney which I do have. They wouldn't  know if it was real or not with all their experience I'm sure. No tact either. Worst store experience  of my life. I definitely  don't need to be treated like this.

High traffic Costco location, no matter what day of the week or time of day. Great selection of products, but the parking lot can be very hectic, and getting off and onto Lawrence Expressway can be very challenging. Beware of long check-out lines during the weekends.

Wonderful place to shop. Super friendly employees. Lines move fast.  Better pricing when shopping in the store instead of buying on line.  Some items are in store only like 4 LED light bulbs for $10 and the dog food is about $20 less for the chicken adult kibble than delivered. Diamonds are way less than local jewelry stores and the tennis bracelets are exquisite. Lactaid is about 25% less in store. Plenty of parking and New car parking available . Highly recommended.

Visited for the first time in over a decade.  Parking lot was packed, but some spaces could be found a distance away from the building.  Great selection of necessities and fresh baked goods.  Carts are huge and it takes a bit of careful navigating not to bump others...  Self checkout is quick and easy.

Very fun shopping.  Can be very crowded, especially the parking lots.  Avoid weekends if you can.  Staff very helpful.  I visit several Costco stores.  All of them are always in perfect condition.  Delicious pizza!  Huge slices, very cheap.
Sunnyvale Costco has most of the products you need but the parking lot is always so full. It would take you at least 20min to find a spot on Fridays, Saturdays or Sundays.

TRUCK Drivers beware if BOB Receiving Supervisor for Costco is Temecula. VERY RUDE and unprofessional. Cursing at me when there Costco Driver was upset with me because he said he did not have enough room to back in. Pictures show where I was ready to back in for delivery and how much room this driver had. VERY Unprofessional driver not having any respect for another truck driver and said he was going to teach me how to not mess with a company driver. COSTCO drivers are more superior than other COMPANY Drivers??? Very unprofessional and then BOB got upset with me and came out yelling and cursing words to me a Truck driver who appreciates Costco delivers all the time all around California and spends my hard working money at these facilities to be treated very unprofessional NOT accepting the WATER I was delivering. COSTCO management never called me back to listen to the TERRIBLE treatment another Driver received from BOB their SUPERVISOR. Very disappointed Customer and Delivery Driver. Attached are pictures of where I was parked and HOW much ROOM this Driver had to make this kind of uproar to another hardworking driver. VERY VERY Unprofessional.

Good parking easy access, friendly personnel lots of merchandise good quality bakery is very good but I wish I‚Äôd change it up a little. Get some different stuff in there. Pumpkin pies are fantastic. Easy check out very efficient.

Not bad. They do pretty well on keeping the lines down considering it's always packed with people. Great greeters at the front door and when you exit. I do think they should change where they place the vendors.  After a long walk around the store who really wants to stop and talk about fixing their kitchen, or roof, or whatever else they offer that day.  Maybe when you first walk in you're more willing to talk because your not tired yet from shopping üõçÔ∏èüõí just an idea.  Love the store and how clean they stay. Great job Costco employees!!
Very good store. They have lots of stuff even more than a regular grocery store. The only bad part it is crowded in Mondays-Tuesdays.

Wow Costco after years of praising you and giving you 5 Star reviews I was taken aback to encounter 2 incredibly rude workers in under 2 minutes ~ for years I have everything left in my cart with bar codes up ~ your employees have thanked me over and over ~ the $400 cart I go thru normal checkout as it‚Äôs too much to scan in the cart ~ self checkout I have all barcodes up and ready ~ 100% of the time the friendly clerks scan my card & cart in under a minute ~ today, with only a small cart but some heavy items, all bar codes up, the clerk said I have to take everything out of my cart ~ thank God a sensible employee stepped in and scanned my cart & card like always ~ on the way out a manager was standing watching so I inquired about the rude & friendly clerks ~ she then was beyond rude and condescending as she told me they are never supposed to scan your cart items at self check out ~ so the last several hundred visits your employees were always wrong? Never in all my years spending thousands of dollars every year have I been spoken to so rudely ~ I trust Costco will weed out their bad staff and continue with the outstanding service I am accustomed to.

Disgusting! Heres a pre washed, ready to eat spring mix that I usually purchase from Costco La Habra, but got it in Torrance branch. Ate half way when I found this dirt wrapped around stem of one of the vegg. Quality control needed badly!! üëéüëéüëé
Employers have great integrity here. Everyone does their job and does it well. Amazing presentation.

Costco is iur preferred shopping & grocery store.
At times, the grocery deserves a better scrutiny from Cistco buying teams,
For examples, the asparagus was of very poor quality (old and fibery & hard). At least 3 times for the last 6 weeks.

Great store with large variety of brands, items, food, electronics, clothes, sporting goods, cooked food section, diary section, fresh fruits, wines, beers and much more. There are lots of benefits and savings, it really worth it the membership annual fee. Very accessible location and enough parking spaces.
My kidos enjoy the pizza üçï and ice cream üç¶ on the store food court section, and the fuel savings is another plus. Highly recommended üëå üëç

I love a lot of things about Costco, but if a multi-billion dollar corporation can‚Äôt figure out how to provide adequate parking for their customers, someone needs to be fired. Spent 15 minutes looking for a spot before I just left, and now am leaning towards cancelling my membership. This location is almost brand-new and yet they‚Äôre already redesigning the entire outside because it was laid out so poorly.
We love visiting our local Costco. During holidays season it is decked with all holiday decorations and various holidays special gifts etc. great deals

I would guess like all Costco‚Äòs it‚Äôs a place you want to avoid on the weekend. However, the Costco in Tracy is very very well stocked. You can find just about anything you are looking for there. The bakery area and produce area is excellent as well as the meat department.my only actual gripe about Costco is that they move things around quite often and you cannot remember where things are. As well as most people who work there aren‚Äôt too helpful in finding things.
Always full of people anytime in day. You will get almost everything for your daily routine need. Lots of parking, food court, Tire center and pharmacy. Always clean .

Great place to shop for groceries and general merchandise always at great prices, store is well organized and clean restrooms and the food court has the same prices it had since I was a kid, always a great experience shopping here.

We were traveling and want to buy some stuff. Cashier was so rude and she told that we can‚Äôt do more than 2 transactions. Not sure why she restricts us. I am paying $120 in membership and I can buy as many times I can unless Costco Change the plans. Really frustrating and Costco should train there staff  about rules and regulations in California.
The staff here are awesome and very friendly. Appreciate them when it's ridiculously busy on a Sunday afternoon. We got pizzas for our team here and they were great! 18 inches for $10!

LOVE Costco staff, Tire Department and prices. HATE the new rotisserie chicken container (plastic bag). Why?
1. Handle of bag had chicken juice on it. That will get on cart handles. No place to wipe my hands, means anything that I touch could become contaminated. Ugh!
2. Any holes in bag that occur between the display and my car means I could easily have chicken juice on my car upholstery.
3. It could easily also get on the belt st the register.
4. Told all this to a supervisor. He said that it was a corporate decision. Corporate Costco, please bring back old rotisserie chicken containers! More sanitary, easier to transport, and results in a better product and customer experience!

I think my only complaint about Costco is the amount of people there always is, but that‚Äôs inevitable so besides that the employees are always super nice; as long as you are to them‚Ä¶ I mean obviously, but we all have our days lol. Great store though, love the samples!

Terrible experience- the cashier over charged me and I was treated like I was an inconvenience. I went where she told me and no one acknowledged me. I understand they are busy doing clerical work but a simple acknowledgement does not take too long
I seriously hate having to stand in a line to get out of the store and show a receipt! It's ridiculous! Half the time, I just want to waive and just keep walking

Costco is always the best place to shop for the best price if they have what you are looking for.
Love all the produce, canned goods, baking supplies, spices, batteries, tires, ready to eat meals, frozen meats, frozen fruit, ice cream, clothes for all, yard toys, games candy, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, paper goods, kitchen appliances, tvs, etc. Staff is always helpful ü•∞. Samples are yummy üòã. Lots of parking and a food court, too.

Like the price. The gas prices there are the cheapest in the area, and each lane has three gas pumps. The service is very fast. However, the road in front of the gas station is winding and can be confusing. If it's your first time going, be careful. Overall, it's very good.

We were visiting the Irvine area and needed to pick up some supplies for our stay so Costco it is.

I noticed this Costco isn't jam-packed with people like some of the ones that I have been to. It's not quiet, but steady with parking spaces still available and plenty of room to walk around the warehouse.

Having gone to many Costcos across the US and Canada, it's always interesting to see all the variations in regional stock. Here, I found Tuna Poke, fresh animal food, and more Asian options.

The store is clean and the staff are efficient and friendly. This Costco met my expectations.

Busy location. Returns usually has a line but it is relatively fast. Fantastic return policy. No hassle. Store is well laid out. My only negative comment would be when they have food stations for tasting it slows the traffic in the store. Helpful staff who work hard and are friendly. Great variety of items to choose from and quality is good. Wait line to checkout goes fast

Went for gas ‚õΩ filling during our way back from LA to SD and they were closing at 7.30 PM ...we reached on dot and it was open.... Luckyü§û....noticed that they keep it open till 7.35 PM.... Liked this gesture of them üòÅ

Small gas station...i think total 16 pumps were there. Not crowded at all.
Always very clean, organized, friendly staff. Gas station had easy flow and is always fast.

This location is very easy to get in and out quickly, less crowded than the other nearby locations, making it easier to move around inside the store with less traffic inside the store. Worth the extra 5-10 min drive to get to for less stressed shopping. No rotisserie chicken at this location, might be why it's less crowded.

One stop shop for everything that you need and don't need. The prices are going up. Everything seems more expensive than before but still cheaper than grocery stores. The membership ID card and the credit card must be the same person. No more sharing membership. There is a gas station at this location. It's bigger than the one in the district. There's no line for getting gas. Everything is getting expensive at Costco now.

I'm a Costco fan & I love exploring different branches. This one is smaller than others I've been to. However, you will still find here things & stuff you might not find in other Costco branches. So even if the area is smaller, what matters is the items sold in this area & their quality, Costco quality which I believe is one of the best in all grocery stores

This is the worse Costco of the three in the area.    The food court service or lack thereof is horrible. "Do you have onions?" "No we ran out!" Then, the employee just walked away, no solution offered. The drink fountain produces water for drinks.  And no, we didn't press the water button as the return counter employee suggested. All customers we watched were getting only water on both machines. Just a mess all around, not just the food court.
I will give an ounce of credit to the gas station with the many pumps.

Saturday 02.17.24 2pm
Excellent Costco, as all are, but gas was $4.499/gal whereas Costco SJ is $3.899/gal.  Wasn't crowded at all on a weekend, so was easy to shop here as SJ Costcos are ALWAYS crowded.

The gigantic 2-count cooked frozen lobsters (in-season) were so delicious ($11.99/lb) and super fresh, 1 of the lobsters even had eggs, which were so yummy!  We prefer lobster over Dungeoness crabs.

Rotisserie Chicken and BBQ Ribs looked like they were exceptionally popular here as they were nearly all sold out.

Loved the greenhouse going for $1,349.99 even though it's made with plastic instead of glass windows.

Jewelry section was very limited and didn't display the usually higher priced items (ie: the 10ct diamond tennis necklace) like all of the other Bay Areas have.  But they had a nice selection of 14k yellow gold jewelry for great prices here.

Great way to save money around here. Very good deals if you take the time to stock up on stuff. Especially useful for bigger families or households. They also have great deals on electronics, beds, clothes, and just about everything you need can be found there. Wonderful store and staff.

Dear Costco management,

I love Costco, who doesn't, but this obsessive moving items around for the shopper to "meander around and stumble upon new treasures" is annoying, irritating and well underhanded. It's obvious why it is done.

In Costco mission statement it states: taking care of members and employees. How does moving stuff around every day fit in the statement. The employees themselves don't know where items are most likely because swing shift probably doesn't let day shift know. Then again maybe that's intentional?

Suggestions: have the one shift alert the other of the major item movement during morning meetings, so they a least have an inkling of were products are so when a member asks they sort of know the general location. Two move things around less often and three if you insist on moving things around put like things in like places. Example nuts with nuts not in some random place. Yes I experienced that. Walnuts were in a completely different location then the others.

If you really want to "take care of membership and employees" stop moving things around every single day. Yes, I have walked out of the store twice because I was so frustrated and went elsewhere. Why because its annoying.

Members and employees don't need items moved around for "our" benefit to find a new deal. It only benefits Costco, which I get you have the right to do what ever you like, but really every single day and twisting that around so its beneficial for the member...It's about filling up the cart and not convenience (which  I guess you might agree with that).

PS this may seem petty to some and maybe it is in the overall scheme things but it's very annoying and not about convenience. People love Costco, if they want something they will seek it out. There is no need to make that more complicated in the name of finding treasures.

Thanks for letting me vent.

Paul Borg (Willits)

You can't get what you want. You will go there and find what you like then it's gone. Very frustrating!!!!! I'm talking about the Costco in Ukiah. What a disappointing üòû Costco.
RLM

I want to share my experience with this Costco in the management staff. My 87 year-old father Travels to get to this Costco for his shopping from Mendocino. To do this he has to ask one of his daughters to take the day off and travel the two hours to get there.
They did such a shopping trip yesterday and once the got home, they realized one of the items they purchased was really $50 more than they believed. I called on my father‚Äòs behalf to explain what a hardship it is to return such an item and management services took good care of the issue. I want to thank Costco for always putting their customers first above the dollar. Kudos to Taylor in management services for taking her time and taking care of my father. We are lifetime Costco members and we will continue to be.

Always a fun time anytime we can go and visit and read upon necessary groceries and supplies. The staff is friendly the management is out of sight and everything is easy to find and did we mention that everything is ADA compliant and easily accessible via wheelchair.. Costco thought about us when they designed the store! Definitely our favorite place to go.

Ella made our entire adventure worth it! Customer service as a whole was SUPERB! She was friendly and efficient with a smile- every staff member was great! Ella made us feel at home at a store that wasn't our regular. It will be now because of her!! TOP TIER ELLA! WE APPRECIATE YOU!
Very nice, as usual! We love Costco!

This Costco is always amazing experience. The parking lot is very easy to navigate. They even have security in the lot to help keep the peace. I've been a member of Costco for 35 years you can't find many members around that have been there with them that long much less employees. when I go to a new Costco or one that is not near home, it disturbs me to see how are the times have changed when it comes to customer service and customers Being cordial and respectful.  this Costco lacks it all
Vallejo Costco is not as crowded as Richmond, Concord, or others I been to. I don‚Äôt mind taking a drive here and paying bridge toll from Pinole.
Always enjoy going to this Costco almost every week. Very clean. Not too crowded, even on weekends. Fast checkout. Plenty of parking. They also have tire service and gas.

Costco is undeniably a favorite among many for its diverse range of high-quality products and generally pleasant shopping experience. However, a recent encounter with a particularly rude manager left me questioning the brand's commitment to customer satisfaction.

Despite my initial excitement over finding a dresser I liked, marked down from $899 to $699, my enthusiasm quickly waned due to the poor treatment I received at checkout. While the helpfulness of employees like, I think his name was Felipe, who went above and beyond to assist me, was commendable, it was overshadowed by the unprofessional conduct of certain staff members.

During checkout, I was appalled to overhear the cashier and bagger openly criticizing the value of the dress I was purchasing. Their disparaging remarks uttered in full earshot, reflected poorly on the store's commitment to customer satisfaction and respect.

The real disappointment, however, came when I encountered the manager. Not only did she exhibit a dismissive and condescending attitude towards both myself and Employee Brian (Loader), who was trying his best to accommodate my needs, but she also seemed entirely disinterested in resolving the situation amicably. Her disregard for my concerns and blatant lack of professionalism left a lasting impression.

Despite the challenges I faced, the helpfulness and kindness of Brian, Felipe, the lady who checks receipts, and the four gentlemen who actually loaded the item into my truck, ultimately salvaged the situation. Their willingness to assist me in finding a solution and accommodating my needs stood in stark contrast to the behavior exhibited by the manager and the cashiers.

While I understand that every business may encounter its fair share of challenges, I hope this feedback serves as a reminder of the importance of maintaining a standard of excellence in customer service. If Costco truly values its customers, it must address rudeness and unprofessionalism among its staff, particularly those in managerial positions.

As a side note, I am extremely happy with the dresser and its worth every penny and hassle I went through to get it home.

M√ÅSTER CARD IS NOT ACCEPT:come back after 10 years and I am really disappointed first the long lines then my membership was declined I have to go to customer service with proof of my bank that I was charged then comeback to make the long line again just to be told that they don‚Äôt accept master card only visa what a waste of time money and energy I‚Äôll cancel the membership right away other market free  membership has better customer service that this chain of stores
Tables for people are not permitted without any reason, jus they are lazy to clean after or something.

I've been member since 1982. Goes there once a week. One of a kind customer service. They stand behind their products 100% or your money back, that's why they keep growing to become #1  place to shop.

Costco Wholesale is simply amazing. The variety of products available is impressive, ranging from groceries to electronics, clothing, and more. The prices are unbeatable, offering great value for money. The spacious warehouse is well-maintained, ensuring a pleasant shopping experience. The customer service is top-notch, with friendly staff always ready to assist. The food court is a definite highlight, with delicious food at affordable prices. Overall, Costco Wholesale never disappoints and is a must-visit for all your shopping needs.

Let‚Äôs stop pretending this chicken coop is enough for the whole High Desert and some mountain areas. Circled the parking lot at least 2 times to find a space. If you go right when it opens, it is not so bad, but it is still very busy.  I lost my membership card in the store, and by the time I checked out, they had it at the register. Great full someone turned it in, and the cashier helped me check with her supervisor.  Awesome stuff.

Was nice going here after literally decades . Store has something for everyone plus customer service is exceptional and can save you lots of money overtime or even one purchase . Plus the hot dogs a screaming at an unbeatable low price which makes for a decent lunch or snack .

Wish i could give it 0 stars. Good product, nice workers, reliable. Nice kept facilities, clean isles, and great food.
It is expected to be crowded. Not a bothersome, just plan accordingly for parking, shopping, and lines.

I understand the lines are long! I get it, but you employees don't realize how great you have it! next time learn to be polite to people who pay fees to shop there!!!!! I'm not going to drop names. You get paid well ! treat people better

Clean and fully stock branch. As always busy at the check out area.

Costco is Costco. Watch for cars when walking to and from store and watch for people standing in the middle of the isle or suddenly stopping inside the store. Excellent Pizza at this location, maybe just the current staff, but 10/10.

Hello I love Costco their products and all the people working there but today I was never more disappointed ever with this 27 year old when I had 100 pounds of dog food that I need to put in my car and they walk by me so I said it‚Äôs OK they‚Äôre putting their cart‚Äôs away so then I whistled after they were done to get their attention so I can have them help me load the 2 50 pound bags into my car and not a glance and began walking in the opposite direction, I began to yell I need your help! this particular location for the following reasons. Firstly, there are always free parking spaces here, even on weekends you will find them without problems. Secondly, there are not very many people, in principle. If you are in a period when there are a lot of customers, then three people work at the checkout. The cashier himself and two assistants, who work very quickly, put the products in boxes in four hands. It is very convenient and very fast. Thirdly, here you will always find some products or products for the promotion. According to my observations, this happens once every one or two weeks. Personally, I buy. There are a lot of things for work and various tools and utensils for the house. I highly recommend it, you won't be disenchanted, that's for sure.

Great Costco. Great stuff. Good parking lot. They could use a little more employees throughout the store to help navigate. It‚Äôs very hard to know where things are and not many people to ask when you‚Äôre in the maze

This Costco Business Center is great for quick and easy purchase. I usually come here for gallons of water. It‚Äôs not crowded at 7am on a Saturday, but by 8am there is a lot more people. Regardless, checkout is a breeze. Their customer service is amazing and everyone is super helpful.

As everyone knows costco is one of the best stores to buy merchandise in bulk or big quantities. This store is like a warehouse and has bigger bulky items. So if you have a business or a huge family then this costco its good for you.  I don't recommend this store for general public as all other costco stores have a better size on the items you intend to buy.
Rhonda s was the person who assisted me with my purchase and was very kind and professional Same as Kristal or Karina ( lady checking out customers at the door ) I am not giving the 5 stars because the basket scooter that I used was defective and was stopping every time I moved, and was disappointed of the attitude of one of the employees who wasn't polite was was asked to assisted me on taking my groceries, she replied that she wasn't doing that as it wasn't her job. This Costco is okay. Weird layout with all the meat in a back large freezer. Missing a lot of items I was looking for. Whole grass fed new zeland lamb was cool. I would go back for that.

Costs here are unmatchable.. you just need a membership,  which I feel is more than worthy, as you can get more benefits when compared to the membership price..

All products at Wholesale price with good quality and affordable prices. Nice wide aisles. Generally stocked up.  Only time I had a bad experience here was about a year ago when they threatened to kick me out, call the police, and revoke my membership because I didn't have a mask on (along with half the other members). Then the assistant manager and manager stood shoulder to shoulder (not social distancing) while they threatened me for doing EXACTLY what they were doing !  Still in shock but it was just their ignorance so whatever. I can't force scared people to not be scared.

Costco never fails!! It's always so good. We got 2 pizzas and a bunch of other stuff and it was so quick. The pizza has so much protien and it has been so amazing to use the protien. We had a huge group go but there was some seats for us to eat. Super busy but we got out of there quickly and had no problem at all
Short lines in-store and at the gas pumps. Staff are friendly and quite knowledgeable with their products.

You would appreciate what Costco has to offer if you ever move out of the U.S. permanently, like myself. I was back for 2 weeks in the state and did a volume shopping of quality products that are very expensive overseas.  You can't beat Costco's prices. I removed all the additional cartons and wrapping to fit in as much as possible in my suit case.  Particularly hygiene items, they are very expensive where I live now, in Jordan. You gotta love Costco.

From all costco locations in the area I would recommend most the woodland hills location. Clean, organized, good amount of staff and extra parking garage but you would need to use elevator which can only fit 2-3 carts at a time or the escalator on left side. Employees are pretty friendly here. Reason I am give a 4 star is because instacart shoppers are no longer allowed in self check out so even if you have just a few items they make you wait in the regular lines which can take quite some time.
TIPS
Avoid coming here on sunday it could take a while to find parking and very long lines. RETURNS best times I found to do returns are Friday between 10am to 12 noon and Tuesday 1-3 pm.

I have been shopping at Costco for over 20 years and the Costco employees in the optical department have been very helpful and accommodating until today.  I have also bought many pairs ( too many to count) of eye glasses at Costco.

Daniel, in the optical department, was most uncooperative and unhelpful making all kinds of disingenuous excuses why he couldn't put a simple screw back in my frame so I can continue wearing my eye glasses. I asked to speak to a manager for help and he just handed me a card (see photo) and said I could come back tommorow.  Seeing that I live over 45 minutes away and he is perfectly capable of fixing my eye glasses I thought this was terrible customer service...

Love the store but today at Savi ranch I was shocked by the number of dogs inside the store.  Only one, of 10 had a service animal vest.  I‚Äôm a dog owner and love dogs but don‚Äôt want them around my food. They are prepping and serving food in there.  People petting and getting licked by their dog and reaching across the food. Seems gross. I‚Äôm getting old‚Ä¶

Selection and quality of products is fine. However, it's a zoo. Crowds are pretty extreme. Parking is an intense experience. I do not understand why in the world the opening hours are so late (10 AM as of this writing). I imagine the crowd would be much less if they opened the store earlier in the day, say at 8 AM. Many people who prefer to relax by coming in earlier... So why is Costco so late to open their doors to their members?

I love Costco. Their Kirkland alcohol is surprisingly good. It's a challenge only buying a few items. Next thing you know, your cart is full. If I were to have any criticism, I wish they would have better produce. Otherwise, one of my favorite places to shop.

we went inside and found all of what we originally came to purchase and also a few other items at great prices. we couldn't find a few different things we were looking for and asked one of the workers for help and they pointed us in the right direction. we also ordered some food at the food court and received very fast service. it was a great overall visit but the parking lot was a bit smaller than expected.

Everything about this Costco is great! The employees are super nice. OPTICAL and PHARMACY deptments are great. Never a long wait time for any department. Even the outside food court has order kiosks to make your life even more convenient. Can't go wrong at this Costco.

This Costco is very convenient near the highway and other major shopping sites near by. The store is well stocked. But wish they offers more Small sized clothes for both men and women. We are not all tall or well fed. Some are of us are thin and fit. üòÑ

We find the meats and seafood sections are well stocked and fresh. Too bad they didn‚Äôt have many food samples on the time we were there shopping hungry üò±

It's  a Costco wholesale location. You get what you expect. But this location is really clean and has for my personal feelings more space than other ones.

They have lots of parking space around, more than usual. Which makes it easier for me to go here. I hate driving around to find a parking spot.

Also, it has always a good selection of specials.

Fav place for food court and gas! What's there not to love about costco? It has everything and you can get full for free!! Totally worth the membership for the samples and the food court alone! Tons of parking and so many different things that they sell its like a new experience everytime you go!!

I used to use Amazon subscription but we moved close to this location and once you become familiar with the locations of the products you want, I love it. My husband says their pizza is great for the price. The only downside is there should be a better map locator once you are in the store, for example, like what malls used to have. I have made some great meals from the frozen food options that aren't available in the grocery store.
My first time at this location. Everything was clean and well stocked. Love Costco! The best item here is the Cherry Sourdough Bread from Bay Bread Company.
