Kaitlyn was such a great person and I really enjoyed speaking with her and her energy. Really love that so many members of staff are engaged and helpful. Also found an amazing deal on a plant pot that is putting me in the best mood. Picture below:

Costco is just an amazing business model and operation with quality goods and services. Especially the home improvement programs, optical department and frankly everything else. We had new floors installed by a Costco contractor and they are beautiful! Home improvement services employ the best local Contractors. They have to be good because they represent the Costco brand. But what makes this particular Costco so fantastic is the integrity of the staff. I've shopped at several other locations but none come close to the level of service and attention than the Bloomfield Hills warehouse.

Nice store. Well stocked. My usual store is Madison Heights, MI, but the item that I wanted is going to be discontinued and customer service at Madison Heights told me that the item was as still in stock at Bloomfield Hills. If I wanted it I had to go get it. (LOL)

Had to drive a pretty long way to get to this Costco because they were the only location that had what I needed... When I got here compared to the Costco I usually go to this place was a 10 star! Way more organized and clean. Had everything you needed and they were willing to pull stuff off the shelfs if needed during the day while the other location said they could not. For sure wish I was closer to this one!

Matt in optical was great helping me pick out glasses! He definitely  understood "I definitely need help, I'm so bad at this as my exes used to do this!" Costco optical has a great reputation and amazing pricing vs other stores or online. Thanks Matt!

The workers are always helpful and happy. We have been going here as a family since they opened. The gas lines can be annoying (at times), but it‚Äôs cheaper than anywhere in town, so it‚Äôs worth the wait. We love the prices on fruit, coffee and bottled water.

Nice selection.  Staff are always friendly and helpful.  Only real complaint is that it tends to get crowded during peak times.  Recent rearranging of front aisles has improved lines and store traffic.  Pharmacy staff are nice and competent.  Staff always go above and beyond.
They are always busy but move people through like no other. Never a long wait to check out. Staff is always helpful product very good quality

What can I say. Costco has been a godsend for our family over the past 20 years. I think we joined them as soon as they opened up. In fact, my ID picture on the back of my Costco credit card is me holding my two babies now graduated from college.

They return policy is second to none. And if anything I buy ever breaks, I can immediately return it for a full no questions asked to refund.

Great place to shop for people with families or with roommates. Portion sizes are big, prices are cheap. I would prefer having lesser plastic in the packaging though.
Food is fresh, queues are well managed. The pizza after my shopping doesn't fail to amaze me, every time!
Love Costco! I can always get what I need at great prices. Their fresh produce section is nothing less than phenomenal!

I enjoy this Costco since it is not overcrowded like some others are.  The workers in the optical department were friendly and helpful.  The food court was clean and my pizza was hot and fresh.  The checkout lines went nice and smooth.

Cannot recommend a Costco membership enough. However, you do not need a membership to eat at the food court or buy alcohol. There are 13 Michigan Costco locations and this one is very nice, I like how bright and well lit it is. Employees were very friendly and there is ample parking. Costco gas is always cheaper than normal gas stations too.

Costco is getting out of control with its anti sharing measures. My wife and I share a household membership. We should be able to have a single family card that anybody in the household can use. Same with the Costco credit card.  Nope. We each have to have our own Costco card and each need our own separate credit card.  It wasn‚Äôt that long ago when you could have a single household credit card as long as both husband and wife were on the account.  I understand cracking down on sharing with friends and extended family, but come on. This is too much.  There was also zero advertising about these changes. I had a cart full of groceries last week and was refused service because my wife happens to be the one who signed up for the account.  I didn‚Äôt receive an email, nor a phone call, and there has been nothing about this in the circular that‚Äôs sent to us every couple weeks.  Get it together Costco!

Excellent prices, large quantity, high quality. I love grabbing lunch at the food court after shopping. Can't beat the 1.50 hot dog and drink combo. I don't like being heckled about my membership card because I'm not middle aged and the employees assume the membership I'm using isn't mine though

Dior at the membership desk is truly remarkable. Her customer service skills were extraordinary. She is very patient and stuck with us until our business was completed. She went  the extra mile and  worked with her associates to get the answers we needed. Well done, Dior! you exceeded our expectations and we‚Äôre more than pleased with the outcome. Truly, you are one of the finest in the business! thank you, thank you, Dior.

It's always a good time clubbing at Costco!! Super busy on the weekends, so if you can try to go during the week or in the evening. Pharmacy is closed for lunch from 1:30pm-2:30pm most days. Parking at times can be a struggle. They always have carts available.
They got these awesome electric coolers in stock right now too!

The cake they made was excellent! Super cute and delicious. Very easy to place an order and it was ready right on time/before time. I had to order here because the other Costco is renovating their bakery, but the process was very smooth. Great experience. Also, the lemon blueberry loaf is incredible!!

Wonderful place to come waste your valuable time and money!

Employees are trained exceptionally well trained, stuck-up people who live their lives dragging other people down.

Honestly, I just had a terrible experience with customer service acting like the generic "Karens" and watching workers throw away tons of perfectly good food in the food court, which made me want to throw up. Therefore, I will write this review to commemorate such an experience.

Costco, costco workers, and most costco shoopers compared to five years ago have become more and more stingey and stuck-up.
Make a reservation!!  & go early so u can do  wine tasting. Very busy on weekends, but completely worth it! Wine, food, chocolate!, its all amazing.

Bussssssssy. It took quite a bit of time to activate our membership from waiting in line to the 10 minute upgrade speech.

People seemed to be relatively organized though, so we will come back at different time to see if it slowed down a bit.

this really has nothing to do with Costco but thank you to the manager here who stopped me by the book section and asked if I was okay. It was a few months ago, I was having an awful time and she picked me out of a crowd and checked in on me. Even though we didn't really talk I really wish I got her name to say thank you. Having another person acknowledge me on a bad day made a world of difference and i still think about that interaction
There's also a guy in the gasoline station who makes conversation with everyone and is always in a good mood. Sometimes these little interactions make me feel like a person and I appreciate the employees who work here. So, thanks Costco. I hope these people feel valued for the kindest they put out in the world, even in little increments at a time

It‚Äôs Costco - but in Hawaii - I was expecting a bit more island specialties.  They food court was the same as home.  They did have a lot of pineapple and some poke and lei‚Äôs though.  The gas station line and the parking lot were insane!

It's Costco, you're gonna go. You already have a membership. If you've been to one, you've pretty much been to them all because they're virtually all the same. Same merchandise, same food, mostly the same configuration, samples at lunchtime, 5 dolla chickens.  You know the drill.  I love my Costco, though. The green oak Costco has really great people working there.  Super helpful, and always so dang happy.  They must treat their workers really well because I don't think I've ever seen a worker there having a bad day.  Now, go get a hot dog- you know you want one!

We were hoping to find in the store sometime we had see on line. So that we would know if that was actually what we wanted to purchase.  However they did not have it in store.  The staff was both helpful and knowledgeable about their membership card.

The fish at the Haggerty Road location is always very fresh and high quality. Watch out for gas prices, which are often $0.20/gallon higher than the Middlebelt location. On weekends, the self-checkout line can sometimes stretch all the way to the back of the store, so time your visit carefully!

Do not buy tires from Costco. Maybe just this particular one. They want to make the sales, but service is horrible. Be prepared to stand in line for ever for anything, including after you got a call to pickup your car. I waited 30 mins to get my key.

People are so nice. Wish that the grocery items I intend to get were in stock all of the time. Also, open the registers, I should not have to check out my own groceries without being offered a discount

I had gone to their food court. I tried the new roast beef sandwich.  The sandwich size was large. Not much roast beef inside. The sandwich bun was a bit stale. The taste was okay but nothing special.

I enjoyed browsing this store. It's a great place for organic items. Just note that the sizes are very large, so you want to be certain that you can use it up in a timely fashion so you don't wind up throwing it out. I was there in the morning before the big rush. The store was well stocked and organized.

Pictures explaining everything, I paid this strawberry for 8.99 yesterday, and you see what happened. I saved maybe 6 strawberries. O.M.G. I'm so angry, it's too expensive to drive all the way to Costco to change strawberry. Just be careful what you purchase there. üòà

I want to share my experience last night in Costco Kalamazoo. I had to get tires (long story!) just definitely NOT wanting to do so.....however I called last minute. My tires were in stock and they said they could get me in and out. So I walked across to Trader Joe's.....came back! Seeing a super dark sky heading in from the west! The greeter was fine with my Trader Joe stuff so I grabbed the few items I needed and headed over to get my car. They said they had to wait and I was to move to the middle of the store as the front doors were going down. I was getting Tornado warning from my daughter and on my cell. The General Manager and ENTIRE staff were BEYOND INCREDIBLE!!! They moved stuff quickly and efficiently and then we were told adamantly by Melanie to get back to the coolers NOW!!  Very grateful for her and the ENTIRE STAFF!!
I got some coach glasses here. They got the best selection and best prices for designer frames

Sadly I have a torrid love for this store. Sometimes I think about her in the evening, how she teases me with her delicious samples. She's very classy as she only has the best quality. She treats everyone with grace, which is a sign of good culture.

She can be very snobby, as she is exclusive with who she'll engage with.

She'll beguile you with a delicious cost conscious chicken, but it's ruse. When it said and done you leave her having spent hundreds of dollars and with four radial tires.

Damn you Costco! Why can't I quit you!

Don't buy your appliances here. They sell appliances they don't actually have in stock. Two days before they're supposed to be delivered, they tell you that your item needs to be "scheduled" because they found out from the supplier that they don't have it available.

They then push your delivery out several days in hopes that it be available then, but they tell you they don't really know. They'll offer you a $50 credit for the inconvenience, like that helps when you need to leave town and need all of the appliances delivered when they said they would be.

The gas station attendants love their power... walkin' around making demands about "turn your car off" and "quit smoking" like they're starved for attention. Great deals though, worth the membership just for the gas.

My family calls this the happy place because we are always excited to go. Costco knows what you need better than you do, which is great, until you go there for 1 item and leave with a cart full and an empty wallet. We love the healthy snack options and buying chicken in bulk. The produce is usually some of the best, too. The only problem is that the one in Shelby has been getting more and more busy with increasingly annoying people, it seems. I now dread going because I know I will have to park and shop with all those people. It has ruined my experience, but the items are worth traversing the traffic jam of a place.

A decent place to shop with mostly decent people. However, there is an employee in the tire and auto department named Eric (if I'm mistaken with the name, he is a fair gentlemen in his 40's to 50's, who barely has any hair on his head, wears glasses and has some facial hair) who tries his best to not answer your question or concerns, only responds with condescending sarcasm and tries his best to stop you from using your car battery's or product's warranty. I'm not sure if he was condescending to me because I am a woman of color half his age or if he acts poorly with everyone. Either way, he doesn't create a welcoming or safe environment for customers to get the help they need. I will definitely no longer give this location my business because of him.

I could never say anything bad about Costco. Honestly, they always have something I want to buy even though I didn't know I needed to buy it. I still find it and it's something I needed.  Their food court prices are amazing and feeding a family of five for 15 bucks with five drinks and a large pizza can't go wrong.

This is the worst Costco I've ever been to.
(My complaints have nothing to do with the employees or day to day operations.)
I understand that Corporate decides how the store is laid out. They did a terrible job here.
The carts are only accessible on the far left side, past the exit door and return line.
To get the cart, you cross through that foot traffic, which is aggressive, to get your cart. You then have to pass back through the exit flow to get to the entrance on the far right.
If they had switched entrance and exit, it would have been much better.
But this was also the layout that felt the Fuel Center entrance and exit should be the parking lanes. My first time here, I was stuck in my parking spot for a very long time because of this.
This layout is terrible. The people are great, but Corporate made their job as difficult as possible for them.

Do you think that all Costco warehouses in the metro Detroit area have the same prices? They don't! The Madison Heights location has consistently lower prices on produce, meat and many other items, including gas! In contrast, prices at the Bloomfield Hills Costco warehouse on Telegraph Road are consistently higher - because it's in Bloomfield Hills, of course. Get there before 11:00 am or the crowds will be insane.

My experience at Costco, Madison Heights optical department was outstanding. I had the pleasure of being well taken care of by Nancy who is quick, adept, and knowledgeable. She was able to look up previous information. Make recommendations for my new eyewear and made it A truly enjoyable experience. I feel she went above and beyond looking up insurance information, previous specifications and even pulling samples to make sure that everything was accurate. She checked and double checked the proper prescription and made the process easy simple and totally painless. Nancy, if you are, manager is reading this, tell him he should give you a raise because having quality people that care so much dealing with the public on a daily basis is priceless.
Thank you again, Nancy, Kevin

Costco is an absolute lifesaver! From groceries to electronics to household essentials, they have everything I need under one roof. The bulk packaging not only saves me money but also reduces the number of trips I have to make to the store. The quality of their products is top-notch, and the prices are unbeatable. The Kirkland Signature brand offers incredible value and often rivals name brands in quality. The customer service is exceptional, with friendly and helpful staff always ready to assist. Whether I'm stocking up for a big event or just doing my weekly shopping, Costco never disappoints. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for quality products at great prices!

I‚Äôm disgusted by Ethan‚Äôs behavior today, who‚Äôs one of the managers in the returns dept at the Madison Heights MI Costco location. My husband bought AirPods online and returned them almost a month ago. While we were checking out today my husband got pulled out of line to talk with a return manager about the AirPods return. Apparently their system shows that they were returned twice, but all of my husbands accounts only show ONE return. We had to wait 20 minutes for them to explain this situation to us several times, call some people, all while this is THEIR FAULT. They kept saying ‚Äòwell there are two refunds in your account‚Äô like we were doing something wrong‚Ä¶ At the end the manager Ethan was being sassy asking if we wanted to cancel our membership in a taunting manner. His behavior was disgusting, this is YOUR fault and you‚Äôre threatening me to cancel my membership? If you go here don‚Äôt plan on doing a return because they will blame you for fraud.

The lack of customer service in this location is disappointing to say the least. I had a return and the gentleman was rude about returning the product. I will not be shopping here anymore. I never have a problem with Sam‚Äôs Club customer service. Step up your game Costco!

My wife and I had been considering a membership with Costco for some time. When my grandmother needed some help picking up a prescription due to some mobility issues today, I figured this would be a good time to go to the store, learn about the membership tiers and check out the store layout since it had been years since I had actually been in a store.

Went in, showed the employee her card, and made my way to the pharmacy.  The staff there are great and made the process very quick and easy.

While waiting for the script to be ready, I observed an item I wanted to purchase.  Being new to the store, I incorrectly thought I could purchase the item with my grandmother's membership card.  This is something they apparently have recently tightened, unbeknownst to me.  When I spoke to an employee about it, I was made to feel shame and embarrassment for not knowing this.

Yes, it is my fault for not knowing the policy, but when addressed about it, I shouldn't have been made to feel shame, or stupidity.  Long story short, we are no longer considering a membership with Costco.

An interesting thing happened here in the parking lot-no reflection on the Costco crew but on their customer.  I parked at the end of a row with nobody parked within 5 spots because I had a nervous dog in the car. I was in the store about 20 minutes and came out to this note on my windshield.  Really?   How does that parking job look to you?

Same as other similar stores..
Refuses to Close Huge shopping cart door..allowing winter winds to flow in..Summer A/C to flow out..
Not a Green Company

I am for sure a Costco fan and that's why I couldnt give the place less then 4 stars. It is a bit wishy washy on the type of service you may receive at this location depending on when you go. I've had both good and bad experiences and this is forsure one of the busier locations and can also get a bit messy. One other thing is other locations will pull stuff down if needed from the higher shelf but was told at this location they only can while they are closed.

I usually enjoy my shopping experience here.  I agree that the customers generally suck, and sometimes the employees are following rules too strictly, but they are a very busy location and we're just stuck in the churn.  I just wish they would fix their gas station queue.  It's dangerous, often unfair, and inefficient.  I know everyone always thinks they could do it better, but I actually have experience and could do it better.  At least they have gas... unlike Southfield Costco.

Julie at the membership service desk was beyond amazing - she helped keep me calm during a very anxious time and corrected the issue with my membership. This rating is for Julie and the rest of the team members.
However, 5 stars do NOT go to the manager who re-added someone who I had already kicked off of my account. Not only did he re-add said person, but he made them primary on the account I paid for without me being present or even knowing. Thank you Julie for fixing this and working with me!

I paid for a membership but dont see the point, it doesnt save me much money from my regular groceries and my husband can‚Äôt take my card and shop for me. Sams club never gave me a hard time over this policy, will definitely be using them exclusively.

Great customer service makes a world of difference these day. All food and non-food items I have bought from the store have been great quality. Store is super busy on the weekends but during the week 10am-3pm is a great time to shop and look around, taking your time.
The food they sell is healthier. Than big box store.
Tons of organic food.

Just joined today -- found some pretty good deals. The rotisserie chicken is absolutely delicious! Fuel was 20¬¢ less per gallon there than anywhere else in town. I guess if I don't like it, I won't renew the membership next year.

This is one of the most well-stocked and organized store. Gets busy on weekends.
Staff is friendly, would recommend self checkout for faster checkout.
Currently there‚Äôs construction on one of the entry ways but there‚Äôs no sign of closure coming from north.

Impressive Inventory and Eco-Friendly Practices at Costco Ann Arbor, Michigan"

"I recently visited the Costco location in Ann Arbor, Michigan, and I must say, it left quite an impression. Unlike our Costco back in Southlake, TX, this warehouse was bustling with shoppers, and it's easy to see why. The abundance of inventory was remarkable, and it seemed like they had everything, including a variety of products on clearance.

One aspect that stood out to me was the thoughtful approach to sustainability. The presence of trash cans specifically designated for landfill and recycling was a positive surprise. It's a small but impactful step towards reducing environmental impact, and it's great to see a big retailer taking such measures.

The spacious layout of the warehouse, similar to other Costco locations, made shopping a breeze, and the large parking lot provided convenience. My husband and I also enjoyed exploring products that we don't usually find in our local Costco. It's clear that this location caters to a diverse range of preferences.

Additionally, the expansive food court was a pleasant surprise. It offered a variety of options for a quick bite after a shopping spree. The overall experience at Costco Ann Arbor, Michigan, was delightful, and the combination of a vast inventory, eco-friendly practices, and convenient facilities makes it a standout location in our book. Highly recommended for both the shopping enthusiasts and those looking for a more sustainable retail experience."
Has most of everything you may be looking for. We usually go to the one closer to our house but have stopped at this one a few times in passing.

Yes, the deals are spectacular (especially the freshly made pizza at the cafe!) But the best part about the Ann Arbor Costco are the people. The employees are ridiculously friendly and patient. I don't know how they do it given how busy it can sometimes be and how demanding customer service is. Awesome people, Awesome place!

The Ann Arbor, MI location needs to figure out a way to minimize the backups with those who are trying to 'get gas' versus those JUST trying to 'get into the parking lot' to shop.  It took us another 10 minutes just to get in the lot and park! üëé

Great deals on many items (from eye glass wipes, gold rings, carpets, leather chairs, & vodka!). They have friendly associates to help you find merchandise. Wish they had a store in the Irish Hills / Michigan area.

The Ann Arbor Costco has a great selection of alcohol and wine, all at a reasonable price. Their Kirkland brand Scotch, Gin, Tequila, and Vodka are at an even better price!

They were WAY busy around 4:30 today (Saturday), but they still made sure they had plenty of cashiers open to move people through the lines.

Feb 2023 Updating review with pics of all the Far East Asian / Chinese themed products I saw in the store today! I love that this location has so much variety, and welcome more to be added! üòã

Disclaimer: I can't vouch for the taste, since I haven't tried all of them. But the fact that you can even get them in Costco is awesome for us! ü•∞

July 2022 Strawberry sundae hits the spot on this warm afternoon! Decent portion for $2.64 üòã

Not as great as Sam's but we were given a free membership so we get to try it out for a year. Didn't get many photos as was busy doing just that checking everything out. Membership process was lengthy and a bit of a pain. The store layout will take some getting used to also. They do have Yellow Spot üü° Irish Whiskey though but not cheap. Supposed to be a deal here, I believe I saw it cheaper at Hollywood Market in Royal Oak.

I'm not sure why, but I never think to review this place. It's probably because I'm in a hurry to get in and out to minimize dealing with the crowds.

However, I went in for a few items today, found more than I was looking for, and needed some assistance in checking out. Two employees were hugely helpful in getting me where I needed to go, and get me run up. They didn't act put out, and went out of their way to get me through. This was a rare day in customer service.

Costco is great. Everyone that works. There is pleasant and helpful. We all know what a huge selection of items they have.
I just wish that they would expand the store, it is always crowded. The lanes seem to be getting narrower.
The main reason for taking off a star, which isn't Costco's fault, is the customers. So many people don't know how to traverse the aisles.
Many of the customers don't know how to access the self-checkout correctly. There is a large yellow line down the center of the aisle leading up to it. Just like on the road, don't cross the yellow line. Make two lines, not one. Don't cut in front of people in the other line.

Over all I love Costco and this location is very convenient. But I‚Äôm so tired of their rude and unfriendly staff with the nastiest attitudes. I informed a supervisor of the shutting match big back Shirley and the black tried having with me while I walking to get a temporary card.  Just yelling at me like something was off. The audacity she thought and was able to talk to customers in that manner and nothing was done not a verbal correction not a let‚Äôs go off the floor and have a breather because your putting customer and staff at the front of the store a risk with that attitude nothing. I did see a guy approach her but it was all laughs and giggles. Please watch the tapes management from 1115 am on February 20th and see who was wrong and how your employees and customers may have been put in harms way. People or popping off for way less these days.

Costco Optical
Just left Costco Optical and got THE BEST pricing on 3 pair of glasses. We had already shopped 2-3 other vision places.

KRISTOFER was our technician, and by far he was the best person we have worked with at Costco Optical in all the many years we have been going there. Detailed, thorough, patient and extremely helpful. Added to his professionalism, he has a great personality, and made us feel comfortable and like we were truly valued as customers. Bravo!

it is big and they have a lot of variety. I feel it is mixed between Sam's Club, the restaurant depot, and Costco, which is very nice all in one trip the prices some of them are more expensive and some are the same comparing to the other stores overall is very good üëçalso they have Halal and kosher meat more than any other Costco

Costco's business center is open to anyone with a Costco Membership! Right now membership are $60 for basic and $120 for the upgraded Executive Membership that gets you 2% back on all of your purchases and extra benefits on Costco's Services (membership's are satisfaction guaranteed; just like all Costco's products are, too! Exceptions to 90 day electronics (if your receipt prints a bunch of text at the bottom its a 90 day). You can't get cigarettes unless you have a retail liscense but everything else is free game! No bakery or fresh section at the business centers but they have loads of other items and a HUGE cooler/freezer section that blows a regular Costco out of the water!

Huge Costco 70% of their items are different than a normal Costco üî•Anyone can enter with a valid membership ü™™Business Centers do not have a food court, pharmacy, etc üö´They have a lot more snacks and drinks though üç™üç´üßÉand there is a huge dairy and produce section as well ü•õüçäSome halal ÿ≠ŸÑÿßŸÑ items are available here too ü§© it's worth checking out if you like to shop at Costco ü•≥

Awesome place, remember it's Costco.

Designed for businesses and there are some great deals to be had there!

I freaking LOVE Costco's Business Centers! As a former employee of 18 years, I will never not brag about Costco. They just do it right. They treat their employees right and offer such a great quality and value to their members.

My favorite thing about the Business Center is the variety of drinks, snacks, office supplies and bulk quantities of supplies geared towards small businesses. I've purchased items for my online sales. I've purchased snacks to donate to our local police department or for personal use. I appreciate that they have some core Costco items as well (shampoo, conditioner, personal items, etc). Tofu is a great price. The 20lb boxes of pasta is a great price. Everything is great!

The staff is super helpful, too! It was a pleasure speaking with Clay for a while about my previous Costco experience.

Anyone with a Costco membership is welcome. Keep in mind that there are no ancillary departments (optical, hearing aid, meat, deli, pharmacy, food court, etc). Please don't complain about it, either. It's called a Business Center!

Was checking out Costco, trying to see I'd they have vanilla fairlife nutrition plan. I'd love a membership but really need a place I can find the vanilla. Everything in the store looked clean and neat. Door person was great! Service was great with all my questions

I would love to take the opportunity to thank all the staff on duty last night!  I didn‚Äôt get to make it quite make it on time and your amazing team met my needs. Great customer service! In fact probably the best I have ever experienced considering you could‚Äôve sent me packing! Your team rock! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! From Nicole Taylor (new member)

My family has been going to Sam's Club for 20 years, but so far Costco has exceeded all of my expectations and improved upon the parts of Sam's that were lacking. The food is fairly priced and I haven't yet bought a bad product here. Gas is always one of the lowest in-town

I go here pretty often really any time I'm in town üòÇ but why wouldn't I this place has everything!! You could easily live off of Costco alone!! And obviously after a little shopping spree you can grab a giant hot-dog and goüå≠ all jokes aside Costco has it all so if you need anything last minute or not they probably have it ü§†

Typically excellent Costco location. Gas station had extra-long queuing lanes and wide ‚Äòpassing‚Äô lanes for pump-hopping. Out of carrot cake cupcakes though. Bummer. Had the most-excellent fast and uniform-grinding coffee grinder (not the cruddy Jose grinder).

Overall it‚Äôs a value for my family to shop here because we are a large family.  The checkout people are nice.  The management is a different issue.  During the winter, I had made a turn into the first left parking lot and ended up scraping the entire passenger side of my SUV.  I didn‚Äôt see the rock was sticking out way passed the curb as my SUV sits very high.  After getting out to see the damage, I looked at the rock and I‚Äôm assuming whomever plows their parking lot ran into the huge rock and pushed it over the curb.  You could tell by the tire marks on the landscaping and the drag marks the rock made as it was being pushed.  I filed a claim with management whom seemed annoyed and tried to talk me out of filing a claim.  To make it even worse the claim was denied because COSTCO said whatever happens in their parking lot is not their responsibility and they refused to give me the name of the company who plows their parking lot for me to address it with them.

Awful experience. No carts at either the row I parked in or inside. Asked for card to enter and made to stop until I had it out. Asked for my card while shopping and told I had to show it. I had to AGAIN show my card in order to even go to the self checkout register. My arms were completely full of groceries including clothing items, since there were no carts available. I was told to put my items down (on the ground  ???) to get my card out of my wallet, in my purse. I told them it was inside my purse and was told that I was not allowed to go to a register until I provided it. When I got it out of my wallet it was then promptly ripped out of my hand by the staff member to verify my photo ID on the back, causing me to drop my wallet. No apology. Two very large garage type items in the store had no prices on them, and when I asked staff member they said I would have to carry the item all the way to the front to have the scan it through to tell me the price. Again, no carts so I would have to carry this large item to the front. Bkueberres were moldy. The funny thing about my entire trip is that the girl checking receipts when I left swiped my receipt and didn't bother to look at any of the stuff I had in my arms or count them. I had multiple black clothing items covering the groceries in my arms underneath and there's no way she could have had any idea what I was carrying. At least this one was polite and told me to have a nice day. Definitely do not recommend this location.

Have lots of stuffs and good prices, but don't like the parking. They just don't have good parking spaces and I feel like accident just waiting to happen. I will go with friends but probably won't get a membership there.
Great shopping environment, convenient parking, friendly staff, and a wide range of products

I visited this store on 11/28/2022 I was leaving the store,  and the person who looks over the orders as you leave his name was Johnathan, told me he had to "count" my entire order because I used the self checkout.  He then took everything out of my cart and placed it on a self on his left.  Like I was a thief. Everyone was looking at me.   I was mortified,  embarrassed  and in tears.  After he was finished, I went into the parking lot and asked another consumer if she had recieved the same treatment because she too used the self checkout.  She said no.  And we agreed that I would talk to a manager. I then spoke to Scott and he defended the young man.  He then told me he would check the camera to see if he had done the same thing to other customers who had used the self checkout,  speak to Johnathan and call me with the outcome. It has now been a year and I still have yet to get that call back.

No one wants to be the victim of discrimination or unfair treatment
This is terrible.  I do not pay $120.00 per year to be treated this way.  Ridiculous!

Good well laid put Costco. The best part is the pizza making window in the food court! Great for lunch with kids! üçï

For the gas station use Yarrow Street Entrance

Great Costco! We usually go to this location since it‚Äôs near our house. Awesome and well organized! Always stocked up, produce and rotisserie chicken delicious, and helpful staff! They also have some sample stations for food around the store as well, and they‚Äôre always tasty! Sampling station staff are also super nice as well. The muffins are also YUMMY!!! And checkout was smooth. The food they have there right after checkout is also super yummy, especially their sundaes! Anyways, great Costco. I‚Äôll still keep coming back!

I won't be back to the store. My sciatica was hurting me, so I was using one of the handicap carts. I had to use the bathroom, so I headed over. This man asked me if I was ready to check out, and I said no. And I continued on towards the bathroom. This man freaked out on me!!! He yelled really loudly now mama you can't go past! (check out stands), I turned to politely inform him. I wasn't going to take the cart into the restroom, but I needed to get down the hall to the restroom. And he said I couldn't pass and physically detained me., When he called over, the young man who was helping others check out and told him to detain me and to move all my stuff into a cart . Good boy said that I could walk all the way down the hall and leave my stuff. I explained that I was in pain, which is why I was using the cart in the first place. So he unloaded my whole car into a car. And I proceeded forward completely Embarrassed. So when I came out there was another lady. Walking down the hall pushing a FULL CART  And he was watching her . When I confronted him, he said, TOO BAD, it's the rules. This is absolutely disability discrimination, and I feel sorry for any seniors or permanently handicapped people that might have to endure this man. A kind man named Michael helped  me reload my cart. The discriminating man have a ponytail, and you can see Him waving and smirking in the picture as the other man helped me. Never going back to this costco, which I was really excited to get my executive membership from my Chef, who spends a lot of money and also will not be going back to this discriminatory location.
Really great costco as it is newer. Great gas as well. Great selection of everything including wine

I dread going because of the parking, the crowded aisles and the lines.  Oh wait, nix the lines. I'm not saying you won't have to get in line but this store is so efficient the lines move lightning fast.  I'm barely exaggerating.  Pic attached of my place starting in line today.  Nightmare, right?  Nope.  I was on my way out of the store 4 minutes after I took this pic.  4 Minutes!!!  I've been to this store 3 times and while it might be too crowded to navigate the aisles sometimes they do not mess around getting you out the door.  I'm sincerely impressed and that's the reason I'll renew my membership and keep going to this location.  Thank you!

Costco is a wild experience. Be ready to defend your honor! Check out is like squid games, only one person survives. I was told the app was cool too, but you can't even scan and go. The do have the gas station thing figured out the best though!

I have always appreciated the exceptional service that Costco is known for. Unfortunately, my recent encounter with one of your managers left me with a negative impression.

On 11/21/2023, I visited the Costco Havana to return a few purchases. I approached the customer service desk and was waiting for 15-20 minutes. Basel, who claimed himself a manager for 7 years but didn't know to do customer service. He spent so much time chatting in his language with a folk to do 1 return of a shirt. The line was getting longer as he kept chatting which was not professional at all. Then it came my turn, I wanted to return 4 shirts because the price went different. No asking or anything, he just used a higher price to do the return. For a self-claim manager for 7 years, he didn't know why people want to do a return and insisted me to do a return in a higher price. Why would someone do a return in a higher price, let's ask yourself that question, Basel!
More disrespectfully as he went, he proceeded to put words in my mouth by saying loudly I didn't respect him and what not. I simply told him, "If you can't do it, just cancel the return". Basel went on with his stupid accusation and didn't want to listen to my explanation, he gave no care how a long line was waiting for his 7-year profession and how loud he was. I was infuriated as he kept putting words in my mouth and did not let me speak, I eventually said louder that if he couldn't do it, stopped it and cancelled it.

Basel displayed a lack of patience and courtesy. Instead of addressing my concerns with empathy and understanding, he exhibited dismissive and condescending behavior. As a member who values the customer service standards set by Costco, this experience was highly disheartening.

ALL OTHER employees, they are extremely helpful and thoughtful whenever I did any return. I don't care if they are non-manager level, their experience and service always met the expectation and wonderful. I understand that everyone has bad days, but I believe it is crucial for managers, especially in customer-facing roles, to maintain a level of professionalism and courtesy at all times. Especially when you call yourself "I'm a 7-year manager", think 7 times before you speak!
Last time I visited this store, they acted weird cause of my condition & I felt I had to leave immediately üòû

Just stopped by to get some gas. The line is always long but it always surprise me that when some people get to the pump they take their sweet time to get out and start pumping the gas. You've been sitting in your car for 7-10 minutes what were you doing just twiddling your thumbs. Then you get out and start cleaning out your car. Please be considerate of other's time.

Rude & unprofessional service at the return counter. Listening is the key to good customer service and that's just the basics. They were so inundated with telling me no instead of actually listening. Not visiting this location again. I think too many folks visit this location and they don't give a fuq about keeping members. They were so rude, they should be correction officers

Impressive Experience at Costco Business Center - Zuni St., Denver, Colorado"

I recently visited the Costco Business Center on Zuni St. in Denver, Colorado, and I must say, it surpassed my expectations. Having previously been to the Dallas location, the size difference was immediately noticeable. The walk-in refrigerated room is a colossal space, possibly around 20,000 sq ft, providing an extensive range of products.

One aspect that stood out was the impeccable organization and cleanliness throughout the facility. Unlike the chaos often found in other wholesale stores, this Costco Business Center maintains a neat and tidy environment. The commercial appliances section was a delight, offering a diverse range of products catering to various businesses.

Similar to regular Costco locations, the parking lot is spacious, making the shopping experience convenient. It's worth noting that, like other business centers, there are no samples or gas stations. This, however, doesn't take away from the overall positive experience.

In summary, if you're looking for a Costco Business Center that goes above and beyond, the Zuni St. location in Denver is a must-visit. The vast refrigerated room, organized layout, and extensive commercial appliance selection make it a standout choice for business and bulk shopping.

I really like this Costco location just because it has so much less foot traffic than the other locations. I really dislike being around people as it stresses me out so having a place where I feel alone is fantastic. The products are much different than the average Costco but there is some really cool stuff you won't find at the other locations here.

Bird nest soup, drinks, Asian candies, Hispanic candies and more. It's more of a place you go if you have a business but still fun if you are alone.

Would not recommend unless you absolutely have to very hard to find anything there staff seems upset if you ask for help and door person is the slowest I've ever seen checking people out overall pretty poor experience for a Costco even though they offer bulk stuff that other ones don't they could do it with a smile especially at the exit.

So nice and convenient to have nearby. I love shopping here. Great selection of products for bulk and so cheap. Different than Sam's club options. I have both memberships. There are some similarities but there are some options here that you can't beat. Although there is no food court, it's still good. They cater more to local companies.

I go to a regular Costco when I need large amounts of regular household items, medications, fruit, bakery goods, and meat. I come to this Business Costco when I need large quantities of items for my business- large bags of flour, sugar, powdered sugar, cornstarch in big tubs, boxes, bags, deli wax paper, storage or mixing containers, and more. I enjoy the selection of snacks- think of it as the place where cool kids shop to fill their vending machines. It‚Äôs not a place for a jaunty grocery shopping experience though- no samples, fresh bakery, or small cheese blocks. Need a frozen goat? Here you go. 10 pounds of chopped onions? Yep. An unsliced block of prosciutto? Right here! They do have lots of premade salad bowl varieties in 4 packs and boxes of ramen cups in multiple flavors, which we like. In pandemic times, I appreciated the industrial size boxes of pasta and other staples. So you know, this Costco is geared to restaurant/business owners‚Äô needs, not a family outing grocery run.

One of the most friendliest Costco I‚Äôve been to. The staff were absolutely amazing, well stocked and organized, and the store was huge and clean. It was easy to spot everything I need from here. Very delicious food from their food court as well. Overall, I highly recommend this Costco in the Park Meadows area!

This is our go-to grocery store, lots of food selections and random stuff like camping/couches. Since mid year last year, it all went down, book aisles disappeared. When asked, a staff told me that books don‚Äôt sell well, instead, they expanded their alcohol selections. Every single time when I was at Costco, I see people browsing and buying books.

Let‚Äôs move on to food quality. A few times that I have purchased raw food from Costco, I noticed they have a funky smell. Expired? Nope. Not sure what‚Äôs going on here but I will let it slide. However, TWICE now I have noticed boxes of Madeline are still being sold when they are long past the use by date. The first time (2022), I brought it up to the front desk manager. I was told ‚Äúwe are not perfect.‚Äù That is understandable. What‚Äôs shocking is today I went to the store and there they are, another expired batch that is still being sold in store and some of them are already moldy! It‚Äôs time to upgrade your inventory system!

Lastly, as mentioned by many other shoppers, every single time the store is packed, not to mention the parking is a nightmare! You‚Äôd think checkout takes forever, then at least you are done. Nope! The receipt-checking people really do take their time too! So apart from needing a better inventory system, getting what Sam‚Äôs club has will do you good - a receipt and item scanning machine!

2nd Update on March 3rd @ noon: Giving the benefit of doubt that the last review was due to Christmas shopping. What is the excuse & how does a store exist being operated dysfunctionally? Obviously there is something wrong with how this store runs with the current customers. I just don't understand why all these customers allow to shop & operate this way. Was thinking to get something from the food court to see 80+ people waiting for food. Then the two lines to get out, was pushed all the way back for yet another 8~ to exit. Should be a fire risk without enough staff to handle the amount of customers. Can't wait to be done with my membership that I can only handle going a few times a year. Ugh! Tried the one in Parker, almost as bad  I've given up on Costco.
Update a year later 11/17/23, Friday @ 10:30 AM (Last Picture).  Sad to say, things haven't gotten better & probably worse.
Last two times lines go back to end of store (15 mins). People cursing in line. Then broken into two long lines, where people with full carts doing self checkout, because the lines are too bad. Then by the time to checkout stands, a number of them are closed? WT? Poor: Setup, Management, Costco leadership to have this known issue to happen even a year later. No Thanks! üò´
Poorly staffed without enough check stands open/blocked. On a Sunday the line kid you not goes all the way to the back of the store. People complaining & walking away from their full carts. Picture proof

While this location is very busy on the weekends, if you can go on a weekday before 6pm, you won't have any issues with over crowding. They generally have consistent items. The arrangement of the store is not unlike the other locations around the valley. Staff is friendly, store is clean, and checkout doesn't take too long. Oh, and they have their great food court that Costco is known for!

Can anyone really say anything bad about a Costco Wholesale? They sell a lot of everything. No matter what you want(unless it is eggs, in which case they are probably out) they have it. Great deal on Uncrustables. And most important, bathrooms are well lit so you can snap a selfie letting your Instagram followers know how wild of a Friday night you‚Äôre having.

Barnes location is my favorite, even when sitting in line at their gas pumps. From a reliable source in the oil industry, they put Costco gas in their own cars, and that's what I put in mine.

Today I came to Costco to pick up two pairs of prescription glasses, regular AND sunglasses. I'd say it's worth the membership! Years ago, I paid DOUBLE, and that was WITH insurance. (Eye Clinic at Evans Army Hospital definitely didn't steer me wrong about getting glasses at Costco!)

My suggestion is to take pictures in front of mirror of glasses you're trying on, then picture of frame with item number, and repeat it for all the frames you like. It makes it easier to narrow down. When you've made your choices, you can literally walk to the counter and they will get frames from your picture and get you set up with your prescription. It couldn't be easier.
*They carry Ray Ban and Oakley frames.

Selection is good on many other categories and types of products.

oh boy, here we go; Costco is slowly phasing in self-checkout lines, asking us to role-play as Costco employees. Guys, it isn‚Äôt ‚Äúself-check out‚Äù if I continuously need an employee to come over and do something.

The employees already do a great job, you can be in and out in just a few minutes the traditional way. Now, I see people go up there with three things in their cart, and it takes them 10 minutes to figure out what to do. Just get rid of the self check out nonsense and let your professional employees do it faster. I don‚Äôt work here. I‚Äôm telling you now, if you get rid of the traditional cashiers, I‚Äôm not shopping here again.

We had another amazing Costco experience recently. We purchased a big item and we had a hard time loading it in our jeep. The manager Michael, and Jeff were so kind in helping us plan out how to load it up. Jeff was awesome, hilarious, and patient with us as we all tried to figure out how to get it in our car. We got it home in one piece. :) Thank you all for helping us! We appreciate your kindness. We will see you all soon!

Costco is our go to place for most items.  They do a great job of keeping stuff in stock, now that the toilet paper hoarding is behind us.  The prices are hard to beat.  I bought a Vitamix blender for $100 less than I could find anywhere else for the exact same model.  The selection and quality of meats is great for those that love to grill or smoke meats.  Over the years we‚Äôve bought multiple kitchen and home items and they are all good quality items.  The staff is really helpful when you‚Äôre trying to find a specific item.  If you have pets, you won‚Äôt find a better price on pet food, toys, or treats.

Costco is one of our favorite places to shop because of its exceptional services! However, today was different. So my husband and I had brought in our F150 truck for some new tires. So after we checked in for our 1 o'clock appointment, we were told it would probably take a hour and half for the whole process to complete. We thought it makes sense to do our little shopping while waiting. Hour and half rolled around for us to go check the status for the vehicle just to find out that someone had ordered the WRONG TIRES! For whole hour and half of us waiting, no has the decency to call and let us know, because we could have used the time to go to other locations such as Ford Motor, Discount Tires, and many more..Okay, I get it that we make mistakes, we‚Äôre human! But what I didn't get is that why didnt one call and at least tell us?  And when we were there talking to this one guy, or the other employees, none of  them acknowledged the situation. Or at least apologize for having the customers waited for no reason. We apologize when we make mistakes it's in us, humans. Or in business world sometimes it's called ‚Äúcustomer service.‚Äù

I hope this situation doesn't have in the future. Take this review as a reminder.
Same ad always.  üëçüèª.  Great wine and liquor selection in Gypsum.  Even a 50YO McCallum  for $27k

My car battery died at the Costco parking lot. After many attempts I went to the auto center. The manager, Finn, said he would get someone to help me. Bryan came out and tried to jump it, which didn't work.   By that  time it was pass closing. But Bryan and Finn stayed to replace the battery. That worked. They went above and beyond. I truly appreciate their kindness and service.

The tire center here was a God send. We got a flat and this center kept me from a full mental breakdown. They did everything in their power to accommodate us. The staff was friendly and helpful and even offered to drive us to a hotel when we thought we might be stranded. I am very grateful for the people at this Costco location, it solidifies my Costco loyalty.

We frequent here often. Usually have a good experience. Today on the way out we decided to grab some pizza. The rudest we have ever been treated by the food counter female employee. If you hate your job then quit and do something else. Don‚Äôt treat the customers that essentially pay your salary like trash for no good reason. We didn‚Äôt deserved that while with our child too. Jerk
Waiting for some help on propane refills for 20 mins  not a good cuspids service on this area

Had been a while since had been to a Costco and actually shop.

The store is fairly new and seems clean and well stocked. For the most part was having a great experience from the greeter to the person that eloped me out with the membership.

I strolled around and initially seemed the main  issue were the customers.  Which I'm not putting on the store. I immediately seemed apparent customers are not too courteous navigating the aisles. Individuals that seem to be in a rush while getting flustered moving their carts in the left side of wrong direction. Even in stores believe should keep a sense of direction to avoid bumping to others around corners. That alone was just the first impression besides the "high MakaMaka"  demeanor most customers and some staff exhibited. I would like to believe they're not locals but I'm afraid they're for the most part the very individuals complain about other chains customers. To top it off carts are just left wherever as nobody sees to bother putting them back. People just standing blocking narrow aisles with no concern for others.

Anyways on to the actual staff and store gripes.

1. The cashier didnt seem too friendly.
2. The cashier in food court more obviously rude with an attitude she was annoyed to take order and bit rude asking which method of payment as if I had an idea there were kiosks which I didn't notice until after. Mandi could use some training in customer service.
3. I don't recall Costco checking all receipts which created a long line and I did ask the door person which he stated all Costco do so. While it's understandable at the same time it is bit excessive in my opinion.

I sure hope to have a better experience in future visits.

TLDR: Costco is feeling like a tiny dictatorship.

coming to Costco, as I get ready to come to check out - I start to feel anxious and uneasy. Every. Single. Time. Why? Because every time, there‚Äôs an employee yelling at me and speaking to me like some kind of criminal mastermind. Last time it was for splitting our transaction (with the same bank card might I add) one for food for a party and one for food for our home - as we try to keep track of our budget. This time? For having two carts. We‚Äôre a family of 6, we buy a lot of stuff. Isn‚Äôt that the point of Costco? Why do I feel like using the membership I paid for always comes with a headache and anxiety?

Customer service was exceptionally helpful, particularly Trevin who went out of his way and had a lot of knowledge regarding a complicated problem. Trevin maintained a very professional & pleasant demeanor throughout the interaction until resolution. Impressive.

It‚Äôs taken a while but the self check has become much more efficient with someone tending to the problems quickly instead of everyone waiting for someone to show up. The man at the entrance is super cheerful and friendly. Such good deals, and not hard to park the car here. Even the outside plant area now has flats to easily put heavy items on to bring to the register. So much easier and safer.

Super friendly staff here. One person in particular who stands out is Jason.  I see him nearly every time I come in and his attitude and energy is consistently admirable. He always seems to be willing to help out with customers and the operations of the store aswell. I work as a manager and know how valuable it is to have members of a team like Jason.

Easy in and easy out. It was my first visit and I was trying to hurry. Loved the samples, I was hungry. I usually don't try the samples. Great employees. Still a new Costco and easy in and out. 4/16/24 My favorite Costco.

Costco was very clean and not too busy I usually for a Friday. They were down to two lines and was they were getting long then opened a lane. Yay!

I would suggest all Costco's that they go look at the Sam's Club because the do-it-yourself stuff moves a heck of a lot faster than a person can have a lot more lanes. Open at the same time and having two people run the management of all of those Lanes.

I prefer Costco over Sam's but I'm not unopposed to shopping at either. I just like the checkout of Sam's over the checkout of Costco. Plus their software is a lot cleaner.

Costco, if you're listening it probably be worth the investment.

It's Kirkland products who can go wrong right? Store again was clean and the people were decent.

Selection was good.

I think you'll be okay shopping there if you like Kirkland style products.

Blessings to all...

New Costco. Best Costco. Just Costco.
What else do you need to know? The light coming off Pe√±a is a pain to turn from but that isn‚Äôt their fault. It‚Äôs a super nice Costco with great employees as always. Don‚Äôt forget to order your pizzas ahead!

We went on opening day, the store is very well organized, everyone was super nice. We had Kevin as our cashier he was super nice and awesome. He let us know about a deal, that we actually got out of line and went back and got. Costco lived up to expectations and was amazing as always thank you for providing us such a great value and entertainment. PS. The pizza is amazing!

I love Costco in general, but I have enjoyed this new location. The lines are always moving quickly and it is always stocked extremely well. I love the variety of items offered and their ready made food is great. Their food court food is quick and good quality. Prices of items are always extremely clear and they provide excellent prices not available at the common grocery store. I wish they had more boxes available for the items to go in at the register, but I know that is dependent on how many customers are going through at that time and how many boxes are available. Overall, great experience and I would recommend shopping at this location.
Pretty smooth stop again at this location. Very little wait at the pumps and the self check outs were being pushed through quickly. Clean, friendly and helpful.

Avoided Park Meadows to Parker and even worse managed.
Understand holiday shopping can be busy, but this is beyond poorly managed & not staffed well enough for the volume.
At Park Meadows, I experienced many times it go to the opposite end of the store. Shockley the line at Parker started at the front corner of the store and wrapped around to the back & full isle, then from the back to end. People blocking lanes & cursing during the holidays. Took 30+ minutes & in the selfservice has one person supporting. Mine was locked up with technical issues & seeing a bunch of the managers hanging out with no sense of urgency or help.
Poorly managed & feel for the employees & customers, while the corporation makes money.
I will NOT renew my membership. SAD!

Many challenging experiences as a first time homeowner. None quite as frustrating as bad appliances. I will never buy Whirlpool, Maytag, or KitchenAid appliances again if I can help it. Horrendous warranty support experience and a complete lemon of a fridge after just a few years.

However, the fidelity and quality of Costco's staff who worked with us and helped us with this terrible experience? Just excellent. They worked with us to find a solution when they could have simply thrown us to the wolves after the 90 day no questions return policy ended.

Mark I believe was the manager who helped us but really almost every staff member we work with here is patient, respectful, and kind. The tire department as well! Helped us out with a nail puncture situation and were flexible with scheduling a tire replacement in a way they didn't have to be.

I believe that it's not the everyday situations but the difficult situations that define a company's quality and customer commitment. As long as Costco puts customers first and works with us as they have, I'll continue to find reasons to recommend and shop at them over any competitors. Sam's Club can get stuffed.

I LOVE this store!! I just left the clean & organized establishment and wanted to warn you not to approach "Peggy" at the Chicken fajitas food sample post. She's is not approachable & is very Rude. She does NOT know how to talk to people, instead she screams in your face to GET OUT; GET AWAY!! She should wear a face mask during her work shift so you don't get spit at. We all stood in our tracks with our mouths hanging regarding her poor behavior. Hopefully she will have a better rest of her day.

Went in to get a new membership now that it makes sense in my live again. Charlie at customer service was Awesome & not only took Great care of me reactivating my old account he made it fun. You can tell he enjoys his job & recognizes another customer service oriented person. Reactivating my account was an absolute pleasure. Every other employee I encountered was pleasant & eager to help but Charlie is the reason for 5 stars. Everyone else gets a solid 4.

This Costco is legitimately the GOAT. The staff is so cheery and upbeat, and I almost know everyone‚Äôs face that works there. I cannot say enough about the wonderful pharmacy staff. Any request you have, they handle with ease, and patience. Costco pharmacy has made my last year particularly improved. The only piece of feedback I have is to please upgrade the parking lot. It just doesn‚Äôt make sense at all. The gas station is really hard to get to‚Ä¶.. And maybe that‚Äôs just a Costco problem. Oh well. Thank you!

It's a busy store, as it should be. Great selection, great meat, everything you'd expect from a big box store. Not sure that blocking off aisles for stocking on a Friday evening 3 days before Christmas is the most brilliant plan, but there you have it.

Seth at customer return desk was amazing! Give that guy rise and promote him! Costco's customer service (Seth) came to the rescue when I encountered a problem with a damaged product missing from my online order. Despite facing a runaround via the app and online portal, the staff member stepped in, contacted customer service HQ, and efficiently resolved the issue. Thanks to their proactive assistance, I not only received a refund for the damaged item but also managed to purchase a new iPad Pro hassle-free. Kudos to Costco for their outstanding support!

Used to be my favorite Costco. We need about 5 more in the area to make them tolerable. The parking, space and and crowd makes for a terrible experience. It is always packed and a nightmare to get in and out of. I prefer Costco over Sams but have switched to save the headache .

Terrible customer service, pharmacy says its open, but they don't tell you they close in the middle of the day for lunch. Its hard to know when, it varied on when they are hungry I guess. I talked to front manager and to the pharmacy and no straight answer. Suggest you move your prescrition to a place with posted hours to depend on. Crazy a large mega-store can't pay pharmacist enough money to man the place.

Probably one of my favorite Costco locations to visit. It‚Äôs always clean and very easy to get around.

One down side is the parking can get crowded however there still is plenty of parking but you might have to walk a bit.

They always have great deals and are easy to navigate through the store.

I regularly get smoothie ingredients here in bulk.

Bran at cashier made up a rule that the credit card used had to match the name on the member card and inconveniencing my sister saying he can only take cash from non-members. If I am wrong and this is true it‚Äôs just baffling I was able to do it ten times over in the last year with friends and family without ever getting a single issue. Either retrain all your staff or just Bram, but let‚Äôs keep things consistent, didn‚Äôt think Costco was in the business of inconvenience

The cashiers at self checkout honestly ruined the experience for me. I go out of my way to visit this location. Every time I go they take forever. It would be faster for them to just lets us go to the next available register. They think we can‚Äôt and therefore make us wait for them to tell us which one to use when they have 4 open.. the lady was rude to me when she was too busy doing small talk so went ahead to the register and she made me come back and show her my card. Does the front entrance not do that already???
Great store, its always clean and thebstaff is super helpful. I wish their hours were later, especially the gas station. Also, costco pizza is waaaaay better than you would ever expect!

My wife and I have kept the same executive club membership for 7 years and have always shared the Household card since we live under the same roof. Looks like Costco is into maximizing corporate greed and give less to their customers. After 7 years of spending thousands of dollars at Costco, I was turned away at the self checkout and customer service line from checking out because my name wasn‚Äôt on the card and hers was. If Amazon lets members of the same home share an account, I should be able to share a card with my wife. I‚Äôll choose a different route for purchasing goods moving forward, never again Costco. Stop making paying customers feel bad for using their membership.

As always Costco in Superior is a great place for groceries and essentials. We visit this Costco every week for our groceries. It has good stick all the essential items and services to meet the needs of customers. Staffs are very helpful and courteous. They have ample parking and a gas station too. Will recommend everyone

The woman at the door, Miriam, is very rude and takes her job way too seriously.
My partner and I recently moved and we wanted to look around the location to see what their selection is like before committing to membership. This had never been an issue before in previous cities I have lived in. She shouted at us as we walked past the membership counter and essentially escorted us out. It was so unprofessional and uncalled for. We will not be shopping at this location.
This store is neat, clean, well-organized and has an excellent supply of all their merchandise. I love shopping here. I live nearby and I go frequently. I have never been disappointed.

The fast food part is good, but everyone here was incredibly rude.
My wife and I bought a membership online, and went in to see what everything was about.  Everyone there made sure to let us know we are not welcome, so we won't be going back.

We offered "card checker" our membership number, since it was our first time in.  She rudely told us to "Go over there" and pointed to the membership desk.  We went there and stood for 10 minutes.  There was no line, but the two associates were chatting and would not acknowledge us.
Finally, we just went in, and once the cashier found out we didn't have cards yet, she refused to speak to us or look at us until a manager was able to verify my wife's ID.  After about ten minutes of standing at the register and going to help the manager with his computer, we were finally verified and allowed to purchase items.
The cashier then snapped at me "I can't sell you just one of these..." "ugh" and angrily pointed at a 6 pack of muffins.  "That's a 12 pack" she stated, pointing at the 6-pack box of muffins.
I told her I would just take the rest of my stuff without the muffins.  The manager then came over and started explaining condescendingly that costco has "mostly bulk items" and its "not really the best for everyone"

It was very clear that we are not welcome here for some reason.  They tricked us with the membership fee, but we won't make the mistake of returning.  Don't fall for it, most items aren't even priced better than competitors.

Came in today to shop and had a difficult interaction with Hallie. We went over to membership and Andrew took great care of us. Welcoming, friendly, adaptable, and helped us update our parents membership to include us. Andrew truly turned our experience at Costco from irritated to leaving completely happy. Thank you Andrew! People like you make places like Costco great.

Good place for most household things. Just watch the price though because some other stores have the same items for cheaper. They do sell liquor here and I love the dragon bottle of brandy they have right now. I did find out once I got he the glass was cracked so I will be getting a new one soon
Remember when America used to be about offering a helping hand? Costco doesn‚Äôt. Spooky place is horrible and needing a membership is suspect. Air not working is not very helpful.

Couldn't find any of my normal snacks. I can't use my Mastercard debit card at the checkout, but I can at the food court. Make that make sense!! No cash at the self check out. It's not even worth the hassle. I'm going back to Sam's Club...

Costco member for 15 years.
Great company under superior customer oriented management.
Good prices. Plant based and enjoy great fruits and veggies for the most part.

For his foot as it was, and it also being a weekend, I was really amazed at how fast all the lines were even for the membership. Of course, always an amazing selection. There was a few things I was looking for that I didn‚Äôt find but all in all a very satisfying trip.
OMG THE DEALS IVE GOTTEN AT THISE PLACE! Wild the people who work here are awesome Kelsey, Mike, Melissa, TJ and many more love em! Super helpful and also love their input!

We were super excited a few years ago when we found out that we were going to get a Costco in Northern Colorado and more specifically in Timnath, Colorado. Since it‚Äôs opening we have been frequent shoppers here for everything imaginable from food; beer/wine, household goods, electronics, gasoline, and even tires for our vehicles. This is a great location right off of Interstate 25 with a ton of parking. There are always carts available and plenty of staff who are always very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. They always have a HUGE selection of items and will rotate items in and out of stock. They have samples on the weekends and an awesome little food court with really good food for a ridiculously low price. The store is also always very clean and well maintained.

My wife and I have been Costco Gold Members for years and have always enjoyed the perks of the membership. Unfortunately after my experience today, I wont be back. Long story short, I sent my teenage son (who lives in my home) to Costco to purchase a vacuum. He made it into the store, picked up the item, but was stopped at self checkout like a criminal for not having his own card. I get the membership policy, but is this really what its come to? I can't send my teenage son into a store (I pay to have a membership with) to pick something up? Customers are being treated like criminals because employees can't interpret a policy appropriately? Did this checkout person ever consider that the person in front of them might be a future member? Or that this teenager's family might spend a fair amount of money with Costco every month? I could go into further detail about my follow up conversations with the stores Anti-Membership Manager (Greg) but it would be a waste of time. It's important for everyone to remember, you have a choice of where to spend your hard earned money. No need to be treated poorly in the process.

Great Costco!

Can you beat lunch for a family of 3 for $4.50?!

Costco cheesecake is delicious! Warning: it is a 4.5 pound dessert. We fed 7 people and only used half. üôÇ

This is also a solid place to go for work event snacks and drinks. Bulk is your friend.

Was there yesterday to purchase items and two of the employees in self check out were extremely rude. Regina, I believe her name was, got pissy because I had to wait for the person with the card to come back AFTER  he was sent to grab something by another employee and she told me I was taking up the line. Then her and another employee gave us attitude because they don't accept American express HOWEVER there is no posted info on that anywhere in the store so how are people supposed to know what cards they don't accept. If it wasn't for needed this stuff yesterday we would have just walked out. Never had such horrible service there. One employee who was polite and helpful is the only reason I can even consider the one star appropriate

I've always loved the variety and quantity costco gives me, and this location is just like any other. Costco is great, as it's a wholesale store, so you get a lot for your money. There's also a ton of good deals on certain items such as gift cards. Costco offers everything from clothes to food to household items. They also have a food court, which has delicious food for a cheap price. Overall, I'd recommend Costco for whatever shopping needs you may have.
Always find great deals on things needed or not. These bowls are awesome pasta and salad bowls. The popcorn is so addicting!

Super easy to get in and get my membership.  My value buying spouse loves the pricing here on groceries and products.  I like the pre packed meal planning packs you can get.  Also the rotisserie chicken being $5 is epic.  Food court price wise is like stepping back in time by 15 years, as a hot dog and soda combo costs about $3 and is a wonderful lunch.  As a person with blindness I highly recommend this location.  Staff was well trained, knowledgeable, and helped right away.  I was able to get in and out with some lunch in like 30 minutes and most of that time was spent relaxing and eating.  We all know you will pay a bit more on some items for the discounts on others, but honestly being able to get every thing in one trip with out having to hike up to Walmart is worth every penny.  There are more than enough real discounts on groceries to justify the basic membership

Great location for this Costco. Nice and clean store with not so crowds and have plenty of parking. They have awesome deals sometimes. The price of the warehouse items are less compared to market. They have gas station and tire center also.
It sells liquor and almost 20% less than the retail liquor stores. Loved this Costco right on top of freeway.
Be prepared for lines F - Sun.  They, like others, move stuff and make you browse.  Staff is always helpful though, with returns easy.  I prefer self checkout.
The snacks are worth stopping for. Everytime I find something I could benefit from, so it's always win-win when I visit these stores!

No Costco liquor here, too busy to take advantage of the food court if that‚Äôs your thing, self checkout doesn‚Äôt have scanners or a item search but then doesn‚Äôt want anything heavy set on it either. Quality going down and selection slimming. Honestly the savings are not worth it anymore.

Kim in the membership department is an absolute gem! I recently had a complex membership issue that had me stumped, but Kim graciously spent 45 minutes of her time helping me untangle it. She was incredibly patient and understanding, guiding me through the process with such kindness and clarity. Kim made sure every detail was addressed and that I felt supported throughout. Thanks to her, everything was resolved smoothly. I can't thank her enough for her exceptional support!

Good store, Friendly staff. Busy place but checkout lines generally move along quickly.  I was there to visit the hearing aide center & the staff there  is really great! They do try to go above and beyond to help you!

Shoot, i got the best stuff here. i got a $500 tv, as well as a $20 plush toy, it was massive. i also decided to get the 10k rolex they had on sale, i would recommend. their prices are very affordable

I put gas in around noon on a Wednesday. I ran in to the store after to get a hot dog. I waited over 20 minutes after ordering to get the hot dog. I heard the employees say they had 11 people waiting for dogs, which fit with the number of people standing by the food court. There is no excuse for that, they should have had adequate numbers of hot dogs prepared for the noon hour. Worst Costco for court service I‚Äôve ever had.

My husband and I are brand new to Minnesota,we were unaware of the membership requirement,neither of us had been to Costco before,however we explained our situation on why needing to be there and Sherri helped us out completely,very sweet ,helpful person .We will definitely be looking into the membership due to today customer service.
