First time in this Costco.  Fantastic store. Much cleaner and more organized than my normal Costco. Great job

Store is really busy for holidays but workers are extremely polite,respectful,helpful and friendly. Store is clean and has great selection of items not to forget mention good quality and discount one of best returning policy stores.

Most of the time an easy transaction. Although, just had an experience with extremely rude young cashier at self check and manager or superior that wasn't much better. The young cashier stating "Can you not", unsure why maybe due to being to close to the register very unclear and childish statement. I'm very disappointed in costco's choice of employees, to treat their customers so rudely. The issue was filled with unnecessary drama. All due to using the wrong costco membership card.

This is one of the busiest Costcos and I know why‚Ä¶. It‚Äôs the Chocolate Chunk Cookies, seriously great cookie for $2.50.

Oh yeah, they have groceries too.

Anywho, I love this Costco and its cookies.

Highly impressed with product. Some places were bare but staff were working hard to fill empty areas. Prices were great, you can save a lot of money. Parking lot is a traffic jam. Closes at 6p on Saturday,  I couldn't believe that. My shopping experience was cut short due to their hours. Staff were friendly while letting us know they were closing. I'd come back to see what else they have.

Costco is my favorite wholesale store. Be wise in picking when to shop as it gets very busy. Stay away from weekends if at all possible. Choose mid-morning or afternoon when most are at work if that is an option for your schedule. As most know the rotisserie chicken is a great bargain and is delicious! The snack bar foods are a great option for a quit bite as well. I personally get my allergy meds here and save a ton of money over buying the brand name brand. Pat attention to the ads as well. Great deals that will save you even more money.

2024 Thursday busy but lots of staff to help

Very busy on a Friday. Their restaurant food is fantastic

Employees are always very very kind there

Costco has become crazy town to me. I feel like it each man/woman for him/herself. I try to go when the population is down, but it always seems to be....crazy down. And I'm beginning to wonder why, when an average sized bad of caramels IS $13.00üò≥. I'm starting to rethink my membership.

Love the store but always WAY too busy.  Costco needs to add a Blaine store or someplace nearby. Today I waited 12 minutes just to check out on a Friday afternoon. I also accidentally bought $27 worth of ‚Äúorganic raspberries‚Äú instead of normal, because the fruit section can be hard to identify which is which. But otherwise our family loves the products, prices and staff here. Especially the food court!

Love the people from the top down. They make you feel you're the most important person in the store, or super clean warehouse. Thank you, Costco for making our life more meaningful and reminds us there are still kind people to be there only for you! God bless you all!

Came in to quickly check on availabilities of a few items that are not available at the Costco closest to us. I noticed the price much lower than I had paid on a large item recently. The customer service staff worked diligently to make sure that the difference in price was honored, involving 2 associates and a manager to make sure my experience went smoothly.  It is an utterly odd experience to actually leave Costco with more money than one walked in with; nonetheless, I will assure there is ultimately diligent customer service and great attitudes even in this rare case!  Great job Serenity(returns), Kevin(mgr.) and the other Returns associate whose name (I am sorry!) escapes me.
Also, this seems to be a Hopping, high-volume, fun location!

Kind of wild that they don‚Äôt allow you to purchase a single item at the pharmacy counter. Already waited in a line 10 people deep to pick up a med and turned down over trying to purchase 1 extra item. I was not going to stand in a line of 100 people to purchase said 1 item. Corporate needs to reconsider their ‚Äúhold‚Äù on other purchases at the pharmacy. They need to have a limit of 5-10 items rather than turning every single pharmacy patient with items away.

I've always had great experiences with the different departments in the store, but one male employee has been rude, condicending and disrespectful on more than one occasion. All I know is he works at the desk in front of the registers and behind the food court.
He's been at the desk in front of the registers both times.
This employee was rude and snarky to one of his coworkers.
Paige was extremely nice and helped me find an item. She asked this rude coworker for help, he sneered at her and walked away.

The staff is always super friendly and there are some great deals. The clothing rotates a lot so there‚Äôs usually new stuff to look at, also for great prices. Additionally, the $1.50 hotdog is a great way to end a shopping trip.

A lot like Sam's Club but more variety. First trip here. Looking to get different ideas on what to eat for meals. Great deals going on to help you make the decision to become a member. Curious to see how it works for us through the next year.

If it wasn't for costco, food prices would have hurt me more.
The prices are always great for the amount of food you can get. The best deals are things you would not expect, like mushrooms, oranges, garlic, and milk.
Costco is my weekly location I stop at for food and fuel.

The pizza at the pickup is also amazing deal. One large pizza for $10 cannot be beat.

The staff in general are better than most Costcos I've been in.  We had a list of items we needed, the second we walked in the door someone working in the TV section approached us asking if we needed help? We actually did and wanted a certain type, size and brand of TV, he said they didn't carry it??? The website said they had them and every Costco I've been in across the country had them!! We gave up then my wife found 2 of them hidden behind larger sets!? I grabbed him again and said yes you do have them! He started making excuses! They must have just come in! I pointed out they had a display setup that's been there a while, he was speechless. It was like he was hiding them for friends or really had no idea what he was doing!!!  But we finally got what we drove over 100 miles for because they don't deliver to our address!

Pretty good selection and pricing, I have nothing really negative to report. I give Costco 4 stars due to  clothing size stock. I went through 6 different styles of jackets before I found one in my size. Otherwise, great place to get the shopping done fast and at a good price.

I visited the store intending to shop for groceries for my family. After spending two hours collecting items, I encountered an issue at the checkout with these 2 disrespectful employees. Despite being a frequent Costco member, I was informed that I wasn't on the membership plan, preventing me from making a purchase. Additionally, the store's policy of not accepting credit cards added to the inconvenience. Overall, my experience was disappointing, and I cannot recommend this store.

I consider myself a bit of a Costco snob. Unfortunately, the nearest Costco is it a bit of a drive from my home compared to our local Sam's Club. So my review today will take the consideration the competition.
Let me start by saying I love Costco! Their products are quality, their stores are usually pretty clean (considering how many people shop there), and the employees are very friendly and helpful.  Unlike Sam's Club, they are almost always fully staffed.

What I am about to write might be the only thing I don't like about Costco, so here it goes.

I understand how retail stores are trying to save money with the self checkout lines. Costco's is an utter disaster.  The fact that you have to take your heavy, bulk, items out of your cart, scan them, then put them on the scale, then put them back in your cart is unacceptable. It's faster just to go have One of the friendly workers do it for you the old fashioned way.  But you might say, "but they usually have a worker that can come and scan your heavy items for you!" If this is the case, then what is the purpose of the self checkout line in the first place?  On top of that, there is usually one worker for every six self-checkout lines and they are almost always trying to help somebody else so it's a complete waste of time.  I do everything in my power to avoid using the self-check outlines at Costco.

If you've never shopped at Sam's Club, let me tell you about that experience. You have two options.

The first option is that you can go to the self checkout line, take the scanning gun that is available at each line, scan your items while they are in your cart, pay, have your receipt checked, then leave the store.

The second option is called Scan and Go. With this option you use an app on your phone to pay for all of your items as you shop, you then pay for everything from your phone, have one of the checkout people scan your electronic receipt to make sure you aren't stealing anything, and leave the store.  It is quick, seamless, and works extremely well. I rarely see long lines at Sam's Club.

Costco, please address this.  You are better than this.  Thanks.
Best customer service around. Their optical is amazing too. Purchased glasses for my son months ago, the woman we worked with still remembers my son and has seen me there and asked about him.

I started going to the new and closest Costco and have always loved. However, as the location has gotten more popular the parking lot has become a nightmare. The primary entrance needs a 4-way stop, or the gas needs to be redirect to flow away from the current pinch point. Please flip the gas to exit into the west side parking lot.

If you are a truck driver, don't come to this place, it is a bad place, there is no entrance and the reciver staff  give hard time same lady working the reciever I ask her if can take the Tralier dropped on the street she say No one can take stay here tonight till your appointment tomorrow morning  and the truck drivers the docks is to small space for trucks anyway I don‚Äôt get  welcomed  and happy face

As a woman with a family and a business Costco keeps me coming back ü§ç it includes everything I need at a good deal and it‚Äôs accessible! It‚Äôs worth becoming a member, because it‚Äôs more than just shopping - it‚Äôs a whole community.

Costco has become my go-to destination for all my shopping needs. From groceries to business needs, you name it - Costco has it all. Its unbeatable combination of quality products, great value, convenience, and excellent customer service makes it no brainer to shop here.

It is also a great place to grab a bite at their cafeteria area. As a busy business bee, I sometimes make my lunch to be a slice of pizza ($3 lunch, nothing can beat that).  And if the lines are not tooo long, I get gas - it‚Äôs slightly cheaper as well which is nice ‚ú®

I highly recommend! ‚ú®

This is a great Costco outlet with a huge variety of options to buy from.
They have almost everything you need for a household.
The prices are the best! you cannot find things cheaper than Costco. The only catch is to stay focused and not get too lost! Most people come to buy something and end up buying a lot more stuffs.
Also, its a bulk buying wholesale store, so prepare yourself accordingly.
Overall one of the best places for shopping of Household products!

Fairly busy location no matter what time you decide to shop. Dedicated staff, me being a first time member, the process is clunky. The website gives instruction on how to obtain your member card but the experience is different when you arrive. Overall, you can find magnificent deals and items here. The product that is on the shelves are mighty, I learned that if they don't have an item, they just don't have it. Customer culture is fast paced, when you're in the connecting aisles, move fast and get to the isolated aisles so you can browse at your own pace. Spacious, you'll have room to move around but the amount of people that are shopping along side you can make it feel tight. I will return and see if I experience something else.
Always fun to go to Costco seeing the great deals that they have there and looking at all those bulk items

Conveniently located within Eden Prairie business district. I usually take the opportunity to shop at Asia Mall and here at the same time. You want to avoid putting gas here during the weekends. The queues are insanely long even at closing time.

TIP: don't forget that the pharmacy has lunch hours, and MAY BE closed for a little bit. It's less busy during the week than on weekends, WEIRDLY Enough..
*my photos are from today, 1/11/24!
* The food court now has the 750 calorie, $2.50 cookie, which has been rumored to be 2 bakery cookies squished together and baked into yummy goodness!
* The hotdog & pop is still $1.50 and you don't need a membership to purchase those, I dint think?

I bought this meat yesterday. red and beautiful on the outside. But today I want to prepare it and it is dark between gray and brown inside. They only covered it with red meat on the outside to deceive. This is a hoax and I want to throw it away. It must be very old or damaged meat.

Costco. Listen up! These almonds are one of the best items I have ever purchased. I had to buy 8 bags before they went out of stock for the season. Please, consider selling these year round or a variant like these. But these are BOMB!!!

April 30, 2024 Tuesday. 10:30am
We needed a few items. Planned for a big crowd, this Maple Grove Costco is usually wall to wall people.
Just the opposite, not crowded at all.
We picked up the stuff on our list, plus a few items we didn‚Äôt need but wanted.
Checkout was quick and efficient.
There's so much room for activities! This place has everything! I'm loving this open space. This is a nice, clean store. The ambience is outstanding!

Their customer service desk is a nightmare. I have an issue with getting my refund checks that has been going on for years. Each time I spend significant time at the desk which is really poorly run. I have called customer service many times. I even handed it off to my mom who had more time. I am always told it will be escalated to a manager and no one ever calls back. When I call to follow up they say someone will call me back and the whole thing starts over. I have refund checks going back years that they can‚Äôt get me.

Love this place. I love the fact that by gas and then it's already low but I get another 12 to 13 cents below that. Amazing. I love the hot dogs and a drink for cheap. Hard to get out of there for under $100 but I did it yesterday. Did I say I love this place?

If they sell what I want, it is a good buy. But their inventory choices are very limited. Great for gas, tires, a few food items, dog food, laundry detergent, and vitamins.  The shopping experience is always poor for me. It takes forever to find things and the store is crowded. On a 10 point scale, I'd rate it 2.5 or 3.  I'm always in a worse mood when I leave the store than when I arrived. Shopping at Aldi and Walmart is more pleasant. When it's time to renew the membership, thought is required. But in the end, I renew.

I absolutely love Costco! I've shopped at Costco for years after my friend Jen gave me a membership for Christmas one year.  This was such a great gift! Costco has great variety of products.  Everyone who works at Costco is wonderful! I'm serving samples and I love the human interaction! I've bought my adjustable bed and several TVs. Costco has great King Crab legs and delicious filet mignon! I highly recommend Costco!
Made a quick run; 10 items... lined then up in the cart... didn't need to take the items out because the cashier just had to scan, I tapped my card, and then left üòÄ.

1sr time here! Much less busier here than Maple Grove & St Louis Park. They have gas pumps too, which were sooo dead, so we filled up a half tank of gas too. I took over 100 photos, but this review system only allows 50 pictures. I did like that there is a gas price sign as you walk out, there are about 6 accessible parking spots. The aisles are sooo wide and there are over 16 aisles of JUST SNACKS! That isn't the case with a regular Costco. MY BEST DEAL: Kings Hawaiian rolls: 16 count, 2 pack(so 32 rolls) , is $6.79 HERE. Because at Cub Foods it's a 12 pack for $4.99! I LOVE this deal here!

This store whispers my name to me daily, ‚ÄúKarina‚Ä¶come back..you love this Costco‚Äù, YUP‚Ä¶it‚Äôs that awesome! I had the most profoundly professional experience of my work life with Nick Koppinger! If you need something, ANYTHING for your office or home do your self a huge favor & check this super special location first, it might possibly blow you away like it did me!! Thanks Nick!

Our first trip to the Business Center was interesting. We noticed many unique products and surprised over how different it is from more traditional stores. The variety and volume of products in meat, cheese, paper products, and snacks, is beyond what we expected. That said, we were very disappointed with the quality of the fresh fruit we purchased.

Two packages of Red grapes were both far beyond what should have been available for sale. When we arrived home we quickly discovered they were incredibly over-ripe, soft, and nearly mush.  Plan to call the store back, but ours were just two from the many pallets of same which were on display for sale. I‚Äôm sure there are, and will be many more dissatisfied customers. This is preventable.

** Following up on this post. I tried calling the store numerous times after sharing this feedback. Eventually I gave up having not connected with anyone. Voice message was not returned either. This is absolutely not what we have become accustomed to as Costco customers. In fact, we have always appreciated their focus on customer service, and quality products. Am surprised, disappointed

Great food options for personal or business. This location is definitely geared more towards restaurants and convenient stores. Where as there is no clothing, electronics or jewelry. There is a abundance of cooking products such as knifes, pans, commercial mixers and ovens. Lots of cleaning products, many more options for beverages, snack type options, also a much larger refrigerated section offering similar options though in more commercial quantities. To be clear it is a very good choice for personal to shop here.

Only downside is no food court area, likely due to the significantly fewer customers passing through the store at this location.

Great place to go shopping. You could pretty much find everything you need for your house. If you‚Äôre looking for bulk stuff, we go there about twice a month and we spend around 300 bucks. Employees are really helpful if you need help with anything looking for something carrying something putting something on a cart something that‚Äôs heavy these employees go above and beyond to help, great service and you can find so many so many stuff there
Hadn't been to Costco in a while, and even though I just stopped to pick up a couple of things, I ended up spending way more, because they had some cool new stuff.  Dole Whip?  Yes please!!
You need to do better with check outs.  Even at noon during the week the lines are alway 12 deep.  I spend more time in line than I do shopping

I am really impressed with the optical team at our Costco in Rochester MN. Not only do they have the best selection of frames I've found in town, but they're ultra affordable. I have some specific vision issues that I've learned require custom specialty support... but this team was willing to work with me patiently (if not enthusiastically) until we solved a complex riddle with my prescriptions. Some of my glasses will still require a specialty lab, but thanks to this dedicated team of problem solvers, I now know the recipe for success when it comes to supplemental pairs of glasses to keep my style feeling fresh. I'm very grateful for their help and encourage you to give this optical team your business.
Staff are awesome. They go above and beyond. Also great selection of products. I have my go-to products but am often excited what they will add next to their collection every week
Great place to find tons of stuff, we really appreciate Nick at the self checkouts today he was super helpful and friendly!! Great staff!

We love Costco. It's a little bit of a drive for us to go there but it is worth the drive. My only negative thought at this time is that they don't serve fruit pies in the winter except at Thanksgiving and Christmas. They have the BEST Apple pies around!! Really all of their baked goods are awesome ! I just wish they would have  fruit pies all the time.

I like it, it‚Äôs alright. But today the day before the eclipse, all the staff in the front mostly a guy (not saying names) He was mad at us for parking near the entrance, it was raining. Hard. Honestly I would have just spoken up and told him what if he was us rn? But yeah. I like this place. Just that practical guy is a b. Just like Jojo‚Äôs song, karma is a b. What comes around goes around. It‚Äôs very overrated. Plus their new policy is stupid.
I love this place but on weekends is not a good day to go if you don't like to buy when many people around

For some reason, I enjoy bulk quantities of things.... maybe because it means less shopping trips each month.  Costco has what you need and then things you didn't think you need, but somehow you buy it anyways.
My favorite place to shop. Love self-checkout. Very friendly and helpful staff!

I am compelled to write this review following a recent visit to Costco, where I was left immensely impressed by the extraordinary customer service on display.
My recent experience at this particular Costco, however, surpassed all expectations.
We arrived a little late, and by the time we reached the checkout, it was already 9 PM - a full half an hour after the store's usual closing time. Despite this, we were not rushed or hurried, but rather met with an unruffled and patient attitude from the staff.
Following our checkout, we decided to get some food, and what was truly astonishing was the grace with which the staff handled this. They graciously permitted us to dine in, allowing us to enjoy our meal at a relaxed pace, despite the fact that it was significantly past their scheduled closing time. There was a complete absence of impatience or frustration from the staff members. Instead, we were treated with understanding, kindness, and a warm smile, which significantly added to our enjoyment of the evening.
This extraordinary experience is a testament to Costco's dedication to customer satisfaction. It wasn't just about staying open late or letting us eat in peace; it was the genuine kindness and patience exhibited by the staff that left a deep impression.
On top of this excellent service, the store also boasts some fantastic deals. The wide range of products and their unbeatable prices is another factor that contributes to the unique shopping experience at Costco. It's not just the savings on offer, but the quality of the products available that make shopping here such a pleasure.
A heartfelt thank you to the staff at this Costco! You embody the spirit of exceptional customer service.

Edit: this costco has the most chronically unhappy staff i‚Äôve ever encountered. i‚Äôm afraid to even ask for help half the time because of the reaction i get when i do anything as simple as not have my barcodes facing out when i approach an open checkout lane.

by far some of the rudest checkout employees of all the costco‚Äôs i‚Äôve been to! They got upset with me for taking their boxes when i went to shop, then when i checked out at the same lane they packed my boxes with frozen items on top of rotisserie chicken. Had to go back and replace all of them because everything either thawed or cooled down.

Just frustrated

My visit here was quite amusing. I stopped in to use the ATM, but it didn't have the function I needed. It seems to always be a traffic jam inside and out of the building. No matter what location, that's the culture of Costco. I don't deem it a negative thing, nature of the beast type of thing. I also went to purchase a basketball and football. They didn't have it, something to keep in mind when considering Costco. They can have basketball hoops and hockey nets but may not have small items like baseball, depends on the demand. I enjoy Costco because they thoughtfully plan their locations to accommodate a mass group of people. Large parking lots, huge doors, and plenty of product. Another thing I'd like to point out is that the signage is gigantic! You can see the department you're looking for across the store. Staff were friendly. Helped me on multiple occasions. I like this location and will be back to see if I have a difference experience.

Great store in a really nice location. My only negative call out is that the parking lot is an absolute nightmare to pull into, park, and leave. Otherwise, the store and staff itself was clean, fully stocked, and really nice! It seems that this location had a bit more inventory than the Maple Grove location but I could be wrong. Overall, satisfied with our visit!

Nice Costco. Layout was different than what I was familiar with but was able to find everything I was looking for. Busy but clean. I was disappointed that I coundn‚Äôt find any gas pumps. There were tons of electric charging spots though.

This is the typical Costco I got to, and it was another good experience. Stocked very well, neat, organized and is a total marvel of human consumerism & consumption! Haha - I‚Äôm just always blown away by how many items are sold there per day and how efficient it operates.

Some guy in a red uniform thought he could open up a bag of chips and "sample" them. He tried to offer some to me and other customers, he said we could "sample" as well. Completely unacceptable behavior for a customer. I swear people have no respect these days.

Costco has many excellent products. I was grocery shopping on this day. I was able to buy a nice variety of foods that fit in my very restrictive diet. No Dairy, No Gluten, No processed meat, No coffee, alcohol, soda, juice, tea. Yet I still come home with satisfying food I look forward to eating. Sometimes it's hard to pass up the many delicious temptations. As they have so many delicious foods to choose from.

It's a Costco. Busy place had enough checkout help...but busy still. Prices outside of specials are notthing to jump up and down about.  Been a member for years. Don't Like seeing membership fees creeping up over the years the way they are... Normal membership  cost below.  Executive membership  is double basically. . And remember, if you don't  like being ask for your receipt and things searched  over before you walk out the door then  these places are not for you. I don't don't like it either  and somewhat annoying when in a hurry, but whatever.

$60 ‚Äì June 2017

IMHO really overrated. The place is mad busy on the weekends, so much so it is hard to get in and out. It is designed to entice you to 1) buy too much and 2) buy things you don't need. Better off going to your local place for groceries. The prices here are not competitive and the quality is not noticeably better. It isn't a bad place but it is bad for your pocketbook. Don't become part of the cult.

Never had this kind of experience before in a Costco. I used to live in Florida, currently living in Greenville, and now on vacation in Charleston. I was about to go ahead and do my shopping for my stay, and as soon as I step a foot in, they start questioning me about my service dog, who is also an emotional support animal, take into note that they asked me in a very rude tone. (Shouldn‚Äôt be saying this but he assists me with anxiety and panic attacks). When I asked them why I wasn‚Äôt allowed to go in, they said that it was because he‚Äôs not a trained dog, or a service animal, which he clearly is. They didn‚Äôt even want to look at his ID or to see his belt. None of that. I won‚Äôt come back to any Costco location, and I will make sure to take this with legal representation because my dog should be allowed anywhere. The manager or the supervisor (I don‚Äôt know what she was, sorry) she was super rude, and didn‚Äôt even do the right procedure. (Ask for his ID, what type of service animal he was, nothing) absolutely disappointing, never had this problem in a Costco before.

Had outstanding service from mgr Kevin at Charleston Costco regarding a return I thought was missing attachments. He was very professional and went the extra mile to help. Just wanted to recognize the great customer service.

I have never had issues with Costco until moving to South Carolina and dealing with this costco. We dropped our kids glasses off at optometry. They said about 7 days. Got a text saying order is ready. Took our kids since it was their glasses. She opens my son‚Äôs case and it was my daughter frame and his new lenses . They messed up both there glasses, so now my kids have to wear each others glasses, they are too tight and one is too loose. It took 4/5 people to get this resolved and they never resolved it. My kids are wearing glasses that fall off and too tight. The manager was annoyed and kept saying she‚Äôs past her time she was suppose to leave. My kids do not have spare glasses. I was frustrated . I got home and tried to email/ support for Costco, they said to call manager. I called and all she did was apologize and my kids are on a little over a week without there right glasses. I picked up my kids other glasses today, the lady said nothing. Not friendly staff or good customer  service. I feel like Costco here sucks. Never any issues in Arizona. I need to get new glasses and i don't not think i will get our glasses there. I do not live close to this Costco, I‚Äôve been having to make several trips to get this figured out. I feel like no one at this Costco cares or wants to help resolved it. My kids will be without there glasses for two weeks, i don't even feel like dealing with this Costco/ optometry

For the most part, I have enjoyed shopping at Costco. They have an impressive selection of grocery items. However, last Friday (3/15), I went to purchase a MacBook and that is where I ran into trouble. I was unsure where to checkout. The lady at the customer service rudely replied to me, ‚ÄúElectronics!‚Äù She acted like I was an inconvenience to her. So I got into a checkout line and it was long. No big deal because I am used to long checkout lines at Costco. When I got to my turn to checkout, the lady at the checkout counter kept on pressuring me upgrade to an executive membership. I told her no thank you, but she kept on pressuring me to upgrade. I just wanted to buy the laptop. Finally, she backed off and I was able to purchase the laptop. Is it too much to ask to shop in peace?

I‚Äôve been a member for years and love Costco. My husband is always with me and we use his credit card to pay. It has never been an issue. Two times recently I have been asked to see which card I‚Äôm using to pay (out of nowhere, and honestly feeling a little targeted now). The cashiers have been extremely rude, stating the names don‚Äôt match and not allowing us to move forward with the transaction until we speak with a manager. The first time we spoke with the general manager who stated it shouldn‚Äôt be an issue since we are married and he‚Äôs with me using his card. I understand the membership is in my name, but I‚Äôm just really disappointed in the customer service. We spend a lot of money in there and have no problem taking our business elsewhere. It‚Äôs been very disheartening lately.

No early access shopping(for elderly & disabled),  horrible store hours, knock off of a sams club. Smaller than Sam's. limited stores around the location compared to Sam's club. Seems like a ghetto bulk supermarket. Very rude customers shopping there, bumping into each other, really felt like we were in a pinball machine. Very small parking lot, making it look like the drivers would hit one another left and right.
Doesn't except credit cards unless you, of course, sign up and use theirs. The only good quality is they have the few rare items you often don't find other places.

It‚Äôs nice. I can understand why people love it. I do wish they had a scanning feature like Sam‚Äôs because the lines are absolutely ridiculous. I‚Äôm all for a human touch, but nobody‚Äôs got time for that these days. Need to get in and out with kids. Plus digital receipt is common sense and standard these days. Costco‚Äôs is behind the times. We have a good selection of food, premade meals, clothes, and any house where she could possibly imagine. If you can get there membership at a deal it‚Äôs worth it otherwise it‚Äôs kind of pricey.

Wonderful place with an amazing organic selection and great prices. Staff are very helpful and kind and every purchase made is a justified one. The vendors are very sweet and charismatic and passionate about their job. This is an amazing store and I'm glad that Canada also has Costco!

This store is well organized and well stocked. The staff is friendly. The gas prices are (on this day) 20 cents lower than anyplace I have seen in this area. If you go on the weekend just know the store is extremely busy.

I am writing to express my disappointment and frustration with my recent experience at the Costco Tire Center. On March 28, I visited the center to have one of my tires fixed and inadvertently left $245 in my car. Unfortunately, when I returned to pick up my vehicle, the money was missing.

While I acknowledge that forgetting the money was my mistake, I was further frustrated by the lack of professionalism and empathy shown by the employees and managers. I expected a higher level of service and integrity from a reputable establishment like Costco.

I hope that Costco will take steps to address this issue and ensure that their employees are trained to handle customer property with care and respect. I also hope that they will implement measures to prevent similar incidents in the future.

As a loyal customer, I am disappointed that my trust was breached in this way. I hope that Costco will take my feedback seriously.

I used to love this place. I still love the products and the employees, but it's TOO BUSY. Every day there is now as busy as if it were Christmas season. You can barely move around. This is exacerbated by the access problems. There are only two entry points to the parking lot, and they are horribly congested, and parking is awful. COSTCO, PLEASE GIVE US AN ADDITIONAL STORE! Until then, I highly recommend going to the Costco in Spartanburg instead. Parking is easy and open (behind the mall), and the store is not nearly as congested.

Complaint Regarding Found the Dragon fly in the Spinach Bag

I am writing to express my concern and file a complaint regarding a Dragon fly found in a bag of spinach that I purchased from Costco . I have attached clear photos for your reference.

As a loyal customer, I am concerned about the quality and safety of your products.

I kindly request the following:
1. A thorough investigation into this matter.
2.Assurance of steps taken to prevent similar incidents in the future.

I believe prompt attention to this matter is crucial to maintaining the trust of your customers. I look forward to your prompt response.

Thank you

Sincerely,
Kavitha

I love Costco but this facility was so OVERCROUDED it felt unsafe. Parking and driving on the grounds were an example of all that overcrowding does to an otherwise great facility.  Cars crawling at a snail's pace jockeying for position as if in competition. The long lines for checkout inside were a pleasure compared to the entry and exit of the parking lot. Like all Costco's great offerings.

Tight Parking with lots of traffic.

I was there mid day on a Monday and it was packed.

$1.89 per lb Kirkland Spiral Ham for Easter.  Various treasure hunt items.  Was disappointed they didn't have a big annual and flowering container section.

Gas lines were very long and gas price is not posted so it's always exciting to see what you'll pay.  This trip was a winner @ $3.09 gallon.

The aisles in this Costco seem to be much narrower and tight than other Costcos and can be frustrating when they are really busy.

Costco still doesn't provide wifi.

So apparently Costco wholesale doesn‚Äôt recognize anyone rights in the state of South Carolina and tell members who are legally open carry in the store to leave. This is a direct violation of our rights as Americans and residents of South Carolina. I encourage all residents of this great state to NOT shop or do any type of business transactions with Costco wholesale and I will encourage people to contact Your state representatives and have Costco banned from doing business in South Carolina indefinitely.

I love visiting Costco on vacation, especially to pick up locally roasted coffee as a practical souvenir, and to see what other items are carried locally that I don‚Äôt typically see at my home store.

I've been a customer of Costco but decided to leave this review today because of my experience. Giving three stars only because the lady from the check out counter was making a face when I mentioned that I'll be doing two separate transactions (already divided my stuff in two so all she has to do is scan it and give me the total so I can pay it.) I would've given five stars because JP, the one packing my stuff, understood what I wanted right away and was assisting me and explaining to the cashier what I wanted but still the cashier was making a face like she didn't wanna work there. JP has excellent customer service. He deserves a raise. This was on 01/06/2023 around 1pm.

When we went to get our membership, one of us previously had a membership under an old address. We were given a hard time because the added person had a different address from what was on file, even though both our IDs matched now, the file just needed to be updated because clearly we moved since 5 years ago when the account was last active. The membership purchasing experience took over 20 minutes and was full of upsell pitches.

When we come back the next visit, we watched many people walk in without their IDs checked, and yet we were stopped to check ours.

Get to the checkout, ID checked again (this time everyone was checked, so not as big of a deal).

Get to the checkpoint on the way out, ID checked for a third time (though those in front of us weren‚Äôt) and our items were counted not once, but twice.

They treat even their members as common criminals.

Costco Optical - staff is very friendly how ever quality of prescription glasses is average. I recently had to use my spare glasses that I keep safe in my study table in a case and was out for a walk with my wife and I felt a snap on my cheek and she heard a popping sound, in a Blink one of the lenses in my glasses had sprung out and went far somewhere almost like a slingshot that even after two of use searching for it, it could not be found.
Clearly the lens was not mounted properly and I can understand product mistakes can happen but Costco told me it‚Äôs made 3 years ago and is out of warranty. Left a bad taste in my mouth as it was an expensive Mont Blanc frame and can have a manufacturers fault or workmanship should be owned by them for life of such a product. I would have to shell out $200+ !!

If you go in for a few items and try to use self checkout (to avoid lines with much larger carts) just know they will ‚Äúdivide‚Äù the self- checkout into left and right lanes and most times out of sheer bad luck you will end up having people who were behind you now be ahead of you for no reason. I get Costco‚Äôs logic- they are trying to break up the line from being backed-up towards the aisles‚Ä¶ but this is also bad customer service and customers are agitated that despite numerous complaints they have done nothing. I talked to a manager today (again) and I honestly don‚Äôt see them doing anything as this wasn‚Äôt the first time we‚Äôve spoken to them. Customers online were visibly annoyed.

Just be aware that self check-out is probably just as long as regular checkout due to this. May the odds be in your favor!

Checking out different Costco locations while traveling is a hobby of mine. I love seeing what new-to-me products are carried and inevitably always find something to take home. The Costco in Myrtle Beach was no exception. I had so much fun walking the aisles and wish my store carried garbanzo beans, Chomps, Good Crisp, Kettle & Fire, etc. Great store!

Awesome location, lots of great travel/water/summer gear/needs...it was insanity at 11am though.
SUPERB customer service and great willingness to try to help, especially for an out of towner. I couldn't find an umbrella for the beach because they sold out but that didn't stop them trying to help assist me and come up with something else.
They had so many things there I'd wish I'd known sooner. It's a really big location, tons of goodies.

Costco use to be a 5 star. But now it is a 4 star. Great products Great prices Store is really clean. The drop for me was the employee's. There are becoming more aggressive and less helpful with customers. Other people are saying the same thing.
Some staff was very kind and helpful, but the other wasn‚Äôt.

Not as good as Sam's Club.  Sam's club has automatic checkout and scanning on your phone. No waiting in line like in Costco. Sam's club accepts all major credit cards. Costco only accepts Visa cards.  Sam's club gives you $2,000 back when you purchase a car, Costco only gives you $1,000.  Sam's club gives you $1,000 veterans money back when you buy a car. Costco only gives you $500. Sam's club's premium membership is cheaper than Costco's,  and Sam's club also gives you 3% cash back. Costco only gives you 2 percent.  Sam's club meat products are a lot less expensive than Costco's.  I can go on and on, but what's the point.  You'll need to check it for yourself? I have memberships to both clubs and have had them for 25 years.  I shop Costco when I can't find certain products in Sam's.  I like variety.

I have just had the worst experience ever in the 20 plus years I have been a Costco member. Slowly over the years since Price Club became Costco it has replaced quite a large number of items with Kirkland products but has ALWAYS honored their return policy without question. Until recently! I had purchased 2 sets of windshield wiper blades. One set I used immediately and held on to the second set for future use. During this time I sold the car they fit and obviously forgot about the wiper blades in the garage still in their original packaging. After discovering the product recently I took them into the return department. Although the young lady who helped me was very polite she needed to ask the manager about the return. The so called manager Aaron (who refused to give a last name) refused the return. Also requested a receipt and accused me of possibly buying the item at Walmart and scamming Costco. Turns out that Costco switched vendors from Goodyear to Michelin products. This should not be the customers problem that they can‚Äôt get credit for the returned item. Costco corporate may want to address this with their so called manager Aaron(no last name) and possibly send him back through training. Or at least over to the Costco Vision Center so he can read the sign that‚Äôs right above the door.

My experience in the tire shop was very disappointing.

I brought my truck in for tire replacement on 2/24/2023 at 9:30 AM at the Costco in Spartanburg, SC. When I picked up the vehicle, they said that three of the tire sensors were not working with an ‚Äúoh well‚Äù attitude. I told them that I have never had an issue with any sensor and they worked perfectly fine before they serviced them as part of the tire installation package. Sure enough, about 15 miles after leaving the store a warning light came on and the vehicle could no longer read pressure on three of the tires. Could one go bad in the three hours they had my vehicle? Highly unlikely, but possible. Could 3? That would be impossible.

In trying to deal with the shop, they were really snarky and questioned that they were working, sarcastically saying "this is my question to you since you are my expert, another learning moment for me."  I would not expect such an unprovoked lack of respect and professionalism from anyone in any sort of leadership capacity.

As for the tires, I ended up purchasing a reprogramming tool on Amazon at my expense to reprogram the sensors as the shop should have done in the first place.  Surprise, surprise, my supposedly broken sensors now work just fine.

I've been a member for 20 years and have had nothing but positive experiences at other Costco stores.  If this is what is tolerated by store management, I will take my business elsewhere and am strongly reconsidering my executive membership.  There are more choices in the market.

I had a terrible experience with one of their cashiers. First off, he seemed obviously stressed at the amount of stuff we were buying. It‚Äôs Costco, what do you expect?!
Was short with me. Then, when he scanned something he had already scanned I corrected him, ‚Äúoops you scanned that already!‚Äù He frantically looked at his computer and did not respond to me. I made sure to thank him for all his hard work. No response from him. Okay‚Ä¶ I thought, then his associate apologized and said how overworked and short staffed they were. ‚ÄúOkay, I‚Äôm sorry to hear that.‚Äù I said and thought, you can still respond to me, come on! And then responded with, ‚ÄúI understand this must be hard for you guys but customer service is important!‚Äù
He is obviously (and also shared this) being overworked and underpaid but doesn‚Äôt have an ounce of customer service skills nor regulation skills. Made it seem like I was a burden and my fault when he mis-scanned our many items purchased. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs a him problem or the whole Costco management team at this location. Left me feeling shaken up‚Äî not a good way to feel after spending lots of money at an establishment. Oh and when I got home (an hour away) I realized he had in fact scanned two extra items resulting in $30 extra dollars paid. Oh well, but wanted to share in case you would rather drive to the other, better reviewed Costco nearby‚Ä¶

Everything easy to find. If other customers would go, find what they want and get out, there would be smooth traffic flow. However, some believe it is a fellowship hall where they can park in the aisles and have a party with an acquaintance they just ran into and rudely block others from passing. Great place to shop, perfect place to become a rude a--hole.

We stop here went driving on I 26 since it is an easy on and off the interstate. The gasoline prices are usually less expensive than other gasoline stations. The Costco store has lots of quality items we get while there. The people working there are friendly and efficient. There is a snack bar there that has folks order at a kiosk which appears to work well for those using there.

Had a great shopping experience here. Customer service was very helpful. Lots of good deals and gas was very cheap. They had a great selection of plants. Food court is an amazing deal! The two of us ate for 5 bucks and left full. The food tasted very good. I love the fact that they had plenty of sample stations for you to try food. Honestly wound up buying stuff we never would have thought of just because we were able to taste it. Also we sampled stuff that we didn't like that we were going to buy so I think that is very good I wish other superstores like this did that more often. They're main competitor that we also have membership at very rarely does it anymore. The store overall was very clean and well kept up and constantly stocked with products. Will definitely be coming here more often from now on.

What can be said of a wholesale bulk store? One always knows what season to prepare for by the seasonal offerings that seem to be on time, thirteen weeks ahead of schedule.
Some Korean food favorites (that are sorely needed, and were surprised to see in Brookfield) have since disappeared, wish they kept those items, and expanded the offerings.

Costco‚Äôs return policy is the best!

One gripe is the hours, esp for weekend eve hours, particularly for the gas on Sundays

I don't know how to rate Costco.  I just go for a few odds and ends.  It's not like they carry organic foods really.  It's no different than any other wholesale.
I do give 5 stars to the staff at Costco Brookfield CT.  Very very helpful and love their politeness üíñ

I recently visited Costco Brookfield and found the experience to be a bit confusing. While the store itself offers a wide range of products at great prices, I was disappointed by the lack of uniformity among the staff. It was challenging to identify who worked there, which made seeking assistance to find specific items a bit frustrating. It would be helpful if the staff wore uniforms for easier identification. Overall, while I appreciate the variety and value Costco offers, the inconsistency in staff attire detracted from the shopping experience.

After traveling back and forth from different doctor appointments my family needed some supplies for our household, so we thought of going to Costco.

On that note Jennifer and I wanted to take the time to thank the Costco Family (Brookfield), I say family because every person there is family and are part of a closed knit family working together to provide for others! That helps all of our families, through all walks of life!

Thank you all for your service.

Susan. Brenda. Victor. Karen. AJ. Farley. Jon. Austin. Nigel. Christina. Raheem. Richard. Edward.

And to the other employees whose names are not mentioned above, for all that you do for us that can go unappreciated, again and again thank you for your service from our hearts to yours.

Remember the smallest kind gesture from the heart can speak volumes!

Mac also says thank you for the Absorbent Pads!

Delicious Hot Dogs for $3!
Cotsco is the best on it's own way. This time in East Lyme location impression remains same infact lot more positive than the south Windsor one.

I am thrilled with my new Bosch Refrigerator. It is surprising how much larger it is than our old side by side Kitchen Aid.
Ordering on-line was very easy for this 70‚Äôish year old. Everything went smoothly on the day and time we expected it!
The communication from COSTCO was exceptional, every step of the way!
The delivery men were amazing!
They had many techniques for this huge delivery that made it look easy!  They were professional and efficient!  They were very accommodating and took away our old fridge.
The only thing lacking was for them to wipe down the outside of my appliance to remove their fingerprints.

Thank you COSTCO for making the whole process possible and easy!

This is specifically to address the optical center: in the past, I‚Äôve had nothing but good experiences here. Recently, the place has become impossible, defective, and infuriating. They don‚Äôt have enough opticians working to accommodate the number of customers. You have to take a number and wait. They move at a snail‚Äôs pace, and seem to be looking for anything else to do instead of helping the people waiting. I dropped off a pair of glasses on March 1 to have new lenses put in. They told me a week and a half, and they‚Äôd call.  In the past, this usually meant a week, and I‚Äôd get a text. After a week, I was there shopping, and just thought I‚Äôd check to see. They wouldn‚Äôt even look at me without a number, and there were eight people waiting, so I left. Yesterday, I tried calling, but they weren‚Äôt picking up the phone. I called the service desk and the woman actually offered to walk over to see if my glasses were in. Indeed, they were just sitting there! She told me there was eight people in line there and only two opticians and recommended I come later. I decided to be the first one there this morning, and was waiting outside at 9:40. Other people were already there. When that door opened, I literally ran to the optical shop, and there was another woman who ran in through the exit to do the same thing. I beat her to the punch, and got the first number. We sat down in the only two chairs there to wait, as there was no optician there yet. We commiserated, and she had essentially the same story as me, having gone in one day last week at 10:15, only to find eight people ahead of her, and a wait of an hour and a half. She picked up new glasses that had a problem and had to be returned. Well, today when the optician finally arrived, he began puttering around the counter, but avoided dealing with the customers at all costs. Finally, he waved me up. Right out of the box, he commented, ‚Äúwell, there‚Äôs a problem right there.‚Äù It turned out that they only put the correct coatings on one lens, but no coatings on the other. The glasses needed to be sent back to the lab. I explained my saga to him and that I‚Äôm a pilot who needs correct glasses to fly in the morning. He told me he could offer me express shipping to and from the lab on the West Coast, and that‚Äôs great, but it doesn‚Äôt help me for tomorrow morning when I have to fly. It also means that I will lose at least another couple of hours to accomplish the simple task of having updated lenses installed in my glasses. Fast forward: when the glasses came back the second time, they had NO COATING ON EITHER LENS! They had to be sent back to the West Coast a third time. I was told they would be expedited. I still don‚Äôt have them. As of last night (MAY 2nd!), the manager told me, ‚Äúyour frames are at the lab. I called and encouraged them to make your lenses.‚Äù I began this process when I was still wearing a winter coat. Now I‚Äôm wearing shorts and a T-shirt, and I still don‚Äôt have my eyeglasses! With this, I have decided that the better prices at the Costco optical center don‚Äôt end up saving me anything. With all of the wasted time and trips, and all of the unnecessary aggravation, it‚Äôs the same as paying double at LensCrafters. It‚Äôs too bad, really. He told me he‚Äôs the manager of the optical center and he tells the general manager they need more opticians behind the counter, but that it falls on deaf ears. He asked me to express my frustration in writing to the general manager. I‚Äôm using this platform to do just that. I hope they may read this and fix their broken optical center. In the meantime, I may just dispute the charge with my credit card company.

This store only has one way in and one way out.  Went to the store during busy hours and that was a mistake.  It took over an hour just to leave the parking lot due to congestion.  Drivers were cutting each other off.  It was stressful.  Called the store about twenty minutes into it, and they didn't do anything.

Costco has great prices for many items. It's well worth the membership cost for most things, if you have space to buy in bulk or you have a large family and go through things quickly or need to buy in large quantities. They do sell other items in smaller quantities, clothes, and some fresh foods that benefit anyone. The stock changes up frequently always giving something new to try, while the core items you rely on are usually always available. There are also some great deals on things if you keep an eye out for them.
The only thing I'm not a fan of is the constant attention from the employees treating everyone like they are a thief. You have to show your card upon entering the store, before you can check out your products, and your cart is inspected against the receipt on the way out. I understand wanting to reduce shrinkage and membership sharing, but to be frank, that's not my problem as someone who both has a membership and shops with honesty. It reduces the customer experience to be scrutinized when you have not and will not do anything wrong. This is clearly not something that only bothers me, but yet it continues regardless. Maybe if the check happened only once at the register it would be less frustrating and more understandable since it is impossible to check out without a card, even if you walk in the store without one. This is also the only store that I shop at which checks my purchases as I leave.

Executive Membership is deceptive if not an outright scam

I‚Äôve been a loyal shopper, fan of Costco and a ‚ÄòGold Star Executive member‚Äô for years.

I‚Äôm single, shop for me only, but thought one day, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never even received one penny kick back for the executive membership. Why have it? Maybe I just don‚Äôt spend enough‚Äù

Turns out I‚Äôve been throwing money away for years.

Anyone want to guess where your Executive rewards voucher comes? In your renewal mailer.
A renewal mailer that has ZERO outward markings on the envelope indicating your rewards voucher is inside. Literally zero.

Costco ‚Äòconveniently‚Äô offers membership renewal at the pump, I do it. Guess where the renewal mailer goes? Trash.
Costco ‚Äòconveniently‚Äô offers membership renewal at checkout. I do it. Guess where the renewal mailer goes? Trash.

No reminder at checkout renewal about my rewards.  No email about rewards. No mailer with any outward markings about my rewards. Nothing.
I can only imagine the 10‚Äôs of millions of dollars Costco doesn‚Äôt pay out simply because of this clearly planned deceitful strategy.

After talking to a friend about it, I opened my last renewal mailer. I had already renewed at the pump but, lo and behold, a $148 voucher was inside.

While it might be hard to outwardly claim this is a scam, this is certainly corporate deception at its finest, and I thought more of Costco as a business.
That‚Äôs on me.

You'll never find better service employees and management than here. Everyone is exceptional, friendly and helpful. It is always a pleasure to shop there with great products and deals. Kirkland brand items, the Costco brand can never be beaten by any other brand. Returns are effortless and unquestioned. The food court has great, inexpensive foods that complete the shopping day. Try the hotdog and refill drink...1/2 pounds of pure beef with toppings for only $1.50...the best food deal in the world. Their pizzas are great and inexpensive. The Sample People are all friendly. The pharmacy is swift and highly cost effective. The gas prices are always the lowest in the area.

I usually come here with my friends and every time I come it‚Äôs usually an issue while I understand that they have to check the IDs when walking in but every time we go to the checkout line they tell my friends that I can‚Äôt purchase anything because I don‚Äôt have the membership, once a lady had asked me to wait away from the checkout until my friends finished. Now when we get to the exit it‚Äôs always another hassle. I‚Äôll watch other families and people just walk through the exit and the person checking receipts literally just looks at the cart and lets them leave. Now when it was time for me and my friends the lady had to count every single item that was in the cart. The time it took for her to count it about 3 other people left through the other line. Now I‚Äôm not accusing anyone of anything but I do believe that the color of my skin influenced the way I was treated. If I have to be treated differently every time I shop here then I just won‚Äôt shop here anymore and my friends agree they‚Äôll cancel their membership.

We love our local Costco s!! We go for a certain thing and always end up getting more!! Lol  We pick up a rotisserie chicken whenever we go . The Mums are bigger than I've ever seen and healthy. Always a great visit .

I prefer shopping here rather than West Springfield. Parking is always a nightmare at either store. These stores are packed on most days but the Enfield store is less crowded. If I see a checkout line that stretches the whole length of the store, as it does in West Springfield, I won't purchase anything. The cashiers at Enfield are pretty nice and helpful as well.

I love costco but this is the worst costco I've ever be3n to and so poorly run its ridiculously embarrassing.  It hurts me to write a negative thing about costco but good lord there was no staff available the few that were were rude and nasty not willing to help don't blame them to be honest they are overworked and need help. The only good thing was the food counter was fast as heck.

Busy but that's expected, the prices and quality are amazing as always
I also had no idea you could buy a full jungle gym there lol

We absolutely love Costco and this location in particular. They always have great products and their staff is on point. Shout out to the self check out folks who work the weekends - incredibly helpful and actually have a smile and a good attitude. Wish the parking lot was designed better. Soooo many people it‚Äôs crazy trying to navigate it

So first of all, it's Costco - so of course you're going to find great deals if you're willing to buy in bulk and the liquor store on the side is great find as well. In both cases a limited selection, but I find the their Kirkland brand to be pretty good.

Two downsides, it's so crowded at all times so be ready with some patience as you're shopping and at check out, wish they had Scan and Go to be more convenient.

Then, I do find that the prices are just a pinch higher than Sam's Club so I wish they could be a bit more competitive.

My experience at Costco

Very nice grocery store with plenty of parking. Grocery carts are also available for people with physical disabilities, giving them an automatic one. Like everything is bigger in Texas, everything is bigger in Costco and everything is cheaper aswell, but to shop at Costco, you need to pay the 90$ yearly fee.

Overall my experience was great. Highly recommended.

2 stars on todays visit. I left my 14 year old daughter to stand in line at self check out while I ran to grab something. There was many people in front of me so I knew I had more then enough time. The women at the self check out checking Costco cards told my daughter that if I‚Äôm not back then she can‚Äôt start checking out & she exchanged other words with her- along with that she isn‚Äôt the picture that‚Äôs on the card and that she can‚Äôt use the membership at the register. I just got back and I‚Äôm standing behind the women that told that to my daughter I asked if there was a problem. And she said well I told her she can‚Äôt check out. I told the women I said she looks like like the card meaning I‚Äôm the one with the membership. The woman rolled her eyes and said go to register 1 right now- demanding.

This was by far the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had here at this Costco.. my last visit last month Jason (tall male always at check out) was super nice and VERY helpful. The women today needs to have an attitude check like no other.

Love Costco. Don‚Äôt love how the employees use the family restroom as their own restroom. Last four times I‚Äôve visited, waiting for the family restroom, to change my 9 month daughter. Only to have an employee come out.

I went to tire place to patch up the tire due to nail in it. The employee did really poor joy!! That time store was about close so I didn't look at the repair ed tire and wheel, but after couple of weeks I found my rim was scratched, there was new cut on tire wall and and my tire presser recommended by Toyota is 35 psi but repair technician put over pressure which was actually 42psi?? I have reported my incident to tire center manager and he allow me to fill out the claim form, and I hope Costco is going to take a responsibility!!
.. Nice clean store üè¨üè™üõí super friendly ppl. I really enjoy to go and shop around. At least twice a week I go there for my all needs!!
Costco gas is clean and cheap too. Mostly I buy my all organic foods as much as possible üôÜ Fruits, vegetables, and frozen organics.. They have great deal all the times!!
Only complain I have so far, this particular store is not big enough to carry my favorite "Organic Whole milk Greek Yogurt". I have talk to sales associates couple times but there is no hope, only frustratin. Please carry.. Thank you.

Why must it be so hard to find things here? I can only assume that is some master plan of corporate. At Sam's every aisle is clearly marked what is in that aisle and there is some rhyme or reason to it.  If you want English Muffins or Hot Dog Rolls, you would think it would be with the other bread items in Bakery. Nope, a whole different part of the store next to Pharmacy! Why???  Costco doesn't even have a sign out front on the road. Why?  Very easy to mistakenly turn into Target's parking lot.  Costco needs to at the very least copy Sam's Club. Aisles clearly marked, an App so you can avoid the registers, merchandise placed where you would expect it to be.  I wont be renewing our membership.
I love the cheap polyester clothes. They are so comfy and the same quality as the 100 dollar Lululemon.

I love costco and this costco is no different. the layout is very nice and there is good stuff everywhere! there are a suitable amount of check out lines so even if it‚Äôs busy, you aren‚Äôt waiting more than a few minutes. employees are helpful, and stock is generally good.
Be warned, if you go too late on weekends, the bananas may be all gone üò¢üçå. also certain eggs are sometimes out of stock when it gets late. parking is ok usually, and if the upper lot is full, there are plenty of spots in the garage below with an elevator and ramps to get up to the store. it can be congested in the lot to get in and out but it‚Äôs worth it to shop at such a fine place. they also do a good job with seasonal and holiday products. always something for someone.
fairlife 30g bottle packs are only 2 per customer üò¢üò¢but it‚Äôs ok

Loved Costco. Cannot enter with out a Costco card!! There are great deals and I was shocked to see the crazy options they have from the clothing to the meat to the sweets and toys. Prices weren't so bad.

It's a convenient location with great service but the parking lot is difficult to navigate with all the traffic. I'm aware and recognize that Costco has bought the neighboring property to expand their parking lot. However, I think they could improve their parking lot traffic if they had a zone dedicated to mobile orders. I think if Costco was able to figure out how to accomplish that feature, they could not only reduce their carbon footprint, and lower parking lot congestion, but maximize profit margin as well. Maybe they could fence-in part of the downstairs garage with mobile orders? It would help for the people who want a quick in-and-out.

My wife and I just became Costco members and we went to the Norwalk location. The parking lot was insanely busy and not the easiest to navigate. Once inside we went and got our cards. It was a pretty easy process, they just took our pictures and printed out the cards. We did need to show valid IDs before getting them. Afterwards, we went shopping and overall it was a good experience. It was pretty busy but we made it through the store and found what we needed. The prices are great and check out was not bad at all. I'd recommend Costco for anyone looking bulk buying and reasonable prices. Giving this location four out of five stars due to the parking situation.
All the staff in the Hearing Aid Center are top notch. Highly knowledgeable and skilled,  combined with friendliness and a real interest in the member-patients.

I thought Costco had one of the best customer service in the industry. My second time buying water and not an employee in sight so I could get this heavy thing scanned.

If your employees are all busy checking IDs at the self checkout, at least leave the stupid hand held scanners at the counter.

Home Depot does and they don‚Äôt have checkers at the door and they‚Äôre still haven‚Äôt gone bankrupt.

Costco a Multi Billion $$$  business but can‚Äôt afford to leave the hand held scanners at self checkout

Was a bit leery about purchasing a laptop at Costco.  But this HP Dragonfly I7 with Win11 Pro is a sweet little set up!  AND I get 90 days to love it or lump it!  Enjoying it so far. And the price for it's specs were out of this world.

This location is a little out of the way for me but worth it. They have halal chicken from Crescent Foods. It's also a nice, clean store. And for kosher readers, there's a few kosher meat options. Not sure about which certificate though.

The TV selection is pretty solid too. Better than the Costco near me.

Better to spend time checking your product's expiry than your customers' ID multiple times. On 01/08/24, I bought madeleine cakes. Later, I checked the sell-by date at home and found it was 1/7. Consequently, I returned it, but no apology was given. During that time, I noticed another cake box on the shelf with a past sell-by date. Dear Costco, please prioritize checking your product's sell-by dates over inconveniencing customers with multiple document checks (ID and receipts). Even airports with the highest security protocols check documents only twice, whereas Costco checks three times (entry, check out, and exit).

My recent visit to the local Costco Superstore left me with mixed feelings about the shopping experience. While there were some positive aspects, there were also a few shortcomings that I couldn't ignore.
Starting on a positive note, the sheer size of the store is impressive. It's a retail giant with a vast selection of products ranging from electronics and clothing to household essentials and groceries

The downside of the Costco is they don‚Äôt have any label for aisle. So it‚Äôs really hard to find product. Which is not a good thing for the customer. Another thing is each step they are looking for their membership card which is kind of annoying.

Overall I like prefer Costco then Bj‚Äôs. They have more variety of products but they need some improvements.

8-09-23/ The store was very clean and had a lot of samples throughout the store. (I don‚Äôt partake with the samples)We went to Costco for two items only, Costco disposable toilet tissue wipes.  They didn‚Äôt have any!!!  We then went to get half and half.  They didn‚Äôt have any!!! I then decided I wanted something sweet, oatmeal raisin and sugar cookies are my favorites. They didn‚Äôt have sugar cookies and I had to buy the triple pack just to get a few oatmeal cookies $9.99, price was a little too high. We did purchase the rotisserie chicken which was cooked well, and was delicious.  Then , when it‚Äôs time to checkout( self checkout) you are carded before you go use the self checkout.  Then on the way out your receipt is checked to be sure you are not stealing. I definitely do not like the constant monitoring of your identity. But, I do understand it is the company policies that you agree to as a member.

Ohhh my I missed sample Friday. It was a treat while I waited for my tire rotation did a little shopping had a hot dog. The people that work here are so polite and helpful. Ms Valerie was a treat of a person, warm and welcoming personality.. Nice meeting you
Fantastic prices and quality of products; second to none return policy.  They will never let you down and rarely run out of items.  Great employees that are always willing to help!

They have lots of good products in bulk at fair prices. The fact they sell liquor and you don't need a membership is very nice, but a plus when you are going there already. The only two things I don't really care for is the way traffic is routed to get into the parking lot, it creates a fair amount of congestion, in conjunction with the face most people are busy staring at their phones while driving instead of keeping traffic moving. The place is always a mad house unless you go very early. The people around the bottle returns don't make room for the people coming in and out of the store so it can create backup just trying to get in. Most people are in such a rush inside the store they're more concerned with getting in line front of you than just letting you by. These are not Costo's problems, more people problems, why I still have them 5 stars. I always come prepared with a list and go where I need to and leave as quickly as possible. I do like their gas and am willing to wait in line if I need fuel. Their gas is rated among the top best fuels you can put in your vehicle.

This place is great. Huge selection like what you would expect from any typical costco. Likes are not too long, and there was plenty of staff on the floor available to help. Customer service will take a return in any condition for any reason.

I‚Äôve had an executive membership for 2nd year now and right after I didn‚Äôt renew membership to Sam‚Äôs. Costco has much better prices and sales. The store is much cleaner and organized. They have larger selection of products and better quality.

I love the frozen vegetable selection and that they have vegetarian items! Everything is of high quality and I am never disappointed with selections.

Mostly, I purchase the gas because top tier. And the price is always much lower than gas at convenient stores. And unlike Sam‚Äôs there are plenty of pumps and even if crowded the wait isn‚Äôt long. There is also plenty of parking at the store. No such thing as driving around to find a parking space like you tend to at Sam‚Äôs.

Yesterday my young neighbor accompanied me and he wanted a hot dog. The hot dog is beef plus you get a soda and only $1.50. The hot dog was about 7 or 8 inches long and he said it was very good! The deli is very clean and they also have an ATM machine next to it. While waiting on hot dog the lady made ice cream sundaes for a customer and they looked delicious! I think I may go back today and get one; strawberry!! üòÉ

And they have beautiful Christmas decorations at a very reasonable price. I actually love this store because always so very organized and neat!! I‚Äôm OCD üòâ

I highly recommend purchasing a membership. You will not be disappointed and just like me; you‚Äôll never return to Sam‚Äôs! There is really no competition!!!

This is a photo of Connie.  I was in the store and wanted to cross from the returns to the regular part of the store and she is incredibly inflexible and does not use her head.  She insisted that i walk outside and then walk back into the store.  I showed her my membership but that was not good enough for her.  Why does she care.  She seems to be a person that has control issues.  I would prefer people that have common sense.  This person is very much stuck in a very small box and does not have any sense.  What is the big deal??

She tried to keep me from posting her photo.

Love shopping here.  It can be pretty chaotic, but there is a large, varied selection of just about anything you can imagine.  Prices are very competitive with other wholesale clubs.

Only suggestion I have is that if receipts are checked upon exiting, even though members are checked out by Costco employees, why is there not also a 'Scan -n- Go' -type feature within the app like Sam's Club has?  Definitely would beat standing in the checkout line for 15+ minutes, then again for 5-10 mins just to get out of the door.

I greatly appreciated KD helping with my tire just before closing. He could have easily told me to come back the next day but took time out of his evening to make sure we were safe to continue our trip.

Large and open.  Random selection of stuff and not the same when you go back.  So if you discover something you like it may not be there when you return.  Prices are okay on some things but not the lowest either.
It‚Äôs an entire city housed inside ‚Ä¶ courteous staff  ‚Ä¶ organized and efficient ‚Ä¶ everything is available
Friendly people, quick unloading. That was my experience as a truck driver. My appointment was at 8AM but they took me at 6AM. Here‚Äôs the Receiving hours, It will sure help another driver. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Our one and only Costco around. Store is nice and clean, staff are always friendly.  Good deals always, we like to get our meat and fish here. It can get very busy. Some people make it hard for others to shop by standing around when it's busy with carts in the way.

If bulk buying makes sense for you and/or your family, it's easy to see why their market cap is what it is. I give it five stars because for as crazy as it is in there (I've been on the brink of panic attacks once or twice), I've found some really great buys there and you have to give it up to the employees who have to deal with the hoards of people racing past each other to get out. They get the 5 stars.

Costco is the perfect place to get just about everything and their selection of GF items is huge! I always know I can get what I need and at a fair price for the quantity. The downside to this huge shopping experience is that it always seems to be busy. I went in during the middle of the day and found very few parking spaces available and every isle had customers in them. Such a huge place and so very busy but worth the haul every time.

Super duper Costco location. Wow . Loved this . Lots of options to buy electronics and other things - and the best thing is - it‚Äôs tax free :). We bought a couple of laptops and surely saved money on tax !  They have good inventory too.

Wish there were more people near computer area to help customers . It took us 10 mins to find out an associate to get a customer pick up slip for a laptop:  if not for the local help , I would have rated this store 5 stars . Billing was quick .parking is a bit crazy in this location. Liked it overall :)

Great selection of food and drinks. It has everything possible it amazing. Love their clothes as well. On weekends the samples are awesome! Always walk out with nice service.

Food you order like hot dog and drink is so cheap and affordable. Delicious beyond belief its lovely place.

Costco is my family‚Äôs favorite store to shop.  We love their deals, the way they treat us, and their unparalleled returns policy.  My family is an executive member for many years.  My experience today with George, one of the person that handle free food samples at this location is one of the rare regrettable one.  I took one of the free food samples and ate it.  I like it a lot so I took my little daughter who shopping with my wife in another aisle back to try and see if she likes it too.  The moment George saw me, he yelled at me ‚Äúyou already tried it, you shouldn‚Äôt do it again‚Äú in front of everyone.  I told him, that‚Äôs uncalled for!  It‚Äôs just a small piece of free sample!  Also, there is no sign saying a family can‚Äôt take more than one sample.  As a matter of fact, I saw multiple customers took more than one samples at one time and he didn‚Äôt say anything to them.  I may came back the second time but it‚Äôs still not right for him to embarrass me in front of everyone.  The reason Costco gave out free samples is to get customers buy more,  and that‚Äôs how I ended up buying tons of food I didn‚Äôt planned to buy multiple times before.  How would it help Costco sell more of anything when you are embarrassed your customers?  Please do better!

I have been a Costco Executive Member since 2002, and definitely appreciate the quality and value that they offer.
