Unfortunately this location is so overcrowded that it's making it difficult for me to continue shopping here.  It appears obvious that they need to open another location in the area to shift some of the demand off of this store. The lines to get gas, checkout, or even get a pizza are so long that I have given up more often, as I just don't have the time.  And the aisles are mobbed with shoppers, making it difficult to move.  If you go to this location, plan accordingly, and allow ample time.

Costco is the best! Very good products.  I just wish their isles would be labeled.  Sometimes I  just need to run in for a few things & don't have time to go down every isle looking for what I need.  It would help a lot if you had a store directory.  I have left before because I couldn't find what I was looking for & just went to my reg grocery store for items.

author_name: Amy Dahlke, Realtor - Reece Nichols Eastland
text: Costco has a great bakery section. We got some packs of Danish, and they were awesome. Their cheesecake and peanut butter pie are also some of our favorite things there. IMO, Costco has a better selection of most everything. We actually had a Costco and Sam's membership but dropped the Sam's Club because we just never went there when we could get better stuff at Costco.
There‚Äôs no staff on earth better than their pharmacy staff. Honestly, the only place I will ever feel like people are taking care of the small details.

I really enjoyed the shopping experience here, mostly for groceries. Dairy and meat products are always of good quality and tend to be good values, and this place is a staple for coffee. I also enjoy the samples, and sometimes busting the chops of the outside reps who try to push their wares a tad aggressively.  I like the fact that there‚Äôs almost always some sort of surprise that you don‚Äôt expect.

I had a great experience Saturday, April 23th with the Tire Center.  Want to shout out to Kevin, Matt and Garland for great customer service.  Good communication from all three guys.  I have always been pleased with your service.  Thanks to all involved.

Pleasant first time Costco experience.  Busy location.  Nice selections and prices are comparable to the other wholesale club.  Different choices was my reason for joining and I‚Äôm very pleased with my decision.  Shout out to Georgia at the customer service desk.  I‚Äôll be back.

Costco as always is a great value for the money. They have an annual fee but you can make up for the cost of the annual fee by the price of their gas and the value of their bulk pricing. Thy The Pizza pies and slices taste great and are a good value

A great place to meet for a very casual meal at the food court. You can't bear $1.50 for an all beef hot dog and medium drink. I love the soft serve ice cream for $1.99. Awesomely awesome and you don't have to be a member. Just enter through the exit door. The prices have been the same for years.

I bought LG 50 This is my first new TV purchase in 13 yrs.It has a lot to offer compared to what I had with more buttons to push. Wish they had included a little more info in a handbook how things work and  how to navigate the screen. I have always been a Samsung person but think this LG 50 was a good choice.

Sometimes you crave a Costco 1/4 lb beef hot dog for lunch and what a deal, still $1.50 and that includes a beverage!  Pic taken just after a rush, staff did a fantastic job cranking out orders and Sarah did awesome with mine.  Glad it slowed down a bit for them.  The crew at the food court has always been terrific, polite and friendly while everything is always clean!  A+ Service, great work!

These pictures are of the Sanus tv mount 360 full rotation. I live this location because it always carries Top Brands at least 25-40 percent off. I would comment on the rotisserie chicken and the food court‚Ä¶ but we all know that it‚Äôs Amazing. $1.50 for hotdog and drinküî•
October 23- still holding strong to my review- good job

There I find what I want at a reasonable price with best quality I can pay for anything. I love pizza at time after a long shopping we have a great time to bounce back energy this is the right place for shopping quality products with great durability. Costco means quality, excellent customer service at time. Everything we get is enough for a small and large families.

I am really disappointed by the Highlands Costco. Today is Mothers Day and my husband asked my 17 year old daughter to get some bunches of flowers at Costco prior to a party we were hosting. He gave her his membership card and when it came time to check out, the cashier told her she wouldn‚Äôt sell her the flowers because the card wasn‚Äôt hers. She offered to show her ID to substantiate who she was (again‚Äînot buying alcohol or purchasing prescriptions..:she was buying flowers‚Ä¶on Mothers Day!!!!)  and they refused her. She was embarrassed and we are besides ourselves. I wonder how Sam‚Äôs Club would have handled this.

I went to renew membership and was the only one in line and supervisor Callie wouldn‚Äôt even acknowledge me. After 5 mins another employee tried to assist but needed a manager over ride for some reason and Callie typed something in a computer and walked off still without a simple hello.  Then another issue with computer and we had to wait for Callie to come back.  Process took 25 mins of my day to get a Costco card and I was only one in line.  Had to deal with rude manager and not sure why someone with no customer service gets a supervisor role.  Rest of employees were friendly.

This was my second time at this location and I  was helped by an associate unloading boxes. I was in at around 1pm today and I couldn't find the non-bakery bread isle. This worker (that I didn't catch the name of) was extremely helpful! He showed us the different options and also he showed us the frozen unbaked loaves. Very nice guy! üëçüèªüëçüèª

Parents are visiting from out of town. Live in the same household with me for 6 months. Acting as a nice gesture they try to pay for grocery today. Cashier says no they can not. Is this really necessary?

Very fortunate to have an employee bring me an electric cart. Not only are the employees kind and helpful but so are the customers.  My mobility isn't that great at 81 and is getting worse.  It's difficult for me to get items out of refrigeration and some items that are heavy and put in my cart.  I was doing a substantial shopping ( 3 regular carts and my electric cart) thank goodness my grandson was with me, this time, to help.   Costco does have people who will help you shop.

I like Costco. But there is always so many people here on Saturday and that seems to be the only time I can get in as well. So be very careful when going through and navigating the parking lot. We are all on this Big Blue Rock hurtling through space together. If we don't look out for each other nobody else will.

Joined because of all the hype, really think Sam's is better and less crowded. There are some good things in here. Need to get with the times and have the checkout on the app.  Too long of lines and slow to get out.

I always love Costco. This is great Costco location.
It‚Äôs clean it has everything you could possibly think of. I love that they serve samples of some of  the food that they .  The food serving ladies especially Carol are very niceüòä. I will remain a Costco customer.

This has been my favorite Costco for years. I even moved down the street & go a few times a week. Unfortunately the past 6+ months, customer service has been awful. Specifically, there is this older woman who works at the customer service desk. I‚Äôve dealt with her 3 times & each time she has basically refused to do her job. Did a return & wanted it put on a shop card so I can use it same day, ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt do that‚Äù I always do it that way? Did something change? ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know‚Äù hands me a receipt & motions the next customer. Rude. The other day, my BF wanted to renew our membership in person  because the app wasn‚Äôt working & we wanted some stuff anyways. After waiting in line (behind a couple who was also renewing) she told us she couldn‚Äôt & wanted us to go to checkout to do it. We were confused & she said she wouldn‚Äôt be able to take our payment? Even though we just watched her do it. This was like 2 hours before close & there was no one else near customer service, so it‚Äôs not like she was rushing. She just doesn‚Äôt want to do her job anytime I see her. Customer service has also gone down at the registers, everyone seems to have such attitudes these days. I really hope they work on it, I‚Äôve been going a lot less & it‚Äôs almost not worth it to have the black card anymore.

This place is insanely busy. Make sure to bring your own bags or you can also use boxes that they have left over from products they have used loaded. We were told today at the checkout that only the person with the membership card can make the purchases. They have kiosks at the cafe area if you want to order food there. You can order whole pizzas. Also they have the best gas prices around.

They harass their paying customers.
My daughter was in there with her boyfriend. Upon checking out the cashier asked my daughter if the picture on her card was her. My daughter replied yes it is my picture.

Then the cashier asked her a second time if it was her picture on the card Then a third time.  Then giving her her card back allowing her to proceed and process the checkout. This is not a club. It's a cult. I won't be renewing next year

Clean Store. Great Products. Although I was shopping in store (ALWAYS get my Organic Vegetables), my initial visit was to Costco's Tire Installation Center. I purchased and had installed 4 sets of tires on my Acura RDX. GREAT JOB.

My recent trip to Costco was made truly exceptional by the outstanding service of their employees especially Connor. Amidst the bustling aisles, his dedication to customer satisfaction stood out. When we encountered an issue securing our purchase for transport, Connor went above and beyond, providing us with zip ties to ensure its safety. His proactive approach and genuine kindness epitomize Costco's commitment to excellence. Connor's exceptional service left a lasting impression, transforming a routine shopping trip into a memorable experience.

Love Costco, but today was the 1st time using self checkout.  Scanned my card and started to scan items, and all kinds of items started showing up.  After getting assistance, it was another person's items scanning to my register!  I couldn't check out until they were done.  Think I'll use a live person at the register from now on.
Store is great, but the gas pump situation is even better. The membership pays for itself in the gas savings. We are members of Sam‚Äôs club as well but we like Costco‚Äôs gas station better.

Fist time at a Costco, 2 things I  disliked where. 1. The cafe set up. They are basically taking customer service out of the equation.
2. The employee don't where anything to distinguish themselves from customers, other than a name badge.
Two things I liked about Costco.
1. The quality of the Kirkland brand is great
2. Everything was full and displayed and the end caps where set with the correct time of year.

I LOVE COSTCO! Great products at decent prices. I think their quality is the best. The store is spotless, the staff friendly and helpful, and you get samples!!!
If you haven‚Äôt been in, try it! The gas is a great deal too!

This Costco is the only one in my area; the next closest one is in Kansas City. I'm happy to have a Costco here. My only complaint is that it's so hard to find an employee to ask for help. You need to go all the way to the checkout area. Other than that, the checkout process is fast, and the products here are of good quality.

Delicious food for a steal of a price! A foot long, all beef hot dog AND a refillable fountain drink for $1.50. You can‚Äôt beat that.
The only problem I had, was their kitchen seemed under staffed for the sheer amount of people that were buying lunch.

This is a great addition to St. Louis.  There are several items in bulk for businesses besides the electronics (meat slicer, freezer, washers, mixers, printers, speakers, etc.) .  Surprisingly, there are also many similar smaller items that we usually see at regular Costco locations. Some of the items that are in bulk are cheaper than buying them at regular Costco locations.  Apart from businesses, this is definitely a place to consider going for buying groceries when hosting big parties and with thanksgiving approaching, this is a perfect place for holiday season.  Lot of several meat choices (whole goat, lamb, pig and duck) and several cheese options than what we find at the regular Costco locations.  They also have fueling station and we can put in an order for truck load of items if needed. No food court, but that is totally fine.  Staff was great and very friendly.  A must visit for all Costco members!

No food court literally rhe point of costco. When I asked they were so rude about it and laughed not good customer service and I'm a huge costco fan. This place is good if you need to feed alot of people or run a business. Ie: restaurant etc.
Gas is currently :
3.20/gallon

Have you ever somehow found yourself wanting a Costco that was somehow even more Costco? As in, even bigger items with even better deals? Whelp this is it.

Super important find; if you buy beef sirloin here in a big butcher cut and butcher it yourself it‚Äôs, like, half the price. In early 2024 sirloin was about $4.50/lb, but you have to get in ~18lb chunks.
Additionally, they sell bulk chicken breast for ~$1.59/lb in boxes of 40lbs/ea (as of early 2024).

All in all, amazing deals on meat.

I recently became a member at Costco after being a member of  Sam's club for many years. Both memberships have their pros and cons, but Costco seems to be better organized and cleaner. While Sam's club has more available locations, it doesn't seem to be a problem to drive that extra mile for quality products and services.

Honestly, walked in here by accident. The biggest gas station with the most pumps. So feel free to wait in St Charles like it's 1973 or just come here and pump gas. It's more than twice the size of the one in St Charles. Bigger than the one on Olive too.
The store has no bakery or food kitchen. So no birthday cakes or the famous hot dog here.
On the other hand I feed 4 kids. So the business Costco definitely has good stuff for us.
Worth checking out

Very excellent customer service and  store is packed with food and items one needs.  Will be going to their optical, as I made an appointment.  New to Costco

Update:  Costco Optical was great!!  Great customer service!  Also, the price of my glasses was $200 less than I've ever paid.

Good place. Big store. You will literally get everything from electric appliances to home goods to food and groceries. Easy to navigate. Huge parking. Kids friendly. I love costco churros, pizza and ice cream its so cheap and good in taste. They have testers over the weekends but go on a Monday morning or Tuesday morning to avoid people and get fresh stocks

Oh my..is there anything they do NOT carry?!?  Some items are not always in stock but new items come in weekly. They have a large grocery section; bakery; large freezer section;  butcher shop; pet food; clothing, pharmacy, a food court, product sample stations here and there; cookware, flooring; mattresses; freezers and refrigerators; golf and  fishing supplies; toys; diapers and baby needs; a vision center; TVs; furniture (indoor and outdoor); houseplants; cleaning products; laptops and computers; printer supplies; auto services, a gas station that has competitive prices and much, much more! We've shopped with Costco for years and it's always a fun experience. by the way, butcher shop has THE most delicious rotisserie chicken ever!!

It was clean, organized and packed. Definitely don‚Äôt recommend coming on a Sunday right before a storm, lol. The lines are crazy, but the employees were friendly and efficient into getting everyone checked out in timely matter. There is a huge variety of products, everything from chips to fine jewelry. There are some good deals on stuff to pay for the membership. All the employees were friendly, chatty and informative.

Costco always has the best deals and the kindest staff around. There honestly isn‚Äôt a better place to go! Specifically, Elise at customer service helped me today with a return and I was blown away by her professionalism, problem-solving skills and kindness. Thank you Elise.

I'm an instacart shopper and I'm not a regular shopper at Costco so I never really know where anything is and when I ask someone they usually just kinda point in an area but today a team member by the name of Jerome he was so helpful I was halfway done with my order but I was having trouble finding these last few items I didn't even ask for his help he said I had that look of confusion so he stopped and asked and helped me and actually took me to each location where I could find my last few items it only took him one look at my phone to help me find my last few items he save me half the times it told me on my phone it would take to shop. Thank You so much Jerome !

I have the membership and it was a business type one. I was there with my wife today and was ready to pay  with my wife‚Äôs debit card when they wouldn‚Äôt allow us to because she was not on my business membership account, yet the debit card is a joint account with us together. This is so ridiculous and a waste of our time and theirs all because they wouldn‚Äôt accept payment from a member‚Äôs wife while they are there with them. It seems like they are purposely targeting certain races. We had no problem going to a different costco location, but this one, big disappointment! All of this just to get my wife to pay for ANOTHER membership instead of accepting sale of what was already scanned and ready for payment.

Became a member on Friday and am so glad I did.  The staff is super helpful and friendly.  The store is very clean.  And they had everything I wanted and then some.  I mean, who doesn't need 3 pounds of Asian dumplings?  My only complaint is that I waited so long to join.

The Tire Center at this location deserves a 10 out of 10. I've been a "frequent flyer" lately and have had to replace a number of tires in the last 6-12 months.

Dustin, Matt, Brian, and all the other folks working here are always polite, professional, and efficient. They're always easy to work with and have helped me out with Road Hazard coverage in several situations, and they always complete the work faster than they advise. They all deserve a raise!

Excellent job!  Keep up the good work - and thank you!

I have been a valid customer since Costco first open. Never have I ran into an issue even last week when I was previously here.  The cashier was nice and friendly with the people ahead of me. Apparently, once I get to the register and show my membership, I get rudely and very unprofessional, harassed by Sally.  She was talking to me as if my account wasn‚Äôt mine and I tried to show her and she kept yelling and saying I need to get out of her line, until a nice lady, assist me and continued on. Very racially manner.  Look at me as if I did not exist.  Service like this make me want to continue to shop with other establishments like Sam‚Äôs Club and restaurant Depot. I have been to multiple states with food trucks and never had this experience.  I am mixed raced, and really confused about the situation and general maybe because I look more black with dreadlocks. I never had this problem with any employee, at any of their locations.

I hate writing this because I have LOVED Costco for over 20 years. My Costco card says I have been a member since 1997....that is a long time! I have been a customer at this location for 4 years, and the folks there were always so kind. I had a great shopping experience and could feel the team there was more like a family. After speaking to many of the employees that are there, I see what has happened. New management has taken over and there have been SO many changes, including letting a very valuable team member named Matt go. Apparently he was not the only one, there were more people fired that day for this self pay snack situation. On top of the fact that it is heartbreaking, the NEW staff are RUDE and the entire Vibe in the cash wrap area is anxious and off. I had a lady get very upset that I brought my cooler bags to put my cold items in, she was tossing my food in carelessly and gave me a rude look. I was speechless. I had to go to the tables and re pack it so that it fit and was not a hazard.  The whole store is not the same kind feel that it once was. The NEW people are not friendly at all, and I can not stand how off and cold the vibe is. I can see the managers being short with employees, and employees not even smiling, just looking so down. I hope that corporate sees this and changes things. Bring Matt and the others back and get rid of this new manager!

The store is clean and well stocked. I love that they have samples to taste, I have found a lot of things that the family has liked that I wouldn't have noticed without the samples.
The self check-out always has a line but it moves lightning fast because they have an employee to direct you to a terminal.
Hotdog and soda is a great buy, win win!!

I absolutely love Costco! From their incredible selection of products to their unbeatable prices, this warehouse store never fails to impress. Whether you're stocking up on household essentials, shopping for groceries, or browsing through their electronics and home goods, Costco has it all. The membership perks, including their fantastic Kirkland Signature brand and exclusive deals, make it well worth the investment. Plus, their food court offers delicious and affordable eats, perfect for refueling after a shopping spree. The spacious layout and helpful staff ensure a pleasant shopping experience every time. Overall, Costco is a must-visit for anyone looking to save money without sacrificing quality.

Do not buy this product if you can‚Äôt stand a strong smell. This oil would be great without this un called for fragrance and gave me a headache. Since we blindly fall for Costco products, we need to test drive them first before diving into buying a huge bottle over an ounce to base our liking for it. A gigantic disappointment about this product. Will return it.

I have been a member at Costco since they have been in Brentwood. I prefer them any day to Sam‚Äôs however my shopping choice will likely change.  I recently became aware of their decision to fire a disabled person who had worked there for 17 years over what really sounds like an honest mistake.   I know this young man personally and find this decision  quite pathetic for a big company like Costco

Nice store with a great selection. If you find something you love, you may want to purchase several because some items are only temporarily in stock. The vibe here always feels like a black Friday mad dash and the employees aren't very kind.

I had heard so many great things about Costco so was extremely excited to get a membership.  I hope its just this location but the experience was horrible.  Employees were rude, self checkout was glitchy and took several tries before it worked.  Produce didn't look great, meat prices weren't any better than when they are on sale at the regional grocery store.  A large part of the problem is it's the only location within 100 miles of my (and tens of thousands others) home.  If I could afford to cancel my membership and buy a Sam's Club membership, I would.  The only reason it got 2 stars instead of 1 was because of the food court, it was really good.

Costco is a Warehouse store where you can purchase everyday items in quantities greater than that of your local grocery store. They have specialty items as well. The customer service is exceptional with a generous return policy for items purchased there. The prices are a great value and they have a food court where you can still purchase items at very reasonable prices, especially when compared to fast food chains. Get the executive membership and earn $ back on every purchase. highly recommend it!
Typical fantastic experience just as any other costco. Having a gas station was a huge plus. Highly recommend.

I very rarely post negative reviews. Most of the time, I just let it roll off my shoulder and move on. But, this has happened more than a few times. So here it goes.

I am beyond irritated that I drove over 40 minutes, specifically for 5 items and apparently they are no longer carrying those items. But then again, some of them may be there but it's like an Easter egg hunt with them CONSTANTLY changing items locations around.  One example...Trying to find the baby formula...guess where it was located? Not with the other baby items but next to the Pharmacy. What?! That's like going in to buy toilet paper and finding it next to the refrigerated produce.

They also do not LABEL aisles to find things easily (like Sam's does). Maybe that's a marketing trick so that you will spend more time looking and spend more money by seeing other things. That just ticks me off. Besides, with the Scan-n-go at Sam's Club... that's a game changer.

Very large Costco location with everything you need. Bright, clean, well stocked. Getting a Costco membership could be one of the best long term shopping decisions, especially for families. Insider's tip: Shop Mon-Thu after 7pm if you don't like crowds and lines, quick in and out.

Just wanted to share a few photos. I usually go to the west Nashville location but this one is a few minutes closer. So far I‚Äôve had great interactions with the staff and they have been helpful when checking inventory of items over the phone!

I‚Äôm so so happy Costco finally came to Hendersonville. This is so far my favorite Costco. I love everything about it. Of course it‚Äôs new. So many selections of everything. Checkout lines move very fast. Workers are nice. I hope it remains nice like this.

So glad to finally have a Costco just minutes down the street! Pizza and hot dogs are delicious and cheap. The mesquite wings I picked up in the meat section were really good too. Employees are friendly and helpful.  Checkout lines and deli move fast. Love it!

Great parking

This place is a Costco, but it‚Äôs brand new and upscale/clean. I wish there was more variety. But that‚Äôs Costco for ya!

Very large Costco location with everything you need. Bright, clean, well stocked. Getting a Costco membership could be one of the best long term shopping decisions, especially for families. Insider's tip: Shop Mon-Thu after 7pm if you don't like crowds and lines, quick in and out.

Just wanted to share a few photos. I usually go to the west Nashville location but this one is a few minutes closer. So far I‚Äôve had great interactions with the staff and they have been helpful when checking inventory of items over the phone!

I‚Äôm so so happy Costco finally came to Hendersonville. This is so far my favorite Costco. I love everything about it. Of course it‚Äôs new. So many selections of everything. Checkout lines move very fast. Workers are nice. I hope it remains nice like this.

So glad to finally have a Costco just minutes down the street! Pizza and hot dogs are delicious and cheap. The mesquite wings I picked up in the meat section were really good too. Employees are friendly and helpful.  Checkout lines and deli move fast. Love it!

Great parking

This place is a Costco, but it‚Äôs brand new and upscale/clean. I wish there was more variety. But that‚Äôs Costco for ya!

This is a great Costco. They have a gas station and car wash. I also use the eye doctor attached and get our glasses from the vision center inside. The cafe gets very busy and you order from a touchscreen not a person. The entire place is always clean and employees are friendly. Best part is they have a great selection of Asian foods.

I feel compelled to share my recent experiences with this store's customer service, which unfortunately has been declining steadily. The incident that prompted this review occurred on the 8th of this month at approximately 1:20 pm. A light greenish-blue Volvo, driven by one of their employees, recklessly entered the parking lot as if rushing to make it to their shift on time. The driver's aggressive maneuvering nearly resulted in a collision with our vehicle. Despite our attempts to alert him with a honk, he responded with a rude gesture using his middle finger before hastily parking.

Furthermore, the recent policies implemented by the store have added unnecessary inconvenience to the shopping experience. Since October, customers are not only required to present identification upon entry but are also asked to produce the same card again during checkout. This redundant procedure, coupled with the mandatory inspection of receipts upon departure, fosters an environment that feels distrustful and unwelcoming. No customer should feel like a criminal simply for patronizing a store.

While I understand the importance of security measures, the implementation here feels excessive and disrespectful to loyal customers. Personally, I find the shopping experience at other establishments, such as Sam's, to be far more accommodating and respectful of customer privacy. Unless there are significant improvements in both customer service and policies, I regret to say that I will be taking my business elsewhere.

Costco Warehouse is a nice place to get a few good deals yet if you are on a budget you must shop wisely and watch the details. A recent purchase of a large appliance failed, the first time was about a month after purchase where we lost twice the original price of the freezer in meat spoilage and after warranty repair it failed again with several hundred dollars of spoilage. There was many phone calls to Costco online and to the manufacturer service center and at wits end, the manager finally issued a refund. It should not have been as hard getting it right. Buyer beware!

So excited about our new Costco! I've been with Costco for 30 years and love Costco. I love finding quality for a very low price, instead of cheap junk like they have at Sam's Club. Costco means quality!!!

I got their credit card and have gotten so much money back in the few months I've used it that I could buy myself a very nice gas grillüî•
Can get vetsulin insulin for my dog here and even needles.  Much cheaper than vet but state taxes pet insulin but not human. Explain this...

Nice warehouse club in the Wolfchase area of Memphis.  During peak hours, the crowds can get pretty crazy.  I prefer Costco to Sam's as it seems their inventory is turned over more often and they have fresh selections of new items.  The Kirkland brands are really good compared to the more well-known name brands.  The self-checkout has helped but it can still take some time to get out of the store, especially during peak hours.  The samples are good and the restaurant is a nice stop on the way out but it can get busy too.  Overall a good store and I will visit it again.

One of my favorite places to shop.  I like many of their prepared foods such as Bell peppers, pies, salads, prepared roasts, cheeses etc and they have the best roasted chicken for a great price.  I also like a couple of their frozen pizzas.  I like being able to buy in quantity too.  I find some items are a little higher than regular grocers but I compare prices and make co.parative lists. Unfortunately I find their meat are getting higher so I don't purchase it as often.

I enjoy shopping at Costco but the people here need to get serious.
Check out line has too much chit chat and yapping.
Pharmacy line is slower as @#$

Auto tire manager has a horrible attitude and should not even be in customer service , prob send that guy to work in the DMV where everyone had attitude

Eye glasses dept is fantastic
Food /meat area people are fantastic
Food court is always under pressure and gets it done
Costco is cult of personality for sure

Recently purchased a Costco membership and went in today for the cards! Everyone was so friendly, It was a Saturday so so so  busy,but  So glad we got the membership! You definitely get a bang for your buck as well! All of the products are extremely affordable & the size/amount of product/food is more than fair. I love this Costco location so far and 100% recommend!

Costco has always been our favorite. This is another Costco in the Memphis  area. If you are not aware about this warehouse shopping experience, you must visit Costco once. You will be amazed by their ‚Äòvalue for money‚Äô. Also Costco products are of very good quality, including the food section. I love their salads or tacos, or ribs, etc. It‚Äôs huge in size but very affordable good meal. Our Costco experience is always good. This location is just another usual one. If you are a Costco member, visit this location. This one was very neat and clean and organized one, at least during my visit. If you are not a member, I highly recommend you to buy the basic membership ( worth of 60$ yearly). This is a very good investment.

Staffing levels are superb. Always well stocked. Fast checkouts and a lot of parking. I got trapped in the greenhouse display for a few hours but they were able to slide some hotdogs under the door while I waited for the fire department. Bathroom location slightly inconvenient.

I've always enjoyed Costco stores more than Sam's Club and the ones in Memphis don't disappoint. They seem to turnover their stock more often than other warehouse stores and the Kirkland brand has some very nice quality.  Hopefully it remains open as I have seen where a few others closed.  The have self-checkout now and they offer the food up front that you can buy like pizza, hot dogs, and drinks. The staff is always nice and the store is always clean as well.  We'll be back.

I frequent this location and I am usually presented with upstanding customer service, however today I left feeling very dismissed by mgr Stefan. He was very short and rude as I was asking about information from the pharmacy. Maybe he was having a bad day as I can sympathize as I work in up management as well however I did want to bring this to him as well as the company‚Äôs attention as I would hope this is not becoming the new norm for Costco.

Excellent custom service very friendly, professional. I did not have an appointment, had to wait 2-3 hours. The Tire Sales Department Repair the tire still under 5 yr. warranty. Thank you  Donald and Associates.  Very kind.

I have fun every time I shop at this place. The people are friendly, the prices are low, and the place is spotless.

Today I picked up lobster ravioli, jumbo shrimp, pork butts, pork tenderloin, K-cup coffee, caramel and cheese popcorn, and wagyu hamburger meat.

Great checkout system developed by Costco as well. I‚Äôll be back for more.

We love Costco. It's a monthly visit for us as a family with small kids. Kirkland brand is excellent quality and blows other in-store brands out of the water. Employees are always friendly, and their warranties on things like Tires and Appliances are hard to beat. Plus, their pizza is $1.99 and delicious.

It was our first trip to Costco ever. After 30 years of using Sam's Warehouse, it's not even close in terms of comparison.

Even though they were understaffed, all the workers were really nice. You could tell they were well trained.

We signed on for a membership and will be going there from now on!

Arbitrary cutoff; I arrived at the front door less than 60 seconds after 6 pm but was rudely and arbitrarily turned away by two disheveled looking employees who were so pathetic as to threaten to call their manager for the purpose of removing me as a non customer. Honestly, it was hilarious to witness how adamant these two were about not acknowledging a customer who committed the unforgivable sin of showing up within 1 minute of ‚Äúclosing time.‚Äù Regardless, I signed on as an executive member just 1 month ago - this experience, dealing with such morally indignant fools, was unlike any I have encountered as a customer.

I am admittedly obsessed with Costco but this is my favorite location! They always seem to have the hot items in stock that my family in different areas text me about. Currently the Dewey‚Äôs lemon cookies and Island Way sorbet (pictured) are some popular items, both in stock. I am also on a first name basis with Myron one of the greeters, super nice guy! I know this is no secret, but their meat quality and selection is incredible as well!

A lot variety of meat, fruits and dairy. Nice place to buy fresh salmon.
I changed my tire in the store, the collaborates were very professional and faster.I really recommend.

This Costco is good. Sells alcohol and seems bigger than the one in Arlington VA. I think this may be the only Costco that is officially in DC. The other are in Maryland and Virginia zip codes. Definitely a must check out for your usual bulk shopping. Prices seems to be a little cheaper in warehouse than what is currently being displayed online. So check in person first at the warehouse.

Always find what I need. I know how to handle the flow. I always discover something else I want‚Ä¶ always leave with a smile!

üòªSuch a great mushroom selection too!

This place is really nice!
The people aren't that stand offish. If your minority you Dont get treated like a flu! It sure makes taking your kids with you easier and more enjoyable. The prices are reasonable and the quality is really Good. The facility is Nice and clean as well.
Great store with good return policy also for how busy is before holidays store is clean and workers are polite,friendly,respectful and helpful.

Update 04/11/2024
The store was busy but not crazy crowded. The cashiers were fast at checking out customers. People had lots of Costco's purified water @ $3.99 a case of 40 bottles.

02/28/2024
The store was not that crowded tonight, but it was busy as usual. There is always a gentlemen helping woman put water in their cart. They had the large rolls of Bounty and kirkland paper towels. I did not find any fresh ginger. The checkout lines were fast. Got me a hot dog special and a Vanilla Sundae.  They seem to have everything at Costco.

These guys don‚Äôt get enough credit. I obviously needed help out and Colby not only helped me out but figured out how to stack all my items appropriately and efficiently. Great customer service and kindness. Thank you!

Fueling is mucb easier at the new location. parking is less stressful given the larger spaces. the store is huge and typical Costco. it is busier than the old location but it is quicker to get your shopping done.

Amazing products and value that you really can't find anywhere else!  Especially when it comes to their sale prices. The employees are incredibly friendly and helpful!  For being such a big, busy place, you'll consistently see the same awesome employees working there for years on end, which is a good sign that a business is doing something right. It's nice seeing familiar friendly faces while shopping.

We love costco! Very nice young man helped us. We were getting a business membership, and he went over all of the benefits. I have been secretly disappointed as there have been no samples every time we go... but the variety and savings have really been great!

I've been thinking about switching phone service for quite a while - my girls were split on the idea, or didn't care.
Costco switched Exclusively to AT&T, so I did too. I Thought I got a pretty good deal,  but NOW, after a month, and several issues, I can't EVER get Any Help.
They gave me a Costco VIP number - to some in Africa. They say Don't go to the store - but we did, because we couldn't get help from the Costco people, or that REDICULOUS pune number, then the stores seemed butt hurt, because we went to Costco.
I'm Frustrated, and Mad, and disappointed that, so far, the customer service, is about what I had with Verizon.
I got a "discount" through the company I work for, but they "Accidently" put the wrong company in for that discount, and want me to prove I work for a place I Don't work, and now I'm jumping for through a thousand hoops to fix Their mistakes, but they Can't Help me.
I probably will never go back to Verizon, but I sure didn't get the deal I thought I got through at&t Costco. I'm pretty screwed. I just want to be able to ask someone for some damn help, and they have been terrible.

We love to shop here. The food court is always trying new items and if they don‚Äôt work, they change them. I love that they sell pizza in the red bags as I‚Äôm trying to shop. Very convenient for shoppers on the go.

The Optical section is Great. The counter people are all friendly and helpful. There is a wide range of glasses frames and they will help you pick the pair that looks best on your face. I highly recommend this place!
Pick up Rx. N no Costco card needed place was clean staff was friendly.  Excellent for home improvement picking up item's for your front as well as backyard

Love finding new and different things. Found some great deals on chicken, and high protein chicken. I buy several at a time, as everything changes from week to week. Might find something new and exciting next week.

They need to stop with their aggressive sales tactics! Trying to make me purchase a $10 pizza that has probably been sitting in that disgusting red bag for an hour. Leave me alone!  If I wanted a pizza I will order one with the cashier or at the food court. This place has been going down hill for a few years now.

Once a month, the family takes a trip to stock up. Beautiful drive over, so the ride isn't bad. There are so many things you can get, we have to write up a grocery list and stick to it or we will spend too much. It is nice being able to buy in bulk to save money. I'm so glad there is a Costco close buy to us. It saves us on groceries for sure. If you have a big family, or if you like to buy in bulk. Costco is great. You do have to have a membership to shop at the store. It is well worth it. There is more than just groceries, too. Good place to look for winter jackets. They carry wool socks. And they have household items as well. It is not a one stop shop but they definitely have a good selection.

This usually outstanding Costco failed me today. Sure, things are always being moved around in the store, and I‚Äôm almost always able to find them, but accaciaionally I can‚Äôt and require some assistance. Every single time this has happened to me during the decades I have been going there, someone has gone with me to where it‚Äôs supposed to be to make sure I have it. Today I talked to three people, one person twice, and none of them helped me find it and I left the store without it. :(

Great prices and good selection of products. It is well worth the membership. All of the employees we have encountered here have been more than helpful and very courteous. We will continue to shop here for the foreseeable future. The membership is well worth it and you can really score some great deals if you k ow what to look for.

The service at this location used to be a lot better a few years ago. I don't know what happened recently, but Costco seems understaffed based on the workers' stress levels and also the state of the food court (trash everywhere, empty tables covered in condiments, and everything at the self service station as well as sodas being out of stock).

Edit: Well, it's gotten significantly worse. This store is consistently busy and yet management has decided the solution is cutting back store and employee hours. I think the solution is probably a lot closer to paying a livable wage, since your employees are clearly miserable (and I KNOW the wage isn't livable due to having family who applied).

So many great experiences at costco until today. Tammy at self checkout made sure that we felt stupid and like a bother asking questions. Even rolling her eyes at us like we unconvinced her. Everyone else at costco has customer service skills but her? Makes me debate renewing my costco membership

Love Costco, love the service and selection. I love that Costco does a good job of vetting items ahead for me and their quality return policy if something doesn't hold up like it should. I love purchasing lare qualities of salsa for the same price as a small jar in a normal grocery store. The way the shuffle their store around every week or so gives each shopping experience the psychological effect of going on a treasure hunt that provides me opportunities to see and purchase items that I didn't know existed or that I wanted but now upon discovering absolutely must have!

Tire center was awesome. Ordered tires online, said two weeks for appointment. They called me same day as I ordered them and told me they had them in stock and could get me in right away. Then not even two days later I had a flat tire (rock punctured the tire) went in first thing in the morning and they got me in and replaced the tire for free under the road side hazard warranty due to it being too large of a hole to repair safely. No hassle and easy process. Would recommend getting tires here.
Easy to find parking. Staff was super friendly and very helpful. Gas station was easy in/out without any wait. First time i saw propane refill station.

The staff at this Costco are a team of hard workers. It was extremely busy on our visit to this location (which was our first) and I can safely say that this was the hardest working Costco I have been to. Carol and Starlene checked us out and they did a great job! Thanks for all of your hard work!

Love all of the great deals you can get at Costco whether it be for everyday necessities, rotisserie chicken, or new yummy snacks that you can find. I absolutely love the food court, specifically the pizza, which is always delicious and up to standards. Also who doesn't love all the samples that they pass out!?

Convenient location, plenty of parking available and friendly employees, enjoy shopping here. Recently, they switched up the packaging of the rotisserie chickens, I don‚Äôt know what is going on but the chicken has been extremely dry the last couple of times I‚Äôve purchased.
Always a great place to get cheaper fuel!! lol

I had a really negative interaction with the old guy at the exit door. He raised his voice quickly and got frustrated with me because I didn't have my receipt ready. It did take me a second to find it, but I was surprised by his impatience. It was only 5‚Äì10 seconds.

I'm not sure if he's new to the job? Maybe management should move him somewhere he doesn't have to interact with customers very much.

I'm not looking forward to my next visit because of this interaction.

I love the variety of produce, the quality children's books, and affordable work appropriate tops! Grab some samples üòÅ Check out the amazing selection of dips, ready to go meals, and  wine. They have the best (and biggest) cheesecake in town.

I love alot of the pricing and quality items here.
They never seem to have enough cashiers, though the self pay stations have helped alot! Also the parking lot is a mad house. I have almost been run over just trying to enter the store more times then i can count.

No matter the time of day, this Costco stays extremely busy. Have your membership card ready to show at the entrance and when getting ready to pay. Or if you‚Äôre purchasing from the optical center as well.

Been coming to this Costco for years but today is the day I will not be coming back. My wife called in at 5:56pm to inquire for availability to repair our flat tire. The technician on the phone stated that he could get us in if we arrived as quickly as possible. Fast forward 20 minutes, we get to Costco tire center and they turned us away. Told us to come back tomorrow. Worse experience ever. I can say they are just lazy. 3 cars in the tire center parking spot plus ours would be 4.  4 lift bays that were empty. You‚Äôre telling me that you can‚Äôt repair a tire with 4 empty bays? I could understand if you were jam packed busy but you weren‚Äôt. Unacceptable and lacking the so called Costco experience.

Update* the manager from Costco did phone me to apologize.  He pulled video and agreed with me that this experience was far from acceptable. He understood why I felt bullied and uncomfortable yet GARY still works there.. wow zero stars

Costco south Arlington- Monday 1/29/24- 1:25pm.  I was in and out of the store with no problem as I purchased three items. I am here frequently just to buy a rotisserie chicken and usually have a good experience. Today, as I was attempting to leave the parking lot, a lot attendant pushed a row of carts toward my car, then stopped in front of my car. There was no obvious reason for why he was doing this. he stopped the row of carts about 1 inch from my bumper, so close that my sensors were beeping in my car. I honked, and he refused to move, even propped up 1 foot, took out his phone and began  scrolling on his phone as if to tell me, I would be the one moving, not him.  I was on the correct side of the parking aisle and had nowhere to go and believe this employee was blatantly disrespecting me and made me feel extremely uncomfortable. His name is GARY.  I hope someone explains to Gary where his paycheck comes from.  And encourages him to work on his approach to customers.   I will drive across town to go to a different Costco.

I came to this location The weekend before Thanksgiving,  naturally the store was busier than usual.

There were two long lines but the associates at the store had it down to where the lines moved quickly, however the cashiers lacked friendliness. They were extremely grumpy.

I also want to mention at the sample station, a lady working the station complained about people requesting samples, citing their sometimes unruly behavior. Even said customers would go feral over a piece of bread.

I understood her perspective, but I did not like when she lightly slapped my cousin's hand for grabbing a sample.

Also please note: the cherry tomatoes were black and molded, I had purchased 3 of them

And the apple pie for thanksgiving had mold/moss growing on them as well.

So I rate this 2/5 stars.

Super disappointed in the customer service. There has been so many instances that I‚Äôve been dissatisfied but finally this is my last straw. We have had a membership for over 10 years. I call the food court, they don‚Äôt even say hello I just get told we don‚Äôt have any dough. My first question is when does Costco have dough ? Second who do y'all have picking up the phones that they have 0 communication skills. Why do I pay for people to be rude to me in this store.

It‚Äôs not fair this Costco have tasty morning buns that our local Costco does not. They are as good as the morning buns at our local bakery but those cost $3.50 each. Costco sell 9 for $8.99üòÑ

I also like the way they slices their meats here, nice and thick and fresh. Even their bananas and $.20 cheaper than ours.

We have used the products foid stuff, , they are off  good quality..The electronics are of reasonable price, All branded clothes are of reasonable price, variety of flowers a great preparation for mother's  day Today is 8th May 2024. I brought clothing there a good collection of garments too.

Ample car parking, fast movement at counters, friendly staff. I LOVE Cotsco

A well organized and decently spaced Costco outlet. Everything  (Electronics, Furniture, Food, Beverages, Clothes, Books, Toiletries, Toys and Medicine) under one roof and best place to do bulk buying. Organic foods are sold at an affordable price. Love the A2 milk sold here, tastes really fresh. Avoid buying furniture here as it is extremely overpriced. Food and other new product samples are offered at various points throughout the store - must try if interested in exploring. The store also offers various other products such water treatment, roof installation and solar panels at discounted price. Regular and premium gas prices are  decently priced but the traffic is heavy, which is regularly regulated. Worth buying the membership.

I love Costco! It is NOT a great place to buy produce if you live alone. However, you can buy a lot of other things in bulk that will not go bad. I usually buy all of my vitamins, protein powder, and some skin products and hair products from Costco. They have furniture, mattresses, and outdoor items with some really good prices. They also have great deals on prescription glasses; I bought two pairs for a great price and one of them was Burberry.
Love this place and the cheap gas! Best to visit the Gas station on the way to work as usually there are lines later in the day.

Every single time i come here their employees are so so rude at this location. I worked for 10 years in customer service and I am so respectful towards everyone and my goodness there is never so much rudeness at any other store. It's always unpleasant to come and the few deals that they have are absolutely not worth it. Customer service is obviously not anywhere close to a priority.
After years of paying for their most expensive membership, I'm so done with them.

Costco is a shopper's paradise, offering unbeatable value and quality on a wide range of products. From their vast selection of bulk items to their delicious bakery treats and fresh produce, Costco consistently delivers on both price and quality. Their Kirkland Signature brand rivals top-tier labels, offering exceptional value without compromising on taste or quality. Plus, the warehouse format makes shopping efficient and enjoyable. Whether you're stocking up for the month or grabbing a quick lunch at their food court, Costco is a must-visit destination for savvy shoppers. Highly recommend for anyone looking to stretch their dollar without sacrificing quality.

On my first visit, I faced a disconcerting situation. The salmon I bought displayed an expiration date of 12/7/2023, yet upon closer inspection at home, I found an additional sticker with a different end date of 11/30/2023. This has prompted questions about Costco's approach to extending food shelf life and the potential sale of expired items.

Excelent place to shop!
Good customer service, good products. What else we want?
The collection of beers was amazing!
More than 15 kind of beer. As always, everything was good.

I‚Äôm a fan of Costco, I like the predictability and the quality goods they offer. It feels like the buyers pick top notch items to sell in their stores. It may not be the cheapest but the return policy is on point if you aren‚Äôt happy with your purchase you can return it easily. When I travel I like looking in out of town Costco‚Äôs because they often carry different items than the one near my home I usually shop in.

It‚Äôs really unfortunate that I have to give this review because this is a wonderful store. But Kristin with the blonde hair was pretty rude and dismissive to me and my family for no reason. She appeared to be very annoyed because I simply asked a question to the group of workers. If she was having a bad day, she could have just kept quiet because there were 2 other workers near her that answered as well, but were super nice!

Thank you to the other two ladies outside cooking food for the staff who were super nice and gently answered our questions.

Okay, I'm still not seeing any improvement in the rostierd chicken quality at all,

Staff is a little bit more available tgese days,

And I want to give a big shout out to our awesome pharmacy technician Michael, very professional, nice, fast and happy, thank you Michael, those 5 stars are absolutely for you!

I had an issue of concern with my personal items nearly being taken from me by another shopper.

I'm very appreciative of the staff at customer service chatting with me and keeping me company while two manages looked into the issue for me.

In the end it ended up OK, mostly because the two managers, one of whom was part of Loss Prevention, took the reins.

I'm appreciative of the concern, attention, and thorough investigation. It put my mind at ease and that's the kind of work ethic I respect and would proudly work for either of them.

Thank you!

This was my first time at the Cedar Park Costco. I wasn't disappointed. It was clean, bright, and well stocked. It has a different layout compared to the Costco where I normally shop but with the help of employees plus another shopper I found most of the items on my list. The "express" line was long but moved quickly. One suggestion, have a Costco employee at each of the self checkouts to scan everything. I was used to the scanning the customers used to be able to do, so my cart is always arranged with the bar codes up. It makes it easy and fast for all.

This Costco is a busier one for sure, this is in an emerging city called Cedar Park and the peak hours here can see pretty long lines.

That's not saying that it's not well run. There is always a full supply of all items and the people who work there all appear to be happy and friendly.

One of the things that I really like about this particular Costco is that the meat and seafood seems to always be in really great stock. I think the director at this store must be a really dedicated guy.

One other thing I've noticed is that the people who work in the front of store have been around for a long time. There are familiar faces here. That makes a difference.

Other than that, it's got all the great stuff and things you would expect from the Costco franchise, great prices, products and large quantities. I'm a big fan of Costco and definitely have come to geeatly appreciate my membership over the years. I highly recommend Costco and only give this particular one 4 stars because it's so busy and crowded. Clicking the like button will not hurt my feelings! üòâ

Tire center:
I have yet to have a good experience at the tire center here. I have two main issues:
1. I easily spend twice or more time here than anywhere else for similar service
2. They did not own up to $385 of damage they caused to my car

More details:
1. The most common problem I've had is how much time I waste even though I always have an appointment. (The difficulty of getting one is another matter) Dropping off? Wait 20 minutes in line. Picking up? Wait 20 minutes...  (or longer) Maybe I'm just plagued with always picking a bad time to go in, but seems unlikely, especially when I always have an appointment.  Work times are also considerably longer than other places I've done business with. My best case scenario when I've gotten a tire fixed was about an hour and a half. I've also waited almost 3 hours before.

2. They did not own up to their negligence and the damage they caused to my car. I had tires installed at this Costco on an Odyssey with 200k miles. When I got my tires rotated the first time, one of the lug nuts was stripped on a wheel stud and broke off. Any mechanic will tell you this is the fault of the person who last put the lug nuts on: they didn't take the time to thread it by hand initially and just forced it on with an impact wrench. Obvious negligence on Costco's part. I had to fill out a form about the damage (after waiting in line 20+ min...), then deal with a 3rd party with lots of back and forth conversations. They denied the claim because their excuse was they said wheel studs are supposed to be replaced at 100k miles as part of normal maintenance! That isn't in the manual and several mechanics I spoke to had never heard of that (including the Frisco Honda dealership). Costco's representative wouldn't budge. When I asked for documentation to prove what they were telling me, they blew me off. The only thing I can think of where they are getting the 100k mile number is that is when the wheel studs are out of warranty. By that logic, if they crashed my car into the wall they wouldn't pay for that either since the entire car is out of warranty. I had to get the wheel stud replaced for $385 - one of the cheapest quotes I found. Assuming it is negligible to replace the other studs on the same wheel, according to Costco, you are supposed to spend $1600 to have all your wheel studs replaced at 100k miles. Absurd I had to pay for Costco's negligence.

I'll never give Costco my tire business again, even for work that might entail using the warranty and should be "free".

I recently had a shopping experience at Costco, and I must say it was quite impressive.

The first thing that struck me was the incredible variety of products available. From groceries to electronics, furniture to clothing, Costco seems to have it all. Whether you're shopping for your household or business needs, you're likely to find what you're looking for.

Costco's membership model may deter some, but I found it to be well worth it. The savings from bulk buying can be substantial. While individual item prices might seem a bit higher, the overall value for larger quantities is excellent. I've found that the annual membership fee more than pays for itself through the savings I've accrued.

The quality of products at Costco is generally top-notch. They carry reputable brands, and their Kirkland Signature private label often offers a more affordable option without compromising on quality.

One highlight of my visit was the food court. Costco's food offerings are both delicious and budget-friendly. The famous hot dogs and pizza slices are well worth the visit alone.

Customer service at Costco is impressive. The return policy is generous, and the staff members are consistently helpful and friendly. It's a welcoming environment that adds to the overall positive shopping experience.

While the stores can get crowded, especially on weekends, it's a testament to Costco's popularity. However, I appreciate that they've made strides in improving their online shopping experience for those who prefer to shop from home.

I also commend Costco for its sustainability efforts, including commitments to sourcing sustainable products and reducing its environmental impact. It's reassuring to see a big retailer taking steps toward a more eco-friendly future.

In conclusion, Costco offers a comprehensive shopping experience with its wide product selection, membership benefits, and excellent savings on bulk items. The quality of products and customer service is commendable, and the food court is a delightful bonus. While the membership fee and crowds may not be for everyone, I find that the benefits far outweigh any drawbacks. Costco continues to be a top choice for my shopping needs.

This review is specifically for the tire section.

I was in the market for tires.  I still had some tread remaining but was going on a road trip and thought I should have them replaced.

I called the store and worked through the phone system to reach the tire section.   After a couple of days of ringing them  several times each day I selected the option to talk with Admin.

Admin informed me that my best option was to come into the store, select and pay for tires, and finally to make an appointment for installation.   Basically two trips. Admin then said I could leave a message and the tire section would call me back, I could order the tires, schedule an installation appointment and be done.

I'm still waiting on them to call me back after 5 days.   In the meantime I called Discount Tire, had them ordered and installed three days ago.   And...  Discount Tire was even cheaper by a few dollars.

Normally I believe Costco has fantastic customer service, but apparently it hasn't spread to the tire section.

Worst Costco Location!

As expected, it's a Saturday, and the place is extremely busy, and the lines were long. Customer service is outstanding, as is customer service at the registers.  One of the many reasons that I keep returning to this business. The place would be so much more enjoyable without the throngs of people, but then it's just a few hours each week.

This place looks awesome. This is the opening day and I see hundreds of people actively shopping. They got membership discounts going on at the entrance. Come check fr urself. There is ample parking spaces. Check my pictures for all the stuff present here. Don't forget to get ur pizza after checkout :)

Customer experience is the reason for my low rating.  (1) I have to prove I‚Äôm a member at least twice each visit.  (2) In the self checkout, they don‚Äôt trust customers with the scanner gun. I have to wait for one of the ‚Äútrained‚Äù scanner gun handlers to offer their help like they‚Äôre doing me a favor.  Every other store with self checkout has a scanner gun at each register. (3) Their app is useless.  Most places now allow me to scan and pay using the app.  Sam‚Äôs scan and go is awesome.

I really love Costco in terms of products, the cleanliness, and shopping experience up until check out.

My low review is because the business model is petty and irritating. They are so obsessive about checking IDs and cards. It‚Äôs just too much. Sams isn‚Äôt bad that way and it‚Äôs just so irritating to deal with every time we check out. We even pay for two memberships so all of the adults living with us can have a card.

We went to pick up one of the cards yesterday, they make you show something with your extra persons address on it. This is a little frustrating because I own the house we live in so we had to find a medical bill for the other person to use as proof. It‚Äôs honestly just really annoying and it really rubbed me the wrong way. It‚Äôs a store membership, there is no need to be so petty and annoying.

Again - outside of this policy and constant behavior during check out. I really like Costco, but it‚Äôs enough to be annoying during our experiences.

We #adore Costco! ü§© This warehouse was like many others we've visited. We arrived 1/2 hour before closing today... so we didn't get the full experience. We're staying near Bryan/CS until March and will return to this warehouse several more times and will update accordingly.

A great place to shop.
The store has a huge variety of items.  Large quantity packages. Great for families
As with any store it is good to comparison Shop. Helpful staff.
Newly opened. A number of deals right now

Im not sure if it was me but this store was really big. Location is perfect, great service and lots of products; and the gas station moves pewter fast. Don‚Äôt forget the pizza & h dog on the way out!
Anita is rude. How about give your patrons respect and kindly announce where they are to get in line. Will never visit again and will be canceling my member ship because of Anita.

It's the top of the line for warehouse type stores. The people are friendly, the prices are good, the quality is high for everything, and the warranty is outstanding. Virtually anything with the Kirkland name on it will be good.  There's free online help and virus protection included with computers. This is one of my favorite places to buy steaks, the quality is better than local grocery stores. It's virtually the only place that I buy gas. One of the few things I don't like about them is trying to get anyone on the phone.

This was my first time at this particular location.  Cotsco never disappoints.  Found a deal on these beautiful appetizer plates for $6.97. Great samples, even samples of vitamin C.  I was pretty hungry from shopping.  The hot dog and drink for $1.50 hit the spot!

Costco is always nice. It was busy this day but I didn‚Äôt stand/wait in line long. They had lots of samples to try and this Honey Jack Daniel‚Äôs Cake was so yummy. They also had a sample of an immune booster drink and fruit roll ups. Everything was good and it was a plus that I got to snack while I waited in line. The cashier was nice and moved super fast but professional.

The pictures speak for themselves.  Repeat offenders! So these women and men decided that no one else was going to get the clearance items but them. They have a pattern of coming in every week, grabbing and  clearing the tables of various items.  SELFISH, RUDE, AND GREEDY PEOPLE. The managers were not doing anything about this. Very unbothered. This is not OK. Every week, this happens. They need to be stopped. We pay for a membership just like I assume they do. The lack of  management control over this situation was quite interesting.
Amazing and full of ready different varieties items. Crowded during evening hours. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Never come in and out empty handed. Always affordable and lower great prices.

It‚Äôs so crowded shopping at this location on Saturday afternoon; not good shopping quality.
Could not find the pants with the size less than 38 from the brand CAT and Banana Republic. Probably someone grabbed the whole piles of them.
It‚Äôs difficult to find the parking close to the entrance as usual; just park a bit far away and have some walks.
Best Costco location in Dallas! There‚Äôs always a variety of options that cannot be found in other locations. Always clean, always organized, and only crowded on weekends.

I no longer recommend going to this store, better to go to another Costco. In my last visits I have seen many suspicious people at the entrance of the store.  There are up to more than 15 people gathered in front of the store.  The last time I saw them they were screaming and fighting, I'm really afraid of having to go through all of them.

Not necessarily all of the things that you would find at a normal Costco. However, they have a lot more selection for any business requirements like large sizes and industrial grade appliances, and cookware. It also is considerably less crowded on a weekend than our normal Costco is.this is our first time here , that was great experience.

Not crowded, I like the atmosphere. It was a great shopping experience. I thought it‚Äôs only for business members but this store is available for everyone. They have different website and amazing deals than regular Costco website.

Before you ask, ANYONE with a Costco membership can shop here! I thought you need to have a business, but nope, they welcome everyone!

This location is so hidden that the way to the parking lot was through some small streets and potholes. It felt like they don't want regular shoppers to know about them unless you really search it up. I never heard of a Costco Business Center until my mom wanted crab meats, and regular Costco doesn't sell them. The online website said they sell them, but you need to order $250 worth of food to get free shipping. I don't need that much food so I decided to visit the location myself.

I was surprised to see all the amazing snacks and drinks that they offer. The selection is huge!! They have all kinds of chocolates, beef jerky, drinks, chips, and more. They don't have a food court, tire center, gas station, or alcohol sections like the regular Costco since it's catered to businesses mainly. I was able to stock up on some snacks that I didn't know Costco offered, and also canned crab meats for my mom. The store is the same size as a regular Costco, but less crowded.

If you're looking for pantry snacks and groceries, I would highly recommend coming here. Prices are the same as regular Costco, they just have more variety and bulk. They even have a whole lamb for sale in the freezer section. Check-out was super fast because there was barely anyone on a weekday.

I am an individual, and not a buisiness.  Very nice to know my COSTCO membership is valid here.  THIS IS THE ONLY COSTCO BUISINESS CENTER IN THE D.F.W. METROPLEX.  I like Costco better than Sam's Club.  I just bought a commercial grade basic deli meat slicer from a local restaurant equipment supplier; I plan to buy bulk deli meats like ham and turkey, and bulk cheese like sharp Cheddar, Monterey Jack, and Provolone in 5 or 6 pound packs.  Their selection is very limited, BUT the few deli products they have are very high quality and at a reasonable and competitive price.  They have PASTRAMI, and deli turkey that has no antibiotics with only turkey breast, broth, and a tiny amount of sea salt and sugar for the ingredients.  THIS IS A SHORT LIST.  Why buy deli meats and cheese in bulk?  You can save a good amount of money, and freeze what you don't use within a week or 2.  Compared to the prices of a deli at a grocery store, you can save from 50% to 70% off per pound.  The savings vary depending upon what retail price you compare with the same kind of wholesalers deli product.  I decided what kinds of meat and cheese I want, and did the math to find out what my savings would be.  What would cost me $276 at a certain grocery store deli near me will cost me $104 at the Costco Buisiness Center.   This is a $170 savings!  COSTCO BUISINESS CENTER WILL BE MY FIRST PLACE TO GO FOR DELI FOOD BULK PRODUCTS.  Also will buy candy here for Halloween, Christmas, Valentines Day, Easter, and year round.
Cool store, however, many of the items won't be practical or useful for a family or individual. I went just to look, didn't find anything I could practically use.

One word describes my first experience shopping at this Costco location - "Magical" üòÅ Seriously! üòÇ.. All jokes aside, they have products that I've been only able to find and purchase on Amazon for years! It is definitely my new favorite place to get the majority of our shopping taken care of.

Lots of wide parking. Easy access with shopping carts always available as you walk in.  Great layout, consistent, product is where you expect it.  Aisles are clear and the store is clean.  Great selections and most retail pricing is aggressive.   Access to check out is good, Costco opens additional che Louis when too many people are in line.  One issue is the food court.  Great pricing on prepared foods but the addition of a remote kiosk for ordering is not well thought out.  By having both a remote order location and a cash aisle that is manned by the server, the cash aisle gets preference.   The line of people waiting for remote orders builds while the cash customers are handled.  Bad system, better when everything was done from one location.    Getting out of Costco can be a problem having stood in line to pay having another line to stand in to get out of the store can be a problem.  Still hold with 5 star, good place to shop
Lauren and Elizabeth are awesome. They packed up my stuff in boxes without me even asking. Very professional. This is the service you can‚Äôt get at any other grocery store.

Had a bad experience today at Duncanville Costco today. Never had a problem with leaving my daughter in the cart as I go through the check out line unless it‚Äôs some new policy or something the staff member Kia needs to calm her attitude as far as saying things like dealing with people or something like that with comments under her breath. If that‚Äôs the kind of customer service I‚Äôm going to encounter here whenever I shop at Costco then the company will lose an Executive member who spends a lot of money there.

I purchase all of my grocery staples at Costco. You receive more bang for your buck.  I purchase berries, vegetables, Manuka Honey, oats, pumpkin seeds, pecans, Brazilian nuts, almonds, mushrooms, bell peppers, chips, etc. I even find very nice flowers here at a reasonable price.

I found everything I needed. This is not my favorite location. The flow of the layout seems a bit off, and the registers are always pretty backed up. They had lots of selections to choose from. The peaches are back!! Woohooo! There are lots of samples for those who like to try new items. The staff is always very knowledgeable and helpful throughout and kept very clean.

Some people were quite aggressive and upset as they tried to do their shopping.  This is common when we are so close to the holidays. It can get shoulder to shoulder with many people, so be sure you are in the right frame of mind when entering. You should expect this and remember to be kind to others.

Always have to decide to go through regular checkout and get your items thrown down onto your cart or to go through self checkout and have to put every box in the bagging area, where the attendants can help, but chances are they won‚Äôt help (some kinds of people) this time I picked self checkout and sure enough they help people with a few little items that they look at and feel they will chat with. Its picked!!! White hair lady and purple hair guy. Have had same treatment from these exact ppl before. So was not surprised. Could have helped a lot to get a little help scanning boxes.
It's a very big Costco center. There's a lot of stuff. It has a liquor section attached as well. Parking is enough.

Standard Costco experience except it's always been insanely busy when we've gone to this one. It's efficient but requires patience and awareness because so many people are moving. I've witnessed some of the staff be gruff with people just trying to figure out how to buy groceries. Hot food counter is good.

This costco is pretty big, so you can imagine that there would be pretty full and crowded. But costco in general is a good place to go to if you want to get a lot for a smaller price. However this particular costco's gas station is very crowded. and there are almost always long lines.

if you are driving in Downtown or in Richardson or anywhere close to there, then you will be better off going to the the other Costco. To the gas station i previously reviewed.

Dude it‚Äôs Costco what else can you say. The only thing that bothers me is how they can be so annoying with the membership. I can‚Äôt ask a team member where the bathroom is without them asking for the membership. Next thing you know we are gona have to swipe the membership card to use the restroom lol. One flush per household member lol. Other than that good prices for bulk items. Not everything is a steal or a deal. Do your research. However with the optical, Rx and electronics warranties, you can‚Äôt beat it. So yes I would recommend you get a membership and shop there.

A quick trip for yogurt turned into a $560 shopping trip.  It's always fun to shop here.  Ended up buying two pairs of glasses at the optical store along with some cool advent calendars with a different beer for each day, leading to Christmas.  Love the pumpkin pie.
Infinity Massage Chairs are on sale right now!!!  I love them.  The Costco price is a fantastic deal!

I love Costco, and going once a month is not enough, but must restrain myself! Lol

I can find the best of everything at Costco, from clothes, to food, to plants, seasonal items, depending on the season.

I also love their cashback incentives where you earn a credit ‚Äúcheck‚Äù for use in purchasing groceries or other items of my choosing twice per year.

Recommended without a hesitation or reservation.

Not cheap or competitive prices. Clothing up to XL. Some items misrepresented by manufacturer and COSTCO. Expected better prices and consideration to bigger persons. Raw chicken with antibiotics. Wine selection poor. Disappointed. Sam's is better.

This place! It's really about getting what you need at a fair price and then using self control to NOT buy your favorite snacks in a pack of 50!
A membership here comes with a lot of benefits and not just good quantity.  There are bonuses of travel discounts, gas discounts, home improvements, seasonal clothing, home furnishings, office supplies,car rental, delivery options, my head spins at all the programs one could take advantage of.
