Tire center:
I have yet to have a good experience at the tire center here. I have two main issues:
1. I easily spend twice or more time here than anywhere else for similar service
2. They did not own up to $385 of damage they caused to my car

More details:
1. The most common problem I've had is how much time I waste even though I always have an appointment. (The difficulty of getting one is another matter) Dropping off? Wait 20 minutes in line. Picking up? Wait 20 minutes...  (or longer) Maybe I'm just plagued with always picking a bad time to go in, but seems unlikely, especially when I always have an appointment.  Work times are also considerably longer than other places I've done business with. My best case scenario when I've gotten a tire fixed was about an hour and a half. I've also waited almost 3 hours before.

2. They did not own up to their negligence and the damage they caused to my car. I had tires installed at this Costco on an Odyssey with 200k miles. When I got my tires rotated the first time, one of the lug nuts was stripped on a wheel stud and broke off. Any mechanic will tell you this is the fault of the person who last put the lug nuts on: they didn't take the time to thread it by hand initially and just forced it on with an impact wrench. Obvious negligence on Costco's part. I had to fill out a form about the damage (after waiting in line 20+ min...), then deal with a 3rd party with lots of back and forth conversations. They denied the claim because their excuse was they said wheel studs are supposed to be replaced at 100k miles as part of normal maintenance! That isn't in the manual and several mechanics I spoke to had never heard of that (including the Frisco Honda dealership). Costco's representative wouldn't budge. When I asked for documentation to prove what they were telling me, they blew me off. The only thing I can think of where they are getting the 100k mile number is that is when the wheel studs are out of warranty. By that logic, if they crashed my car into the wall they wouldn't pay for that either since the entire car is out of warranty. I had to get the wheel stud replaced for $385 - one of the cheapest quotes I found. Assuming it is negligible to replace the other studs on the same wheel, according to Costco, you are supposed to spend $1600 to have all your wheel studs replaced at 100k miles. Absurd I had to pay for Costco's negligence.

I'll never give Costco my tire business again, even for work that might entail using the warranty and should be "free".

I recently had a shopping experience at Costco, and I must say it was quite impressive.

The first thing that struck me was the incredible variety of products available. From groceries to electronics, furniture to clothing, Costco seems to have it all. Whether you're shopping for your household or business needs, you're likely to find what you're looking for.

Costco's membership model may deter some, but I found it to be well worth it. The savings from bulk buying can be substantial. While individual item prices might seem a bit higher, the overall value for larger quantities is excellent. I've found that the annual membership fee more than pays for itself through the savings I've accrued.

The quality of products at Costco is generally top-notch. They carry reputable brands, and their Kirkland Signature private label often offers a more affordable option without compromising on quality.

One highlight of my visit was the food court. Costco's food offerings are both delicious and budget-friendly. The famous hot dogs and pizza slices are well worth the visit alone.

Customer service at Costco is impressive. The return policy is generous, and the staff members are consistently helpful and friendly. It's a welcoming environment that adds to the overall positive shopping experience.

While the stores can get crowded, especially on weekends, it's a testament to Costco's popularity. However, I appreciate that they've made strides in improving their online shopping experience for those who prefer to shop from home.

I also commend Costco for its sustainability efforts, including commitments to sourcing sustainable products and reducing its environmental impact. It's reassuring to see a big retailer taking steps toward a more eco-friendly future.

In conclusion, Costco offers a comprehensive shopping experience with its wide product selection, membership benefits, and excellent savings on bulk items. The quality of products and customer service is commendable, and the food court is a delightful bonus. While the membership fee and crowds may not be for everyone, I find that the benefits far outweigh any drawbacks. Costco continues to be a top choice for my shopping needs.

I was in the market for tires.  I still had some tread remaining but was going on a road trip and thought I should have them replaced.

I called the store and worked through the phone system to reach the tire section.   After a couple of days of ringing them  several times each day I selected the option to talk with Admin.

Admin informed me that my best option was to come into the store, select and pay for tires, and finally to make an appointment for installation.   Basically two trips. Admin then said I could leave a message and the tire section would call me back, I could order the tires, schedule an installation appointment and be done.

I'm still waiting on them to call me back after 5 days.   In the meantime I called Discount Tire, had them ordered and installed three days ago.   And...  Discount Tire was even cheaper by a few dollars.

Normally I believe Costco has fantastic customer service, but apparently it hasn't spread to the tire section.

Costco's Self-Checkout Nightmare: A Customer Inconvenience Taken Too Far

As a longtime Costco member, I've always appreciated the warehouse club's commitment to providing value and convenience to its customers. However, their recent changes to the self-checkout process have left me utterly disappointed and questioning their priorities.

The new self-checkout system is an absolute nightmare for shoppers. Instead of streamlining the checkout process, Costco has made it an unnecessarily arduous and time-consuming ordeal. Customers are now forced to remove every single item from their cart, scan them one by one, place them in a designated weight area, and then painstakingly reload their cart. It's a ridiculous and counterintuitive process that defeats the purpose of self-checkout entirely.

If Costco's primary concern is theft prevention, they should address it through alternative means rather than inconveniencing and frustrating their loyal customer base. We, as paying members, should not be burdened with such an inefficient and cumbersome checkout process.

Costco has two reasonable options to rectify this situation:

Offer a discount or incentive to customers who endure the self-checkout ordeal. If they insist on making our lives more difficult, the least they could do is provide some form of compensation for our patience and cooperation.

Hire more employees to assist with the checkout process. This would alleviate the need for the overly complicated self-checkout system and provide a more efficient and pleasant shopping experience for everyone involved.

Costco prides itself on being a customer-centric company, but these recent changes to the self-checkout process contradict that very principle. It's time for the warehouse giant to reevaluate their priorities and consider the convenience and satisfaction of their loyal members. Failure to address this issue promptly may drive customers away and tarnish Costco's reputation as a shopper-friendly establishment.

‚ÄúMixed Experience at Costco Lewisville, TX: A Filipino's Oasis with a Checkout Twist"

As someone who grew up in the Philippines, discovering Costco in Lewisville, TX felt like finding a piece of heaven. This location stands out with its diverse array of Asian products, a delightful surprise not found in other Costco branches like Southlake, TX. The food court's double chocolate chunk cookies were a sweet revelation, absent in my usual Costco haunt.

However, my recent visit on a Sunday around 2 pm left a bittersweet taste. While I've never encountered a rude Costco employee anywhere else, this particular visit had its challenges. The checkout process was chaotic, whether opting for self-checkout or the regular lanes. The long lines seemed exacerbated by a thorough, time-consuming examination of purchases, especially at the regular checkouts. Perhaps it was a long day for the employee in question, but the extended wait after a tiring shopping spree was less than ideal.

Despite the minor hiccup, my love for Costco remains intact, and I'll continue exploring new locations ‚Äì just maybe not this one on a Sunday afternoon. The Lewisville branch holds its unique charm, but efficiency at the checkout could use a boost to make the experience truly heavenly.

Love this location. I can always find what I‚Äôm looking for or an associate to help guide me. Great location to stop for gas also. Never waited too long as there as plenty of pumps and they move quickly.

Nice place to find useful stuff. I only find a few choices of any product but this is super helpful in deciding which to buy. Oftentimes I would find great quality mango or mandarin, or strawberries, but not consistent. Same with the eggs or dairy products, readymade food or coffee, the quality varies. Don't know why! Prices are usually consistent and sometimes I even get super great deals.

Some items are with getting at Costco but for some items better stick to grocery stores since it will be more affordable there. I got this delicious paleo, vegan, dairy free, soy free, and gluten free wraps and it was delicious and cheaper to get here than anywhere else. I got kids 300ct vitamins for $13, the a giant box of the best croissants for $6, homemade roti for $10, and so much more for a much better price.

Costco always has great finds, new products, and much more to explore! I personally frequent this Costco often for groceries or just some novelties. Got to love all the organic foods that they produce. Though, I do wish that the checkout process would be a not quicker.
I love Costco. Will this Costco sell some products as wine chocolate or the wine like the pics because they‚Äôre so nice for gift. Thank you.

Recently checked out this location of Costco as I was in the neighborhood. Must say I was really really impressed. From very well organized and cleaner aisles to super-friendly and supportive staffs, everything was at its best. In my opinion, this location offers better meat and fish products, and they also have a wide variety of sauces compared to other Costco outlets in and around Austin. Will definitely re-visit!

Awesome Costco in Pflugerville. Even with the new one opening in Georgetown this one is great! And I love the banana loaves they have. Individually wrapped makes them easy to share with family, friends or colleagues. They are delicious and a winner. Awesome specialty breads there too. Thanks Costco!

The place is amazing!
But the pizza is meh,
I mean, I did like it, but there are better places for pizza hahaha
Staff in Costco is very kind and the store itself has everything!
All good here with lots of good bargains. Of course that always means you buy way too much but oh well. Good selection and always good produce

Doesn't everyone üíô Costco who has a membership ü§î It's Much better than Sam's. Costco carries Organic products throughout the store, which is a must in my family. The prices are great üëç Organic meats, veggies, fruits, meals desserts, etc.  Plus, they have many great products and prices. Their return policy is better then anyone else, too. I honestly don't know how they do it.

Met the most pleasant young man (David A) at the customer service counter today.  He helped me with a price adjustment and was most helpful with the app and researching the receipt for me.  His manager was also very nice and thanked us for our visit. I wasn‚Äôt able to catch his name but he had a nice Puma brand name jacket on.  Please see that both of these gentleman are recognized for their superior customer service , not easy to find these days!

Disappointing Experience at Costco Checkout

I'm compelled to share a recent disappointing experience at Costco, which has left me reconsidering my membership. After completing our shopping and proceeding through checkout, my elderly mother and I were heading towards the exit when we were stopped for a routine receipt check‚Äîan expected procedure at Costco. To our surprise, the employee discovered that a box of bleach bottles had been inadvertently left unscanned, sitting unnoticed at the bottom of our cart. It was clear that this oversight happened during the checkout process, involving both the employees who handled our items and the cashier.

The staff member at the exit pointed out the missed item and suggested we return to the checkout to pay for it. Under normal circumstances, this might not have been a significant issue. However, given that I was assisting my elderly mother, returning through the busy store presented an inconvenient challenge, particularly to rectify an error we had no hand in creating.

In an attempt to resolve the situation swiftly, I requested that the item simply be removed from our cart, highlighting that the mistake was on Costco‚Äôs part as they managed the checkout process. The response from the employee was unexpectedly defensive; she insisted she had not made a personal error. I had to clarify that it was a systemic oversight by Costco, not her individually. This exchange was discomforting and made us feel wrongfully implicated in the oversight.

While I understand that errors can occur, the way this situation was handled lacked empathy and customer care. We left feeling frustrated and significantly inconvenienced, tarnishing our otherwise regular positive experiences with Costco. Effective customer service should prioritize quick and compassionate resolutions. Sadly, this was not our experience, leading me to question the value of my continued patronage with Costco.

Full disclosure: I love Costco, I even have "The Joy of Costco" book. So I'm not sure this is an unbiased review.
As expected, this Costco is a large warehouse filled with great buys. On this particular day, we were on a tight schedule, so my wife went to get gas while I started shopping. I was about 2/3 of the way through the store when she joined me. Even though it was crowded, most Costco shoppers are polite and let me and my cart slip by them easily. And amazingly the checkout lines were short. As usual the staff were efficient and also friendly. And as usual, we found more great buys than we planned ("the most expensive vehicle to operate is a Costco shopping cart").

I was there to get keys made, and my experience was great,  I was amazed they made a key that had a chip in it, which worked perfectly, not expensive at all. It was their last day in Rockwall. I also need a new key fob. I'm going to Plano to the location to have them make it for me definitely better than the price at the car dealers .

Mark the manager at this location refuses to honor the pricing his team had marked on this set. While he acknowledged it was his teams mistake he took zero accountability and stated that he doesn‚Äôt have to honor the pricing mistake and that he won‚Äôt. Within the first minute of calling me said it didn‚Äôt matter if I had called corporate to leave a message cause it‚Äôs ‚Äúhis decision‚Äù then later said when I asked for the district managers contact that he can‚Äôt make that call. So which is it?  He said it was the customers job to check sku numbers‚Ä¶. Said ‚Äúmost customers just let it go when the price is wrong‚Äù. So clearly this happens a lot here and clearly his go to is just telling your customers they shouldn‚Äôt trust the signs him and his team put out? Surely your corporate office knows that‚Äôs gonna land you in hot water with trade practices like that.

I've been a member of Costco since they were called Price Club.  Straight up club shopping.  The store is clean and staff helpful and friendly.   They have self check out about 6 in all that are located together and regular cashier check out.  Also available food court, optical, hearing aid, gasoline, and pharmacy.  Plenty of parking and handicapped parking are available with multiple exits to different main arteries roads.  The gasoline pumps usually open an hour before opening and an hour after closing.   You must have a membership to shop here and also for gasoline.   I do believe no membership is required for pharmacy.   Check local store times for operation.  Closes early on Saturday.

This is the cleanest Costco I‚Äôve been to in all of the DFW area! The gas is really good and my suv seems to be more gas efficient if I fill up at this location. All the employees are top notch and I haven‚Äôt been turned away once when I‚Äôve needed assistance. I highly recommend shopping at this Costco on your next Costco run so you can compare.

They are always really good about return s and their selection is off the charts. It seems like they have a little bit of everything and just what you need. I really appreciate how hard your customer service and checkers. The food court has even added a few new items like the roast beef sandwich and the turkey sandwich. Drinks are always cheap at only 70 cents a pop.

Lately we have been getting a lot of pre-made foods that I do really appreciate the ease and excellent taste. I have tried to stay away from the prepackaged foods because they always seem to have a lot of extra calories and make me feel chubby after eating. The new pre-packaged items like the Tuscan chicken wraps and chicken sandwiches with Dijon mustard are excellent.

I usually get the executive membership and it typically pays me back $300 so it's well worth the $120 fee.

This is a great location with a lot of hard-working people!

This was my first time visiting this Costco, or any Costco. I finally decided to bite the bullet and get a membership. I have no clue why I waited so long because Costco is amazing! I didn't want to leave. They have so much stuff! In particular, I was impressed with the amount of ready-made meals they offer. Excellent selection. I also want to shout out the employees here. They were all really nice and helpful. The lines were long, so I went through the self-checkout line. One of the employees saw me struggling and came over and scanned everything for me. I am not sure how busy Costco's usually are, but this store was bustling with people everywhere. It was hectic, but maybe it always is on Saturdays. Highly recommend though!

I would like to say what a great shopping experience I‚Äôve never returned an item before and I had one that just wasn‚Äôt what I was looking for and there was no questions asked. I will continue to shop there and recommend Costco to everybody. I know. Thanks again for the great service.

Bulk shopping place that makes customers remove all their items, including the heavy(!) ones, at the self check out. What an actual sad joke. Never seen the longer line either. At the time when businesses are moving towards the most convenient shopping experience, Costco is degrading. This place is going down. Time to look at alternatives.

Came close to closing time, grabbed a bag coffee among other things and Jennifer at the exit door kindly inquired if I wanted to grind the beans before leaving. I had totally forgotten and really appreciated her reminder, it would've been so easy for her to not mention it. Love the genuine concern for customers!!

I wasn't sure if it was going to be worth the $60 membership fee but I think it will be.  You do have to do a little homework though to get the best price.  Like 25lbs of sugar, same price as HEB.  Coconut oil same price as WalMart but you get 30oz more!  Cleaning supplies, laundry detergent and dish soap all tons cheaper at Costco.  Salt and pepper tons cheaper at Costco.

First time I tried to become a member, Costco double charged us, we went with their competitor. This year, we decided to try Costco again. We went inside, because you have to go in and get your picture taken for the costco card, not like their competitor, where I just signed up online and was good to go. At first the lady who helped us was cool, but after only offering us the expensive membership for $120, her tone subtly shifted when I asked about the cheaper option she completely left out. She then tried to  explain how the wholesale retail concept works, and I explained we had a Competitor membership and were familiar with how it worked. "We're nothing like them" she said. We paid for our membership, and were told we must sign up for auto renewal. She had issues with the tablet used to sign up for this. The tablet then had issues recognizing the card we were using, the same one we just paid for the membership with. and then finally, the app doesn't allow you to add to the cart by scanning, or allow you to checkout using the app. So she was right, nothing like their competitors. The pricing is better here though, and this is probably a one-off experience with them, but as my first experience, I didn't enjoy being talked to as if I was stupid, nor did I like having to repeatedly turn down a more expensive membership.

A 1 hour wait in line to checkout gives me enough time to write a review. Checkout is always slow, unorganized and terrible. Half the time here, you stand in the wrong line. I don‚Äôt know why there‚Äôs no mobile checkout person with a scanner/card reader for those paying with card only like I‚Äôve seen at other locations. Parking is extremely minimal. The parking lot also has odd intersections making for easy fender benders. There are even great parking areas that read ‚Äúno parking‚Äù which where people accumulate tickets. Every weekend, carts run out, and it‚Äôs obvious more employees are needed.
Over all, zero stars, not up to Costco standards. Worst Costco I‚Äôve been to from here to CA.

I drove from San Marcos to Selma to surprise my daughter a gift. *Manny* & *Olive* did a wonderful job helping me giving me the best customer service by being kind, meticulous, and welcoming. I wanted to make sure the diamond earrings I wanted was in perfect condition before I had purchase it. Manny and Olive went beyond my expectations showing me the same pairs of earrings from another area that was not shown in the displayed case. I am very pleased with their services they had provided me. In the end, I had made the purchase. Now we both have the same identical diamond earrings. Sooooo happy !! If I had a choice, I would have given them both a 12/10 on a scale. Keep up the great work !!! üëç
Went to Costco to get the Cheese and Cherry Danish and fabulous croissants and pineapple and delicious strawberries üçì

I love Costco! I‚Äôve been a Costco member for years now. It has been one of the best decisions made. I do most of my grocery shopping here and if I ever need tire maintenance. Staff are easy to approach - very helpful and polite. Some even go above and beyond, stopping to see if I need anything and taking initiative to check for items in stock.

As you can see by my photos, the Atlantic Salmon USDA is my go to!

I bought a new battery here for my car. It's a name brand, Interstate AGM, expensive battery. It lasted less than six months. I took it back and got a new one. The new, new one lasted six months. I took it back and they want to charge me a prorated amount on the price of a new one which has gone way up. If a 36 month battery will only last 6 months there should be no charge for a replacement. It should be handed over with a "Sorry about that man" It's very difficult dealing with a dead battery. They are very heavy and hard for a 69 yr old to replace. ON top of this they can't even order the high performance Michelin tire I need for my other car. COSTCO: Chinese Offshore Trading Company

I‚Äôve been a faithful member for most of my life.
Nothing beats their customer service and return policies. Just had left over Costco pizza for lunch.
Now inspired to meal prep it and freeze it first later üòà Just can‚Äôt beat the convenience and consistency in their products.

This Costco has great customer service! The employees are friendly and helpful. Well, the food court employees aren't terrific at customer service but I can imagine how stressful their job is. So, the food court aside, the employees across the board are so pleasant. Costco is just a fun place to shop. There's always stuff you don't need but end up purchasing. There's always stuff they don't have and you wish they did. We shop at Costco for rags for our business, for ginormous muffins and almond danishes, for 500 rolls of toilet paper and never-ending tubes of aluminum foil, for the cauliflower rice and grilled cheese sandwiches. If I get a chance to walk through the clothing section, I'm a happy woman. If I get a chance to buy something from the clothing section without my husband protesting, I'm an even happier woman! I wouldn't say Costco is necessary for our shopping. But we sure are glad we get to shop there!

Costco definitely runs a tight ship. Went on Saturday at peak time, and despite the high amount of people shopping, it was fast and efficient. I think the toughest part was finding parking, but even that wasn‚Äôt as tough as some trips to smaller supermarkets on a Saturday afternoon after payday. The products also looked fresh and very good quality for the price (even taking into account that that‚Äôs the whole thing with costco).

MY FAVORITE PLACE! :) love this Costco!
The employees and the cleanliness is top notch.
Also, the gas station remodel has been a major improvement.

Pay a fee to shop here, yet get harassed by 5 different vendors of cell phones, kitchen items, windows etc while walking through the store. Was not always like this in the past. Its already bad enough dealing with the parking and crowds. Easier to just buy most stuff on Amazon.

This place is a madhouse on Saturday afternoons, very hard to find help, (because it's so busy) and people are impatient. Even the parking was tough. Besides the negative, It has a great selection and great prices. The workers were trying their best, but putting up with so many people is taxing.
Save the headaches and go on weekdays.

This location had become an absolute dumpster fire. They don‚Äôt want to have cashiers and they want self checkout as difficult as possible. You now have to wait for someone to help with the larger items or try to lift them over the scanner at the right angle.
We had to stand 45 minutes in line for returns, because they only had 1 person manning the return station. Some people were in line for over an hour!

One of the best Costco‚Äôs I‚Äôve been to! Very quiet, and absolutely not busy at all whatsoever! It‚Äôs nice to shop here and not deal with a crowd of people. They are missing a few items from the regular Costco, but it‚Äôs okay, shopping in a less busy Costco is always a bonus! Would definitely come back here more in the future for majority of the things we shop for!

Had the chance to check out the Costco Business Center in Missouri City, and wow, it's a game-changer compared to your regular Costco! This place is like a treasure trove for food enthusiasts and anyone in the food business.

Right off the bat, the selection here is something else. I'm talking about a range of meats and cheeses that you just don't see at other Costco locations. It's like walking into a carnivore's paradise. I even stumbled upon a whole lamb and some seriously impressive Wagyu steaks ‚Äì items you don't typically find in a regular warehouse.

But the real star of the show is their meat, dairy, and produce room. It's enormous ‚Äì seriously, the biggest I've ever seen. You can tell they've put a lot of thought into offering a wide variety for both personal and business needs.

What's cool about this place is that it's the only Costco Business Center in Houston, which adds to its uniqueness. And the cherry on top? It's not overcrowded. You can actually take your time browsing without feeling rushed or cramped.

Honestly I love the Costco Business Center in Missouri City and this is for sure a fantastic find. Whether you're stocking up for your business or just a food lover looking for quality and variety, this place has got you covered. Definitely worth a visit for a unique and satisfying shopping experience! üõíü•©üßÄüëç

Attn. Drivers: Overnight parking is available
No portal potty onsite
Men & women restroom inside
Please don't block the docks or park in the middle of the parking area. Please park along the edge of the parking lot out of the way.
There's a Walmart w/ a McDonald's & Waffle House just down the way.
Check in is @ 2am. Go up the stairs near door 5 and follow the instructions. Check in regardless of ur appointment time.
They have  cookies  that other Costco does not have ! Must try!!! Not as hectic, plenty of space to load your purchased and great for small. Business needs.

This place is a godsend! I didn't think i could love Costco more but i most definitely do! Great addition to our city and will definitely be a big help to small businesses! Especially the restaurant business! Don't forget to check out the fresh produce section. Its literally the biggest fridge I've ever been in.

Costco Wholesale provided an exceptional shopping experience for my family! The spacious store layout made browsing easy, and the vast selection of quality products catered to everyone's needs. We loved the value we received on bulk items, saving us money without compromising quality. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the checkout process was swift despite the bustling crowd. The food court was a hit, offering delicious, affordable options for a quick family meal. We left with full carts and smiles, looking forward to our next visit!üíñüíïüíµüí≥üßæ

I visited this location on a Saturday.
Nice place but, to my surprise, no spaghetti in stock!
Very ethnically diverse clientele.  Although it is an affluent area, many customers don't follow many basic civil manners!  They leave carts in the middle of the parking lot, and they leave their carts unattended in the middle of the isles.  Haven't you guys heard about "keep your right" as when you drive a car? It is simple!
Others need a bath and lots of deodorant!!!

Outstanding leadership and customer service!

This evening my wife and I bought our household items and decided on a pizza for dinner. The food court was relatively busy but quickly backed up as shoppers placed orders before closing. The two attendants were trying hard to keep up, but as often happens, they fall behind. They are human.

I located a gentlemen who seemed to be in management, Donnie, and mentioned that the food court might could use some help. Not only did Donnie address the issue immediately, he did so with a great attitude. Within a minute, the food court had three additional employees. The clear and obvious leader of the team in that kitchen was Ms. Allison. She was hustling, knocking out orders with enthusiasm, and set the tone for the rest of them. This experience was highlighted even further with the fact that Donnie came back to check on his team and his customers not once, not twice, but THREE MORE TIMES before we left.

That is leadership and teamwork at its very best. Thank you, Donnie & Allison. Fine job!

Super crowded on a Sunday.
One issue I had was at the coffee grinders compared to other Costcos in CA and NV:
The Bunn coffee grinders are too short to fit larger 2.5 lb bags. The Jose grinders are much better.
Those grinders do a poor job. My EXTRA FINE  grind was way TOO CHUNKY. SEE PHOTO compared to regular Folgers.
Other Costcos have wide tape in a tape dispenser to reseal the bag. Since this store didn't have it, some of my coffee grinds spilled out going home.
The paint brush to sweep the coffee beans was ok. Most Costcos use a steel spin.
All things considered, I'm not buy whole bean coffee at this store again.

This was a great experience. I recommend you give this place a try to see if you‚Äôll like it or not ! The concession food is wonderful!! My favorite is the hot dog with a drink. And it‚Äôs best to look around to see if this is where you will shop.

The African American tall older man standing by the door, checking everyone‚Äôs receipt on Saturday, March 16th 2024 at 1PM saw all my food on the cart and literally tossed it on the floor on purpose.
He didn‚Äôt apologize, just said ‚ÄúI gotta check everything ya know‚Äù.
Literally didn‚Äôt even care that he purposely dumped all my food on the ground. Please hire someone more competent than this guy!!

I've been shopping here for the last 5 years and the last year and a half this store has gotten progressively worse... specifically the employees. Their attitudes, politeness, and customer service have gone in the toilet...  some of them are aggressively rude. I LOVE Costco but it may be time to abandon the Katy location for Bunker Hill or Sugarland. I have never experienced these issues while shopping there.

On top of this they insist on putting samples at nearly every third end cap (pictured) so when people wait for the attendant to finish making whatever they are giving away it inevitably clogs the isles with not only the people waiting for their sample but everyone trapped behind them. It seriously buggers up people's movement throughout the store and God forbid there was an actual emergency, it would definitely cause a safety hazard.

This is a good grocery store and they usually have the lowest prices in gas. They treat their members amazingly and honestly at times that isn‚Äôt true because members have problems from time to time but they try to get it figured out. This membership I think may be more expensive than Sam‚Äôs Club or maybe we are just closer to Sam‚Äôs Club, but for whatever reason those two huge stores are basically the same. As always much love from Houston and the universe.
Love to shop here. Tho it‚Äôs a huge space. I enjoy getting my basic and other discoveries. Some items are not repeats. Exchange and return policy a breeze. Best of all the quality of their products.

Costco's the spot for deals and quality, no doubt. But man, the crowds, lines, and parking stress me out every time, no matter when I go. Still, totally recommend it. Pumped they're opening one in Aliana - gonna save me those trips to this spot!

I love Costco overall either myself or parents have always been members my entire life‚Ä¶ feel like I‚Äôm in a GD prison now going there‚Ä¶ check membership at door‚Ä¶. Check it at self checkout‚Ä¶.. aren‚Äôt allowed to use scan guns at self checkout anymore‚Ä¶. Can‚Äôt walk in through the side door to go to the food court and have to awkwardly squeeze past everyone in checkout lines if I only am there for a quick lunch after filling up on gas. Luckily I‚Äôm moving and the location closest to me now hasn‚Äôt implemented all these crazy ‚Äústandards‚Äù yet

First time going into Costco. I really enjoyed it
Awesome prizes. The food court is great as well. Low price food. Staff was great

Great warehouse! Feels more spacious than some others. The lines were really short when we went. Great selection of organic produce and other goods. There were lots of samples when we went and the adjacent liquor sales had samples too. We were only disappointed that there were no organic eggs in stock.

SARAH at the optical section was so helpful & knowledgeable!  She Also had an amazing attitude & cheerful personality! Costco did a great job hiring her! She's the type of person you would want helping you!
At one point she was helping 3 people all at the same time & I never felt neglected She really knows how to juggle the work & help everyone she can it's incredible üò≤  I know not many people can do that successfully, if at all! Great job Sarah with purple hair üíú

I appreciate good service and consideration. At 81 years of age, I know if I need help with a heavy product, someone will put it in my basket and after load it in my car. Attitude is very important to me and I believe the attitude of their personnel is very good.

I've been a member of Costco for several years, and each visit still manages to exceed my expectations! From the vast selection of quality goods at unbeatable prices to the friendly and helpful staff, Costco makes shopping a truly enjoyable experience. The store is always clean and well-organized, making it easy to find what you need. Their food court is a must-try‚Äîespecially the delicious and affordable pizza and hot dogs. Also, the added benefits like low-cost gasoline and exceptional deals on electronics and clothing make the membership worth every penny. Whether you're stocking up for a family or just picking up a few essentials, Costco has it all. Highly recommend for anyone looking to save money without compromising on quality!
Fine Costco. Lots of parking easy access. Don‚Äôt look for liquor at this location though. Beer and wine only.

What to say about this place, come for the hot dog and leave with a cart full of stuff you never knew you needed. Leave your credit card at home if you have no self control. I bought tires here and while I waited I spent an extra 400 just because. So enjoy but with restraint. My wife says she worries about me when I leave knowing what is going to happen. But therapy costs money and I don't like to lay on a couch and pay somebody.

I have been going to this costco since it was built and have rarely had issues with fresh items until this past week. I purchased a fresh fish, strawberries, and mini cucumbers. I cut into the fish package when I got home and saw rotten fish discoloration. The packaging stated it had been packed that day. Then, later in the evening,  I went to use cucumbers and one had mold spores. Next morning, I go to use strawberries for breakfast,  and mold/slime is on the strawberries. Cannot believe that in order to be refunded for rotten fish I had to take it back to the store. Nearly puked from the smell. The steaks were good though. Will.be avoiding fresh items for awhile.  Return staff was amazing, QC is horrible. We pay an annual membership. Do better, Costco.

The service is fantastic; all the workers are super efficient. The product availability and variety are amazing. I have many things I buy regularly. The only thing I don't like, which applies to all Costcos, is that I have to show my membership card at the front. I know it is policy; I rarely ever was bothered until recently. I tend to not pull out my card till I get to the door, so it is not something someone can just rush up and take out of my hand. Yet I don't like to take time and hold up the line by digging it out at the door. I also don't like that the only purpose of the person at the entrance is to ask for my membership card. There is little to zero greeting or friendliness. I also don't know why it matters, because I could have stolen the card. Unless it is verified to be my card and not expired, just flashing it quickly does no good for anyone at Costco or the customers. I was told recently that the employees at the self checkout must verify our membership ID. As it turns out, this is false. After speaking with managers about it, they just want to make sure everyone has their card out ready, because they have a problem with customers being efficient. Plus, when I do show them my card they make a useless glance at it, unable to actually discern it is mine.

This Costco is in a great location but stays busy and hard to find parking.

As usual Costco has the shopping and is busy but we find that the quick checkout is just that and never holds up people too long and the employees are right there to help move it along.

Now I see everyone saying how cheap gas is but here it is the same as outside stations. Would recommend.

I usually only stop at this location for gas because the parking lot is always so full.  But I went in today.  What a great experience!!  I grabbed some flowers and headed for the checkout.  To my surprise, not a long checkout line in self checkout.   And Jeremiah, with his superior customer service, was great assisting me!  I'll definitely go back to this location when I'm in the area.

I don't normally shop at this location. I expected that this location would be similar to my usual Costco. As far as store selection and product availability, it was great. The letdown was in the personnel. I can only describe them as "less than enthusiastic". Everyone almost seemed miserable, like they hated their jobs. No "hi", no acknowledgment, no smiles, nothing. The 2 employees that were at the checkout did seem to enjoy talking to each other while heading customers through the line. The girl who checked our receipts at the door was the worst, not one word, no eye contact, and just went through the motions. I have been a member at Costco for over 10 years, and we shop here every week, this was the worst personal experience. I have come to expect more than this from Costco, but they fell short. It felt like I was shopping ar Sam's.

You can NOT get a motorized cart here to save your life. Every week I go with my disabled grandfather to get his errands done, and we always have to chase someone down when they leave with their carts (and every time we do the person on the cart knows exactly what we need, we load their car for them and then they give us the cart).

Today we were there for 45 minutes with lots of other disabled shoppers waiting for them, we had all the cart guys looking for them and one of them even went to search the store. We didn‚Äôt even see anyone using them, let alone an available one! Eventually all of us who were waiting left.

I had a great experience at Costco Webster, TX Optical department.  Yesinnia and Kim went out of their way to make sure that I was taken care of properly. They couldn‚Äôt find my insurance info in the system so they called my insurance to see if I‚Äôm in network which I wasn‚Äôt.  I still bought with Costco due to the low prices on the frames. They also got the info to help me get reimbursed some of my money spent out of pocket. Excellent customer service.  My first time using Costco Optical and will continue to do so moving forward.

I don't understand how this location has such a high rating when EVERY time I've been to this store the parking is ridiculous, the lines at the gas pumps are long, the employee's are rude and take their job way too seriously unless it's to clean apparently because the snack area is ALWAYS filthy. At $60 - $120 memberships you'd think they could maintain a clean store as "exclusive" as they try to come across. Thank goodness our family has a Sam's membership also. Way easier shopping experience at Sam's.

Love Costco... Much better snack bar than Sam's.

Excellent clothing options.

$60 for the basic annual membership.

Sign me up please.

My mom and I love this location. Besides the great prices, delicious pizza and yummy rotisserie, the best part of the store is definitely the Hearing Aid Center. Heather and Daisy are so professional. They took such great care of my mom. They answered all of our questions and made her comfortable with her purchase. Daisy explained everything to my mom in Spanish. She is such a rockstar. I definitely recommend visiting them if you‚Äôre in the market for hearing aids. It‚Äôs been less than a month but the purchase is so far so good :)

New Item alert: delicious banana bread from bakery st. The first ingredients are banana; so a great snack for me and kids. I also picked up the jalape√±o cheddar bread from Aspen Mills and next time I come in I am going to try the cinnamon chip.

I went to Costco today and once again disappointed! Customer service is non- existent and our cashier was EXTREMELY RUDE!
Sam‚Äôs vs Costco. Sam‚Äôs hands down every single time!
Sam‚Äôs customer service is great and their cashiers go above and beyond! Sam‚Äôs has scan n go AND they accept more forms of payment. Store is overcrowded and their snack bar is ALWAYS dirty. I am NOT going to be treated  like a second class citizen while spending my hard earned money.

Easy parking and access from the highway. This Costco runs like a well oiled machine. Employees everywhere making sure that the aisles are clear and keeping the shelves full. There‚Äôs a Pharmacy, Optical store and a Liquor store. Lots of customers there today but I got there thru the self serve register pretty fast!  Keep up the great work Costco!

Costco has consistently exceeded my expectations as a one-stop shopping destination. The warehouse offers an extensive range of high-quality products at competitive prices. The spacious layout and organized aisles make shopping a breeze, and the friendly staff contribute to a positive overall experience. From fresh produce to electronics, Costco has become my go-to for both everyday essentials and special finds. The membership perks and unbeatable value keep me coming back, making Costco a top-notch shopping destination.

Love it, the only problem is that every time I end up spending at least $100 on unnecessary items due to really good bargains.  The family loves the pepperoni pizza and the giant chocolate chip cookies.

I love Costco! From the samples to the food court, overall always have a great experience. Easy to shop in and the customer service has never let me down. Would like a little more variety of books selection.

Everything you'd expect from a Costco with friendly staff, organized stock, decent prices, and despite the crowds, a pretty clean and well organized store. The location is easily accessible and parking is adequate with ample handicapped spaces closest to the entrance. This store offers motorized carts as well.

Very nice location.

Plenty of parking and well lit.

Very clean and huge selection

Lots of cashiers and self checkout.

This one is supermarket.

Kid friendly

Very clean floors

Highly recommended

I LOVE COSTCO! It's a great place to shop and bring the whole family for lunch! Their food court prices are unmatched for their Members, and they just started reinforcing your membership to make it exclusive to members only. I haven't ran into a team member who wasn't willing to help, and their customer service has always been great. The store is always clean.

Great as always. Just long lines at checkout. Fresh produce. Great selections. Cannot beat the prices at wholesale level. Their pizza is inexpensive and really good too. The food court needs to be cleaner.

My wife and I spend about $10,000 a year at this location. it's Costco. it's great! I've never had a problem with anyone here or any of the products. prices are great, quality is great. this however is the second time we've had a bad experience with the cashier Tammy giving us a really hard time. I've been in customer service for over a decade and I would never treat a customer the way she treated my wife and I today and last time we had the misfortune to be in her check out line. Once the Daytona location opens, we will just go there instead so we don't have any more run-ins with Tammy.

Dear Brian executive manager ! Yesterday and today, I had an interesting experience I need to go home and cut my rotisserie chicken to see that it‚Äôs raw on the inside. It doesn‚Äôt take a chef to know if this is fully cooked or not by the way Brian You cannot check the temperature of the meat watching a video camera. Your Customer service skills is not the best. Here are some pictures of my rotisserie chicken once I cut into it please comment. Is this rotisserie chicken fully cooked! Thank you again for the impeccable service Brian! Would you feed this to anyone? !

Costco Wholesale is a retail giant known for its vast warehouses, offering a wide range of products at competitive prices. The bulk-buying model, which is central to Costco's appeal, allows customers to save significantly on everyday essentials, from groceries to household items.

One of the standout features of Costco is its quality and variety. The Kirkland Signature brand, exclusive to Costco, is often praised for offering high-quality products at lower prices compared to national brands. Additionally, Costco's selection includes everything from fresh produce and electronics to clothing and furniture, making it a one-stop shop for many consumers.

The membership model, while an upfront cost, typically pays for itself through the savings members enjoy over time. Members also benefit from services like pharmacy, optical, and photo centers, as well as travel and insurance deals.

Customer service at Costco is generally commendable. The staff are usually helpful, and the company‚Äôs return policy is notably generous, allowing for a hassle-free shopping experience.

One of the drawbacks is that Costco can be quite busy, especially on weekends, leading to crowded aisles and longer checkout lines. Additionally, the bulk sizes may not be practical for smaller households or those with limited storage space.
Super busy Costco. Gas lines are full. They have a kosher section. Bathroom super confusing to find to me compared to other costcos

Good  prices on organic  products.  You can find almost  anything  here! This is not your  father's  old Price Club or Fedco. Now they have products you  really  want.  Parking  is always a bear, same for the gas station.  The app makes  it a bit better  to find products  but they say they will  soon add that functionality  to the app for real. Look  for the specials  on line and even brakes  to join  with an added  discount  mailed to you  later. They  also have a tire center  although  it's kinda hidden  out back. Still you save money  on quality  and quantity. üíØ

We went here for the LARGE Hotdogs üå≠ which are surprisingly - low priced, filling & delicious. Also - Pizza üçï & Pepsi-Cola for cheap price - Ice cream too. Don't sleep on this food - it's a pretty darn good deal.

Be aware of buying Mattress from Costco . I purchased a good deal Kirkland Stears and Fosters on President's  day, half of price of the ones selling retail stores online.  The mattress  is comfortable and  feels exactly Stears and Fosters but has a strong mildew odor, irritates my throat and slightly my eyes while I am sleeping. Wait for a 5 days to see the smells goes away, but it still lingering on the mattress. Called Costco for exchange, they confirmed my next delivery will be March 16 last week. Today they said I may have to wait until January 2025.  They scheduled last night to pick up the mattress for today.  Customer service confirmed that they will bring a new mattress  to exchange for the smell one on my bed. 45 min later the guys came to pick up the mattress(but didn't bring new Mattress). Where do I supposedly sleep without mattress?. Hate to say,  a terrible experience with Costco.

My trip to Costco in Bradenton was fantastic. The customer service was top-notch, and the employees were genuinely helpful. The store was clean, and I found everything I needed. The membership perks and deals make it a valuable shopping destination. Highly recommended!"

Clean, with just an amazing crew of total pros who know and do their jobs very well. Recently had a wonderful experience in the tire center. Even though they never really showed it and afterwards were apologizing for a wait time; I know they squeezed me in on a very very busy day. Very efficient well done job. Costco RULES!!!! This particular Costco rules even a little more. They also did a flat repair for me in and out in no time about a year ago. Great deals and great service. Thank You, Loyal Costco Member for 20 years

I've never been so embarrassed and sad for my son.  We found a coupon for a medication my son needs at Costco.  They made us join @120 to come in the door.  Did that and he took the coupon and his prescription to the pharmacy. They had us wait for a bit and then called him up.  They told him the info on the prescription (why he was taking it, for pain) was bogus, told us they would not fill it and told us we should leave the store right now. They were aggressive. We never did anything to get that sort of treatment.  Super, super rude. Stopped at customer service for a refund of joining fee, which they gave, and then advised Federal Law says you can't charge a fee to access a pharmacy. We complained to the store manager about all of it.

Great experience! As i was on my way to meet my daughter up in Tampa for dinner, I got a flat tire right before exit 220 and had enough air to drive into the Costco parking lot, before i was fully flat.

The first person I ran into to ask for help, was James Snow, and he was miraculous in his quick action to hear my story and jump into action to help me get the tire off and spare on in order to make my dinner date with my daughter. This guy James was amazing. Costco, you are lucky to have this guy in your employment! Kudos James for saving the day, all without hesitation and compassion. Thanks again!

Everybody knows Costco runs a pretty tight shop, the Bradenton store is no exception. Always prompt and courteous customer service.

However, I have been on the receiving end of EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE two times in two months by Devon in the tire center.  Tire purchases include road hazard.  I have gone years without a flat, but in the last two months I had a bolt and a screw in two different driver side tires. Devon in the tire center happened to one to help me both times, lucky for me.  He gave exceptional service both times. The first time I was heading out of town in a day and needed it checked beforehand. He was able to get me in, determine it had a leak and get it fixed before my trip. BIG THANKS!

The second time was Saturday, 1/27/24, my tire was flat when I came out in the morning.  They were booked on appointments until Tuesday.  I was able to swap my spare and bring the flat tire in and leave it in as a walk in customer between appointments.  They were able to squeeze my repair in within 1-2 hours. I really appreciated this because I didn‚Äôt have to deal with it during the week with heavier traffic, work schedule, etc.

Thanks again to Devon and his exceptional customer service!

And for the bonus points, here‚Äôs pics of a flat tire. And one photo credit to JB. ü§£

Costco has earned every bit of my loyalty. Costco's commitment to providing bulk quantities at unbeatable prices is truly commendable. From household essentials to electronics, I consistently find incredible deals that help me save significantly on my monthly expenses.

One of the standout features of Costco is its dedication to offering high-quality products. The Kirkland Signature brand, in particular, has become synonymous with reliability, and I trust it for everything from groceries to electronics.

Costco's product range is nothing short of impressive. Whether I'm looking for fresh produce, electronics, clothing, or even furniture, Costco has it all. The diverse selection ensures I can cross off multiple items from my shopping list in a single visit.

The food court at Costco is a hidden gem. From the famous hot dog and soda combo to the delicious pizza slices, grabbing a quick and affordable bite is always a treat after a successful shopping spree.

Department stores and hypermarkets with an immense variety of foods, drinks, and everything needed for family nutrition.... The meat area has high variety and quality... The prices are very low for pork. .. Without a doubt one of the best options to buy... Recommended üëç

This has to be one of the best Costco around! Staff is awesome, especially Alex! This guy always has a great attitude and is smiling when I see him. Food court staff work really hard and it shows in the quality and cleanliness. Thank you to everyone!

Easily laid out with lots of employees to ask for help. The only 1 downfall is that even though all of the checkout lines were open, there was still a bit of a wait. One should expect that though. All in all a great place with friendly employees.

Who doesn‚Äôt love Costco. Location is very clean and looks like they were starting to transition into fall decor, Halloween and Christmas. The self checkout is also A LOT better now that they‚Äôre checking membership cards so I do appreciate that. Also ended trip with hot dog and pizza cause Costco!

The problem with Costco and the other large stores like this is that they should consider separating the seniors from the workers. I go there on a Saturday or a Sunday and you can't even walk around. The way you change it? Offer special discounts for seniors Monday through Thursday so they go and shop then. Listen.. people like me work Monday through Friday so our only time to shop is Friday night through Sunday night. That's when we need to be here. The seniors can shop any day of the week. So this store should get them in there Monday through Thursday offer them some discounts or special food or anything. Clear out the weekend so we can get in there and get what we need. You can't walk in here. So either this place needs to be bigger and the hallways need to be wider. Or it's just going to be a pain in the butt to navigate in here. Can't find parking can barely walk around... You can barely see the items for sale because they're so so many people and carts everywhere. They need to fix it!

We love Costco! Search for them everywhere we travel. We always find new things to try(see photo) and always pick up some of our favorites. This time, we bought a Solo stove Bonfire, just perfect for our RV.

I've had a membership for three-plus years. I recently had my eye exam and purchased my frames, filled my prescription in store same day. Also shopped in the store and pharmacy the same day for many of my household needs. At the food court on my way out I treated myself to a ice mocha. Then I went to the gas pumps on premises and filled up the Tahoe at a large savings.
Great shopping day roll all-in-one üòÅ

The parking lot itself is very stressful. You could get ran over and not be able to prove it because the parking lot has zero cameras. The employees are very rude. They heard you out like cattle during closing time. Sam‚Äôs club will bring out and load your groceries into your vehicle. You can scan, checkout, and pay as you shop with your phone at Sam‚Äôs club. Avoiding line build up.
Why do they even close so early?  The store opens late in the morning and closes early.
Not the best shopping experience for all the nonsense that comes with it.

Costco is great! I've spent more money here and transitioned more of my shopping here than I thought I would before I joined. I got a deal including a shop card for joining so that was nice. One thing, the assortment changes pretty often but you don't really notice it until you go looking for something you were buying regularly and can't find it. I've found many frozen foods here I've enjoyed, and the samples help you try things before buying. I'll definitely renew when it comes time. Only negative is the assortment changes without warning...that is frustrating. But I keep hoping things will come back,  so fingers crossed.

Amazing, New, Costco warehouse! Typical Costco layout with lots of amazing products. Definitely recommend getting there early or going later in the evening if you want it to be less crowded. Parking is typical Costco if you get there early, you‚Äôll find a spot. Much easier than going mid day. They have an optical center hearing aid, center pharmacy, cafe and tire center. Staff was very kind and helpful. Seem to have plenty of staff for the opening week. Only hiccup we saw was letting people into the store. They were trying to stagger it and it was quite a mess.

Really nice new location near Clermont. Parking was very easy since this location was built with a huge parking lot area. They have a huge selection of items that I have not seen at other locations. It's the perfect spot to go on a Sunday afternoon.
Great location and easy to get too. Clean and organized. Saves me from going to the grocery store every other day when I buy in bulk, especially with 4 hungry growing kids.

Brand New Costco in our area. The store is well managed and plenty of inventory. You do need to be a Costco member to take advantage of the great deals but it is worth the $. I was surprised to see so many PS5 consoles. Stop by and grab a hotdog for just $1.50 (membership required) or Fill the fuel tank for less. If you own and EV you can recharge at one of the new EV charging stations. Each EV station can charge up to 350 Kwh. This was much needed in the area. (Electrify America chargers)

Recently visited the newly opened Costco in Clermont, Florida. Parking was a bit hectic, and there was a line for membership sign-ups, but having our executive membership saved us time. The store was crowded, akin to a zoo, but we managed to find what we needed. Enjoyed some tasty food samples indulged in a delicious half pepperoni, half cheese pizza with two refreshing smoothies.

The food court area felt cramped, with a lot of people moving in different directions. There seemed to be some confusion, with orders being duplicated, and the employees appeared overwhelmed by the volume of orders.

Despite the busyness and being a bit out of the way, it was a worthwhile experience.

We ordered a dozen whole pizzas on the phone and arranged to pick up @12:30 same day.  I went to the store earlier because I wanted to order an additional pizza. The store was a bit crowded and I was worried that I would not get my order on time. I paid for my order and promptly at 12:30 my pizzas were ready. I had to wait another 10 minutes for the extra pizza I ordered to be ready but I was kept informed right through the whole process. Excellent customer service from the team especially Lewis and Joey. Thanks for a great experience.
Very good products, just please pay more attention to food preparation, I bought chicken wings and it was disgusting, email was sent and there was no response.

This is one of the nicest Costco‚Äôs around.  Super clean and great service.  A big shout out to Lenny in Tires who went above and beyond for and held 4 tires for me.  Best customer service!

As for the store, where else can you get 16 rolls of paper towels, water, baked goods, an electric bike and a computer?  They have everything. Need gas‚Ä¶ best prices around.

Great Prices! Great Variety! This amazing Costco is staffed with many friendly associates. The store is very well organized and the aisles are roomy. After you're done shopping you can also get a delicious hot dog with a beverage included for only a dollar and 50 cents!!! Plenty of parking spaces. I am absolutely in love with this Costco!
Best one. Clean, fast. Like it. P.S. Guys, why don't you have Tabbouleh salad at your location? Have to go to Davie location (busiest and dirtiest store) to get it.

Highly trafficked but very well maintained location which serves most of the Greater Fort Lauderdale area. Not all Costco‚Äôs are alike and this one is no exception so enjoy finding some one-of-a kind items! #costco #wholesale #kirklandsignature #shopping #household #davie #fortlauderdale #browardcounty #florida

This place is a nightmare, many crazy people driving the little cars, everyone is in a rush, I got a free membership to this place but it‚Äôs chaotic.
The prices if you really compare with many other supermarkets its not a big deal to save money. Like 40% of the products have a real discount, the other products are more expensive that regular prices like tvs.
Parking slot full as hell in a regular hour.
This is my humble appreciation, I don‚Äôt try to be mean just sincerely my experience. Good bye people üôè.

Always love a good Costco run, even if there's not much that I need.
This location in particular has some of the tightest, smallest parking lots of any other Costco. Think Trader Joe's level of parking madness.
Anyhow, once inside its a wonderland of cool stuff.
Super happy to find the Jarlberg Swiss Cheese.
Disappointed that they don't carry the 2-pack pre-mixed Margarita jugs.
The butter Croissants are fantastic and taste so much better than ones I've had in Colorado. Got my eye on a TV too.

This nubby textured rug is fantastic! $119!

A trip to this Costco is always justified by its flawless arrangement and reliably filled shelves. However, due to its popularity, manoeuvring through its busy parking area can be somewhat challenging when attempting to find an optimal parking space. Nonetheless, the shopping experience within the store overwhelmingly compensates for any minor nuisance encountered in the parking lot.

Some said the parking here is great? They must have been smoking meth! The parking lot is a demolition derby people ready to slam your car into oblivion over a space. Lager trucks skip right by and jump the curve to park in the grass. And this is just regular afternoon parking. I don't even bother going if it's past noon at this point.

The Daytona Costco is excellent!  This location has plenty of parking, which is generally a challenge at other locations, and has great prices on products from organic produce to household items and everything in between.  The Costco team members that work here are really helpful.   We had tires installed in May and Paul T, the supervisor of the Tire Center did a great job!  The tire shop is super clean and the techs are organized and do a professional job including wearing safety glasses in the shop and checking lug nut bolt torques twice.  Thanks Daytona Costco Team!

This was my very first time in any Costco anywhere. I‚Äôm not sure how they are spots in the world but it was pretty huge and the quality of their products was pretty darn amazing. I was highly impressed with the courtesy expressed by our checkout person. Very very clean. Saved a lot of money.!!

I‚Äôm a huge Costco fan, so naturally I‚Äôm a fan of this huge new Costco - possibly the largest in Florida?

Most of the staff were great and helpful and the store offered a lot of variety, but mostly all of the typical quality items you expect at every Costco - food, electronics, furniture, seasonal/outdoor stuff, etc.

Some of the staff at the food court seemed a little stressed and overwhelmed, but it‚Äôs bike week in Dayton a few days after the grand opening of this new store so I cut them some slack.

Fresh cut üíê wholesale flowers. Custom orders accepted. Get a business card from the flower case inside Daytona Beach Costco. Stunning Bouquets! Order flowers for events, weddings, graduation, homecoming, dinner parties, and special events. For Costco members.
Costco gas station is now OPEN as of January 31, 2024 !!! Plenty of fueling stations, 24 to be exact‚Ä¶ Regular (87) and Premium (93)‚Ä¶ BEST PRICE IN TOWN !

OH COSTCO! Always been the best of the best and always will be. Anything we ever buy is from Costco from food to furniture. I respect what anybody thinks of other wholesalers, but I prefer Costco over any other place for sure. They are always known for quality AND quantity! Customer service is hands down always exceptional. Although, some cafeteria employees can come off a little harsh sometimes.
Highly recommend!! üôèüèº

If I could give negative stars if i could. No deliver trucks next and 2 doors available, and they will not give me a door and forcing me to wait to deliver. Productivity and time management are not their strongest here at this costco.

In a generalized sense Costco is nice compared to its competitors (I formerly had a BJ‚Äôs membership and currently have a Sam‚Äôs Club along side Costco). Compared to Sam‚Äôs, Costco is a lot cleaner, better organized, and has a lot more premium items available like organic items, a dedicated outside garden section, etc. Sam‚Äôs on the other hand has a better dedicated smartphone app where you can order any items that are in-store online, including produce, and schedule a pickup (has dedicated parking spots), it‚Äôs useful when it gets pretty busy and crowded or when you need to order a lot of bulk items. The only downside with this Costco specifically, is the parking lot situation, people speed in this busy  parking lot trying to beat traffic only to end up getting stuck in traffic (a mindless move lol) and traffic gets clogged near the 3 way exit since the exit is a shared common intersection with other high traffic stores (seen a few accidents occurred in the past). That and the traffic light that connects this 3 way intersection is connected to the worst part of traffic in Town Center, so the traffic light takes a while to turn green creating this huge mess of a clog. Plan your time to Costco accordingly, a lot of Boomers tend to go early which is when I go to not deal with traffic.

Typical Costco store. Clean, great selection of products. It was a good experience, minus the crazy woman who decided to start screaming at me because I didn't agree with her politics. Asking her why she was screaming wasn't the right question, either. The most interesting part was watching employees walk by pretending to not see or hear her. She was literally drawing a crowd. What is Costco's policy on customers who are screaming at other customers? What about when we tried to part ways, but she kept coming back to yell some more? I think we'll avoid that Costco from now on.

I love shopping at Costco. I walk through the entrance and am greeted so kindly. With all the unique products available for purchase, everything is well organized and priced. The store is so clean. When it came time to check out, my son and I tried the self-check. A friendly customer service rep immediately greeted us to help us scan our full cart. It was great. We were in and out in record time.

I know costco is only with membership and it os totally worth for the diversity of meat especially halal lamb , great seabass and wild caught mahi , and much mire seasonal items i let the pictures tell you, the beets are amazingly healthy for you and kids , dark chocolate wafers keto and vegan are superb fir snack , along with the great degustation of samples they offer made me find much more goodies , ravioli pesto , coffee and biscotti , cheese bread and the list gets long

Update: We went back today and had some returns and were treated very well! The refrigerated fruit seems to have been scaled back, but I was able to get some nice blueberries.

Previous: It's gone way downhill. Employees have consistently bad attitudes, especially Shirley at the desk who seems to hate the "no hassle" return policy. We had to return several food items that we tried, but the quality was terrible. When I told the manager Lexi about the rudeness, she said she investigated MY account history which was "clean" -- say what? It seems the product curation/quality is not what it used to be. The fruit is rarely fresh at this store and mold can easily be found -- we've switched to Sam's where it's much better. During COVID they took away the onion topping from the food court, only to bring it back much later in wasteful plastic containers that you have to ask for. They also got rid of the churros and replaced it with.. cookies?!?

What can you say about Costco, you either love it or you don't! Costco has great deals especially on tires and batteries. Their rotisserie chicken is great and inexpensive. A lot of the items you can't buy anywhere else, so they made a Niche for themselves. You can't forget their Pharmacy the prices are reasonable to great and the staff is friendly and works with the customers. Now you have to understand that Costco management is rather liberal with some of the products that they buy are International. Which has its good and bad points, mostly good.  You must be careful when buying electrical fixtures because they may not fit a standard American fixture. However their warranty and return policy are very generous towards the customer., we never shy away from buying a product or item knowing that we can return the item if it doesn't fit or works for us. All in all a great place to shop.

I like this store. The employees are great, the products are much better than sams. What I noticed right from the start is how neat their sections are. Their clothing dept. Is impressive. As I have said in previous posts nothing is worse than going to a store where customers toss clothing around in piles not re folding their item of choice, putting it back in the same position as they have found it. (sams on Colonial) is full of rude customers who care less about the people who follow behind them. I don't like their quality of food choices either.  I'm switching to Costco!!!!

Good place, but soooooo crowded. üòñ  It's like being sober in a nightclub that you want to leave after 10 minutes because you're tired of people bumping into you or aimlessly walking across directly in front of you with no common sense etiquette. Pretty sure they don't respect the local fire ordinance for occupancy

AT&T will be servicing this store with AT&T‚Äôs most compelling offers exclusive only for Costco Members! Come see our New Kiosk! We can‚Äôt keep the incredible deals under wraps for long! Switch to AT&T and enjoy the best coverage area in Florida!

Always love stopping at Costco while we are traveling.  Clean and well laid out.  Friendly helpful personnel. The produce is the best and the great buys.  Today, it was mobbed. I would strongly suggest going during the week of possible.

Frodo's here, particularly the berry is, are delicious. We were also happy to find boxes of boiled eggs. This is a very well stocked store, very clean. The bag them shelled nuts were a larger selection than expected, all very fresh. All in all this is one of the best Costco's we've ever been in. Highly recommended!

As Costco members, our recent visit to the local warehouse during our travels highlighted why it is such a popular wholesale chain. The parking lot was packed, and the store was bustling with customers, creating a vibrant atmosphere with aisles filled with a diverse range of products. Despite the crowds, the employees were consistently restocking and available to assist. The checkout process was efficient, and the staff remained friendly throughout.
It's obvious that Costco puts its employees first, as seen in their exceptional customer service. The membership cost is easily worth it because you can save a lot of money with our unbeatable bulk pricing on quality items. Although it can be crowded and require patience to navigate and find parking, the amazing deals make it worth it. The value offered by Costco is truly unmatched!

Well, I can't say much about the lines at the registers or the gas pumps, but I do enjoy browsing through costco. I try to go when the rush hour is over! I definitely do not like Costco rush hour. You walk in and immediately realize that it's not a good time to be here. When you can only see a glimpse of merchandise through the crowd of people shopping, mainly because I happen to be shorter than most, shopping cart accidents, angry people, when you only have one or two items in line of endless shopping carts that are over the weight limit of what the cart can carry, finding out that the person at the register of the line you're standing in has picked up an item that does not scan and now you have hard choice to make, you here ambulance arriving as curious people who probably are the same rubber-neckers on the hwy you were on that added 45 min into your trip to Costco, exaggerate the endless madness of NEED in people's lives. It's time to let go and come back at another time. Realizing the lost will not hold a light to the insanity. Why don't I go to Costco liquor and grab some wine! WOW, there are only a few people here and no one at the register!! Fantastic. As you wait with two bottles of wine first in line and ready to pay. Where is she, you wonder. Looking around, you hear a voice, be right with you, coming from flat carts full of boxes that are to be stocked on shelves. Be patient, as the line starts to build to three people. Finally, pay the bill, go home, and just stop at Walmart close to home. Phone rings, we're are you hon, on my way. Did you get everything, I got the wine. I'm stopping at Walmart on the way home. What happened?
I went to Costco! Ohhh.
Very nice and cooperative staff, they have really good collection. I enjoyed shopping at here.

Who doesn't love Costco? This Costco is usually overcrowded which is a bummer. Otherwise they have a great selection of all sorts of items you need, want, or items you didn't even know you wanted. Food. Household good. Seasonal items. $6 for the biggest pumpkin pie around. The parking lot is always mayhem.

If you shopped and any other Costco, You know almost everything they carry. What sets this Costco apart from the others is the Staff is absolutely amazing,  and try to help you the best they are able.
This Costco is smaller than others,  and is always crazy busy, and one can imagine the staff has a lot to deal with, Over all I give them an A rating.

Welcome to costco! We love you! It really is the best place. I feel like this store stocks well but not the best. Moat expected items are present and many others rotate through. I never think im going to miss something going to this store.

I'll remove this after a week, but one of the older lady cashiers is super rude to the point of being just nasty. Put her in the back away from your customers. It would be mutually beneficial to your overall customer relations and she'll get the solitary she so desperately craves

The location is great. It's always packed.
The food court is wonderful. The food is fresh and good price.

Disappointing Experience at the Kendall Costco

As a single father of twins, I rely heavily on the conveniences and cost savings that come with shopping at bulk stores like Costco. My primary go-to item is baby wipes, as Costco offers a great deal on the brand that has served my family since my daughters were born. Unfortunately, my recent experience at the Kendall Costco on Thursday, April 11, 2024, left me both extremely disappointed and embarrassed.

After a long day at work, I rushed to Costco to purchase a box of baby wipes‚Äîcrucial for my twins‚Äîwith the last of my budget before the next payday. To my dismay, at the checkout, I was informed that my Costco membership had expired back in December. I understand the policy, but given my tight financial situation, I wasn't prepared to renew my membership on the spot. I explained my predicament to the staff member and asked if I could just buy the wipes and renew my membership later when I had the funds. Unfortunately, the staff was unyielding, even after I requested to speak with a supervisor, insisting that I could not make any purchase without an active membership.

This policy adherence was disheartening. I was taken aback that a store as large as Costco, which prides itself on customer service and member satisfaction, could not accommodate a small exception during a time of evident need. This incident has motivated me to manage my affairs even more diligently; however, it has also prompted me to reconsider my loyalty to a store that may not support its customers during critical times.

I hope my feedback can prompt Costco to reconsider its policies or how they are enforced, particularly for loyal customers facing temporary hardships. A little flexibility and empathy can go a long way in maintaining customer loyalty and goodwill.
