The best of all is that Drone Training School is right next door!  So we have the chance to do all the shopping here! Plus they have drones for sale! At Drone Training School, we're committed to providing high-quality drone training at competitive prices.  That's why we find Costco Wholesale Kendall to be a valuable asset. Here's how:

Discounted Bulk Supplies:  Drone training requires various supplies, including batteries, propellers, and maintenance items.  Costco allows us to purchase these items in bulk at discounted prices.  This cost-saving measure helps us keep our training programs affordable for our students.

Streamlined Shopping Trips:  Costco's efficient shopping experience saves valuable time.  Our instructors can make one quick trip to stock up on essential training supplies, allowing them to focus on delivering exceptional instruction to our students.

Centrally Located:  Situated in Kendall, Costco offers convenient access for both instructors and students.  This central location eliminates unnecessary travel time and ensures everyone can focus on the core aspects of drone training.

Overall, Costco Wholesale Kendall provides a combination of convenience, cost-effectiveness, and accessibility.  This allows us to maintain a well-stocked training facility and keep our programs affordable for our students.

I‚Äôm not going to lie this Costco gets very busy! We find ourselves driving around the parking lot a couple of times to park particularly on weekends. But, we plan ahead and come here once a month for the essentials, meats, chicken, seafood, cheeses and paper goods. The Kirkland premium paper towels are comparable to the overpriced and overly advertised on TV Bounty the quick picker upper‚Ä¶12 rolls for $19.00. Kirkland tissue paper comparable to Charmin‚Ä¶30 rolls for $19.00. Their Rotisserie chicken is great more flavorful and better price than Publix for only $4.99. Their bakery is to die for! Awesome cakes, pies, croissants, and large muffins. Yum! üòç

Costco is great for large families and businesses. Your phone is your best friend at the store, you have to do your due diligence and search if same product can be found for a better price elsewhere. Ask yourself does the membership cost outweigh the inconvenience in parking and long lines at checkout? ü§î

We will not ever shop for only 1 item but we‚Äôve seen people do it. That‚Äôs crazy!! üòØ Happy shopping!

The staff is great, and the gas pricing alone is worth the cost of membership.  My only problem has been trying to get the Tire Center to answer the phone.  They just put you on hold.  I've had to buy tires elsewhere twice.

Large clean and well stocked. My favorite is the muffins. No more wedding cakes. They do have a cheese cake that could possibly be used for birthday and special events. The best part of my shopping experience is being able to purchase seasonal foods. Definitely worth the membership dues.

Costco is so much more than a food warehouse and that‚Äôs why I shop here often! For example, this Gerry Jacket which easily zips up, has a hood for those random Florida showers  ‚òîÔ∏è and the most cozy lining which adds a little warmth on a rainy day.  Need hearing aids ? Look no further because Costco has a service for that as well!
With Purchase includes   free ‚Äútune ups‚Äù (cleaning maintenance etc) every six weeks!  A person can drop them off, shop or wait and pick them up within 30 minutes!! Needless to say, Costco has it all!

The parking lot is pure misery.
Inside and out, it's always so crowded and people move so slow. They stop right in the middle of the isles when looking at something. I love the store but the process is such a pain it's not worth it, so I don't shop here very often.

First time there ‚Ä¶What a gem üíé everything so delicious flavorful very fresh. Had our breakfast outside on one of the tables and left with bags of goodies to take home.  Will definitely be back highly recommend
A member over 30 years. Best staff, very professional. Clean and always find a new special. The pharmacy is great, with texts letting you know when Rx are ready. Very friendly staff.

I went to Costco and purchased stuff for $200 this was on 05/05/24 and bought a box of mild Italian sausage I have one for breakfast and gave me the worst stomachache I ever had, vomiting and screaming of pain, went to check sold by date and it was 05/08/24, no expiration date. One of the sausages had mold, I took pictures and called customer service and they did NOTHING!!
Just told me to bring the pack and I‚Äôll get my refund‚Ä¶.  How about my suffering, the terrible pain because of them!!!!
Really? Even Wallmart would do better than that.  TOO BAD COSTCO!!! And this is not the first time they provide bad customer service but this time was the worst.

Signed up about two weeks ago, was throughly excited to use my new Executive membership and costco credit card. Upon visiting this location I had an absolutely terrible customer service experience with the person attending the self check outs. My partner was scanning her items on one lane while I was scanning on another because I wanted to get her a sheet set for her birthday. While checking out my partner tried using a card thats not accepted so the attendant came over and proceeded to give us an attitude and then ask who the member was, I said I was, and then she said that I had to pay, again with a nasty, snarky attitude. This is my FIRST EXPERIENCE CHECKING OUT. Ironically I was going to use my costco card but my partner wanted to pay for groceries this week.

There‚Äôs a way to say things to your customers but apparently this dinosaur that hates her job doesn‚Äôt know how to exercise any customer service skills. She was older, wearing a face mask with a pink pattern and had classes with her hair tied back.

As a business owner in the hospitality industry and if any one of my staff members EVER spoke to any customer this way they would be in the unemployment line within 24 hours.

This is one of the most unpleasant, unprofessional and incompetent staff members I have ever had the displeasure of interacting with in my life.

First real trip to costco, horrible. I want to cancel my membership.

This store, even when crowded, is still a great experience. Everything was well stocked and there were employees around to assist. Other stores I've been to, that would not have been the case on the day before Mother's Day.

Fantastic experience with the first day of Costco! The meats are cheap and fresh. Most of the products are the cheapest you can get in this town. Checkout is faster than expected. The staffs are enthusiastic and friendly. It's close to the exit of the interstate and easy to find. I highly recommend it.

Large crowds of people today, but the isles are very roomy.
The shelves were well stocked.
I also like they have set up their gas pumps with a sensor.
Some of the customers can‚Äôt see over/around vehicles for which ones are in us or not.

At Costco Wholesale in Miami, you'll find the best service in town. Their employees are friendly and generous, always providing an exceptional experience. And let's not forget their delicious ice cream on the way out! Big thanks to the amazing Costco team for making every visit memorable!

The warehouse is closed to airport. A huge parking lot but was packed during Saturday. The gas line price was $2.739 dollars/per gallon, even $0.14 dollars cheaper than another Costco store 10 miles south.

Be advised that the Costco staff here are rude. The front lady at the door with blond hair does not let in emotional support animals. She also does not let you do shipt or insta cart orders since you don't have a membership. She only lets one person at a time with a Costco membership. She has done this on several occasions. This blond lady a little bit older is very rude, you need to hire other people or put someone else in the front. She does not respect others. Is very rude to other customers myself included.

The experience I had yesterday at the Tire Service Center of Costco in Flagler was extremely disappointing, and I feel compelled to share my story. I took my vehicle there to have a tire inspected, as it showed an evident crack, indicating poor quality (I have attached photos and a video as evidence). Despite assurances from the customer service counter staff that the tire would be replaced under warranty, I was surprised to receive a bill with a charge of $180. I was told that the 40% discount applied to the new tire was considered part of the "warranty," suggesting that these tires are not covered for manufacturing defects. This interpretation of the warranty is misleading and evasive, as it fails to take responsibility for the obvious flaw in the tire I presented. It's worth noting that the tire in question is a Bridgestone Ecopia HL 422, with a 50,000-mile warranty. After discussing my dissatisfaction, I ended up paying $130, but additionally, they installed a tire with a very different tread pattern from the other 3 tires.
Given this unsatisfactory experience, I intend to file a formal complaint with Bridgestone regarding the lack of quality in their product. It's crucial to highlight that had I not detected the tire issue in time, I could have faced a potentially fatal risk on the road.

Visit to this particular Costco on Flagler street was a great experience for me. The staff is amazingly HELPFUL & respectful.
On a personal note, I want to offer my sincere gratitude & wholeheartedly recognize one of the Costco‚Äôs sales representative, by the name of Adriana. Suffice to say, Adriana is an epitome of what an ideal sales person should be.
During my interaction with her in the men‚Äôs clothing section, I found her to have a sincere will to provide genuine assistance with her knowledge, immense cordiality and incredibly positive attitude. She‚Äôs indeed deserving of these accolades and I wish her a great success in her present & future career‚Ä¶ üëçüèΩüôèüèΩ

Insanely overly crowded Costco. From the gas to the check out.

The line did move well but if you're in a hurry pick another location.

The products are here just get in early as they open and get out ASAP.

Otherwise Costco is great and workers were nice.

After using Instacart for delivery from Costco at very inflated prices I decided to go for a Costco membership in March 2024! There is an offer of a $20 Gift Card on the $60 membership on the web! The web site was easy to follow & I received notice of my new membership within a few days. The Gift Card came in 8 days. So, I went to the store on Thursday about 3pm. I went to membership services counter & presented my ID. Alberta was processing my membership application & had a problem with the transaction! She called in Manny to help & I presented my banks payment info to Costco! Everything was then processed & I received my membership card. Everyone was extremely patient, helpful & professional. I then went shopping.  I use Bobby Parrish from You Tube as a helpful guide to shopping at Costco. Most of the items he listed were available! I checked out with Eman at the register. He was very helpful to me in packing my backpack as I am handicapped & use an electric mobility scooter! So, Costco you have another satisfied customer‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

I took a chance and went to this location as it was so close to my workplace. And though it was smaller than the West Flagler and West Kendall locales, they had all the items I needed and I was in & out in no time. For example, I just purchased several Orchids in an aray of colors for the bargain price of $15.99 eachü§Øüå∏ There are not many left so run and get them as fast as you canüèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è They make great (and inexpensive) Mother's Day Gifts. They come in a ceramic vase & most of them are in full bloom. But don't be discouraged in getting them. Give them some water & some shade and they will do fineü•∞

I normally come here and all of the staff are nice, but today with the cashier Laura, it was the opposite. me and my mother were telling her that we had two separate transactions and she gave us attitude after that she started to throw our items aggressively and she kept throwing it and one of the items hit my hand

Yesterday, I went to order my daughter's contact lenses and a very rude young white woman completely dismissed me. She told me that if my daughter doesn't have the membership she couldn't order them. This is not the first time she‚Äôs behaved in a dismissive manner. A month ago, I also went to ask if the optical accepted my insurance and the same woman was incredibly rude and told me that without a prescription she couldn't help me.
I have made my 2 children's glasses there as a Costco member and they have never mentioned my children needing a membership in order to purchase their glasses. lt‚Äôs not because she denied me service but rather, the way in which she says it. I think that woman should not work with people. Dealing with people is not for everyone.

Update:

Yesterday, we raced over to this Costco location so that we could grab their all-in-one ready to put into oven Thanksgiving dinner before they sold out. Since we are just a family of two, the size of  their ready to cook dinner is perfect for us. We even have leftovers for the next 2 days. The price was $29.99 last year but was up to $40 this year. It's still a good value, and there is minimal work to do. Plus, it's delicious when done. You get the turkey breast, stuffing, gravy, mashed potatoes, green beans, and cranberries.  Just add the wine and dessert.

As we headed toward the crowded cash registers (the lines started back in the food aisles), an employee came over and took us over to a self serve register but he did the checking out for us and packing! What a blessing! I wish I had gotten his name! Very customer oriented. I added a star just for him.

Parking was a zoo as usual at holiday times! It took a while to find a spot out in the left field. Customers were quite impatient. We even got there just a half hour after Costco opened. We were happy that we got everything we needed and made it out of there without any problems.  We will be back next month for Xmas groceries!

Older review:

Great sales, we shop for our groceries there,  large selection of meat, produce , and pretty much everything else you can think of at very good prices. The store is kept clean, employees are helpful, lines are quick, and there is ample parking.

I am leaving this review because this was the worst Costco experience I have had in years, as soon as I approached the self checkout like Adam and Tanya the members here got very rude with me and after already being in the line for a few minutes demand me to move to a different cashier because they think I am incapable of scanning my own items, it seemed very profiled because of my looks as if I look like I will steal items from self checkout. The way that I was spoken to as well was very rude, not a single hello sir or excuse me, just straight to get you have to go to another line after you already stood here. Poor customer service and I will not be coming back here and I do not suggest you do as well, you will be treated like you don‚Äôt matter

I'm writing this as I'm waiting in line, right now. I ordered on the phone over 30 minutes ago. I watched them put a fresh pepperoni on the warming display meanwhile they haven't sold any pepperoni since I've beem waiting.  Why not give me the whole pie?? Before arriving I made not 1 but 2 stops, to give them time to make my order and to get other things. And yet my order still wasn't ready. Ordering a pizza over the phone shouldn't be so hard. It should be convenient especially if I have places to be or the whole intention was that it would be ready when I go to pick it up. Not have me waiting an additional 30 minutes, making it a total of 55 minutes of waiting and no food. And I'm not trying to make their job hard but it just seems they're being inconsiderate.

The staff at this Costco is a treasure. Mrs. Elva in the clothes section is a Gem and so sweet and helpful. Fernando on the floors always says Hi and goes out of his way to help find items.  Kattaya(sp) in self check out needs to drop the military attitude & be more pleasant which is why we left that line. However that led us to Gregory (Supervisor)who happen to ring us up and was just a joyful human with positive energy.

The gas station staff though needs some retraining on customer service & generally just being pleasant human beings to others.

I have gone to the North Miami Costco since I was 13, that was 27 years ago. Love the new location and revamp but mostly it‚Äôs the staff that has been retained that is the icing on the top of the cake when it comes to shopping at Costco. Also that speaks volumes as an organization to retain staff.

Cesar the manager is very rude and not helpful at all. Really seems like he hates his job and will get disrespectful very quickly for no real reason and will try to belittle you like you are a nobody. Just because of him me and my entire family won‚Äôt be coming back to this location‚Ä¶

Pretty easy to get to.

Their produce is super fresh and I liked their choices of fish. They didn't have a particular brand of coffee I like that I was able to get at the Costco before I moved here.

Also it's set up for people to move through in a counterclockwise direction.

I wish their shopping carts were picked up better since I had to move one so it wouldn't scratch my car. I just brought it in and did my shopping, but there were several nearby.
I love working here representing AT&T.  The COSTCO people are spectacular.  This is truly a great place to serve others!  Together with COSTCO, we make NAPLES a better place!

Love this Costco.  Great deals, great inventory. Very fresh produce and meats.  Even though it is always busy, we get through the line pretty quickly.  Good management. Very clean and organized,  My last visit our cashier was telling us how much she lives working there.  These days, you rarely hear that.

I had an appt to have tires put on, I was told it was 1115am, it was actually at 1215. I showed up at 11am told them I would just drop off early and was informed that it wouldnt be  touched until my appt time. I was fine with that, I would just shop in the store.  At 2pm I still had not heard anything about my car and was sitting outside of the tire center just waiting. A young lady that worked in the tire center happened to walk by and I asked what the usual wait time was as my appt was at 1215. She asked the type if car, walked in and got the keys, handed them to me and said it was already done. No one called me and I wouldn't have known unless I asked. She has no customer service skills. Didn't apologize for the lack of communication or anything. Didn't even tell me where my car was so I could get it until I asked. The majority of the staff don't smile, don't greet you in anyway or thank you for coming in. In no way was I pushy or rude during this appt, I wasn't in any rush, just simply was curious of how long the service took. I'm usually a pretty loyal customer to Costco and shop there at least once a week. The grocery shopping may continue but I will never go to the tire center at the Costco in naples. You need to teach some customer service skills to your employees first.

I'm a fussy shopper and usually cannot find half of the things I'm looking for but in Costco I find it all it's a great shopping experience and a sharing part of my community. People would be surprised to hear how many non-profits they support locally. You can't find the meat selection or fish selection anywhere else. So if you are fussy cook this is the place to shop.
At last
Not OPEN until JUNE
Official opening June 5 üôåüçæü™Ö

Awesome alternative to Restaurant Depot. It could be an essential shop if you‚Äôre a short term rental property owner.

10-20% cheaper than the regular Costco but doesn‚Äôt have some popular items & prepared food. But a lot less crowded so you may pick up stuffs for less and quickly for your business needs.

This store is not regular Costco with interesting collections. More geared towards small restaurants with massive bags of paper cups, cup holders and lots of restaurant supplies. No clothes, sunglasses or bakery items.

They do have gas station, no food out or fire center and no liquor store.

Costco Business Center provides a unique shopping experience, especially for those seeking to avoid crowds. It's a great option without the usual cafeteria or clothing distractions. Quick in-and-out visits are a breeze with minimal lines. However, beware of the chilling temperatures in the fridge area; it's like stepping into Canada's winter, and even in shorts and T-shirts, it can be quite uncomfortable.

We‚Äôve been to Costco before but this was one of the best places by far for buying meat. I got some really good lamb and salmon.
They also have a wide selection of products which suit business needs.

author_name: Blue Heron Resort Rentals Orlando FL
text: Great twist on Costco with supplies you won't see at most other locations.

This was my first visit to this location in a while. We went to the one in Kendall (Miami) on a fairly regular basis up until we moved away about 2 years ago. We still go to the one in Rochester MN where we have our summer home. I've never seen anything like this location in PBG. The lines were all the way down the aisles to the opposite end of the store. On a Monday morning! After waiting half an hour in line and getting up towards the front, they opened a couple of more cashier lines. People started coming into those without waiting in any of the existing lines. Some of the people around me started yelling and even though there was a Costco employee right there, he refused to do anything about it.

It was so packed, it was hard to navigate around to shop. Worst of all, the main two things I went there for, that I can usually only find at Costco, this location didn't have. There's no sense putting myself through the aggravation of shopping here, if they don't even have what I want (and can easily find at other Costco locations).

I will say the check-out guys were super nice and helpful.

I drove an hour to go to the  West Palm Beach Gardens Costco and was worth the drive so many good selections of food . The warehouse was clean and staff was helpful and knowledgeable, can't wait for my next visit.

I love Costco, butt I have to say they have gotten a bit high priced on some items.
It is supposed to be a wholesale place, and I am finding that they have raised prices to the point that items are substantially more expensive than local stores. 2 sandwiched for 16 and 20 dollars? That's kinda greedy from a wholesale place. Makes me price check all of the other items they have.

Dear Costco Management,

I am writing to express my disappointment with the customer service experience I encountered while attempting to add my husband to my Costco membership. Despite being a longstanding member of Costco, I was treated poorly by a customer service manager during this process.

Upon presenting my request, the manager cited Costco's policy regarding address verification, noting that our IDs did not display the same address. While I understand the importance of adhering to company policies, I was disheartened by the lack of empathy and willingness to explore alternative solutions.

As newlyweds in the process of updating our personal documentation, we encountered a hurdle that required understanding and flexibility from your staff. Unfortunately, the manager in question did not offer any assistance beyond citing policy, leaving us feeling dismissed and undervalued as customers.

I must commend the swift and efficient intervention of the supervisor we eventually sought assistance from. She demonstrated a keen understanding of our situation and promptly resolved the issue by accepting our joint bank account statement as proof of residence.

This incident highlights a significant gap in customer service on the part of the manager involved. While I appreciate the resolution provided by the supervisor, it is imperative that instances of poor service be addressed to ensure a positive shopping experience for all Costco members.

Thank you for your attention to this matter

Sincerely,
Kathryn

I'm immensely fond of this Costco. It's vast and perpetually stocks the softest blankets and rugs! Additionally, the staff is consistently courteous and goes the extra mile. The person who packed our groceries had a knack for it, akin to a Tetris champion.

Go to the Pembroke Pines location on an empty stomach. The food lane is way too close to the checkout. It‚Äôs like a rapid river- only one way flow. It‚Äôs to tight at this location trying to the Coral Springs - it‚Äôs a bit bigger.

I like the products and prices. I understand that using self checkout is sometimes difficult because sometimes people tend to try the system. I just prefer that I do my own scans, not have someone take my items out of my hands and scan it for me. Great place to shop in large quantities, but the  service associates tend to be too much. If the person asks for assistance or taking too much time, yes, jump right in and help. But today it happened to me again with small shopping bag items. Anyway, it could be only that one person and not the policy. Have a blessed day, and enjoy the samples of Maple & Bourbon Chicken they are delicious üòã

I have been going to Costco since 1989, and never have I had such a horrible experience at any of all the warehouses I have visited all over the country. I recently went to this location on Sunday April 28, 2024. A Supervisor lady was demanding we show our membership cards while on line to pay, I asked her why, and she told me it was company policy, and if I didn‚Äôt like it to not come to Costco anymore. She also told me in a very rude tone not to tell her how to do her job, because she didn‚Äôt go to my job to tell me how to do my job. So much for customer service, and being an executive member!

2-7-24 Update: Valentine‚Äôs items are now available as well as Easter chocolates!  They have a cute chocolate bar cake w a red heart at center; chocolate covered strawberries (dipped in-house - first time I‚Äôve ever seen those, I usually make myself); a variety of chocolates; pink champagne & lots of cookie choices in bakery inc‚Äôl a tray of their signature flavors for Valentine‚Äôs sharing.  They also offered some beautiful orchids & mini-anthuriums.

I was SUPER EXCITED to see they‚Äôre putting the Caesar Salad in packaging that‚Äôs 50% biodegradable (the bottom portion of container).  One of the only drawbacks to shopping here is at times the hard plastic shells enrobing some products are a huge amount of unjustified, non-biodegradable packaging.  (I mean the earth is literally poisoned by microplastics so let‚Äôs do better with less plastics Costco! üôèüèªüôèüèªüôèüèª).  I do appreciate they don‚Äôt offer plastic bags but rather have recyclable, repurposed cardboard cartons or ‚Äúfreezer bags‚Äù for purchase which is the environmentally sustainable option. ‚ù§Ô∏è. We customers DO NOTICE SUSTAINABILITY!!

Today there were quite a few nice sales & for my kids, I picked up two bags of frozen, chocolate covered yogurt drops for a great price!

Garden items once again looked AMAZING!  They had a copper patio fountain for $199. that was gorgeous; tall glazed & short basic planters; hoses; roses & so much more.  Worth a trip just to pick up garden basics for very affordable prices!

‚Ä¶I‚Äôm a stickler for baking only with real butter & generally pick up a package of Irish butter most trips (Kerry Gold is the absolute best!)  Great shopping today & staff was very kind üòç!

Prior Review: Holiday baking & decorating are easier (& less expensive) shopping Costco.  I buy their 25 lb. bag of flour; Lg. Organic Sugar; Irish Butter; Lg. Tub Sr. Cream; bulk spices; cream cheese; eggs by the box; chocolate chips; fruits & all my nuts here.  Wed. this week I was behind on Thanksgiving baking (family came in) so I stayed up all night & did 3 day‚Äôs worth utilizing my Costco pantry items.  I delivered it up Thanksgiving & everything was a hit!  Especially happily surprised to find the Pillsbury Pie Crust in freezer section this season as it saved time.  I‚Äôm definitely satisfied with this year‚Äôs selections & picked up the two adorable holiday lanterns here, too.  (Adding to my holiday display w the two 5 ft. Nutcrackers I purchased here two years ago.) üéÑü•∞üéÑ

The store is great. No complaints. The parking lot, however, is a nightmare because of the lack of cart return areas. These pics are from 10.30am on a Tuesday, so imagine if on a Saturday afternoon. Chaos

I bought an Apple Watch Ultra 2 at Costco on April 21, 2024. When I got home, I opened the box and tried to turn on the watch, but there was no power button, and the charger didn't connect to the watch. At 10 am on April 22, 2024, I went to Apple, and the support team told me it was fake. I returned to Costco at 12 pm. The manager, Fritz, checked the device and confirmed that I made the purchase on the 21st through the cameras and that it was delivered to me by one of their salespeople. However, unfortunately, Fritz said he couldn't refund my money or give me the correct product. I returned in less than 24 hours, and Costco did nothing about it. This is outrageous; it has nothing to do with their internal problems. Furthermore, the manager told me they purchase from Apple, but when I went to the store, they said Costco doesn't have a selling partnership and doesn't buy directly from Apple. Be careful when buying products from this place. Lack of respect for the consumer.
My favorite place to visit on a Saturday I can easily spend 3hours in here . Great prices great bulk items And furniture I will always be a proud Costco black card member !!

Always love to buy at Costo , but this time ..... I was very disappointed, and I believe many of the customers had the same feeling . Suppose to be faster  for the automatic check out,  instead of that , line was forever. And the person who worked on the lines instead to be helpful,  make it slower. Some older people need to be help , but were helpless and for that reason line was big and slow  , the gentleman  in charge instead to assist them or think a way to make much better the traffic, was there asking for the card to the people on the lines , they ask for our cards already at entrance,  then we know that at the moment of the Payment  we have to get the cards out  again . They have one of the machines with a sign out of order for long and then after was removed ....what is going on ?

Always enjoy finding the bargains and stocking up. Great find in good quality king size bed pack only $20. Chickens a must have @ $5. Good service received from the optometrist. Thank you. So happy with my new specs. 2 pairs, one prescription sunglasses. Love them and the price was RIGHT
I like Costco is pretty good for groceries and a couple things especially for smoked salmon witch I use for my Sandwich snack üòã

Costco Wholesale is a shopper's paradise! With its wide selection of products ranging from groceries to electronics, clothing, and household items, Costco offers incredible value for its members. The bulk packaging and discounted prices make it a go-to destination for stocking up on essentials and saving money in the long run. The spacious aisles and organized layout make for a pleasant shopping experience, and the friendly staff is always available to assist. Whether you're shopping for your home or business, Costco Wholesale provides quality products and unbeatable value.

Never had a bad experience here. Super diverse selection with great deals. Costco hot dogs in the food court are always a great way to end the shopping trip. Folks who work here are knowledgeable and pleasant. Definitely recommend a membership to anyone considering it. I've also been really happy with the length and speed of lines, etc. I never feel overwhelmed by wait times and stuff. I know Costco has a reputation for being overly crowded and hard to shop at, but my store is usually a really easy experience.

I generally feel right at home at Costco. I usually purchase items like paper towels, toilet paper, coffee, laundry and dishwasher detergent in bulk and often purchase salmon, apples, grapes, cucumbers, granola bars, vitamins and a few other things as the quality for price (value) is quite good. We will often strongly consider Costco for "bigger ticket" items like smart TVs, computers and furniture and have often found value with them as well. Also - try their croissants!

Me and my family go here when we need to stalk up on food, and they always have more than just food! Need to find a toy as a gift? Costco might have what you need! Need a giant Squishmallow for your collection? Costco might have one.......or a few. üòÖ Also, the pizza is very delicious! üòãüôÇ

Yesterday I was absolutely embarrassed and humiliated by the Costco in Royal Palm Beach. Walked out like a criminal after doing nothing wrong. I was profiled for what I was wearing and singled out in the middle of an aisle and told to leave. I have never been so embarrassed or mortified in my life. I am a law abiding citizen and to be treated this way by the store was horrific. I would suggest to everyone to not go to this store. There are other big box stores near by that I‚Äôm sure would love to have your support. I am truly saddened by how I was treated. But like others have said we few are nothing to the amount of millions of customers they have. I maybe a drop in the ocean, but I‚Äôm hoping to remove a bucket of people from them. Just sad.

Costco is the best way to find what you need and for the best price. I love shopping there! Not to mention that Costco card gives money back !
I always check the shelves with vitamins and supplements. They have the best price in town!

This is the first store we visit when we come to Orlando. I am sure that it would be worth a tourist who did not have a membership to purchase one. The value on the food alone could save more than the cost of membership. Where else can you get a whole cooked chicken for $5 or a hotdog and drink for $1.5? You then add in the wine beer selection and clothing options you can't get a better deal in Orlando.

What separates this Costco is the wine list. They have cheap wines for big events. They have nice wines to pair with the A5 Wagyu. And the pricing is a lot cheaper than the mega wine stores and at par (or cheaper) with some wholesalers.

It was sooooo crowded. You could hardly move anywhere and the employees were not very helpful or happy. Some of the produce sections were a mess from being picked over and the organization of sections were not super clear. The traffic getting in and out of the parking lot was terrible.

This was a relatively busy Costco. The liquor section wasn't as diverse as I had expected. I didn't find any Rum at all. Disappointing. The main store was clean and well stocked. The staff were all busy stocking and checking but seemed polite, helpful, and happy to be there. One of the food samplers served me what looked like a half cooked sausage. tasted fine, but yikes!

During my recent visit to the Costco in Sarasota, Florida, I was impressed by the exceptional level of customer service. The staff was attentive, and I easily found all the items I needed. My overall experience was highly positive, and I commend the team for their professionalism and efficiency.

Was shopping at this Costco recently and had the absolutely worst experience. I understand that policies are set in place, however, the way it was handled when I tried to use my Costco membership card and then my partners credit card was insane.

The cashier made this huge deal about it and tried to over explain the entire policy. She even offered for my partner (who lives in the same household) to apply for a membership. How in the world does that make any sense at all?? Sure, all I need to do is add him as the second card holder, but the way this entire thing was handled was just unprofessional. I politely asked if she could please call a manager over since this is the first time shopping there since this policy update. Luckily, the manager approved us to go ahead and go through and walked away.

Then, the cashier scanned all of our items (while looking at my partners card knowing they don‚Äôt take American Express and once everything was rang through the cashier said in a snarky tone ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt take American Express here.‚Äù

I had forgotten that they didn‚Äôt take the card and unfortunately we didn‚Äôt have another option for payment (and it was for his work) to complete the transaction.

She then proceeded to ask what she should do and I said ‚ÄúI guess you need to cancel the transaction and have someone put these items back, huh?‚Äù

To make it even better the ladies at the food court are mostly rude and yelling behind the counter about how they are out of things and they don‚Äôt care and they just have so much to do. I understand short staffing and being stressed out but as a customer it‚Äôs not that great to listen to that.

Once my membership expires in July of this year I do not plan on renewing because Costco (as a company) seems to not care about their customer service for their shoppers and is making it more difficult to just go into their stores and shop. I‚Äôve already signed up for a Sam‚Äôs Club membership and it‚Äôs 100 times better already.

Be better Costco!!!

Simply the best Costco location that I've ever been. The Costco was large with a grand enterance. The parking was spacious. The greeter was super friendly. It was not overly crowded. They had tons of free samples that were always stocked and ready to serve unlike other locations that take their times to serve the samples. The people in this location also were very friendly.  They also had a good choice at the takeout section with lots of seating.  This is a great town. Very impressed.

Awesome experience. Customer service handled return fast and easy. Prices are fair. Employees helped me find products. As I live in a small household, I wished they had a section with smaller quantities. 12 muffins are too many ect. üòã  and hamburg 6 lb packages.  The need to save today is great üëç  Power outages cause problems in summer months so freezing everything can be a problem. Purchases add up quickly at register with only a few items total over $150. Then the rest of shopping has to be at local stores during the month. Must have shelf space at home for 12 of everything. Pantry in apartments are small so this limits your purchase there to fewer items as well.

Great store and very well run. Stopped by optical shop and had my glasses that I bought at a different store adjusted.  Got in line for a rotisserie chicken and hauled it in my car about an hour away.  It was still warm and tastty.  Costco has the best employees.  They know how to take care of customers and to keep things moving.  I am 73 and used to belong to Price Club in California which eventually got merged into Costco.

First time I been in a Costco, maybe ever, and was pleased with the experience. The store itself was super stocked, well laid out even if super busy. It was easy to navigate through throngs of people. It did seem like the cashier situation was causing some major back up into the aisles though.

Happy to report the free nitrogen tire stations that are available to the public too.

I forgot my wallet at cash #6 today. Kevin ran over to me and gave it back to me. I tried to give him $20. to reward HIS good behaviour but he said he no thank you. I had over $400. Cash and about 4 credit cards both Canadian & USA.
I AM SO VERY VERY THANKFUL!  That guy needs a raise!

St. Augustine Costco is one of the best place shop weekdays for late hours. Absolutely worth to executive membership credit card with rewards . You have additional card for household member.
Bulk buying and quality of products is awesome.
Medicines, clothes, home furniture, electronic items, garden supply and food items, I bought them at a very good price. A lot of better factory discounts.

Chicken wings was good taste.

Costco staff is always so helpful and friendly.

Also, the best price on gas anywhere around.

I am visit monthly twice or thrise depends on supply shortages.

You can plan Monday or Tuesday evening after 6 PM to avoid crowds and less queue during checkout time.
üòä

If I could give 10 stars, I would! We gassed up our truck/camper trailer, and as we pulled up to a tank, someone tried to pull ahead of us, but the attendant was on the ball and had already put cones down for our rig, so Mr. Small Car was directed to a different lane. When I pushed my cart into a self-checkout lane, an employee quickly scanned my card and also quickly scanned every item IN MY CART. So fast my head was spinning. Pizza was hot & fast, restrooms were clean, I'll be back soon!

Always fun. Lots to look at and to purchase, but often the quantities or sizes are too much for two people.
Also love the liquor and cigar department next door.

So many employees willing to help us.  Our first visit and we were very impressed.  Lots more options than we had expected.  Like any place, you need to know your prices if you're looking for bargains.  Don't expect everything is cheaper because it's in bulk. We found plenty of stuff that was cheaper elsewhere but you can truly find bargains here.  I love the variety of stuff I could find that you don't see elsewhere.  It felt a little unorganized but maybe I just need to get used to the layout.

The ladies at the front counter, the ladies that served breakfast, and the ladies that straightened up the rooms were so gracious, kind,sweet,calm,loving and were the prime example of feeling like family. Thank you for everything. The rooms were clean and we had no issues. So understanding of everything. I can't say enough. 10 stars if it was possible ‚ù§Ô∏è

Reasonably and competitively priced wholesale store in Tallahassee Florida. Entry restricted only to members only with a valid membership card. Members are allowed to take two guests with them. In house fast food restaurant is available for quick bites. They have 90 day return policy for most of the items which is appreciated.

Outside the store, they have Gas Station only for members. Plenty of parking space is available.

Shout out to Scottie!  He was collecting carts in the parking lot and noticed I had some heavy boxes of shelves that needed loading.  He stopped and helped me load all of my groceries and the shelves.  I‚Äôm so thankful!  When he was done he told me to have a ‚Äúblessed day‚Äù.  Today I was blessed by Scottie!  He was so nice and kind.  Scottie deserves a raise!  Thank you for your kind help!

I love costco's! I have a lot of items to choose from,  the warehouse is always clean. However the congestion getting checked out is ridiculous. They got I was blocked so you can't even shop around the aisles close to the register.  Costco really needs the option like Sam's the scan and go app.

Excellent wholesale store to buy things in bulk for everyday needs.  The store is immaculate and well organized.  There is ample parking in front of the building.  Gas station lines are always packed but it moves very efficiently unlike the other competitor wholesale locations like.

My favorite Costco in North Florida. Mary from customer service crushes it every time. Anthony and Will from the tire center are super knowledgeable and have helped me out on numerous occasions. I like the Liquor selection and that this is the only Costco I‚Äôve been to that sells bags of ice. Comes in handy when I bring my big cooler. Shout out to the food court staff that is always busting their humps pumping out those girthy wieners and delicious pizza.

My wife and I went here to compare this establishment to one similar to the one that we already have membership on and after leaving and comparing, we left there wondering, "Why did we wait so long to visit?" My wife lost her mind here. Once we close on our home over the next couple of months, we will join. We will not give up or membership at the other location that we belong to, at least not right away, but I will say, we may never rejoin. The overall benefits of belonging here, out weighs being a member elsewhere. See you soon Costco Wholesale.

I‚Äôm shopping with my mother and the lady named Kassie at the cash register would not let me use my credit card as I am not a card holder but my mom is. Said that you can only use a credit card/debit card in the Costco member‚Äôs cardholder name. I‚Äôve been here multiple times with my family and never had that issue as long as the person with the membership is paying upon checking out. She was extremely rude to us when she told us that and I think management needs to train their employees better.

January 2024 and a nice clean and well stocked store with plenty of employees and easy checkout. Hot Dog still $1.50 and a Chicken Caesar salad at $6.99 why not.

We have been club members for several years but this was our first visit to this location. A little hard to find as it is off Collins and down a road but don't let that stop you. The have a Gas Station and Regular was $2.08 high test was $2.54 a good deal. We only needed 2 fill in items but enjoyed several samples of food which always seems to be out. Ended up splitting the $1.50 Hot Dog and soda...such a great deal. Plenty of parking and nice folks working here makes it a pleasure to stop and shop.

This Costco can get really busy especially before a major holiday or event. Shopping early without crowds is nice. Getting gas always requires a wait, but the earlier the better. Free nitrogen gas always available. They also sell liquor separately from the other merchandise.

They rotate their sales fairly frequently, so it's always a pleasant surprise when something good is on sale. The staff are also friendlier than some other Costco's that I have visited. Keep in mind that Costco staff do not bring in carts if it's raining though.

look at the length of this double wide line. waiting to get to a cashier at Costco on a Sunday afternoon.

Costco typically stocks only about 4,000 different items at any given time, about one-tenth of the variety that is available at the average supermarket.

On March 12, 2024, I had an amazing customer service experience with ilia from the customer relations department at the store. She went above and beyond to answer the questions that I had regarding my membership. She should be recognized due to her top-notch customer service skills.

The store itself is great,  recently Thursday may 9th, I stopped there fill my üöó with gas, somehow I lost my wallet from the gas station to the warehouse, noticed right away that I didn't have my wallet and quickly returned to the gas station in hopes someone had turned it in,  then I went back to the warehouse and asked at client service,  and No the wallet wasn't turned in,  all this happened at around 5:PM
One of the girls at the counter suggested that I call back after they close to see if anyone would turn it in,  üòî  but no,  my wife called in again Friday morning, same answer "nothing has been turned in sorry"
I called in again today,  same answer,  so I'll need to replace two cards, insurance cards, medical and vehicle,  and drivers license that I had just recently renewed.
We loved to check out all the different wines and drinks available at this Tampa location. Very large variety to choose from

Costco is an exceptional store for purchasing items in bulk, particularly for everyday household products such as water, toilet paper, and paper towels. Not only that, but they also offer amazing deals on electronics such as televisions, woofers, speakers, and more.

The store is always clean, well-organized, and efficiently run by the helpful Costco staff who are always available to assist customers.

Great place. I usually go for the pharmacy and they are as friendly as anyone you would meet. I have a wonderful relationship with the staff and they even know my name when I call or come in. Can‚Äôt say enough great things about Costco. The prices are also amazing. Recommended for anyone.

I love the food choices at Costco.  The inside is clean, and it feels "nice" for a bulk warehouse store.   I do not like that you always have to wait in line to checkout. They need Scan & Go like Sam's Club.

Definitely recommend trying out Costco if you haven't! The products and deals they have are great! The store is very organized and there are lots of great benefits to having a Costco membership! The credit card, the gasoline, the automotive section, and lots more!

The only complaints I would have is that the customer service is mediocre, there's always a long line to return and to speak with customer service at the desk. It would be nice if they had another person that could jump on this and help the lines not take so long in this section. I also have a Sam's club membership and they have an app where you can check out from your phone which is so useful so you don't have to sit in super long lines. Costco can be ridiculously busy And it would be amazing if I could check out on my phone like I can at Sam's club. And on top of that, Sam's club does seem to have better deals more often than Costco. Food is definitely comparably cheaper most of the time depending on what you're getting. So they could be a little bit more competitive in that sense. Other than that, I definitely like Costco and I will continue to come here.

Some of the prices are worse than any regular Publix non-sale prices... even despite being huge quantity wholesale type packages. This definitely was disappointing for a first trip to Costco after quite a few years. There were some nice loss leaders though too, and the sales were well priced. The gas was expensive... cheaper at gas station next door, also a disappointment.  Still the incredible prices at their food court save them from dropping to 2 star.

Great selection. Really like the refrigerated desserts.

I can't wait for Costco to catch up with that other big box store, and create a "scan-n-go" type app.  It's so annoying waiting in line at Costco knowing that if they had an app that I could use to shop, the trip would be alot quicker.

This is the best place to purchase groceries and other household necessities if you have a large family. The savings at the gas pump almost makes the membership worthwhile on its own. You can purchase everything from furniture to pre-made dinners to electronics. There is a little food court to grab an inexpensive bite to eat or a beverage on your way out the door.

I haven't really used the extent of my membership as i don't know what all that they have to offer here, yet. (But) the main reason I go to Costco is for 1 product, the Liquid I.V. as helps me to better Hydration with my water that I drink.  Thank you for having this product. Though I wish there was more variety of this company has, as like Hy-Vee does, of the Liquid I.V. packages.

Always so impressed with Costco. The only thing that disappointed me is they did not have large pinto bean bags when I visited.

I did hear that the hot dog and soda pop was going to have a price increase sometime soon, but even if it went up to $2 it would still be a great value!

This is a good Costco location.  Not as crazy as the one on Dodge St.  Always clean and friendly service.  One of my favorites! Great deals on quality products like coffee, beef and poultry.  And don't forget the paper goods.  There is no better place to get money saving deals on toilet paper, paper towels, etc. And I love the rotisserie chicken! I'll buy one and snack on it for days.

I bought eyeglasses at a Costco in Mexico. I needed the arms on the frames bent a little so they'd quit sliding down my nose. The guy (with kind of long hair, about 40), was not only rude to me, he was a jerk to the people in front of me too. This was on the morning of the 26th of April.  He argued with me that my glasses weren't from Costco. Sorry buddy, but Costco honors memberships from the US, Canada, and Mexico. If you hate your job so much, find another one. They'll hate you there too.

I was allowed in Costco with my mom‚Äôs executive membership card however, when I went to check out, the cashier decided he wanted to question me if that was my card because of the picture. Any other time, I see them scan the card and keep it moving. I‚Äôm assuming he couldn‚Äôt believe that two young looking Black people would have an executive membership which is why he took his time examining the card. My parents spend way too much money here WEEKLY outside of the money they spend on their membership for the cashier to hold up the line trying to embarrass me and my boyfriend. He called his supervisor over and the supervisor was very nice and said I can have my parents add me to their account. Problem solved. He made a big deal about it for absolutely no reason and for 5 items! No need in my parents adding me to their account because I‚Äôll never shop here again.

Optical Department
The lady who usually works the optical department is very nice. There‚Äôs now this man that works it the last couple times I‚Äôve came and he is so rude!!!! For literally no reason he seems exasperated to help you, bothered that you‚Äôre there, and talks down to you extremely condescending. I was trying to purchase contacts and had to walk away without being able to purchase anything. I wish that nice lady was still working the counter üíî she got you set up with whatever you needed so fast. I‚Äôve never had a single bad interaction at Costco Optical before this.

I like shopping at Costco,there are a variety of items and the stocks get refreshed at regular intervals, and they are quite relevant according to the seasons and festivals. Often get good deals and discounts. The ambience of the store is good and the staffs are friendly. I visit the store weekly once, the gas is cheaper for members compared to other gas stations.

I headed to Costco because I had been thinking about joining for several years. Saturday December 17, I thought, was the day I would finally become a member. For some reason, I thought membership cost $100. The Goldstar membership is only $60. It's the executive membership that's $120.

One of the things I looked for when I entered the store was the price of fuel. I couldn't find a sign with the prices. However, an employee at the membership counter told me that their fuel price is only $2.41 per gallon. At Hy-Vee, it's $3.09! Wow! I found out you don't have to be a member to look around the store or to go to the food court. That's nice! I took the opportunity to look around.

I found several things I put on my mental list of things I might buy in the future. I also enjoyed their food sample stations. They have several of them spread around the store. I saw a wide range of products from TVs, Bose headphones, chairs, a grocery store section, and plenty of snacks. Oh, I could get into trouble with all the snacks they sell here. I was disappointed when I found out their optical center doesn't work with the company I have for vision insurance which is Eye Med. It is worth mentioning that the reason I wanted a Costco membership instead of a Sam's membership is Costco has a reputation for paying and treating their employee much better.

After taking a good look around, I walked back to the membership counter to buy a membership. The woman who helped me gave me a lot of helpful information, and I could tell she really wanted me to sign up for the Executive membership. She also encouraged me to sign up for a Costco Visa credit card. I said I was interested in the Goldstar membership. As she was taking my information, I asked if Costco takes Apple Pay. She said, "Only if it's linked to a Visa credit or debit card." And that's why I am giving Costco 4 stars instead of 5. I have never heard of a store that won't take Mastercard. That's all I have, and I refuse to carry cash. I ended up walking out of the store with nothing because of that policy. Maybe one day I will have a Visa card. Until then, I can't shop at Costco. Their loss.

I enjoy shopping at Costco. This location in particular had a large food court and a poorly set up gas station. There were also a lot of samples around and the store wasn't as cluttered and narrow as the one I'm used to shopping back at home is. They also check your membership card before you check out when using the self checkout.

First-time member and I must say, the experience was great! Costco has very friendly and helpful employees. My member services person was Joy and she was definitely a joy! I'm impressed!! It was definitely a better experience than when I became a member at Sam's club two years ago.

I shop at Costco quite a bit and I normally get the same things. I ended up getting some Kirkland brand laundry detergent pods because they were on sale for a big bag and it ruined several pieces of laundry after figuring out that‚Äôs what was doing it! I washed the loads and dried them. When I went to fold them I noticed clumps of hard plastic that melted into the fabric. The coating on the pods does not dissolve in all water temps and ends up a hard clump on the fabric of some of the clothes and sheets! And you can‚Äôt get them off , so i ended up throwing out some good sheets of mine and a few articles of clothing!

What a thoroughly unpleasant experience at self checkout. I only needed a few things so I didn't get a cart. She needed to see my Costco card and check my identity for some reason and I didn't have a third hand to get out my card. So she holds some of my stuff because there's no where to set anything down (NOT THAT I SHOULD HAVE TO ANYWAY UNLESS I'M SCANNING TO CHECKOUT!) and checks my card and hands it back to me. I put my card away, wait a moment to step up to scan, and of course I have to get my card out again. There's no where to put my stuff and I can't set it anywhere near the self checkout machine. So I set it on the floor, get out my card again.

I'm in this store a couple times a week and I've never seen them really check my card in a regular checkout aisle. Is self checkout some awesome place and I'm just missing out? Don't you want people to want to use self checkout? You don't act like it.

You need to find a better way to accommodate people without carts which you should be doing already at self checkout. Have an empty cart sitting around or something. I can't imagine one person has looked at your setup and asked how grossly unpleasant your self checkout must be for customers.

In general I love Costco. Great prices, products, and customer service. Only reason I'm leaving 4 stars instead of 5 is their cake and deli food ordering process. The only way to put in an order is to come into the store and fill out a form at least 24 hours in advance. You can't do it online, you can't do it over the phone, hell, you can't even fax it in. It has to be in person. I'm there enough that this usually isn't a problem, but I hate having to make an extra trip ocassionally because of an ancient process. Hopefully someone from Costco management reads this and cosiders a better process.

Costco in West Bountiful is always busy tons of people wish hours went later at night. Of course they have everything in bulk as well as clothing etc. But check out lines are extremely long usually, the checkers are very efficient, I just wish they would not have installed the self-checkout. It takes away from the checkers that are very quick and can move things along faster than a lot of people can work the machines. Just my opinion. Parking lot is packed. Be prepared to walk further away than smaller grocery stores.
Great store. Basically, it's probably not much different from other chain stores. Well, it's part of the Costco network. No complaints though, so overall, it's okay.

The rotisserie chickens had been undercooked every time I bought, in the past 3 months, from the West Bountiful locations. Each time only a small portion I could use for making sandwiches or salad. I had to freeze the majority of it and use it to make casseroles later. Please talk to your employees to watch out and improve for that.  We don‚Äôt want to get sick. Thanks.

I absolutely hate the new packaging on the roasted chickens.  It‚Äôs now put in a bag.  The bag has small holes and leaks any juice if it is tipped at all.  There is no stability on the bottom of the bag. And you cannot see through the bag to see what the chicken looks like. Please bring back the original packaging that works so well to transfer the chicken home and keep it in the fridge. Please please please!

The company and the customer service was absolutely fantastic, the one thing that pushed it to where I didn't give it a full five-star review is the people. Perhaps we should start incorporating Street traffic laws for in the store. When I am there with my kids and somebody is impatient and is going to hit the cart with my kids in it, I tend to get defensive. I get that people are in a rush and in a hurry, but it's to the point where I don't want to bring my children here and they are constantly with me. So I may just wait a while before I need to make my next Costco run.
Pizza was good, the strawberry ice cream was disappointing. They just mixed in strawberry milk powder. They also got rid of churros and replaced them with expensive cookies.

It doesn't matter what location we go to. They are all our favorite. Lehi. Location does seem to get some of the better stuff though when it comes to no food items. Costco is a great place to go for getting new tires. They have better prices, better warranties. Just all around better policy in general then anywhere else.

This location is closest to home and is really convenient to get to.

Fresh produce, great pantry staples, and new items always keeps me coming back for more!  Employees are always friendly and helpful.

You can't beat Costco's return policy - no questions asked and are always accommodating to your needs!

Good Costco, wide selection. The pizza is great and a good price, nice for get togethers or parties. Parking hasn‚Äôt been an issue for me here, the side lot on the eastern side of the building always has a few spaces. Staff is generally friendly and move things along quickly. No complaints here

Love this Costco. We come at least once a week. I get nothing but positive vibes from the GM, cashiers, lot crew, concessions and customer service. Everyone is awesome! This Costco does not sell beer, wine, hard seltzers or liquor.

Probably the nicest COSTCO that I have been too, mainly because it's so new! It was very quiet when we went and we thought that it's so new that people may not even know about it yet and the area is still growing! We called ahead and tried their pizza. It was the Best üëå. It is a better bang for your buck then most places! Love this Costco and hope that it stays a hidden gem!

Potentially the nicest Costco I have been to and I have been to a ton and love Costco! Pro tip go on Sunday!

They don‚Äôt get very busy and it‚Äôs so awesome on Sundays! The optical center was new and has some awesome stands for adjustments I love it. Like a new age lensecrafter very cool?

I have shopped here three times so far. There is always more that I would like to buy than my budget allows. Employees you encounter are friendly and professional. Check out is fast and efficient. I would recommend that anytime you go to buy a rotisserie chicken. They sell at a great price and depending on the size of your family it can make numerous meals.

I know I don‚Äôt matter cause the employees let me know. So I doubt it matters but if it helps another mom not get embarrassed I‚Äôll share. after showing my card in the front and shopping through the entire store. They told me I couldn‚Äôt buy anything because my name wasn‚Äôt on the card. It was my husband‚Äôs card. I was buying food for our family. I was told that they were cracking down on delinquent using the wrong card. Applied that I  was one. I tried to explain and they said well we will see if you are actually on the account. I just said I‚Äôm already late meeting my kids from school.
I dragged my 4 year old out of the store bawling that we forgot all our stuff. We left all our stuff mom. You will be embarrassed in front of everyone if your name is not on the card. Never going back. And I know it doesn‚Äôt matter and they don‚Äôt care. Which is what makes me the most upset.

The self checkout employees are rude. My toddler was helping me checkout with 3 items, the store was practically empty, and they told me repeatedly it would take longer if I let him help (duh). We won‚Äôt be renewing our membership.

What do you think of Costco's new chicken packaging?  I love that they use 75% less packaging!  When I picked my chicken there was chicken juice all over the shelf.  Definitely not a fan of that!  Otherwise we love Costco!

Shout out to the cart crew (Aaron & Adrian üôåüèª) who‚Äôs ‚ÄúCan-Do‚Äù attitudes achieved greatness today!
#KirklandKlub

We love love love Costco. Their hearing aid department is thorough and extremely helpful. Prices are excellent and customer service is outstanding!!
The Optical Department is also excellent, providing great product and service at an unbelievable price. Why go anywhere else?

We love Costco. We visit usually once a week. The products are also well proven by Costco's product procurement team and priced great. We get everything from contact lenses, hygiene products, shoes, clothing, light bulbs, batteries, produce, dairy, meats, and other groceries from Costco.
There aren't enough stars to give this place. This place is so awesome!! The customer service is fantastic. The samples are so delicious. And the food is great quality.

I don‚Äôt tell Costco what I need. Costco tells me. And I appreciate it. Find most everything that you need and want. I think Costco really helps me shop with adhd. Less options and stress than  normal store.  I buy such a variety of items here from electrical to furnishings and housewares and clothes and all the food. And books. Electronics. Got my phone here. Best return policy. Costco for life.

Great for groceries and getting clothing. I bring my kids here when we want a cheap delicious meal. Very quick and efficient. I also use their pharmacy, and they are very helpful and quick at serving customers.

I went to Costco to get my membership card, shop, and compare prices. Their prices are good on most things but I saw a few things that I could save money on if I bought them somewhere else.  The lady that helped me get my membership card was really nice and helpful.
Great place. Lots that Spanish Fork Costco does not have. I do like their selection of veggies better. I do feel as though they stay fresh longer than when I get them from the Spanish Fork location.

Amazing prices and great staff love the food and everything that is sold is always an amazing deal. The membership system is also really well built and really lets you get a great deal. In all honesty it's not only a Costco is a good Costco

I usually love Costco and they are usually nice people. I went the other day to go grocery shopping for my mom and I was declined service because she wasn‚Äôt there because she is the cardholder witch is fine it‚Äôs the rules but the guy was super rude and even said ‚Äúwell maybe get your own god damn card then‚Äù so that shouldn‚Äôt be happening at all to customers and I ordered a online package and the box came destroyed including my package üëéüèΩ

How bad they made me feel in this place, I tell you my story, I was in the self-checkout line and suddenly I had several people waiting for me, my turn came and this person in a red vest named Lily approached me (I know this because of her ID). ) and tells me he needs to see my card and photo, to which I wonder why the white blonde people in front of me didn't ask? (I have nothing against her), why should I show it to you? Why does my skin color or race make you think I don't have it? Isn't it supposed that they already saw her at the entrance? How bad this person made me feel, I consider that if they are going to ask you to show your identity it should be for everyone and not just for a certain group of people.

They have plenty of toilet paper and fresh eggs.  Anything else is icing on the cake (which they have in bulk, of course). Always neat and organized despite the number of messy customers. Update ... try the Kirkland Kettle Crinkle cut potato chips with Himalayan salt.  Update ... Crazy packed on a snowy Cinco de mayo but still made good time and found everything but cat litter. The pet aisle is a dedicated dog only aisle.

I go to this costco a lot and we use the self checkout for a couple different reasons. One of the main reasons is we live on the 3rd story of an apartment complex.  We like to be able to put items in the boxes to accommodate for that.  Usually they'll scan the heavy and or big items for us at self check out.  However on this particular occasion we got denied use of the self check out lanes by an employee who said we had to many items.  We had 14 items total.  We had two milks and 1 Capri sun pack.  That would have been considered heavy. We have done self check out numerous times with wayyy way more items before and no problem.  We triggered the over weight warning once on a separate occasion.  So we are aware of it.  Again usually employees offer to scan heavy and big items so I'm very  confused as to why we were denied use.   So we went to a person to check us out and they didn't even offer us a box. Which again is the main reason we do self check out.  So we can use the boxes to help us unload and pack it up several flights of stairs.  I find today's experience to be rude and unprofessional.

Who doesn't love Costco. It is one of my favorite stores on the planet, and most things are at a great price. They always have high quality products, great service, it's always very clean, and they have one of a kind deals in bulk!  They have a great vitamin and supplements section, lots of great healthy clean foods. Great produce and of course great furniture, kitchen supplies, and amazing outdoor toys abd camping gear.

Shopping at Costco is a MUST for my family since we live in a rural area. We usually go to the WVC location but today we went to this one. The pricing was great, as always. It was crowded with customers but the good thing is they had so many employees actually working. Every cash register was open, including self checkout. One of the front end employees actually came to help me check out because I had 2 carts full of items. They had everything in stock that I was looking for. The store is neatly organized and clean. And of course, my kids enjoyed the food samples.

I always enjoy shopping at this place as it is one of the most comprehensive and well-organized stores I‚Äôve visited. The aisles are meticulously arranged, making it easy to access and find everything I need. Additionally, they regularly offer tastings of new products, adding an exciting touch to the shopping experience. The ready-to-eat food is notably fresh and served on the same day, while fruits, vegetables, and produce are consistently fresh and of high quality. I really appreciate the attention to detail they demonstrate in arranging their products. My only minor concern would be the parking area, which can sometimes be a bit challenging to find an available spot. Overall, shopping at this Costco is an experience I always look forward to.

The food are good and affordable. But one thing that really bothers us is the tall lady in the counter is putting the receipt on top of the food . Like she literally put the paper receipt on top of the pizza. We were shock that nobody notice and complaint about that. Were glad we ordered whole pizza in a box otherwise i will definitely say something if she put the dirty receipt on top of our food . Managers should do something about this. This could be food contamination issue

If I could give NO stars, I would. I usually go to Sam‚Äôs Club since they‚Äôre always great, but since Mothers Day is this weekend I went today to get my mom one of those Costco Cheesecakes she likes and a bag of Liquid IV (my mom n I really enjoy the liquid iv n they really help my kidneys) my mom let me use her card, she is working n I didn‚Äôt realize how strict they would be about being a non member (even though I used to be on her account, it‚Äôs been literal years since I‚Äôve been to Costco) so the woman in self checkout (short petite white woman with longish brown hair and blue eyes, I didn‚Äôt get her name) stopped me and demanded to see my card, and took the card to check if it was still current. She confirmed I used to be a member, asked where the member was I told her at work I was on the phone with my mom n my mom asked her if I could use the card she said ‚Äúsorry I can‚Äôt let you purchase anything‚Äù in a smug tone. I believe she racially profiled me because everyone else in line is white, I will NOT be stepping foot in ANY Costco in the future it‚Äôs too busy and the people are rude anyway.

Costco has great dog food that is a great price and my dog loves it. The food court has great pizza for $10 and it is really big. It has a wonderful and varied selection of beautiful fish like I have never seen in my life. It looks like it has just been caught. The colors are vibrant. The rotisserie chicken is so convenient and a wonderful price. There is frozen fried chicken that when you microwave it it is better than any restaurant I have ever had.

One of my favorite place to do my shopping. From groceries to electronics and even tires to my car. They have great prices with great quality. As an European I like doing shopping like that. Their food court is BOOOOMB! My favorites are chicken bake and mocha freeze. She likes them too, look on pics. Definitely recommend them.

I was in Sandy, UT for a meeting with work and stopped by the Costco off of 11400 S. I'm always surprised at the different items that are at different locations of Costco.

This one was really busy, but the check out lines were pretty quick. I used the self checkout because I had less than 10 items, so it's easier.

Everything was well stocked, service was great like always.

I took my truck into Hillside in Sandy after spending a lot of money at another shop and they were not able to solve the issues.
Chris oversaw the work. The awesome mechanics at Hillside diagnosed the issues and repaired it in less than a day and a half. I can drive my truck with no worries now.
Thank you to the team at Hillside in Sandy.

Costco is a great place for some things and an okay place for others. Sometimes there are great deals on clothes and tvs. The rotisserie chicken is the best deal ever! I love their poppy seed and chocolate chocolate chip muffins. My kids love the pizza and vanilla ice cream. Did I mention that I love all the samples?
What can I say?  It's Costco!  Come for the $1.50 hotdogs, stay for the $300 in groceries when you only planned on buying milk... üòÇ

The Saratoga Springs Costco is great. The best time to shop here is on Sundays or in the morning. I don't buy a ton of food here, but we love the guarantees and the customer service by Costco. We have bought furniture, our blinds, appliances, and other large home items from Costco because of their warranties and return policy.

This particular location does a great job. I like Costco in general but this location really hustles. Multiple times I've needed someone to go above an beyond and they've met the challenge each time. It is hard for them to keep everything we want in stock but that is the way it is in SS these days.

I had the most horrible experience today at the store on our way out when they were checking the receipts they noticed that one of the items and I had in a huge cart full of stuff had not been rung up by the cashier.it was a little $6 bag of snacks. I had no idea. I am not a thief and was actually grateful that she had pointed it out so that I could pay for it but instead of asking me nicely to go over to customer service to purchase the item she made me stand there while she filled out some paper and then called out a walkie-talkie. And made me wait there till a manager escorted me to a register to ring it out. I was so humiliated by this experience that I was physically shaking.I am never going back there again.

I believe the other reviews that say ordering pizza ahead doesn't matter. They only start to prepare it when you arrive. When we arrived to pick up an order, they told us it would be 20 minutes. We said we had a call ahead order with a pickup time. They argued and said it was for a pickup 15 minutes later. This is absolutely not true. We have a party planned and we're picking up pizzas for it. We scheduled the order 30 minutes in advance. We would not schedule the order to be ready only 10 minutes before the party starts. We need to be back home at that time ready to greet guests. Telling them is useless. They make it seem like it's your fault for arriving early to get your order, and deny any input of your order time from you. Other reviews mention they only start your order when you arrive, and I'd have to agree. That defeats the point of making an order ahead, doesn't it? You'd order early to have it ready when you arrive.

I like my local Costco as much as anyone but I‚Äôd love to see more exciting offerings or items that are different than the norm. This Costco feels like. They just stock the safe and boring stuff versus stumbling upon cool deals and items

I had a person order me and fit me for a few pairs of glasses under the initials BP. I have worn every pair since I picked them up and I LOVE THEM! They are very very nice glasses, but all three of them feel accustomed to my face. Certainly talented hands crafted all three of these glasses. They are expertly fitted, and the person who I picked them up from assured they fit flawlessly.

From one technician to another in different (and same) industries, thank you. You guys have served me beautifully, and my glasses fit better than anything else I own. I love them. We technicians really do the heavy lifting don‚Äôt we? :)

P.S. I love the wire holding them together. Functional and the silver is a flawless lining to my thick bum frames! I‚Äôll be a Costco guy for a long time after this!

Costco is just a great place. Helpful employees. Efficient checkout system. Knowledgeable customer service team.

The products here are reliably good. The products vary by region and it‚Äôs fun to see what you find at different Costco stores.

They always have a great selection of Christmas candies and cookies. Hard to not find way more than you need here.
Great stuff. Great prices. Great customer service. The only reason I shop anywhere else is if Costco doesn't have it

Customers have no where to put the shopping cart after loading their cars so they just leave the shopping carts on the sidewalk impeding walking space. I feel that for as rich as Costco is they could afford to implement better cart placement in the parking lot. The meat selection is poor. I buy 93% lean hamburger meat from Walmart and that is no where to be found here. That's disappointing. Costco is missing the one probiotic that I need. It needs to be above 50 billion.
