I agree to using boxes but they need handles to hold the box. On all of them. I need to be able to grip the box. I hate that you upsell and encourage members to auto pay for their next year membership. I don't even like the membership to be honest.  For single people bulk buying isn't always necessary. I would prefer to buy one gallon of milk instead of two at a time. Here they come in a box of two.

You can be better on your discounts as well.  Not impressed yet. I prefer to shop at walmart.
This place has awesome in bulk and the food is really well priced plus super good I tell you what they have some of the biggest whiners have ever seen lol

Went around 5:30pm. Super busy and almost impossible to navigate the parking lot. There were very few spaces open.
We managed to grab a rotisserie chicken (there were two left), and I noticed that instead of the usual containers with the plastic lid, they come in a bag that DOESNT ZIP CLOSED. If this thing tips and spills grease everywhere in my car, that‚Äôs on Costco. I‚Äôm not sure if this is a change they‚Äôve made everywhere, but at least make the bag seal like other stores!
In the self checkout, the girl with the scanner for big items was not helping anyone, yet she did not help us with our huge bag of rice. We had to heave it up so we could scan it and then put it back in our cart. The fuel station is almost invisible behind the trees in the parking lot‚Äîsee picture.

Visited 05/09/24. It was actually the best Costco experience I've ever had, until the end. It was empty, no customers in sight, I grabbed what I needed and went to check out. The gentleman at self checkout was super helpful and kind, he even offered to scan my groceries for me since he had a handy scanner gun. Everything was wonderful until I hit the door. They did as they always have, and checked my goods in comparison to my receipt. All was good to go until she moves a couple boxes and sees an $8 pack of batteries. I immediately apologize, offer to go back, and explain what had happened. Rather than ask the gentleman standing 50 ft away, doing nothing, she calls down a manager, who tells me they will not be asking him. After 20 minutes of hemming and hawing, someone FINALLY takes the miniscule amount of time and effort, and lo and behold, I told the truth. If Costco was not a unique service, I would have canceled my membership immediately over the sheer laziness and lack of respect shown by management.

Love Costco for so many reasons; their deli, bakery, fresh produce and meat cuts are top notch along with the gas station, food, snacks, pharmacy and OTC medicine, gifts, gift card selection, clothing, socks, underwear, electronics, housewares, furniture and everything in between. Worth every cent of the yearly membership fee! Organized, clean and always stocked well. Convenient one stop party/dinner store. Highly recommend! You save so much money and get so much more for your money at Costco! Highly recommend!

Went to Costco in Ogden today to get my hearing checked on one of their busiest days.  It was crazy at first sight, however lines were moving, people were courteous and lots of smiles.  Great service from the hearing aids manager - he goes above & beyond. Delightful first experience with them. Still shopped and totally enjoyed my experience!

Great place to shop for items in bulk, fair value, and good to great quality. Cheap items in the food court like hot dogs, pizza, drinks, and ice cream. They keep the store clean and provide friendly service. The downside is looking for parking since it's always so busy and waiting in line. It can get seriously packed during peak hours. My best recommendation is to show up right before it opens! They'll usually let you in 5 mins before or so, 15 minutes after it opens, it already started filling in with the crowd.

Love the fresh fruits, vegetables and especially the flowers.  We use instacart more for this location than we visit.

We went into the store today - they had all things Mother's Day and new packaging for their rotisserie chickens.  Are you a fan of the new packaging?

Love!!!  What can I say?!  Costco is the best. Bulk items of almost everything you need. You can feed 1,2,3 + teenagers and still have food in the house. Now that‚Äôs a bargain.

If you can get the executive membership so you can get cash back on each purchase. It helps pay for the membership too. That‚Äôs a great deal.
Definitely some good deals you can't or won't find anywhere else! Glad they stopped letting non-members in the food court! Much less crowded!

Great place to shop if you like to buy in bulk or if you have a large family.  It is hard to stop by without spending well over $100 each visit.  Lots of good deals.  You do need a membership to enter.  The gas is cheaper than most places most of the time.

Costco is expensive.

Sometimes unique items, and some are higher quality. Good bakery. Most Home goods are expensive. Some items are a good price like coffee and gasoline.

Hot dogs are great.

Know what you want before going

This Costco location was clean and orderly. What was really surprising to me was how well the clothes were organized and stopped. A lot of locations have a hard time keeping up with people raffling through all of the clothes. However, this location had everything clean even with people continue to search through them and disrupting the piles. The freezer section is nice without things being stacked too high, and the register was quick and efficient.

Great experience. My mother purchased an Executive Membership card, which is a great deal because of the 2% money back you get. The only reason I wouldn't give Costco 5 stars is because of the crowdedness in the warehouse.

I love Costco! I take my kids here as an outing once a week and we walk the whole store and just get whatever. I've never waited in line longer then just a couple min and it's very well stocked. 5 stars for sure!

It was majorly busy but that's to be expected. I'm disabled and have restrictions in place that says I can't stand or walk for more than 10 minutes.  My condition is besides the point.  I feel they need more riding carts for those of us who pay the consequences of having to walk around this huge store.
The employees that work there are amazing at their job, their friendly,  can answer your questions and most importantly,  they ask if your ok if they see you not doing well and will offer to help without hesitation.

Yes, it‚Äôs been a week and had every intention of posting sooner. Just want to give a huge shout out to the costco team!!! They were amazing!! I bought a box pastries and didn‚Äôt realize you needed 2 boxes for the price they advertised. When I got to the register they caught it and the lady ran back to get me my second box. We all know how crazy it gets. By the time they rung up my stuff I had totally forgotten and headed for the door. The gentleman at the door noticed that I didn‚Äôt have my two boxes. Told him someone had ran to fetch it for me but I had spaced it. I HAD NO INTENTION at this point to turn around. Huge crowds just not my style. Then he spots her looking for me and in spite of all my forgetfulness they deliver. Such an awesome team!! Thank you for your fantastic customer service!!

To the gentleman that works there  that
helped me last night ( I‚Äôm so sorry I forgot your name I was exhausted when I got there) I cannot thank you enough!!! They were closing the doors when I got there after working 2 jobs. This wonderful man saw the desperation in my eyes and asked what I needed to get. I told him I needed some food for my puppy and he asked what kind I buy and went in and bought it for me. You Sir are a Lifesaver!!! I work 2 jobs 6 days a week so I don‚Äôt have a lot of time for shopping and I was in desperate need of this last night!! He went above and beyond to help me when he didn‚Äôt have to and the other woman who was chatting with me while I waited who also worked there gave me some wonderful conversation until he came back. You are both wonderful!! You guys have some excellent employees there. Please try to find out who they were so you can give them the recognition they deserve!!
appointment was at six. They checked me right in and was in and out good customer service here.

Costco is more than good quality food and much much more. I lost one of my hearing aids.I was freaking out not only because of my not hearing well but also because of the replacement cost. I heard good things about Costcos hearing center, so off I go, and they were great. The cost for two new up to date hearing aids was less than 1/4 of what I paid for the pair I lost. Yea!

Avoid this place like the plague. Pretty sure they are racist on the fact that they only ever ask Hispanic or people of color for their membership once at the self checkout. Not once did they ask a Caucasian for their membership. What‚Äôs the point of having someone at the entrance for? Sam‚Äôs club has way better customer service. Definitely canceling my membership here.

Attention all Costco food court fans.
They have restored diced onions to the condiments area
This in a great complement to a fresh hot dog.
The diced onions are offered in a small cup.
After sprinkling them on my hot dog, I added then to my slice of pizza which gave a snappy crunch.
The hot dog in history, the pizza slice is almost. Hahaha

Deep Indian Kitchen's assortment of Kati Street Wraps is a gastronomic breakthrough, infusing the lively and fragrant essence of Indian streets into Costco's selection. The *Chicken Tikka Masala Wrap* stands out as a symphony of tastes, featuring tender chicken chunks enveloped in a rich, spiced tomato gravy, all encased in a handcrafted paratha that achieves the perfect crunch when heated in the microwave. The *Spinach Paneer Wrap* offers a vegetarian option that doesn't disappoint, with its gentle, luscious paneer and fresh spinach coming together in a satisfyingly cohesive mix.

Every wrap serves as a pledge to Deep Indian Kitchen's dedication to genuine flavors and superior quality, boasting ingredients and spices that are authentically Indian. Despite the swift two-minute microwave preparation, the flavors remain deep, full-bodied, and absolutely delightful. At an affordable price of $4.99, these wraps provide a nutritious, convenient meal solution that doesn't compromise on flavor or consistency.

From the comforting Chicken Tikka Masala to the indulgent Butter Chicken, and the nourishing Spinach Paneer, Deep Indian Kitchen's wraps offer an experience akin to an Indian street food stall, both accessible and gratifying. It's clear why they've rapidly gained popularity among those in search of a speedy, scrumptious meal that whisks your taste buds away to the rich culinary traditions of India.

This particular Costco seems to feature more unique and bougie items than I've seen at other locations. The crowd of fellow shoppers seem to be less aggressive as well. I've been to almost all the metro Atlanta Costco locations, and this is the BEST one if you're choosy.

Costco has so many great benefits. Their products are amazing, their food court options are great, and they have amazing employees. The gasoline is affordable, and I love how clean the place is kept! The membership is worth it.

Too good. I usually ride my motorcycle to Costco because it limits how much we buy (to around $300).

We've been considering me buying a pickup truck. But even if I were paid to have it, I'm not sure if we could afford the costs of virtually unlimited Costco hauls by virtue of a pickup.

Seriously, the quality of food (beef, salmon, olive oil, tuna (Kirkland brand)) is the best I've ever found. The fact prices are at or below competitor prices makes Costco so compelling. They really have a great system.

Prices are good. Weird that I need to show membership at checkout. I already showed it at the door. Shopping at Costco is always very stressful they need to increase the store's footprint because there are so many people you can barely move around. They need to get a building like Ikea
First time at this location. It was clean.  Newer store.  Gas line went faster since each lane has 3 pumps vs the two I'm use to at my normal store.   Meat selection was very sparce.

It's a great place to shop for major appliances, household items, clothes, tech, etc.  Buying food in such large quantities can cost you extra money in the long run if you don't have a good plan to use it. Their return policy is the best.  Update: Jan 2024: Made an online appt to get my tires replaced.  Wanted to change the date but the website wouldn't let me.  So I called my local Costco and changed the appointment over the phone.  However, when I got there they said the only had a record of my old appt.  They were nice enough to work me in but it took a couple of hours.  I appreciated them putting new caps on my tire inflators and driving my car to meet me at the front of the store.
I wish there were dressing rooms

I went to this store on Wednesday May 8, I was doing my grocery shopping with my family.  I was looking for the box of 5 dozens eggs, but there was none on the floor, all of them were all the way up in the racks.  I ask Jessica if she could find someone to put the eggs down. ( in my mind I was o well I try). She told me yes, let me find someone to help you.  I keep going thru the aisles and she came up to me twice to tell me that pallet of eggs was on the floor that if I still want them.  This is great customer service!!!! Jessica is amazing so nice, polite, helpful.   I will continue to shop there. üëèüèºüëèüèº

Easy access into the parking lots. Friendly employees, clean store. They are well stocked, like other Costco's I've visited in Georgia. The Athens store has vision and hearing centers selling quality eye glasses and hearing aids at very reasonable, almost too good to be true prices compared to name brand stores. The hearing and vision centers also offer hearing and vision exams on site with appointments.

We just went here today 12/19  and got some things.  We also bought the rotisserie chicken and its still raw in the inside I was surprised that they let them sell chicken that is not cooked thoroughly.
This is my favorite Costco. It is not as overcrowded as the rest. As long as you are smart picking your shopping time and day to shop. A better designed access to fueling and parking then most.

5/12 is Mother‚Äôs Day, which pisses me off.  I went to Costco today and saw the salesperson selling products while talking and laughing.  When I walked over to say hello, she didn't respond and even had a stinky look on her face. I picked up the product and looked at the form to confirm, then I changed it to a smaller one and accidentally got it wet.  She said with a stinking face that I would just drink the trial version.  This makes me very angry.  My child has diabetes.  As a mother, can't I just look at the charts?  You still show me such a stinky face, it‚Äôs really depressing.  I'm here to consume, not to see your bad face.üò°üò°üò°üò° I'm extremely angryÔºå4 stars dropped because of her

Went here for the first time in about six years today. Almost every employee I encountered was extremely rude and acted like we were bothering them (exception of the pharmacy staff and the man doing the membership cards) The lady working at the cafe area was the worst. She told me they don‚Äôt take cards at the register you have to use the kiosk. I was trying to apologize because I had never used the cafe there and she cut me off, raised her voice and aggressively said ‚ÄúI was just telling you for next time, you have to use the kiosk! We don‚Äôt take cards here!‚Äù  then she walks away. I pay & I waited there for a while for her to give me my receipt but she never came back to the counter or said a word to me so I took it off the printer so I would know my order number when they called it. She then yelled at me to give it back, she didn‚Äôt know my order. When it was ready she then called out my order number‚Ä¶ which I didn‚Äôt know. The pizza looked like it had slid off the tray, it was a mess and we ended up just throwing it away because we didn‚Äôt trust what happened to it. I just got the membership today but I am calling to get a refund, I‚Äôll stick with Sam‚Äôs!

Usually love this Costco. If you had asked me about a month ago I would‚Äôve gave it 5 stars. I am extremely frustrated though with the garden center now. I want to enjoy looking at the plants but on several occasions now every time I go in the garden center area, someone is smoking cigarettes and employees do not care to tell them to go somewhere else. They should not be smoking AT ALL that close to the building, much less in an area that kids and families are trying to enjoy. I blame the smokers just as much as Costco employees for not enforcing this rule. You have lost my business in the garden center. Do better.

I absolutely love Costco, I have been a member of Costco for over ten years. The food quality is great. I love that you can buy in bulk.  It‚Äôs a one stop shop from food to tires, to getting your eyes checked, a pharmacy, a bakery, a meat department. Excellent customer service.

A store that is well-organized.  When I went here to get groceries, I saw that the store was kept up nicely and neat. In case you need assistance finding something, the staff was really courteous and ready to assist you.

This is one of the busiest stores all the time. Still very friendly and efficient staff. It's little smaller compared to others with no liquor store attached.

They gave added new menu items and their salad is so worth it for 6.99$.

I‚Äôve been a Costco member for years. It‚Äôs a great place to shop for good quality items at reasonable prices. The customer care is amazing, and the shoppers appear to be honest people as well, I‚Äôve lost my wallet there and another time my coat with the cell phone in it. Both times people turn them in and staff goes out of the way to help. What‚Äôs not to like?

SIMPLY THE BEST

Come See For Yourself...
Keep your trash to yourself or can it...keep the Earth Clean thus parking lots and garages count too.
Clean Happy Experience here...
Happy Shopping
Happy Life...

This location can be busy at times but the staff are so on point that they make things much easier to get in and get out. Just make sure you come at times when it‚Äôs least busy to have the smoothest experience. The store itself have plenty of stock, good customer service and the lines move fairly quickly, this location is on point and you won‚Äôt be disappointed

Alright! This shop has a whole lot of staff trying to ensure not a single person is idling... You need a helping hand, sure you would get about three staff members around you and right helping. They were quite cauteous and attentive to customers needs. Although there were queues for check out, but that would disappear in no time.
Prices are quite affordable. Nice üëç one

The customer service is excellent here! David (might be the manager? He was very well dressed) was super helpful and friendly. He and Caleb help to load our items onto the truck. Everyone at this Cumberland Costco is professional, helpful, and friendly. Thank you!

They always have what we're looking for. And some things we weren't. Pretty good pricing on meat. Some prices and quality of items are definitely better than Sam's but Sam's seems to have more variety in certain areas... Costco snack select left me wanting more options.
The food court is always a hit with the family although it doesn't accept the tap to pay. Tables were clean and maintained. Bathrooms were clean and well lit.

I am writing this review solely to acknowledge the absolute consumate customer service professional named Ms. Tammi.  From the first time we visited this location, her sparkling personality, knowledge of various products and warm personality were above reproach.  Each time we visit, she has the same bubbling personality and beautiful spirit!  I made it a point the last time to say some thing to the store's manager and was extremely disappointed with his nonchalant and a bit dismissve attitude at my praise for a member of his team.  The absolute most important asset that any company has is its employees.  I am so glad that Ms. Tammi is on the forefront as she makes every customer feel warm and welcome.  My sincere Thank You and appreciation for her!  Go by and see Ms. Tammi!!

If it were simply about employee experience they would receive 10 stars. They are fantastic. The location very conjested. The parking is not great and the store space seems tighter than most, but I'd choose this location over the Kennesaw location any day .

Great prices great service. I really enjoyed going to Costco. Jerry at the front door is always a blast.!! he‚Äôs a great guy who deserves a bonus!!! Only problem with him is his handshakes of too STRONG !! lol !!

The knuckleheads working the food court gave me 1 cookie instead of the 4 I ordered. When my girlfriend brought this to their attention by saying we ordered 4 and only got 1, they gave us 1 extra cookie. That‚Äôs 2 cookies. Please hire people who can do basic elementary school math in the future.

We drove 85 miles to get our monthly Costco provisions.  The store was clean and in order.  We needed hamburger, so of course we get it at Costco.  Friday at  1pm and  they had 4 packages left.  It looked fat and brown , so I asked the young wrapper if he could get me another package.  He told me to wait a minute.  Some guy came to the window with a major attitude and said he couldn't sell it until the test was done.  I get that, but stop with the attitude, you should have more than 4 packages of hamburger at 1 o'clock on a Friday.  I wasn't going to waste anymore of my time, so I took one from the counter.  Well, when we got home and cooked some of it, there was no way it was 12% or less fat.  Maybe Mr.Attitude should see what percentage of fat is actually in those tests.  I think we'll be shopping at a Costco a little bit farther from home.  It won't be a waste of time if I have to wait for hamburger now would it.
This Costco is very organized and there is not many lines to check out...

Court is a great employee with epic customer service skills. Please acknowledge his work ethic and kindness to customers! I usually don‚Äôt have a good experience at this Costco BUT today was completely different. Court helped us out at self checkout multiple times and overall made our shopping experience better. We will be back, thank you for hiring such a good employee.

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Costco, and I must say, it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The store's layout was organized and easy to navigate, making my shopping experience efficient and enjoyable.

One thing that stood out to me was the incredible variety of products available. From fresh produce to electronics to household essentials, Costco had everything I needed and more. The quality of the products was top-notch, and the prices were incredibly competitive, saving me money without compromising on quality.

The staff at Costco were friendly, knowledgeable, and always ready to assist. Whether it was helping me find a specific item or answering questions about membership benefits, they went above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction.

Another aspect I appreciated was the convenience of Costco's services, such as their pharmacy and optical center. It made it easy for me to take care of multiple errands in one trip, saving me time and hassle.

Overall, my experience at Costco was nothing short of fantastic. I highly recommend this store to anyone looking for a wide selection of high-quality products, great prices, and excellent customer service.

I love Costco in any state I've visited.  Love the quality fruit and meats. Just wished that they carried regular pork spare ribs in Ga as they do in Ca.. I don't care for baby back or St. Louis style ribs.

This Costco is always stocked with plentiful options. Being a vegan I am always happy when I locate good vegan items. That's what happens at this Costco. The associates are helpful and they have plenty of samples daily. The store is clean and easy to maneuver. Have on good walking shoes if you are there to shop and look around. The store is huge.

Quick service.   But Won't renew membership in June because:  1. They check ID at entrance 2. They check ID when you pay 3.  They check receipts when leaving.   For $60 year???  Not worth being treated like a criminal üòï

I'll try Sam's Club.

I always come to Costco when I'm in town visiting my family.  I find so much stuff to buy but can't put it all in my bags to bring it back home. Also, I got a chance to sample so many different products that I did buy a couple of them. They were great-tasting honey and popcorn.

We love Costo! It's just the cashier made us feel a type of way, I handed him my mothers executive card cause her hands were full, then he started questioning me on whose card it was very rudely saying if we don't have membership we would have to pay cash...card payments are for members only......we all had memberships he just assumed we didn't Its not that serious we wouldn't be in there if we didn't have memberships. Just ring my stuff up.

I'm liking Costco less and less when I go.  I use a wheelchair and need adequate space for the ramp on the side of my van.  Rarely is there a handicapped spot open, so have to park all the way at the end and take up two spots. I have 2 teenage sons that could easily run in and get what I need, but they aren't allowed to use my membership card.  Some rules need to have exceptions. Families should all be able to use one membership.

Very busy. Had a great deal on flowers and garden plants. Out of gloves again.
They need to extend their open hours. It's crazy to close at 6 pm on Saturday and Sunday. Especially standing full of customers

On our way to Savannah, we stopped here for gas and to use the restroom. We love Costco but it seems like they either had a special or there was nothing else to do in this town because everyone was at Costco on this particular day. There was a long line just to get to the parking lot. And inside, wow truly everyone was there. I decided not to get the iced coffee just to not wait forever to get coffee since we where on a road trip.

I have ordered car tires here at Costco and requested for appointment. They said we have to wait for tires to reach the store. I have waited for their phone call. The called me Friday and I requested for appointment. They said appointment not required and I can walk-in. After I get the car today at 10 am they said I have to wait in the queue and no ETA will be provided. I have been waiting for 3 hrs now. Still not taken for service. Those kind of service not expected for Costco. Very bad customer experience
Love Costco has the best selection of everything! Gas prices are great! Love the salmon! My go to to get fruits and veggies!

"It was good. I got some clothes. "
"It was awesome. It was busy and crowded but we got through the self checkout. There was one lady in the motorized wheelchair shopping cart combo and at some points she was cooking. Just zooming around. "
Practical Winter Treasures. The woman in your life will think of you every time she steps out of the shower. You thoughtful dog, you...

Costco is synonymous with both quality and affordability, making it a name you can trust. I have a deep appreciation for their products and the consistent quality they offer. Costco truly has everything one could desire, from fresh produce and fruits to bakery items, dairy products, meats, and a remarkable selection of wines. Personally, these are my regular purchases at Costco. Their food court, especially their classic hot dog combo with a regular-sized fountain drink for $1.50, has been a beloved favorite since the 1980s, reflecting their customer-oriented business philosophy.

I have been to this Costco for over 10 years and really enjoyed it before. However, I felt something is very different recently: employee has lots of attitude now. This attitude issue was used to be very rare, then quite often, and now very common. It started from the Customer Service, then cashier, and now everywhere... Yesterday, when I was checking out, the employee who was supposed to help with unloading/loading chose to ignore me but just stood there doing nothing. Of course I can do this by myself, but how about people need this help?  When I put most of the items on the counter, he suddenly told me "stop, leave them in the cart" very seriously, sounds like I did something wrong. Then he kept talking with the cashier while throwing all the scanned items back into cart, including bananas. Of course, the only thing he didn't throw back to the cart were eggs...  When I came to the lady at the gate who checks my receipt, I said "Hello" and smiled to her, well, she didn't answer but sighed... I remember it used to be "how are you", "thank you", or "have a great day" with smiling faces? what is going on at this Costco?

This Costco location poses significant challenges when it comes to accessing gas and leaving the parking lot, creating a rather chaotic experience. However, once inside, the store offers the expected array of products. While searching for a new lamp, I found a decent option. Despite the external chaos, the store itself provides an enjoyable shopping experience.
If you have a large family or use certain items often it is a great store to go to. They also have good prices on electronics, appliances, and office supplies.
When I visit the US, this is one of my favorite places. Very organized, great price on items and the food court is the best.

So got a executive card at Costco, my wife and I were excited as friends kept telling us how wonderful it is.

The prices are stupid high at Costco, their "discounts" aren't discounts. They just price everything high so they give a "discount"

Then the amount of people loitering around the store. We left our buggy there , got a full refund for our "executive card" and went back to Sam's and Walmart.

Hard pass...

Store is clean and organized. Prices seem to be better than average. Last week I bought tires and found the process easy and didn‚Äôt have to wait an excessive period of time. On the few occasions when I‚Äôve had to return an item they make it easy. So overall I am happy with Costco and plan to continue shopping here each week.

If you are a Costco member, then you definitely need to know about the business center located on Mount Zion Rd in McDonough, GA. There are only 17 business centers in the entire Costco system. We are so fortunate to have one in the Atlanta area.  This store is different from the retail Costco stores in that it caters to small businesses. This means they stock many items small businesses and restaurants use such as to go containers, beverages, paper products, a wide selection of meats.  Most items are sold in bulk so you may have to split them up and store them.  If you are willing to do this, there are huge savings to be found.  Come on out today and see what all the fuss is about!!
Costco means quality and good prices in their products  but this location is the best option for your business,the staff are very helpful and friendly very good customer service

This Costco is the hidden gem of the Atlanta area! I originally started coming here because they had gasoline and although we were disappointed that they do not have a food court, they have industrial restaurant supply and small business supply goods where other Costcos would have home goods. On the far side of the store they have most if not all of the same offerings of your normal Costco in terms of food- Refrigerated, frozen, and dry storage items. They also have many more drinks and snacks in bulk packaging in the middle section where you might find clothing at a different Costco.
This warehouse is amazing! All of the Cashiers are very attentive and treat the members like first priority!!! If you enjoy GREAT customer service then come to this place!

Just wanted to check it out and see if it was the same as a regular warehouse. They don't have a bakery or a meat section. No tire store. They have a gas station but didn't see a tire air pump. Sometimes I like to check out my tires on pressure. They are opening up a new warehouse on Thursday 11/16/2023 not to far away from this location. It has all the regular amenities.

The cashier at the Sandy Springs Costco humiliated me by throwing my membership card on the floor, and I had to pick it up myself, even though I'm 70 years old.
Here is the story: After scanning my purchases, the cashier began asking me for a donation. When he saw that I paid with food stamps, he handed me the receipt and didn't return my membership card. Instead, he immediately asked the next customer for a donation. Seeing that I was waiting for my membership card, he casually tossed it in my direction and turned away, without bothering to pick it up from the floor. I had to do it myself at 70 years old. What a humiliation. A copy of the receipt with the cashier's name and the date is attached.

Not sure when this changed but it doesn‚Äôt matter if your wife has a membership. Or if you are there with someone who has a membership. This location will not let you pay unless you also have a membership. Safe to say I will not be shopping at Costco anymore. It‚Äôs none of their business how I choose to pay for my groceries.

The customer service team is considerably rude as heck. They check IDs of whom they wish to check IDs for. Costco has apparently adopted this policy of checking your ID, 4 times before leaving the store. Oh don‚Äôt go to the self checkout as a black person. They are scanning your products for you then gone turn around and say you can scan your own product in the top of the basket. It‚Äôs just the most uncomfortable thing ever. I mean I come to shop in a satisfying way. But the way I felt when I left was the most uncomfortable feeling I had ever felt. I mean they are aggressive and mean and terrifying to approach sometimes. The management is no better. But I encountered a lady checking my ID but not the guy in front me of. But lies and say he showed me his ID as he was walking up to the self checkout.  Girl. You are lying. I was watching her. Because this is so common I‚Äôm sick of Costco and their customer service horrible attitude team members. I literally have had nothing but issues every single visit here. It seems NO ONE IS HAPPY TO BE THERE. They always YELLING ‚Äúthe policy‚Äù. ‚ÄúThe policy‚Äù. Literally that‚Äôs how you go out of business. Racist nonsense and policy nonsense. Sick of this location anyway.

As a black woman my visit to this location was particularly uncomfortable! My friends and I were intimidated by people threatening to run us over with buggies and outright looks of disgust of our presence in the store! I was born and raised in this city and have NEVER experienced such an uncomfortable situation. In 2024! I got the message, I won't be going back to Ash/Dunwoodyüò´
Love the Caesar salad! Lasts for days and just add some grilled chicken and you're ready to go! Would like more croutons!

I've visited Costcos all over the U.S. and Canada, and I can seriously say that we have never ever been disappointed.

This store was exceptionally clean. Very well stocked.

What more can I say, "We love Costco!"

Oh, don't come in here with a large motorhome or camper.  There is a large sign stating that you must be under 12 ft 3 inches to enter, and they have a large steel beam position over the road that I'm assuming is 12 ft 3 inches high.

It is a very convenient place to stop, fuel up (no problem with a travel trailer), pick up groceries, grab a snack, and get back out on the highway. Easy access in and out. The gas price was very welcome (relatively speaking) and appreciated.
A large and clean Costco. This location is also great between Savanna and Atlanta. We got some food and filled up the car for the long drive to Atlanta.

It is very large, corridors and corridors of all kinds of items.
We have found very good prices on kitchen things such as plates, cups, cutlery, pots, pans and some smaller appliances.
The area of ‚Äã‚Äãfresh food very well achieved, everything super clean and tidy.  I also have to highlight the fresh fish and seafood and its price, really very good and plenty of variety.
The staff is friendly.
Definitely a 10 in quality and price.

A very good store. Huge selection of items from ‚Äúsoup to nuts‚Äù and great prices. For now, they excel in their gas prices and excellent prices for their clothes. Unfortunately, for now, they don‚Äôt offer delivery or internet purchase service. And their Paris location is a bit far from the downtown metro area. However, accessing the store is doable (take the time to make yourself a specific list of items you are interested in if you want to make your visit there efficient
I‚Äôve been a member for many satisfying years of which I have never regretted. I‚Äôve saved a lot of money And used almost every one of their services, like car rental and travel benefits. Each item or service they offer is meticulously reviewed by their merchandisers before they are available to you. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about them. üòä

Costco in Sharpsburg is fabulous. We go there almost once a week which is pretty dangerous. Great service. I have lots of free samples. The parking lot is clean. The store is clean and the people are very helpful. Make sure you have your Costco card with a picture or if you have a Costco credit card you‚Äôll need a drivers ID to show at check out.
Always a great customer experience at Costco. The store is clean, well stocked, and offers an awesome variety of items. But, the staff seals the deal. They bend over backwards to help.

SAUL is phenomenal! He is so knowledgeable, smart and above all, friendly. He took the time to educate us on multiple TVs, explaining things I never would have known anything about. He‚Äôs brilliant and so awesome! Promote him now!

I was traveling through Georgia and had a tire on my tire go flat. Costco Tire Center worked me in on a very busy day and installed a new tire. They were very understanding to an out-of-state traveler.

It's been a while since I've had good customer service, clean restrooms, and a friendly staff all at the same place.  Costco upholding higher standards than most businesses and that's refreshing because it feels like that's a dying culture these days.  Good Job Costco and staff.

I would‚Äôve rated it five stars but for some reason they don‚Äôt keep WD-40 stocked‚Ä¶I thought that was a staple household item‚Ä¶ just kidding I reserve five stars for exceptional experiences. They really don‚Äôt sell WD-40 for some reason  It‚Äôs a new building so it is clean and the staff is friendly so far‚Ä¶

FYI they have a pretty good selection of vegan snacks available for purchase.

I took a few pictures, but it doesn't do the place justice. The variety easily rivals Sam's Club and BJs. The clothing section and the size of the size of the rotesaaire chicken. I brought my son with me, and he wanted something from the Cafe. The chocolate Sunday with a slice of pepperoni pizza. It was good. The sundae üç® was creamy smooth with the sweet üòã chocolate üç´ glaze on top, and the carmalization on that thin crust slice will fill you up. Each slice  $1.99 √ó 2 = 3.98 and each Sunday $2.49 √ó 2 = 4.98. The grand total with tax was $9.68. Their kiost system is definitely more efficient than Sam's Club relative to the customer volume, and it can get busy. Enjoy üòâ

Nice Clean store that is not to crowded. When checking out the cashier told my mom that all she had to do was to signed and the cash register will fill the rest out . Once my mom handed over the check the cashier said that they don‚Äôt take personal checks unless you have been a member for over a year. If this is true it should be stated on the policies that is posted at the cash register

I will never go back here again! Sams concept makes more sense. How do you not have scan guns for all of these bulk items. The inventory is mediocre as well. Then when I say I do not want to continue my purchase because now I have to pick all of these items up and scan them on the scanner, that‚Äôs when you offer to take me to customer service and ring me up! No, that is not good customer service. For your clerk to tell me they only consider sodas the ‚Äúbig‚Äù items and not these big bulky boxes of chips and snacks. All it wouldn‚Äôt taken was seconds to scan. This store is not set up for a person with a disability. My recommendation is to put scan guns at the check out or get like Sam‚Äôs and get scan and go!

It is so organized and it's so much on sale and they was cooking miso salmon over by the seafood department and I had to buy a box Thanks for dinner tonight
I am disabled so it was hard to walk you need some more riding carts please and thank you

I‚Äôve waited to post this review because I felt I may have been overreacting in the moment, but two weeks have past and I‚Äôm still upset with the behavior of a particular employee at this location. On 03/30/24, a supervisor (I believe her name was Michelle with the brownish-red curly hair) gave my family and I the most distasteful attitude during our visit once we made it to the check out area. We made it to the very front of the line and were asked to then move to the back of another line that wasn‚Äôt self check-out because we had full carts. I had large items at the bottom of my cart that she did not want to scan with the portable scanning gun. We had already waited in the checkout line for so long, so I immediately declined as we were already at the next available register and continued with our self check out. As we are checking out we were rudely talked about and shamed within earshot of us and all the other customers doing their self-checkouts. If I was not going to be allowed to check out in self check out an employee should have been making that obvious way before I made it to being the next person in line for a register. More importantly, the situation could have been handled more professionally and I could have been asked to move lines in a much more polite manner, but instead we were treated like trash and spoken to disrespectfully and I just wasn‚Äôt going to take that treatment. Together, we spent nearly $500 here for our family‚Äôs Easter weekend celebration, and I‚Äôm regretting the fact that I still gave the company my business that day when I should have just left the cart full of items and walked away. I hate to discontinue my membership with the company but my family and I will not tolerate such disrespectful behavior again.  Please do better Costco, and teach your employees to be better human beings.

I know is difficult to control but when you buy your products at Costco.. you are expecting the best, because in addition you are paying just to be able to goin in‚Ä¶.. so why I am paying for products with a lot of issues? Just yesterday I bought a salad that came with a bug surprise!! üò§ü§¢üò°

What can I say.. it's Costco ... I love everything about it. This location is my personal favorite. Even when it's packed, honestly it's never that difficult to find parking, and the parking lot is mostly easy to maneuver. When the lines are long at checkout, they move quickly and efficiently, and if you go through self checkout it takes mere minutes to get through. I believe it says a lot about a company when the employees stay on, and I've seen the same people working here for years and years.  Customer service is great, everyone is helpful, Costco is life üôå

Our go-to Costco now for the last 4 years. Always well-stocked & great service. Consistently fresh produce, great meat quality way above local grocery stores, tasty take+cook prepped meals. Weekday evenings are the best time to avoid the crowds. Woodstock location is pretty good, but only as backup as produce & meat selection can be hit or miss.

They have everything. Unfortunately, the line was one you have to tag team or you'll be there forever!
That being said, the customers and employees were all super nice! Had fun in line meeting people and talking about their dogs.
Shout out to Riley, the miniature, apricot golden doodle and his daddy, and Micheal in the speedy motorized cart! üòÅ
Seriously, Costco is way better than Sam's. Chickens are better at Sam's though. Pizza is great!

Costco is a way of LIFE! And this Costco has not only an incredible selection, but amazing and friendly customer service. Fantastic bulk prices and quality goods of all brands/types. We go every 2 weeks (sometimes more!) and look forward to every visit!

It's a  busy place.
The fruits a bit pressure than what you will find at Walmart. And/or b j's the price is a little higher. They say it's for the quality and some of the products. I just don't see it. I see similar to similar, accept the pricing

They have got about anything you need. I went with my brother and niece and bought a few things. It's a great place to go for families with it being a bulk item type store. Good bargains all around like the Cara Cara Oranges I got 5lb bag for 5.99. They are some of the best oranges I've ever ate and that is a very good price. A 20oz pack of Buffalo (Bison) which I love, two packs joined together for 40oz actually for quite a good price. A great place to go.

My family just got treated like criminals at your establishment. We checked out with your staff spending close to $700 which is typical for us since we have been executive members since 2018. This was our first experience at Woodstock Costco. We are in line to leave the store and the lady who looks over receipts is glancing at everyone's shopping cart signing off... until it was our turn. Keep in mind we have a lot of stuff. She goes through each item individually and found 1 out of 4 egg cartons was not ringed up properly. The approach was pretty unprofessional. Its not my fault that your team missed an item. It's literally 1% of what I purchased. There is a massive line behind me and people watching as My family including our newborn son is being held because of a carton of eggs. Anyways she forced me to leave my family and says I have to go to the tire center to pay for the eggs. I'm definitely not happy at this point. The guy at the tire center could tell as I'm standing in line. He was the only person in this scenario who showed any empathy. Turns out the lady sent me to the wrong location. I was suppose to go to the other side of the aisle where a lady was standing by some tires. Now this small petite blond woman seemed to continue the vibe of the lady at the door and treated me like I was trash. She said "I was standing here the whole time" and continued to give me "stink eye" the entire time. Finally were done here she begrudgingly gives me my receipt and I go on my way back to Lady #1 who of course once again checks my receipt to make sure I didn't steal the eggs. My $700 purchase made me back 2% and my credit card I used made me an additional 1.5%. I made $24.50 on this transaction with Costco. Why would I steal a $7 egg carton....? My family has probably spent close to $50k since 2018 at your store. Now the wife and I embarrassed by the way we were treated will probably never come back to your establishment.
I absolutely love Costco. We go here weekly for our groceries and our executive members. I wholeheartedly recommend Costco. You will save money and their products are better than brand-name products.
Great deals and excellent service.  I was very pleased to see the staff so pleasant and helpful even during the holiday rush.  Grandma got a massage, too.  She went from irritated to delighted.

Before I travel, I always save Costco's location on Google Maps and go on a trip.
Food needed for a trailer trip and a temporary day stay and refueling in an emergency.

I come here about 4 times a year, and the layout of the here is very unique , so it always feels different.

The meat counter is at the entrance. Anyway, it's a very different structure, so compare it.

As always, $5.99 roast chicken and hot dog pizza are really cost-effective.
So We love Costco !!!
I was looking for Boursin, surprised to see they don‚Äôt carry  it ‚òπÔ∏è

This store is always wonderful I usually find what I need and the store is clean and well kept. On several visits with my service dog I have been refrained from entering. My service dog can not be away from me as I do need him for medical reasons. I have been harassed by the staff when entering several times. This dog is 5lb. Has to be on my hip near me in a small sling on my side. He doesn‚Äôt make a sound and does his job all the time. Again never touches the ground, carts or anything. They have asked me my medical condition which is not ok. It‚Äôs absolutely not their business. After speaking with a floor manager they assured me it was ok. This has happened 4 times so just a warning to people that have a medically necessary service dog be prepared to be harassed.
Their cage free eggs are clearly caged as pictured, and that's convenient compared to the alternative.

We stopped here to pick up our new membership cards. I signed up online. You go to the membership desk to have your picture taken which is displayed on your new card print out. Armando at the membership desk was great, very friendly, knowledgeable, efficent and attentive. He really made us feel welcomed and appreciated as new members. The interior was neat, clean and organized. There was an abundance of variety of merchandice. The prices were vwer discounted. Other depts are Tires, Eye Exams, Eyeglasses,  Pharmacy, gas station, cafe. We ordered their hot dog snd drink for $1.50. It was delish. Parking is free with handicap access. You probably need to get there at 10am opening. The busiest day is coupon Wednesdays.

I am a big fan of Costco.  We shop there regularly.   When I get several items, I ask to have most of it in boxes.  Today was the same, but when I told the clerk I wanted in boxes, she got an instant attitude and maintained that attitude for the duration of my transaction.  I thought the customer was always right.  I wasn't belligerent in my request.  I don't understand the attitude.  I expect better.

Not so packed and in & out. Always stocked and the food(pizza, etc.)is OK. Not the greatest, they can do better but OK. Employees are friendly. Parking is hard to find. I have leg problems due to my diabetes and sometimes I park further from the building due to no parking. I'll just have my daughter drop me off and pick me up from the front due to not finding a parking up close.

Not a fan. Too busy, none of the aisles are marked and the store is disorganized, making it difficult to find what you're looking for. I usually leave with only half of what I went to get because of the above reasons. I don't get the appeal of this "wholesale" club at all. The checkout lines are also way too long. They need more cashiers and a way to organize the endless lines. This is all on a weekday in the morning when I was told to go by others. I wish there were BJ's Wholesale Clubs around here. At BJ's, prices are better, aisles are organized, lines are shorter and there's usually plenty of staff working. I'm new to Costco but I doubt I'll be renewing my membership.

Warehouse is always clean. Staff is handfull. The reason it's missing one star is the staff at the gas station could do a better job. At rush hour, they should let the waiting driver know that there's a pump available hidden by the driver right in front

This Costco is so busy.  Plan accordingly.   Parking is hard to find.  The gas line can also be super long they could add 50 more pumps and it would still be packed.

Over all this location for what it has is great.  Staff has always been helpful.

They also have a lot of samples on weekends but being as packed as it is it‚Äôs hard to fight the crowd.  I have had older people cut in front and push my sons out of the way who were waiting patiently.

Aisles are clear, produce area always packed with fresh produce.   Meats are also plentiful unless it‚Äôs The Big Game weekend and any other holiday so go a few days early.

Also the Strawberry ice cream is really good from the snack bar.

All in all pretty good location.

Typical Costco location with everything you would expect in a Costco. The shopping experience was smooth and the receipt checker greeted us with a smile. She‚Äôs the friendliest lady ever. Best service in a Costco location that I had!

Domenica was the most helpful, sweet and knowledgeable customer service employee I‚Äôve encountered all year! We bought our membership online and came in to get our cards. She was truly wonderful and made our experience in this hectic store great!
Store was clean and employees were friendly. The only negative is they need more parking but in a growing city this big it‚Äôs to be expected.

Prices have escalated greatly in the last 3 years.  Certain terrific items are not available elsewhere ... eg, Killer Bread, 4-Bean Salad, and ready to eat HOT whole chicken for $5 (though HALF the size of 2 years ago).

I'd be careful with the gas at the Twin Falls location.  After filling up soon after had a service engine light. Ran about two thirds of the tank out during the trip and filled up at Loves and the light went out. Believe it was just some bad gas because I haven't had a recurrence.

If you haven‚Äôt enjoyed a visit to a Costco Business Center, you‚Äôre missing out! It‚Äôs similar, but different to a regular Costco. First thing I noticed was how quiet it was. There were no forklifts in the background. There were no demo ladies handing out samples. No one was trying to sell upgrades or whatever other items get pushed at regular Costco‚Äôs. I assume it‚Äôs because the business center crowd are shopping for what they need on a weekly(daily?) basis and are already taking advantage of the executive savings. It wasn‚Äôt as busy as a normal Costco, which made moving through the aisles a breeze. The employees seemed happy and were very helpful. One cashier saw I was buying pull-ups and offered some great advice for potty training my three year old son! Absolutely loved my experience!
Never been in a Costco Bus. Center is a very good place for a restaurant supply, food , etc...wow

Nice and clean store. Great variety of items. Friendly staff, answered our questions about items they have in stock. We are from out of town and stopped at this location on our way home, because it's conveniently located right off I-15. The liquor section is almost non-existent, except one vodka kind, white claw, one or two wine selections and some beer. It's a business center, so I guess they have more household items. Overall we enjoyed shopping there. Found a nice garden hose and some snacks for the kids. We were there on a Saturday at 11 am and it was pretty empty inside, no lines, good time to shop.

Price gouging at its highest and finest!!!
The meat department has gotten out of control with their pricing!!! They name their own price on daily basis!!! Who has given these people mess up our economy like this??? Everyday, they have a different price for boxes of chicken and ground beef!!!! And their greed is never ending!!! Enough of this price gouging already!!

The gas station was terrible. Sure you have the option of 87 or 91 gasoline to choose from, the usual. But there is NO TRASH bins anywhere. And guess what else, the last stall to the right (the East end) has a tiny/tight area to pull out from. Turn carefully or else you'll scratch your car. I refused to pull all the way up to that one, but it seems like the guy that came up was a pro and used to it. Kudos to him. I'm just a visitor.

I had not been in a Costco for at least 15 years. Decided to go get a membership.. and it was the best decision ever! The employees are absolutely friendly, fast and knowledgeable! The store was super clean and organized. The prices remind me of the 90s.. inexpensive. You get double there for the same price you would pay elsewhere! The selection of goods is amazing. The coupon book has actual items people would need or want with excellent discounts. And if you are a prepper.. get there now they have everything you will need, including generators at a steal price! If I had the $$ I would have bought one!

I was visiting this Costco and never have been disrespected so much in my life. Me and my two friends were in the line and this cashier felt the need to ask us if we had EBT and if we did his line was not open to EBT. The funny thing is all three of us make over 300k a year and we had no food items only alcohol and water floats I didn't know you can buy those items with EBT bc we don't use that .

The Costco Wholesale warehouse in Reno, Nevada i visited 2 weeks ago seem to be empty compared to the really crowded with bustling activity of the Costco warehouse i visited in Fort Worth, Texas. Could it be that most of the people are in the Casino? Anyway, i enjoyed my shopping.

So glad to have come back to Costco after all these years Customer service was above and beyond very friendly so far very glad to have gone back to there from the other... Dealt with a gentleman by the name of Parker could not have been anymore polite and helpful. Just went back 4 gas ‚õΩÔ∏è, always a better deal than anywhere else n town...
Stopped in to get a few items while we were in town. A non-union establishment (a +) and we did not encounter rude, condescending or incompetent staff reported by other reviewers.

Took my Corvette to Costco Tire Center on St. Rose Parkway for the mounting of 4 new Michelin tires purchased through Costco.  They did an excellent job.  They were very careful and knew that the Corvette requires special 'pucks' for their lifts so that the frame and fiberglass doesn't get damaged.

The tires were perfectly balanced and mounted with zero damage to my wheels.  I have used them to purchase and mount for several of my cars in the past and never had any problem.

This costco is a well-oiled machine.
Nicely designed and the employees are fast and efficient.
The newly expanded gas station ‚õΩÔ∏è is really big. They added over 10-20 pumps a few months ago. I never have to wait in line anymore.
My only complaint is....getting in and out of the shopping center area where this costco is located can be difficult during peak hours.
There are two air pumps for your tires near the auto center for you to use.

It‚Äôs your standard Costco they do have fresh sushi which is new for me. But the parking lot is absolutely horrible. In the way out is reversed compared to other Costco I‚Äôve been to. I can‚Äôt put that on them. Gotta do what you Gotta do. I felt some of the employees were lackadaisical and we just walk in front of your cart. They didn‚Äôt really care. I almost wiped one out. It was pretty funny, I don‚Äôt think you wanna get ran over by a cart full of six cases of water. It was probably one of the fastest food courts I‚Äôve ever been to. I had my hotdog and a drink in less than 30 seconds and out the door that was great. I don‚Äôt know if there is better times to go but I went on a Friday at 5 o‚Äôclock maybe that was a poor decision on my part all around it‚Äôs a standard Costco nothing over the top

Costco is my go to for so many items! We buy our toilet paper, paper towels, garbage bags, Saran wrap, choice meat, chicken, salmon, tuna, various other pieces of fish, all cheese's in bulk, crackers, frozen fruit, lemon juice, shop towels, clothes, socks, gym shoes, underwear, plants, apple products, Seltzer water, bai, frozen veggies, frozen pizza, our glasses..... seriously so many things are a better price than grocery stores! Then we get a percentage of cash back on our purchases that adds up to additional savings. Oh and we get our gas here as well! I highly recommend Costco. The service is always great, the employees are always kind and efficient. You can tell Costco takes care of the employees! Great store!

This is one of the newer Costco locations and is extra clean and professional. It's kind of on the edge of town, so less of that cramped sardine effect, but certainly still can get crowded. Gas is noticeably cheaper here.

I called in for pizza and they said they didn't have my name down so I told them I will wait. They said 15 minutes. It's been 40 minutes and I haven't got my order yet. Am 224 and now they are on 400s. I usually love Costco but I can see the lady wasn't haven't it. She keep having attitude with others and I can hear customers say "wow". I have 3 very young kids that's why I called in to order.

I have many reasons to dread coming in here most of them being customers. Virtually every time I've come in there's a guy walking around staring at naked pics of clearly not his wife who's walking in front of him, another guy opening a  product per isle and taking a bite to put it back, or my favorite the amount of people who park in the middle of an isle on speakerphone. As for the actual store they wouldn't let me use my husband's card because I couldn't find mine and I didn't find out till I'd finished an hour of shopping. Sticky floors and cashiers that are the spectrum of rudeness to only nods once to flirts with your husband then scoffs in your face. I literally use this as a last resort.

As a veteran, I applied and got hired. Throughout the first week, they emphasized on speed but kept pulling me from station to station to station causing me to not really learn the pace of the store at all. "Work with this person and follow what they do, ask what they need help with" further increasing me no opportunity to really pace myself. Being a shadow of another person makes you work slower obviously, you're learning and being taught. The one moment i did get a task to myself it was to swap 3 products from 2 different isles. I managed to complete it in 15 minutes, they then told me it should have taken 10 minutes and the speed is too slow.
The speed they were looking for was to throw boxes of products everywhere and destroy the boxes while shoving products behind others or even under or above to make it look "Full". Upon inspecting the store, there is many broken boards, items, products and produce everywhere shoved in places out of view. The goal they really gave off was quantity over quality. They expected the speed of someone who has been working there for a long while from a person there for 12 days,  it wasn't  the "Costco Standard". I was pulled in front of everyone by Jack and announced for me to go to the office half way through the shift. Not a very professional way of letting off a person.

They over order and shove the fridge/freezer with the items. They take out every pallet they have in the store blocking walking space and have frozen and refrigerated items sitting out from open 4am untill the last 30 minutes from opening which is around 10am. Items that can't be filled are still brought out  and sit untill opening to further make walking difficult.

There are two Costcos in the Reno-Sparks area, and they are about the same distance away from my home, but I much prefer this one. It is better organized, generally less-crowded, and the parking lot is generous.  There is almost never a wait for the air refill stations, and the gas lines are rarely bad. Overall, a much better experience than the downtown location.
I bought some of the hot cooked ribs, and they were really chewy. I think you need to adjust your temperatures and times for this altitude.

I absolutely love this store! Most especially at this location. Is always clean and the workers are helpful and polite. This store carries the freshest produce and unique product finds. They have great sales, good fast food at an affordable price and many vendors to choose from for your home improvement needs. It is conveniently located in a shopping center where you can get all your shopping needs done as well.

Love Costco! I have the Citibank card and membership with Costco. The prices are great if you shop wisely. The check you get back each year more than covers your membership . The roasted chicken for $5 is a great price and so is the food, court it can't be beat. Some of the items we purchase: All of our seafood, all meat as it's all choice. We buy it in bulk and separate it and freeze it in smaller containers. We buy our cheese, frozen fruit, yogurt, seltzer water, soap, olive oil, tuna, walnuts, almonds, just to name a few things. They sometimes have great specials on shoes and clothes. The only reason I am giving them four stars in summerlin is they need to build another one in the area. It's way too crowded every time I come here!!! No parking and long lines. Costco build another Costco! The pictures I'm attaching were just when it opened as I was one of the first in line.

Except for the over crowded parking its the better option for big-box stores. I have price compared Costco and Sam's Club. Costco is cheaper overall. However, I much prefer the store brand TP from Sam's. But if free samples is your kick, Costco is definitely the place to head to. Each store has their own set of products they carry, so we shop both. Overall however, when I shop, Sam's always seems to have much better parking options for a large truck.
It was busy because of weekend & Christmas shopping! Packed! You cannot beat the price!

I am soo disappointment today I went to ask one of the workers I can just ground my coffee she told me let me ask my supervisor if you don‚Äôt buy it here you cannot do it
So she went and check in the computer and she told me with really rude attitude like she don‚Äôt want to be there she said no  you don‚Äôt buy this coffee here you need to get out of here with that coffeeü•π She said she was a supervisor her name is Brandy   I told her you don‚Äôt have to be rude. I need to buy my grocery  but I feel so miss treated ü§¨. I asked her if I can talk to the manager and she says of course
So the manager came, his name is Aaron another rude person he says well she told me what happened. She said she don‚Äôt say that. Ok I said that is what she told me.
Basically  She kicked me out of the store because I asked her if I can just ground my coffee. Both of them, they‚Äôre very rude. I cannot believe it. The customer service that they give. I always go to this store Every week .  and this is the way I‚Äôve been traded  I told him I spend a lot of money here every week.. and he just make a face saying so ‚Äò‚Äúthanks ‚Äúunbelievableü§¨ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨
They don‚Äôt realize that because of the customers they got a paycheck ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨

Who is not a fan of this huge cookie!!! Incredible taste, quick service and awesome food from the food court, and only 1,50 for the Hot-Dog.

You‚Äôll find anything you want, and this cheesecake at the bakery, taste incredible!!

What not to love about Costco! They got everything you need and don‚Äôt need! Never go to the store hungry because everything looks good and yummy! Definitely worth the membership! Plenty of parking. Sometimes theres already a line  right before the store opens. Consistently good cakes with good price! Don‚Äôt forget to stop by and get something to at the food court. Hotdogs, pizza and more!

Generally the best gas prices from the Canadian border to NH for members.

Great Costco prices and selection in the store. Good court had something we don't have in Canada called a Chicken üêî Bake üçû.. glad I tried it but never again. It was terrible to me but I can see why people could like it.

Gave it 3/5 because Costco is generally amazing. My last couple of visits here I have been less than impressed. Normally Costco is well organized, employees keep it moving, cashier's are quick and efficient, well stocked. Last few visits, employees standing around chit chatting, cashier's moving slower than I've ever seen, lines taking much longer and reaching further back in the store. My trips take twice as long now easily. The final straw was being told our pizza would take 15 minutes and after 20 minutes of waiting, I checked in and was told they forgot about it. Just really put a damper on an already sour trip at what is normally a fantastic store (this location and all others I've been to). Maybe it's just been a off few months? Not sure but starting to feel frustrated to say the least.

Good place to buy volume. However, not everything is cheapest there. They do have a very good optometrist  shop there.  Hands down the best place to buy eyeglasses.  Also, the roasted chickens are good, big, and inexpensive. The same goes for the pumpkin pie. I really like the pumpkin pie!

You can't go wrong with costco. this place usually has friendly staff and it's a lot easier to navigate compared to Iwilei costco.

but this review is regarding something different because I just found my new favorite place to order sushi party platters of all things. great sushi for good prices. it's especially better than some other sushi places that overcharge sushi when their fish is frozen.

It's hard to rate this Costco. If you go when it's busy, it's horrible. The parking is not a typical Costco lot (stalls are small and the flow of traffic can be a nightmare) but on the flip side, it's usually slower than the other Costcos on the island. When you go during show times, it's awesome. Not many Costcos are literally surrounded by water either.
Spacious, well-stocked, not crowded. Lovely!
A great place to shop in bulk.  While on your shopping break, enjoy affordable lunch items like a hot dog, chicken ceasar salad and a bottomless fountain drink at the outside snack bar.

It was absolutely divine good looking office sweet team wonderful thoughtful pricing I was amazed I had 5 teeth pulled hardly felt anything
And they were all concerned every step of the way. wow!!

This store is nuts, the busiest in the US apparently. Weekdays seem to be the best time to go, but they are always stocked and the service is great, so can't complain too much. You're not going to find better deals in the island, that's for sure. The $60 membership paid for itself after the first visit.

Visiting Honolulu, first time I've seen the ability to buy 15 dozen eggs, and a pizza line at Costco.

Special thanks to Hoku in the Deli department as she had assisted my wife and I with an issue as the romaine lettuce here is a hot commodity.

All the Aloha shirts. So many prints to choose from
Also regular,organic and apple bananas! So yummy. The shoyu poke was fresh and delicious. Parking was a hassle, even on a Thursday at noon. But had all the things I needed.

Friendly, efficient check-out counter staff.  They move customers in and out of their facility in record-breaking, timely manner.  And, all the customer needs to do is have their check-list of items handy, move to those known product pick-up spots, and zoom along from one location to another.  And, before you know it, you're out the door and on your way.   And, even on those very busy days, with a little bit of patience (and luck), that illusive, coveted, prime parking spot (and all you need is one slot) usually becomes available.  At least, that's my experience.

My Time-Tested Costco Wholesale "Parking Lot Sweep"
My strategy for securing fast parking.  Sorry (I played high school football).  It's football season.  I couldn't resist. So, ready?  Here goes.  Is your helmet secure, shoulders pads firmly tied down and mouth piece in place?  Ready, set, hut ... for the Costco Wholesale "Parking Lot Sweep." Now, first you've stayed away from Dillingham Boulevard.  It's a mess out there with rail construction.  Forget the Mauka (mountain-side) approach.  Instead, charge Costco from Nimitiz Highway, right?  Your BEST BET (I believe) is the Makai (ocean side) approach. Thank you for the wait.

My "Costco Wholesale Parking Lot Sweep" Images Are Now Posted.  So, for me at least, my fully tested "true and tried" "Costco Parking Lot Sweep" always yields my strategic outcome.  To date, I have always found my one needed spot on every parking foray.  So similarly, to YOU my reader, may "the sweep" be with you!!!

NOW, I also have my carefully developed priorities list of "healthy foods and drinks".  For me at least, they have those "body nourishing special foods and accompanying drinks." IF you look carefully for them.  The fruits (on my list) include avacados, bananas, blueberries (fresh and frozen), raisins (and grapes), kiwifruits (chock full of vitamin C).  (NOTE: PLEASE SEE my POB 1 post for more details).  They have eggs, milk (2%), juices (orange and POG), whole wheat breads and green vegetables (like spinach, broccoli, and potatos).  They have peanut butter and jams (strawberry is my favorite).  And, their's is a wide selection of red wines.  Mind you, this is my very personal list (after consultation with my doctors and nurses as well as internet and YouTube sources) of what I personally believe are the healthiest foods.

Oh yes.  And, there is Kirkland 100 % Columbian dark roast coffee.  I love the rich flavor.  It remains my favorite.

And, I'm still getting acquainted with the variety of Extra Virgin Olive Oil (in dark glass bottles with .5 % maximum acidity) from the Mediterranean (Kirkland's Toscano P.G.I from Tuscany, Italy) and .3% maximum acidity Kirkland's California Cuyana Valley, Fall 2022 harvest.  A CAUTIONARY NOTE:  There are fraudulent, or diluted olive oils on the market.  (Here, I'm still on my learning curve).  I need patience.  Please see my latest posts on these developments.

SO, PLEASE CAREFULLY read the labels (harvest in fall, harvest location (one locale?), production methods, expiration dates, maximimum acidity, .5%, .3% etc, if available).  They should be on your olive oil containers, which should be bottled in dark glass.  These are the current standards that I know.

To your health!!!

It's a madhouse, reportedly the busiest Costco in the world. Classically professional and friendly employees. Loved the local flair: the best deals on local Hawaiian liquor (right by the cheese/chiller area), a broad selection of aloha shirts and chocolate macadamias, plus more Asian-inspired food options than I've seen at other locations.

Easy to get to -- it's at the very last exit on the west end of the H1 freeway and very close to Aulani and the Ko'olina (west end) resort area. Why should you come here? You'll find the best prices on quality Hawaiian island shirts. These aren't the cheapo shirts like the swap meet, but Costco quality at a great Costco price. You'll also find a lot of other Hawaiian island gifts here.

The staff are very helpful, as each costo is set ip differently and this being the first time going to this location, I inquired when entering where to locate a couple of items.  It is not as crowded as other locations, which was nice too.  The store is clean also.  Having the gas station in the same parking lot is nice, too, especially with so much traffic in the area.  The gas station, even though there were two pumps per lane, had fewer cars, and the waiting time to fill gas was only about 5 minutes.

Stopped in to get gas while on Oahu. Cheapest in town, as usual. The lines were long but they moved pretty fast. Always easy at Costco.  And always the same,  no matter which one you go to in the U.S. Super consistent.

Convenient, but busy. Off hours are not bad, but go in the earlier part of the day when items are plentiful. (They do run out of some items)
Gas lines are not as busy M-F during the day when most are working.

For the food court only, we kinda went back in time recently, if you just want a slice of pizza, you have to order at the self service kiosks‚Ä¶ and then wait in line to hand them the physical receipt from the kiosk, to process your order after you‚Äôve already paid‚Ä¶ making the whole number system on the receipt irrelevant. If you don‚Äôt, you‚Äôll wait forever. It‚Äôs just really a weird process, considering before you could order at the kiosk, and then they would call your number when it‚Äôs ready. Judging by all the signage, that‚Äôs how they how they want to do it now, but it‚Äôs just weird. If I order at the kiosk at McDonald‚Äôs, it‚Äôs in their system, the order will get pulled whether I‚Äôm there or not, since I already paid for it. You still get your order in a timely fashion, it‚Äôs just a weird extra step you have to do, for seemingly no other purpose, other then their ticket machine is temporarily down, which it‚Äôs not. They chose to run it like this. Very weird, and other customers were just as confused as I was at first. Kinda just confused at how this would make everything ‚Äúeasier‚Äù. Other then that staff is nice and still a good experience, system is just weird now.

Costco is ALWAYS very busy @ this location. Adequate parking, but very tight. Always lots of demos going on & samples. Decent prices..some stuff seems on the higher side compared to the mainland but that's typical of the island as everything has to be shipped here. Clothes section is definitely lacking and not the same as mainland Costcos. Lots of beach gear...such as beach chairs, umbrellas, sarongs, coolers and much, much more. Has an AWESOME liquor selection üëåüòé food pavilion is located outside, to the right of the main entrance of the store. Meat section of the store has great options and is locally sourced.

This is one of the Coolest experiences in Hawaii!

Definitely a must do.

They have ready made sushi to go on the inside of the store, and they also have their food court OUTSIDE! UNBELIEVABLE! You can literally sit and eat your slice of pizza while watching traffic with a beautiful view of the mountains

Seriously, visit Costco. It's worth it

Always fun to find a few items that are not on the main land. We got guava danishes, Hawaiian shirts (a lot of them), hawaian grown pineapple and apple bananas. I have included a few pics of other unique items.

The prices here are comparable to those on the mainland in Southern California.   Keep in mind that California has some of the highest tax rates in the country.  It is worth being a member just for the gas prices.

The best deal is the roasted chicken for $4.99!  Surprised it is not more crowded.

Costco is a must-stop.

We were here in May and went straight to Costco after getting our rental.

Always check your rental car tires and adjust air as needed at Costco.

We got sushi, which was pretty good for Costco sushi.

They have the reef safe sunscreen if you don‚Äôt want to buy and take with you.

Great spot to grab gifts to take back home like chocolates, cookies, nuts, Hawaiian shirts, etc.

I did a lot of Costco shopping today. I needed everything. Good prices. They didn't have tomatoes, carrots and avocadoes and only the small sized box milk. Otherwise, I found all the rest that I needed.

Costco saves us big time. Good food and supplies at great discounted prices. Dave on gas, too!  We got most of what we needed. Smaller quality items we go to other stores. Food court is great place to eat for a very cheap price. Enjoy your shopping there and save money, too!

Please send your floor managers one more time for customer service training! Time after time I see your floor managers very rude discourteous to customers it‚Äôs seems like they are giving favor just to speak with customers & bc of management behavior your few cashiers become rude as well! So sad.
