BUT absolutely I love Costco & I wish Kona store should have more varieties like mainland along with good samples.
Mahalo!

Love Costco!  The hot food kiosk is consistent in price and quality in all locations: Hot dog + drink is $1.50; and pizza slice is $1.99.  It also has some local specialty such as mango smoothies in Hawaii.  Our first stop after leaving the airport.

The warehouse is clean with friendly and helpful employees. There are some good local items that we can buy to bring home for souvenirs.

author_name: Maly Romero - Discover The Big Island Real Estate
text:
I Love Coming to Costco!

I have been a member of Costco for years, and this is where we do 80%of our grocery shopping. This particular Costco in Kailua Kona is frequently visited by locals and tourists. Because this is the only costco on the island, people from all over come here one a week or bi weekly to get their groceries. Keep in mind that the weekends you may experience heavy traffic! Just be prepared.

First and foremost, the staff at this location are incredibly friendly and helpful. They truly embody the "Aloha Spirit," making our shopping experience all the more enjoyable. Whenever we need assistance or have questions about any products, they are always available and eager to help.

One of the things we love most about this Costco is the great selection of local favorites. They consistently have a fantastic assortment of new, unique, and innovative products available, and we never fail to discover something new each time we visit. Additionally, their inventory is always well-stocked with beach gear, making it our go-to spot for all our beach essentials! This is where we shop for nuts to give to our family as gifts. They also carry local restaurant gift cards to Umekes or macaroni and grill at a discounted price.

At this Costco, you can find everything you need at unbeatable prices, and that includes gas! With a gas station conveniently located nearby, it's easy to fill up our vehicle while also stocking up on groceries, housewares, and beyond.

We also appreciate the concession area in the front of the store, perfect for grabbing a quick and delicious snack after a day full of shopping. It's another perk that makes this location stand out from the rest.

I cannot recommend the Costco in Kailua Kona enough. Its friendly staff, variety of products, beach gear selection, and top-notch customer experience make it an outstanding place to shop, and we always look forward to our next visit. Give it a try, and I'm confident you'll love it just as much as we do!

Love that there is a Costco on all of the main Hawaiian islands.  Thankfully this one is located in Kona and not in Hilo (in Hilo just go to Cost.U.Less).  You can find local Hawaiian gifts only available in the Hawaiian Costcos ie 100% Hawaiian coffee, 100% Hawaiian Peaberry Coffee, chocolate covered macadamia nuts, 100% Kona coffee, beach equipment, amazing flower bouquets, etc at great prices.

But remember to look at quantity limits (per day) when buying if getting gifts so you're not trying to buy over limit in a single day.

The macadamia nuts, chocolate covered or otherwise, sold here are HUGE, super tasty!

They have all sorts of dried seafood snacks, fresh seaweed salad, kimchi imported from Korea, Japan, Taiwan, Thailand, etc.

DON'T BUY CUT FRUIT (papayas, pineapples, mangos) at Costco.  The local Farmer's Market or KTA Superstores carry local Hawaiian grown produce which is MUCH TASTIER and SWEETER than Costco's.

Definitely buy the 24 slice La Tour Bakery raisin bread, it is so good on its own, buttered, jammed, for sandwiches or French toast.  It's only sold in the Hawaiian islands. How good is it?  An entire floor to top section was full of this bread 3 days ago, today there was 4 left.  We bought 2 to take back to the mainland!

Checkout lines are super long as EVERYONE including tourists shop here.  The Costco food court wait is just unbelievable, like an hour wait.

A MUST shopping destination for those staying a week+.

I love Costco and this location is no exception. I always enjoy seeing what unique merchandise or menu items are carried at different stores. Had to order the strawberry soft serve on my way out because my home store only has vanilla!

I went to Costco at around Christmas time and I saw these lovely gems. If you‚Äôre looking for Disney themed Christmas decorations at around Christmas time Costco definitely one of the places to go so worth it.

Costco in the states doesn't offer the Cinnamon rolls in the box. They sure were good in Maui.  It was nice sitting on the patio in the morning with a cup of coffee and a half of roll. Yummmm! Update, just got a box at North Costco in Plano, Tx Costco at Tollway.

This needs to be your first stop in Maui! We landed and immediately went here to get some essentials. We grabbed lunch for $23 for all six of us! Then we headed inside to get some water, snacks for the kids, sunscreen, and food.
The parking lot was packed but we expected to see that. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The location was clean and up to my standards.
Make sure you have enough room in your car!

This is my primary "go to" shopping location for groceries and supplies whenever l'm visiting Maui. It is conveniently located close by to OGG airport, so upon arrival, it is a quick 5 minutes drive to be able to stock up on groceries and supplies. The pricing is identical to Costcos on the mainland. All aisles are very tidy and organized, and items are very well stocked.üëç

It was about what you expect from Costco with a few issues. Have visited on other occasions and would have given it five stars then. Today store was packed. Upon entering the door greeter didn't realize I was following my husband who showed membership. The experience felt uncomfortable. They also don't have cart wipes, even if you ask. I pay enough for membership that I think they can provide wipes.  Same day Target, Walmart and two other local stores did.
Store was very disorganized with several isles blocked. You couldn't find staff to help anywhere. Expect more at Costco. Curious about why this store changed so much.  Even the pizza had issues today.
Great place to stock up on stuff for your stay on the island. Sushi selection is good and priced well.

Costco is such a necessary place to shop if you live in Hawaii. They have the best parking lots on the island and the carts are clean, undamaged and easy to maneuver. The Waipio location is always packed, but more often than not they have what we are looking for in stock. The associates are typically friendly and willing to assist when needed.

Living in a small one bedroom, we don't have much space for purchasing big bulk items, but it is always a good place to pick up roast chicken, milk, and eggs. They are cheaper than anywhere else, and we often do pick up other items that dont petish faster than we can consume. On this side of the island has the cheapest in the neighborhood. Sometimes, the lines are long, but they move pretty fast.

We shop at Costco several times a month for our staples and also for seasonal foods and items we can only get from Costco at certain times of the year.  If you have the storage space and enough people in your family to warrant bulk shopping then warehouse buying is usually the way to go.  Most of the time Costco's every day prices are cheaper than even the sale prices at the markets and department stores.

You can also purchase gasoline there at a huge savings over a gas station and they also have a tire department if you need new tires for your car.

Costco also offers a Citibank rewards VISA credit card.  You get between 1% to 4% rewards benefits that are paid to you in a check when your cycle ends.  Depending on what you use the charge card for you can end up with a nice rewards check once a year that can be cashed or used to pay for your purchase at the register.  Whatever leftover bonus money you don't spend is given back to you in cash.  So if your bonus check is $400 and your bill is only $200 you get $200 in cash back.  It's a great deal and my favorite part of having the rewards card.  You can use the card anywhere VISA is accepted.

Costco has a pharmacy where you can pick up your medications and you will find a little bit of just about everything in the stores.  Most of it is food products but you can also get household items, appliances, automotive, hardware, electrical items, furniture, electronics, paper goods, cleaning items, over the counter pharmacy items, fresh flowers and orchids, freshly baked pies, cookies, breads, and pastries, cigarettes, liquor, ready made cooked foods such as a roasted chicken  for around $5 and so much more.

Costco Nashua store is amazing . Food is great and I always enjoy a slice of pizza after shopping. Loved the deals here, you can always find good promotions. Outstanding customer service. Never had any issues here. Great selection of meat, seafood, fruits , bakery items,vegetables, and frozen stuff, Plus a lot more. Their rotisserie chickens actually cost less than a raw chicken.

Costco is always the best for bull item purchases. Whenever the items are on offer, they are actually the true offers rather than hicking the prices and giving discounts as dome by some stores. Costco eye glases are best, too. But they should at least try to match the prices of frames with the competitors. But the return policy and service is always the best, and you would never get from any other store. There is a need to increase the collection so that more options will be available. The quality of lenses is good so far. I will update the review after a couple of months with extensive use. Sometimes, their online prices are never matched in the store.

This location offers the same quality and value as any other Costco. However, the experiences at service desk and cashiers in the last few months have made me think twice before going here.

Two different persons at return desk on different days have told us to look up order number for items bought in warehouse instead of looking up in their system. One of them even claimed that looking it up on their system wastes time. My friend, YOU are being paid for the time. The customers' time is being wasted with your ineptitude. -1 star

I understand the corporate push for Costco app since it generates data but please don't misguide customers about policy changes like 'no returns without app or print receipt'. If that is your policy, clearly display it at the door and at the cashier and I'll think thrice before picking an item from your shelf. -1 star

The cashiers are being measured for the number of customers they push through. As a result, they have lost the ability to be kind. They are visibly stressed when one customer with a large number of items approaches instead of being happy about higher spending per household. If you really want to measure efficiency, measure the number of items cashiers scan during a shift. There is no excuse for being inconsiderate or accusing customers of wasting their precious time by 'blocking the line'. Do you want the customers in your warehouse or not? -1 stars

I‚Äôm a happy Costco member. You can find great products for amazing prices. It works out better when you pick up stuff in bulk. It‚Äôs always crowded and it takes a lot of time for billing. May be Costco should allow all members to use the scan and go option, this will help reduce the wait time. Cherry on the cake is the pizza that you get in Costco. It‚Äôs very tasty, a must try. It‚Äôs available for a very reasonable price. Costco has a great return policy, so the customers should not be worried. But yes, the return lines are very long.

Costco in Nashua is a fantastic place to shop. They have lots of great stuff, and if you're a member, you get really good deals.

They have a big section with fresh food, including fancy and healthy options.
The people who work there are really nice and helpful, so if you have questions, they'll help you out.

I recently had a disappointing encounter at Costco involving an employee named Celsira, and I feel compelled to share my experience. My family and I visited the store to prepare for an upcoming party, and unfortunately, this incident has left me reconsidering future visits.

While exiting the store, Celsira questioned if I had paid for the jacket I was wearing without thoroughly checking my receipt. Despite clarifying that it was my personal jacket from American Eagle, she insisted on reviewing security footage, creating an uncomfortable and unnecessary situation.

Seeking resolution, I requested to speak with a manager. Unfortunately, no one responded for nearly 30 minutes, prompting me to locate a manager inside the store. To my dismay, the manager and Celsira conversed in Spanish, despite my request for English, adding to my frustration.

This experience, coupled with the lack of immediate resolution, has significantly impacted my perception of Costco. As a loyal customer, feeling unjustly accused and witnessing a lack of effective communication is disheartening.

I hope this review prompts a thorough examination of the customer service practices at this location to ensure a more positive experience for future patrons.

This review is for Daniel at customer service. What a rude human being. Said hello to him, he didn‚Äôt say hello back and gave me a nasty look. Then asked me why I was returning two brand new products that I ordered online. I explained that they didn‚Äôt arrive on time for a party I was throwing so I came in store and got them instead. His demeanor Indicated he was just unhappy to be there working at all, then he looks at me and say next time remove the shipping label from the boxes before you return them. I honestly felt chocked, as it seemed he was only looking for a reason to be nasty. The return was brand new unopened, I didn‚Äôt have to explain to him at all why I returned them. Yet, he found a reason to complain that I never heard of. Never in my life have I heard an employee ask me to remove a shipping label from a product I bought. Costco chantilly, you have to hire better employees!

Cheryl has by far the worst customer service I have ever experienced. Had different payments for different orders and she was very rude, rushed, and had no consideration for the items that had to be scanned. If this is the face and the first impression Costco wants to give to their new members then they need to do better.

Almost every time I am paying at the register, the cashier talk usually in Spanish with other people ( cashier next to or person helping her) they totally ignore me or other paying clients.
I think that is so rude. Last time I told the manager he replied, ‚Äúhave a good day‚Äù. I said to him when you say that in respond to my complain, it means to ‚Äúshut up‚Äù .
They really need to train their workers to be nice to customers who are actually people who pay for them to keep their jobs.

I always thought highly of this store until my recent encounter with one store employee. It was close to closing time and I was picking up my last item at produce section before I head to store cashier. This one Costco employee approached me with unprofessional,  disrespectful demeanor and hostile  attitude and demanded that I should leave right away and that I should start walking towards the store exit because the store is about to close soon. I was dismayed with this young employee hostility and called him out on this unprofessional, disrespectful and hostile attitude. He said that his manager is watching and would get angry with him. This was very unfortunate encounter at a store my family always enjoyed shopping at. I left the store with bad unhappy impression.

Always a pleasant experience at this Costco.  It is typically quieter and draws a smaller crowd than the other nearby Costco's and Sam's Club.

Store is typically well-stocked and has plenty of variety and selection.

Staff is often friendly and helpful.
Food court is clean and provides good service.

Both parking lot and gas pumps are easy to get in and out of

I went to Costco this morning very upset about an over due balance and membership issues. I left 30 minutes later joyful and and satisfied. Angela at Customer Service provided me with friendly, professional service, fixed my overdraft problem and renewed my membership. She represents the best of Costco!

Staff is really pushy. There are different "rules" every time you go for when you can check out where, how many times your member card gets checked/scanned, etc. there is no consistency to the work flow of shopping and no matter what it is your fault. They really need to work on process management.

My FIrst Experience at Costco was I felt like a little kid running through the store, I had to hold my composure, because I had to act like a lady, but inside my head, I was screaming with Joy. The Costco Family gives you samples before you know what you're buying, Awesome,  I couldn't stop grabbing all of these deals, and putting it in my cart. Love ‚ù§Ô∏è this Store, can't wait to go back.

Shael, hands down best customer service ever ! Signed me and my husband up today for a member ship and even gave us something for our special needs daughter that loves Costco! Everyone at this location is so nice üòä so happy we signed up ‚ù§Ô∏è

I have never experienced such a bad customer service experience like the one I had at Costco in Midlothian. Kelvin at the door felt the need to be disrespectful over stupid bananas. Apparently the cashier did not ring the bananas and Kelvin decided to humiliate my family saying that we had 21 items and only paid for 20. They charge me a coffee twice thinking that the item missing was the coffee and after reviewing the receipt we realized it was a $2 BANANAS. Then Kelvin has the audacity to pass by and say ‚Äúlike I said it‚Äôs 21 items‚Äù and walked out. As if we didn‚Äôt had spent over $200 at Costco, trust me $2 would had been nothing. Left the bananas and walked out embarrassed at the scene at Costco. People go to Sam‚Äôs and ring up yourselves to avoid humiliation

I used to love Costco for its deals and customer service. After today, my mind is changed.  I drove 30 minutes to Costco to purchase a new battery for my car. I brought a 10mm socket and wrench to remove the battery terminals when I arrived to trade in for the core charge.  Turns out, I didn't realize that there is another 3/4" bolt holding the bottom of the battery in it's place.  So I can't remove the battery to turn in for the core charge.   I asked the sales associate at the battery and tire center if they had any loaner tools that I could borrow for a few minutes. He said that it's against Costco's policy to lend a simple adjustable wrench or some other tool for their customers to remove their batteries from their cars.

He also said that "people steal them, and that's why they don't lend them out."  First off, customers are being charged a $15 core charge, so there is an incentive for the customer to return the tool and old battery to get their $15 back! If you're still stuck on providing poor customer service at the battery center for customers purchasing batteries, then sell tools there! I went back into the store looking for a toolset, they didn't have any at the time.

This is so frustrating! Now, I have to make another 1hr r/t drive to get the $15 core charge back.

Either lend tools, sell tools, or don't sell batteries at all!  Poor customer experience.

Just skip the steaks! Everything we've gotten from there has been fine, except their steaks. We've tried buying them 3 times now, and have only been able to eat them once. They look fine, travel fine, seem fine in the fridge, but within 24 hours of purchase they smell putrid upon opening.
They have great deals here and apparently treat their workers fairly.  The products are of good quality.  However, buying in bulk isn‚Äôt always a bargain.  Especially when buying perishable food.

I think this location is sooo much better than West Broad. This store is cleaner, parking is more organized, people (both staff and guests) are friendlier, checkout lines are better spaced, sample booth staff are friendly and sometimes funny. Great job to those that manage this store!

This Costco store in Fairfax is known for being one of the cleanest and well-stocked with various merchandise, especially lots of Asian products for Asian communities. It is one of many American wholesale clubs where customers can purchase bulk quantities of merchandise at discounted prices, but only if they are club members who pay an annual fee. Costco offers various products, including electronics, computers, furniture, appliances, jewelry, fresh and cooked food, meats, fruits, vegetables, clothes, and much more. This store also features a Tire Center for tire and car technical needs, complimentary tire air-pressure machines, a gas station exclusively for members, an in-house food court, a hearing aid store, a pharmacy, a vision center, and a bakery. Costco also sends out a membership magazine, the Costco Connection, periodically. Although some products require bulk purchases for discounts, I appreciate Costco's reasonable prices and quality products. Additionally, ample parking is available in the lot, but the store can get busy, especially on weekends.

This Costco is packed during Friday morning.

First I want to say the gas station has 2 pump per lane. And the line can be long at time.

Inside the Costco, the layout is very similar to other Costco. I will say it is smaller space than other Costco I been to in west coast.

The food court is the most interesting because I never seen beef roast sandwich, mango smoothie, and strawberries ice cream. Unfortunately I did not get those yet the time I visit. Will definitely try one day

Costco sells plants and small trees during Spring time but has no arrangements to facilitate customer buying in bulk to load to their cars. I bought 10 trees today, had to go all the way upfront to request the manager of if I can pull my car to the back door so that I can load easily. The manager obliged my request but informed me, it‚Äôs a one time deal. Is Costco so well known for customer service sliding downwards? How do they expect a customer to cart bulky items through the crowd using the regular line via the cashier. It is highly unreasonable, some of these trees are 6 to 9 ft tall with huge plastic pots. This is just plain lack of empathy towards customers buying bulky items. Hope you can improve Costco! Or maybe you don‚Äôt care anymore. Because this option was available in past years. You pay, show the receipt and pickup bulky items at the back. Saving you the headache to navigate through families with kids shopping at the store.
One of the better Costcos in the area. Heavy on Asian related foods, which makes it more interesting.

This is one of the best Costco locations in Northern Virginia. They have a large Asian population in the area so a lot of the products cater to the surrounding population which I think makes it unique and better than other locations in the region. They also have a gas station and plentiful parking.

Great stuff, very busy store so try not to come during busy times if ya can. But if not no sweat, I've never had any problems walking around and getting what I needed, you don't really notice it until checkout and then the line will be backed up. But in terms of service and product selection you'll enjoy it, get a membership!

The staff here works so hard and they are so patient, polite and friendly. So many smiling employees and nice people. I can usually find someone to help me with heavy/large items. Everyone is awesome, from the greeter to the employees who are stocking to the checkout line. It's pretty amazing. Costco hires great people.

I've been here a few times - same as any other Costco, so the consistency is great. You can get what you need and get out of there in a reasonable amount of time. On this trip, I got frozen Atlantic salmon; always the best and one of our top favorites. Something new we tried was Chicken Thai Basil spring rolls. They were ok/average, not great. Also, I got an 18-pack of Premier protein shakes, refrigerated gyro meat (husband LOOOOOVES this!!!), Tzatziki dip, Phillip's lump crab meat (I LOOOOOVE this!!!!), and Coconut Chicken Curry (another new thing to try, but haven't tried it yet).

Great products available at all times.  I enjoy shopping here.  Lots of parking available,  even though it can be tough to get a space close to the store.  Around paydays, it can be packed, but lines move very quickly.   The staff is always happy to help at the registers.
Costco is the only gas station I can trust. Recently Consumer Reports  rated them high scores for having lowest contaminants and the best   prices.
Flowers are amazing and beautiful in this store, I had a good experience with all the varieties they offer, love the Roses, Tulips, Hydrangeas

Love going to Costco. Most of the time, there is a long line to check out. Today, It was not that bad. We also eat there. We will eat there more often. We got 2 hot dogs, 2 drinks, and Smoothie for less than $7.

Love Costco! They have great deals on their food in bulk, Kirkland organic chicken is phenomenal and I get that all the time here for 5.99 a pound. Their gruyere cheese is top quality! Get a quick meal pick up a cooked chicken for dinner for 499.

I love going to Costco, their proces tend to be better than the rest, as long as you have the space for the bulk purchase, nothing is small here.  Their meat selection tends to be pretty vast, along with their bakery section.  The folks doing the free samples tend to be very friendly as well, always a smile and sometimes.. I even get to have an extra sample.

A big draw for me is their little cafeteria area though.  The food is surprisingly good, especially for as cheap as it is.  Got a whole large pizza for about 8$.  Hot dog and a drink 1.50 - it's pretty cool that they do that.

I'll always be back again for more!
Clean store, well stocked with an outstanding staff.  Ready for any holiday.   With brand new carts a great place to shop.  Great deals...

This Costco is smoking hot with customer service. I had to ask where the peanut butter pretzels got moved to and as usual the Costco gentleman told me the exact new aisle where they got moved. Also Costco finally brought back Jean's Posh Pantry cinnamon crumb cakes and I had to bring one home. Will be going back for many more now that I know they are just as excellent as they were three years ago. Costco is outstanding.

I go there for years just did my reading glasses there they are amazing for glasses amazing customer service the quality of the glasses is very good very good price and come with a lot of quoting for free I love going to this specific store because it‚Äôs not the crazy like the one in Sterling very well organized and the people is very nice and helpful

It's a good costco.  Everything is spread out but it makes sense.  The only thing I have to complain about, is the fact that nobody is courteous in there.  People stand in the middle and will not move.  There is no sense of right away its just push through the crowd.  Other than that I love Costco.  Oh they always have AMAZING samples.

Such a disappointment, I always come here and for some reason today this employee (KELLY) stops me before I go to self check out to prove my membership. My hands were full as I wasn‚Äôt using a cart and she proceeded to stand there while I had to scramble to fish it out. I talked to a ‚Äúmanager‚Äù and he said that‚Äôs protocol which if it were, I would understand. However, I watched as she let 5 other people right by without confirming membership. What is truly a let down is the lack of consistency had led me to believe that, in the moment, her stopping me was personal- whether it was based off of looks, how I dressed, etc.

I felt uncomfortable and will be going to another location for shopping. Sad to see this Costco has had such a drop in welcoming environment.

This Costco is hot garbage, plain and simple! From the poor customer service, to them screwing customers on premium gas at the pumps by jacking up their prices on premium to be only a few measly cents cheaper than the other local stations. Add in the constant harassment with being asked to show your card 3 or 4 times every visit now (entrance, waiting in line, at the register, I even had one employee ask me in the middle of the store!) and the crazy recipt checkers who now agonize of every single item and take a minute to get you out of the door! Then there is their employee who wants to push his insane "political" beliefs on everyone and subject them to his insanity (you know who I am talking about...)

Only saving graces at this store are Gabe, Jeff, Kat (at the pharmacy), and the shorter gentleman who is always cheery and helpful.

Love Costco! But not necessarily this location. First of all don‚Äôt come on Sundays. Parking it‚Äôs overwhelming. The way the parking lot is structured calls for traffic and cars trying to turn one way while the other car is trying to get out. I rather r come during the week.
Second complaint is the lack of organic fresh produce. There is only organic apples. Nothing else except frozen items.

Third complain wish they had the A2 milk organic.

Fourth complain this Costco had the Once Upon a Farm yogurt pouches, they have since taken them out. No longer sold here.

Other than that buying in bulk can be convenient for big families or if you have the room to store.
Costco overall has amazing prices. You can never go wrong with a slice of pizza or a hot dog. Prices are crazy low.

This Costco is always clean and tidy, there's constantly rotisserie chickens coming out fresh, and samples are common. The checkout line gets very long and can clog up the main aisle (photo) which is a bummer but staff does a good job separating people and keeping the line moving.

This location has one of the best customer service. They have everything organized and they always surprise me with things I didn't know they sell. They are very helpful whenever I need some sort of assistance. Overall great store and I will continue to shop here for many years.

If you‚Äôre looking for excellent customer service, look for Kendall at the Member Services desk. Truly a pleasure to work with him. He went the extra mile, updated information on my new account, helped me plan a membership strategy to get the most benefit for my money, and was able to find special programs that I was interested in.
It was a refreshing change from other big box stores in the area.
Also, the store was clean, and well organized. The bathroom was very clean and comfortable.
All in all, I was quite pleased with my visit today.

This is our main Costco, and we continue to enjoy our weekly visits without incidents.  They deserve 5 stars.  I somewhat tolerated their downgraded churros compared to their delicious traditional ones. Today, as of 1/20/24, I found out their churros were discontinued. Wahhh. I then see that the churros were replaced by these expensive $2.74 (including VA tax already). The problem is that the cookie is hard on the sides but soft on the inside. The taste was even worse. Poorly made.  Rather than buying this new addition to their menu, buy the chocolate cookies from the Costco bakery section. So long, Costco churros. So long.

Absolutely love Costco! It has everything I would ever need. I would say that Costco fulfills about 90% of all our household shopping needs. As for the rest I may go to Wegmans simply because they have unique items that Costco doesn't carry. But all our meat, veggies, cheese, bread,  eggs, seltzer, toilet paper, cleaning supplies, and wine come from Costco. If you are ever throwing a party, Costco is your one stop shop destination.

Our favorite food items are the salmon filets, English cheddar cheese, Kirkland brand seltzer, and the Irish butter!

Not my favorite Costco, since it lacked the items I got at other Costcos. It was also very crowded early in the morning. The customer service was very good. We did find items we needed at a good price. I always love their fresh vine tomatoes & bags of avocados. I did like their high quality white wine selection with high ratings. The $1.50 drink with giant beef hotdog at Costco is still present and a great deal there. Almost bought a new snack item I never saw in Costco but didn‚Äôt. I would only go to this Costco again for convenience yet I rather try another Costco.

I want to give a shout out to William in the hearing aid department!
I started going here a year ago and he is just super!
Keeps my aids working no matter what!
Saved me lots of money and he does a great job!

This is the best Costco around!

The people that work here are all so nice!
They also have some great prices along with the best hearing aid department!

An update!
William helped me get my hearing aids updated for no cost and what a difference they make!
They came back new!

Working better than ever!

I highly recommend this location!
Clean bright with great employees!

This is a VERY difficult review (and the longest one I've ever written) because I am a Costco person #kirklandgang (not a real gang obviously, just a group of people who love Costco lol).

Either way, I'm gonna give Costco a 2 out of 5 star in this Google review because I'm tired of the experience I've been having at the Costco food court. Enough is enough!

Costco pizza is a 9 out of 10! I would give it a 10 if they brought back the veggie pizza and Supreme pizza options. (hint hint)

But the issue and situation with the food courts at the two Costcos I frequent is a mess (Alexandria Rt 1 and Woodbridge Potomac Mills). The wait time for the whole pizzas can be over 40 minutes which truthfully that isn't the issue. I wait without much complaint as long as 1.5 hours for 2 pizzas at least once a month. My issue is the gaggle of people,  poor organization/flow of service and the minimal customer service that I continue to get. It's obviously not just me because most of the customers are feeling the same frustration when I'm there.

Today,  I experienced the worst customer service I've ever experienced at Costco. I won't mention his name although I seriously debated it bc he was rude to me and his co-worker that was trying to help me. And it's not the 1st time I've experienced it or seen it.

He should not be customer facing with that type of disposition. I thank the manager Jasmine and the supervisor and the employee that was actually trying to help me get the drinks for my kids and I while I waited for the pizza. With a 30 minute wait time getting your other items IF you want them should not be a problem-and normally isn't with anyone else but him. He rudely told his coworker that I could wait eventhough they were calling orders past my number. He said it 3 times while I was standing in front of him as if I wasn't there and as if she wasn't allowed to help me as if he was in charge. I don't know who he thought he was dealing with. I kept my cool but addressed his rude customer service and asked why I couldn't get my items while I wait for my pizza and asked for a manager. After talking to the supervisor who was helpful but I asked for a manager because I needed to ensure I was heard.

Now please keep in mind I rarely write negative reviews bc I recognize that everyone's experiences are different and I like to give places chances to do better but poor customer service is a huge problem that is so easy to avoid and easy to correct with a little bit of courtesy and respect. Please note I've worked at Taco Bell, McDonald's, TGI Fridays, Golden Corral and other restaurants and customer service jobs in highschool and college and even after I graduated. I am a process improvement and project manager and if anyone asked me I'd love to give some simple recommendations for my beloved Costco to improve the crappy experiences I and many others have had with the food court.

I also would like to say that I feel bad for the employees at the food court because it's a pressure cooker and I doubt it's an easy job dealing with the crowds of people that they serve all day. Thank you to all of you for serving us this yummy and great priced food!

But it's 2024 and I hope you do better and expect more from your employees and take time to assess and improve the efficiency at your food court.

Will I stop going to Costco, heck no! But I will definitely continue to be a vocal customer if or when I get poor customer service. Just being real with you. Overall Costco gets a 8 out of 10 most days but today and in regards to the food court experiences today and in the past, they get a 3 out of 10 for customer service (but like I said earlier a 9 out of 10 for the food! Can't beat the quality and price!

If you read this entire review, thx. Very kind of you. üòä

The worst Costco EVER I saw MICE droppings on the clothing, parking sucks and don‚Äôt let your car get hit by their carts they won‚Äôt pay for damages caused by their employee they will claim you are at fault. Crackheads lingering in the parking lot. Don‚Äôt be fooled go to a different location.

I've been a loyal customer of the Costco for quite some time, and it has become my go-to destination for all things home-related. What truly stands out for me is the unbeatable value this store offers. The prices are consistently excellent, and I appreciate that I can get quality products at affordable rates.

One of my favorite aspects of this Costco is their remarkable wine collection. It's a wine enthusiast's paradise! Whether I'm looking for a special bottle or a great everyday wine, they never disappoint. The variety and quality are impressive.

Moreover, the staff at this location is always friendly and helpful. Their dedication to customer service enhances the overall shopping experience.
I don't particularly care for this Costco's. It's a little more hectic than what I'm used to. It really wasn't stocked properly, and I should've gone with my gut and traveled to the one I'm used to.

This place is the dirtiest Costco I've been to. I saw three rats pressed against the wall running üêÄ where the water bottles are at. (Back of the store) At first I couldn't believe my eyes, then when we went closer to the cashier we saw mouse traps. Costco once again you dropped the ball.

I frequent this Costco weekly and I‚Äôm just surprised how the employees treat me. When I shop alone and not with another person, they always ask to see my card even though they do not bother checking other people in line. They always ask me ‚Äúis this your card‚Äù? And I always respond with, yes, did you need to see my ID? Check the system? This happened again today, amongst the almost ten occasions this has occurred. I usually do not let this effect me but just today the employee lied to my face. She didn‚Äôt even bother to check the two people in front of me or the people behind me. I do not know if it‚Äôs the way I look or speak, but I don‚Äôt understand why this continues to happen. I even called the warehouse to file a formal complaint and one of the managers (Al)  gave me the Costco number for everything except the right solution to my problem. He was also rude and hung up on me before I finished talking. I‚Äôve been a member for years and this is just very disappointing.

I have always had a good experience at this Costco, lately it's been hectic because of all these scammers. I was in this long line to scan your own items, but they check Costco memberships for scammers and fraud, which is excellent,  however the costco person at the check registry behind ID check person started letting a few go right through to the registry by passing the line without IDs being checked, meanwhile a few of us were still in line being checked for IDs. This made me and others furious. I think they need to communicate better.

Just joined today, super informative and helpful at customer service/membership desk

Stocked up on Halloween candy at great prices and looked around a bit oh and found Virginia cutting boards that will make fun holiday gifts

Hit up gas station before leaving too üòÅ

Update, fun items for Valentine's Day celebration see pictures

Costco is always a fun place to visit.   The customer service here is fantastic.   The remodel they did last year had made a huge difference not only in the amount of products they carry but it spreads out people more so your not on top of each other.

Food court is always packed and the wait is too long.  And parking is usually very busy.

Costco does have products for a decent price, but the shopping experience has a lot to be desired. The parking area is almost impossible. The crowds inside make negotiating your way through the ailses very difficult, and sometimes check out takes forever.

This Costco is just OK. Not well planned out. The cafe is right on top of the cash registers, creating a major traffic jam. The women's restrooms only 4 stalls, so it feels like there is always a wait. Employees meh, not really approachable, probably over worked. Nicely stocked though, pricing is good as expected.

Costco is OK. The employees are not rude but not approachable. Many times I'm needing help & when I see an employee pass by, they will look at the floor. (human invisible  cloth technique). Also, when they are discontinuing a product that you often buy, you are not given any warning. One day it's there the next time it's gone. Lastly, when you go online to see if a product is available for a store, for example, scoop away cat liter. What you see on that store's website is a different size & price. When I call, I get the excuse that online is different. Yeah, and my cat is a bully because that's how he expresses love. ü§£  Overall, it's  a good store if you don't need help or need to look up an items availability. Employees ok.
This is an impressive Costco. Looks small from the parking lot but a ton of stuff and a great layout (as far as Costco's go...) I swing by every time I am in Norfolk.

Helping members get their lawns ready for the summer season with Sunday Lawn care products such as weed warrior, dandelion dooms & a great deal on our pesticide/ chemical free fertilizer kits on sale at a once a year special spring time event price of only $54.99 & $19.99 for the weed killer sprays. Come check us out now until 4/16/24!!! -Colleen Theresa Booth ü™¥

A very busy location, but well stocked & the employees are helpful. The garden center is currently open & stocked with healthy plants that I've always had success growing & the bakery smelled amazing. There was a nice supply of flowers at a good price for those looking for a mother's day bouquet.

Busy as all Costcos are. Nice and helpful gas station attendant outside actively assisting customers. Plenty of available staff to ask questions. The smell of cookies was amazing walking through as well. Check out time was quick, even as busy as it was for a Sunday morning.
Always satisfying when at Costco friendly staff will assist you with your shopping or food items and they can also provide your order for you to use for the next day supplies

I recently visited the Pentagon City Costco at 1200 S Fern St, Arlington, VA, and I must say, it's one of the best Costco locations I've been to! The store stands out for its impressive size, boasting one of the largest inventories in the area. This vast selection really shines through, offering everything from electronics to groceries, and their bulk purchases are a great way to save money.

The food court is another highlight, offering delicious and affordable options like hot dogs, pizza, and a variety of desserts that are perfect for a quick bite during a shopping trip.

However, there's a slight downside ‚Äì the parking. It can be a bit of a hassle, especially during peak hours. Navigating the parking lot can be challenging, but it's a small price to pay for the overall shopping experience.

In conclusion, despite the minor inconvenience with parking, the Pentagon City Costco remains one of my favorite locations. It's a fantastic place for anyone looking to find great deals on a wide range of products. Definitely worth a visit!

Costco Colossus: Shopping & Samples Await!
Calling all bulk-buying enthusiasts! This mega-Costco boasts a sprawling parking lot and an equally vast selection of goods. But first-timers, take note: VISA is king here, so leave your Mastercard at home.

While navigating the bustling aisles, I fueled up with a delicious fruit smoothie from the food court ‚Äì a smart pre-shopping strategy! Don't forget to watch for tempting Costco samples scattered throughout the store ‚Äì who knows; you might discover your new favorite snack!

Speaking of favorites, the food court pizza. Crispy crust, generous cheese, and that irresistible Costco magic ‚Äì it's a must-try!

Pro tip: Skip the weekend madness and shop during the week for a more relaxed experience. Your wallet and nerves will thank you!

this costco is a pretty good size so it has all the usual items you would find.
one thing that i‚Äôve repeatedly noticed is there is never an employee to be found if you want to ask a question and when you do find the random employee, they‚Äôre less than willing to answer your query.
it‚Äôs usually a vague pointing gesture with a ‚Äúin that direction‚Äù or ‚Äúi‚Äôm not sure‚Äù with no attempt to further assist.
that being said, there are always numerous  employees by the registers hanging out, looking on at the millions the company is raking in.

it‚Äôs my local costco so I go with the knowledge that if i don‚Äôt see the item on that visit, hopefully the next time i might.
We had a great experience here! It‚Äôs SO economical, especially for things we use daily.
This is a great Costco with a wide variety of goods, wider than most CostCos. But, even with two new parking structures getting in and out is really hard

There are many good people here but Costco is changing rapidly and for the worst.

Quality food:  recently I bought a package of chicken thighs (see pictures below).   In the past, each portion (small individual package) had 3 big thighs, and a random small piece, maybe 4 if smaller  I guess to meet the weightcriteria., .

Today I cleaned and seasoned 3 individual packages (normally 10 thighs).  The pieces of chicken were so small that I had 22 pieces of chicken.  More than twice the normal amount.  After removing the skin, the skin, I weighted a few pieces and all of them were 2.6 oz.- 3.5 oz.  18 out 22 pieces were super small and 4 smaller than normal but kind of acceptable.   Imagine how small after cooked.

The other part of the poor quality control (chicken grade F) was so bad they put a piece of oddly cutted  leg was included in one of the small package.

Please start selling grade A chicken.  Mot this garbage.

2a.  I went to Costco to return something I bought long time ago.  Oddly, the person could not fi d the item in the system.  Initially she told me she could not go X amount of years.  When I insisted indicating I have returned older stuff, she was able to go as far as necessary in my purchase history.

She still could not find any of the items.  I suggested to search by product manufacturer, brand or object key word.  She told me the system didn't had the capability.  She can only look by department number and check what I bought classified as part of the department.

Eventually she called a manager.  A guy named Llamar confessed that Costco was limiting the items of your purchasing history because people was abusing the warranty.

I replied what that has to do with me?  The Costco contract with their members was 100% satisfaction warranty.  The only items with time limit are the electronics.  Just as a note, in the past I have returned items 10 months after the initial purchase because I didn't had the pressure of a standard warranty.  Even when I used to go to Costco twice a week.

Of course this change of business model was not publicly announced to the Costco members.

2b.  In similar fashion but more despicable, an old man (looked like late 60s or early 70s) was returning a Home Theather speaker system.  A kid already reviewed the components and gave the green light to the cashier to refund the money.  Suddenly a manager called Elmer arrived and questioned in a rude manner the old man.  The kid was ordered to take everything out humiliating the customer and eventually he agreed the item could be returned no before intimidating the young employee and the customer.

3.  Years ago, the gas also used to be much cheaper than the competition.   $0.50 less per gallon easily.   I used to refuel twice a week due my long commute.  Until recently,  there was no difference in gas prices.  Now, Costco gas prices are competitive but not significantly cheaper.  Not even with the 2% of executive membership refund is enough to go lower than the competition.

4.  In the past, I used get $80-$110 in rewards refund from my executive membership. With high prices, I stopped buying as much.  My last refund was just $25 because I started buying at other better priced grocery stores like Aldi's. I switched to a regular membership because it is no longer justifiable to keep the executive membership.

Costco is behaving so cheap that almost look like Walmart. Many shopping carts need the casters replaced.  See the pictures showing the shopping carts that doesn't work because you have to struggle pushing it with the casters with no rubber or the rubber in the casters are falling apart. You are pushing the biggest shopping cart of all retailers, with over $400 in products, super heavy and it wobbles because they don't have the decency to replace the casters.

Fantastic prices, great customer service, and always clean. There pizza is pretty delicious, especially for the price. My only complaint is the rude black lady that works the food court. I go once a month to stock up and every time I visit the food court she is rude to everyone. She has No customer service skills and acts like you are an inconvenience. At first I thought maybe it was just me until I watched her snap at an older gentleman for switching his order. She told him " can you make up your mind already, I'm busy." She needs to keep in mind that without that man and others orders, she would not be "busy", or have a job. Customer service keeps people coming back, while rude people like her run them off. Do better, Mrs. Busy

I spent an hour shopping but cashier won‚Äôt check me out because my husband who is on the account was not present in the store.

Well Walmart I go.
Thanks for wasting my day but I will spend my hard earned money somewhere else.

Long ago I used to prefer Costco pizza over Sam's Club. Not anymore. There were only 2 ladies working behind the counter working their behinds off. My 1st time in as a customer of Costco getting a pizza, but I understood the wait time. Didn't help others were rude to the ladies. They did an awesome job!

This CostCo is overall awesome. But I would highly advise against anyone buying flounder there. A good place to go if you are buying in bulk. A warning though: Plan on spending more money than you expected if you don‚Äôt have experience shopping at large wholesale outlets. If you can budget out your purchases you can save money. But if you go through the items quickly because they are there then don‚Äôt be surprised if you actually spend way more than you expected.

The store is huge, it has all items you name it. It has dairy, vegetables bread, electronics clothes and what not. A single Costco supermarket is a city. It has everything that a person need for household. The checkout system is too good. Hands down this is the supermarket store.

I loved this store for years but especially by what i witnessed last week, it has really depreciated by its staff. They are mostly all very rude starting from the administration. You can not get through without being turned away or dealing with unnecessary attitude along with hanging up while you are trying to speak. As with all Costcos, great selection of items at affordable prices and despite the amount of traffic in the store, they get you checked out quickly. Compared to the Costco closest to me (Gaithersburg, MD), I noticed some things in this Costco's favor. First, the store was noticeably bigger and perhaps thus less crowded. Larger selection of items as well, including a cat toy we recently bought on Amazon that we saw here for less than half the price. Second, there were a huge amount of free sample stations at around 3pm. Never seen that many at once at any other Costco. Finally, I noticed not as many people were leaving their carts in random places at diagonal angles, blocking traffic. For some reason I experience this all the time in the Gaithersburg one.

Better than other costcos i been to. Their clothing section is more lacking. Strawberries were moldy as well! They did have a cute strawberry milk squishmallow and they were pretty well stocked on everything. They have good rotating deals including the scrumptious taquitos . Service was good and workers were nice! Soft serve melts fast.

Why one start? Because of the clown that received my delivery (#313213695). He lacked professionalism, safety and support, he wasn't not disrespectful to be clear. For those who are searching the churro has been replaced by the giant cookie in the food court. Second pic is to provide reference for size, as I didn't have any tools to measure it at the moment.

Overall, I'd rate it a 4/5. To preface, I prefer cookies with an undercooked, chewy interior (akin to one from Levain Bakery). The exterior was crunchy while the interior was soft. There was plenty of chocolate chips and surprisingly wasn't as sweet as expected (with the use of semi sweet chocolate chips).

I'm curious how much a difference it makes; sitting under the heat lamp for 2 min vs 20 min. There were only a few left when mine was served; unsure as of how long it was sitting for. Would love to try again to get one that's fresh out of the oven for comparison.

I'd definitely get it again; I'm sure it would pair well with the soft serve ice cream.
Costco is selling good quality of progressive lens at $130 this is an attractive price. Look at the pictures you‚Äôll notice the angle is wide.

Costso is a wholesale shop here we can find more groceries new cloths decoration items plants drinks kitchen items blankets pillows nuts dry fruits non veg items etc... all thinks are reasonable prices, pizza snacks etc now recent new collections came for Christmas decoration thinks worth buying new cloths that too costco giving many offers for all the items.
Great place to do some shopping with great prices as always. Great gas prices Finding a parking spot is difficult.

Costco is like an addiction. We have to go every weekend or every other. I like Costco they have mostly what I want, and I have gotten many things here that I would not have gotten somewhere else.  I like the cost points for most items and I usually buy most meats they have.  They have a large selection of many different items.  I like Costco they have many things we do not need.
Staff are very helpful!!! And the lines were quick! What more can I ask?? Well I also got my favorite protein powder on sale this month with 10 oz. More and a dollar less than the best online price!

One time i went here to buy milk and i bought milk and 2 days later when i used the milk with my coffee then later my stomach hurt so bad so i check the milk and it had white specs but i check the expansion date and it said ‚Äúmay 10th‚Äù but the day i drank the milk was may 2nd, i hope you check the milk before drinking it and costco employees, pls make sure that the milk is safe to drink

Great prices and great customer service. Also love the samples. I know a lot of people make fun, but I really find them useful. I hate to buy a big bag of something,then get it home and not like it. I Know you can return it but I really hate to do that. When I sample something that I like I usually end up buying it. If I hadn't tried it,I probably would not have bought it.  Wish they would sample more cheese
I love cheese but would hate to buy a big chunk of it then find out I don't like it.

Costco.. one of those stores you plan on going into only to get a few things, but come out with a basket full of stuff and a bill that's anywhere from $500 to $700. Lol. OMG, I've been going to this Costco for about 15 years, and this was the most packed I've ever seen it. I felt like I was in line at Disney as I  moved in and out of the aisles. The store is super clean and they have a tire center at this Costco as well. They also have a gas station if you need gas. I will say they are very quick at moving people through the check out.  I was there at 2:30ish and there was probably about 50 people in the food court. Boise needs to add another Costco somewhere south of 84.

I purchased these items on 2 separate occasions. The ravioli has been in my freezer since the first day when I went to cook it and saw that it was covered in mold. The cheese  was from the next trip (stopped directly from work). I‚Äôve been holding onto the ravioli as they wouldn‚Äôt do a refund over the phone, and I don‚Äôt live super close to the store. I called immediately and was advised to just return it when I could.

The cheese, as you can see, is half eaten. They‚Äôre individually wrapped, and it wasn‚Äôt until I tasted something funny that I had to spit it out.

All this to say, I have consistently noticed that Costco‚Äôs fridges are significantly lacking in their ability to keep things cool. I‚Äôve even begun pulling from the back just to ensure freshness, but maybe they‚Äôre letting things sit out for a long time before refrigeration?? I buy their chicken skewers and meatballs regularly, and now that feels unsafe to say the least.

I‚Äôm thoroughly disgusted as I ate half this cheese (and have eaten MANY pieces from this package already). Now I‚Äôm seriously questioning whether or not I‚Äôll continue to be a member as I‚Äôm worried at their protocol for ensuring customer safety. I‚Äôve now wasted $20.00 on food that could make me sick.

Do better.

The prices were phenomenal, for what you can get.  The cashier we had was nice. I just don't like it when it's overcrowded and people get rude. Other than that I enjoyed seeing all the products they offer
Nice location and establishment. The staff members were so friendly.

The policies in place are getting ridiculous. My 17 year old daughter can no longer shop there. She is not allowed to use my card and you have to be 18 to get a membership.  80% of our families shopping at Costco is done by her(or was), I guess they don't want our money.

Now you kicked all the teens out from having an economical lunch!  Shame on you Costco!

I will not be renewing my membership.

-Soon to be former Costco member of 13 years

We have  big family so I appreciate buying the larger quantities, especially in the produce section and the packaged fresh meats.   My favorite feature is the pharmacy.   Prescriptions are always correct, always on the date promised, & the pharmacists are always available to answer questions.     The entire pharmacy staff is really helpful with over the counter medical supplies.   They have earned the 5-star rating in every way.

If I could give them a 0-star rating, I would. After purchasing a giant shed kit. We had. 3 orange vest receiving team members assisting us. After hitting me with the shed while attempting to load it as well as buckling and nearly breaking my mother in law's truck bed liner, I stepped in and did the job of 3 men ON MY OWN. Because the one in charge said we aren't helping him anymore when I told them to stop breaking the truck. The 3 walked away talking very rudely.
Apparently they are fine with breaking your truck, or vehicle and hitting you with over 300lbs of weight.
Very unhelpful orange vest staff.
I do not recommend buying anything if you can't lift it by yourself.

I recently visited the Costco in Coeur d'Alene and was impressed. The selection of products here stood out as particularly remarkable, surpassing what I've seen at my local stores. The variety is excellent, catering to a wide range of needs and preferences.

What enhanced my shopping experience even further was the excellent customer service. Our card was acting kind of weird, and the man at the self check out was super attentive and spent several minutes trying to help us out. He was generally super friendly as well.

The overall atmosphere of the store was welcoming, with a well-maintained and organized layout that made shopping easy and enjoyable. The cleanliness of the store was also notable, contributing to a pleasant shopping environment. Additionally, the gas line up was not crazy which is a nice surprise.

First, I sometimes get dismayed at finding handicap parking. I think you ought to designate more parking spaces for the handicap. I don‚Äôt think in the last 3-4 years that I‚Äôve been in Costco when it wasn‚Äôt busy. Thats a testament to both the services/goods of Costco and the explosion of our population here in north Idaho. Second, and most importantly, today I had a young man who was incredibly helpful to me. I‚Äôm disabled veteran but ambulatory except that I had surgery 4 weeks ago to repair my left pectoral muscle. I only have the use of one arm and asked to box my groceries. Without me asking the young man voluntarily asked if he could help me out with my cart and groceries. His name is Caleb and what a testament to your service and the culture of can-do you guys foster here. He was so helpful and full of joy it spilled over onto me. Thank you Caleb for your faithfulness and cheerful demeanor.

I get a few things here. Went in for the first time on a Friday, something I'll never try again. Self check line must have had 20 to 25 carts. Most other lines had 5 or carts in line and all cashiers were on duty. Moved through cashier quickly and the ran into a 20 to 30 cart pile up at the exit. Wasn't a really bad trip but I will reconsider going again on a Friday.

Costco is a cool place, and I probably spend too much time here. Thank goodness they brought back the fruit smoothie and got rid of that nasty mango smoothie. I normally like mangos, but something was so off and it made me sad to not have the fruit smoothie. I‚Äôm not sure why they sell a 10 dollar roast beef sandwich - can‚Äôt speak to if it‚Äôs good but a weird option. I took some random pics of stuff I found that are going on my Christmas list so feel free to judge that. It‚Äôs just nice to have a Costco nearby.

I like this place. A store with a bit of everything and nothing specific. About the only thing they have had consistently over the years is their pizza and hotdogs. It‚Äôs one of the first places we stop when traveling to stock up on the things that don‚Äôt fit in the luggage. This location is ver clean, the floors, the racks, the merchandise and evergreen bathrooms.

One of the best Costco‚Äôs I have been to and I have been to a bunch across the west. I can tell it‚Äôs still pretty new because of how clean it is. The gas station is the upgraded version of Costco‚Äôs gas stations. I am happy to see the food sampling stations are back and there is plenty of toilet paper!
It is a great stop for flowers and lunch whatever the situation you need. I can get just about anything you need there and bulk prices are the best.
It's Costco man! Always great. First time I've been in this location in years! Called In some pizza and skipped the line! üòä Mmmm fresshhhhhh üçïüçï

We love the healthy foods here, the high quality of products, and the bargain prices! They also offer sweet deals for our vehicle's tires, including a complimentary roadside assistance program that can't be beat. The store and employees are extremely well organized, and capable of helping large crowds move through their shopping experience. And the food court flavors and prices are so good that staying for a meal is never a wrong choice!

Optical was the reason for today's stop. Cristina was especially helpful, very polite,  and great attention to detail. Costco's optical department had a great selection and pricing than what we'd found elsewhere.

I love(d) Costco. We bought a veggie tray, a couple salads, and of course wine. Sadly the veggie tray had mold on the underside of the veggies, and the salad went bad within 2 days. However the Malbec was perfect.

The people greeting you at the door could be a little friendlier and welcoming...

But other than that, it's a Costco that has all the Costco things.

Grateful to have one so close to home.

Food court is delicious.

I like my neighborhood costco.
It's on chinden road.
Spacious car park.

This store is clean and the prices are good but, you got to ask yourself why is that cup of ice cream so lite? They actually make the ice cream look good from the outside but the inside is hollow.. and the chocolate üç´ and strawberry üçì topping are now super minimal..

I get what I want, and being able to sample food is usually what helps my family decide what we buy. The clothing is worth it too. The staff at checkout are generally great! The staff in the customer service, great as well! The pharmacy staff deserve recognition too, and the staff in the food court as a whole, deserve medals for the job they do!!!

I would have given them five stars but their customer service is questionable. I had a supervisor actually raise his voice at me because I went under their corded off check stand to the grocery side from the exit side( I hope that makes sense). Unfortunately they had carts in between all of the other registers so we couldn‚Äôt get through to grocery shop. I should also say the only reason I was going through was to help my 78-year-old mother get to the other side quicker, he yelled at me and said you have to go around through the front door, along with other rude statements. I tried to explain the situation but he was extremely arrogant. So my mom of 75 trying not to be disrespectful walked all the way out the exit then back through the front door which was a lot for my mother. We ended up getting her a driving cart. So if you ever have a return at Costco don‚Äôt expect to go through the building to shop you will need to make the return, leave the store come then come back in the front door. üòî  with that being said we do love Costco. They have amazing deals on bulk food. The water is the reason we go it‚Äôs under four dollars for an entire 40 pack or 42 pack.  I should say I‚Äôm sure most employees are great, I just had an issue with one of them. I would definitely recommend Costco.

With four teens at home to feed, house, and clothe, Costco is awesome.  We get most family necessities in bulk and save a ton of money  buying here. The membership pays for itself.

PS. Three out of four of my teens love the hot dogs at the Costco restaurant. It's a quick and easy dinner on a shopping night. Don't judge me.   ;)

Terrible customer service, I do NOT recommend this location at all. I have had so many bad experiences checking out. If you have more than one order, they have a hard time following, also as soon as you get identified as an instacart shopper you get treated really terribly. I've never been treated this way when I show my own card so I am extremely disappointed. The employees seem to enable and encourage a toxic work enviroment towards a third party their company opted into. It screams entitlement and seems to be for absolutely no reason.

Usually my Costco visits are 5 star.  I must have hit them on a bad day.  First I went to the rest room after I shopped but found a dude just starting to put my groceries back. It was no longer than 10 min.  Okay not that bad I could tell he was new and they gave him busy work.  Now for the big complaint.  I got gas and they have new pumps that don't allow topping off.  Updated Review.  They seemed to have fixed the sensitivity issue with the pump shutting off early.  So back to 5 stars.

We had a good experience at Pocatello costco as we've always had with costco wholesale.
We bought gasoline from this location on our way back to Boise.
Good customer service as expected.

Great prices on some things compared to WinCo or Walmart, and some things are more expensive. You just need to know what you want. There is a lot to look at and consider. I love their food court and free samples. It has been worth the membership so far.

Love Costco. Wish they would put nicer people in member services. We had a small hiccup tonight and I tried to go to member services for help. The lady there looked like she hated life and told me to go find somebody in a red vest instead stating ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not dealing with this, I‚Äôm going on break‚Äù. Which, whatever. But if you‚Äôre going to work at the customer service desk at least try to pretend like you‚Äôre there for the customers.

We used to shop here weekly and spend an average of $1000 each time and to be honest, the goods and line of products are always fresh, amazing and well sorted. The workers and customer service however are awful. Pedro I believe is his name, is a star among rock fragments. He is overly helpful each time and he earned them any amount of favour and these stars. Make him the manager! Otherwise the help is awful, the people rude and the service certainly dry and demeaning at times. I have since began shopping at the location much further away and I avoid dealing with anyone who works in the costco stores unless I absolutely have to. I also have, firsthand, seen and heard other patrons expressing the same if not worse and being treated like cattle. I have a Sam's club card too so I have options.
I do most my shopping here.  Great prices. Great quality.  Unfortunately I have to go to the Idaho Falls store for some items or I'd give 5 stars.

It was so nice to have all kinds of help. Other people wanted to help me. And the employee's were awesome helpers to. I was on one of the scooter's. Because of a bad hip. I will be going back there to shop again.

Costco is a nice store. There's not too much to say, as it is a giant corporation, but for a soulless company, it's definitely in the upper tiers of the list. It would be my first choice for any shopping related things, as you can buy in bulk, and there's free samples. It's all around a pretty nice place.

I love Costco, but I must say that some of the tire and battery department employees are laaazzzy!  This wasn‚Äôt based on one visit, this is on three different occasions. These guys have absolutely no trouble showing you exactly how little they want to help. They will literally stand in front of you and make every excuse why they can not help you until you essentially force them to.
I‚Äôm surprised there aren‚Äôt hammocks hanging in between the racks so these dudes can take naps.
Some of the guys in this department must‚Äôve transferred to this store from the DMV.

This is one of Costco‚Äôs largest stores. All the shelves are well-stocked And the store is extremely well-maintained. No trash or shopping carts cluttering The isle ways. One of Costco marketing strategy is to keep moving things around so you have to search entire store for your items. But eventually you‚Äôll find what you‚Äôre looking for. I am not one to use the self check out but I made an exception on this visit. The team member was very gracious and patient at my grumblings of having to check out my own groceries. I have nothing but good things to say about the store

What can I say except I love Costco. I have continued to shop at Costco since they first started opening stores in the area where I lived and have continued to shop there for many, many years. I am most definitely a Costco fan.

Very nice costco. Plenty of products. I was happy to see they had rainx windshield wiper fluid in aisle 112. The staff are very helpful and very professional.  Jorge at the tire center was very helpful and knowledgeable and assisted me with my purchase and scheduling of my appointment for tire installation.
Best pesto I have ever tried. Tempted to buy the Macallan 18 but it's expensive. Bought a bunch of baby clothes for our soon to arrive twin grandchildren. Awesome cherry cheesecake

Costco is a shopper's paradise, offering an extensive selection of products at unbeatable prices. One of the things I love about Costco is the quality of their Kirkland Signature brand products. From organic foods to household essentials, Kirkland delivers top-notch quality at a fraction of the cost of name brands. Additionally, their electronics section is a gem, featuring a wide range of gadgets and appliances with competitive pricing and excellent warranty options. Lastly, the food court is a personal favorite, serving up delicious hot dogs, pizzas, and their legendary rotisserie chicken at wallet-friendly prices. Overall, Costco's combination of value, quality, and variety keeps me coming back for more.

Great place to shop. Large and roomy to accommodate crowds well. Produce and cooked foods are always fresh. Friendly and helpful staff who keep the lines flowing and shelves stocked. Vast variety of products and several services under one roof. Whether your family is large or small this is definitely the place to go to buy anything from clothes to electronics. Love the sampling stations!!!!

A Costco with a standard layout. Gets super busy on the weekends and the entrance to the gas station is horribly placed. Vehicles end up backing up traffic trying get into the warehouse due to the gas station queue. It feels safer driving past the normal entrance and enter via on Chosen Few Way to bypass the mayhem.
Aside from the traffic it is definitely nicer with better products, cleaner and brighter displays‚Ä¶ than the other warehouse clubs.

Our Costco standouts are (and most likely pays for the membership itself every year from the savings):
Great low gasoline prices ‚õΩÔ∏è
Free air for vehicles üöó

My recent trip to Costco's started off well, I picked up the items I needed, including a few extras that were enjoyable but unnecessary. However, when I opted for self-checkout, the experience took a downturn. As a former cashier, I understand the challenges of self-checkout, but this trip left me frustrated. While I meticulously scanned my items, simultaneously a cashier was also scanning my items which led to an oversight on her behalf, which turned into unnecessary scrutiny from another cashier. Overall, a mixed experience that could use some improvement in the checkout process.

I love shopping at Costco. Everything is always good. Very clean, friendly. Rotisserie chicken is amazing..I buy all my meat from here. Very good prices. The parking lot is kind of a death trap..lol Be careful walking you may get run over. But inside the store is great

I love Costco which is why I‚Äôm giving 2 stars instead of the half star it really deserves;

I wasted 2 hours in this store yesterday because no one is on the same page. Guy at the front door lets me in to do my shopping with my MIL‚Äôs Costco card, but gym class hero cashier Patty calls over her supervisor and turns my hour of shopping into wasted time.

So then I bothered my MIL on her lunch break at work for her to come meet me at Costco so she can stand there while I pay for my stuff. And guess what? Non gym class hero cashier scanned the membership card and rang me up like a normal human being and I didn't even need to bother my MIL.

This could have all been easily avoided if the people at the door actually checked the membership cards. But what Costco wants is to catch you at the checkout like they did to me, and then convince you to buy a membership since you‚Äôve already done all your shopping and wasted your time.

Well the parking lot is a joke. Whether your driving or walking. It's like Grand Theft Auto over there. It's a little chaotic anyway if you love buying in bulk Costco is terrific. Btw have your Costco card ready. They have better security than the southern border when it comes to wanting to see proof that you're a member. üëç

My family and I went here past Sunday to become a member and shop. Unfortunately, we were not aware that they close at 6pm but wthe staff let us in as we had 10 minutes to do the application. I forgot my ID in the car so I went to get it and one guy was in my face (his name is Tom) basically yelling at me to leave and talking over me. Not even letting me explain what was going on. Guy that was helping us at the desk had to tell him to let me back in. Man, I wish he put his hands on me and this store would be on the news again.

Didn't really want to be a member here but had to, so we would be able to save money when we go to Hawaii in June as they only have Costco there. Thinking of  not renewing next year if they continue to treat customers like this. Would rather shop at Walmart, Aldi's, Shoprite and Wegmans and avoid getting verbally abused by workers there.

I went here to get my tires done.... I can't tell you how professional Bridges was... I will say that he is firm and to the point and he knows his job that's for sure.... He was very informative and help... I had to order the tires in the app literally got them the next day.... If you ever need tires or a place to go this is the place to go... I live closer to the one on route 10 and East Hanover but I prefer coming early up here for the customer service... There is no doubt hands down at this place is a good place... It won't certainly before you see it is Bridges taking care of business taking care of the customers and also being 100% professional.

This is one of the best Costco in the area. It is always well stocked. The staff is very helpful. Returns are easy . Lines are well managed during checkout and returns. The cafe is cool and we love their pizza and hot dog .However, gas and alcohol would be great additions to this one . Maybe soon‚Ä¶
Great items at great prices, like other Costcos

Enjoy, my bi-weekly visits
and food court pizza great

Hot dog + soda combo best deal.
Never have spinach salad and are out of stuffed papers. This time I also opened up a veggie tray from them and it was moldy and celery was in decomposition:/. See pics, gross!

As always, Costco is a great place to shop... today, I was at Costco Cherryhill üçí, NJ
Almost everything you need is there.. today, I have some photos and a short video.
