The Costco is always busy. The cherry hills one is calm. They have most food other stores have. Also they have many varieties country foods.
Clean, big, organized.

The gas station is nice, organized too. The staff helps gasoline politely and efficiently.

I always enjoy shopping at Costco. As with other locations, I highly recommend avoiding peak times (the checkout line does back up horribly at these times). I usually go on weekdays after 7pm and have a very pleasant experience. Overall, excellent product quality and solid sales.

You can never go wrong with Costco! In addition to shopping my groceries there, members got to experience their phenomenally affordable $1.50 hot dog and coke in costco cafetaria. Cheap gas prices and assortments of costco apparels to boot. Have you heard of Costco gold bars? That‚Äôs apparently all the rage as well.

I love coming to this Costco because of the ease of finding parking and the wide array of items. I did notice they used to carry more Asian products but slowly those started to disappear from the shelves. Nevertheless, I love the live plants and always find interesting new items.

Costco Wholesale is the ultimate one-stop shop for all your household needs. The store is impeccably maintained and organized, offering a wide range of products including electronics, dairy, meat, and more, all at great prices. Keep an eye out for discounts if you're lucky! While it can get busy on weekends, the availability of self-checkout counters helps streamline the process. Overall, it's a fantastic shopping experience with ample parking.

Crazy crowded. Now the good news, everything we were looking for was in stock and the staff worked extra hard to make it the best experience possible. Thank you to the employees, especially Eli- formerly of the photo department. üëçüôå

I love Costco but this particular location is ALWAYS incredibly busy. That may be good for the company, but it strains the customer experience as we wait in long lines, long walks in the parking lot, lack of carts at the entrance to the store. All of which impact the experience. However, the quality of the items is always high quality, and worth the cost but some better management of getting customers in/out smoother would improve the overall experience in this location.
one of the best supermarket chains here in the United States, big place full of variety....the best.

This review praises a particularly large Costco for its vast selection, highlighting unique items not found in other locations, such as ice makers, slippers, lawn mowers, rice cookers, coffee makers, and sliding shower doors. I will  recommend visiting if you have time for extensive shopping, noting the ample parking space. Additionally, there is a Target nearby, making it convenient for a combined shopping trip.

Everything is so well organised in spite of it as an ocean of things !

Loved the staff ‚ù§Ô∏è kind and cooperative üåüüåüüåüüåü

Huge variety, neat clean well organised!!

This was my first time visiting this Costco, and boy, I told you it was so hard to locate anything and anyone. There's no sign to say what's down each isle. You just gotta figure it out. Which isn't helpful at all when you're trying to get in and out of a store. And finding help was even harder. The first person I saw I had to yell down a isle to get their attention for help. No, I didn't want to, but it was necessary in this situation. I was so over walking around for no reason. I did notice that they're offering flu shots in store. I wasn't interested but happy they had it available for the one that were. I also noticed they had 2 ppl on a register and a few lines closed, although it wasn't a long wait I didn't see the point of 2 ppl to a line when they could've just open other lines. But that is just my opinion and observations. The store was clean and well stocked and had things I didn't see in the union store. The saff was hard to locate until check out. I had a $1.50 hotdog after, and it was delicious. I can't go wrong with a Costco hotdog. The recipe checkers were extra on their job, we had different recipes and hr wouldn't allow us to leave until he saw both as if we did pay for or items or after we paid we walked back in to take something it was so wired and also nothing I am used to but I guess that was thought in training. If you're in a rush and need to locate something, try another location you'll be walking around for hrs trying to find it or someone to help.

Please make sure you have your membership id and member with you when you buy anything in the store. The staff won‚Äôt let family members pay even if the primary member is in the store. They ask for id at the entrance, at the payment and at the exit. I don‚Äôt know if they are losing more paying members or what, but this experience will make people want to cancel their membership card. It doesn‚Äôt make sense to check the card multiple times if they already checked it at the entrance. No one can get in without a card.

There is a lot of free parking, but watch out for carts that are left on the road. You might hit a cart that is not in its place when you drive out of the parking lot.

Great Costco. Packed, but not crazy packed if that makes any sense. There are other Costcos that I purposely avoid due to over crowding. This one is busy, but seems well managed. The gas station is a nice addition, but the gas station area really needs it's own entrance & exit.

Costco in Edison is one of the rare stores owned by Costco. The difference with the other franchises is, Alcohols are available inside the main store. This store has other facilities too such as Tore center, gas station etc. lot of parking but very difficult to find one because it‚Äôs one of the busiest stores, mainly addressing to the Indian community.

Your Bulk Shopping Hub. Costco is your go-to destination for purchasing items in bulk, offering a wide range of products from household essentials to electronics. Despite occasional crowds, the attentive staff ensures efficient service and speedy checkouts. Indulge in their tasty ice cream and pizzas while you shop. Weekday visits are recommended to avoid long lines. While parking is ample, it tends to fill up quickly due to high demand.

This Costco is among my top choices for several reasons. Firstly, it's huge, offering a wide range of furniture, and it's conveniently located near a Walmart and a pet supply store. Secondly, they have an impressive selection of wines, which is quite rare, especially in New Jersey. Lastly, there's helpful staff at the checkout who assist in loading your cart, which is a big plus.

Best Costco I've ever visited. The staff were very cooperative, welcoming, understanding, and helpful. I needed to replace one of my car tires, they handled it in a highly professional manner. Additionally, they discovered some other issues with the tire sensors that I wasn't aware of, but they proactively checked everything and ensured that everything was perfect, fixing the tire sensor issue too. I truly appreciate their professionalism and effort. I've been to many Costco centers, but so far, they are the best

Firstly, the wine selection at Costco is nothing short of extraordinary. Whether you're a casual wine enthusiast or a seasoned connoisseur, the variety and quality of wines available are impressive. The prices are unbeatable, making it a true haven for those looking to explore new flavors or stock up on their favorite vintages. Costco's commitment to offering high-quality wines at reasonable prices is a standout feature that keeps me coming back for more.
Beyond the wine, the monthly shopping experience at Costco is a true delight. The warehouse store layout is well-organized, making it easy to navigate and find everything I need. From household essentials to electronics and beyond, Costco truly lives up to its reputation as a one-stop-shop. The bulk packaging not only saves money but also reduces the frequency of shopping trips, a convenience that I greatly appreciate.
Whenever I shop for anything major, I check Costco first, and they never fail.  My daughter needed a sofa, and of course,  Costco had the best deal.  This is a Thomasville.

We recently became members of this Costco after many years of my dad always saying how great Costco is.  The starting yearly membership is $60 and the in store signup computer issues, staff error input and card printer not working are the only cons I experienced at Costco.  Costco offers larger/bulk quantities of items I would normally buy at a good price.  It does payoff as we saw many non perishables that we could buy in bulk - such as bottled water.  Overall this location seemed clean, well organized and had many good deals on items.  The staff at Costco was a bit robotic, meaning they do there job routinely without any being friendly.  I feel the $60 membership will eventually pay for itself when I purchase more items in a visit for BBQ‚Äôs and non perishable items.

Always crazy at Costco‚Äôs! But worth the money, and the staff never disappoint! Always seem content and happy, even the gas attendant‚Äôs! Must be something good in the punch at lunch, cause as hard as they work, theres generally nothing but smiles. Good organization‚Ä¶
I go and shop at Costco every other week and I love the stuff there. But honestly? Christmas in August....already?? Let's get through Labor day at least.

Costco Wholesale is a shopper's paradise! The vast aisles offer everything from bulk groceries to electronics at unbeatable prices. The quality and variety of products, coupled with the friendly staff, make each visit a seamless experience. The membership perks and the well-maintained facility contribute to the overall satisfaction. Whether you're stocking up or exploring the diverse sections, Costco Edison is a go-to for value and convenience.

Checked out this location today. This is a business center location, it‚Äôs different than other Costco location I have been to. Everything sold here is in real bulk. They do not have fresh seafood unfortunately. Lots of halal products which is great. Would definitely go back to this location to buy more in bulk. Would love to see fresh seafood added.
Love this place. Not your traditional warehouse as it caters to businesses. Staff is super friendly and it‚Äôs never super crowded. Always get in and get out.

Great place to buy candy. You can buy a lot of efrutti candies in the Costco Business Center. It is much cheaper than any other stores. Moreover, it is huge, so you an buy some specifical things that you cannot see in Costco Wholesale.

I unknowingly went here not realizing it was a ‚Äúbusiness center‚Äù Costco. I had never heard of that before. I admit I was pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed it. It is geared toward folks running a grocery store, restaurant and things like that. There is no food court, clothing, books and stuff.  However I still got the Kirkland alkaline water I wanted, soda, berries and then surprise items like cracker jacks, sausage I‚Äôd never seen before, and some other drinks I never see at a normal Costco. It was a nice surprise. They had a whole pig for sale there too, for you to put on a pole and fire roast, never seen that at a Costco. Great meat selection to include steak boxes of a variety of types and sized steaks, I was impressed. It wasn‚Äôt busy and easy to check out.
Selection of kitchen supplies is disappointing. They only carry two chef knives, 7 inch and 10 inch.

The service of this location isn‚Äôt effective. When you enter store, you are required to show membership. Once you get to self check out, there is always someone blocking to present membership again before making payment for your items. It‚Äôs waste of time as this is done while multiple self check out are open and this is counter productive. This takes away from quality of experience shopping at Costco. Costco needs better process in place to validate membership and re train your employees.
Love love my Costco I never shop in a food store too expensive

Cookie was good. Julie at the food court is always nice and friendly. Best employee at the food court. Shopping experience was great the dude handing out the cheese samples very nice. Best employee that does samples. Clean store. Best Costco.
Well priced good quality products but need to buy in bulk. You also need a membership to be able to make purchases here. The return policy is easy and super quick. Usually crowded on weekends.

I absolutely love coming here, we originally signed up for them to be able to actually take and continue getting gas from them, but there are several things here that I do love to get that is better than anywhere else I can get it. We even got a really nice new silverware set here for an amazing price and we really needed it. The people that work here are super nice and very helpful. Will continue to come here for many years to go.

Stopped in about half hr before they closed.  Needed something quick for dinner.  Excellent selection. The pics are only a few pre-made selections available.  I got the chicken Alfredo and wow!!!!  So good!!!  Woman at customer service helped me log into the app for the 1st time which was a little bit of a process but she was very helpful.
During the day their associate Gracelynn who's usually checking memberships or receipts is a sweetheart!!  Nicest 1 there!

Costco has a great variety of items and food.  The food is not consistent.  Products are in store sometimes for a short period.  They are very strict with membership. They do not allow shared memberships.

My boyfriend has a membership here, and we do enjoy coming here when shopping in bulk. My reasoning for taking a star off is the fact that they only accept Visa payments. What if I don‚Äôt want to use Visa and would prefer Mastercard or another version of my credit card? Dumbest rule I have ever heard of.

Costco is getting to big for themselves. I bought a membership so my daughter can shop for me. They would not let her have the card, that is part of membership, because she is not in my house. Checking card at door feels like institutional shopping, I will not be renewing membership, will stick to BJs.

This location has a pharmacy and eye center.  Greeters are very friendly.  Good selection of items.  Wish they had a liquor store attached, as the Kirkland brand alcohol is a good buy.  Tire center I have had a good experience at.  Also a gas station with very competitive prices. Customer service is always very helpful.

This Costco has a wide variety of items, and there's a selection of many different types of flowers for sale at the entrance. Right inside the door, they also sell fragrances at prices lower than those on the official website. Besides these, what I find most noteworthy is the drop-off point at the entrance for donating unwanted old clothes, which is something I've never seen before.

This location is clean, has lots of variety, and great prices. I have the executive membership, but it only pays if you spend a lot there. As a single mom of one, we do not spend a ton annually. I end up breaking even or losing out on having an executive membership. If you have a larger family, I am sure it would be worth the extra cost. I recommend getting the Costco credit card because it helps track up bonus points. This Costco does not have alcohol, but Edison does (your memberships works at all locations). The $5 rotisserie chicken is the best deal going! It is so moist and delicious! I love the availability of produce, spices, clothing, prepared foods, etc. The taco kit is üí£.

This location is awful and truly not meeting Costco standards. I have purchased refrigerated items on multiple occasions (some offenders being Kirkland parmesan cheese, carton milk, and pre-cooked bagged chicken) and these items were badly spoiled a few weeks before their expiration date (shortly after being opened). I was worried about my fridge temperature so I bought two fridge thermometers and that was not the problem. Food from other stores has never presented an issue either.
I still shop there because I haven‚Äôt had an issue with the eggs spoiling yet; however, the organic brown eggs have been completely out of stock on my last few visits in the past 3 weeks at least. Disappointing product availability here. Save yourself the time and frustration with this overcrowded store off a treacherous highway and go to a different location or club altogether.

I remember previously the price was $3.99 this time $6.99 that's fine.

I like costco, and of course I do shop a lot in it. I used to love costco for the best fresh fruits. Just, for some time already, fruits they have are old, spoiled, not good.
This time all fruits I got there turned out to be spoiled.
Raspberry, mandarins , blackberry all not good. Very disappointed. Where did all the quality disappear???

Specialty foods are always a plus. The prices are certainly surging but still a savings for many items. Customer service was okay.
The food and aisles were neat and filled up.
The taste testers were out around 1pm today, and that's was nice. The flowers are always beautiful too.
Definitely recommend them. We have used them ourselves and recommend them to our customers for bathroom accessories.

Doesn‚Äôt carry popular Indian food items; best eg. organic rotis, Nanak sweets unlike other Costco stores; this Costco doesn‚Äôt even carry fresh ginger  (see attached picture from other Costco branch)

First time shopping in Costco with my daughter who has a membership. Made a purchase of over $400. I had three credit cards in my pocket. they olny except Visa. So I had to leave my daughter standing there and run out to my car to get my Visa card. I wonder if these people realize it's the 21st century.

Love to buy stuff in Costco. Everything is of good quality and much better prices.

This location has a gas station, tire center, pharmacy and optical center too.

I must recommend the tire center! My husband had his car‚Äôs tires changed from Costco Tire Center quite some time ago. Then one day he got a flat tire and another with nails in. I drove the car to have the tires fixed but was told that they were not reparable. So they had to replace both tires. To my surprise, they were still within warranty and I had to pay not quite even 1/3 for the replacements!

Costco consistently impresses with its high-quality, affordable clothing and diverse food selections. Every visit is a delight, capped off with their delicious and well-priced pizza. It's a one-stop-shop for value, variety, and taste, making each trip enjoyable and budget-friendly. I enjoy its pizza and very affordable.

Costco has been our favorite store to shop for a while but NOT today. They do not mind to spend few minutes to collect donations for the cause of children which is great, but they said that they do mind drawing quick smilies on the receipt during the checkout at the exit as per new policy. When you take your young kids to the shopping and get lot of stuff, spend few dollars for donation at the cashier but cannot have smiles drawn in literally 3 seconds on the receipt anymore, seems to be the Costco Management problem. This issue should be fixed. Lately, customer service at this store has been poor. I think the management should hire more friendly and happy people or they ll see their customers going somewhere else.
Costco wholesale market very good very big one good staff thanks Costco üòä

Nice location and very good parking . Crowded and it takes a long time to Bill !! Courteous service . Good place to shop ..

I like this better than Edison location - 1) billing is quick and less crowded . Whenever we pass by north Brunswick , we try to get our provisions from here . Returns also take less time than Edison .. there are also other shops around and they have their Costco gasoline ‚õΩÔ∏è service .  Employees are very helpful and always smiling .. the only issue is - placement of items is totally different than other Costco locations . Ex - milk produce , fresh produce etc are in different places and we had to search for them . Otherwise it‚Äôs a good experience overall

I love Costco!

I like that they have a wide variety of things and sometimes it‚Äôs just good to browse while doing some targeted shopping as well. Shopping in bulk has proven to be more economical in these times, it‚Äôs worth the visit.

I highly recommend this Costco for its comprehensive selection of products, many of which are hard to find elsewhere. You can discover an array of items ranging from various types of printers and computer cases (making you think you've stepped into Best Buy) to refrigerators, fireplaces, stoves, and washer-dryer sets. It's an excellent spot for young couples setting up their new home. Additionally, they offer car seats for infants and, in the fruit section, you can even find exotic choices like lychees and papaya. The entire store is spacious and well-lit, creating a very pleasant shopping experience.

The parking lot is so big wide and spacious, costco gas is good. Very busy in evening times have to wait in line at least 5-10 minutes for gas. And coming to Costco wholesale the store is quite good clean and well maintained. Wide range of variety selections for customers. And here also same the checkout counters are very busy have to wait at least 10-15 min in queue for billing in evening timings

I am sick of this location. I mean why do you always have to be rude at customers? When I come to Costco, it means I am a member. When I show my card at the entrance, why make me show you my card again before I pay at the self check out? When I do then you‚Äôre like turn it coz I need the picture. Seriously why the audacity? Not even okay thank you. Secondly, some customers enter without showing their cards and it‚Äôs okay but not on others. Thirdly, after I check out you make sure you count my staff which are arranged in order of the products and you can easily see the total if you know math like if I arrange in line each line having 4 items x 4 lines. Why count like 4 times yet you clearly see the total number of items on the receipt. I always forget to check your name but I will come back here to make sure I see your name and will send your cooperate an email to train you guys on how to be nice to customers.
I am so sick of some staff who clearly just play with other people‚Äôs businesses. Shame on you!!

Definitely my favorite chain store.  I can easily find any product I'm looking for.  It works with an annual subscription system, but thanks to the points it gives at the end of the year, you easily get back the subscription money you have given.  The products are of very high quality.  You can also easily choose the products produced under its own brand.  The staff is very interested and friendly for your problems.  I definitely recommend you to choose it for your shopping.

I love this Costco! The ones near me are always beyond busy and out of control, but we usually have good luck here. The workers are also very friendly and on top of it.

We drive over 50 minutes just to go to this location for the better experience it offers.

We have been coming here for the past 10 years and it never disappoints. They have great employees, a nice variety of products, and excellent food. One of the best locations I've ever been too. On top of that, they never change their food court price!

Hi-- today I encountered a young man by the name of Billy in your tire store.  What a wonderful young man, he is so kind and considerate trying to help me with my tire issues... he was so helpful and I am extremely glad he crossed my path today... Thank you Billy for your patience and kindness today...Costco is lucky to have such a great person working with their company....  Sherri S.
They have a great selection of merchandise at fair prices.  I visited the store on Sunday it was so busy never again. I'll go during the week, worth the trip. Great pastry.

Costco consistently delivers an exceptional shopping experience. The membership perks, from bulk savings to exclusive deals, make it worth every penny. The product selection is vast, ensuring I can find everything on my list and more. The quality of their Kirkland Signature brand is consistently impressive. The spacious aisles and efficient layout make for a stress-free shopping trip. The food court, with its affordable and delicious options, is an added bonus. Costco's commitment to customer satisfaction, coupled with their fair return policy, sets them apart. Whether it's groceries, electronics, or household items, Costco remains my go-to for unbeatable value and a seamless shopping experience. Five stars well-deserved!

I want to call out Brendan for giving outstanding service on a few different occasions now. He is the type of employee that keeps members coming back as he is professional, handles situations as they should and provides the best customer service around. On another note, employees should not be harassing customers to upgrade to executive membership every time we come to the store, these tactics were leading me to not renew my membership and Brendan was able to take care of the situation without even asking.

Big giant store üè¨ where you can get everything you need in house hold (groceries , vegetables, fruits, chocolates, dry fruits, breads,  clothes, Television , mobile, artificial jewelry, bags, electronics and garden supply etc. See pics and videos for more details. It's crowded in the weekend and getting out of parking is also time taking. Lot of parking spots are available. You need membership to use this store. They even have real kids play house and play area. They have garages, benches, camps etc Thanks üòä

My mom and I had scheduled hearing tests today. We can not say enough about the service the staff provided at the Hearing Aid Dept. Both specialists, Brian and Harry, were exceptionally thorough. Brian, went above and beyond trying to optimize my mom's current device. The reception staff were pleasant and patient.
We've used other Costco Hearing Aid locations in the past. This location makes the visit a pleasant one. Thank you for your professionalism and taking pride in the important work that you do!
Costco has great produce! Love the strawberries, blueberries, and salads! Costco has a terrific selection of men's and women's clothing. Also, their bakery items are delicious! Great place to shop!!

Friendly staff and good items in store. Would say it's the same as BJs and Sam's Club really. Few items are better priced as they come in bulk. Was very hectic when we went but overall good experience. Only difference from those other membership only stores is that they have a gas station on site and a fair price.

What a poorly conceived and designed store. How there aren‚Äôt car accidents every single hour the store is open is beyond my comprehension. I also see road rage incidents in the parking lot almost every single time I am here. The store itself is fine but it needs a footprint about twice the size and more than a handful of single lane entrances.

Overall, ok store. But too crowded usually. Avoid returning prodyct here unless you want to waste 30min of your life.  Line out the door for return and one lady working and the other fixing her stapler for almost 20 minutes. But 4 people checking receipts for people exiting.
Ridiculously large amount of people fighting for spots. I saw a live fight for one! HUGE Costco with gas. Food Court closed. Not worth the headache of crowds.

Costco‚Äôs never disappoint! This was a large warehouse that had a separate store for liquor purchases so don‚Äôt expect to see a wine section inside. The selection of items were quite impressive from fresh sushi, ready made foods, to sandals and throws. I felt that this was overly stocked with snacks though, instead of toys or electronics. Overall, it‚Äôs a very busy location with difficulty finding parking on a Sunday afternoon, so be prepared to walk a bit.

As for the liquor options, lots of tequila and vodkas, including some premium at prices quite high than other Costco‚Äôs in different states that I‚Äôve found.

So sad to leave this review here. Unfortunately, üíØ customer satisfaction is no longer part of the policy.

I tried to return a ring that was purchased a little over a year ago, and, surprise: it's no longer returnable. Anna, RoseMary, and Joe, the store managers dealing with my case, started to investigate the entire account, looking at all the purchases and returns.
They did not include the short timeframe of my returns, or that I replaced the items that were broke.
Apparently, the conclusion and advice were: DON'T BUY jewelry from Costco if you are not satisfied.

I just visited this store and was not treated well or with any aspect of customer service, and I would honestly have to say it felt like racial discrimination. The most annoying thing as a Black person is the exhausting burden of being racially profiled, from being ignored at the optical section with merely a simple question to then them shutting down the section whilst still ignoring my family, to then having manager tell a rep to scan all my items for me at self checkout as if I cannot be trusted, disgusting in 2024 that it‚Äôs acceptable to treat people this way

I visited on a Monday around 1130am, very crowded. In reading the other reviews I guess it doesn't matter when you go it'll be crowded. This a very organized store with really friendly and helpful staff. Shout out to Evelyn, I signed up with her and she was super friendly and helpful, all staff I encountered were. I also signed up for the credit cards as well for the gas benefits. I even got a care package. Great store to buy in bulk. Thank you Evelyn.

I've always been a fan of Costco, and this particular location is just the right size‚ÄîI can always find everything I need. Weekends tend to be crowded, but the best time to visit is during the week, especially right before closing, as there are fewer people.While the cashier service is generally fine and I've never encountered any issues, I can't say the same for the food service‚Äîit's quite disappointing. They take a long time to attend to you and are slow in preparing the food, which can be frustrating. Overall, while the store experience is great, the food service could definitely use some improvement.

Nice to see New Jersey has the JUCE. This is the only drink My kid can have there‚Äôs no red dye. No artificial junk. So easy to mix with water. And the price you can‚Äôt beat it. I usually buy it on Amazon. It‚Äôs a lot more expensive.

A great place pleanty of food and nice employees. They have stands where you can try food from the store for free and there are pleanty of toys of clothes, good prime steak and they have good clothes too.

Never buy tires for your car at this location, specially if the sales person is Rahamat K, my appointment was at 9:30am came here at that hour, and he made me wait until 10:00 am just to say that they aren‚Äôt able to put my tires on because the cardholder wasn‚Äôt present when in the first place they never mentioned the card holder needed to be present just to install the tires after she had already bought them and payed them, THE WORST SERVICE EVER!! They don‚Äôt even wanna give me my money back because I have to bring the ‚Äúmember‚Äù who is pregnant and now have to come to deal with this disgusting thing.

This is one of the best designed Costcos around here. Huge parking lot, with easy parking. Huge and easy access shopping cart corral. Much larger walking space for shoppers getting into the store, larger main aisles and larger side aisles. Plus nothing blocking the cash register area, so the lines are much easier to manage compared with a traditional Costco where the cash register area is a mess filled with an extra row of food and snacks limiting and chocking the line of shoppers waiting to purchase to just 2 or 3 carts before the line has to bend in a huge mess.

The location itself is very convenient being next door to the Willowbrook mall, BJs and a movie theater.

Prices are awesome for almost everything. If something is not on sale, just be patient and come back again another day.

The only negatives I have pertain to all Costcos and not just this location:
Negative 1 are the Pantene shampoo and conditioner bottles used to be $9 per bottle until Bidenflation hit and now overnight the price jumped for no reason.. both are now $14 per bottle.. same stuff inside, same volume/quantity, same quality but price is $5 higher. Not made of gold or precious metals. Just greed. Luckily Costco realized the mess of this mistake and now often drops the price to $9 on sale usually once per month since at the $14 price not many people are buying it.

Negative 2 is the Costco milk bottles. Years ago the bottles were identical to normal grocery store milk bottles. Then they redesigned the bottles to be a more square shape. The two problems with this new design are the safety seal and the pouring dynamics. The new safety seal is nearly impossible to remove without hurting yourself or using a knife or fork to stab it open and often I see these milk bottles with faulty seals that didn't totally seal or they sealed it in a way you can turn the cap all the way. Lots of defects and way worse than the traditional milk bottle seal. The pouring dynamics are also terrible. The new bottle shape makes it extremely difficult to pour the milk without spilling it all over the place. Really bad. Just bring back normal milk bottles please.

Negative 3 is the Kirkland brand bottled water in the 40 bottle case. These bottles used to be slightly thicker and slightly bigger caps which made the bottles stronger and caps would perfectly seal no problem. Then around a year ago some idiot at Kirkland redesigned the bottle to have less plastic to save Costco money, but rendering the bottles and water inside useless. If you drop the case by accident, more than likely a bunch of the bottles will pop open and spill everywhere due to the weak and very thin plastic and very thin caps that pop off if you barely touch them. And if you even carry 1 bottle it is likely the cap will pop off just holding it. Please bring back normal bottles and caps for this. In the mean time I buy Poland Spring water since they use normal thick water bottles with strong caps.

Negative 4 is Kirkland brand paper towels. Again in a stupid move to save money, Kirkland removed all the individual plastic wrap per roll of paper towels. So if you open the main seal holding all the rolls of paper towels, each roll can now easily get dirty from dust, spills, rain, snow, insects, dirt, falling on the floor, rolling in your car, falling on the ground outside.. there is now nothing to protect all the unused rolls. One of the most stupid ideas they ever had.. don't be fooled by them saying it is to save plastic. It is for them to save money and charge us full price while making all your unused paper towels in storage much easier to get dirty becoming useless and then forcing you to go back to Costco and buy more rolls sooner. So I buy Bounty towels instead since they are logical and still have individually wrapped rolls to protect your unused towel rolls that are in storage.

100% would recommend this place. I personally love shopping here anytime of the year especially around the different holidays. They always have what I'm looking for and more. They bring in a lot of cute and cheaper things for the holidays. The selection for the whole store overall is very good as well. If you are looking to buy cheaper and in a bulk this is a great store to go to. They do have a food court as well. A lot of people stop here for a quick bite or a snack. You can also get a water bottle from their vending machines for only .25 cents. If you need something cold to drink. The store is always clean but very busy during the day and on the weekends. The lines move fast and they do have a self checkout area as well while moved quickly. This store is very nice and big with plenty of parking. I would recommend not going during the busy times so you have time to really see what they have.
They have Many Excellent sections within the Store!!! My favorites are the ‚úîÔ∏è Bakery, Hot Foods, Produce, Electronics, and the FLOWER Section !! üå∫ üå∏ü™ªüåºüíê

Nice store but why tell me why do i need to present my Costco membership card when i walk in this store??..u can't purchase anything without the card and I understand you might not want people just roaming around your store but there's inconsistencies between this store and your store in teterboro New Jersey where they don't require you to show your card when you walk in...& please please stop drawing stick figures on my receipt when I exit the store.  I'm trying to leave & u are just delaying the process. There's a line of people behind me trying to get out and you're drawing a stick figure on my receipt. Absolutely ridiculous!

So ANNOYING that items are constantly moved to different locations inside the store! I know they think it will cause their customers to impulse buy, but more often it just causes aggravation because it takes us longer to find our items! I come with a list, so I know what I need! I just want to get in and get out! What an incredible PITA!

This Costco is perfectly suited for individuals with standalone homes or apartments, offering a wide array of gardening products including flowers, shovels, and outdoor essentials, virtually catering to all your needs. Additionally, this location boasts an impressive selection of wines, making it a must-visit for enthusiasts. Lastly, situated in a bustling plaza surrounded by various other shopping destinations, this Costco allows you to fulfill multiple shopping needs in one trip.

What service!!  Beyond amazing. I bought a new outdoor furniture set at Costco . I had to rent a truck to bring it home.  The fire pit was defective!  The manager, Mark, went above and beyond to help me. So thankful! There are still amazing wonderful people out there! Mark is one of these exceptional amazing human being!  Also to mention Bill helped load my truck for me. Great Costco !!

They have a variety of items you can‚Äôt find somewhere else. The staff is very friendly and do a great job a keeping this place organized. The parking can be a challenge sometimes. They also have a gas station.

I'm a huge Costco fan.  With that said.  You guys need to pick up your coffee game.  I bought coffee at Wayne last month and this week in Wharton.  Someone in your store needs to buy a 2.5 pound bag of coffee and try to grind it in your store.  Its a joke.  Both places there are no scissors and no one knows where to find them.  Problem 2, your grinder only fits half the bag of coffee.  What exactly are you supposed to do with the rest of the beans if they won't all fit into the grinder?  Last there is only one grinder.  Please do better.
Come here on the regular. Great people always helping customers. But come here for bulk stuff. And I love the new kids amazing.

I love this Costco in shoreline! They have such great deals and I called in a pizza today and they let me get half pepperoni half cheese. Best pizza I've had in a long time and I just cannot say how thankful I am for the price. You do such a good job Costco team. Thank you from the bottom of my heart

Costco is the usual story... you must buy in large quantities and be satisfied with a limited selection. They are not always the best price/value. If you spend time at other local grocers and pay attention, you can get better deals. There are a great many things you can not get here, for example, fat free milk. You can't buy fat free milk at Costco; that makes no sense. Fuel is a great deal, but don't buy on the weekends, the lines tend to be huge.

As long as there are charged scooters available I'm pretty happy. But it's hard to get Citron/ginger tea in the jar, more times out than there, twice no Curry powder and the Chicken Tortellini soup has changed from little chunks of chicken to shredded so fine looks likeno chicken, doesn't taste as good as it use to either. Probably won't buy it any more.

Cashier staff needs more training in customer service. Husband's membership card was shown at the register and he had stepped away to grab something and would be back before the cashier finished ringing everything through. I let the cashier know, but he behaved like I stole the card and was being incredibly condescending. I understand their need to enforce, but his behaviour was way too hostile. Cashier name was Joe.

The staff at this Costco are so great. Self checkout is always a breeze. There's always someone there to help you scan heavy items while in your cart and make sure you have empty boxes available to pack up your stuff. There's usually at least 3 people checking receipts on your way out so it's always efficient.

I just wanted to share about cookie you can get here at the Costco Food Court. The cookie is served gooey and warm. It is probably the best $/calorie item I've ever seen. 750 calories for just $2.49. Enjoy!

The Bellingham Costco did an amazing job with our wedding cake! We dropped in orders for multiple sheet cakes, divided up with frosting lines into pieces to cut and little icing flowers on top, and a smaller cake for us. They were all their vanilla flavor with cheesecake mousse inside. They had all our cakes available by the specific date & time we indicated and we were able to easily pick them up - and they were a HUGE hit! It was such yummy cake, according to many of our guests :)

We also purchased all of the alcohol for our wedding here, and it was great to be able to return the unopened units after we got back from our honeymoon and settled in again (within 60 days of purchase). They were a great deal, and we don't drink but our guests loved all the options!

How does one describe Costco in BHAM? Simple , organized chaos, granted there are days that you can get in and out with minimal collateral damage but I won't divulge the local secrets! They always have what we need and more! A wonderful assortment of wine and meat for the smoker!

If you are familiar with membership stores , how they sell in bulk at reduced prices, this one has a pretty good selection. Anything from fresh produce, organic too along with the regular selection. Be advised to buy here it is best to have a pantry and a freezer of decent size. I have a small chest freezer in the garage for the overflow from the fridge/freezer in the kitchen There are tires, household goods, electrical appliances, and sometimes flooring. Clothing and shoes are always stocked. Much more as well. The membership rates have 3 different levels I use the one that gives a store voucher every year which pays for the membership with a little left over for shopping. It is probably worth a 5 star rating, but the prices of some of the things like meat, and a few other things are still market price with no savings. They do have specials on occasion. Gas at the pumps is always the best price in the area. 10 to 30 cent cheaper per gallon.

This Costco was very clean and the staff were super friendly. Despite the parking lot being as full as it was, the lineups and wait times to check out weren't very long. They did have samples out, and those who were offering them seemed knowledgeable about those products. Awesome prices on all products, as they usually are at Costco! I'll definitely visit again when I'm in Bellingham.

The manager at the optical department in Bonney Lake, Carl, went to a lot of trouble to help me get my new lenses correct. He went above and beyond, helping me get the lenses to my satisfaction, and was always polite and smiling when he helped me. I will not hesitate to return to the Bonney Lake optical department when I need a change in my glasses.
Newer Costco, easy to navigate, fast cashier lanes, lots of parking. I like going to this Costco!

I love this store, and not just Costco in general. The staff is always kind and helpful. The associates at customer service are always patient and knowledgeable. The cashiers and assistants are always quick and accurate. They keep it clean and organized. Love it!

Great Costco though there is a very rude woman who works at the returns area with long auburn hair and legally blonde style glasses that is incredibly rude and abrupt with how she talks to people.  If it was a one time thing, I‚Äôd understand she was having a bad day.  This is just about every interaction I have with her.  She comes across incredibly disrespectful, loud and curt with how she talks to people and was literally shaking her head and rolling her eyes when I returned about $30 worth of merchandise today.  No it was not a dead Xmas tree or a half eaten cooked salmon.  It was some unopened beer and cider and brownie brittle.  I spend over $10,000 of merchandise per year at Costco and returning a few items here and there is not against the policy.  I‚Äôm not sure why she is so rude but she‚Äôs the last person people they see when they leave the store and it leaves a lasting impression of her attitude towards customers when they are treated so poorly.  Sadly, it makes me not want to return to this Costco due to the multiple bad experiences and due to the fact I can‚Äôt avoid seeing her.  Someone with subpar customer service skills and anger issues probably shouldn‚Äôt be handling returns.

Always impressed with excellent customer service and products at Costco. Thank you to the management at Bonney Lake's Costco and Optical department. 10 stars for coming through for me. Long story short, I took my glasses in for a new prescription, and wanted to keep my AirDrop Oakley frames. Unfortunately the frames broke while removing the old lenses, but they were able to locate my frames, which they don't carry. Thankfully I got the frames I love, and my new prescription within a couple weeks. Personal thanks to Carl, Rita, and the assistant GM Steve I believe for making this work. It was bit of an awkward feeling since they don't carry these frames and I wasn't sure they could get them.
Thanks team Costco! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

One of smaller Costco fuel stations. Still very nice. Easy in, easy out. Clean. Pumps have long hoses for fueling on either side of vehicle.
No staff at this location.

The online ordering keeps zeroing my info out when I try to do a different delivery address from my cc billing address! Has done it five times and I tried different ways to change it! Frustrating! Need better ordering  website! My shipping address is stored so why does it want to change it to my po box billing address?
Why? Why? Why?

My visit was around 4:30 pm on a Tuesday. It wasn't too crowded, easy to find parking. They have friendly and helpful customer service. Among other items, I picked up the street tacos (ready-made meals located in the back of the store).  They were delicious.

I found a reclining chair that I was interested in purchasing. There was a price tag above, but I didn't see any in a box. I took a picture of a chair price tag. The cashier at the self checkout looked up the merchandise code and had someone bring one to me from their inventory.  They loaded it into my vehicle.

Things change and so has Costco.  I enjoyed the better pricing once given and the image that gave Costco. If you shop you may save elsewhere.  I would like to be a bigger part of Costco if you know what I mean,  we earned it.

Store needs to address the massive pileup of customers standing at the checkout area waiting for food. Maybe move the food court to the exterior like some stores? Also, they don't keep things consistently stocked. Whoever does the ordering needs mentorship from more experienced stores.

We love our Costco!

We have never had a bad interaction with anyone here, even other customers. It's a relaxing place to shop, at least for us.

We grocery shop here at least once a week, sometimes more. There is always a good variety of just about everything you would need. Not just food either. The gluten free and vegetarian options are slowly growing and we appreciate it.

The bakery is always a good go-to for a birthday cake (that buttercream filling!) and their pumpkin pies are insane.

The deli has saved the day for dinner on more than one occasion. The taco kits and rotisserie chicken are our favorites.

We also love that we can buy good quality affordable clothes here. They don't jack up the price like everyone else does.

Staff was really friendly everyone in the store looked like they were making good money the guy at the desk told my mom that a certain computer would be able to handle the steamvr's graphics but it wasn't had to take the computer back to get a better computer with a better graphics chip only to get home and open it to find out that the screen has pressure marks all over it causing white spots when the screen is black I don't know if it's Costco's fault or the people they got it from but it is upsetting and it's costing me a lot in gas to keep going back and forth

Tire Shop doesn't answer their phone.  Why have phone access to Tire Shop?  What's the purpose if you can't answer the phone?
You may be busy, but that's not an excuse nor a way to treat a potential  customer.  How would you feel in an emergency situation you tried to call 911 and no one answered?
Love that their ‚ÄúAT&T‚Äù representatives send us back to the stores to fix all the problems they create and the stores cant fix any of it. Bunch of scammers and fraudsters.

Awesome except for the pharmacy is being remodeled and then they're not actually restocking anything until afterwards and that's unfortunate cuz it's where I pick up most of my clients extra pharmacy stuff

Amazing, helpful staff at the Covington location. I was in self checkout and a man walked up and said here let me get that for you and scanned everything. Its so hard now days to find good customer service and so far I've been treated amazing at this Costco! 10 stars!

This location is rather busy, but it wouldn't be that way if it were a bad store. The parking can be tough, but there is usually somewhere to park as long as you are willing to walk or wait, even on the busiest days. I have never had an issue with the employees at this location. The bathrooms are clean and so is the entire establishment.

Another thing worth mentioning is that this location is a test location, meaning they will test new food court menu items here, which makes this one particularly enjoyable.

Probably one of the best Costco in the Puget Sound in terms of ingress/egress. The city did a great job paving roads, making it an efficient big box in stellar structural layout. That being said, employees need diversity training as most hourly workers are from isolated and culturally insular local communities. Costco may not have the proper training protocol nor the professional resources to create change. Most corporations are on the same boat. Starbucks was under scrutiny in this respect. Sustainability of a company is largely based on how well you treat all customers, not just those who belong to your own ethnic group.  This could be a good challenge for Costco to take on as a trail blazer in corporate America. Corporations can set an amazing example by making their sales/profitability success a cultural success for the better community.

Extremely crowded.  No parking available anywhere in the lot. Handicap parking totally full.
They have such few new items. It's repetitive shopping for years of the exact same items over and over.  Clothes are very bad quality and they sell so much of the same thing soon everyone is all wearing the exact same thing as everyone around you
Every time the bring in a new item such as cookies that are different the chocolate chip or donuts like lemon ones you buy it fall in love with the item and boom they never have it again!
I am not going to renew my membership after being a member since the company first opened..  I don't need the repetitive items in huge containers in my life anymore! I would prefer more options of regular grocery and clothing items! I like being unique and my clothes not to be made cheaply in bulk! Quality is better than quantity!!!

I actually ended my 30 year membership! Not a fan. The employees seem extremely overwhelmed and always unfriendly.
Had a fridge here shock me with electricity.
A women hit me with a cart.
Beyond horrible cashier.
But hey it‚Äôs Costco.

Been Costco cardholder for nearly 35 years, starting at the Airport Way Portland Costco.  Lots can be said about Costco.
The business is an amazing story. Over the years I've been consistently amazed with the return policy, no one else even comes close.   Prices are excellent on most items, but like every store, you can find better bargains on some items elsewhere, but its not by much.    Merchandise is typically of higher quality than elsewhere.  You need to consider that when comparing with other stores.   BTW, check out the COST stock.  Its been amazing performance, and I would recommend it as a long term investment.   Yes, they are cracking down on the membership thing.  I find it annoying too, but I understand its because that's their business plan.   The vast majority of Costco profit is in membership, not in the product itself, which they sell at razer thin margins.    Our family easily gets the annual membership fee and much more back from the 2% annual reward.    They have avoided raising the membership fee, although I suspect its coming, as well as scanning the membership card when you enter the store.

We visited Costco for a Door Dash order.  Other than it taking a long time, the it was a good experience.  We were able to complete two orders.  We had to come back to return a order that we were unable to deliver.  Slow service time but we were able to complete the order.
The staff were so kind and patient. Shoutout to Jake and Trish!
Love this store but they need more organic products and wild caught fish and shrimp. Lots of good buys and product diversity. Store does get very busy so plan accordingly.

Visited about 3:00pm on a Tuesday and Costco was manageable regarding customer volume.  Great service from the employees out on the floor.  They were busy straightening the shelves to make it nice for the next customer.  The employees at the checkout were curt and all business.  No time for being nice as by the time I left around 5:00pm there was a lot of activity.  I found great deals!!

Always a great price! Everett Costco parking you can usually find spaces not to too far away. Love these Fitchrunch Bars, Castello vintage Havarti cheese and La Boulangerie Smoked Ham & Swiss Cheese Pockets.

Nice store pleasant people although the food court needs to get a handle on their pizza making. Took me 45 minutes to get a pizza that I called ahead for but they were just handing out pizzas as people came in and not holding one for you. Extremely busy they were yes but

I just started shopping here the last month and I know what you‚Äôre gonna say. You‚Äôre an average, so you get what you get in Everett. However, the staff has been amazing with the exception of this evening, when I made the very rarely, but still happens mistake of bringing my service dog with me. There were at least three other service dogs in the building and they try to trick you upon walking in, as if people with service dogs don‚Äôt know that we can have them when and if we feel the need to have them where we need them. Anyways, my service dog as an emotional support service dog and is trained in anxiety in addition to my husband‚Äôs heart condition. That said, one of the cashiers came up to us and politely asked if she could say hello now I see why many people with service dogs prefer to not allow people to pet their dogs. This woman was extremely kind, and  truly grateful to be in the presence of my dog. And as we left, my dog responded to our baby talk with one bark, we said goodbye and as I walk out the managers seem to feel it necessary to stop me. Ask me if I‚Äôm OK and let me know that dogs only bark service dogs only bark when you‚Äôre going to have an episode. He was clearly  passive aggressively trying to challenge my condition or my dog, seeing me giggling and laughing and smiling and waving goodbye knowing I was not in any kind of distress, but just felt the need to go out of his way to make me feel a certain kind of way. It takes a special kind of person to have , this regard toward dogs anyone really. And I‚Äôve only come across it a handful of times through years of having a service animal. Hopefully as time goes on, I‚Äôll be able to update this review because the rest of the staff seemed extremely kind, warm, and even fun to banter with the several times I‚Äôve shopped here so far. I just don‚Äôt understand what compose a person to take time out of their life to go and negatively impact somebody else‚Äôs day  I guess I will never understand that.

I shop here way too much. I'm here at least 3 days a week. I buy a lot of things.... Wines from Costco Reds of course Whites don't count and as you know everything else people buy from Costco but their wines are at great prices....
Always my favorite place. Great quality grocery and fresh fruits.

The Costco Warehouse in Enchanted Parkway is one of the best companies to go to for your grocery and household needs. They have pretty much everything except the one thing I need. I was looking for the Food Container with Silicone protection on the bottom. They didn't have it. However, I got tons of other stuff.

I love the variety of products Costco has, and for this location, I feel like it has a lot of ready-to-eat cooked food, such as rotisserie chicken, BBQ ribs, pizza, hot dogs, and more.

Lots of people go to Costco late in the afternoon. I suggest that you go early and get it done before the ‚Äúfools rush in.‚Äù Per Elvis

Store design fail.  Came to Costco to see about a good deal on large appliances.  They managed to put out their products without prices.  Maybe the prices are buried somewhere in the tiny print on their displays.  The world may never know.

If ya thought I didn't care about prices, I wouldn't be coming to look for a good deal at Costco.  *head to forehead* Major fail.  Do better!

Otherwise, this is a decent Costco.
Not sure why Costco ushers are super lax on allowing dogs in store. One morning and there are at least 3 dogs walking around in produce and food sections. Pets are NOT ALLOWED in gorgery store.

The quality of customer service has gone down so much at this location. I shop here every other week and usually only have a couple items, one of which is dog food. Because I only have a couple things I use the self checkout. It used to be someone would come and scan the dog food for me but this is the third time in a row the checker ignored me. I had two this time look right at my bag of dog food and walk away. When I spoke to member services about it, she just brushed me off and said, "well I don't know how it's supposed to work over there." If you can go to any other Costco, go there. This one is so bad now.

Costco is renowned for its exceptional membership-based service, offering a vast range of high-quality products at competitive prices. It distinguishes itself with a bulk purchase model, enabling significant savings for families and businesses alike. The stores are well-organized, with sections ranging from groceries and electronics to clothing and home essentials. Customer service at Costco is top-notch, with friendly and helpful staff ready to assist. The return policy is generous, giving customers peace of mind on their purchases. Additionally, Costco offers unique services such as pharmacy, optical, and photo printing, enhancing its one-stop-shop appeal. Overall, Costco's commitment to value, variety, and customer satisfaction makes it a standout choice for shoppers seeking both quality and economy.
Best kept secret. Not crowded. The employees are the friendliest. Great products. Only ‚Äúproblem‚Äù is the VERY small personal care area (medicines and hair care). Love this store.

I love Costco! I think I might love the business center the most! Short lines, great selection, friendly staff! Easy parking! What more can you ask for in a Costco! They have so much to choose from and a large selection of items in bulk. I loved being able to get in and out on a Saturday! Great deals and smaller crowds! Perfect!

There are some distinct differences between the Business and regular Costco for sure. But if you view them in that perspective I would say you could strike an excellent shopping balance. For example, I grill with charcoal alot and I normally wait for the sale to get the Kingsford Professional Charcoal bags. But I miss the sale more than I catch it. However, I just recently noticed the Business Costco stocks them more often than the regular Costco. Also, there is more of a variety of larger bulk items that may be used continuously; such as chopped salad or coffee for those mass meetings or luncheons. The mood at this business store in Fife is alot different than what you'll experience at the store in Tacoma. It can give off an unfriendly and uninviting vibe by the staff. But when observing those who shop here they are extremely focused on what they're getting. So, I didn't notice much engagement because everyone is in and out with blazing speed! But it's not an excuse for subpar customer service.  I observed and experienced it from a few of the employees and they could demonstrate just a tad of professionalism at the exit door and the checkout lines.

For businesses and bulk-conscious shoppers, Costco Business Center in Fife is a great choice. They consistently boast well-stocked shelves, offering a wide variety of products from office supplies to restaurant essentials and even household staples.
What truly sets them apart is the good value.  Their bulk prices are hard to beat, making it a fantastic place to stretch your shopping dollar.  Plus, the customer service is excellent. Professional and helpful staff are always there to assist you, making the shopping experience smooth and efficient.
In short, if you're looking for quality products at unbeatable prices, with top-notch customer service to boot, Costco Business Center in Fife is definitely worth checking out.

This is by far the best Costco to visit.  It's not packed with people and the checkout lines are short.  There are hardly any kids and there is no food court, and they don't serve their rotisserie chicken or any hot or cold foods, it's a business center.  You can get in and out quickly.  I stopped going to the other Costcos, I can be in and out in 30 minutes or less!  Fabulous location!
It‚Äôs a hobby of mine to visit Costco while traveling. I love to see what product is carried regionally and I always pick up local coffee as a practical souvenir to take home.

I had an outstanding shopping experience at Costco! The store was incredibly clean and well-organized. From groceries to electronics, everything was available in bulk at unbeatable prices. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, always ready to assist or answer questions. The checkout process was remarkably efficient, with minimal waiting time despite the busy atmosphere. I was also impressed by the variety in the food court, offering delicious and affordable options. Costco truly stands out for its excellent customer service, great value, and diverse product range. Highly recommend!

Employees have little pride in their work at this location. If you ask for your items to be boxed they literally throw a few items in a single box, scatter the rest in the cart and give you empty boxes so you can work on it in the rain outside yourself. It‚Äôs super fun to have 50 loose items in a pickup truck bed.

Lanes are purposely closed when checkout line is backed up, the entire experience is poor, I won‚Äôt be renewing membership.

Employees aren‚Äôt dressed professionally very poor management at this location.

Would you like your raw chicken to be removed from the bag, scanned and then left out of the bag and placed on your fresh blueberries? Would you like your electronic device you just purchased thrown in the cart with backspin? If so the Gig Harbor Costco will help you with that!
Great place to shop, very clean, well stocked, organized and great employees.  I love coming here at least once a week. I always find great products at reasonable prices!  One of my favorite places!

Awesome service! I was in their car repair center. And they did a good job. All the payment process was really fast. Also the guys that work in there are very kind. We needed only two tires fixed, but they checked all other tires, and filled up some of them with air. :)

Well the fact you need a membership to get a hotdog or slice of pizza now days sucks. Everything is overpriced for being in bulk, in my opinion- a lot of items aren‚Äôt actually cheaper than online or in a store like Safeway. So it takes a lot of math to make sure you‚Äôre getting a good deal.
The parking lot and check out lines are always a nightmare. We had a horrible time with the tire center here. They literally lost our car keys for an hour. Overbooked, understaffed and overall I think the prices need to be better to justify the experience of going.
The only positives are - good pizza for cheap, good produce for decent price, good frozen family meals and the pharmacy has always been pretty quick and fair.

Hello Heaqurarters,

I wanted to share that while I understand why we should love the fact that 50% less plastic is being used for this high volume product, the sustainability factor after opening the bag goes down significantly which creates an issue for storage and cleanliness.

Subtracting plastic from another product perhaps is a better plan as now we must open the entire bag and expose all the paper towels at once.

I‚Äôm sure this is saving Costco millions of dollars but it‚Äôs inconvenient as I have had to purchase additional plastic ware to house this product in storage.

Purpose defeated. üòû

Good store, well maintained.. James is a wonderful person, always helpful and brightens up the shopping experience. On the contrary there is one cashier (brown & racist towards brown people), which leaves a sour taste. Ignore that lane and have a good time at this store, highly recommend it.

Sushi made in-house is one of the best features of this Costco location. They have nigiri, rolls, and sashimi made with real crab, tuna, salmon, and scallop. The real crab California roll was good. I preferred the salmon to the tuna nigiri. I need to try the scallop sashimi.

PS If this review was helpful, please "heart" it. Thank you!

Not our favourite Costco at all. Very crowded and people are savage
The food court was outside
The sushi were surprisingly good!!

Great staff! Shawn, the new GM there is a stud.

They have lots of liquor options and Human Touch massage chairs are there now!!  Amazing ü§©

I just enjoy the experience of Costco... Awesome deals abound... Some of the best prices and great selections... I found my favorite coffee "Peet's Major Dickerson's blend dark roast coffee"... 75 k-cups for $39.95... they do have a wide variety of coffee's... They also have air fryers which are multi-purpose... There's a fantastic bakery...optical dept...Produce... Wines beer and liquor... Meats fish cheese salads etc... Chips crackers... freezer and refrigerated sections... Computers TVs washers dryers toiletries and the list goes on...it is always jam-packed... Make sure you have time when you go shopping at Costco... It is worth the adventure and make sure before you leave you get an all beef hot dog or my other favorite is there Caesar salad with rotisserie chicken...deliciousüòÅ

Only complaint is people stand in the middle of the aisle talking oblivious that people are waiting for them to move. I can't imagine how bad it would be if there were an actual emergency or fire in here. Walking traffic  employees guiding people in on move over, and tell people to plan to meet up to talk later with friends in the deli area, would be great.
Each Costco has some unique products which makes the shopping interesting.  We were searching for gluten free products.  Excellent selection if you peruse the aisles.  Cashier service is efficient.
It was very busy on a Sunday afternoon. Staff was friendly and nice.   The staff told me the best time to shop was right after they open.

I love Costco but I‚Äôm only leaving a review for my fellow truckers, this is my first time delivering to this location or any actual warehouse location (I‚Äôve done distribution centers only) and their receiving hours are from 4am to 12 noon. There is NO OVERNIGHT PARKING according to the signs so plan accordingly.
UPDATE: So I went to speak with the manager (David) and explained that I had a 4am delivery and asked if it was ok to stay overnight, he very nicely told me yes and that he had no problem as long as I could move from where I was currently parked. I also appreciate Stacy who was at the door and was very helpful and said she‚Äôd be doing security until about 11pm and thanked me for asking and letting them know. I am a Costco member and I appreciate the associates.
I feel the quality is decreasing, this is new bought oranges has at least 4 of them already rotted. We all trust the Costco‚Äôs quality to save our time to select things, little disappointed:(

On weekends, it's becoming increasingly crowded, and even weekdays, especially in the evenings, tend to be quite busy. This Costco branch is relatively smaller in comparison to others, but it still manages to stock most of the essential items. Personally, it remains my preferred choice.

This Costco has almost everything, including the gas station, food court, and every department.
Most items are in stock and they have promotions and sales very often.
It gets very busy in store and gas station in the evenings, especially Friday night and Saturday.
Half of the staff is knowledgeable and nice, half are not so much. We ran into issues multiple times, for example: the pharmacy provided incorrect info over the phone and I wasted a trip; when we opened our membership, the associate made a few mistakes that we had to correct later; another associate ranted negatively about kirkland signature brand product we were looking for in his store! Overall, customer service is OK.
Nice location. Good selection of items. We got all we needed.

I never had a Costco employee that refuses to scan items in the cart with hand held right after double verifying I was a member. Even after having plenty of time just standing there she never offered to help. It's position is taking from an actual working human. I expect this from other big box stores do better COSTCO!

This place has a little of everything. We were traveling through town and of course it‚Äôs my wife‚Äôs favorite to put gas because it saves us some money as well as gives points on the credit card. However, she wanted to go inside to use the restroom and then it ended up getting some snacks and foods for the travel journey also. Moreover, since it was our wedding anniversary, she selected some jewelry too. so it is a great place which ever way you look at it.
Great place to shop especially if you have a freezer and a food saver!  Love the snacks.   Every one of them tempts you to buy more.

Every Costco has it's little nuances. This one is just 15 minutes away from the one we typically shop at yet had several items we can't get at the other one. And, vice versa. Costco is pretty much an American treasure

I have been a member of Costco for year's but not anymore.   I went in this afternoon and even though my mom and I both have cards she can't find her card so I showed my card and she paid and they told her she needed to use her own membership card to check out if she was going to pay.  This is a ridiculous policy and why do they care who is paying for it if they are getting our money?  People lose their cards all the time and to have a policy like this is outrageous.  Go to hell Costco and their CEO.

Lake Stevens Costco is the best! Super friendly and helpful staff. Great products that provide an exceptional value. 32 gas pumps means you never have to wait. Easiest in and out of any Costco I've been to anywhere. Self check out staff are especially attentive and helpful. Consider reading the book The Joy of Costco to better appreciate this amazing company.

My local Costco consistently provides a fantastic shopping experience, thanks to its friendly staff and exceptional service. From the moment you walk through the doors, you're greeted with a warm welcome and helpful smiles from the employees, creating a welcoming atmosphere that sets the tone for your visit.One of the highlights of shopping at Costco is the ample parking available, which eliminates the stress of finding a spot and allows you to focus on your shopping needs. Whether you're making a quick stop for essentials or stocking up for the month, the convenience of accessible parking makes the entire experience smoother and more enjoyable.The staff at my local Costco goes above and beyond to assist customers, whether it's helping you locate an item, providing recommendations, or answering any questions you may have. Their dedication to exceptional service ensures that every visit is a pleasant one, and I always leave feeling satisfied with my shopping experience.Overall, my local Costco stands out for its friendly staff, ample parking, and exceptional service. Whether you're a regular shopper or visiting for the first time, you can expect a positive and stress-free experience that keeps you coming back for more.

I‚Äôve been shopping at Costco for a very long time, this review is more about Costco in general not just Lake Stevens. Back in the day Costco used to be about quality products, yes buying bulk saves money but you could always count on getting a high quality product. These days I‚Äôm not sure we save much money and the quality on most products are not good at all and is you start looking at where their products come from it‚Äôs mainly from China. I know it‚Äôs hard to not get anything from there but I was shocked to see how much food products are from China. Yes it‚Äôs cheaper but they have almost no regulations so you don‚Äôt know what kind of low level poison you are ingesting. Another thing is that I used to go to Costco almost weekly because the produce was so good, I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs because ok Stevens is not as busy as other locations but the produce has been sub standard for a long time now. I get much better quality at the grocery store and because I‚Äôm not throwing a bunch away I am saving by not buying from Costco anymore. Lastly you have always had to show your card at checkout and someone checks you‚Äôre product as you leave. My last visit was a tough one, I had to wait to get in because they were checking cards, had to wait to check out now there is a long line to get out because they are checking every single item, I snapped at the gal checking products and grabbed by receipt from her which was rude and wrong on on my part so I apologize for that. I called and talked to the manager and apologized and asked why they they were checking every item instead of a quick scan.he pretty much blamed it on the checkers and it helps them save on shrink. Well it is actually the checkers instead of making your customers feel like criminals and making us stand in line to get out of there why don‚Äôt you install cameras and watch the check out process. It would save us all a lot of grief!!

I love this Costco! Not only is the location great, but the parking mlot is big and the gas station has more pumps than any other Costco in the area. I‚Äôve  never had to wait to get gas.
The store layout is convenient and items well stocked. The employees here are friendly and helpful and I‚Äôve always felt welcome (I‚Äôm there a few times/week at least).
Definitely one of the best Costco stores I‚Äôve been to.

Good options to buy. Just don‚Äôt fall into consumption what you‚Äôll never consume it before it expires. Also be prepared for crowds and busy parking. I do find it is ridiculous to have to pay to spend money there (membership).
The Food court has good priced options specifically if you‚Äôre not on a restricted caloric diet.
It's Costco. It's got great stuff. The best cheap lunch ($1.50 hot dog & drink) in town. What's not to love...

This store is a zoo. Plan to wait in checkout lines for longer than you spend shopping. Also, they won‚Äôt let you pay with your Costco rebate if you self check, which they don‚Äôt tell you until after you get to register. Would not recommend.
Great selection of items at the Lynnwood Costco. Not too crowded and relatively easy to find a parking spot.
Good, clean location, but sometimes there are too many customers. Staff is friendly.

Chef Alfred Lewis here! I just received my Costco Executive Card  yesterday!!! My son Austin and I visited there together for the first time! This place is huge!!! A large section of everything!!! Great quality stuff!! My only complaint was with the hotdog from the food court area!! Y‚Äôall need to add chili and cheese to the sidebar!! That‚Äôs all!! Believe you me, you will like it!!!

Compact and minimal-frills version of Costco, catering to business owners, though regular Costco members are welcome. Generally is less crowded with shorter hours and calmer vibe. For the record: NO free samples, concession stand, tire service, pharmacy, optical, clothes, books, toys, alcohol (though they do sell tobacco), etc. On the other hand, they do offer a broad array of business supplies such as cleaning agents, mops, brooms, buckets, uniforms, gloves, bags, wrapping and packaging material, bathroom equipment including electric hand dryers and foodstuffs which you won't find in the regular store like whole frozen Australian goat and lamb.

Gangway! You may find yourself shopping alongside massive carts where clerks are diligently preparing delivery orders 8-10 boxes at a time. All said, come once if you're curious. Come often if you want to fill up on cheap goods and services for your business.

Only the Costco business center sells the commercial Rubbermaid yellow mopping bucket. Not bad price, $57 plus $12 for mop head and mop stick.

I‚Äôll be back to the Costco business center, they have larger cuts of meat and other grocery things as well. Overall smaller store but focused on small businesses or if you have a party this is the place to go for cuts of meat, dairy, snacks, etc.

Parking was easy, and they are open on the weekends too.

I had the worst experience with the service at this store, especially as a colored person. I spent over $300, only to be told at the exit that the items at the bottom of my cart were not scanned or paid for because they couldn't find them on my receipt. The employee called for help to check my order, but nothing was found. Meanwhile, other customers with bigger carts were hardly being checked, simply because they were not of color.
I became frustrated as they continued to go back and forth, claiming something was missing but not being able to figure out what. It didn't make sense to me, especially since there was no self-checkout and everything seemed to be in order. When I asked for my order to be canceled, the employees completely ignored my request and continued to rescan all my items.
