Feeling fed up, I decided to walk away and reiterated my request to cancel my order. Despite nothing being missed in the end, one of the employees was told to bring the items to me as I was leaving the store. I am deeply disappointed and upset at how they treated me like a thief, selectively discriminating against me even when nothing was found. It was a terrible experience, and I will not be returning to that store again.

This place is amazing, with a wide variety of sections and unique items you won't find in typical Costcos. Most of the staff are friendly and welcoming, but I had a not-so-great experience with a newer employee at the membership desk, I think his name was Brian. He seemed impatient and treated me as if I owed him a lot of money. Hopefully, it was just a one-off bad mood and not something that happens often.
Good collection of items in bulk. Very big cold storage with a lot of variety of halal meat ü•©but I could not find organic items.
This location Adds a sense of warmth and connection to your typical Costco visit by making it feel like a familiar and friendly encounter.

Not overly crowded at noon on a Thursday, all the employees were pleasant and the food sample providers were helpful. I only purchased 5 items, no wait at self-checkout. In and out in less than 10 mins.

So what's the trick for consuming fresh produce and bakery items bought here?  Consume within two days or eat the $ you spent?  NEVER had food rot so quick as the items bought here.  Nothing lasts more than 2 days before turning.  WTH, Costxo???
Besides them changing out they're hot dog buns it's pretty pretty awesome place, their return policy is 100% satisfaction guarantee on everything except for electronics.

Love Costco. Don't like the new roast chicken bag. The old clam shell thing served as a handy tray for slicing and digging into the chicken, you could flip the chicken around in the tray, get pieces of, and snap the lid back on. The new bag sucks for getting a piece of chicken off the chicken. Putting your hand into the bag gets chicken grease on your hand. Taking the chicken in and out of the bag is greasy and a PITA. Much harder to get pieces off the chicken while it's down in the bottom of the bag. Bummer.

Finally tried the roast beef sandwich. It was completely saturated with mustard.!! Gobs & gobs of dripping mustard! The bottom chabatta bun & lettuce were ineatable from the amount of mustard oozing out everywhere & making a huge soggy mess. Save your $10 on this one & stick with a hot dog!
Eye center is amazing and the staff were very helpful and they have a fair selection
Costco is great when buying in bulk. The society their is kind and courteous. We always pick up something in the food court! Check out their new chocolate chip cookie in the food court!

I have a love hate relationship with this store. I love some of the deals that I pay to get, however I hate how they question you on a sale, or price... I pay to be treated better than a Walmart shopper!!

Packed! The selection has diminished, prices have increased and if you think the line is long for checkout, it's way longer to get out the door because they individually go through your receipt and cart before leaving! Yeah, no. Won't be renewing this year.

We bought 137 different pies for our company, to take home to their families for Thanksgiving.

As busy as Costco gets, they made this easy, user friendly, and took good care of us! It's no wonder people shop here as much as they do!
I like the store, huge assortment of anything you might need, with reasonable prices

This is a very busy Costco, but it‚Äôs always clean and the staff is friendly. If you want to find items that are manger specials look on the far left side of the store towards the alcohol. The manger specials have a price ending in .00, which means it‚Äôs the lowest price.

My child has issues with walking due to medical reasons and while shopping with friends one of the sample stands workers offered my kid a green(vitamin?) Drink my kid said no thank you and was asked again if he wanted it and was more pushy that my child take it we walked away after that and the second time of kid saying no later that night friends told us that said stand worker had mumbled under her breath as we walked away if my kid didn't take his vitamins he'd end up staying in that cart have contacted the stores manager

*UPDATE* My recent trip was much better, it seems like they have been reading reviews, thank you. I am updating to 5 stars.*
Like most people I enjoy Costco but lately the extra policing and harassing for your card is unnecessary. We are already carded when we come in, let me check out in peace please.

Never been to a Costco in the West coast and there is a different selection of food and items so it was pretty nice. Went here to stock up food on my trip to Seattle. I tried the mango smoothie at the food court and I liked it. They don‚Äôt have the mango smoothie at my local Costco store in the East coast. The cashier was friendly.
Great place! Very crowded over the weekend, but lines are fast. I love going to get my groceries and I like it has the gas station.

I think this is the best Costco in the greater Seattle area.  The layout of the store and parking lot are better than the older Costcos.  This place is still always busy, but the way it is laid out make it less frustrating.  The fuel station also has 3 pumps in a row so it handles a lot more traffic than a regular one.
The store happens to be in a counter clockwise setup, rather than the clockwise path that most have.

Huge wholesale stores for shopping for bulk buying at warehouse prices with great offers. To be a member and shop for all your household essentials from vegetables, groceries, electronics, computers, garden, furniture, etc.

Excellent shopping place for grocery, electronics, clothes and other household items. It does have some additional south Asian grocery items to cater to the larger diaspora of the south Asian community in the neighborhood. Also it has the best warranty for electronics which no other retailer could match.

I mean, you already know what you‚Äôre getting with Costco that dollar 50 hotdog and soda combo cannot be beat and that alone is a reason to have a membership here but I had another pleasant experience today where I bought a expensive item around $400 and then I came to Costco today and I saw that the thing that I just bought was like 80 bucks off and so I wanted to refund place. I asked him if they could credit me back and they said yeah because you purchased it within 30 days we will happily Give you a refund to the amount of the discount so that way you don‚Äôt feel bad about the purchase so that was a really good experience for me. I really liked it. Happy to continue being a Costco customer. The people here are quite nice. It does fill up a bit early like as soon as Costco open at 10 AM there‚Äôs already Hella people in the parking lot so yeah plan accordingly I don‚Äôt know why people come here to get the gas in the car wash the car. The gas is not that great and the car wash pricing is just like it‚Äôs OK like what even need car washes in Seattle but whatever.
U

I only go to this Costco when I happen to be in Seattle. The most frustrating thing about this location is the parking lot. On busy days it can be a long and frustrating time to either find a spot or just to make your way to an exit to leave.

The one advantage this Costco provides is they have a reasonably priced car wash. Even when the line to get a car wash looks long and daunting, the line generally moves quite fast and the wait time isn't too bad. It's been since I purchased gas from this location (I go to the Federal Way location where their gas price is significantly less expensive), be aware of the yes or no questions at the pump as you may inadvertently buy a car wash that you didn't intend to. I am so used to answering yes to 'printed receipt?' that I didn't even realize there was a car wash question.

As far as the store itself, it's mostly like all the other Costco locations though it seems like it's a slightly smaller location so there may be some items they don't carry. This location is also subject to the Seattle sugar tax so prices on soda and other sugar sweetened items end up ridiculously expensive.

Went there for a hearing aid update. Was busy as usual.
Next day for a eye exam test.  Because I have noticed a few things that are not quite as clear as  a couple years ago.
And the test devices say I need stronger power glasses.
Stephen C HAYES üëç

I have found shopping at this Costco to be pretty smooth considering the large crowds and massive store footprint.

Pros: friendly staff, good prices, Kirkland store brand is usually good quality, cheap pizza (served hot, or bake at home), good service and workmanship at vision and tire centers. Pharmacy is responsive, helpful, friendly and affordable.

Cons: staff can be hard to find if you have a question, some products are poorly organized, you don't need 144 ounces of that sauce.

I visited this Costco local on a weekday morning.  I filled the car up with gas first, then went into the store.  Everything was clean and the merchandise all neatly stacked.  It's so nice how everything is labeled so you know what you're getting and what you're paying.  The produce looked fresh and the meat department offered a variety of options at incredible prices.  I always come away from Costco feeling I've gotten a good deal and saved money.  Well worth the annual fee.

Gas is always a bit less expensive than the others, regionally. Parking is easy with wide aisles. The employees are happy and helpful. The seasonal Christmas decorations are very beautiful. Seasonal gardening supplies and plants are always spot on. Marked down items are an additional bargan.

Love this place,  bargain cloths when they are out of season or closing out the lot. Sometimes all the wrong sizes for me but sometimes they do have to right size and its below $10. As Bob Barker used to say " the price is RIGHT"  Then the rest of the stuff in the store; delicious bakery items, deli items, love the chicken salad and  fresh baked croissants! Sometimes there is close outs on food items really great prices  . Also tires and car batteries, home electronics really BIG screen t.v.s too bad nothing worth watching but great prices on Giant screens!  Lots of Apple stuff tablets, watches, laptops if you are a fan boy or girl. Personally I love android all the way. Love this place, been a member since 92' oops dating myself.  Did I mention we Love this place!

Great selection which changes regularly. You‚Äôll find everything at this Costco. Clean. Friendly employees. The receipt checkout employee found a double charge on our receipt. Handled quickly. Very helpful! Love this Costco!

What can you say about Costco that has not already been said? It truly is one of my favorite places to shop. The Sequim Warehouse is fairly small compared to the other Costco locations that I have visited , but I always manage to find something that I didn't know that I needed. The people that work here are great, especially in the pharmacy.

One of the quietest Costco's around - this is my local, and i'm very appreciative that it is not jam packed like other Costco's that i have visited. :)  Staff are always super friendly, and very helpful if looking for something that has "moved" from its last place.
Really well run Costco.  Plenty of room to get around really nice service.

The best wholesale membership store, period! Only drawback, store is often crowded and you have to buy in bulk.The $50 annual membership is covered quickly with the savings that are offered. A good grocery, hardline, and soft line selection are offered. Sample stations throughout the store to highlight promotions. Enjoy the variety of meats, deli, and alcohol selections. The food court can sometimes get dirty with a lack of upkeep, but they do have spray bottles available to clean the area before you eat.

Went in to have an eye exam and had the greatest experience. Dr Hammond was very knowledgeable and personable and that's something that you don't find every day. Loved the compassion, and the gals upfront were so nice and comforting also. No one really wants to go to the doctor necessarily but it was a very good experience for me. And America's best said that my pupils were too small? What is that even supposed to mean? Eye techs atCostco laughed at that one, the captured my eyes perfectly! Thumbs up worth it 100%

Love Costco..! Great quality products in bulk prices. The food court is the best with great prices. Unfortunately the seating area can get dirty with no cleaning. Also you might not be able to get a drink top or straw for drinks.

Went to restock the house on some paper products and was turned away at the counter. Apparently, households can no longer shop independently. Small business Costco pinching pennies, I guess.

Plenty of other great options in the area for bulk purchases, and paying exorbitant member fees, (now apparently double per household,)  just to drive out of the way for "cheap," gas has hardly been worthwhile. It's probably the excuse I needed to cancel our membership.
Ann Marie and Yoni at membership were so helpful and got us all squared away with a new membership and helped set up the app. We love Costco!
Nice big store, I miss the coffee roasters that used to be here, it‚Äôs just not the same anymore without them üò¢

Great store! Winter/ Cold Gloves on sale!! That was great!! Being in a hurry means I left the pizza on the top of my car and drove off! Now to find my receipt and they will replace the pizza üçï!  Also always check boxes because when I got the house, the convertible Balaclava was empty.... bummer

I am at the food court waiting for my pizza. A lady comes to the counter to pick up her food. She a DOG in her arms!! Are you freaking serious????? It's a food counter. I am glad my order is in a box and not sitting on the counter. You need better hygiene rules. The employees were shaking their heads. No common sense from that lady .

This is the Sprague location - Spokane WA., the food court employees are really nice and helpful...they don't seem to be in a hurry to go home - that's new! The parking lot feels smaller and tighter but there is still plenty of room. It's very orderly here. The lines at the cashier aren't as long right now even though there are a lot of people here. This location is so busy...I actually got a table to eat pizza and have some Coke for! The area is mostly business so there is much more home shopping to do, the freeway is like right there. Sprague is a main street but traffic is not so bad. The location is like nearly dead in-between the Valley and the city.

Good central location with everything that I need. I especially love getting my economical rotisserie dinner for 3 under $28! The cashiers are great and always ask if I find what I‚Äôm looking for. However, I can‚Äôt say the same for the floor staff. Some are quick to avoid you if it looks like you‚Äôre searching for something or contemplating a purchase like the young gentleman I included in the photo. I wanted to inquire about one of the TVs but he was more interested in watching instead of assistingüòû

Very popular place, and all the time, it is very busy.
Great product range but, to find the right product it would take times.
Gas prices is affordable but always long queue.

I like Costco, but with the inflation the prices went up quite a bit.
But I still appreciate the produces that are provided and service of Costco.

Employees don‚Äôt have energy to greet. Checking receipts are slow at the door which showed inefficient work flow. The employees should consider consumers‚Äô time value as well. Spending time talk to customers at the exit made the traffic slow down too much!

Gave attitude to my 8month pregnant mother when she asked to have her items scanned, got told she can scan to smaller items herself. Long wait times for the food court, employees are rude. Would not recommend going to this location.
Puyallup Costco is so much better, the employees there are friendly and courteous, and it doesn‚Äôt take almost 40 minutes to get a hotdog.

It's my first time at this Costco, and I usually frequent other locations. Bought steaks, veggies, salads‚Äîcouldn't wait. The meat was top-notch. Then, at home, two excellent waiters awaited, catering to my every need‚Äîan exceptional experience from start to finish.

I find this particular Costco store quite challenging to visit. Firstly, navigating the parking lot is a real hassle, especially on weekends when it's consistently overcrowded. The shoppers sometimes appear to lack common courtesy. Despite that, the store offers a wide range of quality products. However, I had an unusual experience with a staff member at the entrance. When I briefly examined some clothing items, an employee abruptly interrupted her tasks and asked about the size I needed in a somewhat impolite manner. This was unexpected, as I've never encountered such a situation at any other Costco.
Perfect place to get groceries. Don't have a lot of options for electronics and don't sell bicycles here. There are currently many good deals for sweets and snacks for the upcoming Halloween!

I enjoy shopping here. I seem to find things I didn't even know I needed, as well as the things I do need. Employees are always very nice and helpful. As long as they are, here I'll keep coming back to the Tukwila store.

I love this store's size; I drive down occasionally from Seattle due to the broader selection‚Äîa large parking lot. The only sour taste was when a manager yelled at an associate about a phone within earshot of multiple customers. Praise in public and correct in private is a management philosophy they should maybe teach.

Beautiful store, well stocked, very friendly staff.

Love the new healthier options.

I've shopped here from the beginning when it was Price Club, then Price Costco.

Love seeing more high quality Kirkland items.

I always love going through the costco checkout stand. I love having tow employees there and watching them interact. Always smiles on their faces and having fun. The employees at the doors checking receipts always make the process feel good. I always thought they were checking to see if I stole something (maybe they are) but recently they've made comments about checking that I wasn't charged for too many multiples. It changed the feeling from me being potentially bad to them protecting me.

This five-star rating pretty much goes for all Costco's because, I love Costco! And who wouldn't? Quite often being single and retired, a lot of times I don't take advantage of the quantity they offer. But what I do buy there is totally worth the membership fee. I buy lots of meats then vacuum seal and freeze them. And then dried and jarred goods I also take advantage of. And now to the important part. The food court!!! Are you kidding me?  $1.50 for a huge hot dog and a soft drink. Not to mention the pizza, while you're shopping and saving money? I only wish they would bring back the onions lol.

Prefer this location over others nearby. Even though always packed with customers, atmosphere seems friendlier & staff more courteous. Great prices & deals, considering inflation. Keep up the good work.

Always friendly staff and definitely can't complain about the selection of products. When I need something that's not on the shelves, they're more than happy to help me find it and let me know when it's going to be available in store.

I always love a trip to Costco. Even if I'm just shopping for a very small amount of necessities.  Winter clothes are available for reasonable prices, and we're talking only name-brand, quality clothing. Nothing super cheap, (and here I AM referring to the value, not price) or broken, but also nothing really unique or original either. The clothing is all plain and basic necessities. I have quite a few things in my wardrobe from here that I wouldn't buy anywhere else, even if I could. Most of my camisoles that I wear daily were bought here, along with the plain white t-shirts my husband wears under all of his clothes. Plus they are carrying a pretty good selection of Legos sets this year during the holidays and this dope af StarWars pinball machine that has 10 different virtual boards programmed into one compact, authentic looking machine. That is for sure at the top of my Christmas list this year! üòâüéÑüéÅüéÑ

We are a family of five so buying things in bulk is great for us. and We love the products especially the brush chunks. and We also love all your food. and We all loved you‚Äôre  products I always walk out of Costco satisfied for everything that I have purchased. and It is a very great place to buy food. and It has light bulbs and food and drinks and furniture of all kinds. and It has other things like a electronic area. and We love shopping here.

A++ service is great. Awesome place has everything. Always has what we are looking for. The go place we shop. Love the samples. Also like when they bring in vendors. We bought an infinity chair from them. We love it. Thank you Costco

Walk in to use the bathroom get asked if I have a membership I tell them no and dude at the exit says oh you need one to enter and I ask to use the bathroom and he responds all snarky saying that‚Äôs what I just explained. Than he escorts me down to the bathrooms like if I‚Äôm a kid. Tell your employees to talk to customers with more respect and not to come off as hostile and rude the moment you enter the building.
The self checkout is very handy but I wish they would offer "scan and go" on the app where you can scan items as you put them in your cart
Great Costco place with a variety of high-quality items and fresh produce. I am always in love walking all the aisles to discover something new for my home. I would love to be back someday

Costco is a good place to purchase in bulk or for large families or a small retail store. Prices are good on some items and high on other items. There is plenty of parking and wheelchair friendly.  The store is clean and well stocked. Staff are very helpful and friendly.  Their gad prices are reasonable.

Thank you for having the best cake! The quality and quantity at less then ¬Ω the price anywhere else makes this quantifiably the best deal! And for 30 years the limitations of their decorations; rainbow, bear etc was worth it. The other day I noticed someone else requested "soccer" blew my mind..so I Requested "Mermaid or Beach" and this is what I got! (I added the tiny Minnie mermaid) It was such a surprise!! I nearly cried. So thankful this particular Costco has a cake artist that could manage the request. I have no idea if other locations could. My plan B was blue balloons I could smear around to make an üåä ocean but it wasn't necessary!

Definitely need another costco in the area. Smaller than many stores. Clean, tidy, but too many self checkouts. Already worked retail! Friendly, but can't find anyone to assist you in the store, at checkout they offer help loading car when needed. Overall nice store, but can be crowded. No optical dept. Beats the competition!
Costco already has their Christmas products out and I am LOVING it! I generally a "not until Thanksgiving is over" type of person, but this year it is very welcomed!

Everything I needed was in stock.  There were new items I bought and was thoroughly happy with my purchases.  I bought a new soup that was extremely delicious!  It is a Tomato and Red Pepper hearty soup.  Pacifica is the brand and it's a delicious "stick-to-your-ribs" meal.  It's perfect for a cold snowy day.  Pair it with a nice crusty sourdough and a salad.  Perfection!!

I‚Äôve been around for a long time and I‚Äôm used to seeing pushy sales people in public places. The AT&T guys are the TOTAL OPPOSITE. They saved my buddy $250 dollars a month from Verizon. No pushy tactics just honesty and humility. The AT&T kiosk is the place to be at this Costco. Young men with great energy especially THE MAN in charge Souleymane.
Hurry get yourself a membership and save when buying bulk items. Keep your eye out every year for sales on selected items that you will not want to pass up. Great product.

Visited Costco in East Wenatchee. Lots of great deals there right now. If only I hadn't spent so much before Christmas. Maybe I should do Christmas, after Christmas next year!? Anyway, clean store, great prices, wasn't terribly crowded. Quick, friendly staff.

Dr. Chad Swanson and Bozeman's @Costco Optometry department is Amazing.  Service is bar none. Value and quality of Eyewear is top-notch.  Brands like Maui Jim, RayBan, Gucci for a fraction of what we used to pay.  I'm impressed.

Purchased Saturday 2nd March.  Opened, smells rotten, everything bad.  Checked date.. Best if used before Feb 26th. .  Cannot see any date on outside of the 4 pack box. Only once taken home, can you see date on individual boxes.  Why are they selling out of date food?  Disgusting
Nice selection of items at a fair price. Compared to a few ones in the area, this one seems a bit smaller.

Somewhat smaller Costco warehouse store with often difficult access off the Woodinville-Redmond highway. The parking lot is often full during busy hours and the gas station line also long at these times. Checkout lines also long during busy hours. But overall still a good store with friendly, if limited staff. Special promotions are common at the store nearly every month year round. Has tire shop, pharmacy, optometrist, snack shop (pizza, hot dogs, etc.), and membership desk.

Our favorite weekend shopping place. Great products. Less crowded as compared to other Costco locations. Their cheese pizza is awesome and delicious.  Offers fresh bakery items and fruit produce. Great selection on the fresh wild fish  and seafood.

Costco offers a decent shopping experience with a variety of products at reasonable prices. The membership perks and bulk purchasing options are convenient, and the store's layout is generally user-friendly. The staff is helpful, and the quality of their products is satisfactory. Overall, a solid choice for budget-conscious shoppers.

Love the business center which is just what is says it is a business center, no clothes, no televisions but it does have commercial appliances and machines.  The fruit/veg/dairy/meat cooler is enormous (and cold so be ready).  More choices, especially with meats than a regular Costco.  Only reason for 4 stars is because sometimes stock changes so can‚Äôt always get what you got last time.

Search ‚ÄúThy Chea‚Äù on YouTube for video review. We were shock at how much drinks they have. Still Costco without Tech and other departments. We still had a good time walking through all the aisles.

I used to give this store 5 stars, but now the situation has changed. The cashier employees must be trained. How to respect the customer, especially the employee Gaby with an invitation that my subscription needed an update , and I did that a month ago , when I went to customer service I waited a long time in the line and  they found my account was updated last month they didn‚Äôt offer any apology for the delay , when I go back to the cashier they returned me to the back of the line again. I was poorly treated. I do not recommend shopping in this store.
We buy all of our fruits and vegetables there for our juicer as well as bulk items and gasoline. Can't beat Costco quality and prices! Kirkland is great.

Amazing diversion.  I went here after seeing items listed that aren't in any Costco warehouse clubs near me.  Their meat section had cuts that were amazing.  They have a nice selection of halal meats....and beef bacon!    Their baking products were a very pleasant surprise.  They carry Kerigold unsalted!!!!
I always love shopping at costco. Coz their product prices are very low. We went to this place at lunch time. They have pizza and the baked chicked bread which was awesome.

I had an amazing experience with manager Alex at the Bloomingdale Costco, truly the old school value of customer service.
He took care of my issue better than any company I have experienced in the past 10 years. I'm confident in all my purchases going forward with this store!
Thanks again Alex

Cool place for bulk buying as usual. Staffs are very professionals; pretty much standard layout except the food area gets crowded and at times blocking exit. Ample parking slots and easy to access from main road.

Do enjoy free food & drink samples.

It's a Costco. It's what you expect. Massively busy on weekends but manageable. Decent selection. Not the biggest alcohol area, so if you're stocking up for a big party maybe hit the Schaumburg one. But usually I'm just shopping for me, and this Costco has all I need!

I work for with the Sampling Crew here at this store! My parents have been members of this store for many years now! We are here at least once or twice a week. Lots of good deals, foods, and clothes to buy! Definitely recommend!

I just recently went to this grocery store to buy groceries and also look for appliances and other household items. I did not have any problems with the groceries, and I really like how everything is nice and fresh, especially the produce, meats, and the like. I went to the store mainly because I wanted to look for a burner gas grill for some reason. I was really not going to buy it and I was just trying to check it out to see if it is available here and also if the prices are good. I was really glad how the staff helped me when I asked for it, like where it is located inside, the price, and the things about the particular burner gas grill I liked to check. After thinking and knowing the price, I ended up buying it since it is reasonable and it really seems like a great choice considering its quality and everything. It was not my intention to really buy it, but thanks to the staff who helped me, I realized that it was a great deal. I like their customer service. I did not forget to buy gas, and their prices are definitely better than anywhere I could ever think of.

Costco is Costco. This is a pretty good location right by the highway so very convenient.

A shout out to the AT&t booth salesperson who was here:
Jesse Carapia
For providing wonderful service. Thank you Jesse!
Just bought a rotisserie chicken for dinner tonight. Great deal, big bird. Wasn't done on one thigh. Pink/red is unacceptable.

We appreciate all the helpful workers at this Costco. They patiently listen and then help you find what you're looking for. We enjoy seeing what new items they've gotten in for each season and checking out the deals. Receiving the member price on gas is especially nice.  Just went today and got everything on our list. Highly recommend this Costco.

Being a resident of Bolingbrook for over 25 yrs and going to Costco Bolingbrook since they opened.   I have been blessed with their customer service.  Especially, I would like to recognize Kinney I think he is one of the managers.   He is very professional, courteous and helpful.   I don‚Äôt think he ever use no to a customer.   Thank you for all you do and keep up the excellent service.

I've always been a loyal customer, spending like 10k each year in Costco. Most of the employees there are very friendly and helpful. However, a short-haired Karen just yelled at us today, saying some membership stuff and not letting us use self-checkout two orders. I know it‚Äôs a new policy, and they try to enforce it back. But there is no reason that Karen needs to yell at us. I can‚Äôt believe I spent 120 dollars on membership each year just being yelled at. I also had bad experiences with this Karen before, she wasn‚Äôt happy with the basic requests. I understand if you have a bad day or something, but it‚Äôs not a single incident. Really disappointed. Ruined the whole experience. However, most workers there are very nice. Just not that Karen.

The only thing I don‚Äôt like about this place is that recently they‚Äôre carding members at the entrance and at all registers. Maybe cracking down on non account holders? Idk. Everything else, including the rotisseries, is fine.

There was a heavy set woman at the register who was very unpleasant to the customer in front of me. The customer had a positive attitude, and handled it kinder than I would have. Though the cashier was nice to me, she wasted my time in the process of drawing out the transaction for the person in front of me. I was only a guest, but the incident made me decide against a membership. It would be foolish to think it wouldn't happen to me at some point if the staff feels this emboldened to act like this.

Today, cashier was really nice to me! She threw me a pen and she ordered me to pay it nicely. LITTELY, she said "Pay." I guess she was bored because there were not many customers today. Thank you for your service JD

Like any other Costco this branch is good. We shop regularly here. They rotate products on a regular basis. So it‚Äôs hard to keep shopping for one item that we like. You like one thing and next time they no loner carry it. Other that that it‚Äôs great.

Costco Wholesale is a retail giant that consistently impresses with its membership-based model. The vast product selection, from groceries to electronics, offers great value for families. The bulk packaging reduces per-unit costs, making it budget-friendly. Additionally, their Kirkland Signature brand often rivals big-name products in quality. The spacious layout and helpful staff contribute to a pleasant shopping experience. The food court, with its affordable and tasty options, is a bonus. However, the membership fee may deter some, and the limited brand variety might not suit everyone's preferences. Overall, Costco is a go-to for those seeking savings on quality products in quantity.

I ordered Costco online from this location. First of all, the box was already opened because they taped just single layer and it wasn‚Äôt even properly attached to the box. And lotion and candy packages were already opened. Fortunately, nothing missed. The liquid dish soap bottle was broken‚Ä¶ probably there was too much space inside of box, so I guess it broke while it was delivering. Soap was everywhere:/ I contacted customer service and they will replace the soap but they should be careful with their packaging.

I was very unhappy with my visit to Costco. I had to wait for more than 30 minutes in line to check out, the lines where very long and unorganized. The cashier was slow and rude, and she didn't even apologize for the delay.

To make matters worse, I had a terrible experience at the vision center. I wanted to buy some eyeglasses, but the man who was supposed to help me was very unprofessional and disrespectful. He ignored me when I asked him some questions, and he gave me the wrong answers. The other two lady‚Äôs there seem very professional while helping others but not the guy taking care of me.

I will never go back to this Costco store again. They have poor customer service and they don't care about their customers. I would advise anyone to avoid this place.

I recently had the pleasure of shopping at Costco, and I must say it was an outstanding experience from start to finish. I give this store a well-deserved five-star rating!
The prices at Costco are incredibly competitive. As a member, I enjoy access to wholesale prices, allowing me to save a significant amount of money on my purchases. The value for money is exceptional, making Costco my go-to store for bulk shopping.

I'm so sorry but every time I come here, there is someone who triggers my anger with unprofessionalism. Bertha, (older woman) was serving free samples of some sort. Nothing wrong with that except the fact that she was talking to herself AND she blew into the cupcake holders that she placed the samples on and began to serve several customers with the tainted cupcake holders. Now, I'm sure that food servers are supposed to have a food Handlers card of some sort but she disregarded the safety of other by blowing into those holders. It is even in the food and sanitization exam that you should NEVER blow into gloves or any sort of "cooking paper" to separate it. Not only that, she was really dismissive about it, like she didn't do anything wrong. I don't think that is the job for her.

If I see her again serving any sort of food again, I will call the health department on this establishment.

Costco is great for buying in bulk. I like buying paper towels and toilet paper. The prepared meals such as chicken fettuccine alfredo fajita kit, lasagna and more are very good and fresh heat and eat meals under 20.00. The pastries are delicious and always fresh. In the frozen aisle they have really good pizza it comes packaged in a box of two Motor City Pizza Company brand. Super good the crust is so good too. Update: was back at Costco today and found chocolate covered strawberries in the freezer section.  They are fantastic! Yummy.

It offers all the good things you expect from a Costco location. Very clean and well lit. Usually not crowded, at least not as crowded as other locations in bigger cities.

Gas station lines are usually short, although prices are not very attractive (a couple local gas stations often have similar prices). I heard you can get better prices on Thursdays.

Store closes early on the weekends so check the schedule before you go.

Probably the worst place in all of central IL every worker I had any contact with was vary rude and acted as if they own the world or at least the little place that gave them a job being nasty to the customers must be in there training because they all do that well . only thing good about my year membership is now I know I will definitely not continue this abuse, didn't have even one good experience with this place starting from the first when I got the membership. The manager must be a real hard a.. To have all the employees so conceded and awful. I hope they can escape and hope they don't take it home and treat there family so bad

There is an article in the Costco Connection magazine about a couple, empty nesters, that shop at Costco. They are wise at what they buy just because of the volume of items you have to make sure of how it fits your lifestyle. So it‚Äôs a great place to shop their stores are clean the isles are wide to accommodate the carts, and the prices of their merchandise are budget friendly.

Costco Peoria is about an hour drive from Springfield.  Need I say with the rating that it is worth the trip!  We had arranged an appointment to have a set of new tires installed on our SUV.  The tire shop was ready for us and we decided to shop while the installation was completed.  Christmas plants, toys, decorations and many new items were being perused by the shoppers.  The store was crowded yet orderly, especially in the checkout lanes. My wife had misplaced her membership card and without missing a beat, a new card was created which earned  a broad smile from her.  As per usual, our tab at checkout was more than intended.  We find that this the norm as we discovered items we knew came in for,  yet there were so many other ‚Äútempting buys‚Äù that somehow made it into our cart.  The tire store had texted us that the vehicle was ready long before we were finished with finding out what was new or interesting to us. Costco is premier shopping outlet that we enjoy visiting.  Finally, before we headed back to Springfield, we filled the gas tank for under $3 per gallon.

Overall, a great experience at this Costco location, for a Sunday it really wasn‚Äôt busy at all. No lines at the self checkout and all the staff were helpful in helping me scan my items quickly. As always the pizza is delicious and a great deal aswell!

The most ethnically diverse product offerings! It blows my mind! Service is always on point and the bakery staff is so kind and considerate! They went out of the way to make my daughter‚Äôs cake extra special! They added extra candles to make her feel special and added diyas as well‚Ä¶. I was ecstatic. The  food court staff are always polite and helpful!
Less crowded environment and convenient parking compare to Korea costcoüòÑ

I love a good deal , always amazing to buy in bulk and be HEALTHY‚Ä¶. But man More vegan options ‚Ä¶ would be super great!! Lots of people I know have pasts working on farms or factory farms and you get a feel for the way it makes this culture just callous ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm all for a good price but let us purchase more that does NO HARM to any being! Just like we all want for ourselves ‚Ä¶ and anyone can eat plant based foods it‚Äôs just not the other way around right ? So idk I love the concept and culture and man their Warrantys doubling and customer service is SO GOOD the ethos is there in so many huge ways , please let us vote with our wallets for non violence towards animals !!!

I think Costco doesn‚Äôt even deserve to have one star! They make over a half million dollars every day and they can‚Äôt even buy cart pullers? C‚Äômon! Man!!! What kind of corporation is this?!?!? I‚Äôm NOT going to renew the membership with Costco!

This Costco reliably gives bad customer service. Not that I expect a top tier experience, but the employees at this place consistently act like you‚Äôre ruining their day personally just by you showing up.

As long as you‚Äôre ready to feel as if you‚Äôve gravely inconvenienced someone the moment you step foot in the parking lot, you‚Äôll be just fine.

This Costco is better than any other Costco hands-down. There‚Äôs no comparison. I‚Äôve been coming here for years and the store is always clean, the staff is always kind and friendly, and they have the best variety of everything. They also always have the best gas prices. I feel like I can spend all day in this store. Favorite place to just walk around it.

Amazing place to spend money üí∞üòÑ
Very cool and professional staff.
Cleanest and most organized Costco store.
Can‚Äôt say enough good things about Costco! The selection, the quality of food, the workers all fantastic. Look at the selection of flowers! And now self-checkout!! Highly recommend this Costco!

I just joined.  I am sure this is typical of any new member's experience, but I was annoyed by the upselling.  I didn't want a new credit card, but was made to feel I was making a financial mistake if I turned it down.    I saved money on my purchases and will save on my car insurance by joining.  I am happy about those things.

My son and his best friend went to Costco today. They walked there and it took them an hour, they came running home crying. They said that the people there wouldn‚Äôt allow them in because of their age. They had been looking forward for the whole day to get the brand new double chunk chocolate cookie.

I stopped in with consideration of becoming a member. This store is 10 minutes from my work but 50 minutes from my home. I was directed to speak with a fella named Adam about signing up. All I wanted was the basic membership since I wasn't going to make this my primary grocery store. (Far from home). I repeatedly stated I just wanted the basic membership.  He would not back off on trying to up sell me. I have never been pressured so hard in my life. Far worse than dealing with any car dealer, lol. He kept telling me I have nothing to lose. I flat out told him I'm losing my patience. Well, because of this guy being so insanely pushy, I won't set foot on that property again. I'm not one to get upset easily, but this dude really pissed me off. I cringe every time I see the name Costco.
Typically clean and well laid out Costco store. Very good prices. Excellent check out staff. Other staff members throughout the store were nondescript. Excellent supply of in stock items
Love the triple lane gas pumps at this location.  Never have to wait to fill up.  Self checkout lanes are also pretty great for quick trips.

Always a fantastic experience at the Costco in Lake Zurich! Their customer service is phenomenal, consistently going above and beyond. We find everything we need here, thanks to their well-stocked shelves and great selection of items. Five stars without hesitation!
I love Costco so much. Always have amazing deals you can‚Äôt miss out on and not to mention the amazing quality they offer. Store is always so clean and well organized.
Everything is super-sized, including the chocolate chip cookies in the food court. Still can't believe the chicken bake is $4. Such a good deal.

Twice in two weeks I have had issues with bad food. First I purchased a rotisserie chicken and when I opened it the same day purchased, it was rotten inside. Second within a week of purchasing cheddar cheese (expiration date 5/24) it was moldy inside. When I went to return they said I should‚Äôve called. I guess they don‚Äôt understand 1) safety issues 2) the inconvenience of purchasing and having to sit on the phone for refunds 3) not to mention having to make a separate trip to find dinner at the last min or find the product elsewhere. Twice in two weeks putting my family at risk is a quality control issue with either supplier or store. Do better costco‚Ä¶ lest we all end up in the hospital.

Was no problem to find parking, found everything i needed. Great location and clean store. The only thing if you have a friend and I bought first with my pass, she can buy as well but than she can only pay with debit card for her stuff. Which is strange, we did not had this problem in another location.

Normally I would never write a review of a big box store, like a Costco, but I wanted to write a note of appreciation for the employee Carlos within the Tire Center. He took time to go above and beyond to help me.

I went in this afternoon to purchase a set of tires. I had no idea where to find any information pertaining to buying them, so he actually walked to my car to check the measurements etc.

After we found the correct tires and price, I mentioned that I was worried about the time it would take for them to arrive since I needed to drive 400 miles for work within the next few days. Carlos went back out to look at my tires and explained that it would be dangerous for me to drive such a distance. He also had this verified by his supervisor.  Thanks to him, I quickly rented a car and avoided a potentially dangerous scenario where my tires could have blown out.

Thank you Carlos for taking the time to help. As someone who doesn‚Äôt know much about cars, I appreciated this help. I hope the Costco team recognizes the great work he is doing

Can't stop shopping there. My wife tries to go without me.. I really enjoy this place. The only problem is that their pants, shirts, coats, jackets, fit small men, nothing over 34. They need to bring their clothing into the 2023 sizes. All men aren't skinny or fat. We are just as healthy and full in size without the weight! Need bigger, taller sizes for thick men. 38's-44 sizes and up with lengths at 36 and more. Thank you

I get my money's worth out of the membership very quickly. You can't beat a rotisserie chicken or pumpkin pie for $6. Their pharmacy is superb, great service and no problems. I don't know how much I save every year, but I'll bet it's in the hundreds of $$.

I don't shop there often unless it's for gas, which a membership just for gas is worth it to me. It is always the best deal for me at Costco. The store is great. I'm just me, so I don't need much. I'll also note I share the account with someone that needs that bulk, so it works out. But $60 a year isn't bad.

Be aware of the prices, some are good, some are very good and some you can find better somewhere else. Selection, you buy what they got, may not be what you wanted but you settle on what they have because of the price. Great return policy.

I'm an honest person. I scan all my items. I trust their system has it right. When I walked out, I was informed that an item wasn't on my receipt.  I was forced into an awkward situation. I sadly left my $7 item because I felt shamed with everyone staring at me. That could have been avoided with a better self check out system.
It's a very good place to buy anything for your home.

Love this place. Then again, who doesn't love Costco!!!

This location has very helpful staff and is very well maintained. The pizza and ice cream they sell is very yummy and top tier. Love how the sample employees continue to give detail description of the product even as you grab and go.

If i would be able to give a - score I would. Terrible experience with workers at the checkout. He didn‚Äôt ask anyone else for a membership but asked us ONLY. And it‚Äôs okay to ask for a membership but you don‚Äôt have to act like army officer when doing it. I felt like i‚Äôm being checked by the club security while using fake id. Also for some reason we were not able to ring up an alcohol on the self checkout. So we had to wait in separate line for the alcohol to be rung up by another employee or smth. I will be driving 30 min to another Costco but will never go back to this one again!

A typical Costco in Chicago area. Costco has always been our favorite because of its price and quality. They always maintain a good standard for stuff made for the family. On top of that their customer service is just the best. This location is just another usual costco. We stopped by in the evening to grab some stuff. Women‚Äôs clothing section had a great collection. I bought a nice plush jacket from Columbia in a relatively cheap price. Felt like won! The store was organized, neat and clean. The washroom was pretty decent too.
Costco remains the only place you can get your tires rebalanced, buy 3,650 mg of Allertec, & eat a pizza all in the same place

Costco is a staple store and household name for many in the US. They sell literally any and everything from food, to technology, to paper, to plants. Prices tend to be reasonable considering the volume consumed, but you end up paying over $100 easily. The food court though is on another level: nowhere in the US can you get a hotdog and drink for $1.50 anymore, and the fruit smoothie drink is amazing.
Overall, it makes sense why the Costco stock chart looks like the global population‚ÄôsüòÇüòÅ.

This is my favorite Costco warehouse and I especially like coming here for the gas prices, which are less expensive than almost anywhere. I did have an experience there over the weekend which I would like to relate: I couldn't find my Costco membership card (it was in my car,) and while I was going through my credit cards, a staff member came over to assist. It was very kind of him to offer to let me use his card (I'm not sure how that would have worked.) Fortunately, I had a Costco cash card on me and used that instead. So what's the problem? I discovered later that another card of mine was missing. I don't know if I dropped it there for sure. I would just like to request that your gas station attendants not hover over customers while they are going through their credit cards or wallets. It's very easy to get distracted and drop something inadvertently. I like to have time to check the pavement around me. Thank you!

Costco Pleasant Prairie: A Weekday Shopper‚Äôs Haven

As a regular at¬†Costco Pleasant Prairie, I‚Äôve come to appreciate the store‚Äôs rhythm throughout the week. During the weekends, the hustle and bustle are expected, with crowds bustling through the aisles. However, it‚Äôs the weekdays that truly shine for me.

On a typical weekday, the store transforms into a tranquil haven, where one can shop at a leisurely pace without the pressure of navigating through a sea of carts. The calm atmosphere allows for a more thoughtful shopping experience, whether I‚Äôm browsing the latest electronics or restocking the pantry.

What keeps me anchored to this Costco, apart from the wide selection of products, is the unbeatable¬†gas prices. Consistently offering the best rates in the area, it‚Äôs become my go-to spot for fueling up my vehicle, adding to the overall value of my membership.

In essence, Costco Pleasant Prairie has become more than just a store; it‚Äôs a part of my weekly routine that I look forward to. It‚Äôs where efficiency meets serenity, and where every visit feels like a well-orchestrated shopping adventure.
I love Costco great place and I always horde the free samples they even call me the sample muncher in the streets. Go here if you like Costco and the sample muncher
Great place for shopping. Employees are always super nice and helpful. I love getting my gas from here too. There are long lines sometimes during peak times but they move quickly !

Great Costco location! The staff is so friendly and helpful. Specifically Erica, John, Deon, and Cameron. We purchased stamps at self check out and forgot to get them at the pick up spot in the front. They all helped orchestrate the store opening just past closing in order to get us our stamps before we drove back to the city. Such superb costumer service!! We will be back to this location for that reason! Well done üëèüèº

What is the purpose of having a membership? When do you have a favorite item? It becomes discontinuous. I've been waiting for months for you (Costco) to restock on these things, which is really annoying because this is the only yogurt my kids can ingest. Bring this item back

Costco is obviously great to buy things wholesale for families. The deals are great. You need a membership to shop here if you don't know. You can get almost anything you might need in your house. It's cheaper to stock up on things in bulk and use them. Parking is great, I'm not sure if they validate parking though. You can get food/ snacks or drinks after you finish shopping. Be sure to order them before it closes though.

What is the point of the guy touching all my stuff at the exit if you're not making sure that my receipt is correct? I bought two different drink cases but the cashier scanned one twice and I ended up paying more. Costco doesn't have their priorities straight. Instead of making me feel like I'm in a penitentiary by checking my card when entering, asking for my card AND id at checkout then having some dude manhandle my purchase at exit, Costco should focus on making sure their cashiers and staff are awake enough to work the line. When I called to try to have this taken care of, I was placed on hold and subsequently hung up on. Their gasoline is the only reason to keep a membership.

Costco offers great prices and a wide selection of trees. I recently bought one and was impressed by the quality and value. Their trees are healthy, well-cared-for, and priced competitively. If you're looking for affordable yet high-quality trees, Costco is the place to go.

Nice store.  Seems more roomy than the stores in LZ, LITH, and the southern Naperville location.  First time I was here.  Everyone was pleasant.  Funny thing, Costco customers seem to be the difficult part.  A woman (50s) and her mother (70+) were at the food court. They got the hot dogs in the drinks, and the mother had a sour face on and didn't know what the cups for until the daughter told her they're for drinks. I don't know if the mother wanted a drink or not. And I don't know why sometimes people get bothered by the slightest things.  This has nothing to do with the store and I found it a great location. I'll come here again.

I love this Costco! It‚Äôs so nice to have one closer to my house now. Everything is always very organized and there is always someone there to help. I recently bought a new TV with my mom and we had help checking out with the TV as well as bringing it out to the car. Great service and great atmosphere!

This Costco is spacey then the one back home. I visited this while visiting family and of course this Costco has different things to buy. The food court even has that roast beef that I wasn't able to try. It's a great location to different stores and a mall nearby. Would come back here again.

I am a long-term member of this store. I always like to come here to buy daily necessities and food. Costco is my favorite!  Usually I always meet very friendly and polite service staff. They always smile and ask if I need help.  I usually like self-checkout, but today because there were too many people queuing up at self-checkout, the service staff suggested that I switch to staff checkout service.  Unfortunately, I was not so lucky this time. I met a very rude checkout person, ROTTANAK. He asked me expressionlessly, do you only have these items?  Then every time he completed a project, he would throw away my products rudely, which made me feel very bad.  Later, I stood nearby and watched for a long time. When dealing with white customers, he always wore a smile, checked out gently, and would not rudely throw away their goods.  All I can say is that I encountered discrimination because I am Asian?  I really can‚Äôt believe it. After living in the United States for many years, this is the first time I have had a very uncomfortable shopping experience.

Blonde lady in the foodcourt omg. She is so rude. Someone came to her to complain about the pizza being soggy and she laughed in his face, and asked what she wanted him to do. He was right it was soggy and since then i have been getting well done until yesterday when the guy said they are not allowed to well done the pizza according to his boss.

Love Costco ever since they first opened their stores in Chicago IL. For a big family as big as 4+ people, the store has good durable household & food products worth the value compared to other retailers.

I mainly like about the store the fact that they almost always sell the same items you have accustomed to buying at this place. Lately though, allot of my favorite products either discounted or temporary unavailable, for whatever reason few of which are: bacon wrapped chicken cutlets which went MIA since last year. Also haven‚Äôt seen the $100 smoked prosciutto meat leg. It used to come around winter season & made an excellent gift, but I haven‚Äôt seen it this winter. Occasionally I also see some out of stock favorites but they return after 2 weeks give or take.

Costco has mainly Kirkland brand as their supplier as well as other big verity of organic non GMO products. Though there still a few bioengineered stuff seen in the back of the contents label.

I like the fact that they promote their products to taste them out prior buying. And truth be told 95% of the stuff I tried as sampler I ended up buying and it was good. So I‚Äôm glad they have the samplers because had I not tried it myself or someone recommended, I would have never purchased it out of blue.

Parking at this location is always packed, no matter the day or the hour. But I calculated best time to shop at Costco is after 3, during weekday, between Mon-Thur. Less people at the store & close open parking spots.

But in order to shop at their store you need a membership card. Otherwise they won‚Äôt allow you to make a purchase. Unless maybe if you have a guest pass. Not sure about that. But what I‚Äôm sure of 150% is that membership has to be 1 per (2 people) household. So for example there are 2 membership cards for household, say one in your name another for a spouse. Yet if your mom/dad/sibling wishes to visit the store without any of you, your household family members will not be able to shop/buy if their name isn‚Äôt on that card. They recently changed their policy about that. :(

We have a large family, brothers & sisters all under one big roof. Been buying at Costco for years, our household main person is my older brother. So it was his & his wife names on the cards. We never had issues cuz all of us are with the same last name/address. Once or twice they asked for ID to check home address but not since October 2023. We used to be able to shop there without an issue until they strictly enforced the other people of the household to pay for the annual membership. I think it‚Äôs super unfair to enforce that rule and they will only loos money on that whole membership issue which is $60/year (the lowest). Imagine how much $ people spend daily‚Ä¶ I can reassure you some members of my family refused to shop this place because they enforced their membership. Anyway it‚Äôs their loss. But what I have been told of recently, they are planning to get rid of physical cards & scan membership from smartphones.

A shorter male with braids has been harassing and hitting on my wife the last two times she‚Äôs seen him at this location. She said he hands out samples but has made numerous comments on her legs and she no longer feels safe shopping here with this employee around. Please take action as we like to shop here. Thank you!

Another huge departmental store. One thing what I learned is a that the huge furniture like assembled couch or cot has to be ordered online rather than buying from the store. This saves you a few dollars in transportation.

Yesterday at Costco, my friends and I were overcharged for an extra 40-pack of water bottles, which was promptly voided from our bill. However, the staff member at the exit, who clearly didn't understand the bill, made a scene and accused us of wrongdoing. Despite the mistake being on Costco's part, we received no apology. This is unacceptable and needs to be addressed promptly.

Lovely store. Ample parking. Well-stocked, of course. However, even Costco has fallen prey to the self-checkout trend and, unfortunately,  with the attendant bad attitude of the employee 'minder'. There is nothing like trying to check yourself out, in yet another store, trying to find the barcode on your bulky item and then be treated as if you were a recalcitrant employee who had not been paying attention in the store's in-depth employee training program.
Your checkers were doing an exemplary job, Costco.

My experience at Costco in Niles, Illinois, was exceptional. The store offers a wide array of high-quality products at great prices, making it a one-stop shop for all my needs. The staff members were friendly and helpful, and the store was well-organized, making it easy to find everything on my list. Additionally, the Costco membership offers excellent value with its additional perks and discounts. Overall, I had a fantastic shopping experience at Costco Niles and would highly recommend it to others.
Just a regular Costco. Nothing exciting. But I still love to buy huge croissants here.

This is a great place.  Lots of free samples and great customer service.  Gas station here.  After lots of issues at other grocery chains I now really appreciate this place.  Produce selection doesn't compare with regular grocery but pantry and household items are reliable. Also ? Pricing is always accurate here.  No mismatched prices.

Did you know this Costco sells fruits and veggies cheaper than the Costco in Glenview? You are welcome.

This Costco is much more packed, crowded, and offers more food samples than most other locations. However the parking lot is crazy with many bad drivers double park and blocking others. You know who you areü§£

It is huge whole sale place with variety of products and really good price rate as well as discounted stuffs.
The staff at the entrance and exit gate are very friendly.
One thing i learnt that you need to have a membership card to shop here (which one of the team mber had luckily).
We love to buy 2%fat yogurt, rotisseri chicken, nice minced beef, cheese, cheap ice creams, milk jars, water bottles from the COSTCO.
Huge free parking space available for Costco members.
Costco never disappoints but yesterday it did. I was waiting for a fresh rotisserie chicken and purchased one. Once I got home to enjoy it, to my surprise it was still pink and bloody.

One of the employees ELIEL at the gas station was so helpful and went above and beyond his call to duty assisting me with the gas pump. Employees like him definitely deserves recognition. Keep up the great work ELIEL

Hi there guys, what can I say about this store...
This is the only place to get all of our home supplies and stuff that we use for our everyday needs...
As well as groceries and food for the entire family...
And just like everything, it has pros and cons, ups and downs...
But in the end it's up 2 U where you go to spend your money.
Overall is a damn great store !!
Believe me,  we come every weekend in here, also to refill our 3 cars tanks in the gas station...

Avoid this place!
Use to be one of the best Costco stores in the area. Not anymore. Even in the beginning of pandemic they cleaned thr cards and had 2 people to do this. I don't know what happened now. Sometimes they spray the cards with some chemicals but newer wipe them. Is this chemicals safe for my skin? I don't know. Now is even worse. Store which charge me over $100 per year complitely doesn't care! I was there on May 25th 2020 around 1:30PM. Beautiful weather, no cards at all! All cards outside! Nobody cares! I spoke with the manager which was really nice and he can't see everything so the problem is: there is no team. Someone should inform the manager about the problem before I did it. Aldi stores don't charge any annual charges but they have a person who cleans the cards and takes care of them. It was my last year with you guys. I will quit.
Edit: Costco Tire Center Service: you guys better start to sell donats not tires! I had appointment to fix the tire, I came 15 minutes early and still wait 2 hours to fix the tire!!!!!!! What a shame!!!!!!
I love the environment when entering this Costco. I came in to return an item and I was greeted nicely upon walking in and the return was made extremely quick. I‚Äôll be coming in more often.

Receiving/deliveries..  big trucks u must enter from the back side of the building from w22nd... u cannot make the left turn to go around the buiding.  Look at the satellite images..the docks are enclosed... i arrive at 545am for a 630 apt... they told me to sit in my truck and wait till 630 and someone would come get me when to go to dock.  I backed in at 645.. another truck left .. no one came.to get me.. The docks backing in are very tight when next to another truck. Empty by 730
Saturday afternoon at a Costco was tame. East coast Costco be a mad house, but this place was pretty empty and no crazyness. Did see  a mama goose and baby geese. So that was cute

It's a Costco, what can I say.
Inexpensive gas.
Quality products at bulk price.
Great food court. Famous $1.50 large hot dog.
Wide aisles and some testing stations. Self check out or regular checkout.
Self check out very quick if you run in for 1 or 2 special items.

Best repeat item... Chicken pot pie when available.

Great Costco overall. They always have good deals whether its for food or for clothes. Also the employees here are much better then the other Costco‚Äôs I‚Äôve been too in terms of giving out samples and other customer service stuff.
5/5 great Costco

This five star review goes to this branch because of the Dr Morad who honestly did the great job with my hearing test believe me or not he made feel so comfortable and made my test goes so well because all my life tried several hear test and I was always stress with this kind test but here with this Dr Morad please try it then you believe any one in your family have this issue please so go this dr at this branch
Once again Costco thank you for have such a professional at this location who has done phenomenal job

Isn't it amazing how cheap Costco is? The food court workers are clearly stressed and as such, rush everything. The pizza dough is runny, half the condiments are almost always out, and finally they can barely fill up my coffee cup. I am amazed at how rude they are when you tell them to fill up the cup for something you paid for! It's not coming out of your paycheck!

Also, the cashier "conductors" are super loud, rude & obnoxious. Yelling at members isn't constructive ushering, their job is useless. Surely, other places in the busy store need help! This is consistently happening so I am not wasting my money here anymore. I am canceling my membership because of this. I got a bad taste in my mouth over the terrible service.
I had a wonderful experience today shopping here. Minerva was great and very friendly. She went out of her way to help me. We need more people like her! Great job

The employees always seem to be cheerful and very helpful. The selection of food beverages and appliances are always good. We shop here about once a month! The prices are always good and the food samples are even better!

Very, very crowded as usual.   Nice variety and quality.  Prices are okay but if you're a competent shopper you can usually beat their prices.

You have to have a lot of time on your hands to shop here.

Check out times have improved thanks on great part to the portable scanners who capture your purchase and place it in a suspend buffer.

My wife says the cinnamon rolls are better than Cinnabon.

Man it was an excellent experience. Shopping was great, food was yummy, and customer service was great especially Minerva shout out to her she was so very nice helpful and sweet. Costco if you‚Äôre reading this give this woman a raise.

Good variety and quality. Great prices on most things. Helpful staff in the store and at the checkouts. The gas station was very busy as the prices were very good, and they actually had a facilitator helping get cars into open spots. That was very much appreciated.
The store is great but the new clientele coming through now is irritating to see. Must be using the free money our government is giving them. Welcome to the new UK.

Very well run store, they handle the crowds like a well oiled machine. I was in and out. Great sales, plenty of help. Store is always clean and lines move quickly. Great prices on slices of pizza and snacks on your way out! Very annoying Mastercard is NOT accepted

Susan in the hearing department seems always kind of bothered when asking a question.
I realize they are real busy but, ‚Äú maybe they should have someone taking care of the desk and cleaning the hearing aids‚Äù. I‚Äôm elderly and go once a month to Costco to go shopping. I think it‚Äôs crazy to make an appointment to have my hearing aids cleaned. The hearing department in St. Charles Costco has no problems to do it and are friendly. Susan definitely has a problem doing it. I would drop them off and pick them up 2 hours later when I‚Äôm done shopping.

Normally, buying in bulk is better.
They are not keeping up with products,  using cheaper substitutes as replacements.
Prices have increased to the point of stupid.
Looks like everyone is enjoying Bidenonomics
Gotta love Costco if you have hungry people to feed. Bill felt like half my rent when done, sure hope bartering becomes the norm again..

This has got to be the worst costco. Takes forever to find parking. Hardly any employees to ask questions or help in finding stuff.
Always out of essential items like yogurt or water. And you need to hire MORE people in your cafe. Long lines to buy a pizza or get a drink. The wait is forever. Hire more people. Self checkout is not the answer.

The store is clean, nice to visit. But I would like to point out that they put less sausage in the pizza than in other Costco's. The pizza is more appetizing on the display case than if you take a whole pizza home.

Like any other Costco in the area always BUSY.  Not much that differentiates this Costco from others except that its in Schaumburg i guess.  Place is super busy Saturday and Sunday and after 5pm.  Overall good quality of products and somewhat helpfull staff although I had not to use their assistance much.  The parking lot outside is always full so bring good walking shoes.

This location disappoints because they don't restock what actually sells. Mango juice for example, they don't restock it, instead they switch it out with papaya juice! Which no one seems to care for. That's just one of many examples. I come here to replenish and what I normally buy gets switched out by a weird product that no one touches. Just today I went there for peas, but they decided to fill the pea shelf with MORE broccoli. I don't run in that problem with the mount prospect location, which I'll be going to from now on.

On a super busy Sat. Karine assisted my wife & she went way out of her way to ensure her Membership Card was correct!  I thank her & all of our Customer Service Reps in St. Charles...Your all Amazing!

This Costco is rather cramped compared to other locations. The bathrooms seemed much smaller.  The eating area was very fat and the food was hot.  The employees were friendly and the store seemed to be well run and maintained. The parking lot is very large as well.  I would visit this location again.

This is my favorite Costco to shop at. The workers here are soooo nice! I love coming when they have free samples. Good luck trying to spend less than $200 on a single trip! Everything always seems to find its way into my cart. We exclusively buy our paper products here for the sheer value of it. Paper plates and paper towels that'll last a household for half a year, easy. Love Costco.
Maria at Customer Service was incredibly helpful, personable, and kind!  She helped my wife and I with our membership and went above and beyond to make us feel like VIP‚Äôs. Thank you so much, Maria!

Love Costco!! Biggest issue is that it‚Äôs usually pretty crowded but that can make it fun! Food court is always a tasty value. Parking is sometimes problematic but usually find a spot. Always plan on spending 1/2 to 1 hour longer than planned. Be sure to have membership card with you!
Great interior has good pricing. I like to get pop, seafood, and steak but the parking at every location is horrible. They need some help on their parking lot designs to have better flow

A nice store. Always busy.  Good chicken enchiladas, stuffed bell peppers, lamb chops, pork belly, kim chi, winesauce spinach. All around great place to shop. Great gas prices too.

I'm bummed to hear that Poke will not be brought back this year due to poor sales.

A good place for pizza, hotdogs, chicken wrap and yogurt.

I'm glad they kept the hotdog at the same price and also great selection of food items and also good prices on some electronics on display, sometimes you can even find a good deal also the perks of Costco are alot better than Sam's club.

I went with a friend to check out Costco and once we were ready to check out it was an awful experience! Apparently, if you don't know they only accept Visa and no MC you stand there swiping your card repeatedly until finally one of the reps notices and says we don't accept MCüôÑ
Ended up putting everything back! Sad!

They always have great prices at Costco and you can usually get in and out pretty quick if you go early around 10. If you get there later like around noon or anytime after that it's super busy and it takes awhile to get out of there but the prices can't be beat. The one problem I have with them is they run out of stuff and don't restock it for a long time

Did not have a good experience although we are loyal and frequent customers at this particular location. Was aggressively and rudely kicked out at closing time as we were making our way to check out. Furthermore, we felt targeted and bullied as there were other customers eating and hanging out at the food court past closing time without being kicked out. Staff at this location are not friendly.

The opticians at this location are great! A few days ago, I took my damaged glasses to the optical department after I accidentally stepped on them and ruined the frames. I thought for sure I would have to replace the frames, but a very friendly and helpful optician was able to repair them‚Ä¶ for free! This kind gesture made my day.

Costco is my fun shopping place, after Home Depot!
You'll never know what bargains they have that you may or may not need, but will probably buy anyway!
I love the food samples!

Love this costco! Food is always fresh and I enjoy looking through the books. Great variety of options to buy. The only bad experience I had was when my toddler knocked over my beverage while we were waiting for our pizza. One of the workers refused to make eye contact and ignored my apologies.

The staff here is so rude! There was an adult person who had mental delays waiting in line with their mom. I was behind them and the line was close to one of those podium the staff like to stand by and watch the store. The special needs customer was having free samples and kept asking his mom repeatedly if there was a trash can. If you‚Äôve been to this Costco you‚Äôd notice they‚Äôre everywhere really. He then kept saying ‚ÄúMom I found it.‚Äù and was so happy to throw away his trash. He clapped and kept saying ‚ÄúYay!‚Äù. There were a couple of employees standing at and by the podium. An employee said ‚ÄúAre you serious? There‚Äôs a trash can behind them..‚Äù The employee was upset because the special needs customer used the little trash can next to the podium instead of the larger trash can that was farther away by an isle. The employees surrounding the area were also conducting themselves in a demeaning manner. One said ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs wrong with him!‚Äù Another said ‚ÄúIgnorance is bliss.‚Äù and started laughing. Mind you the customer they were talking about aloud was special needs and probably didn‚Äôt notice their belittling, unprofessional, disrespectful, degrading remarks where directed to him. The mother seemed bothered by it though. I really felt sorry for her because she was just there to shop and didn‚Äôt go to Costco to have the employees criticize her son. He was just throwing away his trash properly and not tossing it on the ground. I don‚Äôt understand why a group of employees would even be bothered by it. He‚Äôs not creating more work for them or interrupting there workload. The employees were just standing around doing nothing. I‚Äôm going to cancel my membership. The customer service is  just lacking at Costco. They have good deals but it‚Äôs not worth supporting employees who have such condescending behavior toward their customers.

Such a different experience from my local Costco on Long Island, NY.  This store seemed, by comparison, empty and it was so easy to navigate around.  In three visits there were NO waits at the checkout registers.  A fabulous experience.

I purchased new glasses from the optical dept. The purchase experience was fine but not the pick up. The man that helped me when I picked them up should be fired. He could not be bothered to help me and did not even sit me down for the final fitting. The glasses are progressive bifocals which make this even more surprising. He looked at me and the glasses and decided that was good enough. The glasses did not sit properly for the bifocal portion of the lenses and the nose pads were never adjusted. Subsequently, a nose pad fell off and I had to pay another optomitrist to replace both so they matched. I made extra effort to use Costco for glasses but NO MORE! Terrible experience. Zero stars if I could.
Costco is great. It‚Äôs always clean, employees are helpful, and you can buy anything from mattresses to pickles to tubs of mayo bigger than my toddler. Returns are easy, too.
Tis the season.. they have awesome gardening items in, including fruit trees and various live plants and shrubs.  I hope they will begin selling boxwoods someday.

This is really going much better since COVID and I want to give it five stars but they just need to have a couple more people available when you can't find something.
