Overall service has improved and friendliness of staff has improved in the admin staff is great if you need something on your account.

The storage kept cleaning I believe you can still find hand sanitizer or wipes if you really want them or need them for your shopping cart.

The pharmacy staff was amazing. They were friendly and kind. We spoke with multiple people and they were helpful, kind, and knowledgeable. They were able to fill our prescriptions while we shopped. They even handled an insurance issue quickly and with care. Thank you!

This is one of the greatest places on Earth üåé!!! The prices are so good that you can basically cut out other places to shop. They sell Audi‚Äôs, diamonds, and DJI drones! The food court is amazing and the prices are better than McD‚Äôs. The membership is worth it, so buy it! Download the app because it rocks too! There are things online you can‚Äôt buy at the store. I can‚Äôt wait until I go back again, just because of all the awesomeness therein!! Love you Costco!!!

First time in Cosco invited to go with a neighbor. I hit the refreshments counter first and ordered a giant pizza slice that was so yummy then shopping here I go. I found most of the items I purchased at comparable prices or a little lower than other box stores. I was more impressed with the organization and layout of the store. I appreciated the signage identifying each area and the friendly staff. I will look into getting a membership soon.

This is my first time coming here my friend brought me here & I have to say it is way better than Sam‚Äôs club it has more products and more inventory. They have furniture and they sell phones here. it‚Äôs sort of like a Best Buy. The place is so clean and so neat everything‚Äôs in order and it‚Äôs so bright inside the building. The people are very nice oh and they have this amazing pizza for $10. It‚Äôs huge with thick layers of cheese and crust. I would say when holidays come around the corner this place gets really packed.

New member, still learning. Gas prices are unbelievably lower than the area supports.  They play this game, it seems to me, of let's move everything around and see how long it takes her to find what she came for. I see great big TVs going out the door every time i visit so prices must be great. I often buy food and women's clothing.  Always buy a cheap hot dog and drink as I leave if I have a couple minutes to spare.

I love Costco, but I just got 2 bouquets of 2-dozen flowers each for Mother‚Äôs Day and the petals were falling off the roses when I put them in a vase.  It was the most disheartening gift I‚Äôve received.  No idea why the quality would not be there.
These came via delivery yesterday.

This review is only for the cashier Rochelle. My mother wanted to buy some supplies for her business and I was offering to pay as another treat for Mother‚Äôs Day. When Rochelle saw me pull my card out she acted like I was committing a crime or something. Attitude dropped to hell and she was so rude addressing us that I couldn‚Äôt pay with my debit card and I‚Äôd have to pull out cash. I apologized as I didn‚Äôt know this was a rule as I don‚Äôt regularly shop at Costco.

She continued to explain with a tone that my mother should have known. Then she didn‚Äôt scan my mother‚Äôs items as tax exempt and when I asked she got even more angry with us and stated we should have told her ahead of time as now she has to scan everything again, my mom got 10 items. Again, I don‚Äôt go to Costco and my mother never had to ask before, it use to be automatically done as she has a business card.

Not sure if Rochelle‚Äôs just mad as it‚Äôs Mother‚Äôs Day and she has to work, but please just be nice to the customers. We didn‚Äôt force you to work today, I just wanted to help my mom buy stuff.

There are several Costco locations in the Indy metro but this is my go to. It usually has the lowest price for gas in Indy and among all the other Costco (yes the prices vary among them, the one on Michigan Road in Fortune Park is about the same). I love their fresh baked cranberry walnut bread which is only available seasonally.  It's $9 for a loaf compared to $16+ at other places. üòã Make every carb calories worth it.

Quality luxury products are better than competitive prices.  Produce, although larger quantity, lasts longer at home and usually has more flavor.  Their signature pizza is consistently the highest quality ingredients and taste without question 100% at any location.  Not strictly bulk purchase; higher end products priced below any competitor.
Thanks, Costco, consistently providing deals to their members.  Michael

Great value, but you should know that out of Costco without reading a review. This particular location is lacking in service. It's difficult to flag someone down on the floor. When ordering food I placed my order and got my number. After 15 minutes I checked on it to make sure that they hadn't lost it. They pointed up to a rail and said something while turned around to assure me that they didn't. 15 minutes later I asked about it again and they said that they lost it. I was at the counter the whole time. I understand it's a newer location but they need some help getting their service together.

Great store to find all the stuff that you and your family need!
Grocery, home goods, electronics, an eye glass store, a pharmacy and a cool little food court place, where you can Always get the $1.50 foot long hot dog combo that so popular amongst Costco members and family and friends!
They also have great prices on chicken bakes and pizza, as well!
And, they also have a service center for your vehicle!
Very cool store! Check it out!

As usual, you have to show a membership ID. Lately, the fruit looks good but goes bad quickly. I bought a bag of nectarines they looked good (mon.) and by Thurs I had to throw the bag out they were molded from the center of the bag out.   Not good for a quick meal being that you have to buy in quantity. I have found some good clothes. If you have a large family it's for you, but watch your prices, the value may be better at your local supermarket. Great for getting supplies for parties or large gatherings.

This is about Costco availability. For some reason Costco does not want to carry Silver at the Evansville store. Other Costco stores have bars normally and now they are carrying silver eagles. Busy sadly Evansville does not get to enjoy the fun. Costco needs to understand that Evansville deserves the full spectrum of Costco products.

A good place to buy bulk goods. They've got a great deal to choose from.  In and out pretty fast. Everything from food to vehicles.  And a service center,too. The snack bar is really good.  Try chicken bacon wrap its real good for a snack before you shop. Never shop hungry.  All in all, it's a good place for what you may need in your refrigerator all the way out to the garage.

I love Costco, but I came in hoping for a fresh chicken pot pie and there weren't any so I purchased some of their other easy dinner options. The checkout ladies were wonderful but I was attempting to pay with a discover card and did not see any signage to let me know they do not take credit, only debit cards. I had to go back to my vehicle, get my bank card and check out a second time $300 worth of groceries. I felt embarrassed for the inconvenience.

Our family absolutely loves coming to Costco. We frequent here on the weekends mostly, so we aren't exactly seasoned on what the store is like throughout a standard Monday through Friday weekday. But on weekends there are usually samples of various food items throughout the store. This gives us a chance to try a bit of everything. For example, the kids tried lentils for the first time ever. I could almost guarantee that if I made them at home, they wouldn't even give them a try. But, because they are samples, the kids tried them and loved them. Now I can make them at home.

The biggest draw, however, is the hot food deli. You can't beat their pizza and their $1.50 hot dog and soda combo. On weekends prepare to wait a while as there can be a substantial crowd waiting on food.

Also, I believe Costco only accepts visa as digital payment. So if you have mastercard or American Express, you might have an issue. Cash of course is always accepted.

I really like Costco for its large variety of items and equipment., I also love the free samples, SO GOOD!!! Overall my shopping experience was pretty good and I love buying in bulk. Afterwards, we got some pizza and some ice cream and it tasted delicious. So Overall, 5/5 on costo for thair outstanding service and great items! Can't wait to come back

My absolute favorite place to shop. This particular location, I've got to know several of the employees and they are awesome. Very warm and inviting and appreciate their jobs.

For fun to post this picture with this review, this is an example of my family hiding from me while we are shopping. I literally did not see them. üòÇ

Happy shopping!

Shopping at Costco Wholesale is always a fun adventure! They have great bulk deals on food, electronics, alcohol, and housewares. They do rearrange the store very often, but it just gives you a chance to make sure you didn't miss any bargains. The food court is fast and super affordable. The employees are always super friendly as well.

This place is a h3ll no for me. My boys had the bright idea to get a Costco Membership today. We were immediately stopped upon entering the store even though the two people in front of us weren't stopped. After my experience in the store today I'm going to attribute it to the fact that I hadn't gotten a fresh blowout this morning nor do I shop at J. Crew or Macy's.
We went to the desk to get a standard Membership because we just wanted to check the place out. HOW DARE WE ONLY WANT THE STANDARD MEMBERSHIP!!! We were met by Lisa, whom was extremely aggressive and got angry that I had researched the memberships ahead of time and knew what I wanted. She was not about to hear it. Her attitude was so nasty I wanted to just leave, but my boys really wanted to check it out. So she got the same attitude she was giving from me.
This place IS NOT for people with anxiety or PTSD.  Don't expect to be able to browse. If you want a rotisserie chicken you're waiting in a line for half an hour if not more.
It's just too much here. Noone needs this much food unless you have a family of 12 or more. That's the only way I'd find this place worth it.
It's also the hot spot to take your family of 13 for lunch. Trying to go down an asile while mom and her wild children are standing in line for a sample is ridiculous.  Technically this is a playground with snacks....
Even the employees have had it here. Everyone of the employees given out samples were exasperated.  Pretty sure the last one I saw was contemplating his life choices and the life was drained from him when a mom in plaid and her puffer vest pulled up with her 4 young children whom were bouncing and screaming as the employee tried to prepare the children's free lunch for the day.
The Membership is ridiculous.  2 cards? Only two people can share the membership in a household??? And someone in your home can't use your card....You HAVE to be there and YOU have to pay for your items.
Being watched like a hawk while my son was checking out is scary.
Felt like I was being accused of stealing the way my sons items were gone through as we left.
Constantly having to show our membership card.
It was too much. I was ready to throw hands with anyone just trying to leave.
I'll be canceling the membership.  Not worth anyone's mental health here.
And who needs a chicken potpie this dang big?!?!?

Costco is an absolute gem of a store that never fails to impress me. From its vast array of high-quality products to its exceptional customer service, it truly stands out as a shopping haven. One of the highlights for me is their gasoline service. Not only do they consistently offer competitive prices, but the convenience of filling up while doing my regular shopping is a game-changer.

Walking through the store, I am always amazed by the variety and value Costco provides. The bulk packaging is not only cost-effective but also eco-friendly, reducing unnecessary waste. The fresh produce section boasts a wide selection of fruits and vegetables that are consistently fresh and delicious. Their Kirkland Signature brand is a testament to their commitment to delivering superior quality at an affordable price.

The friendly and helpful staff members add to the positive experience. Navigating the store is a breeze, and their willingness to assist makes every visit a pleasure. Plus, the samples offered throughout the store provide a delightful treat and a chance to try new products.

But let's not forget about the membership perks! The gas prices alone make the membership fee worthwhile. It's incredibly convenient to fuel up at the end of a shopping trip, and the savings quickly add up over time.

In conclusion, Costco's commitment to excellence shines through in every aspect of their operation. With unbeatable gasoline prices, a vast selection of top-notch products, and outstanding customer service, Costco has earned my enthusiastic recommendation. It's more than a store ‚Äì it's a shopping experience that keeps me coming back for more.

They have maintained the upkeep, cleanliness and quality of this store.  I know people didn't love the hassle of the parking lot remodel last year, but it speaks to the company to repave before the lot was in major need of an overhaul.  This Costco has numerous employees who have been here since it opened which is a testament to the company and local management too.  Even when it's packed, it's great to shop at a place where the employees from all departments seem to enjoy where they work.  Staff from the tire shop had jumped onto the registers the other day and they were wonderful too.  Thank you!

Costco Fan!

I've been a member for years and shop Costco almost weekly.  So much so that it's become a running joke among my family.  That said, it is refreshing to have a retailer that is so convenient even when you are away from home.  Our most recent stop was for fuel and a quick bite to eat before getting on the road.

In addition, my wife and I have also started tracking how many different Costco locations our two month old has visited, six so far.

If asked, I always recommend checking out Costco for your needs.  I can't imagine they don't have something for everyone.
Costco is awesome! and loved their food court better than Sam's

Nice place, cheaper prices but requires a membership (worth it!) Though a lot of times it's harder to find the stuff your looking for. Some areas are narrow, some are wide. Some are cramped, but atleast there's free samples!
Wonderful place I got smoothie I would totally recommend, but they come with paper starws really good fre samples didn't like the coconut water tho overall it's a great place to shop
Costco is the best place to buy alot of seafood, and bulk items, great fresh selection! Gotta love when they get the Tomahawks in!

I got a membership during the summer but I always had a Sam‚Äôs Club membership. Between the two I think Sam‚Äôs Club is better. Sam‚Äôs club layout is a lot better thanCostco. Costco seems to have their items scattered around instead of grouping certain items together. Sam‚Äôs Club has their candy,snacks and chips all  in a tight section where you can go up and down about four isle and can find everything in that section if those are the items you‚Äôre looking for while Costco very small section that isn‚Äôt even straight. The selections are not as big and honestly the prices seem better at Sam‚Äôs. I don‚Äôt like that that we get in the self checkout and workers still come over and scan some item before you‚Äôre done. Is there is a scanner at the check out that I can use myself, then why would I need a person to scan for me? Now the scanner he used was in his hand and I had one in my hand so who is my items being scanned by someone holding the scanner other than mine? It sounds like it‚Äôs part of the security system but it contradicts the meaning of ‚Äúself checkout ‚Äú. There is a bottle neck around the rotisserie chicken area that people who‚Äôs not looking to buy one has to contend with. I saw one isle of men clothes but four for ladies. The workers are very nice but I‚Äôll stick to Sam‚Äôs club after Costco membership expires.

I'm  a Sam's guy as we only have one Costco in Mississippi and we just got it. Overall they are the same insofar as you need to buy in bulk to see a different. I like some of the prices very inviting.

We haven't been here in years. My son recently got a membership and asked if I wanted to check it out. He's a great cook so he loved the organic produce and meat selection. We got some great deals . ( Know your store prices) Favorite find?
25lbs of flour for under $9.
Worth the membership if you shop here often.
My company works for Costco. It is really nice place to shop. They also have a lot of healthy foods as well which is amazing. Your prices are really good.. I fill flowers here. Love it!!

My wife and I took a pre-membership tour. We were pleased with the very friendly people at the front door, the customer service desk and all over the store. If you can buy in bulk and use the product before it expires you can save money. I enjoy the tasty samples and friendly conversations üòã
Great shopping experience. Good selection. High quality items. Sometimes a struggle because of size and volume of items, but overall one of the best stores in the area.

I love Costco. I needed a battery for my car and the young man at register was so helpful and professional. The same young man help has I came back to drop off my old battery for the deposit and the young had to call a manager to give me deposit.  You need to promote the young African American man and empower this man to complete the transaction. He‚Äôs proven his trustworthiness.
We always do a big shopping trip every couple of months. They have great deals on a lot of their products. Staff is always friendly

I went to this new Costco on opening day / night. It was hella busy. This was my very first time in any Costco (but not my first time in a warehouse club). I loved walking around and looking at everything.  The people who worked at this location were sooo nice.
Very spacious!  The staff was very friendly.  Parking spaces are large.

Bigger, better. Finally Costco is in Noblesville. Huge and spacious parking as usual but Costco need to put more Stop signs in between. Its spacious from inside. It has different layout than the castleton location so will need some time to get used to entrance and exit on opposite sides.

Store is great. Food court on the other hand needs help. Ordered pizza by phone. Was told to pick up in 45 minutes. I arrived an hour later. Lady behind counter was rude to me. She would not look for my pizza. Kept telling me that is was not made yet and that it would be about an hour wait. What's the point of calling it in, if I'm there to pick it up when told to pick it up and then told that I need to wait about another hour for it.

Been to the castleton and Michigan rd stores, the workers there  are  burnt out. The noblesville store workers are all pleasant and seem to enjoy the customers and their jobs. Been there 8 times since they opened  just to see the differences among the stores. Keep up the good work!

I‚Äôve been a Costco member since 2016. It‚Äôs my favorite store for all general needs. It has high quality products and outstanding customer service. I trust Kirkland brand items and they‚Äôve never let me down. The employees are all very kind and helpful and the experience is well-worth the price of membership. Clothes, food, concessions, cheap fuel for your vehicle, tires and automotive, electronics, stamps, household items and more are all readily available and shopping there is something I actually look forward to. I can‚Äôt rate this place high enough. I strongly encourage anyone to get a membership. The food court is a huge bonus (which you don‚Äôt have to be a member to enjoy).

Great employees and a clean store!

I was nervous about signing up but Customer Service helped fully explain all the fine details and print for each type of membership. That allowed me to find the right one for me and Ive been shopping here since

The produce and meat is always fresh, and naturally bulk purchasing makes it all economically cheaper than places like Kroger or Walmart.

Not to mention that $1.50 hotdog and drink deal on the way out. Speaking of the food court, it is honestly worth going there just for the food alone, having the best fast pizza in the area in my opinion.

Was surprised and rudely treated when I was told I couldn‚Äôt use my parents membership card. Absolutely absurd! They treat the cards like gold, and make the store feel like a prison. Apparently you can‚Äôt share cards even with your other immediate family members (even as a minor, tried to use my parents card at 15).
Our tire blew out and we had to get a new set. Costco got in quick and we did a little shopping for our grandson.

It was my first time going there. It was a very pleasant experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Got a lot of good bargains. Will definitely go back with my friend, whose a member and will definitely consider getting my own membership.

Great place. Always busy in the morning. I would come the best time is 4pm after and ideally on Thursday or Friday. Weekend you can forget it.

This is cater to Asian stuff which I love.

The parking lot can hold the capacity of the building . There is no good time to visit.  Good luck keeping your car in one piece if you get into the parking lot. Be sure to make use of handicap parking regardless if you are handicapped if you need something in a rush.  Large extended famlies roam the store with multiple carts and block isles and hold up lines. If you suffer from high blood pressure avoid this location as much as possible.

Wow! 2 story Costco! That's amazing. I love the cart escalator and the exotic food/products that Kansas City Costco never carry. Surprisingly, certain items are much cheaper in NY than KC. I can spend a whole day here and not be bored, but my pocket would cry. There's so much to browse and buy. If you are a Costco fanatic, then this is a must visit location.

Today‚Äôs experience at Costco upset me. Why can‚Äôt I checkout on self checkout cashier if it‚Äôs open. Staff did not explain anything and were just ignoring me. They were allowing everyone to checkout while I needed to wait for someone somewhere. After I questioned them about empty self checkout cashier, they decided to close it and said to wait for line. I had only berries and some fruits to checkout. Why can‚Äôt you just close all checkout cashiers if I can‚Äôt checkout by myself. At least explain why you pass everybody else except of me. I was waiting in line for 8 minutes, after I got to open self checkout cashier, they said me to wait for somebody to checkout and started exterminating all other open cashiers.

Good, nice place, always been, still is. A bit overcrowded, so avoid usually busy days. Monday is one of them, don't think it's only weekends. Make sure to check out their food court, unbeatable prices. If you have no dough that's the place to eat. They have absolutely unbeatable price to quality ratio for those French macarons they sell by the berry fridge. Manuka honey is cheap there too.

Long, long lines!
Each location seems overwhelmed with their own popularity. The line is regularly to the back of the store. The self checkout is slow. It is an absolute zoo from open to close.

Literally, all of Long island is at this Costco on the weekends, and yet they have shorter hours. It makes no sense whatsoever. The hours on the weekend should emulate the weekday hours when there are actually fewer people going. This is a poorly thought out. I would argue they should extend the open hours on the weekends.

Costco is a great place to shop for quality products and services at low prices. As a member, you can enjoy many benefits and discounts, such as an annual 2% reward, exclusive offers, and a 100% satisfaction guarantee. You can choose from a wide range of items, from groceries and household supplies to electronics and furniture. You can also shop online and get shipping included on thousands of items. Costco has weekly flyers and coupons that can help you save even more money on your purchases. You can also use a Costco co-branded card to earn cash back rewards. Costco also provides many services to its members, such as tire centre, hearing aid centre, optical centre, pharmacy, photo centre, and travel agency. Costco is a one-stop shop for all your needs. I highly recommend Costco to anyone who wants to get the best value for their money.

Costco is great. Good products, good service. Good prices. The only thing I hate is self check out.....being asked before self service check out for your card & ID so they can look you up & down & make sure it's you. Then to check your receipt immediately after checking out, then to check it again at the exit is a little too much so I don't use self checkout.
Love Costco. Staff is great... friendly and helpful. Good selection. MOST items decently priced. Can't beat the food court..unless they bring back the sausage and pepper sandwich.

The only reason I gave it a two is because I thought I was getting yogurt I guess like in 2018 it was so delicious and healthy and now whatever this is, it‚Äôs just taste like a lot of sugar and I don‚Äôt know I should‚Äôve looked up on the board because it was terrible. I just toss it.üòõ

Otherwise, I like Costco the lines are too long, but that‚Äôs the way it is, but I do NOT like Costco ice cream. That is definitely a NO I think people should look it up and see what the calories and sugar content is.

I love this store! The guy doing the demo for the superfood has phenomenal information.
I have been buying this product on Amazon for quite a bit more and he explained to me why I need to drink this . I love the product and I will continue to come to that store to get it.

The store is stocked well.  In the pasr the employees were helpful and friendly.  Not anymore.  Majority have an attitude that they are doing you a favor helping you.  Some employees are still nice but few and far between l.

Lots of variety at costco. If u pay for a membership to shop, this is the preferred place. The Executive level is $120 but it allows you to get 2% of your annual purchase back in a certificate to use or cash out. Costco has become part of the American way. From blackberries to bundt cakes, they have you covered. Today , 9/1/23 I went to Costco again for odds n ends. They didn't have those so I got other things lol. Blackberries, izze lemonade (both on sale). Oh n Hershey syrup,  2 bottles for $4.97 since it's discontinued perhaps. Same price as izze above. Must be deleted for good. Oddly they do not allow members to order food court items at the front end registers ANYMORE. Can not do it at self checkout either. I say bad move because ordering it before you end shopping, having to order at computers at food court, delays rhe time for you to complete your shopping experience. Who would change policy at that building and not at one at nesconset? I actually laughed instinctually when a red vested employees told me.

This is definitely one of the best Costcos on Long Island for bulk shopping or picking up summer essentials. I find myself going there roughly every two months. The staff is super helpful and friendly. You can snag some really good deals, but be sure to double-check that you're actually saving money. While many items are cheaper than at a supermarket, a few might end up costing a bit more in the long run.

Good product for good price, Gas is cheaper than most gas stations but not all ... didn't like on last visit the fire zone blocked by carts had a issue getting my 91 year old Mom and her groceries in the car üòê ... fire üî• zone still impeded on  01/24/24...

I would like to thank Ms Donna & Mr Keith from the sample department. They had great smile promoting the products. The shopping experience here was very calm and you get your shopping done quickly. The aisles were organized and staffs are present when you cannot find an item, you could simply ask and they will help out. The parking is free also so it‚Äôs a plus.

Do their food court number work??!! No! Why not!!! Because they apparently busy all time! Even when they not busy!

It‚Äôs crazy! Also as of late their pizza is somewhat more oily and thinner! Why?

Cookies are amazing can‚Äôt lie! Chicken bake is a 10/10!

Timing was perfect. Plenty of samples available. Fully stocked aisles, refrigerators, freezers, and a relatively peaceful shopping experience. Lines were short, plenty of carts available.   There were some product changes and location changes where things once were so one may end up making a few circles. Food Court was closed for renovation. Notice at the Court's concession location was very small. As an operations faux-pas, this should be a larger notice/banner size and it should be known at the entry point. For some, shopping and knowing you can get a bite to eat and regroup, is one of the great Costco benefits.

Membership is required. My favorite place to shop with large parking lot. It can be filled up rather quickly and crowded inside. A place for serious shopping only, leave the kids at home. Wide selection of groceries and some samples of new products. Some essential electronics (TVs and cooking etc). A definitely must shop place for me. Food court also has some yummy treats: ice cream, pizza, chicken bake etc

If the temperature is hot outside and you run to Costco to buy water üí¶  for sure you will find an empty palette and no water they are never prepared for hot summer days. And this is not the first time it's always been like that.

This Costco is comparable to suburban locations. It has all the things people love about Costco: great prices (the famous $4.99 rotisserie chicken, and the best value in bacon anywhere), the food samples, and bulk items you can only get there. The customer service desk personnel were friendly and efficient.

My Favorite Food shopping place since I have had my own apartment for over 20 yearsüôåüèæüí™üèæ
My kids love watching me do tetris with the groceries to pack everything securely & efficiently
They try to help us pack it up, but Aht Aht Aht.... I got this!üòÇü§£
I Love this placeüíú

I haven't been here in some time. The prices in the meat section alone are crazy besides throughout the store. Packages and bags/cans are all shrinking in size still, but that price is going up. So I'm paying more for less for real. Really, how much air can you do the industry stuff in the bags / containers. I get everyone trying to make their money. But damn.... the meat selection is not much of a selection, at least cut down the mests, so it's more manageable. People don't have those machines at home.
Again, it is not directly at Costco, but those prices, though.... That it's a sale when it's really not lame. Don't use those words, period. There is nothing on sale anywhere you go to buy in the shopping world.

Costco is always a great experience. We go every few weeks. Intending to get just a few items in the flyer, we arrive and discover many surprises and fill our cart. Prices are great, the staff is friendly and helpful. The long checkout lines actually move faster than you expect. A few sample foods are an extra treat.

Nice and convenient Costco location with paid parking. We do our eye exam with Dr U inside Costco every year and she is great - very kind and thorough. Check out could be a little chaotic but efficient.  The staff are generally nice.

First, I absolutely dread the self checkout horrific experience. Do u need so many employees to supervise adults? Honestly costco is the only store I choose a cashier over self checkout.

The store is bright and has a large selection. The employees are very nice and I was in and out fairly easily. Some seasonal items are now out like gardening, grilling, and outside storage.

Hometown love. Have been a #1 Fan since they opened. Staff has been there for years, and I look forward to seeing their friendly faces. Whether I am visiting Optical, Jewelry, or just a leisurely shop, I am always in the best hands. Fast service at food court. Safe parking lot. Fun fact; this location featured big time lotto winners going back a few years!

Typical Costco. Lots of employees floating around. Visited on a busy Sunday. Tables with clothes were kind of messy but I suppose that is to be expected. Long wait at checkout and exit. Kind of cramped past the registers, where the restaurant‚Äô and customer service is located. But a pretty decent Costco location.

Great shopping. Fewer tems offered, but they are at least a better than average or much better, so less comparison shopping is necessary.   The prices to are at least average or better, plus you get double warranty, better services, help, and return policies. If you see an item for the same price elsewhere, It's better to buy it at Costco.  Only problem with this store is that too many people think like me, and it's really crowded.

This review is for the tire center experience from today. I have seen a steady decline in this department over the last two years. The service is subpar and usually it begins with an attitude. Not just towards me, but other members based on my observation. One employee is really nice and helpful (Frank). He took the time to correct the errors made by the previous employee that decided to walk away for his lunch break, mid transaction. The employee that walked away, told me that the car batteries are pro rated over a year‚Äôs time and said o needed to pay $75 for my battery exchange. The battery was only 8 months old and sells for $110. After the confusion I realized the $65 was the cost of membership renewal (which I told him to include in this transaction since I had to renew). I‚Äôve seen him working at this location for years now. How could he not know what he‚Äôs ringing up? That‚Äôs very concerning especially since he‚Äôs handling money for this place. Also, walk away mid transaction for lunch break? I hope corporate reads these reviews. Based on recent experiences it seems like no one cares at all over Costco corporate or even at the warehouse. Tire center buyers beware

It‚Äôs a Costco! What can I say. They have everything you need +30 gallons extra of it. Been a member for 25 years. Wish I could compare them to Sam‚Äôs club or BJs but don‚Äôt really have a need to do that. It‚Äôs also a great place to buy a fully cooked pizza. Best pizza prices anywhere

Generally a fan of Costco‚Äî quality at reasonable prices. This location is bustling even on a random weekday afternoon.

Pharmacy staff was very nice and professional, the room they use for flu shots has an air purifier and the pharmacy staff that helped wore a mask which was appreciated.

Ventilation was unusually bad for a warehouse type store. It was 1000-1400ppm, quite bad. Lowe‚Äôs or Home Depot are usually around 500-600.

400-450 = outdoors
450-600 = good
600-800 = just OK
800-1000 = bad
1000+ = very bad

"After enjoying golden kiwi from Costco for many years, the kiwi I bought two weeks ago awaited its ripening. Excitedly looking forward to eating it, I found that when I finally cut it open, it was either too firm and sour or simply rotten. Unfortunately, I don't know where this batch of kiwi comes from, but I'm truly disappointed."

Zero isn‚Äôt an option so I‚Äôll put a one. Horrible employees yelling at us and doing a double count on our items essentially accusing us of stealing.

Horrible horrible horrible employee I saw attacking peoples sexuality and assuming peoples genders. Good job Costco hiring bigots.

Go to any other Costco as this one is just horrendous. Avoid at all costs.

PS- we normally have good Costco experiences but this one is garbage.

The store is so big it will take more than an hour to go around. Plenty of selections to buy unfortunately they only accept visa credit card luckily we brought cash otherwise we will go home without any goodies. Most of the products are cheap and  meat products are really fresh. Bakery section the best. I had wonderful time going around the store. Less people and not crowded the 2nd time we went food shopping.  A good experience for us. Thank you.

Organized and well stocked store. At $60 a year for membership I would recommend if you have a Costco nearby and have space to store items. Everything is multipack and large sized. The staff is helpful. One thing I learned is that you do not need to be a member to use the pharmacy.

Typical Costco. Good selection, but overly crowded and narrow aisles for maneuvering particularly near the checkout. Self checkout moved quickly and staff were quick to resolve any issues keeping things going. Long line to get your receipt checked at exit.

Shopping with my kids it was a pleasurable experience until check out.  After checking out and going to the food court I proceeded to leave the store. That was when I realized the cashier had not given me a receipt and I could not leave the store. I proceeded to walk back to the cashier who rang me to grab the receipt. When Suzanne the cashier helper said it‚Äôs your responsibility to get the receipt from the cashier.  I‚Äôm sorry Suzanne if I rang myself up yes it would be my responsibility to make sure I received a receipt . However I did not ring myself up you and another gentleman did. Wouldn‚Äôt it be your responsibility to hand a customer a receipt when you ring them up? I‚Äôm sorry it isn‚Äôt rocket science. But for her to make that comment when I initially said nothing to her is ridiculous! Costco please re-train Suzanne she is rude for no reason !

Great Costco! We just opened a membership here and loved it. They had selections from out of the country which was nice. Their sales seem to be amazing, we stumbled upon a $45 sale of ON whey protein when they're currently around $80!

I went my own costco on middle country road. You can get an eye exam in their optical department, which I did last week. My prescription pairs of glasses were in today so I picked them up. I also did some shopping, picture included. They starting selling baseball cards again. I bought a few of the 2023 topps flagship collection box, 2 feet by 1 feet approximately in length . Also, avocados which I used with eggs today. Additionally the southwest chicken wraps are outstanding.

Large parking lot. Avoid weekends if possible since it will be extremely crowded. Must have Costco card to enter. Can't use any credit card except Costco credit card. You can use debit card or cash. Wholesale price. Cheaper than most places. Little bit disorganized but it is ok.
This Costco is pretty good, you can buy outdoor gear and fitness equipment here.
a good store and a much better selection than in Connecticut, and a larger assortment, there is also alcohol and not only that, take your family friends and relatives and run here;)

Great place to buy in bulk at reasonable to low prices. The downside is the long checkout lines. Expect to waste approximately 20 to up to 40 minutes checking out. Let me not forget the chaos at the parking lot.

At your new rochelle location, I had a terrible experience at the self Checkout lane today with one of the employees who refused to help me and abandoned her post. I waited on the long line to come to the self check out and the lady named brenda said I had a shop too much to go to the other other cashier where I had to wait on the long line again. I told her there were no signs stating there were a limit for the self checkout and I had my child with me she was tired.

I had shopped at the self checkout numerous times before with a lot more stuffs. I started scanning all the little stuffs , I had couple of large items like water case and cereal boxes on the shopping cart, I asked Brenda to help me scan the rest item, she refused to help me she said no I told you everything will not fit. I told her I have never place water cases on the register, it usually gets scanned on the shopping cart. I also told her if she is not willing to scan to give me the hand scanner so I can do it,. Asked for the store manager, some other employee claiming to be a manager, named sherryl, tells me that I should have listened to her in the first place. I have been shopping there with a payed membership, went through the self checkout. With way more merchandise, I was helped before, and not to mentioned they scaned other costumers merchandise from there shopping cart, and they gave me an attitude in front of my five year old daughter. Trying to play me like a fool. Your employees were unprofessional, and didn't want to provide service when requested and tried to brush me off because the I was pushing a load that may been to much for them.i put up a picture of the shopping cart they refuse to scan by hand.

I always come here when I need gas, and this Costco, like other locations, is fine. Good products at good prices. I would have given this place a 5 star review except for the fact that the guy checking me out smelled like a homeless person and he was handling all my groceries which made me not so happy. If Costco is interested in knowing who it was let me know but I suspect you guys already know. If your employees don‚Äôt shower, please don‚Äôt let them be in a position to handle food. Maybe just make them take a day off? Just a thought.

My favorite Costco. Gas is about 25 cents per gallon cheaper. Lines move quick, and keep in mind the pumps extend to the far side of your car.
Parking area is huge, as are the spaces-very wide. With a narrow sidewalk leading to the store to keep you safe from moving vehicles. Store is rarely overwhelmingly crowded, is usually kept very neat, clean & orderly. As are their bathrooms. Eyeglasses are about one third the price of anywhere else I have had the misfortune of purchasing them over the last 40 years. Checkout is always quick; I usually use the self-checkout area. Nice place to shop.
Also: ten months after purchasing my glasses I returned to inquire if anything could be done about a chip in one lense. Unsure how it happened. The gentlemen told me it would be a week to ten days. No charge!!!!!

Im obsessed with Costco! The moment I step through those iconic doors, I know I'm in for a treat. the selection is vast, and the quality is top-notch. From fresh produce to electronics, I know I can trust that I'm getting the best value. Plus, the Kirkland Signature products are a game-changer - that chocolate chip cookie dough is my weakness! The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the self-checkout lines make shopping a breeze. And let's not forget the food court - $1.50 hot dogs and pizza slices? Yes, please! Overall, Costco is my happy place, and I'll be a loyal member for life!"

Kenny & Glen are top notch in the optical department!! They went above & beyond to resolve my issue. They were sweet, professional & patient even though it was a very busy Saturday. Costco is very lucky to have them representing the company in a time where excellent customer service is rare.

Oceanside Costco is the best place on earthüíØ it‚Äôs big enough to enjoy everything and park anywhere you like, managers are extremely nice and helpful, the staff is very kind, returns are done easily‚Ä¶ never had a problem there as I heard other Costco staff is rude, this is the place for the nicest workers, managers and Administrators‚Ä¶

I was in Costco Optics and received great personal service. The lady (who, per her tag has been with Costco since 2002), went out of her way to help me find a suitable frame. And she very capably took care of all insurance aspects and ordered the glasses for me very efficiently. First class service. And the prices are very good.

This is a two layer store. Normally it‚Äôs very busy but today during the snowstorm, it was kind of nice and quiet. I was able to try this new superfood, and the price is a lot less expensive than online.

Has 2 levels. Used the food court, service was quick, seating is tight.
Parking is very very tight. No gas.

As a frequent visitor to Costco Port Chester, I can confidently say it's a shopper's haven. Nestled conveniently in Port Chester, this warehouse store offers a plethora of goods at unbeatable prices.

One of the highlights is the spacious layout, which makes navigating through the aisles a breeze. The staff is always friendly and eager to assist, creating a welcoming atmosphere. Moreover, the membership perks, including discounts and exclusive deals, make it worth the investment.

From bulk groceries to electronics and home goods, Costco Port Chester has it all. The quality of products is consistently high, and the selection is diverse, catering to various tastes and preferences.

Additionally, the food court is a must-visit, offering delicious hot dogs, pizza, and other treats at wallet-friendly prices. It's the perfect pitstop for refueling during a shopping spree.

Overall, Costco Port Chester is more than just a store; it's an experience. Whether you're stocking up on essentials or indulging in a little retail therapy, this warehouse giant delivers on all fronts.

Your typical Costo for the area. A good product range etc. The issue here is the opposite of some of the others where the parking is tight but the store is flat and open. This one has really good parking and a funny floor layout that involves two floors escalators and elevators. Sometimes the wheels don't auto lock so you can take the escalator so then you have the use the elevator which can only take about five carts at once. Either way is slow compared to their flat layout. I personally rather fight for parking and be able to move my large, heavy shopping cart around the entire store easily.

Romance can be found in the most unexpected of places‚Äîeven a Costco parking lot in Queens, New York. As the sun dips below the skyline, casting hues of crimson and gold across the asphalt, it's a reminder that beauty knows no bounds. Surrounded by the hustle and bustle of urban life, there's a quiet intimacy in sharing this moment with someone special. It's not about the grand gestures; it's about finding magic in the mundane. So grab a slice of pizza, clink your Costco-sized soda cups, and toast to love, laughter, and the simple pleasures life has to offer.

I do a shopping here once in a while. Actually in 2 different locations. Here and in Brooklyn on 3rd Ave. My family spent over $10.000 dollars at Costco.So I feel very comfortable at this store. But today I got disappointed. I stopped for the restroom. And can you imagine: a guy with a name Fritz whose job is look at customers‚Äô receipts and imitate that he counts the items and match them with the receipt didn‚Äôt allow me go enter the store from the exit side. Which is next to the restroom. His partner/ boyfriend Kevin said that I have to enter from the main entrance and he corrected, saying that I can‚Äôt use that restroom. Only the other one which he told me is in cafeteria. And he insisted it looking at my VIP membership card. Unbelievable.

It‚Äôs great! I mean, it‚Äôs Costco how could it not be. The employees keep the lines moving and are helpful when you need it. I took off a star only because this one is very small and doesn‚Äôt have everything like the one in Westbury and it runs out of sale items fast‚Äîbut it seems to be the clearing house Costco. You can find a lot of clearance items such as clothes for cheap‚Äîsometimes as low as three dollars.
went through the humiliating procedure of having my empty backpack searched as I left the store.  It's disgusting.

Rumi is one of the best employees at Costco Vernon. When she is at the checkout she is very attentive to the customers, she does not mix up the items and above all she is calm and gentle. Employees like this make you want to come to Costco. Regardless of the number of people in his line, I prefer to go to someone else. A truly peaceful person

An amazing store where you can shop for your business, the line goes quick and it has everything you need. This store is very positive because they greet you well and provides samples that promotes healthier products, such as Celsius drink where it gives you energy in your day to day life. Vita Coco is also a good hydration drink. You can also pick up gift cards for your love ones such as for Anniversary. Overall, it was a good shopping experience. Thank you to Ms Janette from the sample department for promoting the brands.

They were supposed to close 15- minutes after we got there but they stayed opened and my niece and I got to finish shopping. I was only suppose to get a few things but ended up buying double what I was meant to get. Even though they are located downstairs it is so big down there. We ended up leaving 20mins after closing time, so about 7:20 cause it was a Sat. Parking is not free it's either park in their garage, which I've never done, or lucky enough to find street parking. My husband waited in the car.

Today I was shopping with my husband, daughter and grandchildren at Costco. According to tradition, we ordered a whole pizza, drinks, ice cream from the cafe and waited about an hour for something else. There was a young man serving, he was the only man on shift, the rest were girls. He gave me everything except pizza within an hour. although I stood and all this time asked him to give it to me while the pizza was being prepared. he publicly ignored my request and took advantage of the fact that I don‚Äôt know English well. continued to serve all the numbers that came after me. In addition, he took my personal check with which I stood in line. in the end, an hour later I gave everything except the pizza, then crumpled up my receipt and threw it on the table. I was perplexed and outraged by this behavior. I asked to invite a senior employee. but the employee ignored my request. my husband came up and asked where our pizza was, to which he said that I allegedly said that I got it. my husband said that this is impossible because I only speak Russian. the employee did this to justify why he crumpled my check. in the end he went and gave the pizza. I suffered humiliation and discrimination from this employee. I was under a lot of stress. If I see this employee again, I will never buy anything from him and will advise my acquaintances, relatives and friends to do the same. .I am attaching to this review the receipt that he crumpled up and threw on my table.

This Costco is a must to visit with plenty of parking inside rego center located in a great neighborhood next to many bus lines the subway and an expressway products for all your needs at a great price  with helpful staff

This was the worst shopping experience my wife and I ever had. It's like a zoo, you can barely move around on a Sunday. And everything is oversized made for people who eat like animals. Don't think I would ever go back. We ended up going to our local supermarket, and it was way better, more peaceful, and more products to choose from. I actually used to work at this Costco while in college. Didn't realize how bad it was to shop there.

The organic section is great but we had difficulties buying a 2 pack of thermos mugs. Apparently somebody switched the colors in a pack and they wouldn't let us purchase the pack of water bottles.. which was very disappointing. The check out lady was rude about it too. Costco is usually great with the customer service.. very disappointed

First time in this Costco, customer service, cashier and porters are rude and unhappy people, beside they threaten you like a thief. Come in today 2/28 to update my membership and the lady at the customer service was very nice!
Also the gentleman working by the pharmacy and the security were very friendly, attentive and helpful. Thank you!
The store was impeccable. Kudos to the Riverhead team!

Good place to buy stuff if you don't mind. Buying a little bit of bulk has a nice selection of beer as well as wine. Has a little bit of everything. Really can't go wrong. I think it's worth the membership price

This place is being to much with the id showing I mean costco card you have to show to every employee you run into they need to stop with this harassment of showing id's they're over doing it now BJS is not like that  I show the lady my ID scanned it I had to go back to get a chicken and the same lady ask to see my ID AGING  I'm in this store everyday the lady see me every day it pathetic costco is that paranoid they don't let people shop if people want to steal they're not going to goto the register

I came in Rochester for like 9 months now and this was my first visit to Costco. I had the best shopping experience of the decade. My words, so many collections of top quality food brands. Nothing comes close.

My son took us here to see what it's like.. I really love this place, it's got everything you could think of. The food was delicious that you eat upfront $1.99 for soda and a huge hot dog!! Great multi packs, only thing is, you have to shop there a lot, to take advantage of the membership fee in one year. That's why it's reasonable..I'll get one after holiday seasonüëç

We occasionally travel across the border to explore the diverse range of products available that we don't find back home. Each visit reveals something new and interesting, which is a big part of the appeal. The staff members we interact with are always friendly and welcoming, adding a personal touch to our shopping experience. However, it's worth noting that the place is perpetually bustling with activity, often resulting in long lineups. Despite the crowds, the variety and the warmth of the staff make the trip worthwhile.

I like the variety and quality of the products. They have lots of organic products and healthy options. I love that on the weekends theres so many samples in every aisle. I dislike that it‚Äôs crowded every time I have go regardless of the time.

The food court pizza is not bad and I really liked the chicken bake. I did not like the fruit smoothie.

2/2024: The inside of the store looks just like California Costcos.  3/11/24: Nice workers.  Wide variety of food & items.  It's odd that they do not box your items for you.  3/24: Things are done differently here: staff said partly due to Covid.  They do not box your purchases or wrap your pizza slices!  You can not buy food court items at the register üôÑ when you're paying for your groceries.  March, 2024: They had Hermes toilet water online for $96, compared to $161 per bottle at other retail stores.

‚ÄúI had an amazing experience with Costco wholesale store located in Staten Island! The customer service was top-notch, and the product exceeded my expectations. I had an issue during to pay at self cashier station. Supervisor Trish help me right away to resolve the problem.  She did an amazing job and I wish that every Supervisor was like her. I highly recommend Costco located in Staten Island to anyone looking for quality products and excellent service.‚Äù

12/4/23, evening, The employee working in the self-checkout area should be aware of customers with large/heavy items and actively/promptly help check out. ...In my experience, most employees won't come to you voluntarily until you asked for help. They were usually busy chatting with some one and help them with their small items, or checking the photos on the membership cards. once or twice, I remembered, some young employees did quite well. They understood who needed help and were happy to help.

Very rude co worers not nice at all cashier , customer service and the one who check the receipt all old people are very very rude .
I don't why they hiring tired old people why they not giving a chances for youth.
Hope they change the hiring time
I love costco

If you are a truck driver and you are delivering here just avoid this place.
They are very disrespectful to the drivers.
I am up since 1:30AM, I came here 12:30 for an appointment @ 3PM
they are holding me out till 3:15PM and after couple of times ringing the bell they finally responded.
They asked me to get in door 1 and to come inside or to give them the keys if I want to stay in the truck.
It's freaking freezing outside and if I don't run the truck I will freeze.

This Costco is extremely bad.
Even their customers are complaining, why people even come here shopping?

Pieces of junk to say the least on the membership team. My mom is bed bound and cannot leave the house and I was simply trying to purchase muffins and croissants for her and because her membership just expired they made me put it back. Have a heart. Also this place is always a mad house like they‚Äôre giving out free turkeys in here.

First time here at Costco I spent about an hour and a 1/2 walking around checking out the place...... So many items to look at I wanted to get myself familiar with this store..... Lots of neat stuff here from hard good soft goods food and so much more.....
Interesting experience. The membership is not worth it for me due to distance, however, I can see why it is for most people. The quality of the products is top notch.

Good prices and excellent meat and bakery departments. Their Australian lamb chops are outstanding, and don't pass up a chance to try their croissant rolls, cookies and cinnamon rolls. You have to be willing to buy in quantity (such as a 1.3 gal bottle of Heinz White Vinegar at a very low price), and sometimes an item you like (eg. the cinnamon rolls and Paisley Farms 4-bean salad) will disappear from stock only to reappear 6 months later. While shopping, take advantage of the free samples handed out by their friendly staff. You need to pay a yearly membership fee to shop at Costco's which also entitles you to purchase gasoline at their pumps at a price that is usually the lowest in town. Be sure to sign up to receive their monthly mailer listing items on sale. UPDATE-1: The 24 pack of cookies at under $10 is a bargain. The chocolate chip and macadamia/white chocolate cookies are very good, and the oatmeal raisin are outstanding.
They have good deals . The food is good there . The prices are good . The food are a good size .

Workers are friendly, helpful, and professional. I only had questions about membership, so I didn't go inside the store. Looked VERY well-stocked from the entrance. If you're a member, don't forget to bring your Costco membership card!

Love the goodie selections for Chinese new year! Costco is amazing. This location is super busy, but I‚Äôm always happen when I‚Äôm shopping here. Love it. The locals love it. No complaints, not even the long line bothers me!

We usually love everything we get at Costco and their prices, and this year our absolute favorite item was the Snoopy Christmas tree! It was also great for Frida Panda to pose with and wish all a Merry Chrismukkah! üêæüêº ‚ô•Ô∏è

I also prefer this location because it feels less hectic‚Ä¶ although it can still be very busy, it is somehow more manageable than other locations west of it.

I went with my neighbor. I normally go to bj's. I was quite impressed with their variety. The store was extremely crowded, but I didn't like they didn't take my credit card, but I used my bank card. "ANYWAY"
I've found some great snacks for my pescatyrian lifestyle.
I would recommend this place

Great products, prices, but very overcrowded and long lines however cashiers are fast and efficient.
You would think self checkout at the food court would make the process faster, but get ready to wait 20-40 min for your ticket to be called. No blames towards the workers in the kitchen, the problem is the system. It was fine when it was just the cash registers upfront.

My biggest complaint and maybe I don‚Äôt know the whole story, were the managers standing around yelling at the busy employees, pretending to help but making everything stressful and chaotic. The employees faces just look disgruntled, it‚Äôs laughable yet sad. At the regular lines a manager had the audacity to be passive aggressive to his ONLY worker trying to control the lines. He was saying ‚Äúwhy don‚Äôt you sit don‚Äôt, calm don‚Äôt, see all better?‚Äù Meanwhile the employee he was talking to ignored him. Managers HELP them, you useless a-holes.
Costco I highly recommend you all to try out, their more cheaper and cost saving with highest top quality products, at a wholesale price.

I made a purchase online with a pick up in the store. Nobody was available to help me. But they were all talking, and alighting including the manger. They all ignored me, including the manager. Minutes later he decided to help me, he was rude
This place is great. Compare with others Costco that I have been. You know when a location is good, it will be always full of people. I think that people are nicer here. Things are more organized.

I think this is a very good Costco location they have stuff for the city and for suburbs they have sinks they have mattresses and all a  household needs and of course Costco has certain kosher food and cookies. So I thought I should go online even before my family has collected all the items we need because usually in Brooklyn the line takes forever but overhear I went to the line and I was almost done checking out even before my family has finished collecting all the stuff they needed they check you out very fast even on a Sunday but add the receipt check at the end of the store that took a while even though I had so little items she made sure everything was counted but that didn't bother me so much, it's a clean and nice store bathrooms were clean and nice not smelling like in Brooklyn. I like this location also you have phone service all over the store. Whomever you ask any worker in the store will answer you right away wherever store items are you won't have to go too far to look for them
Considering it is snowing I am surprised by the fact this place wasn't crowded.

Even though they were out of the item I came for, the staff was quite helpful and pleasant. They also had an interesting array of family style dishes that were irresistible. As always, I ended up with stuff I absolutely had no intention of buying LoL

Overhyped- this store is a shell of its former self. As a Costco member since 2001, I am disappointed in the overall upkeep and cleanliness of the store. It also seems like there are less items available, for example the bread section is 1/2 of its previous size. Prices are high comparatively and the food court not having condiments is ridiculous.  I‚Äôm done - Sam‚Äôs has better deals and the store is clean.

Costco isn't just a store‚Äîit's a lifestyle. From the moment you step through those iconic doors, you're welcomed into a world of unparalleled value and variety.

First and foremost, let's talk about the savings. Costco is the ultimate destination for budget-conscious shoppers looking to stretch their dollar without sacrificing quality. From pantry staples to electronics and everything in between, Costco's bulk-buying power ensures that you get more bang for your buck.

But it's not just about the deals‚Äîit's about the experience. Navigating the aisles of Costco is like embarking on a treasure hunt, with unexpected finds and hidden gems waiting around every corner. And with their ever-changing selection of seasonal items and rotating specials, there's always something new and exciting to discover.

Of course, no trip to Costco would be complete without a visit to the food court. Whether you're craving a slice of their famous pizza or a hot dog with all the fixings, the food court offers delicious eats at unbeatable prices‚Äîa perfect pit stop for refueling during your shopping adventure.

And let's not forget the perks of membership, from access to exclusive deals and discounts to the convenience of their gas stations and pharmacy services. It's like joining a club where the benefits just keep getting better.

In summary, Costco isn't just a store‚Äîit's an experience. With its unbeatable value, diverse selection, and member perks, it's no wonder Costco has become a beloved staple in the lives of so many. So next time you're in need of essentials or just looking for a little retail therapy, Costco has got you covered!
Great price for ribs.  I love getting the chums too!! (Rolls of ground beef, Great quality, less $ than in the case).

Love shopping here for groceries and household products. They have a fantastic variety of food, and the sizes are great to plan out a week or more at a time.

Be forewarned on Sundays and before holidays the place can get packed and lines get loooooooooonnnnnnnggggg. But you can always grab hotdogs after. (It's like a reward)

My first visit to Green Bay COSTCO.  Not the easiest store for out-of-towner to find but worth the effort.  Typical layout and well stocked with merchandise.  Expected  a larger range of sales items given the time of year.  Ended up with more impulse items than I needed which, I guess, made it a successful visit.

It‚Äôs a pretty typical Costco. It‚Äôs a brand new store so it‚Äôs very clean. You never quite know what you‚Äôll find on any given visit.I got a nice ch√¢teaunerf de pape for a decent price. It‚Äôs a great wine. A lot of people rave about Costco for their crate bourbon, I went almost daily for a couple of weeks and never found anything out of the ordinary at this location very few checkouts are staffed, they want to use the self check out, they don‚Äôt have the scan and go like Sam‚Äôs Club does, the pizza is good, and cheap.
Awesome place to shop I bought a 75 in tv for $499 there can't get a better deal than that and the staff even helped me load the big TV in my truck

Easy location to find. Ample parking. For those with handicap needs, up close parking. Friendly staff, diversity in products. Online shopping is also great. One specific item I was looking for was out of my size.  I went online when home, found it and ordered. Will arrive next week. Over all quite pleased with my experience.
It's always a great to shop at Costco! Staff are super friendly and helpful.

Great Costco.  Very organized inside to handle the new store rush.  Stay away from the membership counter if at all possible!  Wrong hours are posted in the news releases and even on google.  Here are the correct hours:
Saturday crowd was more navigable here than the Brookdeild location on a weekday!

I was there about 2 weeks ago and bought 2 packs of bacon. Opened them a week after purchase, and they were both full of mold. They both said they were good until July. I don't live in the area, so I was unable to make it back to that location for a return or exchange. Employees are ridiculous about the membership cards and trying to dictate how a customer pays. If a husband and wife have a membership together and credit card together, what does it matter who's name is on it. Its none of a stores business how a customer is paying unless they are trying to use a form of payment, not excepted. How do you treat elderly or disabled people if they come in with others to help them. Rethink your nonsense! Ridiculous

Costco, you are being incredibly petty! My husband and I shop here all the time for many years and because I had his card you wouldn't let me check out. A normal person would‚Äôve let the customer go about their business and make sure that they get added to the account. It‚Äôs never been an issue in the past, so who knew?! Instead, you take a middle-age woman, parade her across the store to tell her what she already knows, if you weren‚Äôt going to let me check out, you should have simply said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry you‚Äôll need to bring your husband back.‚Äù I didn‚Äôt need you to give me a lesson on policy. Very strange.
I go to Costco pharmacy to get my dog's prescription. It's the best price I can get around and Jeremy in the pharmacy is pleasant and helpful.

Very nice staff!  Let me chat with them while husband got the card because it was negative degrees!  They encouraged me to stand under the heater as I was shivering.  Has all the food, well stocked, and clean store.

Great place to be. The sample ladies and gentlemen are always the nicest and they give out amazing samples. It's tough not to get them. The atmosphere there is also amazing. It's very easy to get in and out as well. Overall, one of the best stores in the area!

Best thing since sliced bread. Half of what I own has probably been purchased from Costco. I‚Äôve never been disappointed by a product.

They have a an excellent electronics section. Their TV selection has a great variety of makes and models. They have the best policy on headphones and ear buds - LIFETIME SATISFACTION GUARANTEE (if you don‚Äôt believe me talk to someone in the store or look online).

As a whole the warehouse carries a diverse selection of items. They continue to get new products and do a nice job rotating them throughout the store .

If you‚Äôre a first timer, just get one of the rotisserie chickens. I promise it‚Äôs not all hype, they‚Äôre great.

My most recent purchase has been a Lasko space heater. Couldn‚Äôt be happier. The heater is efficient at warming up any regular sized room in a house or office. It has all the bells whistles and more for only $50. More importantly it‚Äôs very quiet.

They usually have the cheapest fuel in town. If you play the membership/credit card game right you‚Äôre able to earn lots of cash back.

LAST THING: COSTCO - Bring back the turkey melt!!!

My experience is that the associates have always been very helpful. The warehouse is always clean and has a pretty good selection of goods, however, the stock is never quite the same from month to month. If you see something, buy it then; you may not see it next time you go. I often go with a friend because the portions are larger, and I do need to split them with a friend.
You can‚Äôt beat the rotisserie chickens, and hearing aid batteries for price!

Friendly staff that are very helpful! Like the selection of products you can't find in a regular store.

It is pouring rain today and 37 degrees and a staff person getting carts saw me drop my earphone and it rolled under my SUV. He got down on the ground and crawled to get it for me. Very grateful!

I would like to inform you that I have once again come across expired products at this Costco in Appleton warehouse located (5401 W Integrity Way
Grand Chute, WI 54913
United States). The first time it was expired fresh fish. The second time it's smoked salmon, it's in a vacuum package and it's already five days overdue. For me, it's terrible how it happens in a store where I pay for membership. That is, I have to pay for it and not receive proper service at the same time. I understand that I can go to the store and get a refund without any problems, but no one takes into account my time spent on this, I live 30 minutes from the store and in order for me to get a refund, I have to spend an hour! Also, since expired products are often found, the desire to go to this store begins to disappear! It can also happen something terrible and someone, without noticing it, will eat expired food and get to the hospital! Does it also mean that I have to go around the store and check the expiration date of each product? But it seems to me that this is the work of the store's employees! We like this store, but we regularly come across expired products and you're already starting to wonder if it's worth going there!

Its always clean and organized. Checkout is fast, there was a guy there, who helped me beyond expectation. He went looking all over the entire store and on his his radio to find a misplaced pallet of sugar free muscle milk. This is important to me for after fire calls, disaster deployments and such.
He totally hooked it up, carried back too!
Know your prices at Costco, sometimes also had it for the same or cheaper and you don't have to buy a ton at once. Their meat is the best quality versus price honestly. The orange chicken is great, chicken sausages, coffee, spring rolls, frozen snacks too. Paper products are good quality versus price also..
Again, know your numbers people.

First negative experience. We bought a down comforter yesterday and when we unpacked it at home that evening it was immediately apparent that it was heavily used and returned and put back on the shelf to resell without even looking at it. It was covered in stains (looks like sweat or urine, possibly blood?), hair, and other debris which would have been obvious if even a bare minimum inspection happened. When we returned it today we were refunded but the employee told us they don‚Äôt look at returned goods and just take the persons word that it was unused. This completely changed my opinion of buying any consumer goods from them. It was essentially a biohazard and now I‚Äôm concerned about fleas or bedbugs or any other possible infestation that could be in our home. Very disappointed in our experience which seems very out of character for an otherwise great store. I guess just be aware of this possibility when buying home goods from here.

To be fair, I did go around 4:30pm. Customer service not so good. Lots of out of stock items in the Cafe. Soda machine down. Had to get a warm diet Pepsi. The customers were even annoying to me. In membership,  I think her name is either Brenda or Jennifer, She is a Black woman. She was very sweet helpful. That was the highlight of the visit. It was tons of options but cost is higher then Sam's Club.

Customer service is not a priority here. I opted to do a self guided tour in order to decide if I wanted to join and decided to after finding a few good items even though my experience on the sales floor was subpar at best. Jennifer at the membership desk was very nice and even came over to take a look at our cart and compliment our purchases. The ladies at the self checkout stood there and watched us which made us uncomfortable. At least come over to help instead of stalking while we ring up our groceries. There‚Äôs definitely a wide variety of items here but customer service on the sales floor and checkout needs some work.

It's worth fighting the crowds to go the day of the new sale. Just remember their items are always a little different than the same item at a box retailer. I hope they follow through on getting rid of the sample carts. I saw a family taking 4 samples each at every sample cart. And their shopping cart was empty.

Costco opens at 10 am to the general public.  Got there at before 10.  Doors open, and it was quiet.  Everything looked fresh. folded and stocked.  We were there for about an hour and found what we needed, plus more.

I love my Costco!  They‚Äôre always in stock of the basics I need‚Ä¶and (curses!) they always have something I want but was not expecting to buyüòÇüòÇüòÇ

My top 10:
‚ù§Ô∏è Rotisserie chicken every time
‚ù§Ô∏è Kirkland Scotch
‚ù§Ô∏è 5 dozen eggs
‚ù§Ô∏è Pharmacy
‚ù§Ô∏è Frozen fruit chunks
‚ù§Ô∏è Fresh berry parks
‚ù§Ô∏è Volcano lemon juice
‚ù§Ô∏è Microfiber fuzzy blankets
‚ù§Ô∏è spices and olive oil
‚ù§Ô∏è THE $1.50 HOT DOG!!!

Always clean and well organized, and the store staff is pleasant and helpful.

It's a great place to buy things in bulk. However, they have terrible customer care. Every time I come in, I get treated like I have no business being here. It seems to me like staff very much judges you by your appearance. As an ambulatory wheelchair user, they're only nice to me when I come in on days I need my wheelchair. Other than that, I get treated super poorly. If you're okay with being treated badly, go ahead and buy a membership.

Every single time I have been in this location there has been a middle aged woman with red hair working at the service desk that has been unbelievably rude, unprovoked, to many people including her coworkers (except for the coworker she was flirting with). I love Costco, many other employees are kind there and actually know how to treat customers but this woman needs to be fired.

Chaotic but I think that's probably just part of the whole Costco experience. Pharmacy staff were friendly and efficient and the person giving me my flu shot was masked which I appreciated. Main thing is you can assume you'll always be able to find the same selection of stuff...and while many things are a good deal, not everything is so it pays to price compare.

What a great wholesale store. I was able to go several times with a friend as a guest. My experience has always been positive when there. Despite it being crowded at times, lines move quickly. Their purchasers make great choices on what they carry at Costco. Foods are tasty and they have demos at times. There is a large liquor department with a wonderful liquor consultant, James, to guide you when needing some advice on what to buy. Desserts are delicious, the cakes and specialty cranberry walnut bread are so satisfying.  As you can see by the photos, the store is clean and very well maintained.  I am now a proud member...is it time for you to join too?

I love Costco! I've been a member for over 5 years. Great seasonal items, camping gear in summer, Christmas trees in fall/winter, plants in spring, and more. Every day items, electronics, housewares, clothing, produce, meats, soups, pet supplies, water, juices, drinks, beer, wine, spirits.
There's plenty more.
Had a return visit and found some crab legs and Lobster tails.
Always a nice place to shop. Delighted with their special offers, fresh foods and fruits. Love that they carry so much quality furniture and appliances. Wonderful people.
Got a gift membership to Costco.  I‚Äôm not a big buyer for large bulk purchases.  Nice meat selection.  Liked the fresh cut flowers.

This Costco was really busy but also surprisingly efficient. They had all the cash registers going and the food court was serving up a new order every few seconds. The two workers at the front end of the food court were amazing!
It's always a great day visiting Costco. The people are really nice. I like all the free samples. The prices are always very reasonable. I always find good deals on the electronics. I love the pizza

Love this Costco! The Pewaukee Costco is located in a great location on Pewaukee road. This is a very organized and clean store, and the staff is very helpful. There is a pharmacy and a food court too with a great menu including churros, ice cream and chicken bakes. You can sit down at a table and enjoy your food. You can buy most things here including food items, soda, diapers, dog food, clothing, electronics, alcohol, bakery and much more. It also has a gas station with the lowest prices in town! I highly recommend a visit to the Pewaukee Costco.

Today was my 1st day as a Cost Co member and I'm shocked by the horrible staff, 1st the customer service desk wasn't sure how to activate my member that bought through a Groupon, and was grumbling about it vs. asking someone to help her if she didn't know how.

Then this location is set up very weird to the point it was a bit overwhelming, go to self check out non of the boxes there for customers where the right size for my items.
