So I went a lane over where a row of register was empty and grabbed a box and the cashier YELLED at me as if I were a child that I was not allowed to walk  behind her in a very open concept register situation and given it was directly behind the food court, how many people walk behind her to cut through there.

Who the hell does she think she talking to like like this? Also, again my 1st time in a Cost Co there are no signs posted for this, and also you don't YELL at people to the point people in her own line are slack jawed by your workers horrible customer service.

Everything was going good‚Ä¶everybody was friendly until I got to the self check out. I was using my parents membership card and because they weren‚Äôt there because they were busy I got denied the ability to check out. Something needs to change because I know I technically wasn‚Äôt paying for the membership but my parents are and I‚Äôm a part of their household and I‚Äôm still giving money to Costco by paying for the items. After being denied another lady heard the conversation and was offering to use her membership card so we could purchase the items but the Cosco employee heckled her and said that she would have to pay for it instead of us using our card which is beyond real and totally ridiculous. It‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm using some random persons card it is a card from a member of the household that I live in. I‚Äôm just in disbelief.

During an out-of-town trip to Pewaukee, I visited what was once my local Costco and savored every minute.  Particularly enjoyed the pastry selections and men's clothing items on sale.  I miss my old store and the good memories it provided.

I let my membership expire for 2 months before renewing, to save money.  The only problem is that Costco doesn't like customers saving money!!!  They renewed my next membership for only 10 months at full price, instead of 12 months, and the people at the service desk actually refused to answer straightforward questions about this, and just redirected to "we can refund your membership if you never want to shop here again."  The problem is I do find it a useful store to shop at, and would like to be treated fairly while shopping there.  Twice I've gone out of my way to make sure I paid the correct amount at a register when a Costco employee made a mistake and missed an item, but they won't do the same when the mistake works in their favor.  Shameful and disgusting.

Great store. Just like any other Costco, it has an abundance of things, but in large packages. So, if you want a large amount of anything of then furniture, clothes or anything from the food court, this place is for you!

Costco is Costco. Remarkable warehouse- style retailer that somehow doesn‚Äôt feel like a cold, big box facility. Amazing, fast-turning inventory of often useful items at typically low prices. Bulk grocery selections are first rate. Optical center offers high quality vision products at lowest prices I‚Äôve found anywhere. Same can be said for auto center: Great prices on top-shelf batteries and tires. (Unfortunately auto center does seem to be occasionally overwhelmed by demand). Low gas pricing too. And return policies throughout are unbeatable. If any criticism, like to see Costco incorporate more aggressive form of recycling options for patrons.

I mean, it‚Äôs Costco. Who doesn‚Äôt love Costco!
A trip to Costco is always a yes.
Great selection, amazing customer service.
Highly recommend!

APPARENTLY Costco‚Äôs new/mot do new rule is guests have to pay CASH.

Went with my cousin as her guest and shopped for 2 hours. Went to split the payment in line separating hers from mine and was told the member has to pay or I can pay cash. Over 150$. Does anyone carry that much cash on them??

The rude cashier then states it‚Äôs been a rule guests must pay cash and I mention I was not aware. She says there‚Äôs are signs everywhere then I ask if she can make an exception this time since this is the first I‚Äôve heard of the rule.

She calls manager over who also gives me a hard time I explain that I‚Äôve come to this Costco many times with my a member and split payment and they say those employees weren‚Äôt doing their jobs. He then says ‚Äúwell it seems like we‚Äôve made exceptions for you in the past‚Äù where I respond: ‚Äúit‚Äôs not an exception if I didn‚Äôt know it was a rule in the first place‚Äù after about 5 mins of back and fourth and him not budging  I was finally like ‚Äúok are you guys going to put all the stuff back? Or make an exception?‚Äù As a little check mate and he said ‚Äúok let it through‚Äù

Don‚Äôt understand why Cash vs Debit matters?? Most businesses prefer cards. Only heard of cash preferred for the companies looking to be under the table or tax evasion. Maybe trying to save on processing fees.

Make this ‚ÄúRule‚Äù well known somehow!!!

Costco offers a great shopping experience with its friendly staff, affordable prices, and pleasantly uncrowded aisles. Their famous hotdogs are undeniably the best, boasting a perfect blend of flavor and value. Shopping here is a treat for both the wallet and the taste buds! My kids love their free samples.

It was awesome until checkout.  Way too few people  checking people out.  Painfully slow.  Everything was to be expected until the lines got to be in the aisles.  We paid for membership only for the holdup?  Seriously?
Bloody rotisserie chicken! üëé I called and they said I can return it, no questions asked. Ok, sure. I live half an hour away. Maybe sell cooked chicken instead?!

One of the best places to by hearing aids and glasses. Great warranty on most items I buy. Unfortunately, I bought an LG TV and also purchased the extended warranty. The TV quite working, sill under LG warranty and LG would not stand behind the warranty. LG strung me along for over 3 months until their warranty expired. Luckily, Costco concierge services helped me with the All State extended warranty and they replaced my TV. I will never buy any LG products. Also, LG knew there were existing issues with my TV.

I'm a little ashamed to say how much I love the food samples throughout the shopping experience at Costco!üòÅ It's a shopping buffet - Genius!üßêü§Ø The staff is super friendly and it's ALWAYS a great time!!

Costco shopping is always a positive experience, especially when there are free food samples to try. Staff is always helpful when I need help. In addition, I greatly appreciate their hearing aid center.
Love this store. Employees are always helpful and pleasant. Prices have gone up a little but everyone seems to be raising  prices also!

A very clean and spacious Costco and that too nearby our home. They have friendly staffs and we became gold star members since we shop almost 3-4 times a week. We all know that Costco offers great deals and we specifically like this branch as it never feels too crowded to shop in the weekdays and gives a good vibe. Must visit!
What can you say?!? A beautiful clean and new Costco. The folks are friendly, the place is clean, and the deals are great. Lines move fast.
Sun Prairie one has more sale stuff but this is good too.

I'm a new member to Costco and so far Costco has been a very great place. I look forward to updating my reviews. The store has been very clean, the deals have been awesome, the people that work there have all been very nice.
Update 2-13-24
The store and people are still very great. I haven't been out as much as i had hoped but I have been taking a big advantage of my gas station. At the gas station I always see the attendants actually helping others that look to need some assistance and I don't see that much anymore.

This is a newer and bigger Costco. The aisles aren't as crowded and narrower as the West Des Moines location making it easier to shop. The gas station is also bigger with more pumps and lights showing which pumps are available.

Overall, I enjoy shopping at Costco and this location seems to be well stocked and carries a diverse selection of food to household items.

Epic Mega Costco!! It‚Äôs huge! The biggest in the Midwest in fact. It has a very well thought out layout.
Other than the crowds, no complaints! All the staff were very efficient and helpful.
There are a few differences from the West Des Moines location:
1. Optical is to the far left by pharmacy
2. Alcohol is in the back left corner area
3. The back is similar but bigger, pet stuff is tucked in its own section in the back
4. There is a fridge section next to the freezer section with cheese, meats, etc.
5. Food court has a nice self-service. It‚Äôs super easy, just hit buttons, pay and then wait to pick it up!
6. Tire shop is a little further back on the left (from entrance).
Hope this helps!

Our favorite Costco. Very friendly staff. Clean and stocked. Surprising to see how every staff there has been trained to be very pleasant and customer oriented. Even though the store is packed with people they manage the billing really fast.

We were Costco skeptics and this store completely converted us! The quality of products Costco sells is unbelievable which has completely changed how we shop for groceries. Only thing we wish was different is the incovenient store hours as we prefer to shop earlier in the day.

Clean store. Great options for LCHF, clean and less processed snacks, and prepared food and desserts. So something for everyone. Food court has more options now.

Gas station still 25-40 cents less than local so it's really packed. I love how helpful the staff is. And how they welcome you with warm smiles and care
Surprisingly efficient checking out despite always being very busy. Great products and great prices. Although I always end up spending too much!
Just want to say how great the tire department was today installing my new wheels & tires on my car. Dustin took exceptional care throughout the whole process. Would highly recommend them to anyone.
Big store. All bulk things. Many cashback and other schemes. With big free parking. Has gasoline also.

As far as Costco goes, this is the worst one I've ever been to anywhere in the world. They don't carry the Kirkland brand blocks of cheese, only more expensive cheeses. They have less vegan food than any other, even compared to stores in the US. When the Kirkland brand offers two flavors of something, for example, their protein bars, this one always only carries the flavor that's not nearly as good. The employees are almost always rude. I really wish there was another within a reasonable driving distance because this one barely makes it worth having a membership.

Costco is always one of my favorite stops to make while traveling.   The gas prices were awesome today.   Check out the Great Deals on TV's (see photos) . They even have 85" Sony and 85" Samsung üì∫ with reasonable prices, üôÑ to bad that the 70" is the largest I can fit between my two windows ü™ü.  I even found some Harry Potter Squishmallows hiding in the back of the store üòÄ

First time and last time unless they do some extraordinary sale event/period. I feel like someone who paid the bouncer at the door just to get inside of a club and end up spending even more money buying drinks. It's ridiculous to have to decide if an individual wants to spend $60 or $120 just to spend more money knowing one cannot purchase anything from this place without a paid membership. I didn't see every item throughout the entire building but from what I did see the so-called deals are not what they're put out to be. The star is for the credit I give them for the variety.

Very disappointed with Costco most of their products are more expensive than Sam's club their cafeteria food is lesser for the same cost and most of the employees have been a awful that I've dealt with.    The had the audacity to claim their better than Sam's too.  Big L going to Costco.

We have been Costco members for over 10 years now and we are usually surprised by seeing products we never heard or saw prior. Great place for paper products and laundry essentials. Be careful and try not to overdo it with the larger sized products.

Great for most things. Apart from the employee at the food court telling my friend & I to use the kiosk after getting us our chicken bakes (5 stars for those) when the register was 3 steps away. A very kind employee rang me up there the night before w/o issue.

When you shop at Costco, you get used to certain things. The sundaes are $2.49, the water is in the same place. The cold produce is right next to the dairy - and so on. Of the half a dozen stores we've been to all are the same. This Costco is not laid out as the others. Which makes it a bit more challenging to shop. They have a lot more pallets out in the aisles. Less staff means they're not really able to give any quality customer service.  They generally seem oblivious to the customers in general. You can make your way around.  It's four stars for having the same quality of products.  The service is why it's not a five. That and they were out of stock for sundaes.

This is a horribly inefficient store. I went here on a Thursday evening. There were 3 workers at the doors (1 checking costco cards as you enter, 2 checking receipts as you leave - which amounts to them staring at your cart for 10 seconds pretending to compare it to the receipt, then drawing a line on your receipt with a highlighter).

At the front of the store there were 2 more workers (managers?) standing around a podium. Finally there were 2 workers at the register. The lines were absurd as most of the registers were closed. Of the 7 people working at the front of the store only 2 were on a register actually helping customers.

Again this was a Thursday evening, if you go here on weekends be prepared for the situation to be even worse. The management here does not care how long the lines are, their reply when I complained about it to them was "I wouldn't come in on the weekends".

I enjoy shopping at Costco. The store has good deals and excellent selection of products. Make sure to check the produce because sometimes they are moldy. The store can be busy at times and the parking can be hectic.

What annoys me the most about this location is the customers are so rude. They just stand in the way, never move their carts, hardly look both ways when walking, and almost run you over. The aisles are narrow which makes the store congested. The parking lot is just as bad, people not looking both ways and cutting through.

The gas lines can also be long. When pumps are free they don't move up.

Really disappointed in our experience today. The check out Gal was extremely rude! My daughter and I picked out pots of flowers (on a whim), while shopping for zip-locs in the back of the store. No signage, just rolling racks of flowers.
We stood in a check-out line that reached the meat section, only to find out we needed a third pot of flowers, to purchase the two we had. The woman ringing us up and the man helping her, both rude AS HELL! I was told that I shouldn't have unloaded my cart on the belt, b/c now they'd have to lift items more than 15lbs. OMG REALLY?!? I WAS TRYING TO HELP!
This was a reminder to me on how Sam's still has you beat on some of the simple things... Curbside pick-up, line control, and now employee attitudes.

Customer service is always phenomenal. The kids love when employees draw them something on the receipt even if our 4 year old requests something elaborate like a dragon. Rod is the best, protect him at all costs!

I love Costco. Things that I need in larger quantities are so affordable here. Gas is also a better bargaining to next door. Nowadays, cutting costs is a must. Nevertheless, things that I buy individually is better elsewhere because of others have more selections and styles at the similar comparable prices.

Today is my first time visiting this Costco location and it went well.   Clean and friendly atmosphere inside and out from the greeter‚Äôs, customers, and staff.   Pricing from electronics, clothing, food etc was reasonable and keep a great inventory on updating the sales floor.  Definitely will be back for future service

We‚Äôve been Costco members for years, and you‚Äôll find us at this store frequently. Store supervisors Natalie and Katy P. recently helped resolve a purchasing issue for me, displaying a dedication to customer satisfaction and brand loyalty that is remarkable. They were willing to make decisions that were fair to the customer and responsible towards the company, even when an assistant manager seemed hesitant, indecisive, and willing to lose a sale and disappoint a member. This should reflect in future promotional opportunities. With years of sales, customer service, and team management in my background, I‚Äôd hire them both for management hands down! Nothing bothers me more than poor customer service, and these fantastic team members prevented me from looking elsewhere for this product, and possibly membership.

Lanny at the loading dock is also a rockstar and deserves a shout out. Keep up the good work!
All were good, except one of the ladies near the macaroon section serving free sample food. She was very rude and unprofessional.

If you enjoy fighting tons of traffic inside and outside a store that has limited choices, then you've found a great place. Seriously, it takes hours to shop here. Just order cheaper groceries with a much better selection at Harris Teeter. Costs $10 to save hours of hassle.

Best shopping experience on my USA trip.
Large push trolleys. Membership required to access. Helpful staff (American hospitality üòÜ), and an assortment of items. You'd have to control yourself not to grab everything.
The food stand at the tills is a brilliant add-on. I had the Chicken Grab, which could ultimately be the best thing I tasted on my entire trip. It's so good. If all Costco's are like this, then I totally recommend.

I like Costco, but I don‚Äôt love Costco‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.. their checkout system is antiquated compared to the other big box stores. Being able to scan and pay for my items in the application, as far superior to standing in a line. Especially when there are so many self-serve lines which could be done in the application, quite easily, efficiently, and without wasting the customers time.
Stock was quite good and the employees are friendly. The store was quite crowded and the parking lot is terrible.  Very difficult to get in and out of the location.
Looking forward to a new Costco coming nearby hopefully will be better logistically

I have been going to Costco for a long time. I have been a member and love Costco. I walked up to the door with my daughter who is 18 and still in high school. I let them know because I have shingles. I wanted to be safe around other people and not go in the store and keep  other people safe. It had nothing to do with me! We were told that my daughter would have to use her own money to shop there if I wasn‚Äôt in the store with her, So I had to go in the store with her . I am a single parent household. I am so sorry. Sometimes the welfare of others and safety of others should come before the rules. I am so disappointed in this store. So I now know that they‚Äôre keeping people safe does not come before the rules ! mind you, I was waiting in the car for her!

A friend gave me a gift card so I came on a Sunday morning to check it out. I found a few items I wanted to buy so I thought it would be faster to do self checkout. I got all the way to the self checkout line breakout only to be told I have to go to a regular line because I don‚Äôt have a membership.

WTH is up with the line situation at this Costco?! That in itself makes me want to go to a different location. There are 3 main (super long) lines you queue up in only then to have to scramble to get into another line for a cashier.

Other than the stupid line process, the store is clean and well stocked. Prices are clearly labeled. Grocery items, health and beauty, and cleaning and pet supplies, are on the left and housewares are on the right. In the middle is snacks, furniture, clothing. In the back is paper goods, frozen food, meat, the bakery, produce, and wine.

Go early or late to avoid the crowds and long lines.

It's a wonderful place. We absolutely love it.  We are very envious of our son and daughter-in-law having Costco nearby.  We live in western Tennessee and are here visiting.  The nearest Costco is in Nashville over one hundred miles away.  Costco has plenty of great items at wonderful prices.  The meat department is absolutely fantastic.   They have everything, and they are very well stocked.   We bought a great leg of lamb for our Easter dinner and really enjoyed it.  I can't say enough about your Costco.
FANTASTIC !

Pain to get in and out. Checkout lines took awhile. They should have more local gift cards.

Oh and everyone is just rude.

Every experience I find more reasons to go down a star. Seriously the rudest costco workers I have ever experienced and I've been to a lot of Costcos around the country.

Edit: again, the WORST COSTCO EMPLOYEES EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They are so rude! I've been lucky to call a few different Costco's as my home Costco, and all the previous Costco employees have been incredible. Many of these workers at Durham Costco need to get fired.

Guy at the pharmacy counter is really nice though. He needs to train the other employees how to speak to humans

We visit weekly. Sometimes more than once a week. Rarely ever been disappointed with our visits or the food or goods that we've purchased. Do nearly all our shopping there.  Most employees very friendly and seem to enjoy their work. Looking forward to our next visit already!
Got to love Costco. Money well spent! You have such low prices, even as inflation keeps rising. The workers are just as amazing as the deals! They really do make it an enjoyable experience!
Awesome place. Always different stuff, tons of delicious food--some you can even try, and great prices! This Tommy Hilfiger coat is less than $30!

I was really disappointed in the behavior of two employees at the women‚Äôs restroom on March 31, 2024. I had my daughter with me with her little baby. We did not know that they were closing early until I saw an employee cutting the lights off in the cheese shelf. We needed to go change the baby and when we walked into the bathroom there was a guy cleaning. We asked if we could change her and he rolled his eyes, shook his head and said we‚Äôre closed but go ahead. Then a lady employee came in saying she announced to everyone that came in the door that they were closing at 6. She did NOT say that to any of us. We had been there for two hours looking at stuff. She was very rude and walked out only to step back in and continue to fuss at us. We ignored her and she finally walked out. I shop this store every week and I have NEVER seen this kind of behavior. People were still walking in the store and in check out lines!

Outstanding experience! Selecting, Measuring and Fitting of my new Eyeglasses. Thank you Kris Kirkpatrick for your professionalism, patience and dedication to customer service. Kris is a consummate professional who subscribes to the high standards championed by Costco. Kindly assure that Kris gets a copy of this well deserved accolade; he is indeed a great steward for Costco

I've been to many Costco's in my life. But when I moved to North Carolina and I went into this Costco for the first time I was extremely surprised at how clean it was and how nice and welcoming the staff were.  You can tell the people who work here take good care of the store. Good customers as well! Everyone's nice here. And so far it's never too busy. I recommend shopping here!

I brought it back today and they were very nice and fixed it in like half an hour. Actually it was like 20 minutes. I appreciate a lot. I‚Äôm making it five stars now. But leaving the comment here from the one star time. ‚Äî>>My tire was put backwards. Now I have to go and wait another two hours. (I had told them these are one way rotation tires.)

Their service was super wonderful. I happened to want to buy some super heavy planters while carrying a baby in my arm. The employees helped me lift them up, wheel them to check up and even load the planters into my car for me. All the employees who helped me were super friendly and patient. I hope they got good benefits working here bc they totally deserve it!!! :)

So nice having this new Costco so close to home! I stop in weekly it seems for the essentials (basically beef jerky!). Membership pays for itself with gas alone. Generally saving 25+ cents a gallon compared to surrounding stations. Always got to get a hot dog combo with a Pepsi before I leave. Only a $1.50 which is the best price for a dinner around!

This is for the Greensboro location.

Parking is busy, but the packing is ample. And the usual Costco size parking spots make it easy to park, even if you have a truck.  They don't help pull the shopping carts up to make it easy to grab a shopping cart. Also, the door doesn't greet you with the Southern warmth that you would expect.  Oddly, they have a walk-up eye test window that I've never seen anywhere.  The food court is indoors in front of the check-out lines, so it makes it tough to get by when people are waiting for their food.

My worst experience in a Costco food court was here.  They push you to use the kiosk to order your food even though there wasn't a line.  The counter was not friendly. They failed to even engage at all with people and only would be friendly to select people --- and we were not those people.  This was not an management issue but an employee issue.

The store was not crowded, and the lines moved pretty quickly. The selection was good, but the layout was oddly narrow and didn't flow as well as other Costcos in the same area. No employees working in Electronics or Jewelry or any of the major high-profile areas which was surprising on a pre-holiday Friday afternoon.

Self-checkout was not friendly either.  They even questioned if I was the person in the photo! I'm pretty sure I'm not an underage person trying use their parents Costco card.

I would honestly drive 15-minutes more to the other Costco location.

Midas 2-stars for the unfriendly service.

I think Costco is pretty great. As with all of these types of stores the more you know the better. Obviously you can save money by shopping here. That said if you buy more than you need you then run the risk of wasting. Occasionally you may also find that some other stores have sales etc where you can buy less quantity with the same overall savings. So being informed is the key.
Nonetheless Costco has great deals! Great rotisserie chicken, pizza, hot dogs and more.
In my humble opinion if you can shop here regularly the membership cost is well worth it!

I love that Costco is always clean and organized. They do have some good prices on some things. But I do wish they would try and keep cost of there products reasonably. The environment is very comfortable. Great looking food items. Cakes are super deliciousüòã!!  I do look forward to going back.

Well, I don't see deals
I see tricks
If it is a good deal, then it's just cents
I'm not picking on this place. I'm but nitpicking.

Milk is a good price, but it's actually the same as my normal organic milk. They just put it in 1/2 gallon cartons and bundle 3. This hides the fact that it's no cheaper than other places.

Most of the workers were decent. Still have the usual rude ones. I didn't hold back at this location like the other.

It's an okay place to do what needs to be done. But paying $120 for a membership to a place that's has the same prices done higher, not much lower than a normal grocery store. Well, I'm not sure about all this, lol.

Go check it out. Just really look at the prices. I'm guessing this is why they are scared to let you go in and walk around before you get that membership.

They only get 2 stars bc the pizza is good. I have never seen a food court in such disarray and then you get to the front and there's a granny that looks like Consuela from Family Guy with the NASTIES attitude as if she hates her job. I used to love Costco, but customer service skills have gone to the slums. 2 stars and 2 thumbs down.

First time at Costco.  It was a positive experience.  Sample areas were a bit crowded and sometimes caused traffic jams.  But all the other customers were friendly and patient.  Staff was friendly too.  Didn't have any trouble getting in and out and got lucky with parking.  Can see that it could be an issue in the future.  We went on a Friday mid afternoon so before after school and work crowds.  Looking forward to going back.

Just wanted to say their hearing dept is awesome. I had an exam and got fitted for hearing aids yesterday with Margaret in Matthews. She was a joy to work with. Everyone in that dept was courteous and helpful to every customer as I waited. I had arrived early. It can be challenging dealing with the elderly and they were so caring. I would recommend them to anyone. Great employees!
Wholesales at its best üëå. Everything you need and more. Should do the scan and go thru the app to expedite the long line at the checkout ü§î.

I hadn't been to Costco in years. We moved back to North Carolina and decided to try it again. For one, the gas station sells gas cheaper than anywhere. We were used to having to by stuff by the case. All of that has changed. Now you can get single products, as well as the case if wanted. They have a travel guide, find that trip you always wanted to take. They have it all. Try it out, you will be pleasantly surprised, I promise you.

Here in North Carolina,Cotsco is as usual with maximum customers satisfactory range. Went to buy some stuff for our short dwell in the hotel and loved it . But gotta little hard to park as it is a really busy area.

Just as good as my home Costco or any of the others I've been to whether in Billings Montana or Tulsa Oklahoma. Same layout, the same products and the same great membership low prices.

The only thing that's changed is that they're now checking to make sure your ID matches your membership card. Unfortunate that people want to cheat a great system but there you go.

I was able to find everything I needed easily as, again, the layout is just the same. Dairy, fresh produce, fresh bakery. Do I want rotisserie chicken for dinner tonight? It sure smells good!

I enjoy shopping at Costco! They always seem to have what I need. Especially this last Sunday when I had a flat tire and there was no other place available to fix it. Luckily, I was right next to Costco. The cost was under $12. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? I thought, and was expecting, that I would have to pay much more. But, like  their hotdogs and soda, you pay so little and get so much. I want to thank Travis and Chip in the tire department for being there for me and being so accommodating. It is employees like you that really make Costco. Thanks again, your loyal Costco shopper üòä

This Costco is great. The worker named Jo who gave us our membership card was not. My husband and I went in having done research on which membership we wanted to buy. Jo pressured us for 30 minutes giving us every reason in the book that we were buying the wrong one. She asked us personal questions about our credit card score, how much we spend on groceries per month, etc. I understand trying to sell a product but she was relentless. Go to this Costco, but stay away from Jo.

These massage chairs were such an amazing deal
Had to order on for Christmas. I got a couple of the massage gins for Christmas too. They are nice.

Please... It's Costco! Need I say more? The service is top notch, the products are top of the line, and their foods are wonderful. Giant muffins, breads, bagels, prepared meals, everything is delicious. Best warehouse brand out there!

We came here while traveling from Canada.  We used Costco self-checkout for the first time and for the last time trust me, as it kept glitching.  The lady helping had to help us at least 4 times and basically checked everything out for us.  We got to the door and the girl counted every single item.  A skirt had been missed.   We spent over $350 and a skirt was missed and we were held at the head of the line making everyone else wait and listening to her yelling for someone to come over.  I wondered do they go through your cart and count every single item when you shop and you have a human cashier?  I wanted the skort so we paid for it.  But I went out into our RV and got a shirt I bought two days before after spending over $450 at another Costco.  It had picks on it and I had forgotten to take it to return it.  It was only $6.99 and figured I‚Äôd just keep it for wearing around the house.  After this episode I was was so upset and felt like everyone looked at us like thieves so I stomped out and got the shirt and got my money back.  The manager matched my degree of upset instead of trying to appreciate how I was made to feel.  He said he wouldn‚Äôt be steamrolled or treated like dirt.  I was upset but I didn‚Äôt yell or swear, I was indignant.  I said you don‚Äôt mind letting your employees treat your customers like thieves though do you?  He walked away.  I want to gather all the things we‚Äôve bought from Costco on our trip and return them to his store.  But I won‚Äôt‚Ä¶.i will ask anyone on here?  When you go to Costco and a person runs your groceries through, do they pick up and count Every item in your cart?  I will Never use self checkout again.  And like I said, the lady there helped us 4 times.  What a rotten way to be made to feel‚Ä¶.

Get ready for a long wait at the cafeteria. Takes forever to get your order. Not very efficient in the way they prep food and hand it to you. Sorry Costco, you‚Äôve had my loyalty for over 30 years but on this one I have to give you a 3 star rating. Would give you a 2.5 if I could.
Love to shop there, always good deals. We bought most of our grocery and snacks there.  The snacks isle are my favourite. Parking is always a problem, have yo be patience.
Love Costco, my 1st visit to NC  and I drove to this Costco due to a certain wine I like, this Costco made me feel like I was back in California except the people here are much nicer.

Absolutely ridiculous.  No one with any mathematical logic would shop here and think there is any cost savings value. EVERYTHING we compared was more money than even Publix and Harris Teeter AND that before the $60 annual membership and the fact you have to buy BULK everything which only goes to waste or you need to invest even more in food storage. Everything from toilet paper to pies to rib steaks to powdered drink mixes. All more money per unit than higher quality grocery stores. Not to mention that stuff that can be found a Walmart, like toilet paper - total ripoff. And to top it off I could only use Visa or debit card AND the member advisor tried to sell us on the idea that "99% of all members have a Gold membership" - LIE. And to top it off, no aisles were labeled and it was so crowded on a Tuesday morning 10 minutes after opening you couldn't even move with a cart in the store and browse leisurely.

Nice, clean, and organized. But, I left my cucumbers in the cart. Went late and couldn't see well enough in the parking lot..boo hoo!
If I had the money, I would have gotten this.

Always love coming here. It's a great store with everything you need in bulk. Or just great prices. You need to be a member or have a gift card to shop here. They have great food and house items from indoor to outdoor. Samples, good food court for a quick bite and many many other options. Everything is always tempting if you come hungry.

Customer service was really helpful. We paid for executive membership but have hardly used it, so they are rolling that extra money over to pay for next year's membership. My friend, who came with me, said that their vegan healthy food options were much better than those offered by Sam's Club. It is a fun store to look around because you never know what you might end up finding since they sell a bit of everything.

It was a very inviting and friendly place to be! I could spend the entire day just talking to the workers about products and random little things. A stand out person for our trip was Brooke at the membership desk. She made signing up incredibly easy and really a fun experience. She explained to me and my friends the benefits of the executive membership and how it works. We all signed up if that shows for it haha! I‚Äôm excited to come back for the pleasant atmosphere and people üòÑ (I hope she sees this and remembers how much of a great worker and person she is! Thank you so much! )

My wife and I signed up for a membership with the hope that all the claims about buying in bulk were true. Well, for some things you may save money, but on most of the items you don't. For example, we compared their prices of toilet paper, paper towels, pasta, milk, produce, soda, dishwasher detergent and laundry detergent to prices at Walmart. In most cases, the unit prices were the same. In some cases Walmart was several cents cheaper and in other cases Costco was several cents cheaper. Now, for the non grocery items such as books, clothing, shoes, kitchen, and electronics, we found their prices to be higher than what you would pay for these items on Amazon. My wife and I made the decision to cancel our membership within a week. It was not worth the $40 membership fee to essentially break even. I recognize they have their own credit card that you can get 4% back on. Well, American Express has a no annual fee card (for the first year) where you get 6% back at all grocery stores and 3% back at all gas stations. Amazon has a chase card where you get 5-6% back on everything you buy. Plus, I am not going to mess with the huge crowds, waiting in line to have someone examine my receipt with a microscope, and trying to find parking without getting hit. Not to mention waiting in line at the gas pumps. I know some people spend time here because they enjoy simply going. For me, time is money. If I can save money and time elsewhere why in the world would I shop here?

I absolutely LOVE my new Shark Lift-Away vacuum cleaner! I can do all my hardwood floors and rugs. And then take it apart for a canister vacuum to do the blinds and my car.

Plus you never have to buy bags! Just empty out the canister . . . and you can also wash out the foam hepa filter. Saves you $$$!

The best part is it pulls up lots of dirt and dust that my other $600 Riccar vacuum has left behind! I've had allergies all my life, so this is very important to me.

This is my first Shark vacuum, and i'm a big fan! Another customer at Costco told me he bought 2 . . . one for upstairs and one for downstairs. This is one of the better ones. and was on sale for $50 off. Paid $220.

Great buys at very reasonable prices.
They likely make most of their profits via annual membership fees.
The product offering is outstanding, but a number of the items come in bulk sizes.
My biggest complaint is finding specific items that seem to be moved often to places one would never expect them to be.
Unless you buy a considerable amount on an annual basis, stick with the basic membership.
Gasoline ‚õΩÔ∏è is top-tier, with unbeatable prices.

Sam's has the beat on so much.

It was my first visit
I wanted to walk around before joining
They will give you a tour i didn't much go for that.
Think everyone there is pretty much rude.
To the point of snooty.

The things I looked at I had already priced at Sam's. They averaged 4-5 dollars more on those things.

Good price on meat front what we could tell.

They will get one more visit out of me, and if I encounter the rudeness again, we'll cancel the membership.

Now just so you know I'm not lying about the prices. What I was looking at was glass containers with lids. They're 19.99 at Sam's 24.99 at Costco.

And this will sound weird but the place was boring.

I have been a member at Costco for over 12 years. I do not like the new QuickChek out. I think it‚Äôs horrible. It blocks the entire lane and then you go around the corner and there‚Äôs five registers with two people and three people in line but when you come down the first lane where everybody jams up the hallway, there‚Äôs big pressure for you to go to the self checkout line. I‚Äôm not spending all this money to go self Cashiers. The cashier s depending on who you get, there‚Äôs a man that is really nasty. I avoid him like the plague so between the pushy self check out people and the cashiers that I just cannot deal with oh my gosh. They need to go to a customer service class . I‚Äôm not sure which manager it was but I try to return a an item in a set of four one it had leaked all over the car and I didn‚Äôt realize it until I had one and I checked it and it and was like this stuff is leaking so I took it back. It was like eight bucks and he was like you can‚Äôt return it cause you‚Äôve eaten one out of four of the containers , who does that? I‚Äôve been a customer for over 12 years and spent thousands in that store. Are you telling me you‚Äôre not returning eight dollars..I almost never return anything..they‚Äôre unnecessary nasty and if they keep this up they‚Äôre gonna lose customers because Trader Joe‚Äôs is a lot nicer and their prices are a lot cheaper.
Costco is always great! Kind of like a fun way and place to shop! Not to mention they give you little treats to experience.

Visited this Costco during a trip to the KC area. Costco is my favorite wholesale club. They always have a nice variety, usually stay well stocked, and the samples are always good. This location was very busy but it was still easy to get in and out. It is in Kansas so unlike the ones just across the border, you don't see the large selection of spirits and such.

The lenexa location has better selection of meats than the overland Park location.  The lenexa location is very busy and difficult to get in and out of.  Great deals, I really like Costco for the great deals you can find.

Love shopping at Costco,their fresh meats are unbelievable and we love their stuffed peppers. The fact that they offer samples gives you the great options of trying before buying. Very clean and well managed.

I‚Äôm a really big fan of all of our Costco‚Äôs within the KC Metro, but needed to put a big shout out to Cameron at this location (Lenexa)!!
I called a couple other locations specifically looking for the Korean Bulgogi meat, and unfortunately, no one seems to have it. However, Cameron was extremely kind enough to not only double check the inventory/computer system to confirm.   But he was also gracious enough to take the time to thoroughly explain how some specialty food items are a regional thing.  And he understood how important this food topic was to me‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ Considering I‚Äôd be driving roughly 40 minutes one way just to come get this delicious Korean meat!
In my opinion, Cameron went above and beyond my customer service expectations‚Ä¶.. And I believe that is the best definition of excellent customer service!!
Huge, excellent price and quality. I'm from Brazil and it couldn't be better !!!

COSTCO is located at 123rd and Blue Valley Parkway in Overland Park,  KS.  WHAT IS UNIQUE ABOUT COSTCO ARE ITS 2 WALK-IN COOLERS:  1 FOR EGGS AND DAIRY; AND THE 2nd for cut up and smaller packaged Vegetables, incliluding vege trays that are ready to serve.    Costco  Warehouse has Varieties.of Vitamins, Shampoo, feminine products and diapers for adults and babies,  Coffee in bags and K-cups, cooking oils, spices, breads, nuts and chips, even a Fresh Flower Selection.   Bottled water, Soda Pop, bulk PaperTowels and Toilet Papers, plus baby wipes, Dog pee pads, plastic wrap, aluminum foil, plus paper plates and cups.   Limited clothing, electronics,  some high priced jewelry and more.  SEASONAL DECORATIONS.  Dairy and Eggs.  There is an on-site Pharmacy, an Optical section and Hearing Service.  Eye Glass exams and Glasses are KS TAX EXEMPT.  PLUS, a fast food area with pop.  You can purchase tires and have them installed in an attached Service Garage for this. Wheelchair accessible.  Disabled Accessibility with Motorized carts.  Big push carts.  Ample Parking. O5-08-2024.  Mgb.

Honestly, I think this is the best location Costco compared to all the other surrounding Costcos. They are always fully stocked with new exclusive items that Costco in the Northland, which is only 15 mins away from me, never carry. I would rather drive about an hour to come here and get all my needs completed. I'm not sure why all Costcos are different. This Overland Park Costco always carries asian items at a cheaper price compared to Asian markets. Noodle selections are nice too.

Apparently Costco is getting very serious about membership names. I live at home, dad sent me in for groceries and got at least $300 worth in my cart before being stopped at self check out by a tall angry man who couldn‚Äôt wait to check membership IDs and tell me I couldn‚Äôt make this purchase today. I‚Äôve done this for years, I would have loved a warning or notice at least so I didn‚Äôt waste my time. The self cashier guy was on a total power trip couldn‚Äôt wait to humiliate me and snatch my cart from me. Disappointed, disgusted and will never spend money on a Costco membership for myself after that interaction. To Sam‚Äôs it is, I‚Äôm sure if they have a policy change they would at least give customer notice!

I dread going to this Costco as I think I‚Äôm not alone when saying it‚Äôs the worst in the area.

There are some very rude and demanding employees at this location that I think need a bit more service industry training, especially when it comes to unwanted suggestions about my children.

On another instance, I had just found out about a product and wanted to know if they had it in stock. They sighed heavily as they went to go check their records. I got a nice little lesson on how to plan and save up for things I wanted in the future.

Honestly, I just want to be left alone to shop in peace. Is that so much to ask for?

They have great products, and awesome staff! Most recently I went to fill a prescription for my dog (they have an awesome pharmacy!) they were out of the med I needed, but the pharmacy staff called another Costco, found the med, and told them I was on my way! Almost closing time, because I had just gotten off work, but were waiting with a smile when I got there!

Costco, the beloved warehouse store, is truly a shopper's paradise. With its vast selection of products, it caters to a wide range of needs and preferences. Whether you're looking for groceries, electronics, furniture, or even a new set of tires, Costco has it all. The sheer variety of options available is mind-boggling, ensuring that customers can find exactly what they're looking for.

One of the most enticing aspects of Costco is its unbeatable prices. The store is renowned for offering products at significantly lower prices compared to traditional retailers. This makes it a go-to destination for budget-conscious shoppers who want to get the most value for their money. From household essentials to luxury items, Costco's prices are hard to beat, making it a favorite among savvy shoppers.

One particular item that stands out among the many offerings at Costco is their delectable mixed nuts. These perfectly roasted and seasoned nuts are a true delight for the taste buds. Whether you're a fan of cashews, almonds, or pistachios, Costco's mixed nuts are sure to satisfy your cravings. The quality and freshness of these nuts are unparalleled, making them a must-have for any nut lover.

In addition to their wide range of products and unbeatable prices, Costco also runs incredibly cool promotions from time to time. These promotions can include discounts, special offers, or even exclusive deals on popular items. These promotions not only provide customers with additional savings but also add an element of excitement to the shopping experience. It's always a thrill to discover a fantastic deal or a limited-time offer at Costco.

The staff at Costco deserves special mention for their exceptional customer service. They are known for their kindness, helpfulness, and willingness to go the extra mile to assist customers. Whether you need assistance finding a specific item or have questions about a product, the staff at Costco is always ready to lend a hand. Their friendly and approachable demeanor creates a welcoming atmosphere, making every shopping trip a pleasure.

One of the highlights of shopping at Costco is the samples they offer. As you navigate through the store, you'll often come across stations where you can try out various products. From tasty snacks to refreshing beverages, these samples allow customers to experience the quality and flavor of different items before making a purchase. It's a fun and interactive way to discover new products and indulge in a little treat while shopping.

In conclusion, Costco truly is a fantastic store. With its wide range of options, unbeatable prices, delicious mixed nuts, cool promotions, helpful staff, and delightful samples

The have stopped letting us use the handheld scanners in self checkout, which makes it take ten times longer and far far more effort to check out. You can check out by scanning items with your PHONE at Sam's Club, making Costco look just as pathetic as it truly is. Where is my discount on my membership to offset the features I paid for but do not receive now? Truly anti customer move.
Very nice store everything is clean, well stocked, neatly setup, and you can find some really good deals.

Purchased 2 large planter pots. They had the best price after checking other places around. Moved to Wichita, KS from Colorado. Wish they had a Costco on the west side of town. How about a Costco business center? Also, there is no alcohol section. Miss it. üòÅ

Plenty of things to purchase for a good price but when it compares to Sam‚Äôs? I‚Äôm choosing Sam‚Äôs. Both places are super busy but somehow Sam‚Äôs handles their check out process better‚Ä¶ Ok, maybe I‚Äôm a little frustrated that Costco doesn‚Äôt take Mastercard but oh well. That‚Äôs a personal issue.

This Costco is good and if it‚Äôs necessary for you to go due to convenience, I recommend because it‚Äôs nice and big. But, if there‚Äôs a Sam‚Äôs Club close. Choose that first.

Great location coming from Highway 83 to grab cheap gas, a snack and of course a ton of items.  The samples are fun, the staff has been wonderful to deal with and I was given a $40 gift card online for signing up. Definitely worth the membership.

It has always something you need and certainly don't need... Look i say only a few items... But always leave spending the house, but they are so good.

Bulk items have been a great option especially those who live far away.
You see many items like vitamins, plethora of that. Then Meats n bread area, dang that's dangerous. So yummy and delicious.

This was a true upgrade to the city. I just hope all places benefits from good products at their prices.

Pizza was good, not great but very good.

They didn't have tofu!? Like, what?
Otherwise, it was a totally normal costco experience.  They have this down to a science. My mom did tell me they put the items in their ad at the front. Factual? I dunno, but there's that. Have fun spending way more than you planned!  I REGRET NOTHING!!
Went in to fix tire but was to old they only fix up 6- 7 year old tires. That was ok, they were very kind. I didn't get charged for the check the check up. John was kind and personable.

I love Costco. The only reason it's getting 4-stars is because of inconsistent service from staff. I've had more than a couple disappointing experiences. More context below:
1. They fail to ask whether I need a box or act as if my asking for one is inconvenient
- Tiresome explaining I have a truck. Small items are free to move around the bed of my truck.
- More than a couple times I didn‚Äôt say something in time and ended up with no boxes to help manage smaller items. Very frustrating especially when dealing with items in glass containers!
2. Aggressive and inconsistent scanning of items by staff at self-checkout.
- Evidently, they do this to mitigate splitting orders? A friend was told this. They will randomly pick random items to scan, not just big items but small things like muffins or chicken. I‚Äôve caught myself re-scanning items they already pre-scanned which would mean I‚Äôd be charged twice.I question whether I‚Äôve re-scanned without catching myself?! It goes beyond courteous and is clearly contrived ‚Äúassistance‚Äù. I have the higher tier membership and it‚Äôs very off putting having them disrupt my shopping experience with this ham-handing mitigation.
3. They seem to have backed off this one a little but for a time they were aggressively asking for a picture ID. Again, I pay for the higher tier membership. It‚Äôs off putting being subjected to the show me your papers bit.
4. General rudeness. It‚Äôs strange but there is a general smug attitude at times from some staff. Like they are doing me a favor letting me shop at their store. A moment that comes to mind is when I had a full paid-for cart and my children and I were getting food at the food court. An employee was standing by the end of one of the tables and I asked whether I could leave my cart beside the table while I ordered. Not really sure what other options there even are?! The gal was indignant and told me I can‚Äôt leave my cart there. I'd be blocking traffic. I asked where I‚Äôm supposed to put the cart and she just looked at me with an upset stare that I would even ask. I ended up moving my car back behind a closed down till. It was too far for comfort from our table but I did my best to keep an eye on it.

All of this said, I do love the store and there are a lot of courteous staff. That said there are noticeable examples of poorly executed management initiatives and a clear lack of courtesy from some staff that may demonstrate courtesy isn‚Äôt a high priority for some management.

I've shopped at West Fargo Costco for almost 14 years now (as of April 2024). Almost all the time people are friendly, and the store is always clean. I like that they often have new items; but the flip side is you might not find your favorite items coz it's been replaced by new items. I really like that they listen to feedbacks and order items in for you to purchase. The rotisserie chicken is pretty good, but Sam's Clubs has better tasting ones. Cafeteria is always open, but the selection of soft drinks not so great. Sam's has at least 3 times more choices in fountain drinks but not always open...

I appreciate this Costco a lot. Long live the West Fargo Costco! ü§ü
Great customer service, I found so many things at this location that , we don‚Äôt have in Costco Canada. ( Winnipeg)They accept credit cards . I will go back again.

Been a member 2 weeks. The place has some ok finds, but mostly it is cringe. Jam packed long lines of over weight broke people trying to get deals on snacks and cheap food. I would rather pay more than stand around that rat race. The whole membership card thing is pretty lame as well. The people at the entry ways and exits are a waste of time and are useless. The food court is cool.

It's too bad more stores aren't this cheap, well maintained and have pleasant employees.
The Alfredo is pretty bomb as are 95% of the food products I've purchased.

I picked up exactly what I needed and a few things that I wanted.  As always no matter how busy it is it never takes long to do my shopping and go through the tills.

Staff are always so happy and friendly; the management and staff of the store do a great job of making me feel welcome and appreciated.

I enjoy going to Costco.  I do think the membership is worth it if you are selective on what you get.  Example would be the cost of Charmin Toilet paper or the large box of small bags of potato chips.  There is a large difference in price for what you would pay at the normal box stores.  Recently I purchased a Green Works self propelled electric mower.  Never would I believe I would buy one, but the truth is, that todays gas mowers are not very good or worth the money.  This 80V, 21 inch self propelled mower with batteries included and charger were bought for $499.  The charge is enough to do my yard and it really does an excellent job.  I can't believe that I actually liked it.  It is quiet and cuts well. Only thing wrong I've found is you need to let go of the self propel and let it travel a couple of inches for the wheels to roll backward without locking up.  My only complaint so far.  I do worry that the batteries hold up, but only time will tell on that. I do recommend this product.

Great experience as always.  A bit packed on Sunday. So maybe go in another day.   Lots of options as always.  & as always go in for some 32‚Å∞ undies & maybe some Kirkland chocolate & some how walkout with 400$ worth of stuff.  The staff was smiling & friendly,   helpful & curtious.  The shelfs were plentiful & stocked

Always an amazing experience. The return/exchange program is truly market leading that very few, if any, can compete with.
My big disappointment with the KY locations are that they have not carried the 12-yr old Kirkland Single Malt in many years. It is an amazing drink and I miss it. Bring it back please. The sampler is not good enough!

I have say I had the best experience at the optical. When I dropped off my prescription, Cece took time to help me iron out my insurance issues. Cece, went above and beyond! Cece was so GREAT!!

When I picked up my glasses, Ashley was wonderful! She made sure everything fits and took the time to make sure everything I‚Äôm comfortable wearing both of my glasses! Best customer service I ever had!! Kudos to both of the ladies!

Only accept their own visa for food ie. Pizza and hot dogs
My visa was accepted in store but not in-house restaurant. Just another reason not to go there.
I joined because of the publicity of being able to buy gold ingots.  The woman I spoke with said you can't buy gold at her store and didn't know what  Costco stores did sell it.

My wife and I like Costco better than Sam's Club and frequent this store about once every two to three weeks. Luke most stores you need to know your prices and shop with a strategy. I should also mention that I like the way the store is laid out.

I just love Costco.  The gas is so much cheaper than everyone else - it would easily pay for your membership.  I feel like Sam's is a bit cheaper on daily items (toilet paper, detergent, etc.) but Costco is so much better to their employees and is a great addition to our community.  The food is much better quality than Sam's (I won't buy meat at Sam's).  The clothes are better quality than Sam's but still with a great price.  The prepared meals from the deli are AMAZING.  Overall they have a lot of organic, healthier options.

This place has terrible customer service. I don‚Äôt understand how they could have a number of Google reviews state how harsh they are and yet they don‚Äôt change. I don‚Äôt think any Costco employee is trained to roll their eyes, groan at questions, and just be an overall dark cloud on a sunny day and yet they are. I hope they fire whichever bad apples they have and hire people who will provide better service than whoever is there now. Specifically the checkout attendants.

Great options for catering considering price and quality! If ordering a platter ahead, you need to drop off the paper in the ordering slot at least 24 hours in advance. They did say you could call and order, but you would have to talk with someone at the front of the store who would then have to walk back the order (you might need to call with more than 24 hours notice).

Also, the audiology folks are great. My grandfather passed away, they said they could repurpose his hearing aids for my grandma, she just needed a Costco membership and to schedule an appointment with them.

On Friday, May 10 I had tires put on at Costco in Lexington, KY. This was the first time I had tires installed by Costco Tire department and I was amazed at how quickly the install took. I was pulled in at 4:28 and by 4:57 I was out the door. On Saturday, I took my van to have an alignment done on the wheels and the mechanic on duty told me that two lug nuts were completely loose and that all of the lug nuts needed to be tightened the rest of the way. This is frustrating because what if I had not gone to get the alignment done and rode around on loose lug nuts? Perhaps slow down on the install and make sure everything is right the first time. Now everytime I have to bring my van in to have the tires rotated am I gonna have to have someone else check to make sure the lug nuts are tightened correctly? I am needing tires for my other vehicle in the next year, but am hesitant to buy another set from Costco if they are not going to pay attention and do the job correctly.

So the deals are pretty good. Costco is great if you have kids. A lot of things are in bulk but worth the buy. If you see something you like, grab it. It may not be in there next week. I get cult vibes sometimes. I believe if you look like me you get looked at differently. Anyways. People are always in a hurry. They don‚Äôt say thank you or excuse me. But if you can get past that, grab some samples, and maybe play the piano while your pizza cooks, you‚Äôll have a swell time.
Picked up a cake I ordered. Their cakes are wonderful. All check out lanes were opened and the check out process moved very quickly. I really like how they empty your cart for you.
Well stocked, clean, helpful workers. We love the pharmacy, the optometry department, and the food we purchase is always fresh. Great return policy if you end up not happy with a purchase.

Small things matter, my family got food after shopping and the guy  behind the counter told me they were out of onion and relish. I went to the customer service counter and an associate named Ashton walked straight back to the food service counter and cut up onion and refilled the relish and got us new hot dogs/a refund for waiting. It's the small things that go a long way to ensure customers are then care of and get the full Costco experience. Thanks a ton Ashton!!!

I honestly think the only reason this place stays in business is because it only has one real competitor. For the most part, Sam‚Äôs Club is leagues above Costco for a multitude of reasons. First, I don‚Äôt understand the need for employees constantly asking to see your membership. Last time I went in, I was asked by 4 different employees for my membership over a span of half an hour. One of the times was while I was at the self checkout. That one didn‚Äôt even make sense because I can‚Äôt access the self checkout without scanning my membership to begin with, so what was the point? The only thing positive I can say about this place is that they do have very good protein-friendly foods. From quick microwave-able options, to different cuts of meat, to protein snacks & shakes. However, most of these items sell out quickly and either don‚Äôt restock for a month or don‚Äôt restock at all. The app is also pretty useless too, since it doesn‚Äôt tell you where any items are located in the store or if it‚Äôs in-stock at all. Lastly, and I know this one is a bit of a nitpick, but the people who shop here are the absolute worst. I have never seen such a lack of spatial awareness and common sense in my entire life. People will run into you with their carts & block out aisles, then look at you as if you are the problem. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair to count that against Costco as a company, but I believe it is worth noting. I think your best bet would be to cancel that Costco membership and go to Sam‚Äôs club.

May of 23; absolutely love the roasted chicken, you just can't beat it especially for the price. Lots of Summer items out from furniture to plants, a nice variety and selection of both. Nice selection of fresh-cut and in vases for Mother's Day, or just to give somebody some lovely flowers.

April 2023; the staff is always super friendly and helpful. Enjoy shopping here. Always love their whole roasted chicken and always a great deal, $5! Nice selection of fresh produce as well. Found an oversized and sturdy welcome mat for $11. Also love the samples, gives you an idea what you can do for dinner (try before you buy). The plants and trees are in excellent condition and worthy of any yard.

March; Nice store, first time at this location. Always top off my tank at the fuel center, and today tried their infamous hot dog and soda for $1.50 - very good! Clean and neat store, helpful associates, check out was a breeze with friendly staff there as well.
Like that you find most anything here, in bulk, but also a tire center, eye glass center, pharmacy, planting and outdoor needs as well.

This Costco is nice and clean. Even the bathrooms were clean.
I do want to spotlight this lovely woman. She was either the dairy manager or food manager. My friend needed the no brand baby formula and couldn't find it. She asked the nice lady with the computer in her hand if she knew if they had it. The lady said she believed they were out but to ask up front. We were up front later about to check out when she found us and let us know they were out. That was so sweet of her. I wish I remembered her name.

Wow this place can keep the longest line moving it looks crazy long but you move forward almost the while time. Food options are nice I am a vegan and I can normally get vegan cheese, Hippeas puffs(they are like vegan Cheetos), burgers and somtime "chicken" as well if see the chicken in the picture below get it, it's great. They will also have things like the cheese flight that is just for a short time.

Really nice Costco!  Really good deals for Christmas gifts this year.  Associates were all very friendly and super helpful.

February 2022 Edit:
*Costco doesn't do customer wifi in any of it's stores and it would be a very nice addition.
*They were completely blown out of rotisserie chicken during our February visit

I first joined Costco when we decided to get a dog. It sounded cost effective even though were are a family of two.

Seven years later, we lost our dog, but we kept our Membership. Even though we don't go there often, the do have some of the best deal and unbelievable, customer focused policy.

Last year, my husband had a full knee replacement and his friend recommended that we get a recliner from Costco which helps people to stand up (the way it's designed). So, of course, it sounded like a good idea. My husband was on a mission to take his PT and knee exercises seriously because he loves playing golf more than anything in the world. I saw him sitting on the recliner less than 10 x in the year since we bought it.

Last November, I called Costco to see if I could return this ginormous recliner (it had been just over a year). Ironically, my husband had bounced back and was on his annual golf trip. The lady in customer service said if I brought it into the store, they would take it back. She assured me it was fine and to make sure the to bring any electronics associated with the chair.

Two weeks later, my husband and I took the chair back to Costco (with trepidation) because it didn't sound believable that we could actually return it for a full refund.

I rolled the recliner chair in a big, flat cart and took it to customer service. The person scanned my card and gave me a full refund.

I was elated!! I was happy to get the money back, but even happier to get rid of another piece of furniture which was taking up too much space!!

Thank you, Costco!!
This location is overcrowded. The selection is very good. Get here early, and then you can shop relaxed.

Twice now I've had an awful interaction with a cashier named Sam. First instance was when I asked my daughter to pay with the credit card with my name on it that I was handing to her IN FRONT OF THE CASHIER which matches my membership card because I really had to use the bathroom. This woman had an absolute fit about it and was super nasty to me bc 'she's not on the membership card'. She was extremely rude about the entire thing. Now fast forward about a month and a half and I didn't realize I had this cashier again. I'm checking out with my husband and I asked him to go order a pizza while we were checking out so it would be ready by the time I was done. He hand me his card just in case I cannot find mine. The cashier IMMEDIATELY snaps at me and says 'are you on the membership too?!', which I tell her yes I was and that was my husband. I then told her I was looking for my card but I though I might have forgot my card at the return counter when we walked in. Apparently this was not okay with her because she starts berating me telling me I cannot pay for the groceries with my credit card because he walked away and I didn't show her my card even though I AM ON THE MEMBERSHIP and she watched my husband walk away to order the pizza. The way she goes about this entire thing is why I'm so irritated about it. She caught me off guard with how mean and rude she is. She's vile and doesn't know how to speak to people. I could use other choice words to describe her but I won't be doing so.
Someone needs to have a talk with this woman or I will be letting my membership expire if I have to deal with this again.
Great deals, like usual at Costco. The highlight this time was two 5 quart bottles of synthetic oil for $31.

The prototypical big box store that has almost everything. A huge amount of their stuff is house brand but you do see many popular name brand products. It's almost overwhelming the huge selection of items for sale under one roof. There is a learning curve to just know where to begin to look for whatever it is you're there to purchase. I found the employees to be helpful to a fault almost and they really made my day better while I was there shopping. Quite busy at the time I was there and if I had one beef and I'm nitpicking here it would be wider aisles because you can't get tough to navigate around all the carts and other things including people as you navigate around the store.
Home of the best hot dogs in Avon. Granted, my sample size is one hot dog seller, but it was good enough for me to stop when I‚Äôm passing through.

Horrible experience for our family! Extremely rude employees to my wife and children.

We will never return. My family has never had an experience this bad.

If you are going to work with people, maybe you should at least like your job to some extent to provide a decent experience for customers to return.

Customer service and being polite must have a different meaning in Costco than every other company.

We have a large family and spend a lot every month on groceries. After this experience, we will take our money back to Sam's Club.

I've never been to Costco, so my first impression is this store is.....AMAZING! We started our trip with a stop at the cafeteria where everything was delicious aside for the chicken bake...hard pass on that. Im not sure if it's the salad dressing or the bacon bits but it was difficult to swallow. The store is full of everything you could possibly want from food to cutlery to clothes and toys. I've never experienced so many free samples in my entire life. The employees were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The bathrooms were immaculate. There was ample parking. All around, this store has everything you could need or want.
Great prices, and polite and helpful employees. Clean store. Free food samples are back. Can't say enough about the awesome employees. They make shopping there delightful.

I've been a member of Costco for quite a while. I really enjoy shopping there at the discounts are great. The food court is amazing. I highly recommend if you're looking for a club style shopping experience that you go to Costco

I love this location! Everyone is so helpful and smiling! Today, a wonderful lady struck up a conversation with my teen and convinced my finicky teen to try a drink she'd never had before. My teen didn't like it, but I was thrilled she tried it. I had shopping to do, and they were still talking when I circled back 5 minutes later. ü•∞

Update March 2024 - I still love this location.

Accepts only Visa cards üí≥.

Bog standard Costco üõí. Loads of stock and the usual layout of items. Good selection of meat üçñ and seafood ü¶û Aisles are clear and wide. The staff üë∑ are nice and helpful.

Self service checkout for warehouse goods available. Food court is self checkout tills.

I Like this Costco a lot, Personally! They have Nice employees, lots of different foods and high quality products, good bathrooms, and lots more! I‚Äôve always had a nice experience in the store and never a complaint! Thanks and have a Good day!
-Review Date 2/21/23
Came just to try the world famous $1.50 hot dog meal & wasn't disappointed. Thinking of having my wedding reception here.

I like Costco but don‚Äôt much care for the checkout process.  Really would like to see Costco change their app to allow customers to scan and go like Sam‚Äôs club does.  That makes it so much more convenient and adds to a pleasant shopping experience.  Just a suggestion.

I love Costco but
Self check out employees are so rude & mean ‚òπÔ∏èüò≠
Especially the lady who hiding her name tag w/short hair ..

Let me first state that overall I like Costco. Most of your employee are great ambassadors for your company. But the operations of this store fall far short of where they should be. Today I went to Costco, picked out my items and then looked and all the line were back to the meat case. After literally waiting 10 minutes with the line barely moving I left my cart. This is not Super Bowl weekend, Memorial, Labor Day or any other special weekend. Why would a store manager at noon on Friday, ever let the store get that much out of control. It would have been different if all of the registers were open, but they were not. When a manager first starts to see the line getting past a predetermined point, additional individuals should be called up to run a register until the lines begin to clear.  Costco, what gives???

Friendly employees. I‚Äôve found that anything that is on sale is a really good price. Recently I didn‚Äôt need anything but a $5 rotisserie chicken so I just walked the aisles looking for sales. I‚Äôve heard Costco is a good place to buy tires but that you should expect your appointment to be set out a month.

Great selection and value. Was very busy but somehow managed to not feel too crowded. Would recommend this location to shop! Lots of wine and foods. I was surprised to even seen an exotic fruit- rambutan! Only slight negative is that the returns line looked very long on a Saturday afternoon.

I wanted to give an employee there a great review and I hope you reward him with something.   We were trying to find a specific 3D puzzle but it was buried in the other ones.  I flagged down an employee named Christopher.   He first helped pulling a couple boxes then went to get a pallet jack and pulled the entire thing out and again helped us search.  We finally found it after he pulled another pallet out.  Then we went for the Lego ones and again he pulled another pallet out.  He didn't just walk away.  I assumed once he pulled boxes off he just say you didn't have it but the kid definitely went above and beyond patiently going through the boxes to help us.  Cashier was also quick and kind.   We're from out of state and seeing you hold up to great customer service I'm thankful.   Again, if you would, give Christopher some praise.  He made y'all look great.  I thank him!

Poor opening hours. Produce is medium quality, avocados always awful. Decent deals to be found but they purposely rearrange the inventory so you spend more time in the store. Look up ‚Äútreasure hunt‚Äù marketing.

Do yourself-a favor come on a Tuesday! it just really isn‚Äôt worth it to be in this circus.  They have yet to solve one of the largest painful experiences of checking out!  We customers must be straight masochists.  Why is it, an AppStore shipping company figured out the grab and go format.‚Ä¶ Costco can use that tech to its benefit.  Come here on Tuesdays through Thursday. Unless you like ‚Äúno parking and waiting in long lines‚Äù.
Neatly organized place, huge rush on weekends. But you will find almost everything in plenty in this location. Great place to shop in Mason.

First time in the store. All the employees that I encountered were very nice, friendly, and helpful. I had some online returns, but didn‚Äôt have my receipts so it took quite a long time for Terri/customer service to look these up. That was not her fault, just the way the system is set up and the fact that some of my items were bought several years ago. So it took time and patience for Terri to find the items in my purchase history. Terri was very sweet and patient. Reggie helped her, in between time of helping other customers. He was awesome, too.

People at the door is having a good power trip, don't think about bringing any bags from any store that is not Costco because they will refuse entrance even when they are in a shopping mall???? Good luck if you don't have a car and want to do more than one thing at this shopping mall

As new members to Costco we are trying some of the different locations. This store is clean. As before we found a lot of good deals and went home with more than we came for. Gas was a good price also.

I would love the place if they would just treat their customers better. As a secondary membership holder I would have to stand in line for almost 2 hours to get a card in order for me to be able to shop there. I can't go by myself right now. I have to give my wife the money for anything I want to purchase. Meanwhile, their are guards at the entrance and cash registers watching everyone shop.
Some of the deals are good, but a lot of the price breaks are the same as Walmart.

Everything and more! Great for families to shop and bulk! Great selections. Helpful staff and very clean inside and outside! Memberships only! No one day passes. $60 for the basic membership for a year.

I used to like Costco. Recently, it has been annoying and overcrowded. They continue to move products around which is the height of annoyance. The app is useless and only works for online orders. This place has turned into a zoo full of zombies aimlessly walking around and not aware other people are around.

The employees are no different. At the checkout line the two employees did not acknowledge me at all. They were mindlessly chatting amongst themselves. The only thing said was do I want to donate. I just nodded no and took my receipt. The art of customer service is a far thought at this Costco.

Store is always clean and even when busy, the lines move fast. The food of course is a must try, at least once. Hard to beat paying 1.50 for a hot dog and a drink. Hot dog was massive and could easily be shared. Always enjoy the shopping days here.

I absolutely love Costco but boy oh boy is it crazy busy! We typically go when they first open in the morning otherwise it's pure chaos. They had lots of samples out today which was nice to see.
