I wish there was a more organized way to control the crowd at the food court/station because it really causes a big people/cart jam trying to navigate out of the food court crowd. The staff is always helpful. It would be nice if Costco had later hours.

I have had a Costco membership for over 20 years. Until this store, it has been my favorite place to shop. Not just for food, but for clothes, shoes, kitchen things, electronics and so much more. I loved taking my time and seeing what was new from my last visit and I was never disappointed. Recently my previous store closed and a new one opened in West Chester. I HATE IT. It is so crowded all the time! No more spending time in the aisles perusing deals and new items - it‚Äôs too crowded. Half the time I can‚Äôt even get to the aisles. Specific items have been out of stock - something that I‚Äôve never seen in other Costcos. The checkout lines are complete madness. I‚Äôve spoken to some of the employees who have come from the old store. I won‚Äôt go into details, but their stress levels are very high. Don‚Äôt even get me started about the parking. I‚Äôve parked closer at a Browns game. I‚Äôm very sad. Feel like I‚Äôve lost a friend. I‚Äôve been driving to Florence, KY when I need to make a trip now. I used to just go because it was such a great place to shop and linger. I think they could have kept both stores open and had no loss of foot traffic. I‚Äôve talked with other Costco shoppers. We all don‚Äôt like this store. Too much traffic in it. Yuck. I miss you Costco.

This is the newest Costco in the liberty township.. I have been going here from the 1st day it opened late 2022‚Ä¶ it has huge parking lot..  not much traffic as other place as easy access from cox road.. liberty way.. we love the Costco ice creams.. good quality products.. moreover it‚Äôs  very clean in and out‚Ä¶  the gas price is always little less compared to others..

Costco is very expensive for everything, we joined the member with $60 and purchased so many things to see if this is really reasonable price like how other customers reviews in social media but it‚Äôs expensive than Walmart and Sam‚Äôs club. So what‚Äôs the benifit to go this store by paying membership fee? We will never go cost co again. Good bye.

This Costco location is a great place to shop for quality products and services at affordable prices. The store is huge, well-organized, and offers a wide variety of items, from groceries and household essentials to electronics and furniture. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the gas station, pharmacy, optical department, and hearing aids center are very convenient. The only downside is that sometimes the gas station is crowded.

Great place & prices. Sometimes harder to find things because of the size of the place and floor layout. People are always helpful though. Check-out lines can be a challenge, but personnel working the lines are the best. Excellent customer service in guest services!

Costco offers a fantastic shopping experience with its diverse product selection and bulk deals. The membership perks, including exclusive discounts and access to quality brands, add value. The spacious layout and helpful staff make navigating the store efficient. However, it may not suit everyone's shopping style due to the bulk packaging and membership fees. Overall, Costco delivers excellent value for those looking to save on a wide range of high-quality products.

My husband bought  a rotisserie chicken today from this location and it is raw . It is a shame that workers re selling undercooked chicken . I am going to be posting pictures as a proof . This is unacceptable. Period .

This location has everything I need. Tey consistently have regular staff which makes it a better shopping experience when you have questions on location or availability of items.  Everyone here is always pleasant from the greeter to the exit workers. The food court is always busy, but you see that the workers are always scrambling and doing their best to get orders out promptly and stay on top of things. Even when they are busy, they  smile. The store is clean and organized.

I've always only been there with a friend. Never thought I'd become a member due to not much need.
Well your reading from a just became one.
I still question several reasons as to why but no complaints.
I can get overwhelmed by crowds and sales and navigating and on and on.
Much to offer
I'm thinking there will be good value in joining
Stay tuned.üòâ

We are moving to the area, so we went ahead and got a membership since it will replace our normal shopping place, Sam's Club.
For a Wednesday night after 7pm it was pretty busy.  We had a small wait to complete our membership purchase but nothing too long.
We went ahead and walked through trying to get a feel for the layout and comparing products to what we are used to at Sam's Club.  Everything seemed pretty good.
Look forward to further shopping after our move is complete.

**Update:  Now that we've settled in and unpacked, we have been made a few trips in.  Due to a mishap in our move, we even bought a couch and had it delivered quickly.

One thing I haven't figured out and something that I really miss from Sam's Club was the ability to order on line and then do curb side pickup.  I work nights, so it was very easy to order before going to work and then pick up my order at 7am after work the next morning.  That would be a great service if Costco has this.

Costco in Plain City is our go-to spot for everything great! It's not just about the deals and the quantities; it's also about the quality. We mostly shop for vegetables and fruits here, but there's plenty of other stuff we love too. Overall, it's our favorite place to shop!

Costco is pretty great but this store is getting quite aggressive with demanding to see the photo on your Costco membership card at check out. I know it's a membership club, and they are trying to prevent people from sharing accounts, but I think a little customer service could go a long way. It feels accusatory. I do have my photo on my ID and will gladly show them, but please stop making us feel like a criminal. Sam's Club isn't like this. You can't beat the $1.50 hot dog combo though, so there's that.

I bought mini cucumbers at Costco today. The price tag was $6.99 for 3 count and it was showing in the left corner of price tag $2.33 each. We even talked with my wife and said it was a good price, lets bought 3. When I went to self checkout it was charging each $6.99. When I called for assistance, they told me they are checking the price. After waiting a couple of minutes, I went there to check the price myself and saw 2 store associate leaving that area. They took a picture after changing the price tag and claimed I saw it wrong and it is each $6.99. I asked for the manager and I explained the situation to Manager Troy and how it was wrong to change the price tag and claim I was wrong. Troy acted like he did not understand with the most stupid/fool face. I explained him twice but he continued to play idiot. It was really annoying and unacceptable. Costco manager should own the mistake, apologize, and honor the customer. Troy acted like he did not understand, did not apologize and ran from the checkout area to avoid confrontation. Senior manager or general manager of Costco, please check the cameras between 4:10pm and 4:25pm in produce area for 5/5/2024 and you will see I am telling the truth.

Feedback for you Troy, you need to improve your customer service skill, lack of conflict resolution skill, lack of communication skill, poor management, and poor judgement.

The Costco here is the best one in all of Plain City. Best carts, most friendly cell phone reps when you're just there to pick up veggies and TP, best samples when you're on a diet, best place for awkward conversations when you bump into your neighbor that you're pretty sure is the one whose garbage blows into your yard, and the best cookies (remember, you're still on a diet).

It gets pretty busy, but the checkout staff do a great job of keeping everything moving, even helping a lot in the self checkout area.

I wish they had more room in the food court seating area though. It gets pretty crowded and there isn't a great place for people to put their carts while they eat, so it bottlenecks the people who are just trying to leave.

I bought today 5/9:2024 branzini fish and it was horrible smelling when we opened it , I tried to call the customer service to address the problem but their lazy careless response was to bring it back!!!! Instead of going to investigate my claim and make sure to damage what is left on the sale floor, I believe it should be trashed. please be careful sea food department
Nice Costco.  Good prices. Great selection.  Very clean.

This place has solid stuff and nice people working there. That being said, the check out experience is the bane of my experience there and will likely be the reason my family cancels our membership.

At Sam's Club, and a lot of normal smaller grocery stores, they have the option to check out via app. I wish you guys would adopt that option. Instead, if we go to self check out, we still have to show our card again. If we go to a cashier, that's a whole separate issue, only to have a person counting and touching every item, one by one.

Lastly, why are the gas prices not in a visible place?

It's 2024, you can do better.

I am in agreement with other shoppers. Most of their stuff is priced for people with endless money. They need to calm down about the membership cards. The lady at the door was horribly rude about me having a temporary card. I get it, it was expired but no need to brow beat someone about it. Then having to show your card AGAIN before you can check out? Come on. That is the precise reason I don't shop at Sam's, now Costco will be the same. They are not so great that I feel like they have a reason to check your card like that. Give me a break.
First time here on a Sunday. Wow...this place was busy. Clean facilities and staff was very friendly. Thank you

The details of my own experience is that the professionalism from Stephanie and Luke in Optical is phenomenal.
Stephanie has a sureness about her that puts people at ease. I have seen first-hand with her years of experience and knowledge, take a Costco to member all the way through the task of a glasses fitting/purchase and make it as pleasant as can be.
Luke has a vivacious personality, he cares for Costco members with gusto, and has a comradery with them that treats them and makes them feel like family.
I have purchased my glasses here and would not go anywhere else: I cannot beat the prices or the Excellent Service.

My experience at this location was amazing!  I had a problem with my passenger front tire loosing pressure with over 500 miles more on my trip today. They had a full schedule  but they got me right in and fixed the tire and I was back on the road in less than one hour at a very reasonable price. Thank you so much for your help to me today Costco!!

I love shopping at Costco! The prices are unbeatable, and I can always find great deals on the things I need. One thing to keep in mind is that (almost) everything comes in bulk, so be prepared to stock up! Also, don't forget to bring your own bags, as they don't provide them. But overall, the savings and selection make it well worth it. I've saved so much money on groceries, household items, and more. The warehouse can be overwhelming at first, but once you get the hang of it, you'll be hooked! Great experience and highly recommend!

Walked up to the automotive counter and no other customers were around. Talked with the Costco person at the counter about getting a refund for the core battery I had brought back. Phone then rings at the counter and the Costco person answers it and now I am waiting. Eventually I walk away from the counter with the core battery. I definitely understand if the Costco person was on the phone when I walked up but this was just a lack of customer service the way it was handled by Costco. Option #1 could have been to not answer the phone until I completed the return. Option #2 could have been answering the phone and asking that customer to hold while the return was completed. Customer service is fading fast at Costco. All that will be left soon at Costco is pricing and once that is not appealing it will just become another big box store. Sad because it had been a great store for so long.

Edit: I returned to the same Costco to take the core battery back again and the same person was at the automotive counter. He (Steve) asked to scan the QR code to show the membership at Costco I had and I held the phone up. He then asked if he can take my phone. I asked if he scanned the QR code and he said he wasn't able to at the counter. I told him I was not going to provide him my phone and then he demand the account number which I provided. He gathered all the details of the car I have and then went to get a new battery off the shelf. I explained that I was returning the core battery that I had brought back to the counter. He said there was no record of a battery purchase. I then asked about the core battery for my wife's car battery which I had recently bought at Costco also. He again gathered all the details of the car and went to get a new battery off the shelf. I again explained that I was returning the core battery and was just looking for either of the two batteries I had purchased so the core battery could be returned. He said there was no record of that battery purchase either. I then asked to speak to the manager and he came over to the counter. He (James) scanned the QR code and located both battery purchases and provided a refund for the core battery I had brought back.

My favorite Costco in our area! All of the workers encountered were awesome!!!! So happy I finally got membership!!! Just Kirkland toilet paper and paper towels are worth the membership fee!!! Tysvm for keeping your prices so good! Saves me a lot of money in long run!
By far the BEST Costco location I've ever been in. Not insanely chaotic, well laid out parking lot, tons of staff. Also watched the solar eclipse from their lot. Great location

I Want to Recognize An OUTSTANDING Manager by The Name of ‚ÄúSteven S.‚Äú   He was The MOST PROFESSIONAL and Courteous in assisting me !!!  Everything was PERFECT !! He made sure A-Z that I was taken care of.  I also took notice of How excellent he treated and talked to the other members who needed assistance.   He goes ABOVE AND BEYOND for the Members at Costco and also His Team around him!!!  They definitely work well together in a Stunningly Clean Environment!!! His Leadership and Expertise Shine Bright!!!  The Biggest Thank You Steven S.  !!!

Guess it‚Äôs not for us. Wife and I retired so large quantities are not for us.  Some things we would like to try but not buying 6 or 12 frozen to sample.  Place is always packed  unless you get there when it opens. Got hearing aid there and very satisfied .  Gas is good deal however.

I would like to recognize the guys in the Costco Strongsville tire center.  Not only did they work me in when I had a nail in my tire (bought at Costco).but they were incredible patient when I couldn‚Äôt locate the security wheel lug nut.  The supervisor, Josh , is incredibly professional and has a great attitude.  All of the guys in the tire center at the Strongsville Costco are hard working and deserve a raise.

This location can be a pain to get in and out of sometimes. Overall it‚Äôs not a bad store, just not fond of some of their corporate policies about being a ‚ÄúNo Carry‚Äù zone. It‚Äôs their right, just as it is mine to shop elsewhere, but the convenience is worth the hassle.

We are brand new to Costco and we are loving it! The rotisserie chicken is awesome. Their gasoline prices are low! Unbelievably great prices on my allergy meds (Allegra and Nasocort)! We like the Kirkland brand paper products and laundry detergent and they are reasonably priced. Lots of good food at great prices! And of course, we had to try the $1.50 hot dog/beverage at their food stand and it was delicious!

Always have a Great time strolling thru Costco and seeing all the great deals and stocking up on family favorites such as their snacks, prepared meal kits (street tacos, and Mac n Cheese are big favs) and baked goods. We also get our household supplies ( Paper towels, toilet tissue and garbage bags) Love their all natural laundry soap too!

I would like to thank the Costco employees Tori and Mike's dock staff who helped assist Toledo Public Schools with the distribution of weekend food bags from the Islamic Food Bank by arranging the donation of used Watermelon bins. These bins help Toledo Public Schools to store the over 400 bags a week distributed to our schools. Thank You for helping our Community. Jeffrey Griffith, Lead Counselor Toledo Public Schools

Stopped by while visiting to pick up some items.  The entrance, the layout is opposite of the layout in Ann Arbor location.

Three big difference that jumped out - 1) self-checkout:  on the day I visited, you didn't need to show your ID and 2) the cashier at the self-checkout did not have to sign the receipt and 3) they have empty boxes lined up along the wall by the food court so customers can pick and take the one they like.

This is opposite of the Ann Arbor location.  The cashier checks your card when using the self-check out and sign's off the receipt before you head out.

Why is this place so busy at noon on a Thursday.
Important to note that they only take Visa for credit. Cash and debit otherwise.

Ended up going to Sam‚Äôs because I didn‚Äôt have cash or a debit card.

Stopped in with a friend so he could be come a member... Lenny at the counter was great.  I renewed my membership as well. The store was full so we left without purchasing anything.  Thanks Lenny for being a great sport.
